111011031.content: I'll just give it to you straight. Its fluctuations have grown somewhat frequent, but it's hard to determine whether that's actually relevant here.

111011032.content: So to sum up, we're just not sure what exactly is going on with your body.

111011033.content: Ookuninushi sighs, obviously a bit frustrated. She then turns to pick up some sort of device.

111011034.content: Administrator, are you able to go into more detail about what kind of illusions you're seeing?

111011036.content: We've put together all of the eye-witness reports CORG sent us regarding the "phantom butterfly". Just like what you said, basically: "an apparent phantom that suddenly emerges prior to a partial or full loss of self-control."

111011037.content: There are also a number of eyewitness reports of butterfly sightings prior to the ghost of an old acquaintance or loved one. But it seems you have no experience of that particular symptom, have you, Administrator?

111011038.content: A ghost? I haven't, no... Is that another common illusion then?

111011039.content: Not really. Eyewitnesses all report conversations with their ghosts, reflecting some sort of actual consciousness. You could call that a kind of... spirit...

111011040.content: A conversation with someone's deceased spirit? Reminds me of something that happened in Sasanami.

111011041.content: ...But this is a little different. Reports here mainly revolve around some kind of spiritual entity.

111011042.content: Anyway, Administrator, it's getting late. You really should get some rest. We'll keep an eye on these Phantom Butterflies. If you find anything else, be sure to notify us.

111011043.content: Understood. You guys should also get some good rest.

111011044.content: But my colleagues don't seem the least bit interested in finishing up for the day. I leave the treatment room with a strange sense I'm missing out on something.

111011045.content: Is there a problem in the Sephirah Core?

111011046.content: If there is, it's not reflected in the observational data. I'll need time for a more detailed check.

111011047.content: If the issue is instead with the Cycle, then...

111011048.content: The corridor is eerily silent in the dead of night, its only activity being the faint glowing of lampposts. I wonder what it is about this night in particular that makes me so uncomfortable.

111011049.content: I suddenly develop an inexplicable feeling that I am on the verge of realizing something incredible, like someone has opened the curtains of my mind to let in fresh rays of sunlight. I feel faint.

111011050.content: I have difficulty maintaining my balance from the sudden onrush of emotion when I see a dark butterfly at the end of the corridor for a moment.

111011053.content: No response except the echo of my own voice across an empty corridor... I rush over to where the butterfly had flashed past and look around. Nothing. Anything that had been here was already gone.

111011054.content: Is my mind playing tricks on me?

111011055.content: I try not to let whatever had just happened get in the way of a good night's sleep. I flop onto my pillows and into a world of dreams.

111011056.content: I wake up in a half-dreaming darkness, my mind blanketed with fog. All I can see is a pale white light dotted with freckles of blackness.

111011057.content: It's the black butterfly again. I reach out to it instinctively. The butterfly hesitates, circling around once again, and then landing on the tip of my finger. I think I hear a voice, but it's terribly indistinct.

111011060.content: It flaps its wings once more as if to emphasize the reality of its own existence as I stare at it in utter amazement. I want to say something, but nothing comes out.

111011061.content: The black butterfly continues talking as if any acknowledgement from me was entirely superfluous.

111011062.content: If you can see me... then please come to the place filled with white flowers.

111011063.content: I have something I want to tell you.

111011065.content: I hear the faint sound of the fragile wings take off as the black butterfly transforms into a point of light hurtling toward my chest.

111011066.content: My vision fades like an unplugged television. There is no more white light or black butterfly, only her words resounding between my ears.

111011067.content: Something incredibly strange just happened... Why am I crying? I reflect on the fact I have no answers as my world fades to black.

111021001.content: I don't get much time to reflect on the strange dream because the peacefulness of my morning routine is immediately disturbed by a sudden, violent shaking.

111021002.content: What feels like an earthquake rocks my room for the better part of a minute. The adrenaline banishes all fatigue from my head.

111021004.content: Hey! Rookie! Wakey-wakey! Urgent mission! Report to the Command Room at once!

111021005.content: Mimir's eager voice resounds through the comms system without any of his customary somnolence. I check my vitals once again to make sure I'm alright before rushing over to the Command Room.

111021006.content: I find quite a few Modifiers already there when I arrive. What immediately draws my attention is an enormous black coffin by the window and a girl leaning against it with her eyes closed.

111021007.content: Her long, gentle, silver hair seems to sparkle under the sunlight, and yet there is also something profoundly cold about her. I shudder inwardly and look for some familiar faces. Ver and I catch sight of each other.

111021008.content: Hey, Administrator! You're finally here. Miss Shu's been waiting for quite a while.

111021009.content: I'm sorry I'm late. What's going on? Does it have something to do with that quake?

111021010.content: Indeed. Ain Soph has just been hit with a violent Quake and without any forewarning. It's inflicted terrible damage on the Duskfall Area.

111021011.content: Shu never lifts her attention from the holographic map and continues to issue battle commands. Things were obviously bad.

111021012.content: I need you to leave right now to assist the worst-hit areas and work with other teams to eliminate nearby Visbane threats.

111021013.content: Admin, this is a sudden and unexpected event. It's up to you to make decisions in the field.

111021014.content: Understood. We'll head out right away.

111021015.content: Disasters are always sudden and always indiscriminate. Nothing makes you understand that more than when your boots hit the ground.

111021016.content: The sense of hopelessness and utter destruction hits me like a sledgehammer once I set foot in the ruins of the once magnificent municipality.

111021017.content: My ears are immediately assaulted by a combination of crackling fires, weeping, and the sound of thousands of people scrambling to get to safety.

111021018.content: The roads had been ripped up and buildings flattened in a scene straight out of hell... A disaster of this magnitude really highlights the weakness and frailty of the human condition.

111021022.content: Crystal Clear. What happened, Miss Shu?

111021023.content: I think you have seen the scene. It's the largest Quake we've ever recorded since observations began, far in excess of any of our predictive models.

111021024.content: We would typically let CORG handle the rescue, but it's so bad we'll have to work with them—on top of eradicating Visbanes.

111021025.content: Don't worry about that, Miss Shu. We'll take care of it. After all, we've got the Administrator with us.

111021026.content: Good. And beware, there's something deeply disturbing about these Quakes. I suspect there will be Encroachers around. Proceed with caution!

111021027.content: Shu anxiously terminates the call. The seriousness of the situation was fairly self-explanatory, and so I thought it best to put the matter of last night's strange dream to one side.

111021028.content: You look a bit out of sorts, Administrator. Are you alright?

111021029.content: Maybe I didn't get enough sleep last night, but I'm fine. Don't worry about me. Let's just focus on the task at hand!

111023001.content: This wound doesn't look good. Don't move. Let me help you.

111023003.content: I'm sorry, but could you tell me what happened?

111023004.content: I'm not sure... There was a sudden earthquake. I ran out of the house.

111023005.content: And... I ran into a monster! A real monster! It was on the road! It attacked me!

111023006.content: I survived by the skin of my teeth! Is this... some sort of horrible nightmare?

111023007.content: It's just a bad dream. You'll be fine once you wake up.

111023009.content: Excellent. We've handled the basics. Now we can leave the rest to CORG.

111023010.content: The monsters they are talking about... sound like Visbanes, Administrator... There'll be others trapped inside. We should move in to save them.

111022001.content: Boy, am I good or what?

111022002.content: I think all the Visbanes in this area have been dealt with.

111022003.content: Search the area, check for any injured personnel or Visbane you might have missed.

111022005.content: A man's voice comes from behind me, just when I began to let down my guard. The voice is weak, but enough for me to stretch my nerves.

111022006.content: We see a man dressed casually in formal black attire with a messy head of hair and visible rings around his eyes despite a pair of shades.

111022007.content: I'm sorry. Did I frighten you? I just wanted to ask... are you the rescue team?

111022009.content: Thank heavens! Someone's come to rescue me! I'm a doctor at a nearby clinic. Here's my license...

111022010.content: We got hit by the earthquake and then these bizarre creatures. I've just been hiding here the whole time... Could you... Could you take me with you?

111022011.content: The gaunt fellow appears rather hesitant and afraid of rejection.

111022012.content: You'll be fine! Those creatures were a piece of cake. Wham, bam, done!

111022013.content: He sure is a lucky guy. Just light injuries. We can let Mimtastic escort him back to the shelter.

111022014.content: Don't worry, sir. You're perfectly safe now. These AGI Mechas will escort you to a place of safety. Please go to the shelter.

111022015.content: You mean—these machines? You're not coming?

111022016.content: I'm sorry. We still have lots of rescuing to do, and every second is vital.

111022017.content: Alright. But I must remind you I just saw the monsters... They killed a bunch of people.

111022018.content: They were just lying on the ground like that... I couldn't do anything...

111022019.content: It's okay. We won't allow anything like that to happen here again.

111022020.content: Really? That's amazing... Best of luck then!

111022021.content: The nervous-looking man bows reverently toward the group before following the AGI Mechas to safety.

111022022.content: Word that others had been killed by the "monsters" brings a hardness back to everyone's face.

111022024.content: This isn't the time to slow down. Let's keep moving.

111031001.content:
A human being is an assembled mass of contradictions.

Humans have strongly defined emotions which nevertheless can be discarded at will; humans have the ability to experience pain beyond measure, and yet are cursed with the inability to forget it.

This is why some people have decided to close their heart to compassion, the suffering of others, and the joys and tragedies of the human spirit.

Yet strangely even such a drastic step does not heal old wounds, nor alleviate the pain afflicted by memories that cannot be forgotten.

111031005.content: Is it really alright, Miss Hel?

111031006.content: To be blunt, there's absolutely no reason you have to accept this sudden request.

111031007.content: ...What I mean is: These people don't deserve your help.

111031010.content: The girl with the silver hair and purple eyes lifts her head toward some place unfathomably far away as her hand clenches in front of her chest.

111031012.content: How can we walk this far without seeing anything?

111031013.content: Zenkibo nonchalantly kicks a stone from the vanguard of the group. The kick echoes quite far across the ruined municipal district.

111031014.content: She's probably starting to get boring, since she didn't get any chance shooting anything for quite a while. The Visbane horde we expected didn't show up, and the city is unusually silent.

111031015.content: The corrosion here has gotten a lot worse. Administrator, are you reading any nearby life signals?

111031016.content: Very faintly. And since a moment ago, the fog is getting so thick, and I'm having trouble pinging their location.

111031017.content: I don't know why but I'm getting a really bad feeling about this...

111031022.content: The fog clears to reveal a terrifying scene of destruction on closer approach.

111031023.content: We see what are undoubtedly human remains strewn across the road. The savagery of the attack has everyone of the group clutching their mouths in revulsion.

111031025.content: Must be the victims that guy talked about.

111031026.content: I think I'm picking up nearby life signals. We need to check them.

111032002.content: When I suddenly realized something's not right and stopped, I was already surrounded by these thick fogs. I can almost feel the water droplets sticking to my skin, and it's not pleasant.

111032003.content: I can't hear anyone now. It's quiet—too quiet. I get the sense I've been separated from my teammates.

111032004.content: What... happened? Ver? Can you hear me?

111032005.content: No response. The last thing I remember before I black out is some white butterfly flying toward me. I'm not sure when it appeared or when it vanished.

111032007.content: Oh right! That man running away!

111032008.content: Please, please! Let me go. I'm a human, a human, a human! AHHHHHHH!!!!!

111032009.content: My thoughts are interrupted by a terrifying scream. I run to the source of the cry as fast as my legs can carry me, disregarding the feedback from my exhausted lungs.

111032010.content: The fog dissipates as I close in, but what I'm seeing is way beyond my expectation. A girl with silver hair carrying a heavy black coffin on her shoulders is standing amidst the ruins with hair flapping in the breeze.

111032011.content: Long guns are stretching out of the coffin, and are aimed squarely at the odd guy who was fleeing earlier. Something mechanical seem to be growing out of his putrid mass of writhing flesh. The transformation process smells almost as bad as it sounds.

111032012.content: I'm a human. I'm... am I going to die? I...

111032014.content: The pull of the triggers and noise of the guns swallow up the creature's malformed sentence. It falls down. I look at the girl's face, seeking some sort of emotion, and find none.

111032017.content: The dark muzzles turn towards me from behind the silver-haired lady. I have no doubt I would have been torn to shreds if I'd moved a muscle.

111032018.content: This is the very moment I bring back the memory of a combination of a silver-hair girl and a black coffin.

111032019.content: I'm #{nickname}# from the General Office. Are you also a Modifier? I once saw you in the Command Room.

111032020.content: Can you tell me what happened?

111032022.content: He was no longer a human... And had to be eliminated.

111032023.content: At least now the lady appears to have let her guard down somewhat, although not her weapon.

111032024.content: I follow her gaze to the thoroughly destroyed corpse which, just as she said, has transformed itself from an apparent human to a hunk of now-lifeless metal.

111032025.content: An Encroacher victim? How did you know? He seemed... normal to me just now.

111032026.content: There was something... simulated about his emotions.

111032027.content: His apparent terror, and helplessness were... clearly simulated.

111032028.content: I could feel the lack of soul within his body...

111032030.content: Thank me... why? It's my job.

111032031.content: Oh no. If I had chosen to save him like I'd wanted to, I would have ended up the same... So I really have to thank you.

111032033.content: The silver-haired girl cocks her head to one side as if to re-evaluate me, then shakes it, retracting all her black firearms. My palpable sense of relief shows just how much stress I must be under.

111032034.content: But she has no interest in continuing our conversation. She turns around to head back into the fog.

111032035.content: W-Wait! I don't even know your name.

111032037.content: She then disappears into the mist, leaving me at a loss for what to do next. To make matters worse, I feel a weird throbbing in my chest.

111032038.content: An emotion rather inappropriate to me, a kind of wistful sadness mixed with grief emanates from the same point in my chest where last night I had dreamed the black butterfly entered me.

111032039.content: This sudden, inexplicable onrush of sadness and pain threatens to overwhelm my senses. My legs want to crumple under me, but a hand reaches out from behind to steady me at the last minute.

111032042.content: You just disappeared on us, Administrator! We couldn't reach you on comms. We've all been really worried!

111032043.content: That's right. Good thing we didn't lose you altogether.

111032044.content: Sorry. It's that weird fog. How'd the mission go?

111032045.content: Everything's fine. Mimir just notified us that the entire sector has stabilized. Apparently, thanks to some outside help, the rescue operation wrapped up super fast.

111032047.content: Anyway, we'd better be getting back.

111032048.content: I nod while glancing in the direction Hel departed into the fog. Is that the fluttering of butterfly wings near my ears?

111041001.content:
A place of rest? I'm fine with anything, anywhere.

Everything vanishes in the end anyway. What's the difference?

It's taken a lifetime of loss to make me realize it is better to have never gained at all.

Never entertain hopes beyond your station or seek intimacy with others, and you'll be just fine.

111041005.content: Are you really okay, Miss Hel?

111041006.content: It's the third time you've returned here this month.

111041007.content: I'm fine. Don't worry about me.

111041008.content: The world apparent to Hel's eyes and the home apparent to her memories were very far apart indeed.

111041009.content: The funeral parlor appears to have been completely abandoned in the years since. Virtually nothing remains.

111041010.content: Nothing is the same anymore, right?

111041011.content: It's not like you to say that, Ganglati.

111041012.content: I'm sorry, Miss Hel. But I'm afraid we must be going.

111041016.content: It's quite late by the time I return to the shelter. I end the pre-arranged phone call with Shu and allow myself a long sight of relief.

111041017.content: It looks like the situation has stabilized, Administrator?

111041018.content: Yes. Much better now. Shu's a lot more relieved about the whole thing.

111041019.content: But it's happened so suddenly CORG hasn't had time to arrange a proper takeover. We might have to stay here a while longer.

111041020.content: What? Are you kidding me? That's going to be so boring!

111041021.content: It's just another mission. Everyone had better rest up then.

111041022.content: Especially you, Administrator. You don't look so well. Is it that Phantom Butterfly thing?

111041023.content: Wait... What!? Do you mean that urban legend that people meet ghost butterflies? Sounds really cool!

111041024.content: Can it, Zenki. The Administrator needs some rest too!

111041026.content: Don't worry about me. I'm fine. Just a bit tired.

111041027.content: You don't need to push yourself if you're not feeling totally fine.

111041028.content: Night had arrived at some point to snuff out the last hint of sunlight. Yet the well-lit shelter remains as crowded, and busy.

111041029.content: I'm thinking how I can make myself useful when the cacophony around me vanishes all of a sudden.

111041031.content: Another vision of the Phantom Butterflies— an innumerable host of the otherworldly, luminescent creatures hovering around the camp, glowing with a kind of sad, mournful light.

111041032.content: I feel myself grow faint under an unexplained rush of vertigo. I am trying to fight it when a sudden tender slap on the back snaps me out of the light-filled reverie.

111041033.content: I turn to find a familiar, anxious-looking face.

111041035.content: I'm fine. Thank you... Oh, I remember you. I saw you during the day.

111041036.content: Oh, I don't think I properly introduced myself. My name is Zery. I'm a psychiatrist working in the Duskfall Area.

111041037.content: I wanted to thank you properly for saving me.

111041038.content: Don't mention it, Dr. Zery. That's our job. Was there something you wanted to see me about?

111041039.content: Oh, nothing except that you looked a little out of sorts there. Do you feel alright?

111041040.content: I'm fine. Just a bit of lightheadedness, that's all.

111041041.content: Looking at you I can't help but ask... did you see the Phantom Butterflies?

111041043.content: Don't misunderstand me! I just couldn't help overhearing your conversation.

111041044.content: I've seen the same symptom pop up in my practice of late, but haven't located a consistent cause. Maybe we could talk it through. I could help you find some way of dealing with it.

111041045.content: Something about the proposal excited the doctor, who shakes my hand firmly without further ado.

111041049.content: I'm sorry, I'm afraid you may be a special case. It's also the first I've heard of this black butterfly phenomenon.

111041050.content: I'm as surprised as you are. Must be like ghost sightings. Most people never see anything like that.

111041051.content: "Ghost" sightings you say? Maybe it's better if they really exist...

111041052.content: The black attired doctor turns, disappointed, to the framed picture on the table containing a photo of a beautiful girl in a white dress.

111041054.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Just some old memories...

111041055.content: Apologies. I wanted to help you, but I'm afraid I may not be up to the task.

111041056.content: No problem. You did the best you could.

111041057.content: Thanks. Can I give you some mild sedatives? I doubt you've been sleeping well recently, correct?

111041058.content: By the way, the place that voice mentioned in your dreams... You might want to look into that. It could be what you're looking for.

111041060.content: It's late by the time I exit the clinic, and I return to my room. I'd been thinking of what to do, but my fatigue quickly overwhelms me.

111041061.content: I pop the sedative from the doctor and it didn't take long before the sleepiness overwhelms me. My mind keeps turning back to that , Hel, and the strange butterfly traveling into my chest. And then I faint.

111041062.content: The brilliant canopy of light covered with black dots returns as well as a sense of a distant, swaying figure. I just can't see that figure clearly.

111041063.content: I try to take a step forward toward the shadowy figure within the light, but it looks like I've been absolutely fixed into place. My legs don't respond at all.

111041064.content: The small figure walks toward me. I recognize her face, but not the positive, vivacious energy reflected in it. I'm having a hard time believing in what I'm seeing.

111041067.content: Hm? My little Helena, what's wrong?

111041068.content: I hear the gentle voice of another lady from somewhere behind me, and turn to look at its source. A girl in a black dress is sitting next to a table, her hands holding some sort of incomplete piece of art and a tool.

111041070.content: Yes! See the butterflies I made? Do you like it?

111041071.content: ...I like them. Just as beautiful as you.

111041072.content: When did you get so sweet... I'm sure you'll be much more beautiful than me, Helena, when you grow up!

111041074.content: Silly goose. Didn't we promise? We'll always be together... Always...

111041075.content: There's that sense of strong alienation again, reminding me forcefully that this dream, however real it seems, does not belong to me.

111041076.content: The sound vanishes as the brilliance dims into shadow. The figures likewise disappear into a puff of smoke.

111041077.content: The black butterfly reappears albeit much more faded than when I first saw it.

111041078.content: If you can see me... then please come to the place filled with white flowers.

111041079.content: I have something I want to tell you.

111041080.content: The butterfly then disappears as before after repeating itself yet again.

111041081.content: I sit up slowly from my bed, blinking in a confused daze while I try to separate the dream from reality.

111041082.content: There's a deep sense of discomfort and unease radiating from my chest. A breath of fresh air on the balcony might help.

111041083.content: I push the balcony door open. The fresh air helps somewhat to reorder my muddled thoughts. That's when I first notice someone else is here with me.

111041084.content: At some point, Hel must have taken it upon herself to sit on the side of the rooftop. Her gaze is fixed to some far off point over the horizon almost as if she hasn't noticed my presence.

111041085.content: I'm strongly reminded of Helena's face from my dream when I look at her silver hair and purple eyes. The resemblance is uncanny.

111041088.content: I've stopped the girl in her tracks. Her eyes focus upon me. I can see lines of stress forming around those nearly emotionless pupils.

111041089.content: I remember you. That weirdo... from today.

111041091.content: Where... did you hear that name?

111041095.content: The silver-haired girl is now standing right in front of me, the cold light reflecting off her black firearms. Whatever fatigue I woke up with has disappeared.

111041096.content: My head still hurts. I'm not up to this kind of intense conversation. All I can do is put my feelings into simple words.

111041097.content: Wait! Just calm down a moment, Hel! I heard it from my dream.

111041099.content: I know that sounds a bit hard to believe.

111041100.content: But I saw a girl in my dream. She looked a lot like you. And the other lady called her by that name.

111041102.content: Yes. A gentle lady wearing a black dress. I think her name was Vena.

111041103.content: Hel squints at me with a ferocious intensity at the mention of this name.

111041107.content: Vena was my sister... She was... once family.

111041109.content: She passed away some time ago.

111041110.content: Oh, I'm sorry! I had no idea.

111041111.content: It's alright. Plus, even if she were alive, she wouldn't consider me her sister any longer.

111041112.content: An unsettling silence fills the air. I wasn't quite sure how to respond. Something within me feels deeply unsettled by that comment.

111041113.content: Then... whose voice am I hearing?

111041115.content: I remember it very clearly. I'm sure I heard a voice in my dream. Like it could be your sister's.

111041116.content: So does that mean... I'm having a conversation with a ghost?

111041117.content: There are also a number of eyewitness reports of butterfly sightings prior to the ghost of an old acquaintance or loved one. But it seems you have no experience of that particular symptom, have you, Administrator?

111041118.content: A ghost? I haven't, no... Is that another common illusion then?

111041119.content: Not really. Eyewitnesses all report conversations with their ghosts, reflecting some sort of actual consciousness. You could call that a kind of... spirit...

111041120.content: A conversation with someone's deceased spirit? Reminds me of something that happened in Sasanami.

111041121.content: ...But this is a little different. Reports here mainly revolve around some kind of spiritual entity.

111041122.content: I connect the dots in my head well enough to give a rather logical presentation to a surprised Hel. I explained to her on the Phantom Butterfly phenomenon and my own recent experiences with it.

111041123.content: If we can believe people seeing the Phantom Butterflies can communicate with ghosts, then does that indicate maybe the black butterfly I saw could be...

111041129.content: Got it. But the only hint she left was to find her in the place filled with white flowers...

111041130.content: I have no idea where to even begin looking for that...

111041132.content: Hel drags me out of there before I have a chance to compose myself. We soon find ourselves heading off into the darkness.

111051001.content: It may be midnight, but for people like us, that means the night is just getting started.

111051002.content: I cling to the illumination provided by the old street lamps that bathes my pallid face in alternate flashes of faded yellow.

111051003.content: But nothing can help alleviating my stomach-churning sense of impending doom. But I force the feeling down as much as I can.

111051004.content: I'm sorry. I'm not sure whether your body is up for this next step.

111051005.content: Miss Hel may feel otherwise, but I do not wish to waste our time on your account.

111051006.content: You make out a low moan from the black coffin. Perhaps it was unhappy about having an extra passenger aboard.

111051007.content: Hey! I'm just a human! You almost threw me off!

111051008.content: Is that so? I think we could move a bit faster. Miss Hel wouldn't mind.

111051010.content: Hel seems to have had enough. The acid-tongued coffin shuts up.

111051011.content: We'd left from the shelter in Ain Soph West around 15 minutes ago. Now we're in a relatively undeveloped area fully out of reach of the city's bright lights.

111051012.content: Undeveloped is perhaps not the right word. A few buildings dot the landscape here and there. I notice an old street sign and can just make out the faded words: "Kryptos Cemetery".

111051015.content: So saying, Hel makes her way up the hilly path near old gravestones covered in moss. It sure seems no one comes here anymore.

111051016.content: The blackness of night feels twice as desolate and lonely in a place like this. Noticing that I am falling behind, I race to keep up with Hel.

111051017.content: Many of the gravestones by the cemetery roadside are totally covered by fallen leaves. I shudder as my overactive imagination begins thinking of all the horrifying things one could find by peeling back the layers of nature.

111051018.content: We're not there yet are we, Hel?

111051020.content: How much further do we have to go?

111051022.content: Our conversation tells me nothing except that my companion can talk, but that was itself some consolation.

111051023.content: But the comfort turns cold as soon as I hear a strange noise in the wind.

111051025.content: I leap forward, realizing only afterward the true source of that weird sound—myself.

111051026.content: I had been frightened by a piece of already rather well-decomposed leaf. Hel is staring at me, confused.

111051028.content: It's nothing, I was just scared...

111051030.content: Don't you think it's normal to be scared of things like this in a graveyard in the middle of the night?

111051032.content: Seeing as she'd probably pigeonholed me for an oddball, I figure there's no point defending myself and turn instead to looking for traces of the black butterfly.

111051033.content: I feel a kind of warmth emanate from my chest that seems as if it is guiding me toward somewhere deeper in the graveyard.

111061001.content: My older sister was always full of laughter and smiles—rather out of place in the solemn, heavy atmosphere of the funeral parlor. It reminded me of the warmth of the early morning sun.

111061002.content: She'd often sit by the windowsill when we weren't working and think about how to organize that little garden of hers.

111061004.content: Yeah. Look how the beautiful daisies are blossoming! Mrs. Warren would've been so happy.

111061005.content: But... they buried her in Kryptos yesterday.

111061006.content: The gentle lady bent down to pat Helena on the head.

111061007.content: Helena, you know life has many different stages, just like a flower blossoming, blooming, and then withering. Same as people.

111061008.content: Every stage is utterly new to every individual. It should be welcomed. We shouldn't feel trapped by anyone's passing. Life is forward-looking. Always has been.

111061009.content: I hope my grave will be filled with flowers...

111061010.content: The graveyard is several times bigger than I'd imagined. It certainly wasn't my idea of a fun-filled adventure, walking past tombstones in the darkness. I only rest after surviving goodness knows how many waves of Visbanes.

111061011.content: Strange. What are all these Visbanes doing in an abandoned graveyard?

111061012.content: Apart from which... I don't think we're alone.

111061013.content: You are right, Miss Hel. I'm picking up life signals as well.

111061016.content: I hurry after Hel's departing figure, ignoring the stumblings on the ground. I just don't want to lose track of her at a moment like this.

111061017.content: That noise is soon swallowed up by the endless darkness of night. The silver-haired girl does not slow down for a moment, but hurries deeper into the graveyard.

111061018.content: I run for a long time and eventually stop to look out over the horizon at the first glimmers of sunlight.

111061019.content: I approach the light further only to realize it is not the morning sun, but the combined illumination generated by countless fluttering, white Phantom Butterflies.

111061020.content: The black butterfly dances in front of a gravestone covered in white flowers. Someone is standing there... and praying devotedly?

111061021.content: Our arrival scatters the dancing butterflies. The person in front of the gravestone turns to us.

111061023.content: It is a young girl in a white dress. She takes a few paces back and visibly shrinks in fear like a startled white rabbit.

111061024.content: It is obvious from her terrified eyes that she had mistook us for some sort of ghosts or spirit of some kind.

111061027.content: I didn't get a chance to explain further as the ground starts shaking.

111061028.content: A shadowy silver figure then launches itself aggressively at the girl like some sort of demon.

111061031.content: Hel is much faster off the mark than I, and protects the girl from attack before the first blow can land.

111061032.content: Just hide... somewhere... I'll handle this.

111062001.content: Many impacts from the whistling black firearms slow the silver Visbane down eventually to a mere crawling whisper of the wind.

111062003.content: Confirmed clear of threats, Hel disarms Ganglati's weapon and then heads over my way.

111062004.content: A trap. But we're fine now.

111062006.content: The girl in white is absolutely terrified. She is quivering with fear. I notice glistening tears in her eyes.

111062007.content: I'm sorry, did we frighten you? Trust me. You're safe.

111062008.content: My name is #{nickname}#, her name is Hel. What's your name?

111062011.content: (That's very similar to the other Vena. What a coincidence...)

111062013.content: I want to help her wipe the tears away from her eyes, but realize I hadn't brought anything with me. Luckily, Hel is here.

111062014.content: The owner of the black coffin says not a word, but readily passes the handkerchief over.

111062015.content: Alright then. Could you tell us, Vina, what you are doing here at this late hour?

111062016.content: The girl lowers her eyes for a moment as if lost in thought, and then finally shakes her head.

111062017.content: I don't know... All I remember was I was dreaming.

111062018.content: It was like I had an older sister in that dream... She was lovely and gentle. She told me stories, braided my hair, and...

111062019.content: No one has ever been that good to me. I was really happy.

111062020.content: And then she took me by the hand and led me to a far away place. We got to a forest, and then she disappeared.

111062022.content: Yes... I searched for her for a long time. Then I heard someone calling my name, and I woke up.

111062023.content: I woke up in complete darkness. I had no idea where I was. And I couldn't even find my way back!

111062024.content: But then I saw all these amazing dancing butterflies that lit up the night like the sun.

111062025.content: There was a butterfly, a black one, that could talk. She wanted me to follow her. Her voice sounds a lot like that sister in my dream, so I followed her here... That's all I remember.

111062026.content: Hold on a second. You said you saw a black butterfly?

111062027.content: Yes. A very large beautiful black butterfly. She was staying here. Hm?  Strange...

111062029.content: I look where Vina indicates. There's a gravestone, but a lot more finely polished than anything else in this semi-abandoned graveyard.

111062030.content: I examine it. There's no corrosion, no signs of wear and tear, and a huge ensemble of white flowers as if still under someone's care and attention.

111062031.content: I can make out the words over the gravestone very clearly: "Vena"... The name of the lady laid to rest, and very familiar to me although I'm not sure how. I look at Hel.

111062034.content: Hel tenderly rubs her hands along the embossed text. There's something sad about her movements.

111062035.content: And that's why the black butterfly called it a place filled with white flowers.

111062036.content: Yes. This is where it meant.

111062037.content: But what is it trying to tell us then?

111062039.content: Ganglati seems to have discovered something untoward. It moves quickly from behind Hel to over the gravestone.

111062040.content: Something is not right, Miss Hel. I'm picking up an aura from another entity... a very negative aura. Apologies, but I must insist.

111062041.content: Ganglati's firearms appear once more and start laying down fire precise enough to avoid any of the white flowers.

111062043.content: What I heard then negates my suspicions the machine had gone haywire. The withering fire had opened up a perfectly-shaped hole in the ground beneath.

111062044.content: But that wasn't the surprising part. There is no trace of anybody within the supposed grave. It's empty. It is almost as if grave robbers had stolen Vena's corpse. They didn't even leave her coffin behind.

111062045.content: This may be much more complicated than we had predicted, Miss Hel.

111062046.content: The lady's purple, ever-composed eyes rest on the empty grave that should have contained her sister's body without reflecting much emotion. A small flicker of what could be anger crosses her face.

111062048.content: Vina, the little girl, must not be entirely sure what to do or say. We are all starting to get a feeling this makes Hel deeply uneasy.

111062049.content: The girl in white tugs at Hel's outfit before hiding behind me.

111062051.content: A gust of Phantom Butterflies suddenly fly at us out of nowhere with all the sound and fury of falling leaves.

111062052.content: The three of us close our eyes on instinct. The butterflies are gone by the time we open them again. A solitary lady stands in front of us. But her body seems slightly unreal.

111062053.content: Ah... The big sister from my dream...

111062055.content: She smiles before giving us a stately bow.

111071001.content: Don't go... Where are you going?

111071002.content: It's alright, Helena, Someone wants to talk to me about something.

111071003.content: Just wait for me at the church. Don't worry. I'll be back soon.

111071005.content: Don’t be afraid, Helena. I will always return to your side—no matter how far.

111071006.content: That's a promise then? Come back soon.

111071007.content: You told me very clearly... that you would come back.

111071008.content: You told me very clearly... that we would be together forever.

111071009.content: I trusted you... and look what happened.

111071011.content: I'm shocked at the revelation as to her true identity. Though I had seen her in my dreams, seeing this... ghost in real life was a bit more startling than I'd expected.

111071012.content: Guessing at our likely awed response, Vena says nothing, but simply continues to gaze gently in our direction.

111071013.content: Vina, who was standing with us is the first to recover from the sight of an actual ghost, and simply runs toward Vena with a spring in her step—excited to finally meet this ethereal presence.

111071014.content: The big sister from my dream! You're really real... (Sobs) Where did you go? I couldn't find you in my dream.

111071015.content: Don't cry, dear child. Remember that black butterfly who spoke to you? That's me. So I've always been here. I haven't gone anywhere.

111071016.content: That must be why you're so beautiful! You are a butterfly!

111071017.content: Vena kneels down and pings Vina on the nose, who enthusiastically tries to shake her hand. A moment later and her eyes turn to me.

111071018.content: The butterfly I saw... that was you?

111071019.content: Yes. We meet at last... And it's no coincidence you could see me. You also have that... inside...

111071021.content: She motions me to keep quiet and shakes her head gently. She finally turns to Hel after a short pause, who remains frozen in place.

111071022.content: Thank you for coming as well, Helena.

111071023.content: Vena... No. You must be an illusion?

111071025.content: But by now you would already be...

111071026.content: You're right. All I am now is just the remnant of some lost soul, but I'm afraid this is how I must reappear to you.

111071027.content: But I'm very happy to see you remember me.

111071028.content: Are you really my sister... Vena?

111071029.content: Hel walks up to Vena to touch her, who takes a step back to keep her distance.

111071030.content: I'm so sorry. I have so much I want to say, but we haven't much time. My... soul data  is liable to be lost any time.

111071031.content: It was so hard for me to contact you... And now you're going to leave?

111071032.content: Why... Why do you have to dash my hopes... again and again...?

111071034.content: Helena does not exist. Helena disappeared the day she lost her home.

111071035.content: I'm sorry... give me a moment.

111071036.content: Deep wounds within Hel must have surely been opened by this latest interaction as her face contorts in wordless pain.

111071037.content: Vena reaches out a hand as if to stop Hel from going, but it's too late. A few moments of silence later and she turns back to us from Hel's departing figure.

111071039.content: Is she really going to be okay, Miss Vena?

111071040.content: Yes. She's just not used to seeing a dead person again... But I have something even more important to reveal.

111071041.content: Is that the other thing you mentioned in the dream?

111071042.content: Yes. You must do your very best to protect this child. The plan won't succeed if you can keep her away from harm.

111071043.content: The unreal projection of Vena turns to gaze at Vina by her side.

111071044.content: What's this plan, Vena? Does it have anything to do with the people who took your body?

111071045.content: My sources are limited. All I know is this child is extremely important.

111071046.content: I know that they won't be able to establish the "Coordinates" they seek from my body as long as this child, who inherits my soul, remains safe...

111071047.content: The phantom projection of Vena suddenly starts shimmering as if unable to remain in physical form.

111071050.content: I have reached the limit. I think this will be our last meeting.

111071051.content: Protect the child. I must also entrust... Helena to you!

111071052.content: Vena then suddenly turns back into a black butterfly and disappears before I can process her last words.

111071053.content: I escort a rather stunned Vina over to Hel, who I locate not too far away.

111071056.content: Hel is back to her old, emotionless self—except this time she's especially uninterested in conversation.

111071059.content: She wants us to protect Vina, basically.

111071060.content: I can foresee a lot of issues, but that might be our only way forward. We can start by escorting Vina to the shelter, where we can discuss things further.

111071061.content: We'll take you back with us, Vina, okay?

111071063.content: Fantastic. Then you've got to hold on to Hel's hand really tight so we don't lose you.

111071064.content: I'd also like it if you could learn some basic etiquette, so you don't just use me as a tool for getting from Point A to Point B like some uncivilized barbarian.

111071065.content: I ignore the complaint from Ganglati in my earpiece and help Vina to Hel's side. At least Hel doesn't seem to have an issue.

111071066.content: A chill wind blows through the eerie, deserted graveyard in this night of nights. I'd been hoping against hope our return would be uneventful, but fate did not agree.

111071067.content: Visbane horde incoming at our 3 o'clock, Miss Hel.

111071069.content: They're coming in fast. 0% chance of avoiding conflict. Safety dictates we send out the one called the Administrator to bait our enemies away.

111071072.content: Ganglati, shut up! And prepare for battle.

111071074.content: Hel, it's too dangerous to take them on all alone.

111071076.content: Hel passes responsibility for Vina onto me and makes ready to head off the incoming Visbanes. That's when Vina grips Hel's wrist in fear as if sensing her impending doom.

111071080.content: Hel hesitates a moment before removing Vina's anxious hand and disappearing off into the darkness of the graveyard.

111072001.content: It wasn't the best escape by any means, but the darkness plus the diversion provided by Hel allowed Vina and I to somehow make it out of the graveyard.

111072002.content: I stop to catch my breath under the faded street lamps. Try as I might, I feel like my lungs are burning. I just can't breathe in enough oxygen after that insane dash.

111072003.content: At this distance, the sound of battle within the graveyard is already quite faint, but it is loud enough that we can tell Hel is knee-deep in a horde of Visbanes. Vina looks anxiously toward the sounds.

111072005.content: She's very powerful. She'll be fine.

111072008.content: Is it because the big sister I saw in my dream left her? She didn't look very happy when we left.

111072009.content: Yeah, I think so. After all, that was her sister, too.

111072013.content: The negative response hangs in the air for a moment as Vina turns to look in Hel's direction. I suddenly realize something.

111072014.content: Vina... did you ever see that big sister before? I mean, apart from in your dream.

111072015.content: No... That was my first time meeting her.

111072017.content: I had wanted to continue the topic, but the sounds of battle abruptly cease. We wait a short while before Hel's familiar figure emerges by the roadside.

111072018.content: Hel's coffin looks rather the worse for wear under the lamplight, as well as Hel's own fine evening wear.

111072021.content: Vina and I rush over to greet Hel warmly, who does nothing but shake her head to indicate that she hasn't been injured.

111072022.content: We resume our homeward journey after a short rest. Vina takes the opportunity at the first chance she gets to squeeze on to Hel's hand tightly, which she does not let go.

111072023.content: We arrive back at the shelter late of night. I see Ver and the others from a distance waiting by the entrance.

111072026.content: I point to the sleeping figure of Vina, and everybody quickly lowers their voices.

111072027.content: Things got really complicated. I'll explain it to you soon as I get the chance. Poseidon, is there anywhere we could rest?

111072028.content: It takes quite a while to explain the entire sequence of events to the three, whose shocked expressions do not leave their faces until I finish.

111072029.content: So that's what happened... to Miss Hel, Miss Vena, and Vina. A lot has happened tonight.

111072030.content: Administrator, next time something crazy like this happens you better ask me to come!

111072032.content: Is there any way we could help?

111072033.content: All we can do now is just take good care of the kid... I'm not even sure where to start with Hel.

111072034.content: The Undertaker Squad? I've heard of it. Just one person. Somehow I didn't expect it to be Hel...

111072035.content: Right now what you all need is a good rest. Administrator, if you or Hel run into any other difficulties, you know you can talk to us anytime.

111072036.content: I do my best to calm myself down and head back to the room where Vina is resting. Hel is sitting on one side of the bed and, from the looks of it, Vina is still holding onto her.

111072037.content: She makes as if to get up when she sees me, but stops as soon as she realizes that movement might wake the kid up from her pleasant dream.

111072040.content: It was hard to tell exactly what kind of dream or nightmare Vina is having, but whatever it is, it makes her cling all the more tightly to Hel.

111072041.content: I shrug in Hel's direction. She responds in like manner with her eyes. I close the door quietly and leave.

111072042.content: Stay with her then, just tonight.

111072043.content: Hel's heart is telling her as much. She looks at the face of the sleeping girl and becomes suddenly struck with an overwhelming sense of peace and contentment.

111072044.content: (This is what my sister used to do. I'm doing what my sister used to do.)

111072046.content: (I showed her how angry I was... But did I really say what I wanted to say?)

111072047.content: (There was so much more I wanted to ask...)

111072049.content: Hel is caught by an overwhelming sense of fatigue before she receives an answer, and is brought down into the world of dreams.

111072050.content: I think I've gotten a handle on the overall situation... Administrator, I think there's a lot to investigate here.

111072051.content: First of all, I would like to update you about Ookuninushi's research. We are confident the Phantom Butterfly phenomenon is some sort of data spill.

111072053.content: To put it simply, it's data that ought to be stored in the Source Layer that somehow spills onto the Surface Layer. The volume of data spillover events reached a detectable peak following this morning's Quakes.

111072054.content: But we haven't seen anything like this with any of the previous Quakes, leading us to suspect an abnormality in the data interaction processes around the Sephirah Zone. Administrator, remember what I told you about the Sephirah Core?

111072055.content: I remember that it is essential to keeping the Sephirah Zone up and running... Are you saying there's something wrong with the Sephirah Core?

111072056.content: We can't exclude the possibility. The Sephirah Core is absolutely essential because it gives us the power to observe all data in the Sephirah Zone.

111072057.content: Quakes, abnormal data phenomena, as well as the mysterious plan you alluded to, Administrator, all point us to the horrifying conclusion that—if all these events are indeed related—someone has taken aim at the Sephirah Core.

111072058.content: W-What? Do we have any way of confirming the current status of the Sephirah Core?

111072059.content: Not as yet, unfortunately. But you don't need to be overly concerned about it. The Sephirah Core is constantly on the move, and it's unlikely anyone could gain an access point without obtaining its Coordinates.

111072060.content: But it's not exactly a great position to be in, regardless. So, Administrator, we'll need you to continue your investigations.

111072061.content: Understood. By the way, Miss Shu, I had another question...

111081001.content: Hel dreamt that night, which was very uncharacteristic of her. And it was a very long dream.

111081002.content: The first thing that she notices upon waking is the pitter-patter of rain outside the window. The weather was strangely dark and gloomy.

111081003.content: I'm talking to you! Helena! Look at me!

111081004.content: Why have you come to ruin us all? My wife died thanks to you. Do you want to kill me as well?

111081005.content: I'm telling you... No freaking way!

111081006.content: The smell of alcohol and cigarette smoke fills the room. Helena finds it utterly revolting.

111081007.content: Father, I'm sorry... I will listen to you better from now on...

111081008.content: Listen to me? What good would that do? I'm telling you, Helena, you're a disaster for this family!

111081009.content: The glass bottle explodes near the girl, who is currently curled into a terrified ball by one corner of the room. The fist which soon hits her body leaves a bloody, bruised mark. Just like any other day.

111081010.content: The man suddenly loses his balance and stumbles backward into a heap.

111081011.content: You dare strike me?! You dare?!

111081013.content: I'm sorry, father. I don't... I'd never.

111081014.content: Helena! Where are you running? You just wait. I'll find you! I'll kill you!

111081015.content: The girl covers her face in her hands as she rushes out into the icy rain. Poisonous curse words and angry shouts follow her bruised and broken body.

111081016.content: Something warm and bright comes to shelter the little girl who'd been running through the pouring rain.

111081019.content: I'll take that as a yes?

111081020.content: A hand gently pushes the door open. A figure enters, hesitantly. She sits down next to the girl.

111081021.content: How do you feel, Helena? Anything hurting?

111081023.content: I see. I found you beaten and bruised by the door to the church. Did your father—

111081024.content: My father. I'm sorry... I'm... so sorry...

111081025.content: The girl leaps up like an arrow loosed from a bow, as if mentally preparing herself for some horrifying eventuality.

111081026.content: I understand... I'm sorry. We shouldn't talk about it.

111081027.content: Don't be afraid. No one here will hurt you. Are you hungry? I brought you something to eat.

111081029.content: I understand. So I'll just leave it here. It's better if you eat it while it's still warm, okay?

111081030.content: You should rest more. I'll come again later.

111081031.content: She sits up as if to leave, but hesitates by the door.

111081032.content: Helena, I hope that you will consider this your home—I mean, before you're fully recovered.

111081033.content: The girl leaves and closes the door gently behind her. Helena looks at the warm bowl of food on the table. She'd almost forgotten what a bowl of delicious hot food tasted like.

111081034.content: Overwhelming hunger eventually forces her out of bed and into devouring the food.

111081036.content: (So am I really going to stay here?)

111081037.content: She begins to cry. Her tears fall into the bowl, adding a kind of salty aftertaste to the meal.

111081038.content: What next awoke Hel from her deep slumber was the smell of food as well as a gentle voice by her ear.

111081040.content: You slept for a long time.

111081041.content: Hel lifts her head from the bed. She is confused, disorientated. She seems not to know why she is here.

111081043.content: Are you up now, Hel? Did you have a good sleep?

111081045.content: Good morning, Miss Hel. It's Friday today. The temperature outside is 23 degrees with a relative humidity of 62% and some excellent sunlight. Your loyal, Ganglati, at your service.

111081047.content: The discovery that Hel had remained by her side throughout the night seems to have restored Vina to her customary cheerful self.

111081048.content: She eagerly goes on at length over breakfast about all the details of her dream last night to Hel, who simply listens in silence, spooning one mouthful of boiled pumpkin into her mouth after another.

111081052.content: It's really good, Vina! I didn't know you could cook!

111081053.content: Heehee... I'm always cooking for myself.

111081054.content: By the way, Vina, where's your home? I feel like we should visit your family. Your parents must be worried sick.

111081055.content: It seems perfectly obvious to me that we can't just keep Vina with us forever. But my question reveals an unpleasant truth.

111081059.content: Because of my sickness. They had to spend a lot of money on me... It got too much for them... so they abandoned me.

111081060.content: Any positivity in the room is thoroughly snuffed out by this horrifying revelation. Vina's eyes slump down to the table as if the wind had been knocked out of her sails.

111081061.content: Hel gives me a strange look, but reaches over to pat Vina's hands before retracting them after a second thought.

111081062.content: The room goes quiet. Vina, sensing something is wrong, lifts up her head to wipe the tears from her eyes.

111081065.content: That's alright. I'm the one who should be apologizing for asking something I shouldn't have. I'm sorry.

111081066.content: But then where were you living before now, Vina?

111081067.content: In the Arcadia Orphanage... The manager was taking care of me. He's a good old man.

111081068.content: But I'm not sure where he's gone...

111081069.content: I see... So, fancy a walk, Vina? The weather's good for it. We might run into someone you know.

111081073.content: I don't want to give Hel the chance to say no, and immediately lead them outside. The weather is just as good as Ganglati had declared. I wonder what the purpose of turning on the thermostat inside had been. I enjoy the breeze against my face and, as result, my mood quickly improves.

111081074.content: All concerns quickly disappear from Vina's face, probably due to Hel's presence, and she starts to excitedly explore the impromptu market around the shelter.

111081076.content: They also have these... have a look!

111081080.content: Hel responds largely with intermittent nods and grunts. She can't yet quite figure out why Vina has so much positive energy around her, and why she is so willing to respond to her every request.

111081081.content: A distinct impression begins to form in Hel's mind that in many ways young Vena was mirroring her own relationship with her sister when she was young.

111081088.content: I turn to the sudden commotion at the corner. I catch sight of a familiar face—an anxious Dr. Zery running toward me with a couple of bags. He throws them on the ground to embrace Vina.

111081090.content: I'm sorry, Dr Z-Zery. That hurts—your beard!

111081091.content: I'm sorry. I... got a bit excited.

111081093.content: Oh, good morning! Now I know you're fine—seeing you with all this energy.

111081094.content: Thank you for the meds. By the way, you know Vina?

111081095.content: I was just about to ask you the same thing, seeing as you're traveling together. Vina was one of my patients before the earthquake. I've been looking for her ever since. I never thought...

111081096.content: Dr. Zery's a volunteer at the Orphanage. His medicine tastes terrible, but I know he's a good doctor.

111081098.content: Leaving out a few key details, I brief the good doctor on the circumstances of our meeting Vina last night.

111081099.content: My goodness, that's incredible! It's just wonderful that you made it back safe and sound, Vina.

111081100.content: Yeah. I'm really grateful for their help.

111081101.content: By the way, are you looking for people who would be able to look after Vina? Maybe I can help?

111081102.content: I see. I'd be a bit more comfortable if it was somebody we knew.

111081104.content: As expected, Hel doesn't really respond. For some reason I think I detect a faint hint of mistrust in her deep purple eyes.

111081105.content: Well, how about everyone comes to my office first?

111081106.content: The little tent has been converted into a temporary clinic by Dr. Zery. I sit with Hel in the strangely clean room for the check-up across the partition to finish.

111081107.content: Hel is getting anxious and fidgety even after a relatively short time.

111081108.content: The curtain opens and Vina jumps onto the seat next to Hel as if to emphasize her perfect health.

111081111.content: Sorry for the wait. I gave Vina a cursory examination. All good. No major problems. I see you've already helped her with a few scrapes. She's recovering really well.

111081112.content: Thank you, Dr. Zery, for the trouble.

111081113.content: No problem. But I would just like to recommend Vina stay with me for a while. I think I have a pretty good handle on her situation and can provide effective care.

111081114.content: ...Alright. It does sound better for her to stay with a doctor.

111081115.content: But the doubts quickly creep in—perhaps because we were about to say goodbye to Vena, perhaps because of Hel's suspicious glances.

111081116.content: Vina clings ever more tightly to Hel, keenly aware that the moment of separation has come.

111081117.content: Hel, will I still be able to see you again?

111081120.content: She keeps looking in our direction as we depart.

111091001.content: Wake up, Helena! It's time for breakfast!

111091002.content: W-What are you doing here, Vena?

111091003.content: Just here to help you wake up. You really do love sleeping in, don't you, you sleepyhead?!

111091006.content: A cold fingertip gently against her forehead stops Helena mid-sentence.

111091007.content: You haven't done anything wrong, Helena. Why apologize?

111091009.content: Helena, listen to me. That's all in the past.

111091010.content: No one is asking you to do anything here. Don't be afraid.

111091011.content: But... if I don't do what people want me to, then...

111091012.content: Helena, I promise: No one will ever hurt you ever again.

111091013.content: Why are you so good to me, Vena?

111091015.content: Helena's new friend responds with a warm hug.

111091016.content: Helena, every life deserves to be treated with love and respect, and you are no different. You deserve to be loved.

111091017.content: Don't be worried because sometimes I like to joke around with people.

111091019.content: By the way, Father Fray said you can stay here as long as you want, you can consider us your new family.

111091021.content: The girl seems to chew for a moment on this most unfamiliar of words. She looks a bit dazed and confused.

111091022.content: What do you think? We can be family, Helena? If you want to.

111091025.content: It is almost like her memory is under a cloud when it comes to details like this—clear one moment, confused the next.

111091026.content: Hel looks up at the strangely starless night sky. What is she looking for? Perhaps an excuse to get away from this feeling of numbness.

111091031.content: The rusty hinges on the door make a soft creaking noise. A girl in white walks slowly over to Hel.

111091032.content: I heard you might be here... Oh... I'm sorry—I don't mean to bother you.

111091033.content: It's alright. Were you looking for me?

111091034.content: Yes. I just wanted to say thank you. I didn't have the chance before.

111091035.content: After we got separated last night, I was worried I wouldn't be able to meet you again. I just wanted to come in here and say thank you... Thank you for saving me, Hel.

111091036.content: You don't need to thank me. It was Vena who wanted to help you.

111091037.content: So what was she like—I mean, that "Miss Butterfly"?

111091039.content: Because I think you are. You kept calling out her name in your sleep.

111091040.content: You two were family, weren't you? The manager at the orphanage always says family are good to each other.

111091041.content: But Hel... Did you get into a terrible fight with her?

111091042.content: I wouldn't call it a fight. It was just that I...

111091043.content: Did Miss Butterfly do something wrong?

111091044.content: Hel shook her head gently, passively alluding to a far more complex reality than could possibly be put into words.

111091045.content: She didn't do anything. I'm the one who did something wrong.

111091046.content: It was I who disappointed her... And made her abandon me.

111091049.content: Hel was not prepared for the sudden touch of Vina's warm hands upon hers. She looks over at the girl staring at her.

111091050.content: It mustn't have been like that, Hel. I know because I saw it. She was crying when she disappeared.

111091051.content: I'm sure she must feel terrible about it. Just like you do... I can feel it.

111091053.content: I feel warm when you are accompanying me, that's the first time in my life. Being with you makes me so happy. I really care about you.

111091054.content: I feel bad if I see you feeling down. I'm sure Miss Butterfly felt the same. That's why she looks so sad.

111091058.content: Unsure of how to reply, Hel clasps the young girl's hands in return.

111091059.content: Hel feels a flicker of something in the corner of her eye—either a passing meteor in the sky, or a tear.

111091060.content: The shelter is finally settling down for the night after a tremendously busy day.

111091061.content: But any temptation to sleep is quickly banished by Dr. Zery's agitated presence as he comes rushing over.

111091063.content: Vina... She is not doing well!

111091064.content: Before I can collect my thoughts and respond, my erstwhile silver-haired companion seems to blink into the Command Room like a ghost.

111091066.content: Come with me. You'll know once you see her.

111091068.content: We reach Dr. Zery's makeshift clinic as fast as we can. We see Vina lying on a bed, her eyes tightly closed, body shaking, muttering something under her breath.

111091071.content: The girl lifts up her slender hand and waves it around haphazardly.

111091073.content: Vina has always suffered from a neurological disorder. I just didn't expect it to reassert itself so soon.

111091074.content: Something must have triggered it. As you can see, if we don't do something, Vina could be a danger to herself.

111091075.content: Is there anything we can do?

111091076.content: There is a special sedative for this. We have quite a lot back in the clinic.

111091077.content: But as you would know the clinic is currently under lockdown... There's no way I can get over there in time.

111091081.content: Yes. Can you tell me where it is?

111091082.content: Alright. Wait a moment. I'll prepare a map.

111091083.content: A few moments later and we find ourselves in possession of a map pinpointing the location of the medicine and clear labels to follow.

111091084.content: I leave finding the medicine to you. Her situation is deteriorating. Come back as soon as possible.

111092001.content: This should be the medicine Dr. Zery needs.

111092002.content: You check the medicine list again for what you need. There really are quite a lot of medicines stored here—rather a lot for such a small, otherwise unimpressive clinic.

111092003.content: I double-check to make sure we have everything we need, and then climb out of the nearly crushed doorway with some difficulty. Hel is there, watching out for Visbanes.

111092004.content: We got the medicine. Let's get it back to the doctor.

111092006.content: Hel's tone is flat and emotionless as usual... but I think I sense a dash of anxiety starting to creeping in.

111092007.content: Hel, I think you're even more worried about Vina than I am.

111092009.content: She... really reminds me of my sister.

111092011.content: Yes. A lot of what she does reminds me of her. Not just her past, her expressions... They even wear the same butterfly.

111092013.content: Yeah. My sister made one just like it. I've never seen anyone else wear anything remotely similar.

111092014.content: I sometimes see my sister when I look at her. I don't understand how that could even be possible—how they could be so similar...

111092016.content: Hel finds something illuminating in my unexpected reply.

111092018.content: I talked about it with Shu last night...

111092019.content: I had another question, about Miss Vena we saw in the graveyard. She said that Vina had somehow inherited her soul. I wasn't sure what that means.

111092020.content: But I would have assumed that Vena's soul would have simply entered the usual Gaea Cycle? Isn't that right?

111092021.content: Yes, the Cycle applies to all persons upon death. Then they are reinserted into Gaea to begin a new life.

111092022.content: If I had to guess what was meant by Vina inheriting her soul, I think what Vena is trying to tell us is that this Vina is actually her Cycle.

111092024.content: Surely you've figured it out... The same person's soul can coexist in two locations simultaneously. But as far as I know, the Cycle does not allow that.

111092025.content: A very interesting question, Administrator. What do you think?

111092026.content: I hadn't given it much thought until you told me, Hel, about all the ways that they seem impossibly similar to each other... Here's my best guess: Butterfly Vena and our Vina somehow each hold a piece of the same soul.

111092027.content: That would help explain our present circumstance.

111092029.content: I didn't want to add anything seeing Hel's visible confusion. I simply quicken my pace as I turn my attention to other topics.

111092030.content: My ruminations do not last long. An urgent SOS through my comms system brings Verthandi's panicked voice to my ear.

111092031.content: Emergency, Administrator! The shelter is under Visbane attack!

111092033.content: There was a tremendous explosion the moment we catch sight of the shelter. I heard it before I saw it—a pillar of fire ascending up into the night sky.

111101001.content: By the time we arrived, the shelter was just as much a hellish disaster zone as the ones we had visited earlier.

111101002.content: The roar of Visbanes mingle with the cries of helpless humans. Our buildings, supplies, and tents had been ravaged mercilessly.

111101003.content: (Crying) I don't want to be eaten!

111101004.content: Something flashes through. The monster falls to the ground in pieces.

111101005.content: It's alright. You're safe now. Go find that lady with blue hair. She'll take you somewhere safe.

111101007.content: Administrator! It's really bad. A whole lot of Visbanes attacked the camp out of nowhere. We're not sure how they got in!

111101008.content: We immediately took action, and then I go look for Vina to keep her safe in the basement shelter.

111101009.content: I checked the doctor's tent but it was empty! It's almost like they simply vanished. I asked around, but no one's seen them.

111101011.content: I'm sorry. It's my responsibility for not protecting them.

111101012.content: It's too early to say yet. Can it really be that no one saw them go?

111101013.content: We were so focused on the refugees that we weren't paying attention to the shelter.

111101014.content: I see... Let's stay calm. We'll get rid of these Visbanes and ask around!

111101016.content: No. I'll be fine on my own.

111102001.content: Time keeps going, as Hel works her way through the Visbane with fire and fury. She's growing steadily more anxious with every minute.

111102002.content: I catch sight of a Visbane preparing to attack Hel out of the corner of my eye. She'd never normally let herself get into that kind of vulnerable position.

111102005.content: Hey, I just saved someone who told me they saw a man in a black suit carrying a girl out of the city, toward the graveyard!

111102006.content: Out of the city? Dr. Zery must have known how risky that was...

111102008.content: We are not sure yet. It may be the doctor saw something was wrong, and so took Vina out of harm's way before the attack.

111102009.content: Anyway, we'll start searching for them there. Ver, you can handle anything else that needs to be done in the city.

111102010.content: Got it, Admin. And we'll come find you after we've dealt with all the Visbanes here.

111102011.content: Hel seems puzzled by how familiar I seem to be with our increasingly common cooperation. I already made myself comfortable on Ganglati before she said anything.

111102012.content: I should be fine on my own.

111102013.content: No. It's also my fault for choosing to trust the doctor. I must take some responsibility for Vina's missing.

111102015.content: Perhaps I am finally becoming accepted by the odd duo, but for whatever reason Ganglati decides not to complain this time. We head into the night as quickly as we can.

111111001.content: We rush over to the same graveyard we had visited earlier, arriving with the first rays of the morning light.

111111002.content: Yet no amount of sunlight seems able to dispel this strange, thick aura that surrounds the graveyard, making everyone feels oddly heavy.

111111003.content: Way more depressing than last time.

111111005.content: If they really did head this way, they should have left some clues to help us track them.

111111006.content: I look around grass and tombstones for some sort of clues, and then suddenly notice a strange source of light. Lo and behold, it is a hoard of Phantom Butterflies fluttering around something.

111111011.content: Good. Looks like they went this way.

111111012.content: Then we'd better keep going. We should find another clue soon.

111121001.content: We follow the butterflies and the clues Vina had left behind to a rather suspicious-looking door attached to the abandoned church.

111121002.content: We aren't getting through that over-complicated door lock easily. Time to call Mimir... who's probably sleeping.

111121004.content: S-Shut up, rookie! I wouldn't have any trouble at all with a lock like this if it weren't for this darned restrictive bracelet!

111121005.content: Hmph! Just give me a second. This is child's play.

111121007.content: Whaaa! What are you doing! That's too dangerous!

111121009.content: I stare at the entrance, if it could be called that, that Hel's cannon had opened for us into the church. The interior looks a lot more modern than this old graveyard would have suggested was possible.

111121010.content: Quick. Inside. Let's check it out.

111121011.content: It's cold—very cold. There are hundreds of computing devices arrayed behind glass partitions on either side. The constant flashing of lights and red and green signals simply adds to the bewildering mysteriousness of the place.

111121013.content: This is the place. Vina is here.

111121014.content: We might be able to get something usable from a terminal.

111122001.content: I lean against the wall of a small supply closet to catch my breath, and try to see if I can do anything to stem the pain of my injuries inflicted during the escape.

111122002.content: Hah! How is it going? Have we shaken them off?

111122003.content: Mm. No more Visbane signs, for now.

111122004.content: Sorry. I didn't think that would set off an alarm. Thinking about leaving, rookie?

111122005.content: No. Hold on a sec. Lemme figure out what's going on with those documents.

111122006.content: If I'm not mistaken, this "Soul Replenishment Plan" is the very same plan Miss Vena mentioned.

111122007.content: And I'm afraid its ultimate goal is to take control of the Sephirah Core.

111122008.content: (In Mimir's unique shriek) Sephirah Core? What makes you think that!?

111122009.content: There was a document that mentioned Coordinates back there, right?

111122011.content: Any such Coordinates should be invalid, correct?

111122012.content: Yes. The Coordinates in Vena's body must be broken. Just as the report said.

111122013.content: But if there was some way to fix them...

111122014.content: I think you're overthinking it, rookie. I'm not sure how you can locate something like that in a soul... Wait! Is this why they're experimenting on soul transfers?

111122015.content: Yeah. I think whoever is behind this experiment is trying to get the complete the set of Coordinates using some other kind of... data. But they seem to have failed.

111122016.content: Meaning they haven't hit the right precondition, which is... a soul with exactly the same frequency as Vena's.

111122018.content: As Vena's Cycle, She must be their best candidate.

111122019.content: We catch sight of the conspicuous nearby door almost at the same time. Hel grips my wrist.

111131001.content: The massive underground laboratory alarm is ear-splittingly loud and accompanied by all manner of red lights from all manner of glass enclosures.

111131002.content: Hel and I glances at each other from in front of the door leading down some deep passageway. Both of us are weighed down with anxiety having learned of this Soul Replenishment Plan.

111131003.content: Hel nod at me to indicate we should try opening the heavyset door together. What we see inside shatters the last bit of good wish we might have had.

111131006.content: Two massive life-support capsules had been erected in the very center of the room, each containing a body visible through the viscous liquid.

111131008.content: It is your privilege to witness the fulfilment of the greatest experiment of this century.

111131009.content: The black-suited Dr. Zery looks at us with a crazed, flippant smile from behind his glasses.

111131010.content: Dr. Zery! It was you all along...

111131011.content: Hahaha! I wonder how Turing would feel?

111131012.content: ...You used us to get close to Vina, so you could take her away for your evil plan?

111131013.content: Exactly! And I should thank you, really. I almost lost my invaluable test subject when that earthquake hit.

111131014.content: If I can find fault with you, it is only that you are so easily deceived. I hadn't expected victory to come so easily.

111131015.content: Zery... Do you have any idea what you're really doing?

111131016.content: Of course! Isn't it obvious? Completing the Soul Replacement Plan to resurrect my dear wife.

111131017.content: This is my chance to call Elizabeth back to my side. Turing will glorify us both.

111131018.content: And don't call me by that ridiculous name "Zery". Today's the day Ain Soph—no, the whole world—will hear the name of Otis!

111131019.content: And you, dear friends, have been the cornerstone upon which this plan has succeeded.

111131020.content: The man in black looks at me with a crazed gleam in his eye. That look makes up my mind that we must compromise his madcap plan.

111131021.content: Hel remains silent, but I can tell she is shaking with barely contained emotion. She looks past the madman to the body of her sister behind him.

111131022.content: You shouldn't try to interfere at this stage. Even I don't know what will happen if you do...

111131023.content: By the way, I also prepared a little thank-you gift. It's nothing really.

111131024.content: Otis smiles contemptuously in our direction before clapping his hands.

111132001.content: There's a whole horde of them!

111132002.content: I manage to roll to the side and out of the way of a Visbane behind me. I take it out with my sidearm, although I barely have enough strength left to do even that. Hel wails away on the Visbanes with her cannon, but isn't making her usual headway.
