111132003.content: I glance over at the doctor. He seems relatively unconcerned with us, assuming perhaps our defeat by the Visbanes is a done deal. He just keeps watching the slow progress bar on the energy meter climbs toward its destination.

111132004.content: No one will be able to stop the plan now...

111132005.content: I can finally see you again, Elizabeth!

111132007.content: Without a doubt in his mind, the madman presses the activation button. The room darkens slightly in response to the massive amount of energy now being channeled into the two bodies in the capsules.

111132008.content: The light gets brighter and brighter before settling into two distinct auras for each machine, which then start to integrate in the air. The brilliant aura tells me we've failed. I shut my eyes in regrets.

111132009.content: There's a loud sound from somewhere, possibly an explosion. Then the earth starts shaking, which also seemingly disrupts the auras from integrating.

111132010.content: Integrate! I said keep integrating! What's going on? Don't stop now!

111132011.content: You can't fail now, you can't! M-My plan was perfect!

111132012.content: Otis' triumphant glee turns to one of abject horror. He feverishly taps on his console to try to figure out what's going on. Soon he opens his eyes wide in horror, and then sits down on the ground as if paralyzed.

111132013.content: Insufficient computation power! That's impossible... I've got more computing power here than the entire Sephirah Zone. Who destroyed my Wedge?!

111132014.content: I take advantage of the madman's despair and rush towards the console. Hel, for her part, decides to leap up into the two auras of brilliant light.

111132015.content: An even bigger earthquake hits us en route. The light around the capsules starts to oscillate with increasing frequency.

111132017.content: I'm too late. A tremendous explosion cascades out from the center of the fluctuating light streams, enveloping everyone in the room in a tremendous wave energy.

111132018.content: Before I lost my conscious, I took a look at Hel. She has collapsed on the ground alongside that ball of light.

111141003.content: Look at you now. Hadn't you already decided long ago to give up on human emotions?

111141004.content: I... decided that a long time ago.

111141005.content: It's a past that is too awful to remember. It's the darkness within human nature that is too hard to ignore. Yet why...

111141006.content: Why would you go to such great lengths to protect someone? Heh.

111141007.content: Think about what you've been through... about that crazed drunkard who used to be angry at you all day for no reason?

111141008.content: The person that you trusted most in your life, your dearest sister, abandoned you, and cast you out.

111141009.content: And now you are yet again about to lose something you want to protect. And there's nothing you can do about it, is there?

111141010.content: All feeling and emotion is a road to nowhere. Why do you persist?

111141012.content: A black butterfly suddenly flies over.

111141015.content: You can't abandon your emotions. They are bound to grow as long as life continues.

111141016.content: Any pain you have suffered will in time ultimately be healed by warmer and gentler memories.

111141017.content: So don't say that... that nothing in this world is worth believing in any more, just because I wasn't able to protect you...

111141018.content: Your greatest regret will be losing the one you cherished most.

111141019.content: Come, Helena. Let me take your hand. Once more.

111142001.content: The black butterfly lands softly on Hel's shoulder and then begins to glow with a powerful luminescence that is faintly projecting Vena's figure.

111142002.content: The projection appears weak, as if liable to disappear at any moment. But this did not matter. She watches the silver-haired girl run up to her in a warm embrace. Now they can say that they have finally returned to each other.

111142003.content: Were you leading me the whole time, Vena?

111142004.content: I was always so worried about you.

111142005.content: Remember the promise we made? Helena, we are family forever.

111142007.content: Vena responds by embracing Hel all the more.

111142009.content: Everything was my fault. I said things I shouldn't have. But I'm so happy I can see you again at least...

111142010.content: I'm the same. And overjoyed at the life of freedom and independence you're living now.

111142011.content: Alright then. We'd better get out of here now, Helena. It's time to wake up.

111142012.content: But Vena! I have so much I need to tell you! I have so much I need to ask you!

111142013.content: Can I just stay here a bit longer if I want to? Just by your side a bit... a bit longer.

111142014.content: You cannot, Helena. There is something more important you must do.

111142015.content: Look at you. You have made some good friends, haven’t you?

111142016.content: You should cherish them now. And you need to learn... to let me go.

111142018.content: I've always loved butterflies because, even if they are weak and fragile and small, they still manage to escape their cocoon, flying off to live beautiful lives.

111142019.content: I will always love you, Helena... Do not be bound by the cocoon, by me. Go out and live your own life.

111142020.content: You deserve to spread your wings, like a beautiful butterfly.

111142023.content: There's nothing that Hel can do to stop the illusion from disappearing. She sadly retracts her hands and pats her chest in one last memento of her sister's parting warmth.

111142024.content: I know what I need to do... Vena.

111151001.content: I wake with a heavy smell of burnt metal in my nostrils, reminding me that my physical condition is pretty far from ideal.

111151002.content: Every muscle in my body seems to be screaming out with pain, like I'm being crushed by a massive dumbbell. What's worse, I think the shockwave broke one or more bones. I try to open my eyes, but it's too hard to see through so much blood.

111151004.content: I look over at the silver-haired girl lying not so far away. My legs don't respond, so I have to crawl over.

111151007.content: I look over at the source of the noise. A very large barrier door raised up behind us after we enter the laboratory. Something is doing its best to smash its way through. Something giant.

111151008.content: Each terrifying collision with the barrier adds another deformity to the structure until finally opening up a small aperture.

111151009.content: At last, a pathway has been carved out of the mangled barrier door. I do my best to raise my sidearm in its direction just in case I needed to open fire on whatever comes through.

111151010.content: It quickly becomes apparent it is a pointless exercise. Another smash and a horde of Visbane stream into the laboratory through the broken door in our direction.

111151011.content: (My goodness. How can there be so many Visbanes? Did something bring them here?)

111151012.content: I empty my last clip into the horde's direction and then use the last ounce of my strength to move to shelter Hel's still unconscious body. I close my eyes and await the inevitable end.

111151014.content: Admin! Hold on. The cavalry has arrived!

111151015.content: I suddenly realized someone is calling my name. Am I just hearing things? But then I get an urge to yell "We're saved!" when I see who's coming my way.

111151017.content: We came as soon as we noticed that quake. Thank goodness we made it.

111151018.content: Take Miss Hel and stay back, Admin. We'll handle the Visbanes.

111151019.content: Poseidon helps myself and a still dazed Hel over to a somewhat safer location for first aid while Ver and Zenkibo block the Visbanes.

111151020.content: Hel seems to be in a terrible shape. Besides her wounds, she's started to mutter to herself, as if in a daze.

111151024.content: Poseidon shakes her head sadly. I look over at the still glittering aura of light and pray a miracle might occur.

111151025.content: I hear the butterfly wings again. I stare at my chest from which, inexplicably, a black butterfly flies out.

111151027.content: I was just a soul forced to stay in this world. It's only right that I should leave it now. Can you forgive me... for this, Helena?

111151028.content: The butterfly bursts into dark, fantastic flames before flying into Hel's chest.

111152001.content: The battle has lasted for almost half an hour, and yet the steady stream of Visbanes show no sign of abating.

111152002.content: Ver and Zenkibo have started to hit their limits. After leaving Hel in Poseidon's safekeeping, I hide behind some nearby cover to offer what little assistance I can.

111152003.content: Huff... My goodness. How are there so many?

111152004.content: Zenkibo is almost out of ammunition.

111152005.content: I'm sorry, Ver, Zenkibo. 'Til Shu comes with reinforcements, we're all the protection Hel's got.

111152006.content: Even so, the two Modifiers are clearly exhausted, and the Mimir System is starting to lose its edge as well.

111152009.content: (Not... fast enough. Not gonna make it...)

111152011.content: Another purple explosion rocks the battlefield, wiping out the surrounding Visbanes in one strike. The voice that followed was immensely reassuring.

111152014.content: Hel? You are awake?! Are you alright?

111152015.content: I'm fine... Thanks for looking out for me.

111152016.content: Don't mention it. After all, we're a team, aren't we?

111152018.content: Heh, Miss Hel. Haven't we been fighting together this whole time?

111152019.content: That said, that last attack was super helpful! Thanks.

111152021.content: Well... How about we take 'em all out!?

111152022.content: Come on, Hel! Let's do this together!

111152024.content: Hel firmly grips the hand I offer in her direction. There seems to be a bit of extra sparkle and resolve in her usually lifeless eyes.

111152025.content: Shu's reinforcement arrives soon after, and our combined forces easily vanquish all the remaining Visbanes in the area.

111161001.content: Once the battle is declared over, Hel and I arrive virtually at the same time to the command console to stop whatever remnants of the "Soul Replenishment Plan" are still in motion.

111161002.content: That's the end of it, then?

111161003.content: The auras of light above do not separated into two as we originally expected, but move with one accord over to Vina's capsule to join the liquid inside.

111161004.content: The capsule door then opens and I rushed over to embrace the still-sleeping Vina. Hel stares at the newly-emptied capsule. She is confused.

111161006.content: I think the portion of her soul probably dissipated in the process. So it was inevitable her body would be converted into data...

111161008.content: (Thanks for remembering our promise... until the very end.)

111161010.content: The long silence continues until Vina woke up.

111161011.content: Where... am I? What happened, Hel?

111161012.content: You were asleep for a while, Vina. Do you feel okay?

111161013.content: I'm fine. I just think I had a really bad nightmare.

111161014.content: I dreamed I was kidnapped by creepy monsters and you came to save me, Hel. But I couldn't reach you for some reason.

111161015.content: I finally graspped your hand, but you just disappeared. I thought that you had abandoned me, but it turns out... it was just a dream.

111161016.content: Vina gently clasps Hel's hands as if embracing the last lifeboat left in a maelstrom.

111161017.content: Hel loses herself for a moment in Vina's eyes as her memories transport her back to a time many years ago where her position was somewhat reversed.

111161019.content: What do you plan to do about the child?

111161020.content: CORG will arrive any minute. I'm sure we can trust them to handle it.

111161021.content: I would like to adopt her.

111161023.content: If she's happy enough to consent, then you don't need to worry about the paperwork.

111161024.content: Would you like to live with me, Vina?

111161028.content: Hel still remembers that moment, when Vena extended her hands with a warmth reminiscent of the first rays of the spring sun melting the icy winter's chill.

111161029.content: The warmth of that moment is etched forever in Hel's memories.

111161032.content: The whole group breaks out in smiles.

111161036.content: Something about the abandoned graveyard continues to send chills down my spine as we walk through—even in the middle of the day.

111161037.content: I look at the girl walking in front of me. Her footsteps are nimble, her silver hair occasionally glinting with the rays of the sun.

111161038.content: Following the route we walked the other day, we soon find ourselves at the place "filled with white flowers". Too bad that night's battle had left the site with considerable damage.

111161040.content: My sister's tombstone. I plan to repair it.

111161041.content: She liked to keep things neat and tidy.

111161042.content: How do you feel now, Hel?

111161044.content: Oh, I just mean in terms of your relationship with Miss Vena—in light of all that's happened.

111161045.content: I... Everything is fine now. We are family, after all.

111161046.content: But in the end she never did tell me why she wanted me to leave...

111161047.content: Yes, well, I did some investigation about that incident, and found some relevant information from ten years ago.

111161048.content: Some... relevant information? About my sister?

111161049.content: I'm sorry, it's not really my place to poke around. You might not find it pleasant.

111161050.content: No... that's alright. I'd like to know what happened?

111161051.content: I always felt I wasn't good enough somehow to know... All these years, I put it out of sight, out of mind.

111161052.content: Information is a bit sparse, but it seems the Camdens family offered to purchase the funeral parlor for an exorbitant price. But Vena rejected it.

111161053.content: There was a violent incident in which the church and orphanage suffered tremendous damage. The matter was kept from the press thanks to the family's influence.

111161057.content: Helena?! You're not in your room!?

111161058.content: I was waiting for you. What's wrong, Vena?

111161059.content: I'm fine. I was just going to wash my face.

111161062.content: Helena, return to your room at once!

111161063.content: Don't be angry with me. I... I'm sorry...

111161064.content: You should learn to take care of yourself, Helena.

111161065.content: So they did something to Vena, didn't they?

111161066.content: Camden... that's my old surname. My father must have been looking for me.

111161067.content: That is, your adoptive father. That wretch seems to have wanted to take you away from Vena, and so threatened her with violence.

111161068.content: And because Vena didn't agree to surrender you, they... treated her badly.

111161070.content: The Camdens tried several nasty methods, but Vena still didn't give in.

111161071.content: But the whole situation seems to have made her illness getting worse and shortly thereafter... perhaps she felt like the moment had come where she couldn't protect you anymore. That's what drove her to that choice. And then afterwards...

111161072.content: I know what happened afterwards. Thank you for telling me this, Administrator.

111161074.content: Hel caresses the new gravestone, bends down, and places it at the place filled with white flowers.

111161076.content: (I'm so, so lucky to have met you...)

111161077.content: (It's enough for me to know that you never left my side.)

111161079.content: Goodbye, Helena. It's your turn to be a good sister, now...

111161080.content: I pick up the faint but very clear voice.

111161081.content: Quiet and gentle, just like a black butterfly flies off far off into the distance.

111171002.content: I've got some good news and some bad news. Which one do you want first?

111171004.content: As I thought. Here it is: I think I'm making progress with the Phantom Butterflies.

111171005.content: I investigated the areas around recent sightings. My scanner picked something up. There really is some kind of retained energy around there, which means I'll soon be able to figure out exactly what causes the phenomenon.

111171007.content: The bad news is that this leftover energy is somehow interfering with our Quake Detection System, which has since become... sort of useless.

111171008.content: The Quake locator has been generating dozens of contradictory results. If we can't do something, it's not just we won't be able to fix the Detection System, our entire early warning system will break down.

111171011.content: Ookuninushi produces a somewhat strange-looking device from behind her back. She slaps it's metallic shell proudly.

111171012.content: Meet the newest addition to the BunBun series: the Quake Analyzer 1. It allows us to directly gather the energy. But I'll still need help...

111171013.content: You can't just gather it yourself?

111171014.content: I've got a lot of other things on my plate, you know that. So no. And the energy signals disappears rather quickly. I can't collect them immediately.

111171015.content: Oh. So you'll need someone... fast?

111171016.content: I think I've got someone who'd fit the bill—although she doesn't technically work for Aether Gazer. Hold on. I'll put you in touch.

111171018.content: I-I beg you! Don't come any closer. Don't! Aghhhhhhhh!!!

111171019.content: The cries of the helpless man do nothing to stop the slow advance of the monster. He can feel the icy chill emanating from the beast like a dagger to his cheeks.

111171020.content: The man clings to the corner of the wall and closes his eyes in despair as he awaits the inevitable.

111171022.content: A powerful shout is followed by some very quick footsteps. The man feels the temptation to open his eyes.

111171023.content: At that moment, there is no more fear of death inside his mind. All he's thinking is: If there really are a goddess, she must be a girl with blonde hair and a pair of leg exoskeletons.

111171024.content: A powerful kick sends the monster flying several meters. The valiant heroine bends down to talk to him.

111171027.content: Are you injured? Dizzy? Lacking oxygen? Take some deep breaths. Follow me. Breathe in... breathe out...

111171029.content: That's great! Looks like I made it in time. That was pretty close.

111171030.content: Alright then. Could you go and hide over there? I'll take you back after I clean this place up.

111171031.content: O-Okay... Are you sure? You're all alone?

111172001.content: Thank you so much! Not just for saving me, but also the ride... I honestly don't know how I can ever repay you!

111172002.content: Hey. Don't mention it. No trouble, really. And I couldn't just stand by and do nothing.

111172003.content: If you really want to repay me, then you can start by supporting our business. Here's my card.

111172004.content: Oh no. I forgot I was meant to touch base with our director about now. Gotta go! Remember to contact me if you ever need something delivered... fast! We're on time—always!

111172005.content: The loquacious girl disappears like a gust of wind, leaving the man staring, confused, at the card in his hand.

111172007.content: Hermes, at last! We were starting to get real worried about you.

111172008.content: Don't worry, Iris. I've already delivered the emergency supplies. They should be helpful.

111172009.content: Hope so. These Quakes are coming way too fast. People are really hurting... But you were meant to touch base with us an hour ago. What happened?

111172010.content: Aha. Oh. That. I delivered the supplies on time, right?

111172011.content: Hermes, did you go on some heroic errand?

111172013.content: Of course you did! What can I say? It's all fine and good to help others, but you should at least let us know beforehand.

111172014.content: I'm sorry. It's almost like my legs started running of their own accord when I saw this guy was in danger. I'm all about delivering love and hope!

111172015.content: But, from our perspective, your safety is our top priority. Also, someone else was looking for you today. Let me link you up now.

111172017.content: Long time no see, Hermes! Is now a good time to talk?

111172019.content: Yes. I'm Shu. This is Ookuninushi from the Cryptics.

111172020.content: Ah, right. You helped me debug and check my Access Key. What can I do for you?

111172021.content: It's a little urgent. I'll try to be brief. Hermes, we need your help with something.

111181001.content: The golden-haired girl stands on a makeshift tower of crushed stone, wiring, and steel as she surveys the ruined city upon which these Quakes had left their mark.

111181002.content: ...Even worse than I'd thought. No wonder Iris looked so worried when I left to deliver the supplies.

111181003.content: I used to like this place and its old city vibes. Hope everyone got to safety.

111181004.content: That reminds me... how is the relief effort going?

111181005.content: A lot better since you joined. We've managed to take all of the survivors into shelters of some kind or other. And we have dedicated teams to handle "the other things".

111181006.content: Do you think the city will ever return back to the way it was, Ookuninushi?

111181007.content: I think so. But that will also depend on whether we can get a fix on the source of these Quakes..

111181009.content: Hermes scratches her head in confusion before turning to look at the strange device she had been given.

111181010.content: This thing you gave me, Ookuninushi... it doesn't seem to do anything. Is it really going to help?

111181011.content: It's called the BunBun Quake Analyzer 1! Gosh.

111181012.content: Ookuninushi sighs impatiently as if somewhat peeved at the name of her brilliant invention not being remembered.

111181013.content: This is the story: Lately, we've been picking up drifting energy we're calling "Data Spill".

111181014.content: Most of such data showed up on the Surface Layer following the Quakes, and is making it hard to pinpoint the source.

111181015.content: I'm starting to suspect the Quakes and this data are connected in some way. If I was able to analyze the data, maybe I could use it to work out the source coordinates and then perhaps the coordinates of the Quakes themselves.

111181016.content: Huh? Sounds like I'm just collecting data. Don't you have heaps of people at Aether Gazer who'd be even better?

111181017.content: Nope. The energy disappears almost as soon as it spills out. We only have a very short window of time to collect it.

111181018.content: So we need someone very fast to collect it as soon as it appears. To me, right now, it seems you and your Access Key is the best hope.

111181019.content: Right... I got you. I'm pretty fast, ya know!

111181021.content: No. I don't want to worry about those complicated things. All I need to know is that I'm running for the sake of the city.

111181022.content: Hermes! We've got a data point! Remember—be quick!

111182001.content: Hermes supports her knees, panting, as if just released from a hurricane.

111182002.content: Phew... Did I make it in time, Ookuninushi?

111182003.content: I don't see any data here.

111182004.content: Gosh! Even that wasn't fast enough! I'm sorry. If I’d ran a little faster, maybe I’d’ve made it in time.

111182005.content: All those Visbanes popping up out of nowhere cost me a lot of time.

111182006.content: The petite researcher displayed on the screen seems deep in thought.

111182007.content: The Data Spill should just be like a stream of discarded information. There's no reason why it would attract Visbanes.

111182008.content: Looks like our data gathering might be more complicated then I'd realized. We're going to have to look at a more secure acquisition method...

111182009.content: Maybe I could calculate the coordinates ahead of time...

111182010.content: Uh, Ookuninushi? Is there anything I can help you with there?

111182012.content: Alright then. So what should I do now?

111182013.content: Whatever you want. I'll let you know if anything comes up.

111182014.content: Ookuninushi hurriedly ends the call. She'd obviously rather think about this problem than talk about it.

111182015.content: She hung up. Okay! I'd better go back and help at the shelter.

111182016.content: There's lots to do! Time to get moving!

111182017.content: Hermes pats herself on the cheeks before setting out once more.

111191001.content: The shelter is a hive of activity, with people hurrying to and from. Everyone has a serious look on their faces.

111191002.content: Not Hermes' favorite vibes, but she knows that the best way she can help is to keep running.

111191003.content: The curtains are suddenly pulled back to reveal a trolley pushed by Hermes filled with all manner of cardboard boxes.

111191004.content: Olympia Express! Here are the supplies for this station. Please check the list.

111191005.content: Just leave it there, Hermes. Wonderful! These supplies could be the life saver for the folks in our makeshift ward. At least they'll get through tonight!

111191006.content: We've had so many injured... we don't have any spare time to go and organize proper medical supplies. It's great you're willing to help out.

111191007.content: Heh. That's alright. Just leave it to me!

111191009.content: Hermes' ears perk up at the sound of crying from somewhere in the tent. She quickly locates the source.

111191010.content: It's a girl crying into her mother's bosom by a dimly lit corner of the tent.

111191012.content: I'm sorry, but is there anything I can do to help?

111191014.content: Yes, I am! Spreading love and hope from over the horizon at your beck and call! That's our motto!

111191015.content: Hermes of Olympia Express at your service!

111191016.content: Hermes does her best to imitate a certain masked superhero from a popular cartoon as she makes her entrance. She isn't the greatest actor, but it doesn't matter.

111191017.content: The girl stops crying and just stares at Hermes—looks like she's shocked by Hermes' performance.

111191019.content: Hey hey! Olympia Express at your service! Could you tell me what happened?

111191021.content: I lost him on the way here...

111191022.content: Mommy... mommy said I might never find him again... (Sobbing)

111191023.content: D-Don't cry! That won't help me find him. Could you give me some tips on how to find Ivan?

111191025.content: Hermes, Ivan is my best friend... Can you really find him?

111191026.content: Come on, dear. Miss Hermes has something more important to worry about.

111191028.content: You can leave it to me! Oh, by the way, is Ivan a doggy or a kitty?

111192001.content: The battle came suddenly, but Hermes wrapped it up faster than it came.

111192004.content: Hermes could detect the sound of applause from the channel on the terminal although Ookuninushi's face wasn't moving.

111192005.content: Ookuninushi, when did you join the channel?

111192006.content: When you were messing with that blanket.

111192007.content: Well... it really felt so similar.

111192008.content: And what is it about that teddy bear?

111192009.content: A girl's best friend. She lost it during the escape. I'm helping her get it back.

111192011.content: Of course! It's not just any old plush toy. This means hope to a little girl.

111192012.content: And we are in the business of hope—no matter how small.

111192013.content: But then again, Ookuninushi, what would the Visbanes want with a little teddy bear?

111192014.content: That's actually why I came to you. Could you try testing that teddy on the BunBun Analyzer 1?

111192015.content: Let me have a look... What? It got some data!

111192016.content: Right. The device reacted when you got close to the toy. I think some Data Spill was detected on it.

111192017.content: Next, Hermes, can I trouble you to press the Analyze button? That will upload the data for me.

111192019.content: As soon as she presses the button, Hermes hears something like an error alert wailing in her ears.. Then she finds herself slipping down into unconsciousness. It's dark when she wakes up.

111192023.content: Hermes doesn't have time to figure out what is going on before a voice in the dark grabs her attention.

111192025.content: Daddy, did you remember it's my birthday today?

111192026.content: Of course! Look at what daddy got you! This cuddly teddy bear!

111192027.content: I'm sorry, darling, I've been so busy with work lately. I haven't had much time for you. This little bear will keep you company for me when I'm away, do you like it?

111192028.content: Yay! Thanks for the present, daddy! I'd like to call him "Ivan". Is that OK?

111192029.content: Oh no... This... This does not look good...

111192030.content: Darling, oh darling... I wish I could... see you again...

111192032.content: Hah?! Ookuninushi? Did you hear that? Someone was talking in my mind...

111192033.content: Calm down. That's just the BunBun Analyzer 1 syncing and parsing the analyzed data for you. Strictly speaking, what you just heard was actually a segment of past memory.

111192034.content: I felt like... I heard that girl's voice in my head. And her father's too...

111192035.content: Yeah. I'm getting the impression that this snippet of memory actually belonged to the girl's father. But this is strange...

111192037.content: The fact that we've been able to pick up bits of memory in data form, indicates that the person who generated these memories was already... well... you heard the gunshot.

111192038.content: Typically, when the souls of the deceased enter the Cycle, their memories will be saved in the Source Layer as standalone data packages. But, as you can see, the Data Spill phenomenon is actually allowing us to analyze it.

111192039.content: You mean... we can expect to see other memories when we come across other Data Spill?

111192040.content: Theoretically, yes. Memory data saved in the Source Layer was brought to the Surface Layer with these spilling data streams. That indicates something abnormal is going on with Gaea.

111192041.content: Does it have something to do with these Quakes?

111192042.content: I thought so, but this never happened with Quakes in the past.

111192043.content: I'm afraid that it's not the Quakes causing the Data Spill, but something or someone trying to pinch data already recovered by Gaea. That might be the cause of these Quakes.

111192044.content: I see... Then we should send the data back!

111192046.content: All these memories and data belong in the Source Layer. So if we find anything here, we send them back to where they belong.

111192047.content: Maybe I'm just a workaholic... or maybe it's duty calling, but it just feels like we should do it this way. The question is... how?

111192048.content: Actually, all we need to do is stop whoever is trying to extract this data—wherever they're doing that—and then send it back to the Source Layer. And I'm guessing, we'll find the source of the Quakes there.

111192049.content: The data you just picked up has given me enough info. I should be able to reverse calculate a rough estimate of the coordinates. Why don't we try looking there first?

111192050.content: Huh? Can I return to the shelter first?

111192051.content: No. The location pinpointed is liable to change at any moment. We've got to grab hold of this opportunity.

111192052.content: Alright. Time's ticking. Let's do it.

111192053.content: Hermes takes another look at the sad, helpless-looking teddy bear in her hands.

111192054.content: Don't worry. I'll get you back to your master soon.

111201001.content: All objects around Hermes quickly recede into the distance as she speeds up. The experience for an observer would be somewhat akin to looking out the window of a high-speed railway train.

111201002.content: But the blur of these high speeds does nothing to deter Hermes, who expertly weaves past all kinds of streets and alleyways to her destination.

111201003.content: This is the place, right, Ookuninushi?

111201004.content: Seems I didn't need to guide you at all.

111201005.content: Hey, let's not forget I've been to every nook and cranny of Ain Soph! I've got the whole city map memorized down to the last street corner.

111201006.content: Maybe someday I can take you for a stroll, Ookuninushi? I know quite a few interesting places you might like.

111201007.content: Nah. I'd rather get this issue sorted as soon as possible.

111201008.content: Right. Well. After we've sorted it.

111201009.content: Hermes stands up again to look around after this awkward overture.

111201010.content: The closer I get, the worse the situation is.

111201011.content: In fact, you are almost at the epicenter of the recent Quakes. Since these coordinates were just an estimate, that's the best we can do.

111201012.content: Do I need to keep collecting data then? The analyzer is saying there are nearly 100 separate data signals around here. Analyzing each one will take ages...

111201013.content: Not necessarily. If whoever is extracting the data keeps going on, I'm sure we'll find most of the data gathered in one place—and that's our target.

111201014.content: Got it. Like you get most of your water from the mouth of a fountain.

111201015.content: Right. So let's just start from wherever the data is densest.

111202001.content: Quick, Hermes, after it! That Visbane has got its hands on a huge amount of Data Spill. I think it just absorbed it.

111202002.content: Follow it! This is our chance to find where the data is going.

111202003.content: Got it. But it's so fast!

111202005.content: Hermes rounds the corner and then comes to a gradual stop. She looks around, confused.

111202006.content: I seem to have... lost it?

111202008.content: Not possible. I'm just about the fastest there is in this business.

111202009.content: And this is a pretty open area. I don't think there's anywhere it could have taken cover that fast.

111202010.content: In other words, it must still be around here. It's just hiding.

111202011.content: Brilliant, Ookuninushi! I'll search the area. There must be some sort of secret passageway.

111202012.content: A large hole concealed by tiles and bricks soon located by the two Modifiers.

111202013.content: I'm detecting Bane Energy. It must have gone down from here.

111202014.content: Didn't realize it was that easy for them to just disappear.

111202015.content: Let's go! Find where it's taking the data. That Visbane sure seems strange to me.

111202016.content: I'll beat it out of it!

111202017.content: Wait, Hermes! You should at least—

111202018.content: Hermes realizes only after leaping down the dark hole that she may have left out something important.

111202019.content: Ookuninushi! How deep is this thing?

111211002.content: Hermes rubs her thighs, which managed to absorb most of the impact, and slowly stands up for a look around.

111211003.content: The only conspicuous object in the dark room is a pallid screen crackling with audible energy.

111211005.content: Around 100 meters underground relative to your previous location. I didn't expect this under Ain Soph.

111211006.content: O-One hundred meters? No wonder. That was a big drop.

111211007.content: And what about the Visbane? Where'd it go?

111211009.content: No trace of it. Let's just pick up the chase if we can. The data here is really dense—much denser even than the previous peak I detected. And that brings heaps of interference.

111211010.content: Conversely, that means our Visbane is not responsible for collecting all of this data. I think we're really close to whatever is trying to pull the data away from the Source Layer... It's just...

111211012.content: I'm just starting to wonder... about the teddy bear and everything since... Why would Visbanes want all this data?

111211013.content: In other words, do the Visbanes actually need soul data for something? Anyway, the first thing for us to do is to find the data stream around here.

111211014.content: Not a problem. Then again, where is "here" exactly?

111211015.content: The place is blanketed with all kinds of experimental devices. There is hardly room to walk.

111211016.content: That Visbane left a mess. But these are important clues as well.

111211017.content: Hermes navigates her way carefully through the labyrinth of densely-packed machines. She follows the trail to another dark room.

111211018.content: In contrast to the disordered hallway, the room is tidy enough to send chills down Hermes' spine. There is a large table arranged with all manner of books, glass cages, and a rather exquisite picture frame.

111211019.content: I think someone was living here? My goodness... The animal specimens in these cages look perfectly lifelike.

111211020.content: Hermes, is there something under that picture frame?

111211021.content: Um, it looks like someone's diary. The author's name is... Otis?

111211023.content:
I haven't been doing very well since you left, Elizabeth...

My research has hit a roadblock, I lost my experimental subject, and had to stop all activities by order of my bosses.

I would have been so excited to spend all this time by your side once again, but everything has come too late.

I would so love to return to the past, Elizabeth... Nothing remains for me in the present except despair.

When I think back on the wonderful love we had for each other, I'm overwhelmed by the hope that this is all just some terrible dream.

I'll do anything to bring you back to my side.

I'll even dirty my hands with the forbidden arts of soul manipulation...

111211030.content: The forbidden arts of... soul manipulation?

111211032.content: Hermes turns her head at the sound just quickly enough to glimpse a silvery shadow flash behind her.

111211034.content: You're not getting away this time!

111211035.content: The sound of Hermes' rapid steps quickly fill the hallway. Seeing the Visbane disappear behind a certain door, Hermes rushes in without thinking.

111211037.content: Argh! My eyes! I'm going blind!

111211038.content: Hermes waves her arms around in confusion as she struggles to adjust to the blinding light that fills the room. But the Visbane is already gone.

111211039.content: There is an enormous pillar of what looks like light extending downward through the very center of the room.

111211040.content: What an incredible amount of data!

111211042.content: The BunBun Analyzer 1 has been picking up an extraordinary amount of data since you entered.

111211043.content: The massive density tells me this is the opening responsible for generating all our spillover events. That is... this is the source of the Quakes.

111211044.content: You mean this pillar of light?

111211045.content: If I'm not mistaken, this is a passage to the Source Layer.

111211046.content: But why is it here? Do you think someone...

111211047.content: You must be able to travel from here down to the Source Layer! It must have escaped that way!

111211048.content: Then I'm going in after it!

111211049.content: Hey, Hermes, hold on! Don't rush into anything!

111211050.content: The room is once again filled with blinding light followed by stillness. This time it is the girl's figure which vanishes into thin air.

111221001.content: What Hermes sees upon opening her eyes is a world unlike anything she has seen before. A world of floating crystals and far-off beams of light... a dimension that is qualitatively different.

111221002.content: The other thing Hermes notices immediately is the pain coming from every direction, like she is being squashed by an invisible giant.

111221003.content: That is surprising. It actually works.

111221004.content: Yeah? So this is the Source Layer. It's my first time here.

111221006.content: Right! The source of the Quakes!

111221007.content: Hermes gives her surroundings another look-over. The sight of something far away brings a serious frown to the two Modifiers' faces.

111221009.content: Even at this distance, they can easily make out the streams of light darting out from a giant pillar of light suspended horizontally in midair.

111221010.content: It also looks as if some object pressing up against the base of the pillar might be responsible for opening up a cavity. The object is pulling streams of light downward to a pathway underneath... and some of it is spilling out of the breach.

111221011.content: See that road of light, Hermes? That's the data accessway between the Source Layer and the Surface Layer. The beam of light within is a visual representation of the data stream being uploaded.

111221012.content: To put it in simple terms, it's like blood and blood vessels: and each one of these is critically important to the regular operations of the Sephirah Zone.

111221013.content: Is there something wrong with that accessway?

111221014.content: Yes. Something's pricked it and is pulling away data and computing capacity.

111221015.content: So that is the cause of all those Quakes!?

111221016.content: I'm afraid so. But to see something of this scale is... incredible. What we're seeing is big enough to impact the stability of the entire Sephirah Zone.

111221017.content: If we let this go on, we'll definitely have another round of Quakes on our hands—and soon.

111221018.content: If that's the case, everyone in Duskfall is in serious danger!

111221019.content: We've got to stop it now! Can you help me with something, Hermes?

111222001.content: The powerful roundhouse kick hits the Visbane square in the forehead, which explodes away into nothingness.

111222002.content: All good here, Ookuninushi. How are things with you?

111222003.content: Not good. I just analyzed the data environment, and if we keep losing data at this rate, then...

111222004.content: I think the entire Surface Layer is going to start collapsing in around ten minutes. Including the entire Duskfall Area.

111222005.content: The whole area will collapse? It's full of people...

111222006.content: There must be something we can do?!

111222007.content: I checked it out. There's nothing we can personally do to stop that data pull.

111222008.content: The only solution is to send the data collected by the analyzer back into the breach. That might trigger Gaea's own recovery mechanism.

111222009.content: That will make the system pull back all the data. However, the issue is one of elevation. I don't think it's possible to get the analyzer up there.

111222010.content: I... think I have an idea.

111222011.content: Hermes glances at the site of her recent battle. Large pieces of broken-off crystal seem to have joined with each other in the air, forming a kind of runway in the process.

111222012.content: What if I was able to charge up this thing and take a running leap?

111222013.content: A running leap? You can't be serious! Theoretically yes, but your Access Key won't support it!

111222014.content: We can always deal with that later. I think I'm fast enough to pull it off!

111222017.content: Hermes cuts Ookuninushi off, takes another glance at the giant rip in the control axle, and starts her warm-ups.

111222018.content: You know, I love running around this city.

111222019.content: Seeing everyone's happy smiles when I deliver their packages... makes me feel like all this running is worth it.

111222020.content: Plus, there's so many people to thank for getting me back on my feet after the accident. That's why I never hesitate when there's a problem that requires a need... for speed!

111222021.content: I was put here to do this. So I'm gonna run with everything I've got!

111222023.content: Ready!!! We got this. Let's check it out!!!!

111222024.content: Hermes disconnects and double-checks the makeshift runway.

111222026.content: Hermes mentally signals the start of her running leap on the crystal runway. Whistling wind blows past her. She's always loved that sound.

111222027.content: In the next instant, the acceleration in her Access Key is set to maximum. Soon she leaves even the sound of the wind behind.

111222028.content: The mounting pain in her legs builds and builds as the heat from this insane workout burns every muscle. But Hermes doesn't care—even if her body is about to disintegrate.

111222029.content: Hermes takes the leap from the highest point of the crystal runway and then throws the device into the air.

111222031.content: Hermes throws the device up and away. It draws a perfect arc in the air.

111222032.content: The last thing Hermes sees before she blacks out is a flash of light somewhere in the distance.

111231002.content: The gentle-looking girl lifts her head to look at the confused and disorientated Hermes. She then quickly turns her attention back to a device in the room.

111231004.content: Aether Gazer ward. You've just woken up. I'd advise against sudden movements.

111231005.content: I am still trying to repair your Access Key. I suggest you use this time to rest.

111231006.content: Hermes realizes her legs feel very... bare. It's a bit strange.

111231007.content: Looks like a stroll around the ward is out of the question. But then she remembers something.

111231009.content: Ivan? You mean that plush teddy?

111231010.content: They should be here any moment. You can ask her yourself.

111231011.content: Hermes is still trying to figure out what that meant when she hears a piercing voice from outside the ward.

111231013.content: Iris? How did you get here?

111231014.content: Really? We came as soon as we heard something had happened to you.

111231015.content: You returned, black and blue, carrying a teddy bear. The last thing you told us before you blacked out was to return it to its rightful owner.

111231019.content: A relief? It's alright not to think about work sometimes, you know.

111231020.content: I was just thinking of our company mission: to deliver love and hope!

111231021.content: Iris taps her index finger pointedly against Hermes' forehead.

111231022.content: Come on. Just focus on getting better for now. We're all eagerly awaiting your return!

111231023.content: Hermes turns to look outside at the city. There's a gentle wind and a certain liveliness in the air that brings a smile to her face.

111231025.content: Oh, nothing. I was just thinking... this isn't so bad.

112011001.content: I should have known I was getting myself involved in a dangerous mission, not some relaxing voyage...

112011002.content: I feel like I'm awake, but my mind is floating around in some kind of turbulent, dark void. I start to wonder whether I'm actually drowning until some familiar voices nearby banish those fears.

112011004.content: It's no use shouting! We've got to try something else. I know! Mouth-to-mouth resuscitation!

112011005.content: Hmm... I suppose that could work... But...

112011006.content: So who here do you think has the biggest lung capacity?

112011007.content: Is this another one of your pranks, Zenkibo?

112011008.content: The heck? I'm trying to save Admin's life, and you're accusing me of pulling some prank?

112011009.content: I can do it! I work out regularly. So... how exactly do I do this?

112011010.content: Heehee... First, put your mouth on the Admin's.

112011012.content: But I thought you had to press down on the chest before breathing air in.

112011013.content: Hmm... Poseidon's right. Here we go!

112011014.content: There's a burst of intense pressure on my ribcage. It's so strong I feel almost as if my spirit is about to be pushed out of my body. But, luckily enough, a few compressions later and I can feel my senses returning to normal. I bid farewell to the void.

112011017.content: Oops, you're pushing down too hard.

112011018.content: How come no water came out? Pfft... It's not at all like the cartoons.

112011020.content: We seem to have floated our way to a deserted island. We're lucky—really lucky—to have survived a shipwreck like that.

112011021.content: My memory is starting to come back, but only in fragments. There was a fierce storm, and monsters and a giant Visbane attacking the deck. There was also a giant whirlpool...

112011023.content: Not to worry. Nothing serious is going to happen here with an experienced captain on the scene!

112011024.content: A tall girl suddenly appears before me. She's helping to block out the fierce sunlight from my eyes, and bring me a gentle breeze.

112011025.content: Hey?! Are you alright, Administrator, staring like that? I hope none of that water got to your brain. You haven't forgotten me, have you?

112011027.content: I'm glad, Administrator, that you still remember your captain.

112011028.content: Great! Skadi, is your ship nearby? We could radio in for help on the console...

112011029.content: This comment seems to bring down an air of collective embarrassment. Only Skadi continues smiling.

112011030.content: Haha! Well... My ship is, uh, lost.

112011031.content: What?! You don't seem too sad about that!

112011032.content: I'd much rather consider this a little vacation paid for at the company's expense. Now that doesn't sound so bad, does it?

112011033.content: Good point! And don't worry. Snowflake 2, which I've piloted for many years... She and I are tight. Real tight. I'm sure she hasn't simply abandoned me to go traveling elsewhere!

112011034.content: Have you seen that movie? The one with the loyal dog that travels all over the world to find its master? Well, I'm sure Snowflake 2 is at least that loyal!

112011035.content: She'll return to me whenever her current venture on the high seas is complete. I guarantee it!

112011036.content: I'm getting some very strange images in my head...

112011037.content: Some sudden rustling from the nearby jungle off the beach alerts everyone to the presence of nearby Visbanes, stopping the discussion.

112011039.content: Keen-eyed Verthandi is the first to warn everyone. Before long they're all gripping their weapons tightly.

112012001.content: Phew... That was a close one.

112012002.content: Visbanes? Here? Do you think it has something to do with that strange Visbane that attacked us?

112012003.content: What a buzzkill. And here I thought we could wait out our rescue in peace and comfort on a desert oasis.

112012004.content: That Visbane is also responsible for me losing Snowflake 2. If I have to deal with Visbanes here, I might as well make a raft and go in search of Snowflake 2 myself!

112012005.content: And that's not even more risky, considering what we've been through?

112012007.content: Well, I don't think that we can leave the island just yet, but that doesn't mean that we should just stand around.

112012008.content: I think it behooves us to at least check out the rest of the island. You know, to learn more about where we are.

112012009.content: So do you want to head inland then? But then Snowflake 2 won't find anyone around here when she comes back...

112012010.content: Skadi isn't too happy about it, but the rest of the group agrees with my suggestion to proceed inward.

112012011.content: I'm just about to follow the rest of the group when a sudden burst of fatigue hits me like a lightning bolt. I stumble and would have gone to the ground were it not for Poseidon thoughtfully remaining nearby to catch me.

112012012.content: I was thinking... There is a real chance Snowflake 2 or another ship could come to the island to investigate. So it makes sense to leave two people here on the beach.

112012013.content: I'm happy, Poseidon, that at least one other person understands where I'm coming from!

112012014.content: Leave two people behind? Which two?

112012015.content: Obviously, the Administrator, who lacks combat ability, and Skadi, our esteemed captain.

112012016.content: Alright then... It's a good thing it's still morning. Let's try to pick up the pace before the midday heatwave.

112021001.content: The bulk of the group splits off, leaving me and my companion Skadi on a beach that now seems significantly quieter. A few moments pass before I hear Skadi's loud voice over the soft sea breeze.

112021004.content: Skadi has assembled a large leaf into an impressively trumpet-like shape.

112021006.content: Think you can call the ship back? Maybe...

112021007.content: I stop myself. The ship's probably been at the bottom of the ocean thanks to the same enormous whirlpool we were unfortunate enough to meet.

112021008.content: I can't bring myself to share such discouraging thoughts with the cheerful-looking Skadi. To be honest, the experience of being trapped on an island is making me feel rather lost.

112021009.content: Would you like to hear a story, Administrator?

112021011.content: Three years ago, I sailed Snowflake 2 for the first time. You know, I was a rookie at the time, and two crooks stole my key at a port.

112021012.content: As soon as I disembarked for supplies, they piloted the ship out of the port and disappeared over the vast ocean in a wink.

112021013.content: I just thought that I'd lost Snowflake 2 forever. But can you guess what happened?

112021014.content: She came back the very next day! That smart girl rode the ocean currents straight back to the port. The two crooks forgot to set the auto-cruise, and they were still sleeping when my girl arrived! Haha!

112021016.content: Humph Humph! Let me tell you, the ocean is always full of surprises. And it hasn't disappointed me yet.

112021017.content: And believe me, the ocean is also a mirror—it gives you what you expect. That's why folks always cursing the waves eventually won't be so lucky.

112021018.content: And if Snowflake 2 can outwit a couple of sneaky crooks, I'm pretty sure she can handle that dumb Visbane.

112021019.content: I have that faith in her, if I didn't, she'd be pretty off at me!

112021020.content: Skadi's enthusiasm is infectious, and seems to disperse my worries away like the incoming sea breeze. I actually begin to expect our ship might appear over the horizon any moment now.

112021021.content: Skadi raises her makeshift leaf trumpet to her lips for another blow.

112021023.content: I found her! I found her! Over east!

112021024.content: It's Verthandi's voice, loud and clear. She's already coming back after just having left alongside Poseidon.

112021025.content: Skadi and I look in the designated direction. The sun's increasingly hot rays have already dispersed a lot of the distant fog. The shape that we can now make out through that fog is unmistakable...

112021026.content: Snowflake 2 had run aground on some shallows not that far away from our current position. She hadn't sunk at all!

112021028.content: I've been yelling all this time, what took you so long!?

112021029.content: The group of four that had only just left to explore the island further begin to return. Skadi looks just about ready to dive into the water and swim to her ship.

112021030.content: That'd be wonderful to get the ship back, but don't you think it's a bit dangerous to just go over there without taking care of any nearby Visbanes?

112021031.content: Just get me on Snowflake 2 and all the Visbanes in the world can come after me!

112022001.content: The group makes its way into the ship's main living compartment, which is still half-submerged in water. A thin layer of humid mist dances over it. Our bedding floats by. They are thoroughly soaked.

112022002.content: What's with all the water, girl? Bad ship, bad ship!

112022003.content: Skadi angrily bangs on a compartment wall like a mother reprimanding her daughter.

112022004.content: And the fridge! The fridge is under water! All my ice-cream—gone!

112022006.content: And my super spicy tomato sauce!

112022008.content: Doesn't the ship have some kind of automatic drainage system?

112022009.content: Um... The pumps will take a while, and we'll also need to wait for everything to dry. Anyway, there is a lot of work to do, and my brave girl needs a break.

112022010.content: We might need to set up camp on the beach after all...

112022011.content: No sooner had the words been spoken when I feel a tremendous wave of nausea crash through my body along with the same utter exhaustion I'd felt a short while before. And once again, just like that, I am swallowed up by darkness...

112031001.content: There is a gentle breeze at my face. I open my eyes with some difficulty. Everyone is looking at me with great concern.

112031003.content: And just before we were going to apply mouth-to-mouth! You have great timing, Administrator.

112031005.content: The diagnostic says you're currently suffering from low blood sugar and an overly high heart rate.

112031007.content: Exactly why it's a real tragedy that we lost our fridge!

112031008.content: Luckily, I had the foresight to bring some extra food. After all, the Administrator is a human being and, of course, that means starvation is a possibility.

112031009.content: But the water will have gotten into the pantry as well! Hehe...

112031011.content: Not to worry! The moment I get Snowflake 2 fixed up, we'll be able to contact HQ for a rescue.

112031012.content: I'm just not sure whether the Admin will make it until then, given the lack of food.

112031013.content: Well, why don't we head out onto the island and see if we can't find something edible? Maybe in the jungle? I'm sure we can find something quickly if we work together!

112031014.content: Skadi clearly wants to stay behind to fix her ship, but when her eyes fall on me, that insistence becomes hesitant.

112031015.content: I mean... the ship does need to be fixed. And I don't think I can walk very far now anyway.

112031016.content: How about I stay behind with Skadi and help with repairs while the rest of you look for food?

112033001.content: I found something! I remember the root of this vegetable is edible.

112033002.content: Hmm... But I doubt we can make anything nice from it.

112033003.content: Let's look further inland. There might be something better!

112033004.content: True, but there might also be Visbanes. And I don't think the Admin has much time.

112033005.content: Hmm... Or we could all just go back now. This jungle's way too hot, anyway.

112033006.content: The trip back to the beach isn't gonna be fun either in this heat.

112032001.content: It was no longer blazing hot by the time Poseidon and the rest finally make their way back from the island jungle. The giant rock seems to cast a shadow now over the entire beach.

112032002.content: You've all been gone quite a while. Find anything?

112032003.content: There were a ton of Visbanes in the jungle. Held us up quite a bit.

112032004.content: It's too bad, you know. If only that bottle of super spicy tomato sauce had survived, I could've whipped up quite the surprise for you, Admin.

112032006.content: Don't worry, don't worry. Actually, given that there's not a single tasty thing on this island, you'd probably be happier if I did have the spicy sauce.

112032007.content: Yes! You can make all sorts of yummy dishes with it!

112032008.content: Stop. All this talk about food is just making me hungrier...

112032009.content: Then let's get the ingredients we have in order.

112032010.content: Uh... is the Admin already passing out from hunger?

112032011.content: Looks like we don't have time for anything fancy. Let's go cook.

112032012.content: It's quite late before the group manages to get a crackling bonfire going. They eventually present a bowl of "food" before me.

112032014.content: I try a mouthful. There is something indescribably weird about the taste, but I'm just too hungry to care.

112032015.content: Whoa! Slow down, Admin! This goopy mishmash can't be that good...

112032016.content: An old sailor once told me anything is a delicacy if you're hungry enough.

112032017.content: Um.. I've never seen the Administrator eat like this.

112032019.content: As I eat, my hunger pangs and dizzying fatigue slowly fade.

112032020.content: Please don't ask me to review the taste.

112032021.content: Sounds like you're back to your old self, Admin.

112032022.content: Seeing as the Administrator is human and all, a long stay on this island isn't really tenable. We need to call for rescue.

112032023.content: We just need to make it through tonight. I'll have Snowflake 2 repaired by tomorrow. Then we'll be able to leave the island or call for rescue if we want. Either would be better than hanging around here.

112032024.content: You can have the ship fixed by tomorrow?

112032026.content: There's something else... I must have sailed around this area plenty of times. This is the first time I've ever seen an island here. Something weird is going on.

112032027.content: Noted. The faster the ship is fixed, the better.

112032028.content: It may be the fatigue starting to set in after an exhausting day, or perhaps the soothing sounds of the crackling firewood and hypnotic sea breeze, but, for whatever reason, everyone soon falls fast asleep.

112032029.content: I'm half asleep when I hear a very strange sound.

112032030.content: Don't go running off like that again, silly girl. Or I might never see you again...

112032031.content: I just wish I'd spotted that whirlpool sooner...

112032035.content: Did you hear all that? Don't tell anyone else what I said, okay?

112032036.content: Hmm... I guess you were more worried about your ship than you let on. You seemed so confident.

112032037.content: My... My beloved girl was lost! Of course I was worried! But I'm the captain. The captain has to be calm and in total control at all times!

112032038.content: I pick up a momentary flash of panic across Skadi's face. Which is exactly when I also notice the toolbox behind her.

112032039.content: I realize for the first time that Skadi is not quite the "open book" she presents herself to be. She has secrets too.

112032040.content: It's late, Skadi. Why don't you get some rest instead of talking to your... "beloved girl"?

112032041.content: Eh... It's not for anything related to ship repairs anyway.

112032043.content: I've got to ask: Do you really think you can get the ship fixed by tomorrow?

112032045.content: If you've run into some kind of problem, you should ask us for help.

112032046.content: Skadi goes red in the face as if she's just been caught in a lie—a lie that no decent captain should have to tell. Finally, she lets out a long sigh.

112032047.content: I spent the whole day looking her over from stem to stern. She's taking on water in a lot of places, and she's also missing a few vital components. The satellite antenna, sensor, and the buoy...

112032048.content: There's no way that we can get in touch with Aether Gazer HQ without them, let alone set sail.

112032049.content: But don't worry. As long as I can find all of the parts tonight, I'll be able to have the ship ready tomorrow!

112032050.content: You're going to look for them all by yourself?

112032051.content: That's my responsibility as the captain! I promised Shu safe passage for crew and company, and now look what happened...

112032052.content: In all her days at sea, Snowflake 2 has never lost a passenger. Every single one has made it to their destination safe and sound. That's the reputation my girl and I have to uphold!

112032053.content: Skadi, I wouldn't say we came aboard your ship as just "passengers."

112032055.content: Also, please never underestimate your friends.

112032057.content: Well, technically you're the one in charge of this mission, Admin. What do you want to do?

112032058.content: We should have everyone help look.

112032059.content: You don't think they're going to... laugh at me, right?

112032060.content: Skadi, doesn't every legendary captain have a crew of legendary sailors at their back?

112041001.content: As the morning sun slowly crests the horizon, Verthandi and the others make their way to the bow of the beached ship, still sleepy. Their hopes of finally ending the island adventure are immediately dashed by Skadi's rather abrupt announcement.

112041002.content: The island is still surrounded by that strange storm, and unfortunately it's creating a lot of interference. Short-range communications appear to be unaffected, but without the satellite antenna, there's no way we'll be able to get through to Aether Gazer HQ.

112041003.content: Snowflake 2's main propulsion system is working fine, but we're not going to be able to cross these treacherous waters without the sensor and buoy. We'll just end up going in circles.

112041004.content: So, basically: Welcome, everyone, to a longer island adventure than I had first anticipated. Haha...

112041005.content: Skadi breaks down our sorry situation in earnest detail. As always, her manner of speaking gives the impression she is half-joking.

112041006.content: So... there's no way to fix the fridge?

112041007.content: Gee... Is this really not a prank?

112041008.content: With the Administrator's life at stake? I think not...

112041009.content: But it's not such a big deal, right? All we need to do is find the parts and then we can go.

112041010.content: Skadi estimates it will take a few days to find all of the parts.

112041011.content: Ha? Is that so? I see...

112041012.content: No... And how long until I can see my Master?

112041013.content: Even Shu says you need to learn to be more independent. You want to keep dragging Vidar down?

112041014.content: An angry and embarrassed Leviathan raises her Access Key toward Zenkibo as Verthandi rushes to intervene.

112041015.content: An extended stay on the island means... we'll need to deal with a number of problems...

112041016.content: We'll need to set up camp and forage for food... But don't worry, Poseidon. Seeing as we've made up our minds to stay here for the time being, I'm sure we'll find a solution for every problem we come against.

112041017.content: Also, we'd best figure out exactly how we're going to recover all of these missing parts. What do you suggest, Skadi?

112041018.content: All three of the parts I mentioned come with a built-in signal locator, which will help us pinpoint their general location across the three nearby islands. I think splitting up into three groups and searching separately might be the quickest method.

112041019.content: As to who we should assign to each group...

112041020.content: The little war between Leviathan and Zenkibo is still going on in full swing. With their little fists balled up, they look like living cartoon figurines.

112041021.content: How dare you talk bad about my Master!

112041022.content: I'm not talking bad about her, I'm talking bad about you!

112041023.content: Talking bad about me means talking bad about my Master!

112041024.content: It's safe to say Leviathan and Zenkibo should not be in the same group.

112041025.content: Also, we'll need to keep an eye on local maritime conditions. Skadi can handle that—she is the only one can pilot the ship here.

112041026.content: That leaves the rest of us in three teams. It also means someone will need to go alone to an island.

112041028.content: Leviathan abandons her conflict with Zenkibo to rush over to my side with a determined look on her face.

112041030.content: Just before we set out, Master told me I need to learn how to do things independently... I won't let her down!

112041031.content: Leviathan's rather fragile appearance doesn't instill much confidence. She's always been very dependent on Vidar, her so-called master. We can't help but worry about her ability to take on challenges solo.

112041032.content: But there's no denying Leviathan's fierce determination. At the end of the day, the prospect of disappointing Vidar seems far worse to Leviathan than any unknown danger.

112041034.content: Roger! I'm going to be the first one to find a part! And Admin, don't forget to report this all to Shu!

112041035.content: Of course. And Vidar will also receive the report in full.

112041037.content: Leviathan goes red in the face from the implication. This attracts a sneer from Zenkibo and then, inevitably, a renewed outbreak of their quarrel.

112041038.content: Think you could give Leviathan the least dangerous island, Skadi?

112041040.content: Exploring the islands... Kinda sounds a bit exciting, actually.

112041041.content: We also need to think about how we are going to set up camp, and also about finding food... It's not going to be at all like a vacation.

112041042.content: Hmm... I... I had a bad feeling about this trip even before I got on the ship...

112041043.content: There's one other thing I'd like to draw your attention to, Admin.

112041044.content: I've recovered the nautical logs from Snowflake 2's central computer. It recorded our journey up until the moment we encountered our, uh, "little difficulty".

112041045.content: And I saw that Visbane on the screen again... I have a very strong feeling that whenever we finally do leave this place, we're going to meet it again.

112041046.content: So we need to think about how to fight it before we leave. We've got to have a plan.

112041047.content: My mind instantly flashes back to the towering monstrosity that waylaid our ship. I almost feel myself go weak in the knees.

112041048.content: I'd almost forgotten the horrible reason for our arrival at such an idyllic place...

112053001.content: Leviathan eventually makes out a faint glimmer of light from the very edge of the jungle. She stops for a moment, and the voice that has guided her thus far speaks again.

112053002.content: Unknown Modifier in effective range. Please verify identity.

112053005.content: The mysterious voice, both ethereal and emotionless in nature, mixes in with the rustling of the dense jungle leaves. It has an irresistible, alluring tone about it.

112053006.content: I'll say it again: The only reason that I listened to you and came here was to find that part from Snowflake 2!

112053007.content: Leviathan summons all her courage and knocks down the last bunch of thick leaves blocking her way...

112053008.content: The area in front of Leviathan opens up to a rather large jungle clearing.

112053009.content: Here, there are no irritating vines, mosquitoes, densely packed trees, or interwoven branches. There is just a little pond, full of water as clear as crystal. A ray of sunlight dances off the center of pool.

112053010.content: Leviathan's eyes are drawn immediately to the stone in the middle of the pond and the way it catches the sun's rays. There's something beautiful firmly planted upright in the stone. It looks kind of like an umbrella, or a rifle of some kind.

112053011.content: It seems to Leviathan that this is both their first meeting... and their long-awaited reunion.

112053013.content: Is this the missing part from Snowflake 2?

112053014.content: Hmm... Skadi did say something about a buoy... and that does kind of look like a buoy...

112053015.content: Leviathan cautiously approaches the "white umbrella" thingy and grips it with her hand.

112053016.content: The "white umbrella" releases a tremendous burst of light immediately upon contact, as if sensing the special power within her. It instantly shatters its stone encasement. The entire island begins to quake.

112053017.content: Identity verification complete. Unknown Modifier confirmed as the Candidate. Releasing Anchor...

112053019.content: Leviathan doesn't have much time to be confused. A large group of Visbanes suddenly appear by the edge of the pond, obviously attracted by the thing now in Leviathan's hand.

112052001.content: The Visbanes are defeated, but Leviathan's situation is far from rosy. The ground continues to quake violently, as if it's about to tear itself apart. Leviathan begins to suspect the whole island might actually be sinking under the waves.

112052002.content: Phew... Made it! At least I didn't let my Master down... But is this actually the buoy?

112052003.content: There's another loud rumble as the ground finally splits open. The water in the pond flows into the gaping fissures, revealing a reddish-orange object buried deep down in the mud that remains.

112052004.content: This looks more like the buoy Skadi described—at least compared to the umbrella-shaped object in Leviathan's hand. Of course no one could find it. It was hidden deep underwater.

112052005.content: Yes! That's gotta be it. But then, what is this?

112052006.content: Forget it, I'm taking them both!

112052007.content: The most important thing is, I finished my task first! Yeah! And I did it all on my own this time!

112052008.content: Leviathan snatches up the buoy and, after strapping the "umbrella" thingy to her back, rushes out of the collapsing jungle toward the agreed-upon rendezvous point.

112061001.content: Hey guys, have you found anything?

112061003.content: Yes! That's it! That will help us contend with the ocean currents, at least.

112061004.content: We also found the missing piece of the ship's radar.

112061005.content: Awesome! With that, we'll be able to contact the HQ.

112061006.content: The group falls silent. The third search party, consisting only of Leviathan, has not yet returned.

112061008.content: We should have known it'd be too much for her, going on a solo mission like that...

112061009.content: Hum. She's probably just lost. I can imagine her out there somewhere now, in tears because she can't find her way back. Haha!

112061010.content: Hmmm... Don't you think we should go over and help her?

112061011.content: Leviathan's not going to want our help. After all, she volunteered for a reason. Let's have a little faith in her.

112061012.content: Hey hey! We shouldn't be worrying over nothing, anyway. How dangerous could these islands actually be?

112061013.content: As long as the islands themselves don't collapse, she should be fine...

112061014.content: As if it were waiting for Zenkibo to utter these words, the ground suddenly starts shaking. The roar of grinding rock is unmistakable. A fairly significant earthquake is ripping the islands apart.

112061016.content: Oh gosh. The islands really are collapsing!

112061017.content: Fissures have already started to appear along the beach. Visbanes pour from within. It looks like they've been trapped underground for quite a while.

112061018.content: Why are there so many Visbanes here?

112061019.content: Now's no time to figure it out. This beach is gonna be underwater soon.

112061020.content: None of you are skilled at fighting in water. Leave this to me. Get to the ship! Now!

112061021.content: Skadi already has her Access Key activated. As Captain, she's the calmest of us in the face of danger.

112062001.content: The heat of the sand is quickly replaced by the cold of steel. The temperature of the beach falls dramatically. Skadi manages to repel all the Visbanes by the time everyone else has boarded the ship.

112062003.content: What the heck was that? An earthquake?

112062004.content: It seems my guess was correct.

112062005.content: I think these islands were only ever being held together by some sort of external force. And now that force has suddenly disappeared...

112062007.content: We've gotta find her right away!

112062010.content: The brave girl said she wanted to finish the mission on her own, and I could tell from the look in her eyes that she meant it!

112062011.content: I know for certain she'll return here with the part. This is where we originally agreed to meet.

112062012.content: And if we sail off now looking for her, we might actually end up missing her. We've got to wait here!

112062013.content: Skadi's absolute certainty seems to quell any objections. Though the rest of our group still seems hesitant, there is a confidence in Skadi's look that persuades me to trust Leviathan with more time.

112062015.content: I trust Skadi. And I trust Leviathan as well!

112071001.content: The rising water swirls aggressively around the islands' shallows. The bridge connecting the three land masses is now mostly submerged.

112071002.content: Hold on! If I can just make it to the beach on the other side...

112071003.content: A wave comes rushing at Leviathan out of nowhere—but just as it is about to sweep her away, it somehow disperses, as if smashed by an unseen power.

112071004.content: By the time Leviathan realizes what is going on, she has already made it to the other side.

112071005.content: She can hear that mysterious voice again—although it's hard to make out against the loud backdrop of the wind and waves. It's almost as if the sea itself is talking to her.

112071007.content: Hey! What's going on? Have I made a terrible mistake?

112071008.content: The waves are steadily mounting the beach. A horde of Visbanes comes rushing out of the nearby jungle. Leviathan can't think. She has to act.

112071009.content: She grips her weapon tightly. She hasn't forgotten her mission.

112072001.content: Hey, you really think we can count on that crying baby coming back on her own?

112072002.content: Skadi, fully embracing her role as captain, is still standing on the ship's bow. She seems utterly confident of Leviathan's soon return.

112072003.content: Alright then. Just pretend I didn't say anything...

112072005.content: Verthandi's shout rouses everyone on deck from our despondent silence. We glance in the direction she's pointing. There is indeed a petite figure running toward us.

112072006.content: It's Leviathan, on her way to the rendezvous point—just as Skadi predicted. She is running as fast as she can over the quickly disappearing shallows to Snowflake 2, buoy held high above her head.

112072007.content: I found it! I found the buoy!

112072008.content: There's a faint hint of crying in Leviathan's voice. But we all grin anyway with relief.

112072010.content: I knew that little brave girl could do it!

112072013.content: Hurry up and get over here! Eh... This time I'm not going to make fun of you!

112072014.content: Our shouts of encouragement have just left our lips when the islands seem to take another leg down into the deep ocean. Sand and stone collapse inward, as if being swallowed by some giant beast.

112072015.content: Water mixed with sand and mud smashes into Snowflake 2, which teeters for a moment before righting itself. Skadi wrestles with the steering wheel, trying to keep the ship stable. The islands have just been replaced by a gigantic whirlpool.

112072016.content: Even worse, the whirlpool continues to expand, as if it wishes to swallow the entire sea. It opens up, forming swirling walls of water that seem to reach into infinity. Leviathan disappears into the twirling, whirling abyss.

112081001.content: Everyone waits anxiously as Snowflake 2's recovered sensor trawls the water for signs of Leviathan. Only the buoy is recovered.

112081003.content: If it didn't work the first time, it won't come up with anything the second time. The buoy might be able to float, but Leviathan can't... I'm afraid she's probably already at a depth even the sensor can't detect.

112081005.content: But don't panic! I've already fixed Snowflake 2's radar, and I've locked onto Leviathan's signal. She's alive, just somewhere deep in the whirlpool...

112081006.content: Do we have rescue gear? I'll swim down there!

112081007.content: The whirlpool is just too strong, I'm afraid. The best rescue gear could do is protect you. You wouldn't be able to bring her back.
