112081008.content: At this distance, we can't use the ship sensor to get her either. We've got to get a little closer...

112081009.content: Unpleasant memories of a very recent, very similar maneuver rise up in my mind. I realize what Skadi is talking about.

112081010.content: Skadi, do you mean you want to take Snowflake 2 into that whirlpool? Won't the ship just sink to the bottom of the ocean?

112081011.content: I know! But if we can get Leviathan onboard first, we can use the rescue gear to get out of here. And then wait for rescue.

112081012.content: Anything's better than just standing here!

112081013.content: We all know Skadi's decision is correct and decisive. But we also know how much Snowflake 2 means to her. Everyone goes quiet.

112081015.content: It's alright, Admin. You don't need to console me. Snowflake 2 is much more than my ship—she's also my friend, with her own spirit and desires.

112081016.content: And what she wants is very simple: To take care of her crew and passengers wherever they may go. And to leave no one behind!

112081017.content: It would be an insult to force Snowflake 2 to abandon her sacred duty when our friend needs help!

112081020.content: Skadi grips the steering wheel tightly, her face filled with steely determination once again. This is it.

112081022.content: Skadi's soft voice seems to be attempting to encourage herself as much as Snowflake 2.

112081023.content: The ship turns about and heads straight into the gaping maw of the giant, swirling whirlpool!

112091001.content: I feel sleepy. My body feels fatigued but also... well-rested? I feel like I've just woken up from an afternoon nap.

112091002.content: I look around. There's a table, a podium, and soft light streaming in through clear windows... My eyes snap open. I'm sitting in our classroom.

112091003.content: I'm joined by a number of Division Nine Modifiers chatting away as if waiting for a class to start.

112091007.content: Classroom? The one in Core City?

112091008.content: Yeah. Is there any other classroom?

112091010.content: Images of what I've just been through—crashing waves, mysterious jungles, a giant whirlpool—tumble through my mind. They bring a rush of anxiety only quelled by the supremely peaceful, friendly environment of the classroom. What a nightmarish voyage.

112091011.content: That was a very long, very vivid dream...

112091012.content: A bell sounds. Shu steps up to the podium.

112091013.content: Quiet please. It is my pleasure today to introduce a new transfer student.

112091014.content: Heh, this old song and dance again, eh?

112091015.content: Before you critique my lack of variety, Zenkibo, perhaps you should consider changing up your own bag of tricks—or did you really think I wouldn't see the chewing gum stuck to that chair?

112091017.content: Shu elegantly moves the chair and motions the newcomer into the classroom.

112091018.content: The girl ascends the podium. She seems to be accompanied by a light breeze. If I'm not mistaken, there is a hint of salty sea air in the room.

112091020.content: Huh? You already know my name? Guess I don't need to introduce myself. Haha!

112091021.content: Uh... have we met, though? Have you been a passenger on my ship?

112091022.content: Actually, I was just dreaming I was on a voyage, on a navy-blue ship...

112091023.content: Surely you have better pick-up lines than that, Admin.

112091024.content: Uh, interesting that you would say that, actually. I often think of my Snowflake 2 as a ship straight out of a dream, so I'm not surprised someone else would dream about her too. Maybe destiny has brought us together!

112091025.content: Really? She actually bought that crap?

112091026.content: Ahem! If our newest classmate has finished introducing herself, then I would like to keep today's session moving. Please, have a seat.

112091027.content: Skadi sticks out her tongue and finds her seat. She sits, legs crossed, in a posture reminiscent of a rebellious teenager.

112091028.content: I'll now take attendance. Verthandi, Zenkibo, Poseidon...

112091029.content: Shu duly performs a roll call and then closes the roster. It's only then I realize whose name wasn't called.

112091031.content: Everyone immediately notices Leviathan's absence once I raise the issue. A sense of disquiet falls over the room.

112091032.content: Administrator, need I remind you to raise your hand before speaking?

112091033.content: My apologies... But why isn't Leviathan here?

112091034.content: Leviathan requested urgent leave. She's not feeling well, and needs to rest.

112091035.content: More memories of my unreal adventure come flooding back to me. I can clearly remember Leviathan calling for help as the giant whirlpool sucked her down.

112091036.content: No, Leviathan is in danger! And we have to find her right away!

112091037.content: Please, Administrator. Leviathan really is just out sick. Our class can continue just as well in her absence.

112091038.content: How could you say that, Miss Shu? I need to see Leviathan right away! She was in danger in my dream!

112091039.content: Administrator, are you still sleeping? Snap out of it. Dreams are just that—dreams.

112091040.content: But the rush of returning memories doesn't abate. Suddenly I'm there again in my mind's eye—the crashing waves, the mysterious jungle, and the giant whirlpool. In fact, my disturbing dream is starting to feel increasingly more real than this strange classroom.

112091041.content: No, you're wrong! This room is the dream!

112091042.content: The classroom suddenly freezes in time as if my entire experience is simply a movie and somebody has decided to hit pause.

112091043.content: What a shame. Would it really have been so awful to sleep happily until all this is over? What's the big deal? She's only one person...

112091045.content: The class vanishes like a puff of smoke as I find myself once again in complete darkness, as if I've fallen into a shadowy abyss.

112091046.content: I suddenly hear the tremendous roar of rushing water by my ear. When I open my eyes, I'm looking straight out of the ship's cabin window at mountains of dark blue water.

112091047.content: We are all descending inside Snowflake 2 to the bottom of the ocean!

112091049.content: Skadi comes to first. She rushes back to the steering wheel to turn the ship as close to the floating ball of light out the window as possible.

112091050.content: Snowflake 2 moves closer and closer to the ball of light. Just as we are about to collide with it, a familiar figure flashes past the cabin window.

112091051.content: In that moment, I catch a glimpse again of the entity responsible for our entire island adventure. That Visbane spreads its wings elegantly, just as it did the first time we saw it all that time ago.

112091052.content: And then, just as quickly, it disappears behind us into the endless inky-black darkness...

112101001.content: A massive current pulls us away from Snowflake 2 and down into the ocean depths. Only when we finally collide with something does the sea loosen its grip.

112101002.content: The sound of rushing water fades and with it the immediate threat of drowning. I notice the unmistakable smell of reinforced concrete.

112101003.content: There seems to be a problem with the Waverender... But at least I managed to help you all.

112101006.content: Uh, the land... under the sea?

112101007.content: I look up over at Skadi, above her head is an extraordinary blue dome... and past her shoulder, I see something even more bewildering.

112101008.content: We find ourselves somewhere on the ocean floor within a giant air Bubble surrounded by ocean water. And what we are standing on? Rubble.

112101009.content: W-weren't we just in class? I'm so dizzy...

112101010.content: Did you get a chance to look out the window on our way here? The giant Visbane that attacked us was pretty close by...

112101011.content: Really? How can it be back after us so quickly?

112101012.content: There's no time to talk! We've gotta find Leviathan—now!

112101013.content: I have to get to the ship to pinpoint Leviathan's location. I remember the ocean current pushed Snowflake 2 over in... that direction!

112101014.content: The group looks over where Skadi is pointing, where Visbanes have appeared.

112101015.content: Hey... It's only a few Visbanes. Let's roll.

112101016.content: Skadi, you just used your Access Key to shield us from the impact when we went down. You sure it's okay?

112101017.content: The propulsion system's a bit banged up, but the weapon itself fine. More than fine enough to deal with this scurvy bunch!

112102001.content: There was no hide and seek with Snowflake 2 this time. Eagle-eyed Verthandi locates the beached ship quickly beside the ruins of some large building.

112102002.content: Whew, the radar's still working. Let me just adjust the frequency... I've got her! I'm picking up Leviathan and... her life signal is good!

112102003.content: Everyone heaves a sigh of heartfelt relief. But something else causes Skadi's brow to furrow in concern.

112102004.content: I'm picking up Leviathan's signal. Does that mean we're all in the same illusion, or...

112102005.content: The surrounding nautical data matches up with the navigation map… This isn't an illusion. We're actually in the real world!

112102006.content: Where in the real world is there a Bubble at the bottom of the ocean?

112102007.content: Visbanes have the ability to influence the Surface Layer by corrupting the Source Layer. It's possible Siren has grown powerful enough to change Surface Layer "reality" however it sees fit just by corrupting some Source Layer data.

112102008.content: If that's the case, it means Siren hasn't gotten into our heads. It's just directly altering our surrounding environment—by creating this giant Bubble, for instance.

112102009.content: If we're unable to detect that something's off, it'll make it very hard for us to escape should we fall into Siren's trap.

112102010.content: So you're saying there's no fundamental difference between the classroom we were just in and this giant Bubble?

112102011.content: Siren was definitely looking at our collective memories when it created the last illusion. It's trying to create an environment we're all familiar with. And I think if it hadn't been for the Administrator, it would have succeeded in tricking us. We wouldn't have escaped.

112102012.content: So what about this place? Who's this meant to deceive?

112102013.content: It appears to be a large metropolis that's just been devastated by a tsunami... Has anything like that ever happened in Gaea before? Whose memory is this from?

112102014.content: At any rate, rescuing Leviathan is still priority number one.

112102015.content: Don't worry. Her life signal is quite stable. I can guarantee she's not in any imminent danger.

112102016.content: But my radar has also picked up quite a few areas in the nearby waters, reflecting the same sort of signal as this large Bubble.

112102017.content: That means there are many other Bubbles just like this one. Leviathan could be in one of them.

112102018.content: We have some diving equipment on the ship. We're gonna have to leave Snowflake 2 here for now so we can go search the nearby Bubbles.

112102019.content: But if we try to leave, will we burst our own Bubble, like... "pah"?

112102020.content: Well, I mean, we crashed a whole ship into it and it didn't burst. I think it's safe to say it has some way of repairing itself.

112102021.content: Who's to say Leviathan isn't already out there looking for us? We need to get a move on!

112111001.content: Finally, the sound of rushing water around my head is gone. My head is spinning. I do my best to suppress the urge to throw up as we all gingerly remove our helmets.

112111002.content: I keep feeling like I'm being sucked through a straw...

112111003.content: Keeping a steady heading is a bit tricky due to the tremendous pressure down here on the ocean floor. But no matter what—we're going to need to search these Bubbles one at a time. First thing's first: Let's figure out if Leviathan is nearby...

112111005.content: Verthandi's shout resounds through the enormous space.

112111006.content: She doesn't seem to be here.

112111008.content: Skadi, do you have any way of figuring out which direction Leviathan is in?

112111009.content: Well, I wasn't able to bring the radar with me. But I do remember the general direction of her life signal on the monitor. All I need is my compass...

112111010.content: Everyone looks in unison at the direction shown by Skadi's compass. Unfortunately, it's spinning round and round like a little wind turbine.

112111011.content: Darn. I forgot. Siren can alter magnetic fields.

112111012.content: So we've decided to officially name that gaint Visbane "Siren" now?

112111013.content: That's not important right now. I still remember the general direction. We just have to go through this Bubble ahead, and then over to the next one. She should be there.

112111014.content: Siren is a bit too close for comfort. Let's get a move on.

112111015.content: Seems that's easier said than done. Looks like we're not getting through these Bubbles without a fight...

112112001.content: Why is every Bubble filled with Visbanes? Ugh...

112112002.content: They look awfully similar the ones on the islands.

112112003.content: They're one and the same! I'll bet the Visbanes on the islands came from here!

112112004.content: Be careful. There's something weird about this Bubble.

112112005.content: Skadi keeps glancing at the nearby building, which gradually becomes more and more detailed as we approach—almost as if it is in the process of being "printed."

112112006.content: I think this Bubble is being created as we speak...

112112007.content: So, all these Bubbles were actually created...

112112008.content: Is it just me, or is this Bubble expanding?

112112009.content: Well, they are bubbles, bubbles always expand.

112112010.content: It's not just that... The Bubble we just passed through was also expanding, just not as quickly as this one.

112112011.content: So, you're saying all the Bubbles are gradually expanding?

112112012.content: That would mean if left unchecked, these Bubbles would eventually engulf all of Sephirah Zone.

112112013.content: The only way we could stop it would be by actually facing off with that Visbane... You know, this was rated as a low-risk mission when we first set out...

112112014.content: We have to do something. Problem is... there's nothing we really can do. We need to find Leviathan and then call for reinforcements...

112112015.content: Seems that the decision is no longer ours to make, Admin.

112112016.content: Everyone stares in confusion at Skadi. We realize the needle in her compass is now spinning furiously.

112112017.content: An all-too-familiar, spine-chilling howl explodes out from the ocean water surrounding the bubble, along with a monstrous wave.

112112018.content: Siren has returned once more, wave in tow.

112121001.content: Tsk. Have we accidentally stumbled into Siren's nest? Just our luck!

112121002.content: Everyone, watch out for the currents!

112121003.content: It's the same crazy current that first brought us into this Bubble... Seems that was Siren's plan all along.

112121005.content: Fight? Against an enemy like that?

112121006.content: No way. We've gotta get out of here!

112121007.content: Siren just blocked our exit. If we want to escape, we're going to have to beat it back first!

112122001.content: Siren flies up into the air as if irritated at the thought of having to do battle with the likes of our weak party. It unfurls its wings, shrieks, and then conjures a gust of wind that pulls two massive, 10-meter-tall walls of water in its wake!

112122004.content: Don't just stand there. We've gotta move!

112122005.content: Skadi leads everyone out from the very center of the approaching waves in an attempt to escape before the two walls of water converge.

112122006.content: But Siren doesn't give us the opportunity.

112122007.content: The two walls of water suddenly snap together, bringing a furious torrent of water down onto everyone's heads.

112122009.content: I regain consciousness to find myself once again in the black abyss of the ocean. What little light I can see coming from the bubble space is fading rapidly. I'm afraid I might be drowning.

112122011.content: The bitter salty sea water fills my throat as I feel consciousness slipping away again. All I can do is just gaze at the vanishing light in the distance. Everything begins to fade to black...

112122012.content: Just then, another light appears in front of me.

112122014.content: And with that light comes an extremely familiar voice.

112122016.content: I make a valiant attempt to open my eyes again. There she is at last—the source of everyone's worries.

112122017.content: She extends a hand my way, resembling a little angel as she swims around the deep ocean amid colorful fish.

112131001.content: Leviathan wakes up with a jolt. What a terrible nightmare—full of suffocating moments of panic.

112131003.content: Leviathan, you really shouldn't be sleeping on the mission.

112131005.content: Leviathan opens her eyes to a familiar face in a hurry. It's Vidar, but without her customary coldness. She smiles warmly at Leviathan.

112131006.content: It's good you're up. Time to continue our mission.

112131008.content: We're at the Spealght Factory. We still need to help the Overture Squad deal with the AGI Mecha issue. Or did you forget?

112131009.content: It's strange.. the last thing I remember was being sucked into a giant whirlpool...

112131010.content: A whirlpool? Sounds like you were having a nightmare?

112131012.content: Vidar gives Leviathan another warm and knowing smile. Leviathan starts to feel embarrassed about her silly dream.

112131013.content: Leviathan decides to put away all thoughts of the nightmare and the horrible events it contained, and focus instead on the beautiful reality in front of her.

112131014.content: That's right... it must've just been a nightmare. When I woke up and found Master here... it was really so wonderful...

112131015.content: We still have a mission to do. Don't cry... Let's go.

112131016.content: Leviathan cautiously takes Vidar's hand. It's warm and real.

112131018.content: Leviathan gets up, and follows Vidar into battle. They charge into a cluster of AGI Mechas together. It's just like old times.

112132001.content: The battle is intense. By the end of it, Leviathan and Vidar are surrounded by the bits and pieces of broken AGI Mechas.

112132002.content: You're so powerful, Master. I barely had to lift a finger...

112132003.content: Why even get involved at all, Leviathan? Wouldn't it be easier to just let me handle things?

112132005.content: Vidar flashes Leviathan another warm smile. But this time it doesn't serve to soothe Leviathan's troubled heart.

112132006.content: Won't you be angry at me if I just... keep hiding behind you?

112132008.content: Didn't you want me to become more independent?

112132009.content: Vidar falls silent for a moment in response. She then flashes yet another sweet smile Leviathan's way.

112132010.content: Why would I? I'd much rather keep you out of danger, Leviathan.

112132011.content: Vidar's smile is warm and friendly, like the sight of the morning sun's rays over the frozen arctic steppes. But something deep within Leviathan, something instinctual, pushes back.

112132012.content: Old memories suddenly come flooding into Leviathan's mind. They all seem to point to one thing: This is not the Master she remembers.

112132013.content: Why would you say that, Master? You were very clear with me... The penguin that hides behind the pack always gets eaten by the seal.

112132015.content: But isn't what I just said exactly what you want, Leviathan?

112132017.content: Leviathan hesitates for a moment. She hears a strange voice. It seems so close and yet very distant, almost as if it's coming from another world...

112132018.content: Attention the Candidate: Please exit the simulated space immediately.

112141002.content: Vidar moves once again protectively in front of Leviathan.

112141003.content: Descriptor error. I am not an enemy of the Candidate.

112141004.content: Stand behind me, Leviathan. I'll deal with this.

112141005.content: The mysterious voice starts to break up like a radio broadcast running into static.

112141006.content: Warning... Interference detected... Immediate departure recommended... Depart the simulated space immediately...

112141007.content: Please continue... Continue the mission... Fight.. Protect...

112141008.content: Do you think the AGI Mechas have managed to infiltrate our audio system? Surely they don't expect anyone to fall for something so ridiculous.

112141009.content: Leviathan, you don't need to fight anymore. You don't have to protect anyone. All you need to do is allow me to protect you.

112141011.content: Descriptor target does not match... the Candidate...

112141012.content: Don't do anything rash, Leviathan! I'll deal with the broken audio system...

112141013.content: Vidar destroys the speaker on the corridor wall with one swipe of her battle axe. The strange voice finally vanishes.

112141014.content: Vidar remains motionless for a moment. She can't help but notice that Leviathan is currently keeping her at arm's length... and staring at her with a rather guarded expression.

112141015.content: Master... why would you say such a thing? My Master would never say something like that!

112141016.content: Is there any error in what I just said?

112141017.content: You cling to my side, refusing to leave... What else could I think, Leviathan, but that you want me to protect you always?

112141018.content: If I never leave you, you'll never be lonely again, right?

112141019.content: Vidar takes a step forward. Leviathan takes a step back. Vidar takes another step. Leviathan steps back again. Finally, Leviathan decides to remain where she is, gripping her weapon tightly.

112141021.content: The smile plastered on Vidar's face vanishes.

112141022.content: I see. You actually believed the ridiculous things that voice said?

112141023.content: Very well. Leave it to me. It shouldn't be difficult for me to demonstrate to you that you need my protection.

112141024.content: Vidar's face takes on a cold ruthlessness just as hostile as the axe in her hands.

112142001.content: A defeated Vidar clings to a corner of the wall as she stares in shock at the panting Leviathan.

112142003.content: I know how wonderful, how safe, and how comfortable I feel at Master's side...

112142004.content: But, even a penguin who loves to stay with the group has to go out on its own sometimes. Master told me that's true for all the animals that live out in the polar regions...

112142005.content: That's why I have to try so hard—even if I know that Master will protect me if I run into trouble! I still have to do my best!

112142006.content: Because one day, I'm going to have to go out on my own. I'll have to prove that I have the right to battle alongside Master as an equal!

112142007.content: I've passed the test, haven't I, Master?

112142009.content: Leviathan gazes at her counterpart with steely determination. "Vidar's" eyes darken as she realizes Leviathan is no longer playing her game.

112142010.content: So strange... Such a wonderful dreamscape, and yet you'd still rather confront the horrors of reality...

112142011.content: Is there truly so great a difference between reality and dream?

112142012.content: Human nature is so utterly strange...

112142013.content: A loud pop can be heard—like a bubble bursting.

112142014.content: "Vidar" promptly vanishes. The world of the factory is replaced by a tidal wave of water that immediately envelops Leviathan.

112142016.content: But this time there is no cold, suffocating weight of ocean water. Instead, a aqua-blue light appears in front of Leviathan, driving away the oceanic darkness.

112142017.content: The light seems to be coming from the eyes of some kind of mechanical sea creature. It's heading straight for Leviathan.

112142019.content: Greetings, the Candidate of the Countertide Whalesong.

112142020.content: The water between Leviathan rushed apart, creating a pathway for Leviathan to a giant bubble.

112151001.content: Leviathan's real memories come flooding back as the water fights to re-enter the newly-created Bubble—she suddenly remembers the storm, the jungle, and the whirlpool.

112151005.content: "Labbi" was the highest-rated sobriquet in my data archives. Thus, I selected it for myself.

112151006.content: I am an artificial intelligence attached to the Countertide Whalesong Access Key. According to my system parameters, my highest-priority task is to guide the Candidate with access rights to the Countertide Whalesong.

112151008.content: Leviathan recalls the umbrella-shaped thing still at her side. At some point it must have started emitting a strobing aqua-blue light. It seems similar to the light in Labbi's eyes.

112151009.content: The Candidate, it is time to...

112151011.content: Where am I? And where was I just now? What happened to the Admin and the others?

112151012.content: This is a simulated space located on the ocean floor. It was formed following an unauthorized modification of Surface Layer data. The simulated space the Candidate just occupied has collapsed. I am unable to ascertain the others' location at this time.

112151013.content: Simulated space? So that was all... fake?

112151014.content: Humph. I should have known. Master would never try to hurt me like that!

112151015.content: But why are there illusions on the ocean floor? And what's with these giant Bubbles?

112151016.content: Terms "Illusions" and "Bubbles" are not technically accurate. Siren has been constructing simulated spaces on the ocean floor.

112151018.content: Data archives indicate Siren is a large Visbane active in the Peripheral Sea of the Sephirah Zone. It is the cause of a number of large tsunamis.

112151019.content: Siren possesses many points of similarity in power and capabilities with certain monsters of ancient mythology, and thus has been so named.

112151020.content: Other than maritime disasters, the greatest threat posed by Siren is its ability to conduct unauthorized modification of Surface Layer data, so that it can create simulated spaces. The space in which you were located, the Candidate, was one such space.

112151021.content: If these simulated spaces are allowed to persist, they will expand until the original Surface Layer reality is overwritten. This may eventually lead to the destruction of the entire Sephirah Zone.

112151022.content: Labbi continues, providing Leviathan with a tidal wave of information. It reminds her of one of her math teachers. She just stares, confused.

112151023.content: Hold on a second... I remember running into a really large Visbane when we came here... It looked kind of like a giant bird. Is that the one making the illusions?

112151024.content: Modification suggested: "Illusion" is not an accurate term.

112151025.content: Doesn't matter. Anyway, how do you know all this?

112151027.content: Because of the relevant data located in my archives.

112151028.content: Wow, it makes so much sense.

112151029.content: The Countertide Whalesong was authorized by Aether Gazer for combat against Siren. However, the last attempt was unsuccessful due to the absence of the Candidate. My data is largely sourced from this battle.

112151030.content: So... Aether Gazer has gone into battle against this Visbane before? How come no one told me?

112151031.content: Data error... Establishing conjecture... Data error...

112151032.content: Okay, okay! Forget I asked! You said you've been guiding me. So what do you want me to do?

112151033.content: The Countertide Whalesong will have access to the Candidate on this attempt. Please reactivate full Countertide Whalesong power permissions and defeat Siren.

112151034.content: You mean I can defeat that crazy Visbane with this Access Key?

112151036.content: Leviathan glances once again at the Access Key. It suddenly feels very heavy in her hands.

112151037.content: Master, looks like my test isn't over yet!

112151038.content: Alert! Alert! Visbanes detected nearby. Prepare for combat.

112151039.content: Labbi's warning interrupts Leviathan's train of thought. She glances over at the simulated space nearby to find there are indeed several Visbanes approaching from deep within.

112151040.content: Just breathe... Alright. I can do this! Alone!

112152001.content: After the Divine Power inspired by the Countertide Whalesong faded away, the incoming Visbanes had long been wiped out.

112152002.content: Wow... And here I thought an Access Key shaped like an umbrella would only be good as a shield...

112152003.content: Rather than a defensive shield, the Countertide Whalesong is an extremely powerful offensive Access Key. Logical error! Logical error! Logical error!

112152004.content: Labbi immediately counters Leviathan's comment as if defending its honor.

112152005.content: Alright! Don't be angry! I'm just getting used to this, that's all.

112152006.content: So if we're seeing Visbanes, does that mean Siren is nearby too?

112152007.content: We've gotta find it fast and beat it!

112152009.content: Data indicates this decision to be extremely risky. The Candidate's control over the Countertide Whalesong's power is still inadequate. Chance of success in fighting Siren alone is extremely low....

112152010.content: The faint sounds of a cry for help suddenly reach Leviathan's ears. It sounds as if someone is struggling in the frigid ocean depths.

112152012.content: Scan complete. Drowning individual detected in the waters outside the simulated space.

112152013.content: Analysis of existing data in aggregate provides the following rescue options...

112152014.content: Leviathan grips her Access Key and rushes over to the Administrator's location before Labbi has a chance to finish!

112152015.content: She pushes on despite the freezing temperature and enormous ocean pressure.

112152016.content: Admin, hold on a bit longer...

112152017.content: The light guiding Leviathan's way vanishes. And then, in the darkness, a familiar aqua-blue light shines out once again.

112152018.content: The Countertide Whalesong has anticipated Leviathan's wish, sending a tremendous wave of Divine Power to clear away all the ocean water between Leviathan and her target.

112161001.content: The sound of roaring water disappears, replaced with the sweet smell of breathable air.

112161004.content: Scan complete. Target life signs normal. Additionally, the term "bubble world" is an inaccurate descriptor.

112161007.content: If so desired, I can provide a summarized version of the current situation.

112161008.content: Don't worry about it... Admin, what about the others?

112161009.content: Oh no! They must still be trapped in Siren's Bubble!

112161011.content: That's the Visbane that attacked us at the beginning! Skadi called it Siren.

112161012.content: Data error... Archives indicate that Siren was so named by the Aether Gazer ocean expeditionary squad. Data error...

112161013.content: Now's not the time to be pedantic, Labbi!

112161014.content: Our friends are in danger, Admin. We have to help them! Hurry!

112161015.content: This time, it's my turn to be the hero who saves everyone!

112161016.content: Right as the word "hero" leaves her lips, Leviathan glances nervously in my direction and starts to go red in the face, as if embarrassed by her own words.

112161017.content: But I also see some new maturity in Leviathan's face that wasn't there before. She is positively glowing with determination.

112161018.content: I suddenly realize that Leviathan is fulfilling the promise she'd made to herself and Vidar at the start of this journey.

112161019.content: Even without Vidar's help, you really are a force to be reckoned with, Leviathan.

112161020.content: After all, wasn't it you who just saved my life? As far as I'm concerned, you've already earned every right to call yourself a hero.

112161021.content: Admin... Yes! I can do this!

112161022.content: Labbi, point the way to Siren—and don't you dare tell me I can't go there now!

112161023.content: Labbi's mechanical blue eyes start flashing as it carries out what appears to a rather complicated calculation. Finally, they return to normal.

112161024.content: While rescuing the individual called Administrator, the Candidate managed to boost the Divine Power of the Countertide Whalesong far in excess of its regular parameters.

112161025.content: Consequently, the data model previously formulated cannot be used to assess the Candidate's capabilities. Hence, system rules dictate respect for the Candidate's decision, whatever it may be.

112161026.content: "If you don't defeat the monsters, you won't get the treasure."

112161028.content: Measurements indicate the simulated space occupied by Siren lies at the Candidate's ten o'clock. Please proceed to the border of the nearest simulated space.

112161029.content: Caution: Enemies may be present along the route.

112171002.content: I think the enormous wave just now swept Admin outside the Bubble...

112171003.content: No more talk. It's time for action. Let's go!

112171004.content: The group rallies for another charge out of the Bubble, but Siren has long since blocked their path to egress with another wall of water.

112171005.content: Its eyes dance with a cold, red light, as if signaling that with this move, its victory is assured.

112171007.content: Another giant tidal wave rushes toward the group, but this time there is no escape...

112171008.content: Just as the wave is about to land, the entire Bubble suddenly echoes with a loud cry reminiscent of a whale's song.

112171009.content: There's a flash of light. When it fades, the group can finally see the one singing the cetacean tune...

112171010.content: Leviathan raises the glimmering Countertide Whalesong as she single-handedly blocks the approaching wave, protecting everyone else behind her.

112171011.content: The large wall of water seems to have come up against an immovable object. A few moments later, the entire wall dissolves in front of Leviathan.

112171015.content: Wow! A hero shows up to save the day! Wait, is that Leviathan?!

112171016.content: Is that... a new Access Key!?

112171017.content: Yes! It's a long story... Anyway, it's Leviathan's turn to protect everyone!

112171018.content: Everyone's a bit dumbfounded at this declaration.

112171019.content: Mount the counterattack! I'm not about to be outdone by a skipper as short as Leviathan!

112171020.content: Geez! What does my height have to do with anything?!

112171021.content: Skadi's attempt at humor rouses everyone to action. The group takes up their weapons. Leviathan's new Access Key is glittering with a powerful bright light—radiating the best hope of actually defeating Siren.

112172001.content: The blast of Bane Energy released by Siren's collapse swallows everything around it like a black hole. And just like that, we find ourselves cast into the abyss of Siren's consciousness.

112172002.content: Mami told me that dreaming is wonderful...

112172003.content: Mami told me that waking up is hard...

112172005.content: Mami does not want to wake up...

112172007.content: But the adults said you must wake up...

112172010.content: You must wake up, because dreams are not real...

112172012.content: I don't want to wake up... I don't wanna wake up... I don't wanna... I don't wanna...

112172017.content: The teetering edifice of Siren's consciousness finally collapses as we all return to the Bubble. It feels like Siren is leaving us with a few parting words as the worlds she created face imminent collapse.

112172018.content: It sounds like a child abandoned by its parents—rebellious and yet also full of despair.

112172019.content: You rejected... my dreams... calling them illusions...

112172021.content: Finally, the Bubble collapses as well, and we are all quickly submerged under a torrent of water...

112172022.content: The whale cry fills the ocean around us again. I open my eyes to see Leviathan doing her very best to drag everyone to safety along with Snowflake 2—which has just appeared out of nowhere.

112181001.content: There's a piercing bright light. I blink. The light slowly fades, and eventually something takes shape before my eyes—an unfamiliar ceiling.

112181004.content: You're in the medical bay of an Aether Gazer rescue vessel. We found you adrift and unconscious, floating at sea.

112181006.content: I'm glad you asked. Shows how well suited you are for your current role, Administrator. Set your heart at ease. Everyone is just fine. In fact, you are the only one who ended up in the sickbay.

112181008.content: I've already asked the others to file a report on what happened so we can figure this one out.

112181009.content: But the result is obvious: That strange phenomenon we were observing in the Sephirah Zone's Peripheral Sea has now entirely subsided. And Verthandi has already filed a report on the sunken vessels she discovered. In summary, the mission was a resounding success.

112181010.content: However, no dossier filed on this mission could be considered complete without your contribution.

112181011.content: Memories that now seem so distant flood back. I actually get a little excited at the prospect of telling my side of the story.

112181012.content: Right. Well, we were all sucked down to the ocean floor by a giant whirlpool. It was filled with all these "Bubbles." There was a giant Visbane, which Skadi named Siren, and illusions that felt so real but were actually like dreams...

112181014.content: It seems that your report sounds quite similar to the others.

112181016.content: After the others had filed their reports, I asked our ship technicians to perform a thorough scan of the area. They didn't find any of these so-called "Bubbles". They didn't even find the common residual traces after Quake.

112181017.content: In fact, we found no abnormalities of any kind in the area, and certainly nothing to suggest the presence of a large Visbane. Furthermore, I could find no trace of this "Siren" you all referred to within Aether Gazer's archives.

112181018.content: The only thing the technical personnel found interesting was Leviathan's new Access Key.

112181019.content: The AI attached to it seems to possess a very peculiar data archive of its own. That also must be investigated.

112181020.content: But... everything that I've just told you really happened...

112181021.content: I understand how it might feel that way. And I can certainly believe that you all personally witnessed all of the things that you've described.

112181022.content: However, I'd prefer to add things to the dossier that shed light on our circumstances, rather than contradictions and speculations.

112181024.content: You and the others described a Visbane called Siren, which had the power to read others' memories and create illusions from them.

112181025.content: But the phenomenon you described in one of your illusions—that is, the large metropolis destroyed by a tsunami—could not have originated from the memory of anyone in your group.

112181026.content: The only reasonable explanation would be that Siren had based it on its own memories.

112181028.content: That Visbane might have remembered the destruction of a large metropolis. I have already passed this conjecture on to the Cryptics at HQ. A large team of technical experts has yet to make heads or tails of it.

112181030.content: Shu reveals a somewhat light smile at my confusion.

112181031.content: However, this is not a problem you need to trouble yourself with, Administrator.

112181032.content: You should say hello to the others. They're all very concerned about you.

112181033.content: I return to the main deck and to the beautiful open air and tranquil waves. Everything that's happened to me in the last few days seems like nothing more than a bad dream.

112181036.content: Didn't I say you can survive anything with a good night's sleep? Just like the end of any good action movie.

112181037.content: Whew! I'm glad... otherwise, I'd have a lot of explaining to do to Master.

112181038.content: Thinking about Vidar? Still nothing but a dead weight, I see.

112181039.content: I'll show you who's a dead weight!

112181040.content: Leviathan chases after Zenkibo just as Shu makes her way onto the deck.

112181041.content: Leviathan did a fantastic job on her own without Vidar's help. It was a pleasant surprise.

112181042.content: And the fact that you successfully made it out of whatever danger you were in speaks volumes of her abilities.

112181044.content: Skadi's loud voice rings out over the deck. Only now do I notice she is currently standing on Snowflake 2, which is sidled up next to the rescue vessel.

112181045.content: I'm honestly surprised that Snowflake 2 is still in one piece, considering what I remember from the final attack against Siren. She doesn't seem to have suffered much—I mean, except for where the water is still getting in and the way she's listing to one side.

112181046.content: Leviathan did a great job of parting the water for us, but it was up to Snowflake 2 to bring us up to the surface. If it weren't for her, we'd all be fish food right now.

112181047.content: It's a miracle, and it's all thanks to my good ol' seafaring girl!

112181048.content: Well... If these Bubbles that you all described did indeed exist, isn't it possible the strong currents caused by their collapse could've brought the ship up to the surface? That seems like a reasonable explanation to me.

112181049.content: Huh? I said it's a miracle—a miracle, trust me!

112181050.content: I look out over the horizon, across the tranquil waters, in search of some proof this adventure had ever happened while Skadi and Shu argue. Of course, I find none.

112181051.content: But isn't it enough to walk away with some very exciting and no doubt unforgettable summer memories?

113011001.content: "Everything eventually comes to an end, no matter how glorious they seem."

113011002.content: "All we can do is hold on to the good and beautiful things in this world for a little longer."

113011003.content: The young lady closes the old book. Something about those last sentences stays with her. She mumbles the words again.

113011004.content: Ardisis achieved things the average person could only dream of. And yet that is how he chose to end his autobiography...

113011005.content: However, it is such a thought--a very humane thought--that touches even we ageless Modifiers. Everyone, no matter how mighty, faces moments of loneliness.

113011006.content: Not everybody. Just you. Don't rope me in.

113011007.content: You are always so serious, Oceanus.— Oh, sorry, Cadyllon.

113011008.content: I always call you by your old name. Speaking of old, come to think of it, it's been over a century already...

113011009.content: Hades turns her gaze to the bustling city square and the preparations for the quinquennial art exhibition. Its official name is the Ardisis Ceremony in honor of its first organizer, Ardisis.

113011010.content: Participants have two weeks to present their masterpieces. Judges, not just masters from Chief Appraisers' Association, but also normal citizens in the city, will assess the submissions over multiple rounds, and in the end, seven finalists will be declared the winners.

113011011.content: The chance to be immortalized is worth the judges' scrutiny. The best works will also be granted permanent places in the Stellaris Temple.

113011012.content: This event that our friend first organized is now being held for the twentieth time.

113011013.content: Are you still angry about this morning's meeting? The vote was 5 to 2. This is a council decision. It's not like you to vent your anger to its proposer, Master Oceanus.

113011015.content: Your new outfit looks good on you. Made from selected fabrics from Shashvat. Did Enlil help you choose it?

113011016.content: It was a birthday present from last year.

113011017.content: Birthday? My, my. The word seems so distant…

113011018.content: We both know it's nothing more than a pretense.

113011019.content: Enlil is a lot younger than we are. Some days still seem significant to him.

113011020.content: Such an adorable quality in children, isn't it? The same goes for my little girl...

113011021.content: I heard you've also invited Odin's people to the ceremony this year.

113011022.content: Yes. The Society of Muses has a long-running partnership with Aether Gazer. Except that Shu will not be attending this year.

113011023.content: I've heard they're sending someone else—someone new to the organization. Someone called the Administrator, who is apparently a human.

113011024.content: So it's not just the Society of Muses—Aether Gazer has also gone stray.

113011026.content: Hades ambles over to Oceanus with a sigh. She is curious as to what makes his brows furrowed in anxiety.

113011027.content: Another theft against the associations? And just days before the opening of the ceremony...

113011028.content: This time it's the Society of Music. All the First-Class associations were hit, except two—one of which is your Society of Muses.

113011029.content: Looks like we will have to be doubly vigilant then.

113011030.content: Evidence shows that there's only one thief, yet the Knights of Convallaria still haven't caught this person. They're also on a downward...

113011031.content: (Cough) Sorry to interrupt. The door wasn't closed, so I thought...

113011033.content: Good day, Senator Hades, Senator Cadyllon.

113011034.content: You might find yourself busy today. Even the Commander of the Knights of Convallaria are seeking for your audience.

113011036.content: Actually, I'm here to speak with you, Senator Hades.

113011037.content: We would like to request the assistance of the Society of Muses in dealing with the recent art thefts.

113011039.content: Of all the Sephirah Zones, Omorfies has always had the fewest incidents. Even with all the quakes today, Omorfies has yet to record a significant one.

113011040.content: Omorfies art commands a high price, particularly when sold in other zones through the Photon Rail system. It has been a great source of profit and growth.

113011041.content: Look, Admin! That house was built with actual stones! And look at the floral patterns on the columns. They're beautiful!

113011042.content: Did you make this doll, Mister? ...Admin, can I buy this?

113011043.content: Huh? That building is just a restaurant! I've never seen anything like it!

113011044.content: I figured the rookie would be shocked by the wonders of travel, but it turns out that Ver is the one losing her mind...

113011046.content: Verthandi has been a source of limitless energy ever since we checked in at the port. Since then, she's been carrying the tourist guide to every stop on our route.

113011047.content: Excuse me, you're blocking my view of the building.

113011049.content: That's alright. You must not be from Omorfies, right? With your outfit.

113011051.content: A wondering traveler from afar on the busy streets... Very good. Ain Soph, is it? I'd prefer a silvery color then, something metallic... something cold.

113011052.content: Fiberglass would be a good choice if you want to look... statuesque.

113011053.content: (Apparently the people here talks differently from people in the other zones.)

113011055.content: Oh, yes! But it's not completed yet. Just need to add the finishing touches.

113011056.content: Wind from Stellaris Sea blows over the white walls and arches on the White Cliff. The first street it visits is this Democritus Boulevard.

113011057.content: This is the oldest street in Omorfies. Every cobblestone seems to have its own story.

113011058.content: Every nook and cranny of the city is decorated with artistic flourishes to be studied by any would-be artist, myself included.

113011059.content: Would be? I took you for an artist already! You draw so well!

113011060.content: Definitely not! Not until I pass the exam.

113011061.content: In Omorfies, you have to get an official license issued by an art association by the age of 16 to become an officially-recognized artist.

113011063.content: What are you doing here? Didn't I tell you to wait for me at the Photon Rail Station?

113011065.content: A familiar figure in red has appeared while we were busy talking to the aspiring painter.

113011066.content: You're friends of Lady Hera! I'm so sorry. I had no idea!

113011068.content: Me? Oh, no. I'm just an average citizen. Lady Hera is one of the most famous people in all of Omorfies! I'm one of her biggest fans!

113011069.content: The Photon Rail came early, so I thought maybe we'd just take a look around first.

113011070.content: Oh, I see. So what do you think?

113011071.content: It's such a beautiful and interesting place!

113011072.content: Ver answered with excitement before I got a chance to say anything.

113011073.content: Here is just an ordinary street in this city. Wait until you see the Society of Muses and Stellaris Academy. Then you'll really understand why Omorfies has been revered for so long.

113011074.content: Lady Hera, I have a copy of True Ladies and Gentlemen that you published last month! Would you autograph it for me?

113011075.content: Hera promptly signs the title page with her name.

113011077.content: Why are you looking at me like that, esteemed Administrator of Aether Gazer?

113011079.content: Well, sometimes Miss Hera seems... distant.

113011080.content: A lady of my stature should never be treated like some commoner. However, it is unfitting for a fair maiden to deem others as unworthy without just reason.

113011081.content: Respect begets respect and grace begets grace. This is what a fair maiden should keep in mind.

113011082.content: ...I see you've made little progress in your manners since we last met.

113011083.content: If you lie in front of a lady, at least try to cover it up. However, this might be so hard for a... simple person like you.

113011084.content: Sorry, I just meant that... that you seem a bit more approachable since we last met.

113011085.content: Oh? Then you are sadly mistaken, young Administrator. How could you lump me together together with the common sort such as yourself?

113011086.content: But... a fair maiden must not deem others as unworthy without just reason, for respect begets respect and grace begets grace. This is what I always bear in mind, and it is why many consider me a prime exemplar of elegance.

113011087.content: Um... I don't quite understand what you mean... but I guess I learned something!

113011088.content: Alright. Let me escort you to our society, where you can unpack your bags. It's been late already. I have much to show you about our glorious city.

113011089.content: Hera gives us a gentle smile and ever so slightly lifts the hem of her dress in a tiny curtsy.

113021002.content: The Command Room screen cycles through a series of photos. Some feature multiple people, and some have clearly been taken in secret. The only commonality is a man present in each—a man in formal business attire and gold-rimmed glasses.

113021004.content: Correct. All the photos are gathered by our Intelligence Office. Novich has been sighted in multiple Sephirah Zones—Shashvat, Sasanami, Neuhansa, Omorfies, and others.

113021006.content: I don't know... We considered that he would change his disguise, but he didn't. There may be some limits for a Cognizant Visbane when it's pretending to be a human, which we are not aware of.

113021007.content: Regardless, we now have enough to narrow down the areas he's interested in—whatever that interest might be.

113021008.content: I've sent squads to the zones where he was most active before your arrival. There's just one more zone to look at—Omorfies.

113021009.content: Omorfies? Ah, yes! That's where Lady Hera lives.

113021011.content: Shu hands me an ornate invitation.

113021012.content: This is an invitation to the quinquennial Ardisis Ceremony, the greatest art ceremony in Omorfies. It was sent in the name of the Society of Muses and delivered by Hera. The ceremony starts in just a few days. I think it's a good opportunity for you to start your investigation.

113021013.content: Can't we just ask the Modifiers in Omorfies for help?

113021014.content: Honestly, Omorfies is the least likely target among all potential targets. We don't want to raise eyebrows unnecessarily.

113021015.content: Also, those Modifiers in Omorfies will be very busy these days. It should be enough to keep an eye out for unusual events while you're there.

113021017.content: This is someone's house?! It's... It's massive!

113021018.content: Unlike Aether Gazer's metropolitan headquarters, the Society of Muses is furnished with breathtaking gracefulness and elegance.

113021019.content: At least, half of the building is.

113021020.content: The lobby is used for society work and exams. As the society has grown less busy over the years, more household items have been moved in.

113021021.content: Feel free to look around. But do—not—touch any of these priceless artifacts. Most are irreplaceable...

113021022.content: Look, Admin! This place is guarded by armored knights! They are so cool!

113021024.content: Two knight-like people come over from an archway at the other end of the lobby. Soon they noticed us, and I see suspicion in their eyes.

113021025.content: Who are you? What business do you have with the Society of Muses?

113021026.content: Are you here for certification business? Or the exam? Do you have an appointment? Sign in here...

113021028.content: Hold on. I should be the one asking questions here! Who are you?

113021029.content: We are the Knights of Convallaria.

113021030.content: That's obvious enough! I mean, what business do you have in my home and why are you harassing my guests?

113021031.content: Well... our orders come directly from the Commander. She issued an order that from today onward, we would take over all security details of all associations.

113021032.content: Gah! I should have known it would be Athena!

113021033.content: The other knight, standing slightly behind, pulls her companion to the side and whispers in his ear.

113021034.content: Lady Hera! I am so sorry. As a member of the Society of Muses, of course, there's no need for you to register.

113021036.content: Excuse me. These two must stay for a while longer.

113021037.content: Starting today, all visitors to any association must file a formal application to the Knights of Convallaria—particularly suspicious individuals, that is, those from other Sephirah Zones.

113021039.content: Allow me to reiterate: They are guests of the Society of Muses.

113021041.content: Let's escort them to headquarters to verify their identity with the Commander first.

113021043.content: Wait. We have an invitation from the Society of Muses! We're not suspicious individuals!

113021044.content: This does not look like an official document to me. We will release you immediately after verifying your identity—assuming there are no issues.

113021045.content: Until that time, the Knights of Convallaria will be providing you with alternative living arrangements.

113021047.content: Hera moves protectively in front of Ver and me. Her eyes blaze with rage brighter than the ruby on her staff.

113021048.content: This is outrageous! To insult my guests is to insult me!

113021049.content: Hera, wait! They're just doing things by the book...

113021050.content: I'm sorry, Lady Hera. We have orders from the Commander. Please do not try to intervene.

113022001.content: Mintha, are we really going to just watch?

113022002.content: Do you think we should get involved, Leuce?

113022003.content: Leuce doesn't know. I don't recognize these two.

113022004.content: But Lady Hera is the one fighting there.

113022005.content: Then Leuce thinks we should probably just help Lady Hera.

113022006.content: Alright. After preparing Master Hades' afternoon tea.

113022007.content: Does Mintha think the tea is more important?

113022009.content: Leuce is not sure. Whatever Mintha thinks.

113031003.content: Hera has given the knights a few whacks with her staff. They are having trouble parrying with their swords, but they still aren't willing to step back.

113031004.content: Hold the line! For the duty and honor of Convallaria!

113031005.content: You are simply disobedient, stubborn children—just like your Commander!

113031006.content: Hera raises her staff. Beams of fiery light gather and swirl around it. There is an ear-splitting shriek...

113031008.content: A sword the size of a man pierces the narrow space between the combatants, shaking the ground with enough force to knock Hera and the knights back.

113031009.content: Commander! A-And Senator Hades! We were...

113031013.content: The red-headed lady glares severely at the two knights. Her eyes are even harsher than her words.

113031014.content: Understood, Commander... We'll be on our way then.

113031015.content: I see the approaching ceremony has you so busy that you cannot control your subordinates, Athena.

113031016.content: How did the Knights of Convallaria, once shining examples of Omorfies' grace and elegance, become crude ruffians out to kidnap Muses' guests? Astonishing.

113031017.content: I'm the one who ordered the Knights here, and I only applied to the Council orally last night. Which is why there has been no formal notification.

113031018.content: But I do admit they have some... flaws in the execution of their duties.

113031019.content: I hereby apologize on behalf of the Knights of Convallaria.

113031021.content: The lady whom the knights called Senator Hades walks over to Hera with a friendly smile. I remember the name. If I recall correctly, she's in charge of the Society of Muses.

113031022.content: Athena, these guests are partners of our Society and they received their ceremony invitations long ago. Besides, they just arrived this morning. So they obviously have nothing to do with the thefts.

113031024.content: Understood. I hope that the previous experience was not too traumatic to your honored guests.

113031025.content: Alright, it was all just a simple misunderstanding. I've seen this sort of thing many times during my years at the Society. Let's move on.

113031028.content: Guests from Aether Gazer, correct? We haven't met... interesting. Always on the search for new talent, aren't they? We haven't admitted new members to our ranks for quite some time.

113031029.content: Oh my, where are my manners? Allow me to introduce myself. I'm Hades, president of the Association for the Appraisal of Unconventional Art, also known as the Society of Muses. I'm also the seventh member of Omorfies' highest Council-the Astral Council.

113031030.content: (Is she the same Hades that Shu mentioned? She's nowhere near as terrifying as Shu said. In fact, she's not the least bit menacing.)

113031031.content: Greetings. I'm Verthandi, a member of the Overture Squad of Aether Gazer. And this is our Administrator, #{nickname}#.

113031032.content: It's our first time at the Ardisis Ceremony. We really appreciate your invitation. I'm sure we have a lot to learn.

113031033.content: Oh, no need to be so formal! Make yourselves at home, please. And let me know if you need anything.

113031034.content: Really? Then if it's all right... Can I try one of those Omorfian rotating barbecues I heard about!?

113031035.content: Haha! Of course, no problem. What an interesting kid.

113031039.content: Two maids appear and bow to Hades.

113031040.content: Escort Oneiroi to the parlor, and then prepare a barbecue for our guest.

113031041.content: Shall we serve the barbecue with afternoon tea? It seems a little too...

113031042.content: This is a command from Lady Hades.

113031043.content: The situation in Omorfies is somewhat delicate at the moment, my dear guests. Particularly in regard to visitors from another Sephirah Zone. I suggest you have a Knight of Convallaria accompany you if you plan to go sightseeing.

113031044.content: What happened, Athena? Why are the Knights surrounding the Society of Muses?

113031045.content: In recent weeks, multiple top-class art associations have been pilfered by unknown thieves. Many priceless works have gone missing.

113031046.content: The Knights have been posted to all the associations, not just the Society of Muses.

113031047.content: Works have gone missing... Why haven't I heard about this?

113031048.content: There have been no injuries or casualties, although some association staff was knocked unconscious. So we've elected not to publicize the thefts in the interest of the coming ceremony.

113031049.content: Hmph. So you realized you couldn't stop the thefts, and then you decided to panic?

113031051.content: It's amazing how quickly the mood sours.

113031052.content: Actually, this is something we can help with too, right, Admin?

113031054.content: I meet Ver's gaze. She's smiling at me, expecting me to voice my support.

113031055.content: It seems Ver also thinks these thefts are related to Novich.

113031056.content: It would be wonderful if our distinguished guests from Aether Gazer could lend their assistance.

113031058.content: The Knights of Convallaria have not apprehended the perpetrator, but we have found a reliable eyewitness.

113041001.content: At Athena's summoning, a young man in a school uniform cautiously enters. He is shy and unimposing, which is probably why we didn't notice him earlier.

113041002.content: He looks 15-ish and holds his backpack in his hands, gripping it by the straps like a frightened animal.

113041003.content: This young man reached out to us. He happened to be in the Society of Sculptures during a theft. All other witnesses claim no memory of the attacker. For some reason, he can still describe their—its—face and appearance.

113041004.content: The thieves weren't human... They were like some kind of monsters. They were carrying spears and growling.

113041005.content: It seems like a dream. It's hard for me to imagine that it really happened... I was so scared. I just can't believe it.

113041006.content: You're Ron, right? You don't look like an association staff. What were you doing there yesterday when it was closed?

113041007.content: Honored Senator... I'm a grade 4 drawing student at Stellaris Academy. I'd been practicing for the certification exam all day and ended up falling asleep last night.

113041008.content: Lady Hades, I have Miss Oneiroi with me.

113041011.content: Mintha is cradling an adorable girl in pajamas. The girl is hugging a black and white stuffed sheep. Being carried down the stairs seems to have jolted her eyes open.

113041014.content: Mmmm... There are no classes today. Why is Ron here?

113041015.content: It must be another dream. It's not really Ron... Drowsie, let's go back to sleep.

113041016.content: Huh? H-Hold on. I am Ron! Your classmate!

113041019.content: She is Oneiroi. She's gifted with extraordinary talents relating to dreams and memory. Unfortunately, her ability to control her talents has not kept pace with the powers themselves.

113041020.content: Oneiroi has been responsible for several local... incidents. So for everyone's safety, she needs to get more sleep than is otherwise typical.

113041021.content: Oneiroi? ...I remember now! The Cryptics mentioned her many times in the maintenance reports on the Dream system.

113041022.content: That's because the Dream system was developed by simulating Oneiroi's natural abilities. Even today, it has little more than a tenth of the power that Oneiroi herself could summon.

113041023.content: We're terribly sorry for the intrusion, Miss Oneiroi, but we need to borrow your powers to enter Ron's dreamscape and find out who's behind these thefts.

113041024.content: Dreams are simply a re-ordering of existing fragments of memory. Can we assemble a workable dreamscape from a particular slice of memory?

113041025.content: Kay... I think I get it.

113041026.content: That's Athena, me, and our two visitors from Aether Gazer... Would you like to help as well, Hera?

113041029.content: But only because I want to put an end to this whole nonsense. I don't want you and your boorish knights bothering us for a moment longer than necessary.

113041030.content: Ron? Sit here. The author of the dreamscape should sit in the middle. Anyone else who wants to enter the dream can sit next to him.

113041032.content: The girl reappears, this time wearing a cute dress.

113041033.content: As if she had a pair of wings, she slowly floated over to the boy and takes his outstretched hands in hers.

113041034.content: Are you nervous, Ron? Your hands are sweating.

113041035.content: Will everyone be able to see my memories, Oneiroi? I mean... all of them?

113041036.content: Are there some things you don't want us to see, Ron?

113041038.content: Okay, Ron. Just think back to the things you want to share with us. Drowsie will make sure we avoid any other memories.

113041040.content: Drowsie can see that you haven't been sleeping well, Ron.

113041041.content: I'm worried about my exam... It's my last chance this year. If I don't get in... I'll be ruined. I'll be nothing.

113041042.content: I understand... So that's why you've been having so many strange dreams.

113041044.content: Don't worry about it. Drowsie won't look at them... Because we've made an agreement about that, Ron.

113041045.content: So, Ron... You can... um... think about what happened yesterday.

113041046.content: Yesterday... I got up early because I've used up all my paints and paper. I had to buy new materials...

113041047.content: Drowsie uses up paints really quickly, too. I have to get Mintha and Leuce to buy me more...

113041048.content: I saw some Knights of Convallaria when I went out for supplies. They were asking the shop owner some... I... I'm so sleepy.

113041049.content: Mm-hm... Well then... Sweet dreams, Ron.

113041050.content: I look around. At some point, our surroundings have become a strange mixture of light and shadow. It sounds like someone is whispering into my ear, but I can't quite make it out.

113041051.content: I'm getting really... really tired, Admin...

113041052.content: What's wrong, Ver? Oh my... Me... too...

113041053.content: Fatigue overwhelms me. I try to keep my eyes open, but my eyelids don't want to respond. The world goes hazy and then turns dark.

113051001.content: When I come to, the strange light show has been replaced by the bustling streets of Omorfies.

113051003.content: Ron says he bought his painting supplies from a shop here before heading to the Society of Sculptures.

113051004.content: Are we in the dream yet? Amazing, Oneiroi. I can't believe we all ended up in the same dream.

113051005.content: I remember the Cryptics once attempted a dream-sharing to rouse Osiris, but the dreamscape collapsed pretty quickly.

113051007.content: A short distance away, we spot a young man weaving his way through the crowds, backpack on his shoulder.

113051010.content: We're intruders on his dreamscape. You'll be kicked out if he sees you.

113051011.content: Athena hesitates but decides to follow Hera's advice.

113051012.content: This way. Time works funny in dreams. We just have to wait until evening, when Ron spots the intruder.

113051013.content: Following Hades, we hide behind a bus stop sign. Ron keeps walking, and the scenery behind him slowly collapses into a black void.

113051014.content: I spot a toy sheep with white and black stripes running between us and the darkness. It looks exhausted from all the running, and terrified of being swept up in the abyss.

113051016.content: That's Drowsie. It's trying really hard to construct the dream...

113051017.content: The explanation comes in the lazy voice of a girl sitting on a cloud.

113051018.content: No need to be surprised. Oneiroi can do anything she wants here. Just accept it and move on.

113051020.content: We're far enough. Let's follow him.

113051021.content: We make sure that Ron has already entered the Society of Sculptors before we go to the main entrance.

113051022.content: Athena hasn't given the lockdown order at this time yesterday, but we can already see quite a few Knights of Convallaria on patrol. She was clearly working her way up to it.

113051025.content: We thought having the Commander of the Knights with us would get us through. Guess we were wrong.

113051026.content: I'm your Commander, Athena. Even if you're a complete newcomer, you must have participated in the Investiture Ceremony. I have official business here. Let me through.

113051027.content: It seems that, for whatever reason, the knights who now surround us are not really listening to Athena... and they have swords pointed in our direction.

113051028.content: Can you not understand me? Waste my time anymore and I will... What?

113051029.content: The Commander's words are interrupted by a sharp, silvery sword.

113051030.content: Athena dodges the attack thanks to pure instinct. It is quickly followed by a flurry of fierce assaults.

113051031.content: What are you doing? Don't just stand there. Fight back!

113051033.content: In the dreamscape created by Oneiroi. if the author of the dreamscape were rejecting outsiders deep in their heart, the dream would try to expel us—and that seems to be precisely what's happening.

113051034.content: Another knight thrusts a spear at Hera. This attack is even less successful.

113051035.content: Hera's staff flashes, and the Divine Power sends the knight flying into a wall.

113051037.content: Hmph. Look at you, just standing there. If you're too shocked to respond, I'll be happy to handle them all on my own!

113061001.content: There's a flurry of activity and the sounds armor being struck before the last knight falls to the ground.

113061002.content: After all that, will we still be able to observe the theft?

113061003.content: Don't worry... It's fine as long as Ron didn't notice all this.

113061004.content: What Oneiroi means is that the dreamscape will only be limited within a short range around the dreamer, and the part that deviates too much from the memory of the dreamer will be corrected soon.

113061005.content: No sooner does Hades speak than the fallen knights disappear in a puff of smoke.

113061006.content: We open the door and enter. The atrium is large and impressive, similar in scope to the entrance of the Society of Muses. Here, though, the artwork and ornaments are arranged a little bit more neatly—more appropriate for an official place of business.

113061007.content: Ron is indeed practicing in the sculpture gallery behind that door. He said earlier that the thief came late at night. Presumably we'll have to hang around for a while.

113061008.content: We select a corner on the second floor with a good view on Ron, and then we wait.

113061009.content: Athena, did you know that Oceanus doesn't even cut his steak? His servant does it for him.

113061011.content: The people from the Society of Sculptures tell me that Enlil has to give him lots of napkins when serving lunch, because he always makes a huge mess...

113061012.content: I was not aware of that.

113061013.content: One time he was trying to trim the plants in his garden, and you know what happened? He had no idea how. Even though he loves having an enormous garden...

113061014.content: Hades finds a chair next to Athena and keeps chatting away happily. Athena, however, stands straight up, eyes focused like lasers on Ron down below.

113061015.content: What a conversation. I couldn't keep up a chat like that.

113061016.content: Ahhh... Good morning. What time is it?

113061018.content: Oh, right. We've been here since late afternoon.

113061019.content: Wait! That means five hours have passed, right? I'm really hungry...

113061020.content: Try to recite the words "I'm full" over and over in your head.

113061021.content: I'm full, I'm full...! Mm! Fascinating! I don't think I'm hungry anymore.

113061022.content: That's because we're in a dreamscape. In reality, you're asleep on a sofa in the Society.

113061023.content: I can't believe that boy has been sitting there drawing all this time.

113061024.content: As Hera said, Ron has been sitting and drawing in the gallery for over five hours.

113061025.content: I heard he'll be 16 this year. Most people who fail the exam four times would have left Stellaris Academy by now.

113061027.content: In Omorfies, anyone who doesn't get a certification from a decent art association by 16 can never work as a publicly accepted artist.

113061028.content: That means no stable income, or at least the artwork will be viewed with suspicion. Their family probably won't support them anymore, and they'll have to change careers.

113061029.content: This is a crucial age for a lot of people.

113061030.content: No wonder he's trying so hard... But don't you think that rule may be over strict?

113061031.content: It has a lot to do with Omorfies' history. Yes, we may be rejecting some talented late-bloomers, but Omorfies cannot afford a repeat of the past, whatever the cost.

113061032.content: Athena always speaks sternly, but her tone becomes even more serious when speaking of the "past."

113061034.content: The pen slides out of his hand. As he was sitting in such an inconspicuous corner of the room, it's no wonder the staff didn't notice him when they locked the doors.

113061036.content: (Hey, Admin... I think the description of those monsters sounds a lot like Visbanes. But what would motivate a Visbane to steal artwork?)

113061037.content: (Unless something or someone are controlling them...)

113061038.content: I'm conversing with Ver when a violent wind shakes the windows. It sounds almost like the horn for battle.

113061039.content: We hear a loud pounding against the windows and doors, then the screeching of Visbanes from somewhere in the building.

113061041.content: Athena slashes through an approaching dark figure. We get a good look at its face just before it vanishes...

113061043.content: More dark creatures flood into the room through the ceiling and windows, but none of these pay us any mind. Other than the one attacked Athena, the rest of them all focus on destroying the exhibit cases and stands.

113061045.content: The noise wakes up Ron, who immediately hides under an easel, using a palette as a shield.

113061047.content: Don't be stupid. Did you forget it's just a dream? Whatever happened here has already happened—yesterday.

113061048.content: The Visbanes don't seem the least bit interested in Ron, but focus on overturning and smashing one exhibit after another... Their methods are crude and destructive, but they seem to be searching for something.

113061049.content: Do you think we could find out who's controlling them?

113061050.content: No way. Ron is terrified... the dream is getting smaller...

113061051.content: As Oneiroi speaks, an injured sheep bursts in over a wall and collapses in the gallery. Following it, the black void rolls towards us like a tsunami.

113062002.content: I can't believe Visbanes would actually want to steal something... and art at that!

113062003.content: Perhaps they're developing higher-order desires, like an appreciation for fine art?

113062006.content: What do you think? Someone is obviously controlling them. Don't be ridiculous, rookie!

113062008.content: I heard that Aether Gazer just confirmed the existence of Cognizant Visbane, a higher grade that can issue commands to lower-level Visbanes. Something like the leader of a pack?

113062009.content: To tell you the truth, we didn't come here just to attend the ceremony...

113062010.content: We tell Hades and the others about Novich's appearance in Omorfies...

113062011.content: No wonder you really wanted to enter that dreamscape. It looks like the Visbanes are destroying the exhibits because someone ordered them to find something.

113062012.content: If there really is a Cognizant Visbane in Omorfies, then our situation just got much more serious.

113062013.content: Every association is now being guarded by the knights. We are sure to apprehend them unless all the thefts have already been completed.

113062014.content: Years ago, you told me that you'd rather be a Convallaria Knight than go after Visbanes. Well, it looks like fate has taken the choice out of your hands.

113062015.content: My knights will respond to any threat with courage and honor—whether it be Visbane or human. And I would be very grateful for any assistance the Society of Muses can offer.

113062016.content: Lady Hera, what is Lady Hades saying...?

113062017.content: Lady Athena is also a Modifier, and she has not forgotten her powers and what they mean—unlike some.

113062018.content: And yet somehow, even though Athena is aware of the threats to Gaea—she would still rather lead her silly knights.

113062019.content: She rejected Hades's invitation to the Society of Muses so she could proudly strut around with her beloved knights—around the antiques in Stellaris Temple.

113062020.content: No wonder you two are not terribly close.

113062021.content: My differences with Athena extend far beyond her refusal to join the Society of Muses...

113062022.content: Ladies, Miss, dear guests, afternoon tea is served. As well as a rotating barbecue, as requested.

113062023.content: You didn't have to mention that, Leuce.

113062024.content: It really is a barbecue! Let me see!

113062025.content: Excuse me, honored guest. Please allow me...

113062026.content: That's alright. I can do it myself.

113062027.content: Well, well. Let her do it, Leuce.

113062030.content: Yes. The dreamscape has already collapsed. He's just sleeping because he's very tired...

113062031.content: Carry him to the guest bedroom, Leuce. And Miss Oneiroi? Don't sleep on the floor. You'll get cold.

113062032.content: Oh... I want Mintha to carry me...

113062033.content: Hehe... This is a common sight in the Society of Muses. Would you please make your way, everyone, to the dining room for afternoon tea?

113071001.content: What do you mean regrets? What are you saying?

113071002.content: You haven't hurt anyone. It's just a question of weighing the pros and cons.

113071003.content: Giving up now will mean all our efforts have gone to waste!

113071004.content: That's a huge exaggeration. Believe me, okay? We've all been through this before.

113071007.content: No. Someone has to stand guard.

113071008.content: Verthandi and the human Administrator have fallen asleep on the sofa opposite. Hades and her two servants have chosen to remain upstairs.

113071009.content: I'll be fine keeping watch on my own tonight.

113071010.content: Don't overthink it. I'm just going to get a cup of tea.

113071011.content: The only sound in the parlor is boiling water and the shaking of a candle on top of a teapot.
