113071012.content: The evening lamp casts its faded yellow light on the tea set in front of Hera, and on Athena's porcelain-white sword in the window.

113071013.content: Why do you always look so worried?

113071015.content: Ever since I came downstairs, you've been gripping your sword and muttering to yourself, haven't you?

113071016.content: ...I want to catch whoever is responsible for this as soon as possible. There are also some matters to deal with after the ceremony.

113071017.content: And what will you do if nothing happens tonight?

113071018.content: The knights have prepared a 24-hour guard for all the associations. And it will continue until the ceremony has ended.

113071019.content: And what if you can't catch the perpetrator? Will the Council postpone the ceremony?

113071020.content: I won't allow that to happen... We've never done that in the whole century. And we're not about to start.

113071021.content: Hmph. You may be right... Postponing the ceremony will cause quite a stir. I'd rather avoid that.

113071023.content: What's the look? Do you think I just want to make life hard for you no matter what you say?

113071024.content: No. I’ve... just... always thought you despise me for some reason.

113071026.content: Hera takes a cello from one of the displays. The room falls silent again, except for the sound of the water boiling, which keeps getting louder.

113071027.content: This cello was used by Ardisis himself. It is called Dawn.

113071028.content: I put it in an exhibit after realizing I would never be able to play it as it deserves.

113071031.content: How about a fiddle with it?

113071032.content: Athena's hands tremble. She immediately goes back to gripping her sword.

113071033.content: Silly question. I've never heard of you playing the cello in front of anyone since you beat me at that event.

113071034.content: You won and then you quit. That's cheeky...

113071036.content: The sound of boiling water disappears, replaced the sound of water flow onto the tea leaves.

113071039.content: Very few people get to drink a cup of tea made by me personally. You know, you should really...

113071043.content: Athena draws her sword and runs out before the screech even ends.

113072001.content: You shall not disturb the ceremony!

113072003.content: No! It's trying to get away!

113072010.content: One of the maids appears in the air above the Visbane just as multiple chainblade strikes lock it down. The hovering maid is not holding a cup of tea or plate this time, but an iron fist sized like a shooting star...

113072012.content: Straight out of a comic. Very cool, Mintha.

113072013.content: Don't think you quite pulled off the landing. Pity.

113072015.content: I overslept. My apologies. But it looks like I didn't miss anything.

113072018.content: Athena goes in for a closer look. But the Visbane's body is already melting into dust by the time she arrives.

113072021.content: Only slight injuries. And then they disappeared. It was almost like they entered a space we couldn't access.

113072022.content: So, they were all controlled by this Visbane.

113072023.content: But we still have no idea why Visbanes are stealing art. And where is all the stolen art?

113072026.content: As the individual controlling them was eliminated, the rest of them won't continue their operations. I think we can conclude that the danger is over, and that Omorfies is safe for the time being.

113072027.content: Notify the other knights that the thief has been brought to justice. Tonight will be the last night of the lockdown.

113072028.content: Hold on a moment. There are still a lot of unanswered questions. For example, why target the associations? What were they looking for? Don't you need some answers to conclude it's over?

113072029.content: The knights are not detectives. We will leave that task to others.

113072030.content: My goodness, what I mean is, we need to investigate before concluding anything—otherwise we might be falling into our opponent's trap.

113072031.content: And you're forgetting what they told us. We had reports of a Cognizant Visbane, and the one we just vanquished was not terribly intelligent.

113072032.content: I refuse to waste manpower during the ceremony because of a few unconfirmed intel.

113072034.content: I can't deny that there is something fishy about the whole thing... But the Knights are the keepers of the peace. I am not. So I will allow them the final word on this matter.

113072035.content: And isn't this the very thing you desire, Hera? An end to the knights' lockdown over the Society of Muses?

113072036.content: You place us all under a snap lockdown and then suddenly release it. Your attitude is impossible!

113072037.content: Hera throws the one last angry retort at Athena and heads upstairs in a huff.

113072038.content: We've just won a major victory. So why does it feel like things have only gotten worse?

113072042.content: Today has been difficult indeed. Thank you all for your assistance. The Knights of Convallaria must now be off.

113081001.content: Athena became the leader of the Knights of Convallaria when she was only 16 years old. She did so by challenging her brother Argo, the leader at the time, during the Knights Tournament, claiming he was cheating. And she won.

113081002.content: It was another astounding achievement in Athena's career. She had already become the youngest knight ever at 9 years old.

113081003.content: The Knights of Convallaria changed a lot under Athena's leadership. For example, those deemed unsuitable or too old were relieved from their ranks. She did this to ensure that the knights stayed ready to face evil and corruption wherever it was found.

113081004.content: After these changes, the knights' investigators started solving many more cases. CORG's analysis speaks for itself—Omorfies now has the lowest crime rate in all the Zones thanks to the knights' strict maintenance of law and order.

113081006.content: The other stories are more like rumors...

113081007.content: When Colleen Pallas of the illustrious Pallas family died, her grandnephew Argo became head of the family. And he kicked Athena out of the family and stripped her of the Pallas name after the Knights Tournament.

113081008.content: Sheesh! He was just getting back at her because she ended up taking over his power!

113081009.content: Athena doesn't look like someone who leaves things half-done. I'm genuinely puzzled by the way she just called it quits on the investigation.

113081010.content: Breakfast is served in the dining room, honored guests.

113081011.content: Today we have a selection of pancakes made with dairy milk, pumpkin and yellow bean soup, and Stellaris sausages. All carefully curated by Mintha, who is eagerly awaiting your feedback... Ouch!

113081012.content: Mintha interrupts Leuce with some flashy hit.

113081014.content: A chauffeur will pick you up after breakfast.

113081015.content: A chauffeur? Where are we going?

113081016.content: Oh, I didn't have time to tell you.

113081017.content: These next few days will be hectic with the opening of the ceremony just around the corner. The knights have lifted all lockdowns, so now things are mostly back to normal. This means that, as one of the Council members, I will be extremely busy.

113081018.content: So, I would like to play the role of consummate host today, while I still have time. And that means a visit to the Stellaris Academy.

113081020.content: The greatest art school in all of Omorfies and the seat of the Astral Council. Assuming the customary schedule is followed, the Ardisis Ceremony will be held again in the grand square of the Stellaris Academy.

113081021.content: Technically, we built the academy and the offices on top of where the ceremony first took place... But it's basically the same.

113081022.content: Administrator and Verthandi, you are both in for a real treat. Since you have Senator Hades with you, I think you're going to see a lot more of the academy than most people.

113081023.content: Hehe... Aether Gazer's AI is cutting-edge, I see. You seem to know a lot about Omorfies.

113081024.content: The ceremony has been held 19 times already. It displays the wonders of Omorfies to other Sephirah Zones, and it encourages the associations to pursue excellence by competing with each other.

113081025.content: The winners get lifelong riches and prestige, and the best works in each category are honored with a permanent display in the academy's collection: the Stellaris Temple.

113081026.content: Sounds impressive! Lady Hades, can we have a look at the collection!?

113081027.content: The collection is only open to the public twice a year, in February and October. But I believe we can make an exception for guests who have traveled so far.

113081030.content: Wow! It's like a palace out of a history book!

113081031.content: The museum's exterior is impressive enough, but once we enter the lobby, the depth of artistry shatters our previous notions of beauty.

113081032.content: The lobby is filled with some of the lesser pieces. Inside, there is an area for each of the various arts.

113081033.content: So what catches your fancy today? Painting? Sculpture? Dance recordings and costumes?

113081034.content: It's a tough call. There's no way we can visit all of them today, can we?

113081036.content: I wish I was a Stellaris Academy student! I could spend as much time as I want here, learning and living...

113081037.content: You know, all the students we've met have been so polite. They all take off their hats and bow.

113081038.content: That might be because you're accompanied by a Senator. One of the Senators who brought Omorfies out of the dark times and reestablished the orderly society we have today.

113081039.content: Oh my, it's Oceanus. Good morning.

113081040.content: The Council is the embodiment of precision and correctness. Thus it naturally receives significant respect.

113081041.content: Even the least of the Senators is honored in public because she holds a Council seat. But there are times when such a Senator forgets her proper place and responsibilities...

113081043.content: Apologies. Father is not deliberately ignoring you. But once he begins one of his critical tirades, he never stops...

113081045.content: It's hard to find another person who's spent so long learning the arts without anything to show for it... You'd think such a person would have learned something about dignity.

113081047.content: Seems like a very serious person.

113081048.content: Let me introduce the third Senator—Oceanus. You can consider him my... colleague? And this is his son, Enlil.

113081050.content: Ha. Adopted son. They're also Modifiers.

113081051.content: Good day to you. I heard we had two visitors all the way from Ain Soph. I hope you very much enjoy your stay in Omorfies.

113081052.content: As for you, Hades. Athena told me that the thieves were brought to justice in the Society of Muses. Now that the issue is resolved, I hope the ceremony will start on time? Then all the delayed works must be dealt with as soon as possible.

113081054.content: You haven't seemed very interested in the preparations. But you must have heard about all the problems, of course? And as one of the overseers, you can hardly wait until tomorrow before resuming work.

113081056.content: But who am I talking to? I hadn't hoped that you would take this as seriously as I do. I just thought I'd try, since I heard that you were visiting.

113081059.content: I'm sorry, but my father is under tremendous pressure. Normally he's quite pleasant.

113081060.content: I watch them leave and then look at my guide, who claps happily as if nothing has happened—and as if she hasn't just received a thorough dressing-down.

113091001.content: After spending some time looking through the collection.

113091002.content: It's incredible! I don't know the first thing about art, but I still think every piece is extraordinary!

113091003.content: I can feel the inspiration that each sculptor poured into their work. I feel like each one is trying to say something.

113091004.content: It seems that you are more of a feeling type.

113091005.content: Oh... I... I'm just saying things as they come.

113091006.content: No harm in that. Every person comes at a piece of art with their own interpretation. Once a work is completed, we can't say that the right of final interpretation always belongs to the artist.

113091007.content: This collection contains the best art produced over many decades. And that guarantees that each artist poured in something of themselves.

113091008.content: I'm curious about something: If there are so many talented people in Omorfies, why do you have to pass an exam by age 16? Doesn't that exclude all the late bloomers?

113091009.content: And what exactly is this "past" you refered to?

113091010.content: Verthandi, why do you think there are all these associations, also the Stellaris Academy and Ardisis Ceremony? Do you think it's to encourage people to go into art?

113091012.content: On the contrary... we are imposing order on society to limit what artists can do. We are, in effect, controlling the pathways artists can take in their development.

113091013.content: Omorfies was a very different place a century ago. We had many talented artists back then... perhaps more than even today.

113091014.content: The old artists produced artwork that, with CORG's approval, could be sold in the other zones around Gaea. And it fetched a high price. It was profitable for Omorfies, and it brought tremendous riches and prestige.

113091015.content: But this is where the problems began. The art industry became so lucrative that it destabilized the economy. Everyone wanted to be an artist. Everyone wanted to auction their works in other Zones. And that became a problem for essential industries and everyday life in Omorfies.

113091016.content: It was also a problem for the artistic spirit and for artistic integrity. People got embroiled in disputes between different schools and parties. And the battle for supremacy, prestige, and power soon became more important than the works themselves.

113091017.content: Naturally, when the artistic spirit was corrupted, it hurt the quality of the works being sold.

113091018.content: So is that why you instituted a gatekeeping system?

113091019.content: That's just a summary of what happened all these years. Behind Omorfies' happy exterior, I assure you, a price has been paid... A lot of sacrifices, I would say.

113091020.content: Many of my fellows dedicated their lives so that Omorfians today live better than their grandparents.

113091022.content: Alright then. We're just about done with the sculptures, yes? Let me take you to some other areas.

113091023.content: By the way, what about these suits of armor? Are they part of the exhibit?

113091024.content: They are not, actually. Although one would be forgiven for thinking so, as they are very well-crafted. They are, in fact, part of our security system.

113091025.content: Security system? It doesn't look like any security system I've ever seen.

113091026.content: They are custom security AGI Mechas from a supplier in Neuhansa. You can say hello if you want.

113091027.content: Verthandi waves hello to one of the armors.

113091028.content: Good day, tourist. Is there anything I can help you with?

113091030.content: That was Oceanus' suggestion. He thought that a museum of this caliber deserved more than an old-school security system.

113091031.content: Most visitors barely notice them—they're just part of the background.

113091033.content: Is there anything you need? Is there... bzzZZzzt——Unidentified intruders detected!

113091036.content: The Mecha's eyes flash red. It is just about to draw its sword on Ver when she disables it.

113091038.content: I had a feeling that was gonna happen, just like the Admin!

113091040.content: These Mechas have been corrupted by Visbanes. We saw this in Neuhansa as well!

113091041.content: The Mecha that tried to attack Verthandi is joined by others of its kind.

113101001.content: Are you alright? The knights reported sounds of battle, so I hurried over.

113101002.content: We're fine. But would you look at this? Miss Athena, it's certain now that the thief is still at large!

113101004.content: They just told me these Mechas malfunctioned because of Visbane corruption.

113101005.content: We dealt with Mechas like this in Neuhansa. I know Visbane corruption when I see it!

113101007.content: Athena takes closer look at the disabled guards. She removes the outer shell of armor and peers inside.

113101008.content: I don't sense any Visbane aura.

113101010.content: Did you file your visit with security prior to entry? Maybe there's an issue with the threat identification process.

113101011.content: No way. Visbane-corrupted AGI Mechas are much more likely to—

113101012.content: I saw what happened to Spealght on the news. But we didn't order these Mechas from them.

113101013.content: In any case, we'll return these ones for a safety check and run a diagnostic on the others. I think that should be enough.

113101014.content: Are you sure that's how you want to handle this, Athena?

113101015.content: Yes, I am sure, Senator Hades.

113101016.content: Don't worry. We'll make sure nothing happens during the ceremony.

113101017.content: Then I'll leave the rest of it to you.

113101020.content: So sorry you had to go through that. The Knights of Convallaria will take it from here.

113101021.content: Athena motions for us to leave the temple.

113111001.content: The Society of Muses Library, last night.

113111002.content: Did you find it? Did you find it?

113111003.content: Not yet. There are too many books here. And their catergorization is like a riddle...

113111004.content: Night has fallen. Someone is muttering under their breath in the Society of Muses' Library.

113111005.content: No worries. They're completely distracted by recent events anyway. You have as much time as you need.

113111006.content: Yes! The jewelry collection is here... But it's too high up.

113111009.content: Have a look! And be quick about it! Does it contain what we want?

113111010.content: The most legendary precious stones in Omorfies' history... In no particular order: the Crimson Fireglass, the Sandjewel, the Oceaneye...

113111011.content: Leuce, Leuce, did you hear something?

113111013.content: I thought I heard voices in the Library. At this hour? Could it be mice?

113111015.content: You still haven't gotten over your fear of mice, have you? You really should clean more if don't want strange animals taking up residence.

113111016.content: But Leuce has done an excellent job of cleaning recently.

113111017.content: Don't worry about it. Mintha will have a look for Leuce.

113111020.content: The cursed greenstone, dissolver of alliances and ender of friendships. Given into Ardisis' care after the ceremony and used to decorate a statue... Formal name? Medusa.

113111021.content: It was a valuable keepsake in the early days when the alliance was first formed. It must be that one. But where is that statue?

113111023.content: (Let's get out of here! Someone's coming.)

113111025.content: One strike from Mintha's iron fist splits the desk like cardboard. Underneath is a very frightened little animal.

113111027.content: Mintha sighs. She takes the animal by the tail and brings it outside, annoyed.

113111028.content: I think Leuce can pay for that desk. After all, it's her fault she didn't clean better...

113111030.content: A terrified boy crouches under the other desk. He hugs himself as he tries to breathe normally.

113111031.content: (Don't worry. Just stay calm. She didn't find you.)

113111032.content: B-But what if she'd hit this table...?

113111033.content: She's very violent. How about this? I will deal with her next——

113111036.content: Ron curls up even smaller. His ear drums are blasted by a loud bang near his head. Wood chips fly everywhere. And he can clearly hear an iron fist punch a hole in the floor next to him.

113111037.content: Mintha is good! I caught, another mouse.

113122002.content: Leuce peers cautiously from around the door.

113122003.content: Not a mouse. A book thief.

113122005.content: Mintha's voice is cold as she grabs Ron and tightens her grip. He squeals in pain.

113122006.content: That's a relief! It's only the mice that bothers Leuce.

113122007.content: Actually there is one... Over there.

113122008.content: Leuce steps into the library and looks where Mintha is pointing—that is, next to her feet.

113122010.content: The sound is coming from an upside-down plank of wood. This concerns Leuce. Wood cannot talk.

113122012.content: Something is under the boards. A long tail appears as the creature scurries under the floorboards towards Leuce.

113122013.content: Get back! Get back! You get back... you thing!

113122014.content: Sorry. I didn't have time to take it outside. I just covered it.

113122015.content: It's alright, Leuce. Just don't ruin the mop.

113122017.content: Um... We found a mouse, Miss Oneiroi.

113122018.content: And we also caught a book thief.

113122019.content: Mice are scary. Mice used to bite Drowsie's ears before. It's okay. Everything's gonna be alright...

113122020.content: Oneiroi pats Leuce on the head.

113122021.content: Who's the book thief? It's... Ron?

113122022.content: Oneiroi crouches and looks at Ron with a puzzling look, as if to verify that the poor boy in Mintha's grip is indeed her classmate.

113122023.content: Yes, it's me, Oneiroi! Ouch! Tell her to let me go!

113122024.content: You can't be so harsh with Ron, Mintha. Ron is a friend of mine. Also, you just met him a few days ago.

113122025.content: Oh—yes, you're right. That explains why he looks so familiar.

113122026.content: Mintha releases Ron. The boy gets up with moans of pain.

113122027.content: But even if he is a friend of Miss Oneiroi’s, that doesn't explain why he's poking around the Library at this hour.

113122029.content: (Whispers) ...And that's all you need to say.

113122030.content: Because my big exam is tomorrow... And I'm so nervous I can't sleep! So I wanted Oneiroi to help me.

113122031.content: You can put anyone to sleep, right, Oneiroi? Just like that other day.

113122033.content: Why not just ring the front doorbell? And why go straight to the Library?

113122034.content: The front door wasn't locked so... I just came in. And then I wasn't sure where to go, so I ended up here! The society building is just massive! I don't know where anything is! I was walking around and I just... got lost.

113122035.content: It was Leuce's job to lock up and clean...

113122037.content: I suppose there may have been some oversights.

113122038.content: That's alright, Ron. You can sleep here tonight.

113122039.content: Oneiroi places Drowsie over Ron's head and, soon enough, his eyes start to flutter as he falls asleep.

113122040.content: I know you're a fantastic painter, Ron... And you didn't noticed it yourself...

113122042.content: You'll be able to paint just the way you want tomorrow, as long as you get some good sleep... And you'll definitely pass your exam...

113122043.content: I'll be able to paint what I want...

113122044.content: Drowsie, give Ron a seed of Dreams.

113122045.content: (Oneiroi... I'm so sorry. I don't think I have what it takes. But I have to pass this exam.)

113131001.content: The Knights of Convallaria are the living embodiment of our society's justice, order, honor, loyalty—and any other positive things you can think of. But the knights manifest another important quality, and that is the virtue of sacrifice.

113131002.content: Those who grip the sword too tight may find it difficult to reach for anything else. And sometimes, the sword may even hurt its own wielder.

113131003.content: You won! Ha! Of course you won!

113131004.content: Is this how you repay the family that took you in? By exposing your brother's mistakes? By besmirching the head of the great and noble Pallas family, your family, as a cheater?

113131005.content: Does that smell like victory to you? I haven't seen you defeated since you were a girl. Haven't you won enough?

113131006.content: At the end of the day, what exactly do you want to win after all?

113131008.content: What could a promise mean from someone in your position and at your age, anyway?

113131009.content: But... I'm so sorry. There was no other way.

113131010.content: What a shame, Athena! Now you have nothing! No family! No kin! No passions! No friends! Nothing!

113131011.content: I'll have to leave all that in your hands. I'm sorry.

113131013.content: Were you... having a nightmare, Commander? Apologies for the intrusion. But I saw your door was unlocked...

113131015.content: We received the results for the AGI Mecha we returned to the manufacturer. They say it's all clear. I have the report here, if you'd like to read it.

113131016.content: Just put it there. Thank you.

113131017.content: Yes. And Commander, I couldn't help noticing... you haven't taken a day off recently. We can probably put the thefts behind us now...

113131018.content: I was just having a bit of a shut-eye. Don't worry. It won't affect my work.

113131019.content: I don't mean that. I mean... Sorry for the intrusion, Commander.

113131021.content: The next day, Stellaris Academy Office.

113131023.content: The man bends down further to give his son a clear view of the bowtie around his neck.

113131024.content: I should put a stool in the office. It's hard with my height.

113131025.content: I don't want to be working late every night at the academy. But I can't rely on my dear colleague to do what needs to be done.

113131026.content: Hehe... Hasn't Lady Hades been helpful over the last two days?

113131027.content: Compared to ten years ago, I suppose she isn't causing as much trouble.

113131028.content: Everything is done now... If only I could grow a bit taller.

113131030.content: Father... Modifiers stop growing, don't they, after their awakening? You told me that.

113131033.content: No. Not really. We just finished.

113131034.content: How I envy you. I wish my children were as understanding as Enlil.

113131035.content: Please don't flatter me, Lady Hades. Lady Hera is a world-famous critic, and Mintha and Leuce are first-rate housekeepers—not to mention Oneiroi. She can be quite adorable at times.

113131036.content: Let's go, Hades. We can't be late to the opening ceremony.

113131037.content: Exactly why I'm here so early. How do you plan to get there? In Enlil's carriage?

113131038.content: I can sit for my driver's license next year!

113141002.content: Bronze mirror, silver coin, tulip bloom. The blind poet's treasure scattered around the room.

113141003.content: Ah, the blind poet's treasure... Hahaha! I'm surprised that the Aegis' final components are buried in this temple.

113141004.content: But it has to be that way, right? The final stage in every video game takes place in a grand, tightly guarded palace, doesn't it?

113141005.content: This isn't a game... Ladon, do you really think no one's going to notice us?

113141006.content: The academy will be crawling with people on the first day of the ceremony.

113141007.content: And that's exactly why no one will notice us here...

113141008.content: With everyone at the square, security here will be quite relaxed.

113141009.content: Unable to identify unregistered visitors! Please display your personal identification to avoid activating alarms...

113141010.content: See? Yesterday's plan seems to have worked! Almost all of the guards have been sent in for repairs. Hah!

113141011.content: Let's go. You're not going to have a problem with only a few guards, are you?

113141013.content: Black figures appear next to the young man.

113141015.content: Alright. It won't do any good if you get hurt over there. Just find somewhere to hide, please.

113141016.content: The academy square, opening ceremony of the Ardisis Ceremony.

113141017.content: Attention! Only 20 minutes to go! This is also the centennial of the ceremony's founding. We Knights of Convallaria are here to uphold our integrity and honor and ensure that nothing goes amiss.

113141018.content: Yes, sir! For the duty and honor of Convallaria!

113141019.content: The rows of knights give an enthusiastic response. Oddly, their supposed leader, the redhead standing to the side, is nowhere near as enthusiastic. In fact, it looks almost as if her attention is placed elsewhere.

113141020.content: Commander, are you going to inspect again?

113141021.content: I don't need to. I trust you will do a good job. Tell everyone to head to the designated patrol points.

113141022.content: Understood. We'll follow the previous arrangement. Jonas will be assigned to District A. Lohan to District B. I will take District C. And the Commander will oversee general security for the ceremony.

113141024.content: I'm sorry Kouros, but Nelly will be in charge of District C.

113141026.content: I need you to take charge of Academy Square for now. Is that alright?

113141027.content: Of course! But... why? The ceremony is about to begin!

113141028.content: There is something I need to investigate. Unlikely, but I must be sure.

113141029.content: Very well. I shall not inquire further.

113141030.content: I'll return before the opening ceremony ends. You'll be in charge of the area until then.

113151001.content: One of the books in the Archive Room spoke of how, a long time ago, Omorfies was divided into city-states. The leaders brought priceless artifacts from each city-state to form a greater alliance.

113151002.content: These artifacts were the Bronze Mirror Aegis, the first silver coin ever minted in Omorfies, the eternal tulip, and another legendary item—the lost gemstone of the gods.

113151003.content: But the alliance didn't last. It disintegrated, sparking a terrible conflict and causing people to think the gemstone cursed.

113151004.content: There was something about the gemstone that people couldn't resist. All who came to possess it were swallowed by misfortune. And yet none could bear to part with it.

113151005.content: The gemstone passed from hand to hand in this unhappy way for over a millennium. Eventually it landed in the lap of the great artist Ardisis.

113151006.content: Ardisis decided to create the world's greatest sculpture from it. In the last decades of his life, he shut himself in his study. He finished his masterpiece but died sad and alone, the last victim of the cursed gemstone.

113151007.content: Because of this curse, Ardisis wrote in his will that his masterpiece should never be shown to the public. Instead, it was to be kept under lock and key, hidden away forever in the Stellaris Temple...

113151008.content: Ta-da! Looks like the riddle of the gemstone-turned-statue has been solved by the brilliant, young detective Ladon!

113151009.content: And the statue I'm referring to is right in front of us—the statue of Medusa!

113151010.content: With a bittersweet smile, Ron takes a large bronze mirror out of his backpack. The mirror is carved with a number of round holes and floral engravings, all filled with the items stolen from the associations during the last few weeks.

113151011.content: We finally made it, Ladon, after all this time.

113151012.content: Ron gazes at the mirror in his hands. But the face that looks back is not his own. It is the face of a gray-haired young man with chains around his neck and wrists.

113151013.content: Yes, yes! We did it, Ron! I always knew you could do it. You're as good as anyone else! You are the best!

113151014.content: Thank you, Ladon. Before I met you, I could barely paint in my exams without my trembling hands getting in my way...

113151016.content: I would have never been able to pass the exam without you—without your advice! And I couldn't have overcome all these obstacles to come here and set you free!

113151018.content: There's just one last step! Remove the covering from the statue so that I can leave this mirror!

113151019.content: I don't have many friends, you know. I'm so shy. I can barely talk to my own classmates at the academy. I've never been able to talk to anyone like I talk to you...

113151020.content: Yep! I consider you the best friend I've ever met, too. Now remove the covering! So you can release your best friend!

113151021.content: Ladon, you have to visit me often after you leave. You too, Shady. I'll give a whole exhibition on you and our friendship, once I make it as an artist...

113151022.content: Cool! I'm really looking forward to that. Can you please remove the covering?

113151027.content: One more step, and I'll plunge this sword straight into your heart.

113151030.content: Who destroyed the guards outside? Why are you here? Who are you talking to?

113151031.content: I... I didn't do anything wrong, Miss Athena... Hear me out.

113151032.content: I told you! Don't move a muscle!

113151034.content: What have you got in your hands?

113151036.content: Come here. Give it to me.

113151038.content: Ron nods, taking a step in Athena's direction, knees trembling.

113151039.content: Don't give it to her! It has the silver coin and the tulip we stole! Have you forgotten? There's no way you could justify it!

113151040.content: Ron is equally terrified by Ladon's warning. He takes a step back, clutching the mirror more tightly to his chest.

113151042.content: I'm sorry... I'm sorry, Miss Athena! I can't give it to you. Please. Believe me. I haven't really done anything wrong! I was just helping a friend!

113151044.content: Athena doesn't waste words. She lowers her head and points the sword at Ron's neck. When she looks up, there is no hesitation in her eyes.

113151046.content: Ahhh! I'm so sorry, Miss Athena!

113161002.content: The square erupts into applause at the conclusion of the opening ceremony. Colorful streamers fly down like drops of rain. Screens replay the most outstanding moments of the performance for those who wish to see it again.

113161003.content: The host scurries to the center of the stage. From a distance, it looks as if he's climbing out of a rolling wave of applause. Most people would be overwhelmed by the experience, but only the best of the best can perform at an event like this. He quickly regains his composure as he makes the next announcement.

113161004.content: Thank you for your applause, ladies and gentlemen. Next we would like to call our sponsor to the stage. He is the president of the Society of Sculptures and the third Senator of the Astral Council. Please give a round of applause for Mr. Cadyllon.

113161007.content: Oceanus doesn't seem the least bit bothered by the size of the crowd. He glides gracefully to the podium.

113161008.content: Today's ceremony is held in honor and memory of Omorfies' greatest artist—Ardisis.

113161009.content: He is the one who, during one of the darkest periods of our history, guided us back to the light with his extraordinary talents.

113161010.content: The ceremony will be a proving ground for our contestants' talents, a gallery of arts that Ardisis himself would take pride in.

113161011.content: The Council hereby bestows its blessing upon the talented participants in our ceremony. Also, those of lesser talent should at this point consider their chances nil.

113161012.content: Why has Omorfies been the artistic capital of the world for over a century? Because of our strict institutions and principles that aspire toward ever-greater excellence.

113161013.content: Generations of the world's greatest artists have sat exams in this very square and refined their talents over decades in search of perfection.

113161014.content: And now, ladies and gentlemen, we are invited on the same journey taken by the luminaries before us. To witness the beginning of Omorfies' glory, and an ever grander future!

113161015.content: My wish is for all contestants to exhibit the same extraordinary skill for which you have been selected. I wish all of you a successful and fulfilling journey.

113161016.content: It is my honor to announce, on behalf of the Astral Council, that the 20th Ardisis Ceremony has officially opened!

113161017.content: The applause at Oceanus' last words is thunderous. He doesn't seem the least bit moved and silently leaves the stage.

113161018.content: In your own inimitable style, Master Oceanus.

113161020.content: By the way, do you know where Athena is? I haven't been able to find her anywhere.

113161021.content: On an important day like this? Shouldn't she be overseeing square security?

113161024.content: The Stellaris Temple at this very moment.

113161026.content: Athena's longsword has the young boy cornered. He's terrified and starts to cry.

113161027.content: Why do you have, in your hands, the very items stolen from the societies? Are you responsible?

113161028.content: It wasn't me... I was just helping a friend...

113161029.content: (She won't be convinced by that. She's going to kill you for sure.)

113161032.content: (Let me take control of your body. I know a way out of this!)

113161034.content: (I'm just asking you to hand your body over for a little while. Wholly and completely. Don't hold anything back. Trust me absolutely, and there's a way we can survive this!)

113161036.content: (Good. Keep the mirror close. Don't let it go—no matter what happens in the next few minutes.)

113161037.content: (This may get a little uncomfortable. But all you have to do is hold on. Whatever you do, don't let go of the mirror!)

113161041.content: Athena instinctively reaches out to comfort the boy, who at this point is a sorry mass of tears curled up in the corner, crying out of his pain. But as she reaches out, an incredible force swats her hand away like a fly.

113161042.content: Ah! Ladon! I'm in so much pain, Ladon! I think I'm going to...

113161043.content: A black mist pours out from behind Ron. Moments later, the mist has forms into a pair of very evil-looking wings.

113161045.content: The mist dissipates. Ron stands up and fiddles with his clothing. He seems a lot more confident. He flexes his muscles and kicks the air a few times, as if familiarizing himself with his body.

113161046.content: Ron... No! You're not Ron! Who are you?!

113161047.content: Well... If it isn't Commander Athena! Very pleased to make your acquaintance.

113161048.content: My name is Ladon. And Ron is indeed a friend of mine. I'm just an anonymous artist with just a little talent.

113161049.content: And what, you might ask, is my talent? The talent of telling convincing little lies... happy little lies...

113161050.content: Rather than painting, I declare the true domain of my talents to be... rhetoric!

113171001.content: Why did you steal those artifacts?

113171002.content: Steal? Nah, nah, nah, that's not true, I assure you! At most, I merely borrowed them. Because I have a mind to create a very beautiful artwork myself. "Steal" is too strong a word.

113171003.content: What's more, I didn't perform any of the heists. And didn't I have Ron reveal the Visbanes to you? I even sent you the perpetrator. I am speaking of Ron, of course.

113171004.content: But we will have enough time to discuss the details after I finish my masterpiece. And then I will return Ron to you alive and well. How does that sound?

113171005.content: Athena stares wide-eyed at the individual that Ron had just described as his friend. Ron, for his part, was so scared, yet he still said nothing about his "friend." But in the end, his "friend" has just made him the chief bargaining chip in this negotiation.

113171006.content: Despicable! Do you really expect me to negotiate with a monster like you?

113171007.content: Why not? After all, this isn't the first time we've worked together...

113171008.content: What in the blazes are you talking about?

113171009.content: I had Ron accuse those Visbanes merely to misdirect your attention to those underlings. To ensure no one suspected Ron. That was it.

113171010.content: It was such a silly little lie, just like claiming a glass ball to be a pearl. I didn't think there was a snowball's chance in hell you would buy it. But who would have thought? The lockdowns were lifted. It was a godsend, let me tell you.

113171011.content: But you never really believed the lie, did you, Athena? Of course not. You couldn't be that stupid. But you didn't want to make a fuss before the big ceremony, did you?

113171012.content: I knew the moment I had laid eyes on you that you were someone full of contradictions.

113171013.content: You were worried about the possibility that the Council would delay, or even cancel the ceremony! And so you were willing to grasp at straws if it ensured that the ceremony would open as planned!

113171014.content: And then lightning struck twice! We had the issue with the AGI Mechas. And yet again, I found a willing accomplice happy not to look behind the curtain.

113171015.content: What a pity that your instincts eventually won out. And that you're not as stupid as you seem. What a pity, Athena. You could convince others, but you could never quite convince yourself, could you? You just had to come back for a second check.

113171016.content: Stop talking like that! You don't know a thing!

113171017.content: Oh my... You look positively furious. Are you angry at me, Athena?

113171019.content: Athena lunges at the boy with her longsword. But try as she might, she missed.

113171020.content: That was a close one! You are good, Athena. I wouldn't be your match until my seal is released.

113171021.content: Nevertheless, you are quite out of sorts, aren't you, Athena? A confused mind leads to a clumsy sword. And now is my time to outwit you.

113171022.content: What exactly makes your sword clumsy, hum, Athena? It was something I said, right? Or it's that you just can't help but hold back from murdering my poor host, can you? Or...

113171023.content: Ladon eyes the exhibits surrounding him. His smile grows wider and more sinister.

113171024.content: Ah! I get it, now! Aha! Showtime!

113172003.content: No, no! What are you doing! These are...

113172004.content: Yes! I know. These are a century of Omorfies' greatest works, the winning artifacts of all previous Ardisis Ceremonies. Each one is an irreplaceable masterpiece.

113172005.content: Yes! And yet I still want to destroy them! I want to destroy everything that you want to protect!

113172007.content: Hey! Servants, try harder, will you? Destroy them all!

113172008.content: Right! How about a little heat in here?

113172009.content: No... No... I promised my grandmother we would protect this...

113172010.content: It's just terrible... are you going to beg?

113172012.content: Well, I'm not so hard-hearted. Beg, and I'll tell them to stop.

113172016.content: I... Please... Do not destroy any more of the temple... I... beg you...

113172017.content: Bow your head when you apologize to me.

113172021.content: The young man lifts his right hand in a fist, glowing with an eerie mix of black and red energy. He slaps Athena on the shoulder the moment she lifts her head.

113172025.content: What a shame, what with this seal and all. Otherwise... you'd be done for.

113172026.content: That reminds me, there was something I was supposed to do...

113172027.content: Ron, controlled by the mysterious entity, surveys the bronze mirror and then takes it to the statue at the end of the room.

113172028.content: Finally. I really am quite brilliant. Who else could have done this on Master Turing's behalf?

113172029.content: The boy snaps his fingers. The white cloth covering the statue falls to the ground as if blown by an invisible wind.

113172030.content: It is a statue of a demoness whose hair is made of snakes. The eyes are two cyan gemstones that glitter with an eerie light.

113172031.content: To Ardisis's credit, he made quite a masterpiece. Even here, it stands head and shoulders above the other artifacts.

113172032.content: Ron told me the ancient tales... anyone who locks eyes with Medusa is turned to stone. But not being human, I don't think I need to worry about that.

113172033.content: So how did the gods defeat Medusa, according to the legend?... They used a mirror to reflect her own gaze back on her. She herself was then turned to stone.

113172034.content: Ladon can't conceal the disturbing smile on his lips. He lifts the mirror to face the statue.

113172035.content: And here I am, doing the very same thing!

113172036.content: The moment Medusa's eyes are reflected by the mirror, the light reflected by the gems reflects in the mirror, becomes an even greater beam, and opens a bright red rift midair.

113172037.content: After all this, the mirror begins to crack.

113172038.content: The mirror shatters into a thousand pieces. A black mist comes out from what was the mirror and rushes into the boy's body.

113172040.content: He throws the mirror to the ground and smashes it with his foot.

113172041.content: The day has finally come! You can no longer imprison me, cursed mirror! Die! Die!

113172043.content: The boy furrows his brow and turns his gaze to the red rift hanging in the air.

113172044.content: Alright then. And now for the Sephirah Core... Pardon me for helping myself to it.

113181001.content: Wow, Admin! Look at that screen! What a picture!

113181002.content: That's a live replay from the Painters' Association. The association evaluates the best works produced in every five-year period and put the best ten forward for the ceremony to judge.

113181003.content: It's quite a few, but paintings do get admitted to the temple more often than other works. Competition is extremely fierce.

113181006.content: Lady Hades said that you must try to see the whole ceremony this year.

113181007.content: B-But... I didn't even sleep for a full twenty hours yesterday...

113181012.content: The Seed of Dreams is collapsing... is that real, Drowsie?

113181013.content: The little sheep on Oneiroi's knees waves its foreleg as if answering "yes."

113181014.content: Who did you plant a Seed of Dreams into? Lady Hades didn't say you could do that, did she?

113181015.content: Um... But Hades asked me to put one into Ron... And it's gone. It disappeared just now...

113181017.content: Oneiroi can enter others' dreams. The seed greatly amplifies this ability, allowing her to observe a person's dreamscape whenever she wants to—no matter the distance.

113181018.content: There's only a few ways a Seed of Dreams can be destroyed, when the person dies, when they're under Visbane attack, or... if a person enters the Source Layer.

113181020.content: Oneiroi, can you sense where Ron is right now?

113181021.content: I can sense where his Seed of Dreams was before it began to weaken... It was over there...

113181022.content: Oneiroi points to somewhere behind the spectators stand.

113191003.content: Athena's surroundings resemble a demolition site more than the hallowed temple. Virtually all strength has been drained from her body. Using her sword as a crutch, she can just barely keep herself off the floor.

113191004.content: Am I dreaming? Is this... the Temple?

113191008.content: That guy ruined all this... ruined the Temple...

113191011.content: Is this the same temple we just visited? What happened...?

113191012.content: I'm picking up a strong Bane Energy signal nearby. I think a lot of Visbanes just came through.

113191015.content: I'm sorry. I... This was all my fault...

113191017.content: Ver rushes to the end of the hall. She immediately notices the fragments of the bronze mirror.

113191018.content: The silver coin... The tulip... the stolen items!?

113191019.content: Look at all the data stored by the mirror! Hold on! Is that it? Does this object hold the coordinates of the Sephirah Core?

113191021.content: How's that even possible? Why would the coordinates be in a mirror? And judging from its state, someone has already used it!

113191022.content: Someone was manipulating Ron.... A Visbane called Ladon is the real mastermind behind the thefts and everything that's happened since...

113191023.content: Ladon? And where are they now?

113191024.content: I don't know... They were gone when I woke up.

113191025.content: The coordinates can open a doorway to the Sephirah Core's location on the Source Layer. If a Visbane really has the coordinates, then that's really, really bad news!

113191026.content: Miss Shu once told me that if something ever went wrong with the Sephirah Core, Gaea would no longer be able to observe and log data in the Sephirah Zone! Basically, and it would eventually... disintegrate.

113191027.content: I'll open a gateway to the Source Layer with my access permissions!

113191028.content: No way. The coordinates have already been used. You won't be able to find the Sephirah Core in the Source Layer unless you have them.

113191029.content: Well, we have to do something! We have to find it!

113191030.content: Um... Drowsie thinks there might be another way.

113191031.content: All eyes turn to the girl.

113191033.content: The Seed of Dreams in Ron's body has disintegrated, but it still left a trail that can show me what path he's taken. We might be able to follow that trail...

113191036.content: Oneiroi waves her hand. A purple portal appears.

113191041.content: Hera walks over to Athena and glares at her.

113191042.content: How long are you just going to sit there?

113191044.content: Did you hear any of that? If the Visbanes get their hands on the Sephirah Core, Omorfies is finished!

113191045.content: They've already destroyed everything I've ever wanted to protect...

113191047.content: It was my fault for stopping the investigation early. I just didn't want anything to delay the ceremony. That allowed him to get exactly what he wanted. And let him destroy the temple...

113191048.content: That's not what I'm asking. What I'm asking is... what are you going to do now?

113191049.content: The Knights of Convallaria exist to protect Omorfies' society and artwork. The ceremony represents the beginning of a new order. The Stellaris Temple is the result of centuries of glorious, peaceful artistic development...

113191050.content: And yet here we are. The temple was destroyed under my watch during the very ceremony we swore to protect.

113191052.content: Feeling sorry for yourself won't change a thing! Is this how you react to adversity? By crawling into a corner and feeling sorry for yourself? You seem so confident in front of your knights! So disappointing.

113191054.content: And who cares about the Temple anyway? You already gave up your cello for a career in the knights! Are you going to abandon this as well for just a few dead artifacts!

113191055.content: This is ridiculous. Okay then. Stay here and die with your precious artwork.

113191057.content: Are we really just going to leave her?

113191058.content: If this is her attitude, she'd just get in the way anyway. Who cares.

113191060.content: Don't you want to call another family member, grandmother?

113191061.content: That's alright. I've already said everything I wanted to say.

113191062.content: I want to use my last remaining hours to talk to you alone...

113191063.content: We can talk once you recover...

113191066.content: How strange to hear that from you, Athena. You were always such an honest little girl.

113191067.content: Can't you see that I don't have much time?

113191069.content: Sometimes I wonder whether I was too harsh on you...

113191070.content: The ceremony and the Astral Council have cleared the air in Omorfies. The Knights of Convallaria have become a sword and shield protecting this illustrious land.

113191071.content: People speak of the old days like myths—when we used to fight over everything. But they are not myths to me. They are memories. It is with eternal sadness that I recall how many flag bearers lost their lives on the battlefield.

113191072.content: Those are the old days now. It's been over a century. Hardly anyone left... And I'm beginning to worry whether I can live up to what was expected of me.

113191073.content: That won't happen. Omorfies has the Knights of Convallaria. It has me. I will do everything I can to protect the new era given to us by our predecessors.

113191074.content: You really do remind me of myself when I was your age...

113191075.content: I had dreams of raising you exactly how I was raised. I hoped you'd become like a second me. So that when I was gone, you would have command of the Knights of Convallaria.

113191076.content: But times are always changing. And I don't know whether... whether Omorfies will always need somebody like Colleen Pallas to guide us onto the right path.

113191077.content: If only he was still here with us. I'm sure he could tell us what to do... I'm sure he could provide another way... (Cough)

113191079.content: I've taken such care in these last years to teach you all I know about fighting. About the mission of the Knights of Convallaria. That's the only thing in this world that I really understand.

113191080.content: And so it's no surprise that people used to think I had no sense of humor. They would say I take everything on myself. Before I go... I'd like to leave you with a few choice words—just like he did.

113191081.content: I charge you to lead the Knights of Convallaria with strength and honor. Protect the Astral Council and the ceremony. This is what our predecessors left Omorfies: a shining foundation of glorious stability...

113191082.content: But if one day, this all disappears... That will not be the end.

113191083.content: Where did the Knights of Convallaria come from, originally? From nothing—we had nothing. A place of destitution, surrounded by enemies on all sides.

113191084.content: It may be difficult, but I believe that Omorfies will always vanquish the darkness, whatever form it takes. Because the people are honest and lead with an honest heart.

113191085.content: So long as the desire of freedom and honesty remain, it does not matter how bad things get during an age of darkness. Sooner or later, a voice always calls everyone back to the light...

113191086.content: Athena, when that time comes, it will be enough for the Knights of Convallaria to tell right from wrong and to raise their swords for freedom and justice.

113191088.content: Thank you, Athena. And... I'm sorry...

113191091.content: It's not over... As long as there are people ready to defend the ideals of freedom and creativity, then the Knights of Convallaria still have reason to fight.

113191092.content: Hera stops. She looks back at Athena, who slowly rises from the ground.

113191093.content: So, you've finally come to your senses?

113191094.content: Yes. Thank you for the reminder...

113191095.content: Oh, come off it. Couldn't miss a chance to give you a dressing-down. And I took it.

113191097.content: I'm sure we can get the Sephirah Core back with Commander Athena's help! Let's go, Admin!

113191099.content: Drowsie will lead us—following the crumbs left by the Seed of Dreams! Don't get lost!

114011001.content: All that can be seen are chaos and despair. All that can be heard are silence and emptiness. What floats is a disintegrating phantom. What sinks is a shattered cage.

114011002.content: The Omorfies Source Layer looks like what would happen if the entire Sephirah Zone were chopped up and mashed back together again. The streets, the buildings, everything has the eerie quality of distorted beauty.

114011003.content: A boy slowly descends from the sky, waving his arms like a orchestra conductor reveling in his play.

114011005.content: None but I was good enough to find this place...

114011007.content: The boy's train of thought is interrupted by a sudden burst of pain from his subconscious.

114011008.content: Ugh... What's wrong with this body?!

114011010.content: Bane Energy erupts from Ron's back in a black mist, and condenses into the form of another boy. Ron's face pales as the black mist pulls away, and he drops to the group like an empty husk.

114011011.content: Phew! I'm so glad the Aegis mirror is broken, otherwise I'd have been stuck in this weak body.

114011012.content: Ladon kicks Ron angrily, as if in revenge for the pain he just endured, then narrows his eyes and surveys his surroundings.

114011013.content: This isn't the Hall of the Heart... Was there a problem with the components? Oh, I didn't check the condition of the statue...

114011014.content: AAAAAAAAH—! Why is everything working against me?!

114011015.content: Ladon begins pacing frantically, tearing at his hair in frustration. But all of a sudden he comes to a halt, and a smile spreads across his face.

114011016.content: Aha! I feet it! The Hall of the Heart is near...

114011017.content: There are always twists and turns on the path to perfection, but everything always turns out well in the end.

114011019.content: Oh I'm sorry, did those kicks wake you up?

114011020.content: In a daze, Ron sits up and rubs his forehead. Although still quite out of it, he vaguely recognizes the familiar face... and body?

114011021.content: Ladon? Y-you got out of the mirror?

114011022.content: That's right! Thank you for your trust in me. You kept your promise to get me out of there!

114011023.content: Awesome! And then we... Er, wait a second. Where are we? I had no idea there was such a place in the Stellaris Academy before...

114011024.content: Ron looks around blankly. His surroundings are so bizarre he just can't comprehend what's happening, except that it's much colder here than it was at the academy.

114011025.content: I have to hide somewhere very far away if I don't want Commander Athena to find me. You should stay here for now if you don't know the way. Don't worry, I'll come back for you.

114011026.content: Miss Athena? That's right, she was chasing us... She must be really mad at us now.

114011027.content: No need to worry! We're free now. Well, I still have some business to take care of, so let's split up here.

114011028.content: Are you going to find that girl? I remember you saying that'd be the first thing you'd do if you were free.

114011029.content: Oh, you remembered that. Yes, yes! I really must find her, so I'll leave you here for now! See ya!

114011030.content: In a hurry, Ladon turns to leave, but Ron, hesitant, steps forward and grabs his sleeve.

114011031.content: Wait, Ladon... Shouldn't we go find Miss Athena and explain everything to her?

114011032.content: I mean, all of that stuff we took from the societies, all the hassle we've caused the knights—if we don't explain ourselves, we'll...

114011035.content: Ron's halting sentence is interrupted by Ladon, whose voice is now strangely devoid of any emotion. Ron looks up into his friend's cold, hard eyes and loosens his grip in shock and fright.

114011037.content: W-what do you mean? Ladon? I thought we...

114011038.content: Psh, you really are naive, aren't you?

114011040.content: The air is suddenly charged by Ladon's cruel hostility. Although he and Ron are the same height, Ron feels as though he's an ant being looked down upon by a giant beast.

114011042.content: Ron's limbs turn to lead and his mind goes blank. However, as soon as Ladon begins lifting his hand, fear finally overrides his confusion and shock, and sends Ron running for his life in the opposite direction.

114011043.content: (Why? WHY? Why would Ladon start talking to me like that all of a sudden?)

114011044.content: (Did I say something wrong? Or did I accidentally do something to make him mad?)

114011045.content: The freezing cold air of the Source Layer quickly saps Ron's energy, but he carries on even though his feet feel so heavy he has to drag them. It feels like he only has to look back to once again see the dull, murderous intent in Ladon's eyes.

114011046.content: (What is this place? Could Ladon really have been lying to me all this time?)

114011047.content: How... HOW did things turn out like this?!

114021001.content: Once in the Source Layer, we walk behind Drowsie as it follows the trail of the fragments of the dreamscape seed.

114021002.content: Despite having the Divine Power of the Modifiers to protect me, the Source Layer still feels stifling.

114021004.content: I'm fine, Ver. Don't worry about me.

114021005.content: I thought we'd track down Ron in no time at all, but the Omorfies Source Layer is much vaster than I'd imagined. We'd been running for over ten minutes, and were still seeing the same scenery crop up again and again.

114021006.content: We've been heading in this same direction the whole time. Has Ron just not moved at all? I wonder if he's alright...

114021007.content: Only humans can access the Hall of the Heart where the Sephirah Core is located. As long as that Visbane hasn't found it yet, Ron is safe.

114021009.content: Gaea is the last refuge of humanity, after all. Access to such information is strictly guarded. Not just anybody is made privy to it.

114021010.content: Athena, do you know why Ron would help a Visbane do something like this?

114021011.content: No... Actually, the Knights of Convallaria carried out background checks on him when they received his report.

114021012.content: He's just a normal Stellaris Academy student with a normal family background. He's never been in trouble before in his life. I don't know why he's starting now.

114021013.content: Um, a commoner... If that's the case, I guess he is doing these for the certification exam.

114021015.content: Thinking back to Ron's dream in which he spent sleepless nights practicing his drawing, it seems perfectly plausible that he is very stressed about his exam.

114021016.content: If he fails the exam, it means he'll lose the chance to spend his life doing what he loves. People will do anything to make their dreams come true.

114021017.content: He also doesn't strike me as being particularly bright. He was probably swayed by Ladon.

114021018.content: We can simply ask Ron about his reasons after we find him. Right now I'm more concerned about Ladon's plan. He has gone to great lengths to get his hands on the Sephirah Core—why?

114021019.content: If the Sephirah Core is lost, the Surface Layer will gradually crumble. Maybe Ladon is just like every other Visbane and simply wants to see the world burn?

114021020.content: For years we have known that the Visbanes are driven solely by their desire to destroy. Stealing the Sephirah Cores would be the most efficient way to obliterate all life on the Surface Layer.

114021021.content: Not only that, but the Sephirah Cores serve as Gaea's "eyes" and record almost everything there is to know about the Sephirah Zones. This information is also an enormous power, and we can't rule out the possibility that somebody wants it.

114021025.content: I should have known it'd be impossible to be in the Source Layer this long without attracting the Visbanes' attention.

114021026.content: Oneiroi bounds out of Hera's embrace and takes Drowsie up in her arms.

114021027.content: If there are enemies... Drowsie will help too.

114022002.content: The great sword slashes ceaselessly, forcing the Visbanes into an ever-smaller area.

114022005.content: Hera raises her scepter and the inlaid gemstones burst forth a radiant crimson light, which ignites a violent firestorm that consumes the remaining Visbanes.

114022006.content: However, the storm is too fierce, and the flames explode out toward the edge of the battlefield where Athena is standing.

114022009.content: Athena is forced to back away, swiping furiously with her sword to keep the flames at bay. Hera quickly withdraws her Access Key to stop the fire from spreading.

114022010.content: Miss Athena, are you all right?

114022012.content: Athena turns around, and everyone including Oneiroi stares in shock.

114022013.content: Flames continue to swirl around Athena's blade, even without Hera's Divine Power. It's as though they are resonating with Athena's power, and show no sign of extinguishing.

114022014.content: It's so beautiful... Ow! But hot...

114022015.content: Please take a few steps back.

114022016.content: Once we're a suitable distance away, Athena holds her sword aloft and brings it down heavily in a direction facing away from us.

114022019.content: The hit's power is way beyond my expectation. The thin blade unleashes a fiery tornado straight ahead, so hot it melts the ground in its wake.

114022021.content: I didn't know you had the ability to control fire.

114022022.content: It's not... control, exactly. But when your fire is on my sword, I can feel what will happen when I swing the blade, and the energy is several times stronger. I've... never experienced anything like that before.

114022023.content: (Admin, I know Hera and Athena don't exactly see eye to eye, but it would appear that their combat skills are a good match together...)

114022025.content: But this energy isn't stable enough. I wouldn't say it's...

114022026.content: Oneiroi, could you please have Drowsie lead the way?

114031001.content: All the changes taking place in the Source Layer are making our heads spin, and we have no choice but to follow Drowsie closely.

114031002.content: We keep going like this for so long that we barely even notice when Drowsie suddenly stops and turns around.

114031003.content: What's going on, Oneiroi? Is the path ahead blocked?

114031004.content: It's not this way... Ron's moving...

114031005.content: Moving... Does that mean Ron's alive? That's great news!

114031006.content: Or it could mean that Ladon is on the move.

114031007.content: He can't have succeeded already, right?

114031008.content: No. Although there's no precedent, the Sephirah Core is responsible for maintaining the stability of the Sephirah Zone. If something were to happen to it, we'd know about it instantly.

114031009.content: As we pondered what would happen, Oneiroi suddenly raises her head as though she senses something.

114031010.content: The memories from the seed are changing, and whatever is blocking Ron's memory is... disappearing...

114031012.content: When we first entered Ron's dream, Drowsie saw that some of Ron's memories were hidden. But now the veil is lifting...

114031013.content: Ron's memories are coming back... And they are passing back to me...

114031014.content: Does that mean Ladon has separated himself from Ron?

114031015.content: Yes... And Ron is not far from here...

114031016.content: Why would Ladon abandon Ron's body now?

114031017.content: Maybe he couldn't maintain his control over Ron. Or maybe he was injured... Who knows.

114031018.content: But now that he's kindly done us the "favor" of leaving that poor boy, it is our opportunity to save Ron.

114031019.content: Visbanes are everywhere. We must find Ron before they do, or he'll get hurt!

114031020.content: I feel Oneiroi tugging at my clothes.

114031021.content: I saw... some of Ron's memories...

114031022.content: What did you see, Oneiroi? Can you tell us on the way?

114031023.content: Drowsie can just show it to you...

114031024.content: Clusters of purple bubbles float in the air as we walk. I see a memory from Ron's life playing out in each of them.

114041001.content: The Stellaris Academy library, a few weeks ago.

114041002.content: This is my last shot at the exam. You can do this, you can do this, you can do this...

114041003.content: I've passed every single mock exam, so there's no reason I won't pass the final!

114041004.content: But what if I fail? If I fail...

114041007.content: A bronze mirror falls off the shelf behind Ron and hits him in the head.

114041008.content: Hey hey hey hey hey! You must have a lot of questions now, right? I bet your head is just full of question marks.

114041009.content: Why would a mirror just suddenly fall from the sky? Why is there a handsome boy trapped inside the mirror? And why is he talking to me?

114041010.content: It's okay, don't worry, I'll answer all of your questions right—

114041011.content: Uh... What the... Oh, did that knock you out?

114041016.content: Don't throw me around, it makes me dizzy! Hey, wait! Where are you going?

114041017.content: Why won't the door open? Security! Security! Open up! There's a monster in here! Professor, mom, dad, someone come and save me!

114041018.content: Monster? How rude! Hey, look at me—do I look like a monster to you?!

114041019.content: Calming down slightly, Ron follows the sound of the voice and looks at the mirror on the ground.

114041020.content: Come over here. Don't worry, I don't bite.

114041022.content: My name's Ladon! You know, before I was trapped in this mirror, I was a respectable artist.

114041024.content: Realizing he can't leave, and after checking the boy in the mirror really can't hurt him, Ron gingerly approaches the mirror.

114041025.content: So someone trapped you in this mirror? You're not a monster?

114041026.content: Of course not! Sigh... It happened so long ago now, and I was never one for the spotlight, so it's no surprise you've never heard of me.

114041027.content: Ah... but maybe you have heard of one of my apprentices! He was called Ardisis.

114041028.content: Ardisis? As in, THE Ardisis who founded the Astral Council? He was your student?!

114041029.content: Hehe, I wouldn't go that far... I just taught him a thing or two when I was in good mood.

114041030.content: But that ungrateful jerk was worried I'd steal the limelight from him. He broke his promise and kept me trapped here!

114041031.content: You mean you're the reason Ardisis was so successful?

114041032.content: You've heard the tale of the magic lamp, right? Well, today's your lucky day! If you agree to help me get out of here, I will grant you any wish you desire!

114041033.content: What would you like? Riches? To become as famous as Ardisis? I can make any of these come true just like that.

114041034.content: I-I would like to pass the Painters' Association exam... Whenever I step into the exam hall, my mind goes blank and I just can't manage to draw anything.

114041036.content: It's already my sixth time retaking it. If I fail this time, I won't be able to get my artist qualification.

114041037.content: And if you're an artist in Omorfies but without a certification, you can't get the creator's stipend. And no one will take your work seriously! In other words, my life will be over!

114041038.content: Okay, okay, I get it. Can you please stop shaking the mirror? You're making me dizzy!

114041039.content: Phew... When Ardisis first met me, he was in an even worse place than you. And look where I got him! I promise I can do the same for you.

114041042.content: (Yeah right. Just wait until you set me free...)

114051001.content: A Stellaris Academy classroom, just before the start of an exam.

114051002.content: What am I gonna do? The mock exam is about to start, and everyone looks so serious! I-it's almost like the real thing!

114051003.content: Ahhh, really? Didn't you say you only got nervous during the real exams?

114051004.content: Yeah! But... But this is the final mock exam! If I don't do well in this, then it means I'm also gonna flunk the real exam...

114051005.content: ...If you were ever sent to war, you'd scare yourself to death before the fighting even started.

114051006.content: Just clear your mind, and take out your brushes and paint.

114051007.content: Okay... Brushes, paint, palette... Oh no, I dropped them.

114051011.content: Don't be nervous, Ron. You can do it... You're an amazing painter.

114051013.content: Okay, now concentrate. Look, they're writing the exam topic on the blackboard.

114051014.content: Portrait, Knights of Convallaria... Hey, this isn't too bad, right? Is that what you were practicing in the library a few days back? We're lucky!

114051015.content: What do the Knights of Convallaria wear? And how... how do they stand? I-I can't remember...

114051016.content: (Oh my... This kid has forgotten everything?!)

114051017.content: There's no time... That's right, just draw the outline first, and the details can be filled in later... No! I've used the wrong paints!

114051019.content: Can I have a new sheet of paper please? I need more paper!

114051020.content: All right, stop fussing! Calm your nerves!

114051021.content: B-but I've already wasted so much time! What am I going to do?! Kill me now...

114051022.content: Listen! Now close your eyes. Go on, trust me. Now take a deep breath in, and imagine you're standing in Omorfies as it was one hundred years ago...

114051024.content: A hundred years ago, all order in this land was lost, and greed caused the people to forsake their ideals.

114051025.content: Lies were told for the sake of fame and fortune, and people set strangers up all in the name of self-interest...

114051026.content: During this troubled time, a visionary full of dreams of justice appeared. He hoped to restore order to the land and free creative work from the darkness of chaos.

114051027.content: However, the appearance of the visionary threatened the interests of some, who in their indignation harangued him and insulted him. They even brandished weapons to oust him from his pedestal...

114051028.content: It was at this time that a young girl with a head of fiery red hair came to his aid, her sword held fiercely before her.

114051029.content: "If you are afraid to listen to him, it means his words prick at your conscience; if you dare not look at his works, it means that you have lost the ability to see beauty."

114051030.content: "I don't care who you are. Whoever wants to shut him up with a blade will first have to contend with my sword!"

114051031.content: The girl's words stunned the angry critics, and since then, she has been the visionary's faithful follower and defender.

114051032.content: As the years passed, she acquired a number of scars, and she was never seen without her sturdy suit of armor...

114051033.content: She never married, and nor has she expressed any desire for power. All along, she kept the promise she made when she was a girl.

114051034.content: She was the first Commander of the Knights of Convallaria—Colleen Pallas...

114051035.content: Wha... 99 points! I came top of the class! I never dreamed of it!

114051036.content: My teachers said I'm sure to pass the exam this year... Even the one who hates me most!

114051037.content: Didn't I tell you I could make your wishes come true?

114051038.content: Thank you, Ladon. You've been such a good friend...

114051039.content: (Seriously? This kid just cries at anything...)

114051040.content: Except... During the exam, you projected the picture I should draw into my mind. That's not right, is it?

114051041.content: What's wrong with that? You still painted it yourself, didn't you?

114051042.content: No, that's not what I meant. Besides, it's not like you could have done it for me...

114051043.content: I was just thinking, that was just me copying your design down on paper. It's not really my own work...

114051044.content: So? It's not like the examiners are going to find out.

114051045.content: It just... feels like cheating to me.

114051046.content: (Urgh, this kid is so annoying! Why's he gotta overthink everything?)

114051047.content: It's not cheating, Ron. Think about it. Didn't all of the great artists create their masterpieces based on a dream they had, or a hallucination after drinking? How can reproducing what you see in your mind's eye be called plagiarism or cheating?

114051049.content: And we both know that you would have passed the exam ages ago were it not for your nerves. I only helped you to achieve what was already rightfully yours.

114051050.content: Don't worry about it... As long as you do as I say, everything will work out for the best.

114061002.content: Hey, Ron, I'm so bored... Don't you have any other wishes I could make come true? Do you have any idea how people would kill each other to have a wishing mirror like myself?

114061004.content: Do you want to be the most famous person on the planet? Richer than a king? Get the girl of your dreams? Just tell me and I can make it happen.

114061006.content: Come onnnnnn. Ron, Ron, Ron, Ron...

114061007.content: Just hold on for a minute can you, Ladon? I'm trying to concentrate here.

114061008.content: (Uhh... Why did HE have to be the one who found me? If this keeps up, there's no way he's going to help me complete the coordinates...)

114061009.content: Got it! Ladon, come have a look at this.

114061010.content: I'm not in the mood to read. Why don't you just tell me what wish I can grant for you instead?

114061011.content: No, I've found a way we might be able to get you out of this mirror!

114061013.content: Look what it says here: "Bronze mirror, silver coin, tulip bloom, the blind poet's treasure scattered around the room."

114061014.content: When the old cities formed an alliance many, many years ago, these are the tokens each lord brought to show their devotion. Don't you think they match those two slots in your frame exactly?

114061015.content: You're right. Look, there's one round one and one shaped like a tulip...

114061016.content: Is that why you've done nothing but read these past few days? But I haven't even granted you a wish yet.

114061017.content: You helped me pass the mock exam, didn't you?

114061018.content: I mean... Is that all you wanted?

114061019.content: Yeah! You helped me get over my nerves. And we're friends, aren't we? So now it's my turn to help you out.

114061021.content: I mean, there's not much to go on at the moment. We need to know exactly what these tokens are... This poem is over a thousand years old, but the bronze mirror it mentions must be the one you're trapped in.

114061022.content: A mirror from the City of Crafters, a coin from the City of Traders, a petal from the City of Perfumes... It's just a hunch, but I reckon that if we can gather together all the items mentioned in the poem, we might be able to get you out of there.

114061023.content: I think you're right! They must be what I need to complete the coordinates!

114061025.content: Ahem, nothing. You're even smarter than I thought, kiddo! Hahaha, I knew I was right about you!

114061026.content: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go find that gold coin and the... the pulit thing!

114061027.content: Right. Since these are historical artifacts, their whereabouts should be in this book...

114061028.content: The Silver Coin of the Alliance... Tulip Petal... hidden in... the association libraries of...

114061029.content: It says that these two items became private collections of two different associations forty years ago, and were never traded since. But it doesn't say which two associations they were.

114061030.content: How many associations are there in the city?

114061031.content: In total? I'd say dozens. But those that are rich enough to buy antiques like these? I reckon no more than seven.

114061032.content: Well that narrows it down! Let the search begin!

114061033.content: Um... The problem is... that you can't just drop by and visit an association for no reason, let alone view its private collection.

114061034.content: What if we don't visit? What if we snuck in and... borrowed the items?
