114061035.content: That sounds bad... Besides, how would someone like me get into such well-guarded places?

114061036.content: Don't worry about that. I used to be a great artist, remember? Things might not be going so well for me at the moment, but I can still pull a few strings.

114061037.content: Look, lightly tap the floor three times with the bottom edge of the mirror frame.

114061038.content: Is this some kind of weird ritual?

114061039.content: Don't be silly! This is just how I communicate with my friends. Once you're done, point the mirror toward where you just knocked and I'll call for them.

114061041.content: Excellent. Now... Slumbering spirit, heed the call of your eternal friend and come to me!

114061042.content: (Hurry up and get out here, you filthy insect!)

114061044.content: There is a flash of red light, and a black creature covered in spots of light suddenly appears out of thin air.

114061048.content: The creature, which was about to raise its spear and attack Ron, curls up into a frightened ball at the sound of Ladon's voice.

114061049.content: Ahem... There's nothing to be scared of, Ron. My friend here was just very happy to see you! It's one of the ancient elves that has lived in Omorfies since time immemorial. They rarely appear before humans these days.

114061050.content: An elf? It doesn't look much like an elf...

114061051.content: Oh? Have you ever seen a real elf?

114061053.content: Exactly! You see, there are many different types of elves. This one here may look a little bit fiercer than the others, but trust me—it's completely harmless. Its name is Shady.

114061055.content: Relax. When have I ever lied to you? Come here and break the ice. Shake hands!

114061058.content: Yes, that's right. Let's be good friends and get along well together!

114062001.content: Ron has no idea how far he's run in this ever-changing landscape, but his strength finally fails him and he slumps to the ground.

114062003.content: Everything he said to me, everything he taught me, even calling me his friend... were those all lies?

114062004.content: Ron wipes away his tears, but more spring up in their place, until his eyes are swollen and his sleeves are soaked. Eventually, he manages to get his emotions back under control.

114062005.content: Pull yourself together, Ron. You only met Ladon a few weeks ago. Way too short for a real friendship...

114062006.content: He sighs, and feels himself coming to terms with his situation. Looking around, he doesn't recognize where he is, and there's no trace of Ladon behind him.

114062007.content: I'm alone again. But where am I?

114062008.content: The only thing he's certain of is that he's somewhere that wasn't on any map of Omorfies.

114062009.content: First of all, I should go apologize to Miss Athena and explain everything that's happened.

114062010.content: Armed with a plan, Ron musters the energy to stand back up, but as he does so he hears a strange movement nearby.

114071001.content: Huh? So Ron actually believed that? He really bought it that the Visbane is an elf?

114071002.content: I'm not surprised. After all, he even believed that Ardisis was Ladon's student.

114071004.content: Hmm... Athena—Do you recognize the mirror that Ladon was in?

114071005.content: I do... But it wasn't valuable or anything, just an old relic gathering dust in the library.

114071006.content: If Ladon has been hiding in there all along, then I fear he's been lurking in Omorfies for a very long time indeed.

114071007.content: I don't think he's been lurking—I'd say he was trapped in that mirror. I think the only reason he stayed in it was that he had yet to come across someone as "pure" as Ron.

114071008.content: Without a body, he's got no choice but to take advantage of the kindness of others. Even with intelligence, Visbanes still use underhanded methods.

114071009.content: At first, I thought Ron had just made a deal with Ladon to pass his exams, but it seems he really did count Ladon as a friend.

114071010.content: Admin, you're not looking too good. Are you okay?

114071011.content: I'm fine, I'm just worried... Even during his imprisonment, Ladon was still targeting the Sephirah Core. He's most likely been working on this scheme even before he was imprisoned.

114071012.content: It might have been a coincidence that he met Ron, but if he hadn't, surely he'd also have had a backup plan.

114071013.content: As we discuss everything we've learned from Ron's memories, Drowsie comes to a sudden halt, then turns and jumps back into Oneiroi's arms. She hugs the toy tightly, tears forming in her eyes.

114071015.content: There aren't any more fragments... We'll never find Ron now...

114071017.content: When the Seed of Dreams shattered, the fragments were continuously shed from Ron's consciousness. But there must be none left now.

114071018.content: Oneiroi, can you sense the last direction Ron was in?

114071020.content: Then let's go that way. It's not like we have any other option.

114071021.content: I'll lead. But keep your eyes peeled for any enemy movement.

114071022.content: The Source Layer scenery is constantly changing. Staying in the same place will just make the search even more difficult.

114071023.content: We begin walking in the direction that Oneiroi indicated. After a while, we hear the faint sounds of someone crying. The cries grow louder as we approach.

114081001.content: Now that Shady's taken care of the guardians, we can search the area in peace.

114081003.content: Oh of course! Shady is a kind and gentle elf. It'd never hurt a fly. They're just sleeping.

114081005.content: Ladon, I just realized I never asked you before—how did you wind up trapped in that mirror anyway?

114081006.content: Oh... Well... I guess I never told you.

114081007.content: If you used to be Ardisis' teacher, that'd make you well over a hundred years old, but you still look so young. Are you an ancient Omorfies elf like Shady?

114081008.content: (Come on Ladon, think of a good lie...)

114081009.content: Okay. I'll tell you my story while you search.

114081011.content: A long, long time ago — so long ago that even he cannot remember how long it has been — a boy woke up and found himself in a garden full of golden apples.

114081012.content: Woke up? How did the boy fall asleep in the first place?

114081013.content: What you should be asking is, how was the boy born in the first place?

114081014.content: Even the boy himself didn't know the answer to that question. And there were lots of people like this boy, who didn't know where they came from. It was as though everyone was living in a dream that they couldn't remember the start of.

114081015.content: What set this boy apart from the rest was that he retained his curiosity. Everyone else had been dreaming for so long that they'd lost the ability to think.

114081016.content: He looked at the apples hanging all over the garden, wondering who had planted these trees. He looked at the rows of fences around him, wondering who had trapped him there.

114081017.content: One day, he looked up at the profoundly blue sky. And there, within the clouds, he discovered a whole other world.

114081018.content: A wide open world, a world where people laughed and cried. A world where they experienced joy and sorrow... For the very first time, he realized that he had other options than just thinking about those two unanswerable questions.

114081019.content: What a pleasure it was, to just sit there and watch the scenes of life unfold on the other side...

114081020.content: Soon enough, however, the boy discovered something else.

114081021.content: Over there, people's lives were ordinary and repetitive. Their world was clearly so much larger... so why did it seem like nothing more than a narrow cage?

114081022.content: The boy grew tired. He realized that they were concerned with only one question, even one less than he. They were afraid of anything new, moving around each other in small and pitiful circles...

114081023.content: Half the time, they would close their eyes and just lie there, doing nothing!

114081024.content: You're talking about sleeping, right? Now that you mention it, I've actually never seen you sleeping...

114081025.content: "So boring," he muttered to himself. "So terribly boring."

114081026.content: And so the boy unfurled his wings...

114081028.content: Don't interrupt! So, the boy unfurled his wings and let out a terrifying roar.

114081029.content: He soared into the air, flying through the heavy clouds and rushing towards the great vortex. Although he felt his skin burn and his bones being crushed, he was determined to get to the other side.

114081030.content: This was how the stuffy world welcomed a ray of light. The boy traveled around, telling ordinary people what the true meaning of life was.

114081032.content: He gained a group of loyal believers, leaving scriptures that were handed down from generation to generation.

114081033.content: He transformed the world and set it on the right path. People sought to become a better version of themselves. They broke free of their chains, and interesting and wonderful stories happened everywhere, and all the time...

114081034.content: It was also on this journey that the boy met a girl who thought the same way as him.

114081035.content: The girl had long, beautiful silver hair that was tied into a lovely ponytail.

114081036.content: Like the boy, she had no need to close her eyes half the time. Her eyes were big and bright, and like the boy's, they sparkled with curiosity about the future.

114081037.content: The like-minded companions traveled together and never had a reason to quarrel. And indeed, they experienced one happy thing after another, sharing their laughter along the way.

114081038.content: The girl said to the boy,

114081039.content: "You are the most interesting being I've ever met. I want you to always be by my side, now and forever."

114081040.content: The boy readily agreed. He had no regrets at all about not going back to that golden garden, and he forgot about the scars and marks that were left on his body by his arduous crossing.

114081041.content: As long as the girl needed him, he was happy to stay with her.

114081042.content: However, the girl's words were nothing but lies.

114081043.content: She took advantage of the boy's unquestioning attitude, and dripped a golden, magic liquid into his eyes.

114081044.content: The boy, who had not closed his eyes since he woke up in the garden, fell unconscious, and only came to several years later...

114081045.content: He had been trapped inside a mirror, and the girl was nowhere to be seen.

114081046.content: In the meantime, the disappearance of the boy who brought the truth caused the world to relapse to its former state. The people were led astray once more.

114081047.content: Why did the girl do that? Why did she betray you?

114081048.content: No idea... The boy wandered with the mirror for a hundred years and never saw the girl again.

114081049.content: He could not understand why she had lied to him and trapped him in the mirror. But because he never got an answer, he could not bring himself to hate her.

114081050.content: Oh, Ladon! So that's why you want to get out—so you can find this girl and ask her why she betrayed you?

114081052.content: That does it. I swear to find a way to get you out of this mirror!

114081053.content: (Hehe, who would've thought a children's story would prove so useful?)

114091001.content: Quick, Ron! Insert the components! I'm about to finally be free!

114091003.content: Ron places the golden petal and silver coin into their respective slots.

114091006.content: Did you put them in right?

114091008.content: Have you checked they're placed in the right way?

114091009.content: They are. Everything's lined up properly. So why...?

114091011.content: Just give me a sec here, Ladon... Everything matches up, so the problem isn't how I inserted them...

114091012.content: Bronze mirror, silver coin, tulip bloom, the blind poet's treasure scattered around the room...

114091013.content: Maybe it's that last part we're missing. But... the history of the great alliance didn't mention anything about any gemstone...

114091014.content: Argh, I knew it was too good to be true! That dumb poem was just nonsense. I'm going to be trapped in this cursed mirror for all eternity!

114091015.content: Actually, I think I have an idea of who the blind poet was. When the alliance was formed, they invited the famous troubadour Homer to attend, who was blind. As he was climbing the steps up to the stage, he fell, and everyone in the audience burst out laughing.

114091016.content: But Homer was unfazed. He stood up, dusted himself off, and broke out into the most beautiful poem anyone had ever heard. The audience was awestruck.

114091017.content: Oh really? And where is this Homer guy now?

114091018.content: ... He's been dead for over a thousand years...

114091020.content: It's fine, Ron. You can just leave me... I know you did your best. It's not too terrible being trapped in here, after all.

114091021.content: I can close my eyes and count the stars, I can open my eyes and also count the stars... Counting stars is so fun and interesting. I love counting stars...

114091024.content: Wait! The Society of Muses' library has the biggest collection of copies of antique books in all of Omorfies. Maybe there's something in there about what the blind poet's treasure is!

114091025.content: Well, what are we waiting for? Let's go tonight!

114091026.content: Er, not an option... The Society of Muses library is restricted area. I've only been in there once with Oneiroi.

114091027.content: And the Knights of Convallaria have the entire city under lockdown at the moment. We'll definitely raise suspicion if we just go wandering over there. You said you didn't want anyone finding out who you are, right?

114091028.content: (He's right. That would interfere with my plans...)

114091029.content: Right, so all we need to do is to make them lift the lockdown while keeping ourselves unnoticed!

114091030.content: But... how are we going to do that?

114092001.content: I've made a lot of memories with Ron these past few days. Although they've all just been me fooling him.

114092002.content: Poor poor Ron, running away in such a hurry... He must be heartbroken. Is he going to burst into tears again the next time we meet?

114092003.content: Oh, what am I talking about? This is the Source Layer. There's no way a human will be able to get out of here alive...

114092004.content: I wonder who'll end up eating him first—Shady or Snowy? Pahaha!

114092005.content: Ladon, humming a cheery tune, saunters off in the direction where he senses the Sephirah Core to be.

114092007.content: He passes through an invisible barrier. Although the scenery around him has not changed, Ladon is sure that he has entered a separate space.

114092008.content: Colorful beams of light frame the silhouette of a lone palace standing in the emptiness. It has no physical form; only a closed door echoing back the sounds of Ladon's footsteps as he approaches.

114092009.content: Behind this door is the "Hall of the Heart," where the Sephirah Core is located. Ladon already feels the dizzying intoxication of being this close to the data cache.

114092010.content: Well, that was easy. And boring, actually...

114092011.content: Ladon frowns as he complains, but then his face suddenly lights up like a child who's just seen their favorite toy.

114092012.content: Hello? Anybody here? If not, then I'll just be taking this!

114092013.content: Guess there's no one. In that case, it looks like the new owner of the Sephirah Core is... His Royal Highness, the witty and charming Ladon!

114092014.content: The doorstep to the Hall of the Heart is a mere ten steps away, which Ladon traverses in a joyful tango with an invisible dance partner. He climbs the stairs and reaches out to push open the door.

114092016.content: Ladon is sure of his strength now he's been freed, but push as he might, he cannot get the door to budge.

114092017.content: He begins to hear a faint sound emanating from the door, and an energy just beyond his perception begins to gather in the middle of the hall. The power brewing behind him fills him with both trepidation and yearning.

114092020.content: Ladon hears a sound of a mechanism being triggered, and the energy source seems to be coming to the door—and fast. No longer smiling, he snatches his hand away and leaps back.

114092021.content: Just as he does so, a green-blue light shines in his direction through the crack in the door. Ladon backs off as fast as he can, but the light continues to come closer.

114092023.content: Just as the lethal light is about to reach Ladon's head, everything around him suddenly transforms. The Hall of the Heart and the green-blue light disappear, as though everything he'd just seen was simply an illusion.

114092024.content: Flustered, Ladon looks around and sees that he is now outside of the separate space where the Hall of the Heart is located. He seems to be safe, as the light is not able to reach him here.

114092025.content: Ladon tilts his head to the side as he ponders his dilemma, before suddenly bouncing it back to its original position.

114092026.content: It's. Not. Fair! How could they have such an unfair rule?!

114092027.content: He plays hopscotch along the side of the path with his hands behind his back, occasionally looking in the direction of the Hall of the Heart but ultimately deciding not to risk going back into that space.

114092029.content: I guess that light is a kind of power that only targets Visbanes. Like a drug that's designed to target a specific virus... I was targeted.

114092030.content: Gaea doesn't want Visbanes touching the Sephirah Core, and this is its defense mechanism.

114092031.content: Ladon waves dismissively, then turns on his heels and goes back the way he came. Even though he failed to get his hands on the Sephirah Core, he still has a wide grin on his face.

114092032.content: It's fine. Even though you're cheating, I still know a way I can win. It's the same as having one of those fingerprint scanners—I just need to bring you the right hand and you'll open.

114092033.content: Ladon, what are you doing? Can you hear me?

114092034.content: Ladon hears a low voice question him inside his mind.

114092035.content: Huh? It's you... I can hear you, I can hear you!

114092036.content: You cretin! You've been abesent without leave all this time. What did I do to land a partner like you? I hope Master Turing punishes you good!

114092037.content: Don't be mad. I had a bit of an... accident.

114092038.content: Ladon chuckles as he answers in his head, seemingly unaware of the other voice's anger.

114092040.content: Er... Just consider that I fell down a hole, and have only just managed to get myself back out again.

114092041.content: What nonsense are you spouting now?!

114092042.content: Okay okay! Stop shouting at me. I've got some good news. I, Ladon, am currently standing just outside the Hall of the Heart!

114092044.content: Of course! What did you think I was doing all this time?

114092046.content: ...is going swimmingly. You're not going to pull the plug, are you?

114092047.content: Of course not. I'm not an unreliable jerk like you!

114092048.content: Very good. As long as you do your part, I'll do mine and get the Sephirah Core. And when the time comes, you can take all the credit when you report to Master Turing.

114092049.content: That goes without saying! I've been sitting here ready for ages, while you decided to go off and play hooky. You're lucky I haven't reported you!

114092051.content: Ladon raps his head with his knuckles twice to silence the voice, then takes a deep breath and smiles.

114092052.content: Okay, break time is over. Game on!

114101001.content: Knight Kouros, are you telling me... Commander Athena has left you in charge of dispatches?

114101002.content: Enlil stares blankly at the Convallaria Knight in front of him, who definitely does not seem to be joking.

114101003.content: Correct, Mister Enlil. If there is something about security at the ceremony you would like to discuss, I am happy to listen.

114101004.content: The knight holds out a decree proving he is telling the truth. Enlil glances at it, nods hesitantly, then fishes a piece of paper out of his backpack.

114101005.content: This is a list of all the artists and works present at the ceremony, along with their exhibition times and locations. Senator Cadyllon instructed me to give this to Commander Athena.

114101006.content: Ah yes, I was told that there is usually a discrepancy between the people who say they're coming to the ceremony, and those who actually turn up. We will dispatch guards based on this new exhibition arrangement.

114101007.content: Thank you. Oh, one more thing.

114101008.content: Do you know where Commander Athena has gone? I would like to confirm the arrangement with her face-to-face, if possible.

114101009.content: I'm afraid she didn't tell me, and it's not my place to ask.

114101011.content: But she did say she'd be back before the opening ceremony, so maybe something's happened... Perhaps you could go to the Stellaris Temple? That's the direction she headed off in.

114101012.content: Enlil frowns as he watches Kouros leave, wondering what could possibly possess Athena to hand over responsibility for the ceremony to one of her subordinates.

114101013.content: What could be more important than the ceremony?

114101014.content: What's more, the Stellaris Temple isn't open to the public during the ceremony, so why would she go there?

114101015.content: Just as he is hesitating whether to head back and watch the ceremony with his classmates or to continue looking for Athena, he sees two small figures scurrying back to the square from a distance.

114101016.content: Miss Mintha, Miss Leuce. What are you doing here? Shouldn't you be with Lady Hades?

114101017.content: Good day, Master Enlil. As instructed by Lady Hades, we have just come from the Stellaris Temple...

114101018.content: We were sent to find Lady Hera, Miss Oneiroi, and the Aether Gazer honored guests.

114101019.content: But we couldn't find them anywhere. Would you happen to have seen them, sir?

114101021.content: Why would they go to the Stellaris Temple when the ceremony is about to start?

114101023.content: Mintha thinks Mister Enlil has the right to know.

114101024.content: Between them, the maids tell Enlil about Ron's dreamscape seed fragments, and how Hera and the others followed the trail into the Stellaris Temple.

114101025.content: So that's why Miss Athena went to the temple...

114101026.content: Has either of you seen Miss Athena?

114101027.content: A battle has definitely taken place there, and marks appear to be left by Miss Athena's weapon.

114101028.content: But we haven't seen Miss Athena herself.

114101029.content: Many artworks have been damaged. Leuce didn't have time to count them all...

114101030.content: We don't have time for that, Leuce. Lady Hades told us to return as quickly as possible.

114101031.content: Ah, you're right. If you excuse us, Mister Enlil.

114101032.content: After bidding farewell to the maids, Enlil looks towards the Stellaris Temple, his brow knitted in concern.

114101033.content: A battle in the Stellaris Temple, and it just so happened to take place now...

114101034.content: Something's wrong. I must inform father.

114101035.content: However, as Enlil plans to rush back to his father, he almost collides with someone wearing a mask.

114101037.content: He steps back and apologizes, and suddenly notices that it's not a person in front of him, but a troupe.

114101038.content: Walking in perfect synchrony, they appear to be escorting a vehicle laden with objects. Enlil notices that they are all wearing capes, as if to heighten the mystique of their upcoming performance.

114101039.content: There are so many of them. They're only just arriving now?

114101040.content: By now, almost everyone has flocked in the Ceremony Square.

114101041.content: Enlil stands alone on the path, waiting for the procession to pass, and reflects on the masked person he almost bumped into.

114101042.content: (I was so distracted I didn't even notice someone walking right up in front of me...)

114101043.content: (...Wait a second. When he walked over, there was no change in the wind.)

114101044.content: Enlil frowns. He steps forward and calls over to one of the troupe members bringing up the rear.

114101045.content: I'm terribly sorry to bother you. I'm Senator Cadyllon's assistant. May I ask, is your troupe taking part in today's performance?

114101046.content: But the person completely ignores Enlil and continues walking forward.

114101047.content: This strange reaction only confirms Enlil's suspicions. He runs to the square entrance and grabs the person's arm.

114101049.content: As soon as he grabs the person's arm, a strange feeling shoots through Enlil's hand and he immediately lets go.

114101051.content: Sticking your nose into other people's affairs isn't very mannerly, Mister Enlil.

114101053.content: Before Enlil can turn round to face the chilling voice, he feels a sudden blinding pain in the back of his neck and everything goes dark.

114111002.content: The string quartet's final four bars of the symphony's fourth movement bring its performance on the ceremony stage to a close.

114111003.content: The composer closes the piano and leads the orchestra to their final bow. Thunderous applause breaks out from the audience, although some are wholly unimpressed.

114111004.content: Hades, people will notice your lack of decorum if you don't clap at the end of a performance.

114111005.content: Then they'll also notice how perfunctory your applause is.

114111006.content: The two are sitting in the VIP seats with the best views on the southern side of the square, a red-carpet area where they won't be disturbed by the rest of the audience.

114111007.content: This means the two long-time acquaintances can speak openly without fear of being overheard by anyone else.

114111008.content: The choice of instruments is very conventional, the melody goes nowhere, and the turning point and finale are highly derivative of Master Shervok's Symphony No.9.

114111009.content: Master Shervok? Oh that's right, he was the maestro often mentioned by Ardisis.

114111010.content: Typical academic compositions—so outmoded, they verge on parody.

114111011.content: You don't pull your punches, I see.

114111012.content: Such mediocre effort, devoid of artistry, simply panders to the masses. And yet such work has already been named frontrunner by the Society of Music.

114111013.content: The prosperity of Omorfies has been built around a fine balance of artistic freedom and regulatory rigidity, but I fear such balance is being slowly eroded.

114111014.content: In the dark times, we still produced geniuses like Master Shervok, but today's generation can't hold a candle to the likes of him. It's as though humanity requires adversity in order to advance.

114111015.content: So you say, yet you still oppose the reform. If you are happy with the quality on display at the next ceremony, I expect an apology for your no.

114111016.content: I fail to see what purpose this new irresponsible system would serve, except to make people even lazier.

114111017.content: If someone is without talent, isn't it better for them to realize this earlier so they can focus their efforts elsewhere instead of languishing on a dream that will never come true?

114111018.content: Talents are the conduits of artistic expression, but its inspiration stems from here. We have blocked the way for some latecomers, and Omorfies is stagnating as a result.

114111019.content: Don't forget what brought the dark times years ago. All those mediocre artists who believed that the "inspiration" would favor them...

114111020.content: That is true, but we can learn from that valuable experience and not repeat the mistakes of the past.

114111022.content: Oceanus falls silent for a while, then gently sighs.

114111023.content: I have witnessed too many grand dreams founder, too many best-laid plans fail, and too many... systems that style themselves as perfect succumb to the scrutiny of time and degenerate into mere tools for profit seekers.

114111024.content: Omorfies may be relatively conservative at the moment, but I don't consider that a bad thing. Too radical a shift could throw us toward the other extreme, one that could shake the arts to their very foundations.

114111025.content: Nothing is perfect. The more you wish to change the status quo, the more you'll have to accept radical methods and unknown consequences.

114111026.content: People these days are obsessed with certificates and scores. We both have seen the results of such obsessions. We have to do something, to give others a chance, one way or another.

114111027.content: Sounds like you really are quite confident in them.

114111028.content: I've always been more optimistic than you. But I'm not the one with confidence—they are.

114111029.content: You should pay a visit to the Society of Muses one day, Oceanus. Those with the most creativity these days are the ones you would claim are "on the wrong path."

114111030.content: If that's true, then why don't you teach some students yourself so that we may admire their talents?

114111031.content: What, so they could see that they'd never surpass me and give up in frustration one by one? Are we really going to repeat what happened before?

114111032.content: You either need to learn your lesson, or teach something else.

114111033.content: You know perfectly well it's simply a talent gap. As for other things, it shouldn't be mine to teach.

114111034.content: All I know is that you are not cut out for teaching.

114111035.content: Well, Enlil achieving what he has doesn't necessarily mean you are a good teacher, either.

114111036.content: As the topic moves to the younger generations, Oceanus turns to scan the crowd. His eyes only come to a brief halt when reaching the sculpture class. He frowns slightly.

114111037.content: This ceremony takes place once every five years, yet where is Athena? And not only her—where is Hera, where are the Aether Gazer guests? These youngsters you've supposedly been teaching have clearly learned nothing of manners.

114111038.content: The young have their own concerns. Didn't Enlil go with them? Such a pity.

114111039.content: Enlil is helping me with something. Having said that, he also should have been back by now...

114111040.content: Whatever's happened to draw all these people away, I'm sure it's nothing good. Aren't you worried about their safety?

114111041.content: Yes, I am. Wait... Oneiroi isn't here either...

114111042.content: And you have no idea where they could be?

114111043.content: Hades yawns lazily, and leans back in a more comfortable position in her chair.

114111044.content: We'll find out when Mintha and Leuce return.

114111045.content: Just as Hades summons Mintha and Leuce, a wave of whispers breaks out among the crowd.

114111046.content: Hades, it would appear that a lot of people still remember your puppetry skills.

114111047.content: Oh? Do you mean the troupe on stage now?... I've heard of them. Sounds interesting. I believe they're outsiders invited especially for the ceremony.

114111048.content: A dance troupe has climbed on stage, and they command the crowd's attention before their act has even begun. Not because they are wearing outlandish costumes, not because they made a spectacular entrance, but because half of their members are not human.

114111049.content: I heard this troupe is famous because half of them are alive and the other half are puppets, but once they start performing no one can tell which is which.

114111050.content: I think the one on the right might be a puppet... Yeah, that one...

114111051.content: The guy in the mask must be the puppet master. Do you think he needs to fine-tune the puppets in real time, since there are so many of them?

114111052.content: I didn't think there would be anyone this skilled with puppets since Lady Hades. I mean, these puppets aren't as exquisite as her works, but this is on a much bigger scale...

114111053.content: Ahem... The Senators are just over there... Keep your voice down...

114111054.content: Unlike the inferior puppets made by past imitators of Hades who failed to grasp what makes them special, the puppets in this troupe are completely natural in both appearance and movement.

114111055.content: The puppet masters operate them all in unison, and their dance is even more coordinated than that of the human performers. What's more, the choreography goes beyond mere mechanical movement—it tries to express human emotions within the movements of the puppets.

114111056.content: In the second half of the act, a giant Dance Partner AGI Mecha slowly rises above the stage and dances in mid-air like a maiden holding a parasol, adding an element of three-dimensionality to the performance.

114111057.content: Now this is interesting, I must say...

114111058.content: Tapping her armrest along to the music, Hades eyes are gleaming. Her lips part in a delighted smile. It's the first time she's sat up in her seat since the ceremony started.

114111059.content: The path widens, and the landscape becomes more expansive. Ron's cries for help are becoming ever clearer.

114111061.content: A crumbling theater floats in the middle of the intersection, although its sheer size belies its sense of weightlessness. The surrounding buildings forming the stage are in ruins, adding to the sense of fallen grandeur.

114111062.content: This hauntingly beautiful sight quickly becomes one of terror, as the group spots the pack of Visbanes gathered on the central stage. Ron's cries ring out from somewhere in the middle. It sounds as if he's on the verge of being eaten.

114111064.content: How did he get caught by so many Visbanes?! Quick, before it's too late!

114111065.content: Wait, they're not hurting him. They've just surrounded him.

114111066.content: Are they using Ron as bait?

114111067.content: Even if this is one of Ladon's traps, we can't just leave Ron there. Engage!

114111068.content: The Visbanes surrounding Ron are weak, and we dispatch them with ease.

114111069.content: Ron is kneeling on the floor, seemingly on the verge of tears. We gather around him.

114111071.content: We understand Ron's tears. The combination of the unsettling environment and the Visbanes is enough to shatter anyone's defenses.

114111072.content: Miss Athena... It's really you... I'll accept any punishment you give me.

114111073.content: I shouldn't have trusted Ladon. I stole the artwork, I hurt the guards, I went against your orders...

114111074.content: Ladon has been... lying to me since the beginning...

114111076.content: Oneiroi... It's my fault... There is nothing I can do now... Eh?...

114111077.content: Athena gently pats Ron on the head, who looks up and stares blankly at the commander he was expecting to chastise him.

114111078.content: I've also made mistakes that were hard to undo. But now that you know you were in the wrong, what good is crying about it going to do?

114111080.content: Your case shall be judged by the Astral Council. Until then, you need to calm yourself and help us defend Omorfies against Ladon.

114111081.content: Remember when you would practice your painting so much you'd forget to eat and sleep? That's the Ron we need right now, not this crybaby version.

114111082.content: If you wish to become a decent artist, you need to know how to conduct yourself with grace. If you can't even do that, then you're not ready for fame and recognition.

114111083.content: Ron... We're all here to help you...

114111085.content: Seeing the encouragement in everyone's eyes, Ron nods firmly and wipes the tears from his face.

114111086.content: It is strange, though... This was clearly a trap, but Ladon's nowhere to be seen. Not even an ambush or anything...

114111087.content: Ron, why were you here on your own? Where's Ladon?

114111088.content: H-he abandoned me as soon as he escaped from the mirror. I was chased here by monsters.

114111089.content: My plan was to hide here until the monsters left, and then go find Miss Athena, but more and more of them just kept on coming... I thought I was doomed.

114111090.content: Well, the good news is that it doesn't look like Ladon has succeeded yet. Things could be much worse otherwise.

114111091.content: Just as I'm about to ask Ron if he has any more clues to give, Verthandi taps me on the shoulder.

114111093.content: Admin... Don't you feel that? I think the stage is... moving!

114111094.content: Everyone looks uneasy upon hearing Verthandi's ominous warning, except for Oneiroi, who is still half-asleep, and Ron, whose body stiffens in fear.

114111097.content: Gravity suddenly seems to get stronger, making my head spin. Ron falls to his knees. We notice everything outside the theater has started to whirl rapidly.

114111098.content: It's impossible to tell if it's the landscape rotating, or the theater itself. The heavy red curtain falls, before being split in all directions mid-air and descending on us in waves, trapping us on the stage.

114111099.content: Everyone huddle up! Don't get separated!

114111100.content: I pull Ron to his feet, and everyone stands back-to-back, drawing our weapons and forming a defensive circle. Strange noises are coming from behind the wall of red fabric. We hear rustling footsteps, musical instruments, and the muffled sounds of mechanisms operating and boards colliding.

114111101.content: Rookie, I detect a powerful Bane Energy signal approaching...

114111105.content: The wall of curtain obscuring our vision suddenly disintegrates into scarlet tatters, which fall like fine rain. Behind this, we can see the theater.

114111106.content: Ghostly human figures without legs float in the air, carrying sickles and lanterns. Their weapons seem to be made from pure light. Though without substance, they still make a sound as they tear through the air.

114111107.content: They must be Visbanes. The closest one to us is already a few steps away from Verthandi.

114111108.content: Where did these Visbanes come from? Did we not spot them before?

114111109.content: There weren't any like these just now—these are all dressed up, almost pretentious... Is this some kind of practical joke?

114111110.content: The landscape has changed too. Isn't that... the Stellaris Academy square?

114111111.content: It does indeed look like a glass stage surrounded by a red carpet. Some of the buildings are distorted unrealistically, yet some sculptures carry the recognizable Stellaris Academy style.

114111112.content: In the sky outside float countless musical instruments, silently surrounding the theater like an asteroid belt. The dead space is like a graveyard for these instruments, forever burying their music.

114111113.content: The show is about to begin, and the actors have taken their positions. After a momentary pause, high-pitched singing rings across the stage, and a ferocious onslaught of Visbanes appears.

114121002.content: Oceanus returns the maids' salutations with a courteous nod, and pulls his seat away from Hades slightly so that Mintha and Leuce can stand on either side of her.

114121003.content: You haven't missed too much. The opening dance has just ended, and now the main show is about to begin.

114121004.content: The enthusiastic conversations from the audience are a testament to the performance's popularity. The large-scale puppet show was already exciting enough, but the troupe is also putting on a circus show.

114121005.content: It's time for the circus props to be placed on stage, with the puppet masters performing the intermission.

114121007.content: I'm sorry, but we couldn't find them. Besides, in the temple we saw...

114121009.content: Would you like us to continue searching, Lady Hades?

114121010.content: No. You can stay here and enjoy the show... and chat with me.

114121011.content: Do you know what those things on stage are?

114121013.content: Lady Hades wasn't asking about the show, Leuce.

114121016.content: As punishment, you shall perform tonight before dinner, Leuce.

114121018.content: There's nothing in this world as special as you two, my darlings.

114121019.content: Perform, yes, Leuce will put on a spectacular show!

114121020.content: And Mintha, I want you to perform with Leuce as well.

114121021.content: Oh? Did Mintha say something wrong too?

114121022.content: You gave the wrong answer to my question, too, Mintha.

114121023.content: Are they really just puppets? Take a closer look.

114121024.content: Hades doesn't lower her voice, so Oceanus overhears this, too. Being reminded, he also feels something is wrong.

114121026.content: Fret not, Oceanus. I simply think we should further investigate where these puppets came from. I think you'll find it just as interesting as I do.

114121027.content: The intermission performance is over. Another batch of puppets joins the stage for the grand finale.

114121028.content: With little by way of build-up, the powerful puppets are able to pull off a series of mind-blowing stunts that leaves the audience gasping in awe.

114121029.content: Mintha and Leuce lean on the railing, watching the performance carefully and pondering Hades' question. Hades' gaze never strays from one of the puppet masters.

114121030.content: Heh... Are you putting on such a big show just to get these things inside?

114121031.content: As the intermission performance ends, the puppet master Hades had been staring at exits the stage, following the stagehand who's carrying the props. The two make eye contact for a second.

114121032.content: The puppet master does not appear to notice Hades, and thanks to the mask, this person is able to naturally shift their gaze in another direction.

114121034.content: It was a tough fight, but we managed to take out those odd Visbanes that seemed to be attacking us with dance moves. However, an oppressive atmosphere continues to cloak the empty stage.

114121035.content: There's something wrong with this place. Let's get out of here...

114121036.content: Ron, do you remember which way you came from?

114121038.content: Ron's finger freezes in mid-air. His eyes widen in horror, and his mouth opens soundlessly.

114121039.content: I look around and see the reason for his fear.

114121040.content: After all the spinning and changes to the landscape that took place, it's impossible now to tell which direction is which.

114121041.content: I'm sorry! The one thing I could do to help, and I can't even...

114121042.content: It's not your fault, Ron. We all lost our sense of direction in all of this.

114121043.content: It's hard to see clearly in the Source Layer. There are no landmarks, and the scenery is constantly changing. It would be a miracle NOT to get lost in a place like this.

114121044.content: Athena, didn't you say before that this place looks similar to Ceremony Square?

114121045.content: Yes. The Knights of Convallaria are responsible for security during the ceremony, so I'm very familiar with the square's layout. Why do you ask?

114121046.content: It's just that I'm a little worried about what's going on there. It's been a while since we left now, but no one has come to find us, or even gotten a message to us.

114121047.content: Outside communications are blocked this deep in the Source Layer, and no one would be able to find us without our exact coordinates.

114121048.content: The ceremony is not what's important right now. Hades and Oceanus are there, and they won't let their guard down.

114121049.content: We need to focus on our own predicament...  We can't just run around the Source Layer like headless chickens.  It's impossible for us to just bump into Ladon somewhere.

114121050.content: All we can do is take things one step at a time.

114121051.content: We randomly choose a path, and are about to follow it when a familiar sense of danger assails us.

114121052.content: The red curtain falls, blocking our exit from the stage. Amid its haphazard spinning and the constant gravitational changes, we hear heavier sounds than before coming from behind the curtain.

114121054.content: We really should have left here when we had the chance!

114121055.content: The curtain dissipates for a second time, and I aim my pistol at the head of a humanoid Visbane. I pull the trigger without hesitation.

114122001.content: Is that woman a Modifier? Did she notice me?

114122002.content: The puppet master leaves the stage and stands at the edge of the shadowy passageway. Even though he had turned his gaze, he could still feel the stare from the VIP seats burning into his back.

114122003.content: No... It couldn't be... I didn't give anything away.

114122004.content: Come on Ladon, what's taking you so long? You've revealed yourself, but you're still strolling around without a care in the world... Why do I always get stuck with such unreliable partners?!

114122005.content: Still cursing, the puppet master fades into the shadows.

114122006.content: Did you find out where the puppets came from?

114122007.content: No. The registered factory was fake, and the supplier didn't recognize any of the serial numbers.

114122008.content: Hades nods as though this was what she was expecting. She turns to the maids, who are discussing their answer in low voices.

114122009.content: Well, Mintha, Leuce, were those puppets on stage?

114122010.content: Leuce doesn't think so... Because... um... Mintha, you say it.

114122011.content: Mintha watched the performers carefully, and I compared their movements to those of the twelve puppetry techniques Lady Hades mentioned.

114122012.content: The mobility and unison we saw on stage are impossible to achieve with any known puppetry techniques... Therefore, they weren't puppets.

114122013.content: If our lady can't do it, then no one can. That's what Leuce thinks.

114122014.content: Please explain, Hades. If this is related to the security of the ceremony, you shouldn't keep it from me.

114122015.content: Hey, I've only just confirmed things myself. You can't expect me to know everything all at once!

114122016.content: Leuce tells Oceanus about the disorder she saw in the temple, and the fact that Athena and the others seem to have disappeared.

114122017.content: Do you think they went into the Source Layer?

114122018.content: There's no other explanation. They can't have just disappeared in a puff of smoke.

114122019.content: I'm going to look for them.

114122020.content: Slow down. Without their coordinates, it'll be like looking for a needle in a haystack.

114122021.content: What's more... We'll have our own troubles to deal with... soon.

114122022.content: Hades calls Mintha and Leuce over, and whispers instructions in their ears.

114122023.content: Now, go do as I say.

114122025.content: Oceanus, there hasn't been any trouble at the ceremony for over one hundred years. That is going to change today.

114122026.content: If you think it's that serious, then we must decide our moves with utmost caution.

114122028.content: I know when to put my trust in you.

114122029.content: Hmm... My mistake. After suffering so many of your... lessons, I may have a bit of a biased view of you.

114122030.content: I don't mind, and there's no need for you to change your views.

114122031.content: The circus show finally comes to an end, and the crowd's applause is deafening. However, a sudden screeching noise cuts everything short.

114122033.content: A girl in a maid's uniform taps the microphone on the rostrum, and the screech of the feedback silences the entire crowd. Yet the performance on the main stage continues uninterrupted.

114122034.content: Okay Leuce, you don't need to test it. We can all hear you.

114122035.content: Um... Everyone, we have just received a Quake alert from CORG and have no choice but to halt the ceremony for today. All remaining performances will be postponed to a later time. For now, please follow the instructions of the Knights of Convallaria and evacuate the square.

114122037.content: Impossible. It must be a prank of some kind.

114122038.content: Everyone must leave immediately before the Quake hits!

114122039.content: All emergency exits have been opened. Please follow the knights' instructions and evacuate.

114122040.content: The unexpected announcement triggers a wave of confused murmuring in the crowd, and the dance troupe finally stops their performance. Although the audience is bewildered and annoyed at having the ceremony cut short, they still obey the knights and calmly file out of the square.

114122041.content: Well, today's definitely one for the history books.

114122042.content: It matters not. History is written by the victors; we just need to ensure it's accurate.

114122043.content: We shall get going, Hades. We're the ones who'll have to clean up this mess.

114122044.content: The evacuation is proceeding in an orderly fashion, except for the troupe, whose members oddly stand on the stage, silently.

114122045.content: Hey, excuse me! The performers are still up there. Can't you at least let them finish the show first?

114122046.content: Yes! It would be too rude for us to leave halfway through the show!

114122047.content: Some of the stragglers from the audience begin to complain loudly at the knights.

114122048.content: For your own safety, we must ask you to evacuate immediately. We will also arrange for the performers to exit...

114122049.content: Are we in danger? If so, why are Senator Cadyllon and Senator Hades still here?

114122051.content: Look, everyone! the performers are starting back up. They're going to continue!

114122052.content: Haha, now THAT'S the dedication to the art! Of course they shouldn't stop until the final curtain calls.

114122053.content: I-is this... part of the show?...

114122054.content: The troupe's movements are attracting more and more interest from the crowd. An unpleasant aura starts to build around the stage.

114122055.content: Suddenly, a thick black mist starts emanating from the puppets. When it clears, their eyes shine a dangerous red.

114122056.content: Their outward appearance is still one of elegance and sophistication, but their artistic beauty has now been replaced with murderous intent.

114122057.content: The Dance Partner AGI Mecha raises its diamond-shaped head and, amidst the high-pitched, almost inhuman chanting, Visbanes in the shape of the violinists and dancers launch a surprise attack on the audience.

114122058.content: Oh look, it's an interactive show!

114122059.content: Wait, there's something wrong with these guys!

114131001.content: Chaos and panic quickly spread, and the audience begins to flee from the square. The Knights of Convallaria try to maintain order at the outermost perimeter while sending people to block off the stage.

114131003.content: One of the puppet dancers leaps from the stage and lands in between a mother and her daughter.

114131004.content: My daughter! Someone save my daughter! She's still in there!

114131005.content: Don't panic. Leave this to me.

114131006.content: A nearby knight spots the girl who's been separated, and quickly pulls the worried mother back into the crowd of evacuating people.

114131007.content: Frightened and uncertain as he may be, the knight's sense of honor motivates him to face this strange enemy without a second's thought.

114131008.content: Just as he is about to act, a figure clothed in the Stellaris Academy uniform emerges from the crowd and rushes into the scene.

114131009.content: You continue guiding the crowd. Leave the enemy to me!

114131010.content: A storm begins to erupt from the boy's book, ruffling his collar. He stares at the puppet, which is raising its arm above the little girl and about to strike. His eyes filled with nascent dignity and a trace of anger.

114131011.content: The storm blows the puppet off-stage. Enlil checks that the girl is unharmed, then immediately dashes over to the stage and leaps over the railing to face the puppets head-on.

114131012.content: The enemies rush at him, but his Access Key summons a turquoise storm around him, and the fierce winds send the puppets flying.

114131014.content: Mister Enlil?! What are you doing here?

114131015.content: No time to explain! They just attacked me too.

114131017.content: Nothing major, and I'm glad I made the right decision by coming here at once. Please, get everybody out of here and lock down the square. No one may enter.

114131018.content: Cutting down Visbanes with his wind blade, the usually calm and reserved Enlil has a stern look on his face, and his voice takes on a commanding tone.

114131019.content: Not the tone of an arrogant superior, but simply of someone confident in their own character and ability.

114131020.content: South of the stage, Oceanus and Hades have not evacuated with everyone else...

114131021.content: Impressive. Enlil has never fought Visbanes before, correct? And yet he wields his Divine Power so proficiently.

114131022.content: (Mister Enlil once told Leuce that he usually uses his power of the wind to sweep up the yard...)

114131023.content: Mintha, Leuce. Go and help him.

114131024.content: Right away. Mintha will take the left side.

114131027.content: Mintha and Leuce leap into the battlefield, and make short work of the puppets they come across.

114131028.content: You're not just going to leave this mess up to the youngsters to deal with, are you?

114131029.content: Oceanus draws his sword, and with a swipe, the water surrounding his blade shoots out to form a floating river. He leaps up and sprints along the waves until he reaches a pack of Visbanes on the south side of the stage.

114131030.content: With a sigh, Hades' body flickers into shadow and suddenly reappears just behind Oceanus.

114131032.content: But now that you mention it, how long has it been since we've battled together?

114131033.content: Six years and seven months... Although you did have your puppet army back then. It's just the two of us now.

114131034.content: And what was so great about my puppet army? A sandwich from Mintha and Leuce is way better than that.

114131035.content: Why don't you just concentrate on your own sword, hmm? Looks like you're more used to wielding chisels than blades these days.

114131036.content: I'm still good enough to deal with these things.

114131037.content: Some Visbanes attempt to escape the battlefield, but Oceanus sends out a river current to sweep them back into Mintha and Leuce's fists.

114131038.content: Where's that person you were staring at before?

114131039.content: I'm not sure. Maybe we've taken him out already?

114131040.content: If so, then it means you were watching the wrong person. Whoever was capable of hijacking the ceremony like this would not be dealt with so easily.

114131041.content: But it doesn't matter... As long as they're still in Omorfies, there's no escape for them.

114142002.content: The outer casing of the Dance Partner AGI Mecha cannot withstand Hades' and Oceanus' onslaught for long. The machine's movements become sluggish, and the chants filling the square are interrupted by a frequent buzzing sound.

114142003.content: Without its carefully crafted appearance and sound, the mecha loses all of its esthetic value and simply becomes yet another broken Bane Energy-filled machine. Only its eyes continue to burn red.

114142004.content: Enlil, corner this thing for me and I'll finish it off.

114142006.content: Enlil sets his jaw, and the windstorm around him lifts him into the air. The Access Key in front of him slowly opens up, and his power increases dramatically.

114142007.content: As the Dance Partner AGI Mecha raises its weapon to attack Enlil, Enlil lifts his hand and an enormous wind pressure drops down from the sky, surrounding the mecha and rendering it completely immobile.

114142009.content: Hades plucks at the air with her fingers, while Mintha and Leuce prepare their finishing blows on either side of the mecha.

114142011.content: The young wind master immediately understands. He spreads his arms wide, and the book stops flipping at a certain page.

114142012.content: The wind cage Enlil had formed suddenly dissipates and stills for a split second before transforming into thousands of blue wind blades that dart in and out of the mecha, attacking its wounds and joints.

114142015.content: Straight after Enlil's wind blades, Mintha and Leuce deliver their blows one by one.

114142017.content: The sharpness of the wind blades alternates with the bluntness of the punches, and the rhythm they beat out begins to increase in tempo.

114142018.content: Mintha and Leuce's movements accelerate until they almost become indistinguishable from Enlil's wind blades. The black and white lights trace a dazzling trajectory centered around the Dance Partner AGI Mecha, which quickly crumbles under such an offensive.

114142019.content: The red light disappears from its eyes as the storm passes, and it collapses into a heap of scrap iron.

114142022.content: With his Divine Power depleted, Enlil slumps to the floor with a thud. He sits, too exhausted to worry about anything.

114142023.content: With the AGI Mecha defeated, all of the Bane Energy seems to drain from the puppets, and the dancer Visbanes melt into black smoke.

114142024.content: Oceanus looks stern as he pulls his sword from a Visbane's chest. It almost seems as if he's gained no pleasure from their victory as he turns his gaze from the square.

114142025.content: Senator Cadyllon, are you unhurt? I shall send someone to... Huh?

114142026.content: The knight's jaw drops as he watches a living, breathing person disintegrate into the mist...

114151002.content: The sound of footsteps echoes in the empty passageway. The power supply to the lighting system must have been destroyed in the fighting, as everything beyond the entrance to the passage is shrouded in inky blackness.

114151003.content: Are the Replicates back? Hades must have resolved it.

114151004.content: Oceanus pushes his glasses up as his gaze imperceptibly shifts to the right.

114151005.content: The sound of water dripping from leaking pipes makes the atmosphere here even eerier, but Oceanus walks steadily on, seemingly without a care in the scene.

114151006.content: The situation may be under control, but the mastermind behind it is still at large. If he's controlling this many Visbanes, he must be close by...

114151007.content: The darkness begins to retreat as Oceanus makes his way through the second half of the passage. He lowers his eyes as though deep in thought.

114151008.content: Oceanus shields his eyes against the harsh light as he steps out of the darkness, unaware that there's a figure hiding in the shadows behind him.

114151009.content: (All that waiting paid off... I wanted to lure a Modifier, but it looks like I've caught an even bigger fish!)

114151010.content: (I'll gladly accept the life of the third Senator of the Astral Council!)

114151012.content: A hand, wreathed in cold Bane Energy, shoots from the shadows and points directly at Oceanus' heart.

114151013.content: Oceanus barely has time to turn his head before the Bane Energy bursts out of his chest like a geyser.

114151015.content: Hahaha! Oh you Modifiers are always so predictable. You're so sure that you've got the victory that you never think to check for danger behind you.

114151016.content: What good is all your vaunted strength now? You've still fallen at my hands!

114151017.content: The ambush is going better than even Novich could have ever dreamed. He presses down hard on Oceanus' neck with a triumphant grin on his face.

114151018.content: This isn't the first time Novich has launched a successful ambush. But his smile and his complacency gradually fade as he feels something strange on his hands.

114151019.content: Huh? What the... Why's it wet?

114151020.content: The Bane Energy had indeed burst out of Oceanus' chest, but it looked like thrusting a sword into the water—once the ripples around the wound subside, everything returns to normal.

114151021.content: Oceanus' entire body turns into water, leaving Novich empty-handed.

114151022.content: Novich knows something's not right, but before he can do anything, he hears footsteps rush up behind him.

114151023.content: Your techniques are even more despicable than I thought.

114151024.content: The sword is unsheathed, and the passageway echoes with the sound of gushing water.

114151025.content: Novich turns his head and is terrified to see several Oceanuses standing behind him. Nothing but a puddle of water is left of the Oceanus he'd struck before.

114151026.content: Was taking out one of my Replicates really such an accomplishment for you?

114151027.content: A w-water Replicate! So that was... bait?!

114151028.content: It doesn't matter how good a scheme is—you can only ever use it once.

114151029.content: I'd heard you'd caused all kinds of trouble for Aether Gazer in Neuhansa. Turns out you're a fool with only one card up your sleeve.

114151030.content: You were oh so confident just moments ago. What do you plan to do now?

114151031.content: The dozen or so Replicates of Oceanus draw their swords and advance slowly upon Novich.

114151034.content: It's hard to tell whether all the Oceanus' Replicates slash their swords, or only the Oceanus in front slashes his sword. Either way, the Bane Energy Novich casts forth is torn asunder like a rag.

114151035.content: A thin trickle of water slides across Novich's throat, as the sound of footsteps fades away behind him.

114151036.content: Just this. I simply want you to die.

114162001.content: There's no end to these Visbanes!

114162003.content: I had unwittingly moved to the fringes of the battlefield, but was pulled back by Ver just in time.

114162005.content: It's all right, Admin. We've just gotta keep our wits about us in times like these.

114162006.content: It's all well and good speaking calmly, but combat is still combat. Not only Verthandi, but Athena and Hera are also starting to tire after this protracted battle.

114162007.content: This is all my fault... Y-you should all just leave me...

114162008.content: Don't speak like that, Ron! Giving up on yourself is no help to anyone!

114162010.content: But Visbanes really are endless in the Source Layer. If this keeps up, we'll be the ones who fold first...

114162011.content: Just then, I feel someone tug lightly at my sleeve. A familiar gesture... I look down at Oneiroi.

114162014.content: I don't really understand what Oneiroi is doing, but I suddenly feel myself flooded with a warm, comforting feeling.

114162015.content: Clutching her beloved toy sheep, Oneiroi slowly floats into the air and a purple halo envelops her as she appears to fall into a deep sleep. She resembles a purple moon hanging over the Source Layer.

114162016.content: The shimmering halo expands across the stage, and stills all the Visbanes it touches. Even the fissure in the center of the stage stops fluctuating.

114162018.content: Oneiroi's shout doesn't sound overly courageous...

114162019.content: But, without a sound, all of the Visbanes start to convulse violently and fall to their knees. Their bodies start to crack and peel as though scoured by a ferocious wind, and the light extinguishes from their sickles and lanterns.

114162021.content: Hera? Do you know what's going on?

114162022.content: I don't know, I've never seen anything like this before either!

114162023.content: Drowsie... won't let you get hurt...

114162024.content: The Visbanes are aging rapidly, but the Divine Power waves are so weak. How is she doing it?

114162025.content: The strange scene plays out for a few minutes more. Even the fissures fall still. The halo supporting Oneiroi gently begins to lower her back down to the ground.

114162026.content: Oneiroi, are you all right? Wake up! Wake up!

114162029.content: ...Unbelievable. Clearly we have a lot more work to do to investigate the effect of the Dream system on Oneiroi's powers.

114162030.content: Looking down at Oneiroi as she sleeps in his arms, Ron looks like he's made a decision.

114162031.content: I'll look after Oneiroi. It's the only way I can be of help to you guys, and I swear I won't let you down.

114162032.content: Ron... Okay, we'll trust her to you.

114162033.content: Everyone nods in agreement. After all, the battle with Ladon promises to be tough, and we won't have Hera at full strength if she needs to carry Oneiroi.

114162034.content: There's no guarantee there aren't any other traps here. I think we should leave, and quick.

114162036.content: The sound of a piano playing stops us in our tracks.

114162037.content: Leave? But it won't be any fun without you here!

114162038.content: An innocent teenage voice rings out across the theater. We instinctively draw our weapons, but Ron freezes on the spot as though thunderstruck.

114171001.content: A strange boy with a bright yet terrifying smile is sitting on a floating piano outside the theater. He reaches out his arms, as though to hug old friends.

114171002.content: Yoohoo, Ron! Oh look, have you made some new friends? That girl you're carrying is much stronger than she looks, isn't she?

114171004.content: So you're that Visbane? You just won't admit when you've lost, will you? At least now we can give you a decent death.

114171005.content: Whoa whoa whoa! Not even a friendly hello? How very rude! Especially you, Ron. Don't think I can't see you hiding back there.

114171007.content: We all gather in front of Ron in case Ladon tries anything.

114171008.content: Oh no, is Ron mad at me? If you don't like those kinds of jokes, then I won't tell them anymore!

114171009.content: Look, I came back for you didn't I? I've always thought of you as my best friend!

114171010.content: Why are you still lying to me?

114171011.content: Ron clenches his fists in rage, fear, hesitation... A whole range of complex emotions surge in Ron at Ladon's lies.

114171012.content: I won't let you use me anymore, Ladon!

114171014.content: Ladon's smile slowly fades. He jumps off the piano and starts climbing the black music note stairs to reach the stage.

114171015.content: You really shouldn't be so aggressive towards your friends, Ron.

114171016.content: Look at these hypocrites in front of you. Do you really think they've told you the whole truth? Do you really think they'd protect you unconditionally?

114171017.content: No and no! They're just using you as a way to get at me. And as soon as you're no longer useful to them, they'll erase your memories, and you'll go back to being a timid little student, living life with the wool pulled over your eyes.

114171018.content: And you accuse ME of lying to you? Ha! How far do you think worthless cowards like you can get in life without people like me to lead you by the hand? I gave you a chance to make all your dreams come true! Everything I did was for your own good!

114171019.content: Nonsense! You won't even tell Ron what your goal is! Like hell it's for his own good!

114171020.content: Hehe, you really think I'm going to fall for your cheap mind games?

114171021.content: You're right. Your goal is of absolutely no importance.

114171022.content: The Sephirah Zone will be destroyed if you take the Sephirah Core. You became the enemy of all Omorfians as soon as you started your plan.

114171023.content: Wow! That's quite the accusation... And what an old-fashioned way to judge what's right and what's wrong!

114171024.content: Ron, think about all the tales of heroes you've read! Aren't the heroes who know the truth always the ones who are ostracized and persecuted by everyone else? Only the loyal companions who understand the hero stay by their side.

114171025.content: Ron, do you want to finish this magnificent undertaking we've started?

114171026.content: So you actually want to destroy Omorfies? And you still expect me to trust you?!

114171028.content: Who cares about Omorfies? There are so many Sephirah Zones. The humans will always find somewhere to live.

114171029.content: Ladon shrugs with indifference. He grabs a flute that's floating nearby, and uses that to pull over a drumkit. He then begins to hit the drum with the flute.

114171030.content: ...Don't tell me you're the same as Athena? Why do you care so much about the dumb "art"?

114171031.content: Guess it's my fault to have higher hopes for humans' aesthetic. Besides, where's the fun if there aren't even clear winners and losers?

114171032.content: No one expects a Visbane like you to understand the meaning of art.

114171033.content: Well, now, aren't you the arrogant one? Mmm, I remember you are... You're Hera from the Society of Muses, right?

114171034.content: I've heard your society is somewhat... eclectic. You'll call anything art, correct?

114171035.content: Well, that's great, because I just so happen to have some fascinating art right here. I'd love to get your opinion on it...

114171036.content: Hera's cold stare isn't stopping Ladon from having his fun. He takes half a step back, one hand behind his back and the other raised, like a performer about to take his curtain call.

114171037.content: Watch out! He's gathering Bane Energy!

114171038.content: There's nothing to worry about. This is just a little trick I've learned.

114171039.content: Ladon's shadow on the ground begins to grow longer and more distorted, until it no longer resembles a human at all...

114171040.content: The growling of the giant beast is loud enough to make the ground tremble. We look on in astonishment as the dragon unfurls four enormous wings.

114171041.content: Hahahahaha! Get ready to meet the mighty Ladon in his true form!

114182001.content: The dragon falls into the infinite void. Its massive body is completely scorched by the flames, and disintegrates into barely visible black-and-white fragments, until it is swallowed by the abyss.

114182002.content: Did we... win? We won! We did it, Miss Athena!

114182005.content: Leaning heavily on her sword, Athena suddenly weakens her grip and drops backward. Just as she is about to fall into the void, she is grabbed by a warm pair of arms.

114182006.content: Now, let's not ruin an admirable performance with some silly negligence.

114182009.content: Why are you crying? And why are you... blushing?

114182010.content: I'm not blushing, it's blood... How can you not know that, Oneiroi?

114182011.content: I don't know, I've never bled before... Does that mean you're in pain, Ron?

114182012.content: Yes, it hurts. But I'll be fine... I think I'll live.

114182013.content: A brown-haired boy clutching a girl for dear life emerges from the rubble.

114182014.content: His school uniform is in tatters, and there's a cut on his cheek where the broken lenses of his glasses have cut him. But luckily, the stone slabs fell in such a way that they created a small shelter where he and the girl could hide from the fierce battle.

114182016.content: I did it, Miss Athena... Oneiroi is perfectly fine. I hope I was useful at least once...

114182017.content: Of course you were. You've done better than any of us could have asked.

114182018.content: Shush now. Let me tend to your wounds.

114182019.content: Hera takes Oneiroi from Ron, and concentrates the Divine Power in her staff to heal the young companion.

114182020.content: We won... We defeated a Cognizant Visbane without a single casualty!

114182022.content: I smile in relief, and nod at Ver. I look at everyone in turn and tell them that the danger has passed.

114182025.content: The square has been devastated by the battle with the Dance Partner AGI Mecha and puppet Visbanes.

114182026.content: Hades stands alone in the center of the stage. Beside her, the Knights of Convallaria busy themselves cleaning up the mess.

114182027.content: The Visbane called Novich has been eliminated.

114182029.content: It is what he deserved for attacking Omorfies.

114182030.content: Oceanus, in his water form, comes up to Hades and stands silently for a while. He can sense she's not her normal self.

114182033.content: Let us go into the Source Layer and search for them, then. I'll get Enlil to come with us too. We shall start from the place with the highest possibility.

114182036.content: Almost exactly as Hades looks up, the rumbling of collapsing buildings thunders through the square. Suddenly, a column of fire shoots into the air from a distant dome.

114182038.content: The temple's on fire! Who would do such a thing?!

114182039.content: Quick! We need to put it out!

114182040.content: While everyone else around her panics, Hades calmly looks in the direction of the fire, and her face relaxes.

114182043.content: A few minutes later, a rift opens in the square, and a group of people helps each other stumble out.

114182046.content: Huh? Lady Hera is supporting Miss Athena...

114182047.content: She's too weak to walk on her own. We couldn't just leave her!

114182048.content: Lady Hades, what happened here at the ceremony is completely my fault.

114182049.content: That's not true! It's because I let Ladon use me!

114182050.content: Hades lets out a long sigh at Athena's desolate tone and Ron's attempts to squeeze to the front of the group.

114182051.content: We've had our own troubles over here. Let us find somewhere to rest, and then we'll talk about what happened.

114182052.content: We tell Hades and Oceanus about everything that took place in the Source Layer...

114182053.content: It sounds like Novich was in cahoots with that Visbane called Ladon that you chased. Ladon was responsible for plotting to steal the Sephirah Core, and Novich created the ruckus in the ceremony to distract us.

114182054.content: Is this... Novich really dead? We crossed paths with him before, in Neuhansa. He's a tricky one!

114182055.content: I shattered his core myself. That is, if he really was the Visbane you were looking for.

114182056.content: At least they didn't manage to get their hands on the Sephirah Core. If they did, we wouldn't be sitting here now.

114182057.content: But they've ruined the ceremony, and I destroyed the temple as I was trying to kill Ladon...

114182058.content: Well, that surely will be difficult to restore.

114182059.content: But it isn't the end of the world. Art is for the people, by the people. Yes, it's a shame to have lost such a magnificent collection of masterpieces, but the people of Omorfies will always seek the beauty of art. Starting over isn't necessarily a bad thing. What do you say, Oceanus?

114182062.content: However, what's done is done. What's important is how we deal with the consequences. If we have to build it back, then let's build it back better.

114182063.content: What my father means to say is, everything will work out okay as long as we work hard together.

114182064.content: That's not what I... Forget it. Let's go, Enlil.

114182065.content: As Oceanus and Enlil depart, Hades calls her maids over and issues them a short instruction.

114182066.content: According to the plan, there would have been a banquet tonight for all the contestants, but that's no longer possible. Looks like it'll just be the few of us...

114182067.content: My apologies, Lady Hades, but I need to stay here with the Knights of Convallaria...

114182068.content: Of course. The banquet will be held after finishing cleaning up here. All of the knights are more than welcome to join.

114182070.content: You know you're going to be punished, don't you, Ron?

114182071.content: Of course. This was all my fault.

114182072.content: You stole associations' artifacts, damaged AGI Mecha guards, and helped a Visbane infiltrate the Stellaris Temple... But seeing as you were deceived by Ladon, I think we can show you some leniency.

114182073.content: Except, you passed the examination this year only thanks to Ladon's help.

114182075.content: And Ladon did not trick you into doing that. Therefore, the Astral Council has no choice but to revoke your certificate.

114182077.content: Wasn't this the last year Ron was able to sit the examination? So by revoking his certificate, doesn't that mean...?

114182078.content: It's all right, I deserve it. I have desecrated the arts and Omorfies itself. I am not fit to be called an artist...

114182079.content: I hadn't finished. This may be a mild punishment, but you also need to be publicly reprimanded.

114182080.content: Hades walks over to Ron, who has broken out in a cold sweat, and taps him lightly on the head.

114182081.content: Tomorrow, I want you to go to the Society of Muses and bring your best work, as well as your brushes and paints.

114182083.content: What, don't you want the opportunity to show us what you really can do?

114191001.content: The Stellaris Academy has been attacked, the temple has been destroyed, and the Ardisis Ceremony has been suspended.

114191002.content: This string of catastrophes hangs over Omorfies like a dark cloud. Although investigations and reconstructions are underway, tensions are running high in the streets and alleyways.

114191003.content: It's been two days now, and they still haven't told us why those thugs did what they did. I mean, what kind of person could... It's so scary.

114191004.content: And they haven't said anything about when they'll try holding the ceremony again. I reckon it's because they haven't caught the head yet. If the ceremony's attacked again...

114191005.content: You're worrying too much. Putting on the ceremony is a lot of work, I'm sure it's going to take them more than two days to sort everything out.

114191006.content: I think the biggest issue is actually the destruction of the Stellaris Temple. I heard they didn't manage to save much from the rubble, and that was where all the symbolic works from previous ceremonies were stored. A century of art up in smoke...

114191007.content: That's true. And everyone's so on edge at the moment. It wouldn't be right to start the ceremony back up now. What's to become of Omorfies...

114191008.content: Similar conversations can be heard all over the city. The man's face darkens and he sighs sadly. But suddenly, a roadside holograph lights up.

114191009.content: It's... Oh, come and look at this!

114191010.content: It isn't just this particular holograph—all of the public holographs in Omorfies have turned on at the same time, and all are showing the same channel.

114191012.content: Hades' voice rings out from every corner of the city. People stop what they're doing and anxiously await further information.

114191013.content: Hundreds of cameras and microphones point at Hades as she speaks from the rostrum on Stellaris Academy square. Behind her stands Oceanus, his arms silently crossed.

114191014.content: The Ardisis Ceremony helped Omorfies to arise from the dark times more than one hundred years ago. Today, it is a vital part of our city's culture, one which has been passed down from generation to generation.
