114191015.content: The new order has revitalized what was once a disorderly and self-serving artistic community. Artists have made astonishing progress, and their countless masterpieces have brought glory to Omorfies.

114191016.content: Now that this tradition has suffered an unprecedented attack, we long for the ceremony that was so viciously interrupted. We mourn the destroyed artworks, and we fret for Omorfies' future.

114191017.content: But what I want you all to think about is this—what have we really lost? What is the true root of our concerns for Omorfies' future?

114191018.content: Everyone will have their own answers, and it's something I can't stop thinking about—is this "order" we use to regulate artistic expression, actually holding us back in some aspects?

114191019.content: Over the years, we've seen the artworks exhibited at the ceremony become ever more intricate, ever more exquisite, and ever more perfect. But is perfection what we really need?

114191020.content: What we can see from such perfection, was our artists' cautiousness,  their fear of failure, their fear of not receiving recognition, and their fear of expressing who they really are...

114191021.content: I'd say we have lost something. We have lost the belief our ancestors upheld during the dark times—that creation is the expression of one's truest, purest self.

114191022.content: Therefore, the Ardisis Ceremony is no longer an appropriate way for us to conceive and judge creativity. And as such, the Astral Council has decided to postpone the ceremony indefinitely until we can find a new direction we're all happy with, and until we review our hearts of art and creation.

114191024.content: That hasn't happened in the entire history of the ceremony...

114191025.content: I firmly believe that this is a step worth taking. Art is always progressing, and as we gain more experience and new techniques, our potential for creativity grows ever larger. Our predecessors paved the way for us, but that doesn't mean we should always stick to their path.

114191026.content: Omorfies needs a revolution. We should return the value of art to its true, rightful origin—authentic self-expression, instead of from a rigid set of rules. We should return the creation of art to its true, rightful origin—everyone that loves art and is willing to create art, instead of a small bunch of certificated "professionals."

114191027.content: After long discussions, the Astral Council has decided that the revolution will begin today: The age limit for passing the certification examination will now be raised to twenty-five. Furthermore, anyone who is over this limit but has made significant artistic achievements can apply to obtain certification through a special open assessment process...

114191028.content: ...In addition, although this year's ceremony has now been canceled, we have several other artistic events already on the agenda. They will give everyone in Omorfies a greater chance to learn and discuss arts.

114191029.content: One such event, our New Work Salon, will be a monthly showcase for the best new artworks that month. Submissions for entry are open now. The inaugural event is expected to be held in five days' time. There are no restrictions on who can enter or what kind of work can be submitted. The audience will act as the judges...

114191031.content: At the Stellaris Academy Ceremony Square, the Modifiers and I act as site workers during the speech.

114191032.content: Hera is responsible for the lighting, Ver for filming, Athena for the audio, Enlil for prompts, and me for directing. I've also roped Ron in to help Ver with the cameras.

114191033.content: ...Your revised speech was extremely difficult to read.

114191034.content: It was still better than the sarcastic, provocative thing you wrote originally.

114191035.content: As soon as the cameras stop rolling, Hades descends from the rostrum. She and Oceanus immediately launch into their favorite pastime of mocking each other. Everyone else acts as though they can't hear what's being said, and chat idly as they put away the equipment.

114191036.content: Ron, did you hear that? They're going to raise the age limit for the examination!

114191038.content: Thanks, everyone! I'll definitely pass next year!

114191039.content: That's the spirit! Of course you will! We believe in you, Ron!

114191040.content: Treat the salon as your mock exam. Have you finished what you were asked to paint?

114191041.content: Nearly. I don't know why, but something just feels so "right" about this piece!

114191042.content: Hera, have you been instructing him?

114191043.content: I just gave him a topic... Something only he could do.

114191044.content: I hope you didn't give him something too difficult—Ron may be talented, but he is still only a student, after all.

114191045.content: Don't be rigid! Talent and education are important, but it's inspiration and experience that make a piece of art unique.

114191046.content: Why don't you take part too? Let's see if your cello skills have gotten rusty.

114191047.content: If I'm not too busy with the knighthood works, I will!

114191048.content: Will you be taking part too, Ron? I can't wait to see your masterpiece.

114191049.content: I'm nothing compared to you, Enlil... Even my painting teachers are always saying what a gifted sculptor you are.

114191050.content: Oh no, I just picked up a few tricks from my father.

114191051.content: Excessive modesty is equivalent to arrogance, Enlil. Be more generous in accepting praise for all your hard work.

114191052.content: But my technique and creativity are miles behind yours, Father.

114191053.content: Hehe, you have become the goal of the youngsters, Oceanus.

114191055.content: Administrator, Verthandi, why don't you wait until after the Salon before going back?

114191056.content: You missed out on the Ardisis Ceremony, but we can try and make it up to you with this new salon.

114191059.content: I'm confident you'll be very impressed.

114191060.content: Five days later, the New Work Salon opens as planned. Thanks to the relaxed rules on the participants and times, the submissions come flooding in.

114191061.content: In order to provide enough space for all of them, most of the city's squares are transformed into temporary exhibition spaces. All kinds of  bold and wonderful artworks that had long been suppressed by the strict system finally get a chance for showcasing.

114191062.content: Now that the audience is the judges, the art displayed on stage is being constantly replaced with newer and better works. The Moonlight Salon quickly become the carnival of art lovers.

114191063.content: Ver and I are invited to stay in Omorfies for the salon, and our first stop is the Stellaris Academy.

114191064.content: As elsewhere, even the academy library and some other non-teaching buildings have been turned into exhibition halls, the main difference being that most of the art on display here was made by the students themselves.

114191065.content: This is the painting gallery. Let's find Ron's...

114191066.content: Admin, do you know what Ron painted?

114191067.content: Haha, I don't know, either. But there's nothing wrong with a bit of mystery—it'll add to the surprise!

114191068.content: We move through the corridor, and bump into a familiar face.

114191069.content: Hey, didn't we meet a couple of days ago?

114191070.content: You're the guests from Ain Soph, right?

114191071.content: Do all painters have this good a memory?

114191072.content: As he was the first person who spoke to us in Omorfies upon our arrival, Ver and I both recognized this young man. He'd been drawing buildings in the street.

114191073.content: Painter? I can't really call myself that...

114191074.content: Look over here. This section is all from students in my year. Their artworks are so awesome.

114191076.content: The chatty teenager points to an enormous painting. Ver and I stare up, and smile come to our faces before we even notice.

114191077.content: I mean, just look at all the details! The composition, the action, the colors... Even though it's an imaginary battle, it makes you feel like the painter was really there.

114191078.content: The painting depicts an epic battle on a sloping, crumbling stage suspended in midair, between hordes of ferocious beasts and a flame-wielding mage, a warrior surrounded by lightning, and an archer firing shooting stars.

114191079.content: And in the center of the painting stands a red-haired female knight, facing off against a flying dragon that's even larger than the stage itself. Her sword is raised and from it spouts a column of fire, lighting up the oppressive dark skies.

114191080.content:
"Daybreak"
Artist: Ron Dowles of the Stellaris Academy Painting Class

114191081.content: I thought CORG had wiped Ron's memory about what happened? How could he have painted this?

114191082.content: Maybe there were fragments of memory left... And Hera did suggest the topic to him, didn't she?

114191083.content: Ron did say he'd been having strange dreams lately. Maybe this is just him bringing his dream to life on canvas.

114191084.content: Look, this character really looks like you, Admin. But why are you wielding a bow instead of a gun?

114191085.content: The style of this piece is very much old-school fantasy—a gun would look really out of place, wouldn't it? Especially a BunBun Pistol!

114191086.content: Ah, you have a point. So that's what it means when artists talk about "background story".

114191087.content: Underneath the frame is a comment written in beautiful handwriting:

114191088.content: "Epic battles against evil dragons might not happen in real life, but the world would be a much duller place if we didn't have people dreaming up images like this. I like this painting because the artist has depicted a fictitious scene with a true heart." —Hades

114201003.content: The two people standing across from each other on the square shoulder their swords and perform the standard knight's salute.

114201004.content: One is an imposing knight, the other a petite young girl.

114201008.content: The girl raises her wooden sword, her eyes ablaze with a fighting spirit that belies her young age. Although the small sword still looks far too large for her slender frame to wield, there is not a single trace of hesitation on her face.

114201009.content: The knight, with a wooden sword of his own, does not even bother to assume a fighting pose. Why would he need to?

114201010.content: His opponent today, despite her reputation as a fearsome warrior, is so small she barely reaches up to his waist. No degree of skill could compensate for such a physical disadvantage.

114201012.content: Anyone can see the outcome of the fight coming a mile away.

114201013.content: (Not even you will be able to last that long, Athena...)

114202003.content: Everything happened so fast that everyone stands frozen in shock. The only one who hasn't moved is the young girl, who now lifts her sword.

114202004.content: She lunges forward and lays her sword on the stunned knight's shoulder.

114202005.content: The height difference means she has to stand on her tiptoes and stretch up as far as she can. Her cheeks puff with the effort, making her look like a child desperately reaching for a kite stuck in a tree.

114202006.content: Even the girl herself forgets her age sometimes.

114202008.content: That much is obvious, but Argo still grimaces hideously as he says it, as though he were the one who'd lost.

114202010.content: However, that does nothing to dampen the young girl's spirits.

114202012.content: Her stern face suddenly flushes with childlike joy.

114202013.content: Abiding by knightly etiquette, Athena steps forward and salutes her opponent.

114202014.content:
Thank you for this opportunity.
My name is Athena Pallas, a future Knight of Convallaria!

114202015.content: Although her voice still sounds like that of a child, Athena holds her head high and introduces herself with stern solemnity.

114202016.content: She stays true to her word, passing the two examinations required to become a fully-fledged Knight of Convallaria.

114202018.content: Question 1: What is the Knights of Convallaria's motto?

114202019.content: Order and beauty. To protect the beauty of Omorfies' freedom with the sword of order.

114202020.content: Who founded the Knights of Convallaria, and when?

114202021.content: The Knights of Convallaria were formed in 2216 by... Colleen Pallas.

114202022.content: Athena's chest swells with pride as she speaks her grandmother's name. Although it all happened years before Athena was born, Athena feels like she knows all of her grandmother's feats as though she'd seen them herself.

114202023.content: She didn't learn them to prepare for the exam. She learned them because she wants to be a shining beacon of grace and virtue.

114202026.content: (Who gives this adopted girl the right to take such pride in the Pallas name?)

114202027.content: (I am the rightful heir of the Pallas family, not anyone else...)

114202028.content: The knights are divided into the Knights of Convallaria and the Knights of the Lighthouse, depending on their duties. What do the Knights of the Lighthouse do?

114202029.content: The Knights of the Lighthouse are knights who are posted to different regions to... uphold the law and protect local societies.

114202030.content: Although some of these words and concepts are too difficult for the 9-year-old Athena to fully grasp, she still provides the correct answer.

114202031.content: Athena answers the next questions so perfectly that even the strictest examiner can't find anything to fault her for.

114202032.content: Hmm, Athena... I hereby declare, on behalf of the Knights of Convallaria, you have passed the first stage of the admission examination.

114202033.content: For the glory of the Knights of Convallaria!

114202034.content: Her heart thumps so loud she's worried everyone else can hear it. She just about manages to suppress the urge to jump for joy, and bows deeply instead.

114202036.content: Displeasure flashes across Argo's face. Having spent time with the girl, he understands that her bow was nothing more than perfunctory reverence to the judge, and carried no love or respect towards him, her brother.

114202037.content: Next up is the sword-fighting test. You can memorize every book backward and forward, but you won't be able to defend Omorfies if you can't swing a sword.

114202038.content: In the next round, you'll be pitted against a knight on active duty. Of course, you're not required to defeat them to pass the exam—you just need to stay on your feet.

114202039.content: Although you'll both be using wooden swords, we cannot guarantee that no injuries will occur. Are you ready, Athena? There's still time to back out if you want...

114202041.content: Unlike any other candidate, Athena's face shows no sign of surprise or hesitation upon hearing she will be fighting against a real knight for her test. Her tiny fists are clenched tightly in anticipation.

114202042.content: You lost in one move to a girl less than ten years old... I'm afraid I'll have to ask the commander to reconsider your position within the Knights of Convallaria.

114202043.content: I-I wasn't ready! She moved before the count! She cheated!

114202044.content: Silence! Do you wish to bring even more shame to the Knights?

114202045.content: Argo castigates the knight who lost to Athena, his face as dark as thunder. He then whips around to face the little girl.

114202046.content: There was definitely an element of luck in your victory, but according to the Knights of Convallaria examination rules, I hereby declare that you, Athena, have passed the second stage of the trial.

114202048.content: Do not get ahead of yourself, girl. Impatience is a poor quality for a Knight of Convallaria.

114202049.content: The Commander has requested there be one additional test. Fail, and you shall not be permitted to join the Knights.

114211001.content: (So this is where they hold the "final test", the Temple of Art...)

114211002.content: What's wrong? I thought I'd explained the test quite well enough already.

114211003.content: All you have to do is find the Pallas family treasure hidden here in the Stellaris Temple.

114211005.content: Like all other facts about the Knights of Convallaria, Athena knows the rules for the entrance examination by heart.

114211006.content: (The examination rules state very clearly that all I need to do is pass the knowledge test and the sword-fighting test...)

114211007.content: What's this test for? I didn't have anything like this when I joined... Did the Commander really come up with something like this?

114211008.content: How could Argo be so ruthless with his own sister?

114211009.content: Yeah. Either way, it makes for a good show. I can't wait to see the brat's luck finally run out.

114211011.content: Argo remains impassive as he overhears his colleagues' comments.

114211012.content: The Vice Commander of the Knights of Convallaria, who is responsible for supervising the entrance examination, storms over to Argo.

114211013.content: Argo! You can't invent your own rules just because you have some kind of private grudge!

114211014.content: I would ask you to take that groundless accusation back, Vice Commander. I am simply following the Commander's wishes to hold a fair and open examination.

114211015.content: Argo's dismissiveness makes Artemis even angrier.

114211016.content: I've never heard of an extra test!

114211017.content: It was a direct order from Commander Colleen. I suggest you take it up with her directly should you have any qualms about it.

114211018.content: Like you don't know she won't come here today!

114211019.content: I understand. I'm ready to take the test.

114211021.content: My grandmother wouldn't have hesitated in the face of a challenge.

114211022.content: She stares at the imposing doors to the Stellaris Temple. Her aquamarine eyes reflect back an image of her as a Knight of Convallaria if she passes through these doors.

114221001.content: What Athena needs to find among the countless treasures stored in the temple is the cursed jewel known as "Eyes on the Immortal Star."

114221002.content: However, Athena knows nothing of the gemstone besides its name. As far as she can remember, the jewel was no longer in the Pallas family's possession by the time she was adopted.

114221003.content: Stay calm... Assess the information... These are the basic principles of a Knight of Convallaria.

114221004.content: Since it's a Pallas family heirloom, grandmother must have spoken of it before...

114221005.content: "Family heirloom? Yes... I do recall such a treasure in our possession, before someone borrowed it and never brought it back."

114221007.content: "No, he was... a friend of mine."

114221008.content: "He borrowed it for a statue he was working on, and promised to give me the statue with the jewel inside once he was finished. But..."

114221009.content: "Even your best friends should give things back after they borrow them!"

114221010.content: "Haha, I guess you're right. But that's how he was, always running around getting himself and others into trouble..."

114221012.content: In her memory, Athena remembers the wistful, lonely look in her grandmother's eyes as she recounted the story of her friend who borrowed Eyes on the Immortal Star.

114221013.content: Grandmother said she lent the jewel to a friend for a statue he was making. That narrows things down a bit—I just need to find statues with gems in them.

114221014.content: She looks around and her heart sinks—of course somewhere like the Stellaris Temple is brimming with bejeweled statues.

114221015.content: I might as well start in the statue section.

114221016.content: A statue of a knight in shining armor towers beside the entrance to the statue gallery.

114221017.content:
Such statues are commonplace in the Stellaris Temple.
Like all the other works assembled here, they embody the talent and patience of their respective creators, and form just one part of the Stellaris Temple's artwork collection.

114221018.content: But what very few people know is that these knights are actually the silent guardians of this place, just like their living namesakes.

114221020.content: As soon as Athena enters the gallery, the statue suddenly raises its sword.

114221023.content: Athena leaps back in shock, but she quickly regains her composure. She remembers her grandmother telling her that the Stellaris Temple had recently installed security AGI Mechas made to look like knights.

114221024.content: "I should have expected no less from Lord Derian. He designed the mechas to look exactly like statues so that they wouldn't look out of place in the temple." Athena remembers the admiring look on her grandmother's face as she said this.

114221025.content: Since these are security AGI Mechas, everything should be fine as long as Athena can prove that she's not a security threat...

114221026.content: My name is Athena Pallas, a future Knight of Convallaria!

114221027.content: Without thinking, she introduces herself the way she always does. However, staring at the helmet of the security AGI Mecha, she can't help but blush slightly.

114221028.content:
Athena, Pallas... Searching...
Search complete. No matched name on the list.

114221029.content: Huh? But I'm here as part of the Knights of Convallaria entrance exam...

114221030.content: Athena Pallas is not authorized. Subject classified as... an intruder.

114231001.content:
Colleen Pallas: "What are you drawing, Athena?"

Athena: "Umm..."

Athena squeezes the marker she's using tightly. She's embarrassed to answer, because she knows that her picture is just a childlike representation of what she actually wants to draw. It's...

Colleen Pallas: "Is it a map of the Stellaris Temple? Let me see... This is the painting gallery, this is the statue gallery, here's the musical instrument section... Hmm, you've got them all in the right place..."

Colleen nods her head approvingly as she examines Athena's drawing. The young girl feels encouraged.

Colleen Pallas: "Still, why do you want to draw this?"

114231007.content:
Athena: "Because I remember you once said, if you want to defend somewhere, you need to know it like the back of your hand... So a Knight of Convallaria should memorize the map of the Stellaris Temple..."

Athena's answer brings a warm smile to her grandmother's lips.

Colleen Pallas: "Not a bad answer, Athena. Still, you're missing something on your map."

Athena: "Huh? Where?"

Colleen Pallas: "I'm afraid you'll have to find out for yourself during your next trip. But keep it in mind, Athena: something as old and majestic as the Stellaris Temple must always be treated with reverence."

Athena: "I understand, grandmother."

114231015.content: Although Athena knows the layout of the Stellaris Temple by heart, she'd never known there was a room hidden in this forgotten corner of the statue gallery.

114231016.content: Yet it's only thanks to this room that she's been able to escape the security AGI Mecha that was chasing her.

114231017.content: Once she manages to catch her breath, Athena starts inspecting the room through the darkness.

114231018.content: Unlike the other galleries, this one has no gleaming display cabinets or paintings hung neatly on the wall—it more resembles a storage area for all of the temple's junk.

114231019.content: That's not to say there aren't any artworks here. There are, but none of them are housed in display cabinets—they've either been stuffed onto shelves or even just left on the floor.

114231021.content: Just as Athena is gingerly trying to pick her way through the mess without knocking anything over, a voice suddenly calls out behind her.

114231022.content: There's someone here? Athena turns round in the direction of the voice.

114231023.content: A cloud of dust floats lazily in the sunlight streaming in through the skylight.

114231024.content: But in this dust sits a man who looks like he's perfectly at home in such strange surroundings.

114231025.content: The man looks extremely tired. It seems it's been many a day since he last tidied himself up. However, his smile lights up his face like a star.

114231026.content: Er... A visitor? It's been a very long time since the last time I took appointments.

114231027.content: Oh, I'm sorry! I didn't mean to intrude!

114231028.content: I'm the one who should feel sorry. I would have cleaned up a bit if I'd known I was going to have company. Please forgive the mess.

114231029.content: The man is sitting before an unfinished statue, which appears to be the bust of a woman.

114231031.content: It's fine. It's a good excuse to take a breather.

114231032.content: Although... You have an artist who's been working non-stop for weeks, then an elf-like girl suddenly pops up out of thin air as he starts to feel sleepy. A plot straight from a play.

114231034.content:
Athena doesn't really understand what the man is talking about.
Seeing her confusion, the man waves his hand, signaling Athena to ignore him. This just makes her feel even more guilty.

114231035.content: I didn't know there was a resident here... I-I'm so sorry, please allow me to make it up to you for interrupting your work!

114231036.content: The man is so surprised at the visitor, this young and yet sincere girl, that he cannot help but burst out laughing as though he'd just remembered a funny joke.

114231039.content: I'm sorry. It was just that serious expression on your face, and your unbending desire to shoulder the responsibility for everything... You remind me of an old friend of mine.

114231040.content: Do I also look like that friend of yours?

114231041.content: Yes. My guess is that I'm not the first person to have told you that. She's very well-known in Omorfies. In fact, you've probably heard of her—her name is Colleen Pallas.

114231042.content: The man says the name with pride, glowing with the past glories he'd experienced with his friend.

114231045.content: The man looks flabbergasted. He stares at Athena, but sees no hint of deceit in her eyes.

114231046.content: Yes, I'm Colleen Pallas' granddaughter, Athena Pallas.

114231047.content: The man frowns in thought, and his eyes follow the girl's gaze to the statue at his feet. It's the statue of Medusa that he's currently sculpting.

114231048.content: Medusa's eyes project a dazzling light in Athena's direction.

114231049.content: Granddaughter... So that's how it is.

114241002.content: Yes... Well, at least I think I am. I don't know what Colleen thinks of me.

114241003.content: Could you please tell me your name? Perhaps grandmother has mentioned you before.

114241005.content: It's a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Lucian...But I'm sorry, I don't think my grandmother has ever mentioned your name.

114241006.content: But maybe it's just I wasn't paying attention—it doesn't mean you're not her friend!

114241007.content: Heh, don't trouble yourself over it. Athena, do you mind if I ask you what you're doing here?

114241008.content: I'm looking for something. Something my grandmother said she lent to a friend, and then never got back.

114241009.content: If you borrow something and don't return it, that's robbery. Who would want a friend stealing from you like that? Athena, what was it that was taken from your grandmother?

114241010.content: A Pallas family heirloom, a jewel called Eyes on the Immortal Star.

114241011.content: What kind of person would borrow a family heirloom and forget to bring it back? What a... Wait a minute.

114241013.content: The man moves the statue in front of him until Athena can see a beautiful emerald orb embedded in its right eye.

114241014.content: I should first apologize, for it was me she lent it to.

114241015.content: Mr. Lucian! Why didn't you return it to my grandmother?

114241016.content: You see, it's not that I didn't want to return it... It's just that I haven't had time to return it yet.

114241017.content: As you can see, I live a cloistered life here for my creative work, and I need the Eyes on the Immortal Star for my creation. As soon as it's done, I'm going to give the statue to Colleen.

114241018.content: It must have taken you a very long time...

114241019.content: The gem had too many impurities in it and took me ages to fix. But now it's fine, I should be done by tomorrow! Say, would you mind taking the statue to Colleen for me?

114241020.content: Are you telling me the truth, Mr. Lucian?

114241021.content: Haha, of course! Do I look like someone who would lie to a child?

114241022.content: All right... But it's been so long since grandmother has heard from you. I think you should let her know first.

114241023.content: So long since she's heard from me... I see...

114241024.content: The man bows his head in thought, but a smile soon plays across his lips.

114241025.content: Well, think about it this way, Athena... If someone has waited so long for a promise to be kept that they've given up all hope, won't they be all the more surprised to learn it's been fullfilled?

114241026.content: Er... Was that your plan all along?

114241028.content: I see. In that case, I'll wait here until you're done.

114241030.content: (If it were just a case of an unfinished statue, why would grandmother have sent me to the temple instead of just waiting a bit longer?)

114241031.content: And so Athena waited patiently by Lucian's side. However, perhaps due to the exertion of the examination and her encounter with the mecha earlier, it's not long before Athena starts to yawn.

114241034.content: You don't need to sit so rigid and upright around here, you know. Is that something Colleen taught you?

114241035.content: One must always maintain knightly etiquette when outside of one's home...

114241036.content: Like grandmother, like granddaughter, I suppose... You were looking at some of the things lying around here. Please, feel free to take a closer look if anything takes your fancy.

114241037.content: Oh, you're too polite, Mr. Lucian, after all this is... Um, do you mean it?

114241039.content: I'll make sure to keep it quiet!

114241040.content: Make yourself at home. Just don't set your expectations too high. It's just what I did while messing around on my own—I didn't intend for anyone to ever see it.

114241041.content: You're too modest! Even I can tell that these are all precious works of art.

114241042.content: The room is in complete disarray, and unlike the galleries outside where all the artworks are arranged in neat displays designed to attract the visitor's eye, everything here has been haphazardly thrown onto shelves.

114241043.content: However, having grown up learning a thing or two about artistic appreciation, Athena immediately discerns the unique artistic value of the works strewn about the room.

114241044.content: You must be a great admirer of Ardisis, Mr. Lucian... These three pieces are all exact replicas of his works. I can't even tell the difference between yours and the real one.

114241045.content: The man merely shrugs noncommittally with an awkward smile on his face, then picks up his chisel and gets back to working on the statue.

114241046.content: Athena tiptoes around the room, lingering in front of exquisite works that have been placed with even less care than the furniture. She spots some very valuable pieces.

114241047.content: An Iris Commemorative Coin, "In Iris' Name", issued upon the founding of the Astral Council.

114241048.content: The "Sound of an Asteroid Shower" harmonica, said to have belonged to a legendary bard.

114241049.content: The "Sailor Who Drank from the Sea of a Thousand Stars", the wine glass rumored to have inspired the Omorfies folk song, The Sea of a Thousand Stars.

114241051.content: There are also some objects that Athena does not recognize at all, either from exhibitions or from books.Such as the vintage pocket watch she's staring at intently now.

114241052.content: It has a silvery, frosted cover, and a diamond-encrusted dial with the numbers written in an ancient artistic font.

114241053.content: Ah, that was a gift from a friend.

114241054.content: Athena doesn't know how long Lucian has been standing behind her.

114241055.content: Mr. Lucian... You don't need to pay attention to me like that. I'm happy just to look around by myself. Please, just pretend I'm not here.

114241056.content: Haha, it's not your fault... Knowing that someone is looking at my collection for the first time makes me want to work as a tour guide. I need a break anyhow.

114241057.content: The person who gave me this watch was an outstanding sculptor. But it's more than the superb craftsmanship that has won my favor...

114241058.content: Hey, wait for me! I said I'm sorry, Derian. Won't you talk to me?

114241059.content: The man being addressed keeps walking away without saying a word, as though he can't hear the distressed voice behind him.

114241060.content: We're going to be teammates soon. How are we going to work together in the debate if you won't even listen to me?

114241062.content: You know, people like you are the reason why the stereotype of "Omorfies Punctuality" exists.

114241063.content: Hmm... But that's not too far from the truth, right? It's not a stereotype if it's true.

114241064.content: I can see you're still trying to talk yourself out of it. Since you're so eager to express yourself, you can head up the debate today.

114241065.content: Now that's a little too far. Today's debate is a big one. If we lose, it'll cast a shadow over the future of the Astral Council—no, over the future of Omorfies itself!

114241066.content: Ah, so you do understand the importance! Then why were you still late? It's going to put us at a disadvantage right from the start.

114241067.content: Today is the third session of the debate on the Omorfies art selection process being held in Stellaris Academy Square.

114241068.content: Public opinion has reached a fever pitch. Everyone is talking about this debate to decide Omorfies' future, from newspaper headlines to late-night talk shows, from idle dinner table gossip to school examination papers.

114241069.content: Oceanus and Ardisis squabble, or, more accurately, Oceanus scolds Ardisis for his excuses for being late.

114241070.content: However, as soon as the debate begins they instantly become the best of friends.

114241071.content: Oceanus counters his opponent's arguments with unassailable logic, while Ardisis wins over the crowd with his acerbic wit.

114241072.content: Ultimately, Ardisis and Oceanus win by a landslide, their biggest penalty being for showing up five minutes late.

114241073.content: Is this... for me? But my birthday's still months away.

114241074.content: It's to remind you that time is precious. We were late to the last debate because of you, remember?

114241075.content: Of course I do. I took a long, hard look at myself after that time you told me the importance of punctuality, and I've gotten a lot better.

114241076.content: Like going from being five minutes late to four minutes late deserves a compliment! People need to learn a sense of responsibility, or at least...

114241077.content: This pocket watch is a work of art! The design of the hands, the texture of the strap... And the numbers on the dial here—is that ancient Omorfies script?

114241078.content: A piece of this complexity must have taken you ages to make. Thank you so much, old friend.

114241079.content: Ha. Its dual purpose deserved my time—it's my gift to you, and also a memento of the debate we just won against those antediluvians.

114241080.content: Why would this watch be a memento of the debate?

114241081.content: Because your tardiness was the only negative mark against our names.

114242001.content: I think that was the first time he'd ever given someone a gift. As bad-tempered as he was, he wanted to show how much our friendship meant to him.

114242002.content: I don't think that's why your friend gave you this as a gift...

114242003.content: It's a shame that I couldn't change and ended up letting him down. Otherwise, this gift for Colleen would have been finished a long time ago...

114242004.content: Is there anything else that's caught your eye? Every single item here has a fascinating story behind it.

114242005.content: But aren't I distracting you from your work?

114242006.content: It's fine, occasional pauses can be a valuable source of inspiration. Besides, once I start talking I find it rather difficult to stop, haha!

114242007.content: Er... All right, if you're sure.

114242008.content: Athena looks around briefly, and her gaze settles on a puppet.

114242009.content: What's the story behind this puppet?

114242011.content: Lucian takes the puppet down from the shelf and hands it to Athena.

114242012.content: I thought little girls of your age preferred dolls in flowery dresses.

114242013.content: The red-haired puppet is holding an enormous two-handed sword that is completely at odds with her age and size. She is... exactly how Athena pictures a knight should be.

114242014.content: Was this puppet based on my grandmother?

114242015.content:
Good afternoon, Miss Harth.
You're looking as lovely as ever. I do hope you're here to tell me you've changed your mind about joining the Astral Council?

114242018.content: A bored-looking woman is sitting behind the Puppet Society reception desk, gazing out vacantly into the afternoon sun.

114242019.content: Well, it's even more depressing here than the last time I came...

114242020.content:
Dozens of finely crafted dolls stare back from the cabinet behind the receptionist.
They're extraordinarily lifelike and beautifully dressed, but each one looks as lonely as a princess trapped in a tower.

114242021.content:
The puppet craze that swept through Omorfies was nothing more than a gust of wind—it came and went.
And I don't mind closing the society down if people have no need for it.

114242022.content:
People still like puppets, as far as I know.
But your craftsmanship is too far ahead of its time, none can even attempt to hold a candle to you. And as time has gone on, everyone has simply stopped trying. They've left the industry altogether.

114242023.content: Oh really? But I think we're still so far from achieving everything puppets are capable of. And I'm including myself in that.

114242024.content: I have heard that you have hand-built over three hundred combat puppets, Miss Harth. Are you trying to build an army?

114242025.content: In the know, aren't you? But hasn't anyone ever told you it's not necessarily a good thing to know too much?

114242026.content: Do you have to give me that frightening look on your face, Miss Harth?

114242027.content: All I am doing is improving my craft. What you see here are merely prototypes and failed attempts that I've kept as souvenirs. They aren't meant for anything. The Knights of Convallaria have nothing to worry about.

114242028.content: Oh, don't be silly! We have always trusted you, Miss Harth.

114242029.content: Hmm, improving your craft... But you're already at the top of your game—maybe you would make a bigger breakthrough if you turned your attention to something other than combat applications.

114242030.content: Hmph. And you have a suggestion?

114242031.content: I do, as it so happens. How about this: making a puppet that's fierce in combat, but looks all cute and innocent on the outside? For example, it could be dressed up as a maid.

114242032.content: A design like that would detract from the puppet's combat performance, and would conflict entirely with its actual purpose.

114242033.content: Exactly. But I believe you'd enjoy overcoming these challenges, Miss Harth.

114242034.content: Harth grins as though she's just heard something amusing.

114242035.content: I can see you're already thinking about it.

114242036.content: Tell you what, let's put our puppet-making skills to the test in a little competition. If my puppet wins, you'll join the Astral Council and give up the thought of closing down the Puppet Society.

114242037.content: Ardisis... You have reached the pinnacle in so many artistic fields. Still, though I mean you no offense, there's no way you can surpass me with such an impulsive, ill-thought-out venture when it comes to puppetry.

114242038.content: Perhaps I'm being impulsive, perhaps I'm not. Let me tell you a secret, Miss Harth. I have been a massive fan of your puppet store on Democritus Boulevard ever since the day it opened.

114242040.content: With all that being said, if you don't feel like a puppet massacre show, why not try my other suggestion and work on other interesting applications besides combat performance?

114242042.content: Excellent! Then I'll craft a puppet inspired by the most powerful knight I can think of to compete with yours.

114242044.content: Did you win in the end, Mr. Lucian?

114242047.content: But she showed mercy to my work in the end. Had she not, Colleen's puppet would have been damaged beyond repair.

114242048.content: Now that I look closely, I can see quite a few scratches and cracks where it's been repaired...

114242049.content: Colleen! I... can't go on. You win.

114242050.content: It's not exactly fair that you have two puppets against my one!

114242051.content: The challenger merely stated that there was a time limit on making the puppets.

114242052.content: No limit was placed on the number of puppets made.

114242054.content: You also taught them to speak? ...I concede defeat. I could only build one puppet in the same time it took you to do all that.

114242055.content: With a heavy heart, I bid you goodbye, Miss Harth...

114242058.content: While you admittedly never stood a chance of defeating me, your puppet did impress me.

114242059.content: Is everyone in the Astral Council like you? Stay for a cup of tea and tell me more about it.

114242060.content: Then my friend abandoned her plans to close down the puppet store, and I achieved my initial goal.

114242061.content: Lucian's gaze returns to the puppet, his expression full of nostalgia.

114242062.content:
You know, that duel was probably the only battle that Commander Colleen Pallas ever lost...
I let her down.

114242063.content: ...I don't think that counts as one of my grandmother's battles. But thank you for making such a beautiful puppet of her, Mr. Lucian.

114242064.content: I'm very interested in how you translated her appearance when she was young into a blueprint, then gradually built it into a real thing...

114242065.content: You've even managed to replicate the way she wields her sword, and how she's recovered from many a fierce battle...

114242066.content: Indeed, the puppet bears many small scars, easy to miss unless one were to look at it closely. They have obviously been tended to with the same care someone would use when handling delicate flowers.

114242067.content: It seems like you and grandmother were very good friends.

114242068.content: Lucian doesn't answer. He stares softly at the puppet in silence.

114242070.content: Athena does not wish to interrupt his reminiscence, so she joins him in his silence.

114242071.content: Time seems to stand still in the secret room. However, the flow of time has never held much significance in this ethereal space.

114242072.content: A sharp voice suddenly rings out, shattering the silence.

114242073.content: Hey, I thought you were in a hurry? You sure about squandering your time like this doing nothing?

114242075.content: Athena's hand instinctively goes to draw her sword—it would be classed as a short sword for an adult, but in her small hands it seems much weightier.

114242076.content: She grips the hilt tightly and guards Lucian next to her on alert.

114242078.content: A quick scan of the room reveals no one else there besides her and Lucian.

114251001.content: That was astonishing. The speed of your reaction just now, and the way you unsheathed your sword, reminded me exactly of Colleen...

114251002.content: You're going to make an outstanding Knight of Convallaria one day. Just like your grandmother.

114251003.content:
No, grandmother wouldn't have let her guard down like that...
I'm sorry, I don't deserve that praise.

114251004.content: Ardisis looks at Athena in admiration, only to find her drop her head guiltily.

114251005.content: That voice you heard was just a mirror.

114251007.content: More precisely, it's a mirror with a lovestruck boy trapped inside who claims his girlfriend betrayed him.

114251008.content: Hey, you'd have been so lonely here all this time if you didn't have me to talk to. I think the least you could do to thank me is let me out.

114251009.content: I've told you before, I'm an ancient Omorfies mirror spirit! Release me, and I can make all of your wishes come true!

114251010.content: The mirror that calls itself Ladon doesn't seem to notice Athena is there. The whole time, he is focused solely on Lucian.

114251011.content: The sculptor had never really paid Ladon much attention, except to occasionally mock him when he goes to stretch a bit.

114251012.content: Excuse me? I've told you so many stories. Is a word of thanks too much to ask for?

114251013.content: ...Huh? What are you doing? Wait wait wait, hey!

114251014.content:
With a grin, Ardisis covers the mirror with a dusting cloth.
The sharp voice becomes muffled, as though Ladon has been gagged.

114251015.content: Would you like to go for a stroll with me, Athena?

114251016.content: A stroll? Do you mean in the rest of the Stellaris Temple, or outside?

114251017.content:
Despite her misgivings, Athena follows Lucian's footsteps.
Athena feels sorry for him after seeing him stumble along and decides to offer her help.

114251019.content: Haha, do I really seem so frail?

114251020.content: It's just that you look... You're grandmother's close friend, so I need to look after you.

114251021.content: Lucian opens the door and Athena's jaw almost hits the ground in amazement.

114251023.content: The outside of the room isn't how she remembers it. They appear to now be standing in a strange mansion.

114251024.content:
Strange furniture. Strange decorations. Strange light.
However, the bizarre surroundings do give off a sense of familiarity.

114251025.content: What's the matter? This is my home.

114251026.content: But I entered that room from the Temple of Art...

114251027.content: The Temple of Art... sounds like a very prestigious art gallery. But you're right, I've long felt that living in such a big place all by myself is a bit excessive.

114251028.content: Hmm... Perhaps I'll turn it into an exhibition space. After all, I don't really own much besides art collections.

114251029.content: (What's going on? Is this a dream?)

114251030.content: Athena, could you do something for me?

114251033.content: You're going to agree before even knowing what it is? I know I probably shouldn't say this, seeing as I'm the one making the request, but if you agree to everything too readily, you might end up regretting it.

114251034.content: You're my grandmother's friend, so I don't think you would ask for anything too outrageous. Besides...

114251035.content: Grandmother says that a Knight of Convallaria should always put others' needs first.

114251036.content: Is that so? Well, that does sound like something Colleen would say.

114251037.content: Lucian sighs gently, and once again sees his old friend in Athena.

114251040.content:
Good evening, Lord Lucian.
The mansion and grounds have been inspected. Nothing unusual to report.

114251041.content: I didn't think there would be. By the way, Colleen... I suppose there's really no need to call me by that fake name when we're alone in here, don't you agree?

114251042.content: I'm sorry, Lord Lucian, that I cannot do.

114251043.content: Were I to drop my guard and call you by your real name, I would essentially be handing you on a plate to any assassins that might be hiding nearby.

114251044.content: That's why I plan to use every opportunity to practice calling you Lord Lucian. It needs to become a reflex. That's the only way to ensure nothing can go wrong.

114251045.content: Fine, fine, I guess you're right.

114251046.content: It's getting late. Why don't you go to bed, Colleen?

114251047.content: The Astral Council has ordered me to keep your home safe. I will not abandon my duty for even a minute.

114251048.content: You should go to bed, however. You need a good night's sleep for the lectures and classes tomorrow.

114251049.content: I fell asleep ages ago. I just got up to use the bathroom.

114251050.content: As if to prove he's not lying, Ardisis raises his arms to show Colleen them in the pajamas.

114251052.content: For a second, Colleen cannot help but smile, but she regains her professional composure with remarkable speed.

114251053.content:
I see. I'll continue my patrols.
Please, go back to your room, Lord Lucian.

114251054.content: You're not an AGI Mecha, Colleen. Even if it is a council mission, you still need to sleep.

114251055.content: I'm fine. Now's not the time for rest.

114251056.content: As expected, the knight flatly rejects his suggestion.

114251057.content: You have suffered two assassination attempts in recent days... Although the culprits were thwarted, it proves just how vigilant we need to be.

114251058.content: Well, it's a good thing you've taught me some self-defense. Now at least they can't kill me without a fight.

114251059.content:
There're other works requiring your attention, Lord Lucian.
Please, leave the job to the Knights of Convallaria.

114251060.content:
And please don't worry about me.
This mission is nothing compared to the Knights' survival training.

114251061.content:
Unless my excessive focus on your safety is unduly disrupting your life. Is that so, Lord Lucian?
My deepest apologies. Please do not hesitate to point out any shortcomings or inconveniences.

114251062.content: Yes, it is quite disruptive actually.

114251064.content: Colleen, could you do something for me?

114251066.content: Slightly taken aback by Colleen's willingness to agree to anything without hesitation, Ardisis' lips curl up in a smile.

114251068.content: I want you to take a break. Go to bed—and that's an order.

114251069.content: Certainly sir, right a... Wait, what?!

114251070.content: What's the matter? You just said you'd do whatever I asked.

114251072.content: Ardisis sighs helplessly at the sight of the knight's indignation.

114251073.content:
It's a biological fact that if a human goes without sleep for over 24 hours, it begins to adversely affect their concentration and reaction speed.
How do you know you'll be alert enough to protect me this way?

114251075.content: Are you still not convinced? But you promised me. And I thought a promise was a sacred thing to a Knight of Convallaria.

114251077.content: Although there was still reluctance in her voice, the stubborn knight bows her head in a sign of obedience.

114251078.content: Well that settles it. You may take whichever room in the mansion you'd like. You're more than welcome to take my super king bed with velvet sheets. I'll be fine with the guest room...

114251079.content: No need. I will sleep on the sofa in the living room.

114251081.content: That way, if anyone were to break in, I'll be right here to deal with it.

114251083.content: Although he can sense Colleen is still on edge, he knows this is still a big concession for her to make.

114251084.content:
After bidding her good night, he turns and climbs the stairs to his bedroom.
After a few minutes, he tiptoes back downstairs again, this time with a blanket in his hand.

114251086.content: Although Colleen had refused to lie down on the sofa, her head is leaning gently against the top of the armrest, as though she had fallen asleep nestled under a great tree. Her stiff shoulders are slightly less tense, the corners of her mouth are relaxed, and a soft, delicate snore can be heard.

114251087.content: You really were tired, weren't you?

114251088.content: It's no surprise—as far as he knows, Colleen hadn't slept for three days.

114251089.content: Ardisis drapes the blanket over Colleen as softly as he can. Her eyelashes begin to flutter rapidly, but she does not awaken.

114251092.content: (Hehe, she clearly hasn't conditioned her reflexes enough for when she's sleeping.)

114251093.content: Colleen gave her all for Omorfies, and I... I owe her a lot, too. But I don't know whether I'll ever be able to finish the gift I promised her.

114251094.content: If you owe her so much, then please, see it through!

114251095.content: People have long said that the Eyes on the Immortal Star is cursed, that it brings misfortune to its owner. Colleen has told me dark tales of the gem. She even said she'd once considered throwing it away.

114251096.content: However, she didn't want anyone else to find it and be afflicted with bad luck. Colleen decided that this burden was the Pallas family's duty to bear.

114251097.content: But... how can something like this be anybody's duty? It is human nature to strive towards the light, no matter how deep they fall into the dark.

114251099.content: It took me much longer than anticipated to remove all of its impurities. There were some mishaps along the way, but I still managed to get it done in time...

114251100.content: What do you mean, "in time," Mr. Lucian? Surely there's no rush for you to finish it?

114251101.content: ...Athena, do you remember our agreement when you first arrived?

114251103.content: As she says so, Athena instinctively straightens her back, resuming her posture as a knight.

114251104.content:
If, and I'm saying if, I don't have the strength to leave this room once I've finished the statue...
Will you be able to take it to Colleen for me?

114252001.content: I think you need some rest first, Mr. Lucian...

114252002.content: Although Athena had done her best not to disturb Lucian's work, his long stints in front of the statue worry her deeply.

114252003.content:
I'm fine...
Let's just say I'm fine now. In fact, I've never been better...

114252004.content: But you don't seem to be in good shape...

114252005.content: You've got the wrong impression. For an artist, combustion of creativity is the only vital sign that matters…

114252007.content:
Lucian's face has drained of all color, yet he refuses to drop his carving knife.
Athena rushes over to help, but all she can do is silently pass him a cup of water.

114252008.content: ...Thank you, Athena. I feel much better now.

114252009.content: I really think you should lie down for a while...

114252011.content: Lucian cuts her off in a calm voice.

114252012.content: I am a man pursued by time. I cannot rest... Otherwise, I'll be caught.

114252013.content: Lucian's tone remains calm, but Athena senses an undercurrent of perseverance.

114252014.content: As if in mockery, the unassuming mirror in the corner begins to speak again.

114252015.content:
Who are you trying to impress here, exactly?
If you keep this up, you're never going to finish your precious statue in time, heeheehee!

114252016.content: No one asked for your opinion!

114252017.content: Although Lucian's life is like a sputtering candle, his determination is strong enough to pull him through—a determination that denies all mockery and scorn.

114252018.content: However, the person in the mirror still doesn't seem like he can hear Athena.

114252019.content: Let's make a deal, Mr. Artist. You get me out of this mirror, and I'll help you feel better.

114252020.content: I can do it with a snap of my fingers. What do you say? You have no idea how lucky you were to run into me. What's with the hesitation?

114252021.content: Don't listen to him, Mr. Lucian!

114252022.content:
Although Athena wants nothing more in the world than to help Lucian, she has a bad feeling about the voice in the mirror.
Her gut feeling tells her that he's up to no good.

114252023.content: Lucian simply smiles wanly, and continues with his work as though there's nothing wrong.

114252025.content: Snubbed, Ladon finally decides to be quiet. However, the strange light continues to emanate from the mirror.

114252026.content: (I'm used to waiting after all. Let's see who cracks first...)

114261001.content: Time appears to have frozen still in the silent room.

114261002.content: The silence is not complete, of course: there is the ceaseless scraping of the carving knife against wet plaster, as well as rustling sounds coming from various points in the room, Athena's sounds.

114261003.content: (This needs cleaning, and this... And here... And there...)

114261004.content: (Hmm, Mr. Lucian's coughing seems to have improved.)

114261005.content:
To make herself useful to Lucian, Athena had gone into the mansion to find cleaning supplies.
In order to make as little noise as possible, she takes only a damp cloth, which she is now using to wipe the dusty shelves and mop up the dirt from the floor.

114261006.content: She figured that perhaps dusting the room a little would help Mr. Lucian's cough.

114261008.content: Only when she feels that the air is finally clean enough to breathe through her nose does Athena decides to stop for a rest.

114261009.content: Lucian is still completely absorbed in the carving. It's as though nothing else exists in the world for him.

114261010.content: (Such concentration... But I really should convince him to take a break now.)

114261011.content: Just as Athena has resolved to resort to more physical measures to force Ardisis to take a break...

114261013.content:
He suddenly throws down his knife, sits up straight, and stares intently at the Medusa before him.
The statue's deep and mysterious "eyes" stare back.

114261016.content: He doesn't seem to hear Athena.

114261017.content: Like a mountain climber who has finally reached the summit to see the sunrise, all of his emotions and hardships condense into tears in his eyes.

114261020.content: The emotion spreads to the young girl standing beside him.

114261021.content: Perhaps in relief that his physical and mental burden has finally been lifted, Lucian lets out a long sigh as the accumulated fatigue floods over him. Now that he knows his work is complete, his consciousness takes full leave of him.

114261022.content: He sways to and fro, like a tower with a building block removed, and begins to fall to the ground.

114261024.content:
As he falls, Lucian's arm brushes against the cloth he'd used to silence the talkative mirror.
The mirror clatters to the ground and cracks.

114261026.content:
Like a flash, Athena rushes to catch Lucian before he hits the floor and hurts himself.
Her reaction speed is impressive even by a knight's standards.

114261028.content: She shouts as loud as she can, but Lucian does not stir.

114261029.content: Athena forces herself to calm down. She checks his heartbeat and breathing, and then hoists the man who's almost twice her height onto her shoulders. She prays that he's only collapsed due to exhaustion.

114261030.content: Okay... First I'll get him to bed... Then I'll go for help...

114261031.content: Athena carries Lucian towards the exit one wobbly step at a time.

114261033.content: With all her energy and attention focused on her unconscious friend, Athena fails to notice the dreamlike figure materializing in the room behind her.

114261034.content: You know what they say, all work and no play...

114261035.content: But would you listen to me? I was genuinely trying to help you. This is what you get for ignoring others' kindness.

114261036.content:
What had once been a disembodied voice trapped in a mirror has now taken physical form.
If Athena were to look behind her, she would see a teenager in shackles, stretching out his back with satisfaction.

114261037.content: Since you refused my offers, I have no choice but to ask you to die now!

114261038.content: The noise of someone fast approaching finally catches Athena's attention. She turns around to face the oncoming attack.

114261041.content: Ladon tilts his head, puzzled. His eyes narrow, as though failing to comprehend Athena's presence.

114261042.content: That's my question. Who are you? There wasn't anyone else here a minute ago...

114261043.content: I've been here the whole time, but you didn't pay attention to me until now!

114261044.content: (Why can he suddenly see me now? He could only see Mr. Lucian before... Is it because I'm carrying Mr. Lucian on my back?)

114261045.content: Interesting... The knight in shining armor turns out to be nothing but a silly little girl.

114261046.content: Don't underestimate me—I'm a future Knight of Convallaria!

114261047.content: What's a Knight of Convallaria? Oh... I remember now! They're the jerks who destroyed the wonderful world I'd created!

114261049.content: If I hadn't been tricked by that Modifier and trapped in this damned mirror, there's no way you would have been able to touch the paradise I created!

114261050.content: Well, that's decided. Before I find the Modifier, I'm going to kill each and every last one of you reformists!

114261051.content: I have no idea what you're babbling on about, but grandmother Colleen... Mr. Ardisis... you cannot tarnish the names of these people who have given their all for Omorfies!

114261052.content: Despite carrying a man several times her own weight on her shoulder, Athena's voice still rings out strong and clear.

114261053.content: Interesting, very interesting! Listen well, Minions! My strength has not yet fully recovered, so you're going to have to teach this brat a lesson for me!

114261054.content: I don't care if I'm in a dream, but I'm not going to lose to the likes of you!

114262002.content: What's wrong? I haven't even finished warming up yet!

114262004.content: Why are my attacks so slow? Why can't I keep up with him?!

114262005.content: Despite Athena's iron resolve and fighting spirit, Ladon is simply far too strong for her.

114262006.content: (Forgive me, grandmother... I'm sorry, Mr. Lucian...)

114262007.content: (If only I'd trained harder. If only I were a little stronger...)

114262008.content: I know you're just a sniveling little kid, but I have a feeling you're going to cause me a lot of headaches in the future if I let you go.

114262009.content: Funny, I was just thinking the exact same thing.

114262010.content: Although she knows she's no match for her opponent, Athena remains in combat position, her sword drawn.

114262011.content: Haha, it's almost cute how stubborn you are. Unfortunately, play time's over...

114262015.content: No one had noticed, but Lucian managed to prop himself up against a nearby wall.

114262016.content: Staggering, he reaches out his hand and gently places his palm on Ladon's shoulder. Such a simple movement.

114262017.content: An indescribable force surges from Lucian's body and zaps Ladon like a thunderbolt.

114262018.content: AAAARGH! You...! What are you doing to me?! Aaargh!

114262019.content: Ladon's face is contorted in agony.

114262020.content: You, did you break the mirror on purpose? I won't forget this. Aaaaaargh!

114262021.content: With a final shriek, Ladon dissipates into a plume of black smoke that rushes out the door.

114262025.content: Having fought off Ladon, Lucian has slumped back against the wall in a coughing fit. His face is drained of all color.

114262026.content: I'm sorry... for dragging you into this... I thought... I could hold on for longer...

114262028.content: It's a special kind of creature. I've seen one once before, when I was with a friend. I don't know why, but my body seems to repel them for some reason. I just have to touch them, and they go up in smoke like that... (Cough cough!)

114262030.content: That one was much stronger than the one I encountered last time. But judging from the looks of it, it'll probably take a very long time to recover. It might even lose its memories or go insane.

114262031.content: ...Athena, do you remember the mission I entrusted to you?

114262032.content: Of course. But if I leave you like this, I'll be worried...

114262033.content: Our meeting is nothing more than a dream, and your help isn't gonna change it, I'm afraid. But please make sure Colleen receives my gift, so my soul may rest in peace.

114262034.content: Athena doesn't quite understand what Ardisis means, but the last thing she wants is to ask questions that might cost him more energy.

114262035.content: She follows his gaze, and walks over to the newly completed statue.

114262036.content:
"My fate has never smiled upon me. I've suffered from this illness ever since I was a child. To tell the truth, it's a miracle that I've managed to live for so long..."

"The other children at school never wanted to hang out with the sick kid, so I shut myself away in a room with just my imagination for company, waiting for death to finally come and claim me..."

"But one day, somebody told me that the art I'd created could sweep away the darkness that had befallen Omorfies, and they brought me out of my isolation."

"I met someone who believed in me, right when I was at my lowest point. When I was denounced and attacked, she drew her sword to protect me. They sacrificed their lives and their ideals so that I could speak."

"I never thought I'd be lucky enough to meet such an interesting, loyal group of friends, let alone have the chance to fight alongside them to make the world a better place."

114262041.content:
"But we humans are never satisfied..."

"I started thinking, if I were healthier, would I be able to keep watch over this era for longer? Would I be able to leave more art for posterity? Would I be able to see my friends for longer?"

"Would I be able to... voice the thoughts I dare not speak?"

"(*sigh*)… Haha, maybe I'm asking for too much."

114271002.content: Athena picks up the Medusa bust with both hands. Time's tempo quickens as it plays a series of flashbacks, while the gears of logic crunch against the change in the clock's direction.

114271003.content: Parallel lines, which should never have met, are erased and redrawn in their original paths.

114271006.content: Athena subconsciously calls out to someone she was desperately worried about a few seconds ago.

114271007.content: However, there is no living thing around her to respond to her call.

114271008.content: She has the inexplicable sense that, even though she's in the same room, everything has changed. The air, the temperature, the way the dust is floating in the air...

114271009.content: Even the statue she was just carrying is now neatly placed on a shelf and covered with a clean cloth.

114271010.content: What was all that? Just a daydream or...?

114271011.content: She lifts the cloth and sees her face reflected in the inlaid gemstone. Despite her misgivings, she picks up the statue and runs to the door.

114271012.content: When she pushes it open, she's back in the Stellaris Temple she knows so well.

114271013.content: But she also sees something else that makes her instinctively draw her breath—the knight statue which had chased her earlier.

114271014.content: (I'm not going to let you stop me now!)

114281001.content: She's been gone too long, hasn't she?

114281003.content: You lied from the very beginning, didn't you? The extra test and all the rest! There's no way Commander Colleen would send Athena to such a dangerous task!

114281004.content: Vice Commander, I have no desire for any more of your baseless accusations.

114281005.content:
The sun is beginning to set in the sky. It has been five hours since Athena entered the Stellaris Temple for her extra test.
Five hours since the last time anyone saw or heard her.

114281006.content: Even if this extra test was real, there must have been a time limit. I say the examination is over. We need to go in and look for the girl!

114281007.content: The Commander said nothing of time limits.

114281008.content: Enough of this joke! You'll be surprised to learn what I'll do if something really happens to Athena!

114281010.content: Your threats fright me not, Artemis: if you attempt to interfere with the Knights of Convallaria's examination, as the acting examiner, I shall sanction you right on the spot.

114281011.content: If it's a fight you want, then I'll give it to you right here, right now!

114282001.content:
Argo: "Happy birthday, Athena. Here's your present."

Athena: "Thank you, Argo... Oh..."

Argo: "What's the matter?"

Athena: "No, it's nothing..."

Athena reluctantly takes the teddy bear Argo offers to her, but her big, round eyes are fixated on the sword hanging from his belt.

Argo: "...I give up. Here, you can borrow it for a little while. But it's heavy, so be careful."

Athena: "Thank you, Argo!"

114282008.content:
Argo: "Y-you can... lift it?"

Athena: "Congratulations, Argo! You've become the most handsome knight ever of the Knights of Convallaria!"

Argo: "Oh, it was nothing. The exam was a bit harder than in previous years, but I'd reviewed so it was fine. Now you can tell all your friends that I'm an official..."

Athena: "I want to be a knight when I grow up too!"

Argo: "What? Athena, it's not easy to become a knight. Do you even understand what it entails? We've already got me to continue the Pallas family tradition of knighthood, you don't need to..."

114282013.content:
The young girl ignores her older brother, and instead starts swishing her wooden sword through the air, her eyes gleaming fiercely.

Argo: "Athena..."

The time comes when Athena is no longer the baby sister who follows her brother around everywhere he goes like a lost puppy.

He thinks she just wants to play-act at being a knight, and doesn't realize how serious she is.

All of the dolls and stuffed animals in her room are gradually replaced by wooden swords, shields, armor, and all manner of books that young children don't usually understand.

Argo: "Athena, you chose this path... And this examination is simply the first of many trials you will encounter, and it's nothing compared to the hardships you will face in the future."

Argo: "I know you'd be furious if someone else cut your exam short!"

114282023.content: The woman's calm voice instantly quells their argument as if by magic following her sudden appearance.

114282024.content: Argo, open the gates to the temple.

114282025.content: Lady Selene, I swear in the name of Convallaria that Commander Colleen personally appointed me to the task. We were only following orders.

114282026.content: I'm aware of that... But I have Astral Council affairs to attend to, for which I must seek entrance to the temple.

114282027.content: But... the Knights of Convallaria entrance examination is still in progress.

114282028.content: I don't recall any examination taking this long before. Our patience is limited, and I have an urgent council matter to attend to.

114282029.content: But... All right. It has never been a knight's duty to question the order from the Fifth of the Astral Council.

114282031.content: Two knights standing guard walk over to the temple entrance, but before their hands can reach it, a rumbling sound comes from the other side.

114282034.content: The Knights of Convallaria candidate... Athena Pallas... has completed her examination!

114282035.content: Carrying the statue that's oversized for her in one arm, and propping herself up on her battle-worn sword with the other, Athena stumbles out of the temple door looking as though she has not one ounce of strength left in her.

114282036.content: Behind her is a heavily damaged AGI Mecha. It's almost impossible to fathom how this little girl could have defeated an enemy so much stronger than her with just that one sword.

114282037.content: Athena! I'm so glad you made it out safely!

114282038.content:
The distraught Vice Commander rushes over to embrace her as soon as she steps over the temple threshold.
She doesn't even seem to notice that the rigid stone statue Athena's holding is pressing against her belly.

114282039.content:
By the letter of the rules, you have exceeded the time limit for sure.
However, the Commander did not specify on the duration, therefore I declare that you have qualified.

114282040.content: Argo's face remains expressionless as he announces Athena's result. No one notices that his clenching fists finally open, sweat trickling down from his palms.

114282041.content: Thank you... Could I... trouble you with a plea?

114282043.content: I would like to request to borrow this statue from the Stellaris Temple.

114282044.content: You've already passed the exam. What do you want it for?

114282045.content: Request approved. The rules only mention restrictions on display items, and this statue isn't one of them. Just make sure you return it soon.

114282048.content: For a second, Argo looks as though he's about to explode in rage, but he quickly masters his emotions and answers Athena calmly.

114282049.content: The Commander has never missed the entrance examinations, but today she has to leave to honor a close friend because of the anniversary of his death.

114291001.content: I didn't think anyone else would come to visit him today.

114291002.content: He's a household name in Omorfies. Of course many would wish to come.

114291003.content: The woman in a cloak places a bouquet of flowers in front of the ordinary tombstone, and strikes up a conversation with the person who was here when she arrived.

114291004.content: You don't sound like you're from Omorfies. He is commemorated on another day—Few know the actual day he died, let alone where his grave lies.

114291005.content: Is that so? Does that not make me suspicious then? Are you going to detain me and take me back for questioning?

114291006.content: No, I can tell you come here with no malicious intent. If you did, I doubt you'd have only bought flowers.

114291007.content: Was it his wish to be buried here?

114291008.content: Yes, he always said that crowded places were not to his liking. Of course, his position didn't allow him the freedom to act in accordance with his preference. This place, at least, can grant him the peace he deserved.

114291009.content: Can you tell me about him? I'm... a big admirer of his. It took a lot of research for me to find this place.

114291010.content: A pity that I'll never get the chance to speak to him.

114291012.content: He... accomplished many great deeds. His story takes up at least two-thirds of the records in any history book you will find here.

114291013.content: Carrying out reforms under the threat of daggers and swords, inspiring a nation with his artworks, and guiding us forward after the daybreak... The life he lived seemed to be lifted straight out of a play.

114291014.content: Of course his life wasn't all smooth sailing. For example, he lost a priceless artwork to an innkeeper in a bet, arrived late to the most crucial debate of his life, and failed in an art contest against a frustrated puppeteer...

114291015.content: As she spoke, the elderly knight's steely expression gradually softened, until there was even a nostalgic smile at the corners of her mouth.

114291016.content: When someone is elevated to a deity, people often forget that they live and breathe as anyone else does. Yet, aside from his occasional complaints to those close to him, he never failed to live up to the lofty standards expected of him...

114291017.content: He lost the artwork to the innkeeper so that the inn could sustain itself and keep relieving the poor. He was late to the debate because he had already pushed himself past the breaking point.

114291018.content: He even risked his status to establish a private art competition so that he could motivate the artist he admired, paying the damage to his reputation no mind, and... failed miserably. Haha!

114291019.content: A fascinating person indeed. Makes me wonder why I haven't read any of these stories from the records.

114291020.content: Because people always prefer what they wanted him to be rather than what he was.

114291021.content: But as far as I'm concerned, the man I know had always been the same Lucian, the one whom I vowed to protect, whom I spent decades with, and whom I came here for today.

114291022.content: I have no regrets for the past, but I do miss him sometimes... It's just... If only I had realized it sooner.

114291025.content: Hello Athena, how did your examination go? Huh? What is that?

114291026.content: The cloaked woman has left, and Colleen is about to head home herself when she sees Athena hobbling toward her, heaving what appears to be a stone statue.

114291027.content: Grandmother, I... I passed the exam. I'm now a Knight of Convallaria just like you.

114291028.content: That's my girl! But... I only asked you to acquire the Eyes on the Immortal Star—you didn't have to bring it to me.

114291029.content: I know... I didn't bring it because of the exam, but because... I made a promise to someone.

114291032.content: Despite her training as a Knight of Convallaria, Colleen is shaken to hear that name coming from her granddaughter's mouth.

114291034.content: Colleen recovers her composure and sighs. Although the surprise lingers on her open lips, the color quickly comes back to her cheeks. Seeing the glittering green jewel embedded in the statue, she begins to understand.

114291035.content: I met Mr. Lucian in the temple, but then so many bizarre things happened I think maybe... it was all a dream or something.

114291036.content: It's all right, Athena... Tell me, what was this promise you made?

114291037.content: Mr. Lucian wanted me to deliver this Medusa statue to you, because he was the one who borrowed the Eyes on the Immortal Star and he'd promised to return it to you.

114291038.content: He also wanted me to tell you that while he might be a procrastinator, he's not a liar... And that it's a shame a gem with a name as pretty as Eyes on the Immortal Star is thought to be cursed.

114291039.content: So he borrowed it to remove all of the impurities within before returning it to you... To show you that no gem, no family, no person can be forever cursed and bound to their fate.

114291040.content: Were these... his words for real?

114291041.content: I mean, I could have simply dreamt it all up.

114291043.content: I don't think so... I don't really remember. I'm sorry, grandmother. I bet I sound ridiculous right now.

114291044.content: It's fine, the examination must have been taxing for you. Go home and get the rest you deserve.

114291047.content: The Commander takes the statue from Athena, and holds it close to her chest. Her green eyes stare straight into the inlaid gemstone, imperceptibly filled with tears.

114291048.content: Athena, as if she just recalled something important, comes back to the graveyard.

114291049.content: Grandmother, I just remembered something... Mr. Lucian did say one last thing.

114291050.content: He said that Eyes on the Immortal Star is a pretty name, but feels somewhat cold and distant. So he said that, since he has now removed all the impurities from it, it should have a different name. He thought it should be called... Immortal Star in Thy Eyes.

115011001.content:
Rostach's antiquated lighting system leaves countless pockets of darkness when night falls.
