Between the sparse pools of light, evils fester.

115011002.content: However, occasionally there are fervent believers in "justice" who also choose to hide among these shadows.

115011003.content: For them, the rulers who bring the light are just as evil as the things that dwell in the dark.

115011004.content: Why didn't you turn the lamps on? We're talking real business here, not shabby works to be kept in the dark.

115011005.content: Cut it! The old fart must not find out what I'm about to tell you, you hear me?!

115011006.content: Calm down. Marduk may have complete control over the Akkadian Guild, but he's not the type to plant agents everywhere.

115011007.content: Besides, it's about justice, about something we have to do, isn't it? All the more fitting to talk in the light.

115011008.content: There's a few seconds of silence, but Kingu agrees with the proposal nevertheless.

115011010.content: In the dim glow, the person sitting opposite Kingu leans forward to better see the young man's face.

115011011.content: An expression lacking somewhat in maturity, but making up for it with resolve.

115011012.content: I've looked into your leads. The old fart's definitely working with CORG under the table.

115011013.content: He's involved in pretty much everything: CORG's lockdown on Rostach, their management, and ban on development...

115011014.content: CORG is the very reason why Rostach ended up like a hellhole! And now the old fart is still licking their boots?

115011015.content: I was just as surprised when I learned the news. Have you asked him personally? I'm curious about his story.

115011016.content: No, I don't want to spook anyone around. We're not getting anything from him even if we ask the question in person.

115011019.content: I'm not that kiddo who knows nothing other than following him around anymore. I'll seize power for myself and make him pay for his betrayal.

115011020.content: Really? Well, your decision aligns perfectly with my own interests. You have my support.

115011021.content: Oh, one more thing. Have you given any more thought to my previous suggestion?

115011022.content: The lamp flickers out. The spot of light melts into the container zone's darkness once more.

115011024.content: An explosion of muzzle flares lights up the night, and bullets tear through Rostach station from all directions.

115011025.content: Every so often, there's a scream or a thud ringing through the air as someone falls down to the ground.

115011027.content: We were drinking at the same table the other night, and now they're all against us? Resistance Soldier? Resistance my ass! I thought we were just Bounty Hunters!

115011028.content: To hell with this shit! Betrayers deserve to rot in hell! Where's our big bad boys? Get 'em over here!

115011029.content: Are you nuts? Kingu's the one leading them! We must move now or else!

115011031.content: Oh? So you're saying I'm spilling my brothers' blood for some family squabbles?

115011033.content: Traitors get what they deserve in Akkadian, and I don't give a damn if that's my son.

115011034.content: He should have known better when he decided to turn his gun against our people.

115011036.content: Now get more firepower over here and take that bunker out!

115011037.content: After flashes of flames, all of the enemy bunkers are destroyed. Marduk leads his men as they charge into the debris.

115021001.content: The Akkadian Guild assault slows down as it enters the station. Dozens of carriages form a line of barricades that not even heavy weapons can penetrate.

115021002.content: Halt! I don't wanna walk right into an ambush. They must be hiding somewhere, and it's gonna kill us before we know it!

115021003.content: Clear the rear and hold this intersection! Wait until I give my orders!

115021004.content: These carriages have been reinforced. We can't blast them open with ordinary means.

115021005.content: I got to hand it to Kingu, he manages to get the upper hand every time.

115021006.content: Save that crap! Have we found out why they attacked us?

115021007.content: Not yet... It was all very sudden. They just appeared out of nowhere and seized our station.

115021008.content: Marduk's frown intensifies as his man explains the situation to him.

115021009.content: Can it be that he's after me?

115021010.content: You bet! The kiddo wants to overthrow you!

115021011.content: Find a way to reach their command. I'll ask him myself!

115021013.content: The very next second, Marduk's comms device begins to ring.

115021014.content: Marduk, a man always so decisive in front of his men, suddenly becomes very cautious. He distances himself from people, then ducks into a darkened corner before answering the call.

115021015.content: I said, only contact me at agreed times.

115021016.content: It's urgent. And as leader of the Akkadian Guild, you're able to tell people to leave you in peace whenever you want, I assume.

115021017.content: A female's voice comes from the other end of the communicator, making Marduk grip the device even tighter.

115021018.content: What are you planning now, Paracaesar?

115021019.content: I've been hearing of a mutiny in the Akkadian Guild, which of course has me very concerned.

115021020.content: This is my guild and I'll deal with it.

115021021.content: I have it on good authority that the so-called resistance army has breached the restricted area and held control over supplies earmarked for CORG.

115021022.content: This leaves me no choice but to designate them a criminal organization like the Children of Iron and have the Egregious Crimes...

115021023.content: There's no need for that just yet. I'll take personal responsibility for the missing supplies.

115021024.content: Marduk's firm response is met with silence.

115021025.content: I hear that the leader of the resistance is your adopted son?

115021026.content: That has nothing to do with my judgment.

115021027.content: I'm not worried about that. I'm just curious as to why he's starting this fight now. Have you two had a disagreement recently?

115021029.content: Well, in that case, I might be able to help. Some of the stolen CORG supplies are proof of your relationship with us.

115021031.content: Now I see you do have a clear picture of the gravity of the situation, Colonel. I shall remind you, that our agreement is the only reason Rostach hasn't been burned to the ground, and the continued secrecy of this agreement is of paramount importance.

115021032.content: Everything that takes place in Rostach can be the price to pay for this secrecy.

115021033.content: Marduk's grip around the device tightens, but he still lets it go as the device starts to crack.

115021034.content: Leave Kingu to me. Our agreement still counts.

115021036.content: The caller hangs up, and Marduk gathers his men.

115021037.content: Playtime's over, boys! Send back to HQ for reinforcements. We'll renew our attack as soon as they arrive.

115021038.content: But, boss, we just picked out who should go and negotiate...

115021039.content: Save it. The kiddo's not ready for a talk, at least not until I beat his ass up...

115031001.content: The container zone lies far from the battlefield, and yet the smell of gunpowder still hangs thick in the air.

115031002.content: Resistance soldiers clasp their guns tight as they doze off. Not even sleep can relieve their tension.

115031003.content: But there's one soldier different from the others. He appears to be calm and focused, free from the grip of tiredness and anxiety.

115031004.content: As he moves to a quiet corner, he activates a comms device on his wrist disguised as a watch.

115031005.content: This is Jackal, communication request received. Awaiting instructions.

115031006.content: The call is quickly answered, and a woman dressed like a scientist appears on the holoscreen.

115031008.content: So the dog hidden behind your mask still doesn't like me, huh? Want me to give it a fix?

115031009.content: The soul data stored on the Access Key is far more valuable as research than as a pet.

115031010.content: My apologies. I won't let Upu interrupt us again. Your orders?

115031012.content: If all this Akkadian in-fighting continues, even more people will die. We must put a stop to this as soon as possible.

115031013.content: I like your attitude. But may I remind you that saving lives is a secondary objective. What's more pressing is that the order brought by CORG is maintained.

115031015.content: The intel from our informant says the Akkadian Guild needs a little while longer to muster its forces.

115031016.content: I am highly confident in Marduk's ability. He would win out, even with the few men he has now. However, the longer we wait, the harder it will be for things to return to normal.

115031017.content: So, to expedite the process, I'm going to help him tie up some loose ends.

115031018.content: What do I need to do?

115031019.content: The resistance army recently stole some CORG supplies and stored them up in the container zone. I want you to find them and destroy them.

115032001.content: As fire engulfs the warehouse, Anubis dissolves into the shadows.

115032003.content: Good job. You're an asset to the team.

115032007.content: Even though they're talking via a communicator, Anubis senses a sudden distance from Paracaesar.

115032008.content: Jackal, you never used to ask questions that had nothing to do with your mission.

115032010.content: Just get in position and wait for further instructions.

115032011.content: The line goes dead. Anubis stands there in silence for a few moments, then quickly turns and leaves.

115041002.content: The message has been sent, sir, but it'll take time to assemble everyone...

115041004.content: Marduk snaps, silencing everyone around him. Suddenly, a playful voice pipes up.

115041005.content: What are you yelling at, boss?

115041006.content: Marduk whips around in the direction of the voice and sees a girl draped over the front of a car. She waves over at him, seemingly unfazed by his anger.

115041007.content: Bastet? I thought I told you to stay in the Drinkery?

115041008.content: How many more times do I have to repeat myself? Newbies are to stay clear of the battlefield!

115041009.content: But I'm here to share the good news!

115041011.content: The other Guild leaders have just arrived at the Drinkery. They assured me that their people will be ready within the next three days!

115041012.content: Three-more-god-damn-days? Does that sound like good news to you?

115041013.content: I mean... Bounty hunters usually work in pairs, threes tops. If you want to organize them like an army, that's going to take more time.

115041014.content: So they sent some little girl to deliver the conclusion? So that I wouldn't rip them a new one?

115041015.content: I volunteered, actually. They all looked like they were attending their own funeral when deciding who to send, so I said I'd do it...

115041016.content: Marduk silences Bastet with a glare. He seems he can erupt at any moment, but decides to go easy on the girl at the end.

115041017.content: Shouting at you isn't getting the reinforcements here any quicker.

115041018.content: Don't be upset, boss. I'm sure you can win even with the people you've got now. You don't need reinforcements!

115041019.content: You're underestimating Kingu while I'm not.

115041020.content: Now get back to the Drinkery and give those old asses a whip for me.

115041022.content: As he watches Bastet leave, Marduk feels an inexplicable wave of relief.

115041023.content: This girl only joined the Guild two weeks ago, but already she has proven herself to be like a softening agent, able to smooth out any conflict or personality clashes.

115041024.content: However, his brow once again furrows as he remembers he won't be receiving reinforcements anytime soon.

115041025.content: Boss, what do we do now?

115041026.content: There are options, even when we're outnumbered. Have you learned anything about their combat style?

115041027.content: They came well prepared. They went straight for our weak points, and acted as if they knew what we were going for.

115041029.content: Kingu's commanding them, after all. That kid's a veteran of schemes, you know it better than us.

115041031.content: Most of them are young brats who chose to follow Kingu. I'd say they barely know how to aim.

115041032.content: But they work like an unholy machine when they fight. For a second they were retreating, and the next second they were all in position, firing at us. It was tough.

115041033.content: Marduk ponders for a while before reaching a decision.

115041036.content: You mean we hand over the station? What about the supplies...?

115041037.content: It's only going to get harder for us if we push on like this. They're prepared, with all of the station defenses they got inside, but we're not.

115041038.content: Without reinforcements, we'd just be throwing away our lives for nothing.

115041039.content: Why don't we just outflank them and take out their command?

115041040.content: Not a bad idea on paper. It's just one thing: you guys suck at team-fighting and I'm not a babysitter. Once they go for guerilla tactics, our split forces won't be able to locate them.

115041042.content: Furthermore, the enemy's not fighting us head-on. If we stay, there's gonna be losses one way or the other.

115041043.content: So the option is to retreat for now and let them have the station.

115041044.content: Once we're at full strength, I'll come and take it back. But until then, you guys can do me a favor by not biting the dust.

115041045.content: Marduk's justification is firm and unassailable. Everyone nods their agreement in silence.

115041046.content: The only problem is that the enemy will definitely pursue us as we retreat. Hmm... Okay, we'll do it in small groups and different directions! Once their forces get scattered, they won't be able to pose much threat.

115041047.content: Marduk pulls out a map and points out a route.

115041048.content: We'll reassemble at the western entrance to the station. I'm going this way; the rest of you choose your own routes. If you worry you're gonna piss yourself escaping alone, then come with me.

115041049.content: This triggers an outburst of laughter from the group.

115041050.content: We're not babies in diapers. We know when to run for the hills.

115041051.content: What are you all laughing at? This is not a skirmish anymore, it's a full-blown war!

115041052.content: There's no shame in running for your life. So get behind me if you want.

115041053.content: Marduk's sudden severity snaps everyone out of their mirth. After a while, a few people silently walk over and stand behind him.

115041054.content: I'll follow you, boss. Not because I'm scared, just to take some pressure off you.

115041056.content: The rest of you, listen up. The faster, the better! Remember what I said: small groups only, and don't turn back! That's an order!

115041057.content: Marduk is rarely this stern. The bounty hunters nod their heads.

115041058.content: The resistance army's command center is somewhat sparse: no one except Kingu and a couple of guards.

115041059.content: Kingu holds a map in one hand. The other is pressed against his headphones as he listens to information being broadcast across multiple channels.

115041060.content: As the fighting at the front eases up, he hears the voice of an informant coming from one of the channels.

115041061.content: Kingu, I have confirmation that the Guild reinforcements won't make it by tonight.

115041062.content: Just as I expected. What's the old fart's plan?

115041063.content: Er... The boss said he wants to fall back.

115041064.content: Oh? Then he's smarter than I give him credit for. He's gonna fall into my hands otherwise sooner or later.

115041065.content: I assume he also divided his people into smaller groups?

115041066.content: Wow! You know him like the back of your hand, Kingu!

115041067.content: I don't have time for this kind of crap. Answer the question!

115041068.content: Oh... Yes, he ordered a staggered retreat. The routes were assigned quickly.

115041069.content: Has he arranged for anyone to cover his ass?

115041070.content: Surprisingly not. He insisted on retreating in small groups, and they all obeyed.

115041071.content: So it means we won't be able to inflict any kind of meaningful losses. However...

115041072.content: Do you know which route the old man's taking?

115041073.content: Actually, I volunteered to join his group. Nailed it.

115041076.content: Kingu hangs up and begins studying deployment options on the map. His aide seems to be hesitating.

115041077.content: If he's retreating, do we really need to keep on like this?

115041078.content: I... I just don't see why the fightings is necessary. You already know the old man's in cahoots with CORG—all the other Guild leaders would support you once you make it public!

115041079.content: That would spare all of these deaths...

115041080.content: Instead of chiding his aide for openly questioning his judgment, Kingu simply laughs.

115041081.content: How can someone so much older than me still be so naive?

115041082.content: Have you never wondered why I only told my confidants about it, and specifically instructed them not to breathe a word before we act?

115041084.content: He's an old fart, true, but he's also a good leader. A leader who has a lot of loyal followers in the guild for all these years. Do you really think they'd believe a word I say if I jump out of nowhere shit-talking about him and CORG?

115041085.content: Not to mention, they'll alert him of my plan and we'd end up in direct confrontation. A couple more lies from him would be enough to make me a clown.

115041086.content: In other words, the other Guild members will only believe it if it's coming from his mouth.

115041087.content: And "all these deaths" you spoke of are the tools to pry it open. Understand now?

115041089.content: Kingu turns back to the map. A smile slowly spreads across his face, like a chess player who has the game in the bag.

115041090.content: Others can run as they want. All I need is you, old fart.

115041091.content: Kingu cuts the line and broadcasts the coordinates of his informant to all of his squad captains.

115041092.content: Squads 1 through 7! No, all teams, convene at that location!

115041093.content: Be prepared to carry out my orders!

115041094.content: Your only objective: capture Marduk alive!

115042001.content: Gunshots ring out, and the two informants fall to the ground.

115042002.content: No wonder we couldn't shake them off... The rendezvous point isn't far, we can make it!

115042004.content: Marduk and his group find themselves encircled, thanks to the informants' stalling.

115042005.content: Kingu emerges. Regret flashes in his eyes as he sees the bodies of his informants.

115042007.content: Drop your weapon and surrender, old fart. I'll let everyone else go.

115042008.content: Kingu glowers at his adopted father.

115042009.content: I don't want to repeat myself.

115042012.content: Don't bother. We've already blocked all comms in the vicinity.

115042013.content: Your people will just take it that the situation's out of control. They'll follow your order to the letter and never come back.

115042014.content: What do you want? The guild master's seat is yours once the boss retires. Is a little patience too much to ask for?

115042015.content: A usurper? Is that what I look like to you? After all this shit?

115042016.content: This old fart knows damn well why I've led my people out of the guild!

115042017.content: Marduk is silent for a long time, and eventually sighs.

115042018.content: Well played. You did even better than I expected. But I regret to tell you, son, the game is not over.

115042019.content: Suddenly, a storm of gunfire rings out nearby, and rapidly approaches. The shouts of the other squad captains can be heard.

115042023.content: This is your lesson for the day, son. Don't treat your subordinates like pawns. A conceited man makes for a poor leader.

115042025.content: Yes, you set up some barricades, but do you really think that's going to stop veterans like us? We could tell where your people were heading the moment we caught sight, and that they were coming to surround me.

115042026.content: So what? You ordered them to fall back in small groups!

115042027.content: And you thought they'd continue to obey my orders to the letter? Even after they learned I'm in danger?

115042029.content: Your troops' discipline and your tactics really did catch us off guard.

115042030.content: Whereas my men never listen to a word I say. They're a disorganized rabble. It's tough to command them, but on the flip side...

115042031.content: You used yourself as bait. You fooled even your own men...

115042032.content: The sound of gunfire is much closer now. Marduk smiles triumphantly.

115042033.content: That's right. My bet was my men would disobey me.

115042034.content: The resistance army channels are buzzing with a constant stream of intel. The bounty hunters who were supposed to be retreating begin to emerge one by one.

115042035.content: Now, the resistance army is the one finding itself surrounded.

115042036.content: That's the nature of bounty hunters, you see. They don't give a damn about tactics, but they are loyal until the end.

115042037.content: Not every one of them is a good boy, I gotta say, but I always adapt my tactics accordingly. And that's where a brat like you still got a lot to learn!

115042039.content: Instincts, huh? You think your men can save you? You'll be long gone with me by the time your ragtag gang arrives!

115042040.content: That's not yours to decide, boy!

115042041.content: Marduk deftly loads his Rage Serpent.

115042042.content: Whether or not I can last is up to me alone!

115052001.content: In a hail of bullets, Marduk breaks his men out of the resistance army encirclement.

115052002.content: Boss, Kingu is right behind those containers!

115052004.content: I want eyes on all exits! Someone find me a loudspeaker!

115052005.content: Marduk's men quickly get in position and surround Kingu.

115052006.content: Kingu and his last remaining guards are holding on to their last stronghold, when the sound of surrounding gunfire abruptly dies out all at once.

115052008.content: Kingu, they're here. What should we do?

115052009.content: These young soldiers have been trained by Kingu to strictly follow orders. However, now that there are no orders to follow, they begin to panic and lose their heads.

115052010.content: Keep calm and wait for my instructions!

115052011.content: Kingu ignores his flustered subordinates and takes out a controller.

115052012.content: Maybe you are a better commander than me, old fart. But I need to win this one, even if I have to cheat...

115052013.content: I'm giving you one last chance to surrender, boy!

115052015.content: Get our heavy weapons here. These containers aren't as strong as the bunkers. We can blow them up.

115052016.content: Boss, you sure you wanna go that far?

115052017.content: Marduk stares into the darkness of the container zone, his eyes lit with the fires of rage and yet tempered by helplessness.

115052020.content: Just as the bounty hunters are about to enter the container zone, the ground beneath their feet begins to rumble.

115052021.content: All of a sudden, a giant mechanical beast tears the front two rows of steel containers apart as though they were made of paper. It roars as it approaches the bounty hunters.

115052025.content: A steel blade flashes coldly just as the guns begin to fire, and more than half of the front row of bounty hunters are killed in an instant.

115052026.content: The attackers are forced to flee.

115062001.content: The AGI Mecha gets up again, despite all the times it's been stunned. Exhausted, Marduk falls to the ground.

115062002.content: With his last ounce of strength, he rolls over and watches in relief as his subordinates gradually fade from view.

115062003.content: He then sees the resistance army approach. Kingu stands over him, and with the controller switches the AGI Mecha off.

115062004.content: I think it's time we had a father-son chat.

115071001.content: The counterattack ends as quickly as it began. Before the flames and residual heat of the explosion have even dissipated, the resistance has retaken Rostach station and the Akkadian Guild forces have been wiped out.

115071002.content: Hiding in the shadows between the carriages, Anubis watches everything unfold.

115071004.content: Something's happened. The resistance army has a military-grade AGI Mecha and succeeded in their counterattack. The Akkadian Guild has fallen, and the station is back under resistance control.

115071005.content: A military-grade AGI Mecha? What model?

115071006.content: One I haven't seen before. Must be black market.

115071007.content: It had far more firepower than any standard AGI Mecha, and its mobility was not impaired in the slightest. I think it might have something to do with the person I'm hunting.

115071009.content: Anubis, your mission has changed. eliminate Kingu, and ASAP.

115071011.content: Did I sound like I was joking?

115071012.content: The Akkadian Guild has no hope of defeating something so powerful.

115071013.content: Our only option is to take out Kingu. Without him, their "army" will fall apart and that mecha will be little more than scrap iron.

115071016.content: Negative. The entire resistance movement is headed up by Kingu. If something happens to him, there's no predicting what all these thugs will do. It'll be anarchy, and innocent people will get hurt.

115071018.content: They might be opponents on the battlefield, but Kingu is still Marduk's adoptive son. Marduk wouldn't take kindly to his murder.

115071019.content: Rostach's people are none of my business. As for Marduk, it depends on how clean a job you do of it.

115071020.content: Anubis scowls in a rare show of anger. Upu starts to growl.

115071021.content: I am an enforcer, not your personal assassin.

115071022.content: So you are talking about principles with me? Is that what your adoptive father taught you? Did he not tell you that an operative must obey orders?

115071023.content: Rather than give in to Anubis, Paracaesar becomes even more ruthless.

115071024.content: Jackal, you have no right to question my judgment... You have always impressed me with your obedience and your execution. I trust this time will be no different.

115071025.content: The call cuts off, and Anubis sits deep in thought. Eventually, he gets up and skulks off through the carriages.

115072001.content: An agile figure lands lightly on a carriage roof before melting into the shadows. No one from the nearby resistance army noticed.

115072002.content: Not far off, Kingu is interrogating the captured prisoner.

115072003.content: When did you start negotiating with CORG? One year ago? More? Or... Was your arrival in Rostach already part of CORG's scheme?

115072005.content: The CORG blockade of Rostach needed an agent. That was you, wasn't it?

115072007.content: You're not denying it... So I'll take that as an admission, no?

115072010.content: That's not the question, old fart!

115072011.content: You should know, I mean you know better than anyone, that CORG is the sole reason Rostach ended up like this!

115072013.content: It's ridiculous. I... Everyone... trusts you so much.

115072014.content: What turned you into CORG's lapdog?!

115072016.content: Marduk repeats the word softly. His eyes brim with bitterness, yet he holds himself back from expressing.

115072017.content: Just do what you must, boy. Or are you in the mood for this old man's story?

115072018.content: If you believe you're right, what's the use of talking? Do it!

115072019.content: Marduk's vehemence catches everyone off guard, including Kingu.

115072020.content: If I kill you here, the Akkadian Guild would never accept me.

115072021.content: And stop calling me boy. I know what it takes to be a leader. The goods I have with me are proof of your business with CORG.

115072022.content: The other Guild captains are gonna take a while to get here. I'll deal with you once they've arrived.

115072023.content: What are you going to do?

115072024.content: Show them all the evidence of your crimes. They'll know that you're nothing near a leader of the guild!

115072025.content: A resistance soldier suddenly runs up to Kingu in a panic.

115072028.content: R-right... Someone's destroyed those supplies you told us to guard.

115072030.content: Whoever it was knew what they were doing. They knocked everyone out before the alarm could be raised...

115072031.content: Damn! Lock the old fart up. The rest of you, come with me!

115072033.content: As the resistance soldiers prepare to escort Marduk away, a faint blue flame begins to flicker in the shadows nearby.

115072034.content: Anubis has been lying in wait for a long time. According to his calculations, if he acts now, he'll be able to slit Kingu's throat before anyone realizes what's going on.

115072035.content: The only thing blocking his way is Marduk.

115072037.content: Anubis' keen eyes spot the small pendant hanging from Marduk's belt.

115072038.content: It is custom-made, and identical to the one Anubis has—the one that was given to him by his adopted father.

115072039.content: His father had cherished that pendant. He and his squad mates had made a set of them together. Even though the materials they'd used had been cheap, it was one of his father's most treasured possessions.

115072040.content: Is he one of my father's...?

115072041.content: As he watches Marduk from behind, Anubis suddenly remembers the day his father left on his final mission.

115072043.content: Does it feel different for a son to lose his father than a father to lose his son?

115072045.content: Upu can sense Anubis's sadness, and attempts to console him.

115072046.content: Anubis continues to watch as Kingu's men take Marduk away. He does nothing.

115072048.content: I've lost the target. Mission failed. I'll take full responsibility.

115072049.content: Silence on the other end of the line. Finally, Paracaesar speaks.

115072050.content: That would imply you no longer have a 100% success rate.

115072052.content: That said, you've still got the highest of any of my agents.

115072053.content: We'll discuss your punishment later. I'm not the one who smashes up the lab just because one experiment went wrong.

115072054.content: Go to their headquarters and meet with my informant. I'll then tell you the next stage of your mission.

115081001.content: The chaos unleashed by the resistance army is only just beginning. The bounty hunters who came as reinforcements are gathered noisily in the Drinkery.

115081002.content: The boss got caught? That kiddo ain't up to somethin' too drastic, is he?

115081003.content: Shit, if only we got here sooner... Marduk and I've been fighting side by side since that boy was in diapers. I'm gonna give him a talk!

115081004.content: Right after he captured the boss last night, he locked down the station and container zone and refuses to talk to any of us. If we make a move, who knows what he'll do to Marduk?

115081005.content: Why don't we send a team to sneak in and bust him out?

115081006.content: The kid's crafty. I sent someone in to scout around and found not one clue. We need to locate the boss before anything else.

115081007.content: In a forgotten corner of the hall sits a lone young man. His face is impassive, as though the hustle and bustle has nothing to do with him.

115081008.content: Without warning, a slender figure suddenly appears behind him.

115081010.content: Anubis recognizes Bastet before he accidentally hurts her, and lowers his weapon.

115081014.content: How does it feel, to see your partner jump out of thin air?

115081015.content: I specifically noted I need no partner for the task.

115081017.content: Bastet's mischievous grin makes Anubis suddenly realize something.

115081019.content: Bingo! It wasn't my idea—the director ordered me to come here.

115081020.content: Not that I mind! I'm happy to be your partner as always!

115081021.content: I'm more effective when I work alone.

115081022.content: Oh? Were you effective on that last mission?

115081024.content: W-Wait! Don't you want to find out the director's instructions?

115081026.content: Anubis, who had stood up to leave, silently sits back down.

115081027.content: First things first, can I just check if Kingu really captured the boss?

115081028.content: It takes Anubis a few seconds to register that the "boss" Bastet is referring to is Marduk.

115081032.content: ...Then I can only hope. He was always kind to me. A real nice guy.

115081033.content: What are the director's new instructions?

115081034.content: She said, since that idiot Jackal didn't kill Kingu like she asked, we can at least work out a way to rescue Marduk.

115081036.content: Don't give me that look! Those were her words, not mine!

115081037.content: Marduk is the key to stability in Rostach. I'm going to get him out of there.

115081038.content: But that doesn't mean we can help him defeat the resistance army like this. We need to find a way to deal with that AGI Mecha...

115081039.content: I've sent back images of it. Did the director work out a solution?

115081040.content: She didn't mention it to me. Besides, the R&D team went on their long leave yesterday.

115081042.content: She instructed to rescue Marduk and get him out of Rostach by 9 P.M. tomorrow night. If we don't think we can make it in time, or can't make it at all, then we abandon the mission and get back.

115081043.content: Abandon the mission? Then what are they going to do with the fights in Rostach? Getting Marduk out of the city won't solve anything.

115081044.content: I don't know... The director just said that the swamp is going to be cleared by the end of tomorrow.

115081046.content: And that's it. Now my job is simply to help you with the mission. What are we gonna do first?

115081047.content: Anubis sits in silent thought for a long time, then abruptly gets up and orders a drink at the bar.

115081048.content: I don't need your help to complete this mission.

115081050.content: I promise I won't get in the way. You've seen my profile, right? I might not be experienced, but I came in top in all of my classes.

115081051.content: That's not what I worry about. This mission will be a tough one, and bounty hunters are no easy customers.

115081054.content: Anubis sighs and downs his drink.

115081055.content: Did the director send you to spy on me?

115081056.content: Awkward silence. Bastet orders a drink for herself, and also downs it in one.

115081057.content: ...It's not spying. She's just worried that you might not follow her orders, so she told me to keep an eye...

115081058.content: I'm being honest with you: I'm not planning on doing anything like that. Whatever your plan is, you get my full support.

115081060.content: Because you're my mentor ever since I joined the department. I only ever see the director once or twice a year.

115081061.content: And I know you have a sense of justice. You never do bad things, do you?

115081063.content: Wait a second... You're not planning on such things, are you?

115081065.content: Anubis is silent once more, as though he has realized he's not going to be able to shake off his inquisitive new partner.

115081066.content: Around ten years ago, my father died in a covert mission. I never believed the explanation for his death in the report.

115081068.content: During the last mission, I found out that... Marduk was on my father's team at the time.

115081069.content: But the official report stated that the entire team was wiped out.

115081070.content: So you want to save Marduk and find out what really happened to your dad?

115081071.content: Anubis' face is rigid. He nods slightly in reply.

115081072.content: Also... It seems that everyone in Rostach hates CORG to their very core. I want to find out why.

115081073.content: If I'm to get to the bottom of it, I'll almost certainly stumble across infos that the department doesn't want me to know. It will be a serious breach of the rules. As your captain, it's my duty to inform you of all this.

115081075.content: I'm not going to apply pressure on you. You're free to do what you want.

115081077.content: Hmm... Phm... Aaaaand... Meow. Okay. I've made up my mind!

115081078.content: You said I can do what I want, right? Well, I want to be your assistant!

115081080.content: I'm worried about Marduk, so if there's anything I can do to help rescue the boss, I'm in.

115081081.content: And if you want to investigate Rostach, you don't just need an assistant who already knows everything about this place. You also need someone who's an informant for the director that can help cover for you. Am I right?

115081082.content: Anubis' eyes widen. He'd thought Bastet hadn't grasped the gravity of the situation, when in fact she knows very well what's at stake.

115081083.content: If the department launches an internal investigation afterward, I'll take full responsibility.

115081084.content: Deal. You're better at handling these things than me anyway, and I'm just a rookie here. I don't have the reputation of the famous Jackal to help me!

115081085.content: Secret plans, shady organizations... I never dreamed my first real mission would be so exciting!

115081087.content: You're excited too, aren't you Upu?

115091001.content: As night falls, the lamps in the Drinkery are lit and a large crowd forms around the card table in the middle of the hall.

115091004.content: Yes. We're going to find out where Kingu is holding Marduk. Means intel is crucial.

115091005.content: The "Jack of Hearts" over there is Rostach's most famous intel trader. Nothing in Rostach escapes him, at least that's what he says.

115091006.content: But his info has a price—you need to beat him at his card game.

115091007.content: Can't we just take him with us and hear straight from his mouth?

115091008.content: We need to keep a low profile, don't we?

115091009.content: If we make a move against the Jack of Hearts here, everyone in town is going to be onto us.

115091010.content: Anyway, I've heard that the Jack of Hearts only shows up when someone agrees to play against him. Apart from that, no one ever knows where he is.

115091012.content: What? Don't you play when you're off?

115091014.content: Should've expected that... No bother! Leave it to me!

115091015.content: Bastet bounds off to the registration desk, but returns shortly after, looking crestfallen.

115091016.content: The registration fee... The Jack of Hearts might as well be robbing us.

115091020.content: What? I don't want to spend your money!

115091021.content: It's for the mission. Don't worry, I can get it reimbursed.

115091022.content: Anubis hands Bastet his bank card.

115091023.content: You'll not see your money down the drain, I promise!

115091024.content: The new challenger certainly attracts the attention of the crowd. A waiter rings the bell on the bar.

115091025.content: This summons forth the Jack of Hearts, a sophisticated gentleman in formal attire, quite at odds with the scruffy bounty hunters all around him.

115091026.content: I don't believe I've had the pleasure before. Although first things first—there are no refunds if you lose.

115091029.content: The cards are deftly shuffled and dealt, and the game begins. It soon becomes clear that Bastet is an equal match for the Jack of Hearts, and before long quite a crowd is gathered around their table.

115091030.content: As the endgame nears, Bastet plays her secret trump card with a flourish, eliciting gasps from the expectant onlookers.

115091031.content: The lantern light flickers as the Jack of Hearts showdowns his, and Bastet is crowned the winner.

115091032.content: Awesome! Ahem. Mr. Hearts, since I won our match, I believe there is something you owe me.

115091035.content: If it's information you want, I don't think this is the best place.

115091037.content: Jack of Hearts pulls out a pen and paper, and writes down an address for Bastet.

115091038.content: You've got a sharp mind, young lady. Meet me at this address in one hour's time, and I will give you the information you need. But you must come alone.

115091040.content: At this time of night, hardly anyone is in the container zone. The local residents know to stay away when there could be danger lurking in the shadows.

115091041.content: However, Bastet is new to the city and casually saunters down the container-lined alleyway, seemingly oblivious to the locals' fears.

115091042.content: I didn't think you'd be brave enough to come, miss.

115091043.content: Why did you change your clothes? You look like one of those bounty hunter riffraff.

115091044.content: Of course I make more of an effort with my attire when the public eye is on me. At all other times, I want to attract as little attention as possible—my services are in high demand, after all.

115091045.content: I suppose you're right... There's no one around, so I guess we're safe to talk?

115091046.content: What information is it that you're after?

115091047.content: I want to know where Marduk is.

115091048.content: Oh? Everyone in the guild is looking for Marduk right now. If I hold onto his location for a little while longer, I'll make a killing when I sell it.

115091049.content: Are you really backing out of our deal?

115091050.content: Think twice about it. If word gets out that the Jack of Hearts didn't keep his end of the bargain, how many people would still be willing to risk playing your game?

115091051.content: And why do you think I brought you out to such a place, miss?

115091052.content: A fierce look flashes across his face, but a slender figure appears beside him before he can do anything.

115092001.content: With a few deft moves, Anubis throws the Jack of Hearts to the ground like a rag doll.

115092003.content: I told you, interrogation is the best method.

115092004.content: I know. Why do you think I agreed to come meet him here? You... you didn't think *I* was the one being tricked, did you?

115092005.content: Anubis tries to hide his sheepishness by stepping down harder on the Jack of Hearts.

115092007.content: I don't know where Marduk is actually.

115092008.content: After the ruckus just now? Pull the other one.

115092011.content: I honestly have no idea of his whereabouts, but I have clues that'll help you find him.

115092014.content: Everyone knows Marduk is a pretty straightforward guy, and he likes making new friends. Not all of these friends are the reliable types though.

115092015.content: The Rust Arena King of the Ring was good friends with Marduk, and the two often met up for a chat over some drinks.

115092016.content: But for some reason, he defected to Kingu's camp a few days ago. He was the one who tipped them off that Marduk was coming to the station.

115092017.content: He's now among the top brass in the resistance army, enjoying Kingu's trust. The man's gonna have something to tell you about Marduk.

115092018.content: You sure? I've heard of the Rust Arena, but this is the first I've heard of Marduk being friends with the King of the Ring there.

115092019.content: Anubis starts pressing down harder with his foot.

115092020.content: S-Stop! You can have another piece of information from me, for free of course! The real King of the Ring at Rust Arena is actually just a crazy old drunk.

115092021.content: He couldn't find any worthy opponent in the arena anymore, so he quit the ring.

115092022.content: I only got it from Marduk because l learned Marduk himself is a drunkard, so I bought a few bottles and went over to join them. I tell you, that cost me one hell of a hangover...

115092024.content: Anubis seems less convinced than Bastet, and his foot remains planted on the Jack of Hearts' chest.

115092025.content: How can I get that King of the Ring talking?

115092026.content: Have you heard of the Copper Duel? Both sides put all their money and liquor on the line, and fight until one falls.

115092027.content: Of course, you can also bet with something else of value... Information, for example.

115092028.content: So it won't end until someone's down for the count?

115092029.content: He won't accept ordinary challenges, but he never refuses a Copper Duel.

115092031.content: With a swift strike, Anubis knocks the Jack of Hearts out cold.

115092033.content: Not like I'm going to do it for you. We both play to each other's strengths, don't we?

115092034.content: I'm good at cards, you're good at combat.

115101001.content: In the container zone, a group of spectators have gathered around an empty space to form a natural arena.

115101002.content: Two burly men are having a fistfight, spilling sweat and blood on the concrete floor as the crowd cheers.

115101003.content: The testosterone in the air is almost palpable.

115101004.content: Look, that's the famous Rust Arena.

115101005.content: As you can see, there's no actual boxing ring here. If two people decide to fight, they just find some space and get started.

115101007.content: Ah... Let's just say it's a kind of daily pastime. Law and order aren't what people expect from Rostach.

115101008.content: If you're itching for a fight, you can find someone to have a warm-up bout with. I've heard the prize money is quite generous, and it'll help offset some of the registration fee...

115101010.content: You don't have to be such a stickler...

115101012.content: It's dangerous here. Find somewhere safe and stay out of trouble once I've located the target.

115101013.content: I know, I know. I'll do nothing except be your cheerleader!

115101015.content: Anubis walks among the containers, scrutinizing everyone around him until he spots a drunkard dozing against one of the containers.

115101016.content: Nobody else approaches the space being guarded by the man, whose rippling muscles testify to his strength.

115101019.content: Anubis approaches the drunk man and stares at him in silence.

115101020.content: Never seen your face before... What do you want with me?

115101021.content: Are you the King of the Ring?

115101022.content: King of the Ring? Pfft, save it. They did call me that, but back then I got paid to fight. I was good at my job, that's it.

115101023.content: But I'm tired right now, so you can piss off with your assignment.

115101024.content: I want to know where Marduk is.

115101026.content: How am I meant to know that? Like I said, piss off.

115101027.content: I'm not asking for a free favor.

115101028.content: So I'd like to challenge you to a Copper Duel instead.

115101029.content: The King of the Ring's eyes light up.

115101030.content: Haha! Looks like this kid got a few screws loose.

115101031.content: You're not leaving unless I accept, are you?

115102001.content: The thrilling duel finally comes to an end, as the light from the setting sun spills over the top of the containers and onto the two fighters.

115102002.content: Seems I'm now even older than I thought, to lose to a brat like you...

115102003.content: I did not mean to offend. I only hope you keep your side of the bargain.

115102005.content: The King of the Ring does not immediately respond to Anubis' request.

115102006.content: You're just like Marduk... He also gave me a good beating before putting on his fancy airs.

115102007.content: How did you and Marduk meet?

115102008.content: I moved here many years ago because of the rumors of big underground fighting scenes, and I wanted to score big.

115102009.content: But a few months after I got here, a disaster plowed the city all over. Something I hope never to see again.

115102011.content: You didn't know? It's fine, everyone else around here is also like they got this part extracted from their brain. And they think I'm out of my mind whenever I start talking about it.

115102012.content: Maybe I am... But Marduk never called me that. One day he brought some wine over and we had a good chat. He helped me find a job, then we became brothers.

115102013.content: After a while, I kept my promise to him and stopped talking about the disaster. I became a "sane" person again.

115102014.content: The King of the Ring's gaze suddenly hardens.

115102015.content: But even if I didn't speak about it, I still got it in my mind. The disaster started with that gray CORG tower!

115102017.content: The King of the Ring's gaze shifts to Anubis, and becomes even harder.

115102018.content: You asked about all this because you're with CORG, right?

115102020.content: Marduk told me about it when we were drinking once. About how people who've received military training from CORG all have the same tell-tale fighting technique.

115102021.content: Your disguise is good. If we didn't fight, I wouldn't have been able to tell.

115102023.content: Hmph, I should have turned and left as soon as I figured out you were with them.

115102024.content: But I still finished the bout. You know why?

115102026.content: Because, apart from that characteristic style, there's also something of Marduk in the way you fight.

115102027.content: The way you've tweaked some of the basics, the way you stare at your opponent's weak points without acting on them... Exactly the same.

115102028.content: It's precisely why I always lost to Marduk when we sparred. He always said a good friend had taught him how to fight.

115102030.content: He said the man was like a brother to him...

115102031.content: Anubis' eyes flash. He tries to find the right words to say, but in the end he goes with the simplest:

115102032.content: That good friend of his was my father.

115102033.content: I see... Why are you digging for Marduk?

115102038.content: A CORG kid wants to save him. Looks like Kingu was right—Marduk IS in cahoots with CORG.

115102039.content: The King of the Ring's face twists into a smile as the difficult truth is finally confirmed.

115102041.content: So what? He betrayed me first!

115102042.content: But I lost the Copper Duel, so I'll stick to our arrangement.

115102043.content: Marduk is being held in the restricted area on the south side of the container zone. Monsters are always lurking around there, so only maniacs go near. Whether you can do it is all down to you.

115102045.content: Remnants from the disaster. CORG used to keep it locked down, but now it's in Kingu's hands. Good place to hide something, or someone.

115102046.content: Where is he being held exactly?

115102047.content: I don't know. I haven't been to see him since his capture.

115102049.content: You can take this as well.

115102050.content: The King of the Ring gravely removes a key from his pocket and hands it to Anubis.

115102052.content: Maybe it's because he's getting old, but Marduk was always worried something would happen to him. If he's gone, Rostach would be a mess. So he came up with the "insurance policy."

115102053.content: Why are you giving it to me?

115102054.content: Well, I was supposed to give it to Kingu in Marduk's absence. Kingu is... the insurance policy.

115102055.content: Of course, we never even dreamed that Kingu would be the one to turn against Marduk. Hahaha!

115102056.content: But you defected to Kingu's side.

115102057.content: I know. But I still owe Marduk this much at least.

115102058.content: It's not anything personal. I don't hate Marduk or anything, how could I? He's been the only person who's cared about me for a long time. It's just... I hate CORG more.

115102059.content: So I'm giving this key to you because you want to rescue him. And I won't tell the resistance army about you. That makes me and him even.

115102060.content: The King of the Ring hands over the key, then sits down to bask in the sun's last rays. He looks like a man who has just had a massive burden lifted from his shoulders.

115102061.content: Anubis turns and leaves him to his thoughts.

115111001.content: The jukebox in the corner continues to play its cheery tunes, but is doing little to lift the mood. A heated debate is raging over what to do about Marduk's disappearance.

115111002.content: It's been days now and our scouts still haven't found him. Where on earth has Kingu taken him?

115111003.content: The kid sent a message yesterday saying he won't talk to us until all of the Guild is here. He might as well just say he's never talking to us!

115111004.content: Most of them are coming to help us deal with the resistance army, but I know some of them won't be back for at least a while!

115111005.content: What are we waiting for? Chase those refugees out and scoop up everything in the container zone. We'll be guaranteed to find him!

115111006.content: First, we'd risk killing Marduk. Second, I don't want the boss yelling at us once he finds out, you imbecile!

115111007.content: You little... You know the drill, we settle outside! Get out!

115111008.content: Hearing a fight was about to take place, everyone else also heads outside to watch the action—even the bartenders.

115111009.content: The hall is suddenly empty, except for Anubis and Bastet sitting alone in one corner.

115111010.content: They're not gonna fight for real, right? At least we don't have to whisper anymore if they are!

115111015.content: Ahem, I've found the restricted area that guy mentioned. It used to be a CORG outpost but now it's completely under the resistance army's control.

115111016.content: The strange thing is, anything about the restricted zone is top secret even for CORG, and I can't even get hold of a map, let alone anything else. I've asked around in the Guild, and the only thing I've been told is that it's somewhere to stay away from...

115111017.content: Looks like we're just going to have to go in blind. Let's move.

115111019.content: I found out where to use the key the King of the Ring gave us.

115111020.content: That key is crucial intelligence. You should have kept it hidden somewhere safe.

115111021.content: What's the value of a key if you don't know what it opens?

115111022.content: Anyway, I asked around, and it turns out that there are personal deposit boxes inside the Akkadian Guild's public vault. I managed to open one of them with the key, and inside I found... this!

115111023.content: Bastet dramatically pulls a vinyl record out of her backpack.

115111025.content: I know it's weird, but that's all there was in the box. Shall we give it a listen? I really want to know why Marduk would lock a record away.

115111026.content: I suppose we should obtain as much information as possible before we make a move.

115111027.content: There's just one problem: you won't find record players in Rostach, except...

115111028.content: They both turn and look over at the jukebox.

115111029.content: Like I said, a lucky day for us!

115111030.content: Under Anubis's help, Bastet moves the jukebox into an unoccupied room and carefully places the record inside.

115111031.content: The disc begins to turn slowly, its polished surface reflecting their expectant faces.

115111032.content: What comes out of the speaker isn't music, however, but Marduk's world-weary voice.

115111033.content: Kingu, if you're listening to this record, it means you've had to take over from me.

115111034.content: However, what you're taking on is more than just the position of the "boss."

115111035.content: On the second floor of the Drinkery, you'll find an emergency transmitter I've hidden somewhere on the shelves. The password is the date I adopted you.

115111036.content: Use it to contact the head of CORG's R&D, a vile woman by the name of Paracaesar.

115111037.content: You can get food, Tranzist, and other supplies you need from her. She'll arrange a time for you to go send someone to pick them up. This is where Rostach gets its supplies from.

115111038.content: But they don't come for free. You'll have to do something for her in return, which she'll tell you when you go. If you want to know why I've been working with CORG, you can ask her then...

115111039.content: From now on, you'll be responsible for maintaining contact with Paracaesar and working with CORG to ensure Rostach gets the supplies it needs to survive.

115111040.content: Or... You can reject their offer and choose to do what you think is right.

115111041.content: I don't think I've made the wrong decision in seeking their help, but I won't deny you if you think I'm wrong.

115111042.content: Now that you are the boss, it's up to you to decide.

115111043.content: The record continues to spin, but all that can be heard is the scratching of the needle.

115111044.content: He was working with CORG all along. No wonder the director wants us to go save him...

115111045.content: What do we do now? That was a lot to take in. I can't wrap my head around it!

115111048.content: Find Marduk. I've snuck into the container zone before, and I can do it myself.

115111049.content: Acting alone again? Not under my watch!

115111050.content: What needs to be done next has nothing to do with intelligence gathering. It's war.

115111051.content: Yes, I'm aware of it. And from what we've just heard, I know that what we're gonna do is a big no-no. CORG might suspend me for disciplinary violation, so you're trying not to get me into trouble.

115111052.content: But I'm kinda concerned about the risk of you letting your emotions get in the way of the mission, and to see it through, I'm requesting to join you as your partner!

115111053.content: It's written in the special ops partner code. You know, the one your dad wrote!

115111055.content: There's no time to waste. Let's go, Anubis! And you too, Upu!

115111057.content: The girl drags Anubis out of the hall with her before he can even respond.

115121001.content: Like an endless nightmare, the disaster replays itself in Marduk's head again and again.

115121002.content: Monsters are running wild, the ground is collapsing, and the screams of the injured even drown out the sounds of the explosions...

115121003.content: Do you really want to save everyone, Colonel, or do you just want to appease your own narrow definition of justice?

115121004.content: You should know that, if you don't want something like this to happen again, we both have to get blood on our hands...

115121006.content: Marduk wakes up violently, his vest drenched in sweat.

115121008.content: Marduk examines his surroundings. He's still locked in a reinforced container that's impossible to break out of without weapons.

115121009.content: He squints as a strong beam of light suddenly shines in. He recognizes the person standing in front of it.

115121010.content: Headlights? I've taught you better tricks for interrogation. Or perhaps they're just too scary for a kid?

115121012.content: One last time: why are you working with CORG?

115121013.content: That recorder in your pocket, where did you get it? A history museum? Take that out.

115121014.content: What's the big idea? Snitch the dialogue to the others in the guild? So that they can turn it aside like a joke?

115121016.content: Kingu's hand instinctively goes to the recording pen in his pocket and switches it off with resentment.

115121017.content: I'll let you keep your filthy secret with you for a little longer. But listen well: you are currently inside the No. 8 restricted area of Rostach's container zone.

115121018.content: What... Who told you to come here? Get your men out of here, now!

115121019.content: Ha, so you do know what's inside the restricted area.

115121020.content: Marduk realizes he's lost his cool, and quickly calms back down.

115121021.content: Don't worry, I had my team do some cleaning work here. Now it's your private prison cell.

115121022.content: After I seized this place from CORG, I found that the soil around here was heavily contaminated, and bones were buried everywhere.

115121023.content: How many restricted areas do they have like this in Rostach? What's CORG's business here?

115121025.content: I have ways of making you talk!

115121026.content: Having the answers won't do you any good. You'll understand when the time comes.

115121027.content: Stop palming me off like a child!

115121028.content: Kingu stares hard at Marduk, but is unable to discern any information from his face except a slight trace of guilt.

115121029.content: Hmph... doesn't matter. Sooner or later I'll become the Akkadian Guild leader, and CORG's shackles will bind us no more!

115121030.content: Those who stand in my way have only themselves to blame!

115121031.content: The lights suddenly go out, and Kingu disappears into the darkness.

115121032.content: Marduk sits for a while, and then reaches into his leg armor and pulls out the comms device he has hidden in there.

115121033.content: Good thing I didn't teach you how to do a proper body search, boy.

115121034.content: Marduk looks at the device in silence.

115121035.content: All he needs to do is switch it on and he'll be able to contact the outside world and be rescued. The only problem is that the communicator has been locked to a single channel—the that one belongs to that "vile woman."

115121036.content: After a long silence, Marduk finally reaches a decision.

115121037.content: What happens between me and my son is none of her business.

115121038.content: In the fog of night, two figures slip between the rows of containers and hide in a dark corner.

115121040.content: Phew... Egregious Crimes or the Akkadian Guild, this is a restricted area to them both for sure.

115121043.content: Bastet looks at Anubis' stern, resolute face, and a question pops into her mind.

115121044.content: I can see that you want to find out how your dad died, but why do you care about the truth behind the ruckus in Rostach? Out of a pure sense of justice?

115121046.content: Is it wrong to do what you believe is right?

115121047.content: Not at all. It's just... doesn't the training manual say that obedience comes first?

115121048.content: At our induction, the director said that what we should do is not the same as what's right to do, and that we need to leave the problem for the bosses to decide.

115121049.content: I know. I was told the same thing.

115121050.content: But there are some cases of right and wrong where you don't need anyone else to decide for you. No matter how hard or complicated they seem, right is right and wrong is wrong... It's as simple as that.

115121052.content: That's what my father used to tell me.

115123001.content: Anubis, those monsters we just saw... Are they Visbanes?

115123002.content: They fit the description, so yes.

115123003.content: There's also residual Bane Energy in the soil...

115123005.content: The voices of the Resistance soldiers cut their conversation short. The two hide at once.

115123006.content: Hey, wait up. I don't want to get lost again.

115123007.content: Next time you take a whizz, find somewhere close around. No one's gonna come back for you again.

115123008.content: You went outside of the safe zone Kingu told us about. Count yourself lucky you came back at all.

115123009.content: So the rumors are true? There's monsters in the restricted zone?

115123010.content: You won't want to find it out yourself.

115123011.content: The two soldiers walk off. Anubis and Bastet come out of their hiding place.

115123012.content: That safe zone they just mentioned...

115123013.content: If they were going to lock someone up at this place, they'd pick somewhere clear of Visbanes. That must be it!

115122001.content: The shouts of the Resistance soldiers gradually fade into the distance, and the three of them hide in between two containers as they catch their breath.

115122002.content: You sure don't fight like a bounty hunter, kid. Who are you? Your weapon... Are you with the Egregious Crimes Department?

115122004.content: And don't get me started, Bastet! This kid might be bad at cover-ups, but that ops equipment of yours tells me you're not even trying!

115122005.content: Oh... Did I give myself away?

115122006.content: I've followed every word that woman gave me, and Paracaesar is still sticking her nose in Rostach affairs?!

115122007.content: No. We didn't rescue you because the director told us to.

115122008.content: Anubis takes out a pendant—the same as the one hanging from Marduk's belt.

115122010.content: You and my father fought together.

115122011.content: Boss, you used to be in the Egregious Crimes Department too, right?

115122013.content: Jackal. I inherited the code name.

115122014.content: He did tell me about an adopted son. Didn't know his son joined CORG as well though.

115122016.content: I want to know how my father died.

115122017.content: What did CORG say about it?

115122018.content: They say he died on duty while handling a smuggling case and offered me some compensation.

115122020.content: I looked through the organization's shelved archives and found that the files on my father and his team were modified. Yours, however, had been wiped clean entirely.

115122021.content: You showed up in Rostach only sixteen years ago—the same year my father died in the line of duty.

115122022.content: The mission briefings and outcomes have been completely erased. No record of where the mission was, and who was involved in it...

115122023.content: Not long after, Rostach saw a group of people experiencing a particular form of memory disorder. They all talked about a "disaster" that never happened and that nobody remembered.

115122024.content: That same year, CORG began its harsh lockdown of Rostach, cutting the city off from its development.

115122025.content: CORG's direct involvement and divergent memories... Isn't that exactly how we deal with certain situations?

115122027.content: That chemical plant explosion which caused global contamination... It was actually an enormous Quake in Rostach, wasn't it?

115122028.content: But that was more than ten years ago. Only three years have passed since the first recorded Quake!

115122029.content: CORG is responsible for recording Quakes. If they wanted to cover it up...

115122031.content: Two years after, the Akkadian Guild was established, and a foreign Marduk began to adopt children orphaned by the disaster.

115122032.content: He fought for a better life for his new neighbors and helped those with memory afflictions. He soon won over the hearts and minds of the Rostach residents, and became their leader.

115122034.content: Marduk's joints crack as he clenches his fists, which he then slowly opens as though releasing something.

115122035.content: I have more than sufficient fancy excuses for hiding the truth from others, but I can't keep Jackal's son in the dark—you have the right to know how your father died.

115131001.content: Marduk sits down and leans against a carriage, as if weighed down by what he is about to say.

115131002.content: Sixteen years ago, I was head of Egregious Crimes... We weren't managed by a schemer like Paracaesar back then, and even I would often go out on missions with my team.

115131003.content: Gotta say you look nothing like a director, boss...

115131004.content: That day, we received an urgent top-secret mission. The council wanted me to personally lead a team to Rostach and provide security for some mysterious scientific experiment.

115131005.content: I picked a team of people I could trust. One of them was your father, Jackal.

115131007.content: They'd built a gray tower in Rostach. At first, the residents here, us included, assumed that it was for the future of the city. And then came the Quake...

115131008.content: Hold up, Boss, are you saying the experiment was the cause of the Quake? But aren't Quakes accidental? We can barely predict them.

115131010.content: Quakes had killed people before, and CORG got them recorded on their internal report. Why was my father's covered up?

115131011.content: Also, Rostach is not the only place that saw a Quake. Why, then, has CORG been keeping a vigilant eye here only?

115131012.content: You're smart, kid. Just like Jackal. And you decide to get to the bottom of something even if you sense only a whiff of it.

115131013.content: He died in that Quake. The rest of the security team was killed by the Visbanes, except me.

115131014.content: But the Quake itself wasn't an act of god. It was manmade...

115131015.content: Manmade? So someone out there knows how to control quakes?

115131016.content: I won't call it "control," and CORG had no reason to start a Quake. However, the experiment was the direct cause of that Quake—Paracaesar told me so herself.

115131018.content: Paracaesar was the chief architect of Project Graytower.

115131019.content: The weariness in Marduk's eyes sharpens as he relives the nightmares of the past.

115131020.content: Rostach was scarred by rifts and cracks, and it's hard to say if there ever existed a line between the Surface Layer and Source Layer.

115131021.content: The Visbanes, they just kept coming and slaughtering everything in their wake. Rostach was a sea of flame.

115131022.content: I wanted an explanation. I was getting myself into trouble, yes, but I didn't care. I burst into the experiment control room and saw that woman, Paracaesar.

115131023.content: Where's the head scientist? Get your ass in here!

115131024.content: Keep it down if you would. We cannot afford to stop the experiment until we finished collecting the last batch of data.

115131025.content: To hell with this god-damn experiment! Anyone can see it's luring the monsters here! Shut it down, or they're going to kill all my people!

115131026.content: Marduk raises his gun and points it at Paracaesar. All of the other scientists shrink back in fear.

115131027.content: But Paracaesar remains calm. She even takes out a device and uses it to scan Marduk up and down.

115131028.content: The Divine Grace signal coming off your gun... an Access Key. No wonder you managed to get in here—with that outrageous power you have now.

115131029.content: Shut up, you maniac. I'm standing here because it's my brothers who are getting slaughtered out there!

115131030.content: Have you asked yourself the question, Colonel? Why are you able to kill those "monsters" so easily, while your men are dying?

115131032.content: Paracaesar turns on a screen full of confidential information.

115131033.content: Visbanes, Quakes, Source Layer... All of these new words flood Marduk's brain, but subconsciously it's as though he knew it all along. It feels like forgotten information he's just "remembered."

115131034.content: Quakes... was that a Quake? And those monsters were... Visbanes?

115131035.content: Judging from my scan results, you are a newly awakened Modifier, and the consciousness embedded deep inside you by Gaea will slowly merge with your old self. Once that's done, all of this will make sense to you.

115131036.content: The biggest threat to our world isn't any criminal organization, but what you refer to as "monsters."

115131037.content: If you know how dangerous these things are, why haven't you stopped the experiment? Why are you letting them all out?!

115131038.content: You believe the experiment has caused the Quake? Well, your assumption holds some facts. After all, we did forge Gaea's authentication certificate, which would have debilitated the already fragile boundary between worlds.

115131039.content: But the Source Layer was eroded long ago. Sooner or later Quakes like this would hit every corner of Gaea, with or without our intervention. No Sephirah Zone or city would remain untouched.

115131040.content: If that were to happen, hundreds, even thousands of Modifiers like you won't be enough to save the world, Colonel... they won't be able to turn the tide.

115131041.content: We don't need heroes to eliminate the Visbanes. We need soldiers and armies.

115131042.content: Marduk is speechless. He looks over Paracaesar's shoulder and sees a human test subject in the lab's training chamber. He can sense a power similar to his own emanating from the test subject.

115131044.content: Unfortunately, these are all defective products. I've failed.

115131045.content: But the data from our previous experiment are invaluable for the next step. Should we let this opportunity slip, we'll have to waste decades of effort on rebuilding what we had.

115131046.content: Now, I've explained everything to you, Colonel. What's your answer?

115131048.content: Paracaesar states the facts without emotion, watching impassively as the man who's lost his friends and comrades cries, screams, and finally lowers his gun, defeated.

115131049.content: Tell me, how many more lives are you going to sacrifice?

115131050.content: Paracaesar's cold eyes shine through her glasses.

115131051.content: You're a soldier, Colonel. And soldiers don't ask silly questions like this.

115131052.content: But I can tell you this: every second wasted here means one more sacrifice squandered.

115131053.content: Marduk's gun hand trembles. Eventually, he gets up and walks towards the exit, his face expressionless.

115131054.content: I will have my vengeance! My brothers will have their vengeance—once the threat is eliminated.

115131055.content: Very good. You know where to find me.

115131056.content: But you will exit the gray tower and continue with your mission at present. I need another thirty minutes to finish gathering the data.

115131057.content: So I went back outside and continued to hold the position with my few fellows. By the time the experiment was shut down, Rostach had been reduced to rubble. I was the only one who returned in my squad.

115131058.content: The memories fade, leaving Marduk even more depressed.

115131061.content: Your father disobeyed my orders. He left the gray tower and went to save the wounded in the Quake...

115131062.content: He was my best friend in the squad. A good fellow, always followed orders to the letter and supported my every decision. But for that one time, he defied me.

115131065.content: Thank you for telling me this.

115131066.content: You're both Modifiers, right? I'd bet my ass it's so for everyone else in Egregious Crimes...

115131067.content: CORG invited me to apply two years after my father's death. Only two in my group got qualified, and the other one soon went to a different department.

115131068.content: So that Paracaesar has found a way to identify unawakened Modifiers. I'm not surprised, though, given she's been trying other ways since her last project.

115131069.content: Is that why CORG has locked down Rostach? To keep this plan secret?

115131070.content: To collect data, that is. The longer they run the experiment, the more Quakes there are, and the more restricted areas in Rostach they need to have.

115131071.content: The survivors from that first quake had their memories wiped, but the technology wasn't perfect. That's why we've had people who suddenly recovered their memories of the disaster. CORG needs to keep a close eye on everyone here to keep those people from spilling the beans.

115131072.content: Paracaesar needs someone to help her turn Rostach into a forgotten city, a price to save the world. And since someone had to do it, I thought it might as well be me...

115131073.content: So the restricted ground zero of the Quake, the medical treatment given to those suffering from "memory disorders", the ban on exploitation, and the strict controls on traffic and communications... All because of this?

115131074.content: Correct. I may have left CORG, but as Governor of Rostach I still became their stooge.

115131075.content: You're more than that! You got so many people employed, and adopted so many orphans. Everything you do, you do it for the good of Rostach!

115131076.content: But you're still hiding the truth from the people. They would never accept pity from the ones who've done them so much wrong.

115131077.content: I guess you do have a point...

115131078.content: I've never asked for anyone's forgiveness... What's the next stage of Paracaesar's plan, now that you've rescued me?

115131079.content: She wants us to evacuate Rostach.

115131080.content: Evacuate? But how can you evacuate so many people?

115131081.content: No, she told us to evacuate from Rostach. Means bringing only you with us.

115131082.content: Is she nuts? What about the fighting and the gray tower? Is she just gonna hand Rostach over to that dumb boy?

115131083.content: She didn't say. All she said is that the situation will resolve itself after 9 P.M. tonight.

115131084.content: What the hell is that supposed to mean? If you guys want to leave, then suit yourself. I'm not abandoning this place!

115131086.content: Upu barks twice as a warning. Anubis frowns and immediately takes out his weapon.

115131087.content: The dark corner where they are hiding is suddenly flooded with light. The resistance army has finally found its prey.

115141001.content: In the dead of night, the Resistance HQ remains brightly lit as new members are being recruited.

115141003.content: My parents can't afford to have me under their roof anymore.

115141004.content: They used to be miners, but then CORG blocked the mine, so...

115141005.content: No need to sugarcoat CORG's crimes.

115141007.content: You now serve the Reserve Squad. Go find Logistics to get your weapon.

115141008.content: Th-Thank you! Um, how should I address you? "Sir?"

115141010.content: I don't think I'm older than you, and I'm not your officer. Just call me "Kingu" like everyone else.

115141012.content: Next. Why do you want to join the Resistance?

115141013.content: They took my dad... He was only selling some knick-knacks from outside, but CORG charged him with smuggling.

115141014.content: Why should everything coming in and out Rostach go through CORG's checkpoints?

115141015.content: You bet I'm not gonna miss the opportunity to join you and fight against CORG!

115141016.content: Kingu raises his head to look at the prospective recruit. A teenage boy even younger than Kingu himself.

115141017.content: Pioneer Squad. Go find Logistics to get a weapon.

115141018.content: The recruitment efforts are interrupted by the hasty arrival of a Resistance soldier. He leans towards Kingu to whisper something in his ear.

115141020.content: Kingu doesn't seem happy to see his partner again.

115141021.content: Still recruiting? Is something wrong with that "Dark Metal" I loaned you?

115141022.content: It's borrowed, after all. I don't want to become someone else's puppet like that old man.

115141023.content: Ever on your toes, aren't you? No matter, I trust my sincerity will get you one day.

115141025.content: Well, I heard you seized a restricted area as I suggested. Found anything interesting there?

115141027.content: Just a little curious if you got Marduk to talk about... something.

115141029.content: How about a more... persuasive approach? A little torture could save everyone time and effort.

115141030.content: Save your teachings. I don't trust someone who loves to keep me in the dark.

115141031.content: Once you make up your mind about our cooperation, I'll be more than glad to share them, naturally.
