115141032.content: We are two peas in a pod. The more we know, the more we wish to put CORG's tyranny to an end. After all, one of their top priorities is keeping the secrets of this world buried.

115141033.content: If you want to know the truth, you must first have determination and passion. Then, you need to be strong enough...

115141034.content: And what have we here now? The leader of a meager armed force. Don't rush to get your hands on world-shattering secrets, you still have Rostach to get hold of.

115141035.content: And Rostach will be mine soon enough!

115141036.content: I know you'd like to get Marduk to fess up rather than stage a military coup. It's the only way you'll gain the others' trust.

115141037.content: It's really not that hard. The most expedient means is at your disposal.

115141039.content: We're both from Rostach, I don't think I need to say more.

115141041.content: Earn everyone's trust and make Marduk talk—two birds, one stone.

115141042.content: To be honest, I don't get why you haven't tried it already. Did it not occur to you? Or are you just feeling squeamish?

115141043.content: Watch your tongue. This is my last warning.

115141044.content: Alright, alright. I'll be waiting for the good news, then.

115141045.content: The mysterious visitor departs, leaving Kingu silently clenching his fists.

115141046.content: Squad One, with me! Time to pay the old fart a visit!

115141047.content: Bad news, Kingu! Someone busted Marduk out!

115141049.content: We just received the news! They downed all our sentries along the way. No joke! They've already made it to the station.

115141050.content: Lock it down! Squads One through Ten, follow me!

115141051.content: Though the guards are only firing tentative shots, the cover Anubis and the others are using won't hold up much longer.

115141052.content: Looks like this is as far as we're getting...

115141053.content: I'll take care of the pursuers. You two make your way out here.

115141054.content: You're the one who should go.

115141055.content: I'll do whatever I can to stop them. Bastet, get him out of here.

115141056.content: Don't be a hero, kid! I don't care how good you think you're. You can't take on that many people at once!

115141057.content: Just think of it as my atonement, for you father...

115141058.content: But we came here to rescue you! How do you expect us to leave you behind?

115141059.content: This is between Kingu and me, and I don't want anyone from CORG to butt in, especially Paracaesar's people!

115141060.content: I know you're no fan of Paracaesar, but we're not like her!

115141061.content: I've only been in the Akkadian Guild for a couple weeks, but I really admire you and everyone else here. As for Anubis, I know he'd break the rules to leave no stone unturned.

115141062.content: Have faith in us, boss! We can help you!

115141063.content: Helpless in the face of Bastet's insistence, Marduk heaves a long sigh. He makes no further moves to rush out from their cover.

115141064.content: Well, what's the plan then? The station's crawling with his men now.

115141067.content: Bastet forged an SOS message from you, asking other leaders to storm the station and rendezvous with us.

115141068.content: And the appointed time is in... ten minutes!

115151001.content: In the end, the soldiers lock down all possible escape routes and expose Marduk and the others with their flashlights.

115151002.content: Only two? What a sorry ragtag rescue team you got there, old fart.

115151003.content: This is between you and me, kiddo!

115151004.content: Take all three of them with us.

115151005.content: With a fight about to erupt between the two sides, Anubis readies his mask.

115151006.content: Just then, several lights shine from one side, and a chorus of shouts booms out from behind Marduk and the others.

115151010.content: I knew I could count on them to rescue the boss!

115151011.content: The Akkadian Guild members close in on the encirclement, and the two sides quickly enter into a confrontation.

115151012.content: You ingrate! Is this how you thank the person who took you in and raise you up?!

115151013.content: The boss might have a soft spot for you, but I sure as hell don't! You're not escaping this time!

115151014.content: Hmph. Seems we have a reunion here. Good, saves me the trouble.

115151015.content: Old fart—I dare you to tell everyone in their faces that you're one of CORG's lackeys?!

115151016.content: The crowd immediately falls silent, then suddenly bursts into uproarious laughter.

115151017.content: Bahaha! The boss? One of CORG's? Surely you can spin a better yarn than that!

115151018.content: Use your head, kid! If it weren't for the boss, Rostach would barely survive CORG's lockdown! How could he be working for them?

115151019.content: Boss, we outnumber them now! Let's teach this brat a lesson!

115151020.content: Marduk doesn't say a word as outrage surges through his men behind him. Kingu, seeing his silence, grows increasingly furious.

115151021.content: Look at you, a coward from top to toe. A total disappointment.

115151022.content: Kingu suddenly raises his Wasteland Fiend and starts up its motor. It comes to life with a roar.

115151023.content: Marduk! I, Kingu, hereby challenge you to a Copper Duel!

115151024.content: A commotion erupts from the bounty hunters. They all know the rules of a Copper Duel—they're the most revered and sacred in all of Rostach.

115151025.content: Boss, don't listen to this kid! He's just trying to get the upper hand while you're injured!

115151026.content: We got power in numbers, you don't have to do a Copper Duel with him.

115151029.content: It's fine, I know what I'm doing.

115151030.content: I just remembered something when Kingu was still little. He suddenly challenged me to an arm wrestling match, and that was back when I was the "Arm Wrestling King" of Rostach.

115151031.content: What should I do? Give the boy an earful then brush him off so I could get back to work?

115151032.content: No. I accepted his challenge and took him on fair and square as a proper challenger.

115151033.content: What is a father if he shies from a challenge from his own son?

115151034.content: Anubis falls silent, ultimately watching as Marduk heaves his battered body forward.

115151036.content: At lightning speed, Kingu swings Wasteland Fiend and dashes toward Marduk. Marduk immediately raises Rage Serpent's weighty frame to block his strike, sending sparks flying.

115151037.content: If I win, you'll hand over the presidency and get your ass out of the Akkadian Guild!

115151038.content: But before that, you'll tell everyone what you've done! I want everyone to see your true colors!

115151039.content: Beat me before you talk, son!

115151040.content: Not long after it began, the battle turns white-hot. Loud cheers ring out from supporters on both sides.

115152001.content: Exhausted, Marduk nearly crumples to his knees, but forces himself back up to his feet.

115152003.content: Acknowledge me as the new head of the Akkadian Guild, and tell us everything that you've been hiding!

115152004.content: With his right fist, he delivers bursts of furious punches to Marduk's face. Droplets of blood fly out with each blow.

115152005.content: That's enough, Kingu! Are you out of your mind?!

115152009.content: Kingu freezes. The hand holding his weapon trembles for a moment, but then he tightens his grip.

115152010.content: This is bad! In a Copper Duel, if no one admits defeat, then...

115152012.content: Wasteland Fiend growls ferociously, but then, all the crowd hears is the hum of blades colliding. By the time their eyes adjust, Kingu has already been sent hurtling back.

115152014.content: Appearing in the crowd's view is a dark-haired young man dressed in black. Reaching out to shield Marduk behind him, he stares wordlessly at Kingu.

115152015.content: You piece of... Don't you know no one can interfere in a Copper Duel once it begins?

115152016.content: I'm not a Rostacher. I'm not obliged to observe your rules.

115152017.content: All I know is that you can't kill your own father.

115161001.content: That old fart betrayed Rostach and the Akkadian Guild. He's no father of mine!

115161003.content: Heh... What hardships? I'd LOVE to hear it from him. Not that I think he'll spit it out!

115161004.content: It'd be too lame an excuse if a word like "hardship" can sum up all his crimes!

115161005.content: He crossed the line, and that's something I do not tolerate. I don't care what reason he had!

115161006.content: In that case, I'll protect him.

115161008.content: It's been many years since I've seen my father. All I have left of him is a photo an inch big. To tell the truth, I don't think I can remember his voice well now.

115161009.content: I've thought about it, that if I had been by his side then, maybe I could have saved him. But I never got that chance.

115161010.content: I don't want you to do something you'll regret, Kingu.

115161012.content: I already warned you! Leave, or lie cold with the old man here!

115161013.content: Not responding, Anubis quietly dons his Jackal mask.

115162001.content: As their weapons collide with a metallic ringing, Anubis parries Kingu's Wasteland Fiend and brings him to the ground with a hard kick.

115162002.content: Wasteland Fiend whirls around in the air several times before piercing the ground next to Kingu's face, its sharp sawtooth blade just centimeters from his skin.

115162005.content: How? How could someone like you...

115162006.content: Admit defeat and leave us be.

115162007.content: Like I would let CORG's lackeys go!

115162008.content: Everything he did was to prevent something even worse from happening.

115162009.content: Worse things? What kind of "worse things?!"

115162010.content: That, you have to ask him yourself.

115162011.content: Enough! First it's "hardship", and now you all refuse to explain it. How do you expect me to understand any of this?!

115162012.content: Kingu furiously rises to his feet and grips Wasteland Fiend's hilt.

115162013.content: What do you think all these people behind me follow me for?

115162014.content: Trade business is a no—CORG doesn't allow goods to come in or get out. And with mining permits always getting held up, you have to even open a private mine before you can risk your own life!

115162015.content: All you can do is live like a refugee, looking for handouts each day to tide you over to the next!

115162016.content: And the old fart—after everything he has done for CORG, he doesn't even bother to make an excuse!

115162018.content: You might have won, but now that you've broken the rules of the Copper Duel, I don't see any point in holding back! Dark Metal!

115162019.content: With that, a colossal shadow eclipses the moonlight. The bestial roaring of machinery thunders overhead as a steel AGI Mecha suddenly plummets from the sky, crushing several carriages beneath it.

115162021.content: It's the AGI Mecha we saw that day!

115162022.content: Old fart! According to the rules of the Copper Duel, I have defeated you! I'm the head of the Akkadian Guild now, and everyone here must do as I say!

115162023.content: Now listen up: get this nuisance for me!

115162024.content: The leaders of the Akkadian Guild vacillate upon hearing Kingu's command.

115162025.content: What are you all standing around for? That man has lost! I'm president of the Akkadian Guild!

115162026.content: What do you take us for, kid? We only take orders from our Boss!

115162027.content: Put me under your command? I'd rather quit the guild right here right now!

115162028.content: That's right! Why don't we form a new guild and elect Marduk as president?

115162029.content: With the leaders' harsh rebukes and Bastet fanning the flames, the bounty hunters behind Marduk start joining in one after another.

115162030.content: Tch. So you all refuse to hold your end of the bargain?

115162031.content: You want to win everyone over with brute force! No one's gonna buy it!

115162032.content: Oh, then what do you lackeys of CORG have up your sleeves?

115162033.content: What if he has done everything he could in a situation like that?

115162034.content: Bullshit! If I had his authority and power, I'd definitely do a better job than him! I'd never let the people of Rostach live like this!

115162036.content: Enough talk. Since you won't acknowledge the Copper Duel, I'll just have to take matters into my own hands!

115162037.content: At Kingu's command, the beast-like, armed AGI Mecha bounds over once more—A fiery battle is about to ignite.

115162039.content: Just before the two sides begin to exchange blows, violent tremors start cascading in from all directions, as if space itself were trembling.

115162040.content: Countless rifts appear in the Source Layer, leaking Bane Energy that rapidly spreads to the AGI Mecha.

115162043.content: The Visbanes' unique Bane Energy pattern spreads out across the AGI Mecha until it reaches its control center. The moment it does, the mechanical beast before them—now completely corrupted by Bane Energy—lets out an earth-shaking roar.

115162044.content: What's going on, Dark Metal?! Answer my commands!

115162045.content: Control of the AGI Mecha has clearly been lost, and it's grown even stronger. The nearby carriages are still shaking from its roar alone.

115162047.content: I'll take care of it, you keep your eyes on the other side!

115162049.content: Ignoring the shouts of protest, Kingu rushes over to the AGI Mecha. But then, a wave of energy violently surges out from its body, instantly destroying everything around it...

115171001.content: Through dizziness and a splitting headache, Kingu vaguely makes out flames enveloping everything around him. Dark red rifts fan out all over the ground, and countless monsters begin pouring out from them...

115171003.content: An aide raises their firearm and blows away a monster that was lunging towards Kingu, but is then taken down by two monsters attacking from behind.

115171004.content: Having finally regained his senses, Kingu immediately fires up Wasteland Fiend and cuts down three monsters, but the aide is already down.

115171005.content: What's going on? That explosion just now...

115171006.content: Careful...! Those monsters... Our ammo... isn't enough...

115171007.content: Monsters... Don't worry! As soon as I fix Dark Metal, they won't be a problem.

115171008.content: Hey, just hang in there a little longer!

115171009.content: The aide makes his last effort to extend a hand, showing Kingu the way.

115171010.content: That... big guy... we borrowed... went... that way...

115171011.content: Kingu... We did... all of this... to make... Rostach better... right...?

115171012.content: The Resistance soldier's hand falls weakly.

115171013.content: Meanwhile, at least dozens of other Resistance soldiers have similarly collapsed in pools of blood. The bounty hunters and the main force of the Resistance have all been scattered in the chaos that's unfolded.

115171014.content: Frozen in place, Kingu stands alone amid the shrieks of monsters, like a lost child.

115171015.content: Stay calm... Kingu, stay calm! I need to save them, I need to find Marduk, I need... Dark Metal! I need to get Dark Metal back!

115171016.content: Forcing himself to regain his composure, Kingu realizes that his first priority is getting Dark Metal back. He takes out the controller and presses the Recall button several times in a row, but nothing happens.

115171017.content: Did the circuits burn out? Guess I have to do it the old way...

115171018.content: Kingu starts up Wasteland Fiend again, then dashes toward the monsters in his way.

115172001.content: After a lengthy pursuit, Kingu finally finds himself in front of the rampaging steel beast.

115172002.content: Already completely covered in dark red lines, the AGI Mecha known as Dark Metal occasionally lets out low growls of indiscernible meaning while aimlessly destroying everything in its vicinity.

115172004.content: The instant it catches Kingu in its mechanical eye, Dark Metal lets out a bloodcurdling roar and assumes an attack stance.

115172006.content: Kingu forcefully presses the Terminate button on the controller, but it has absolutely no effect on Dark Metal.

115172008.content: Get out of the way, kid!

115172009.content: Marduk appears out of nowhere and tackles Kingu. A split second after, Dark Metal's front blade whistles right over them.

115172010.content: Forget the controller, the Bane Energy's already got that AGI Mecha... The point is, you need to run!

115172011.content: I had it in my bag! You did something to my mecha, didn't you?!

115172012.content: Listen to me! I've lost a lot of my men as well! There's nothing you can do here, so scram already!

115172013.content: You're not scaring me off like a kid just by yelling at me!

115172014.content: Besides, since I made this mess, it's only fair I clean it up myself. Just stay out of it!

115172015.content: Kingu aggressively breaks away from Marduk, raises Wasteland Fiend, and charges toward Dark Metal.

115172016.content: In a single wave of its front blade, Dark Metal sends Wasteland Fiend flying from Kingu's grasp with unimaginable force, leaving Kingu utterly vulnerable to its next attack.

115181001.content: The flames have now spread to half of the station, and the chilling screeches of Visbanes echo through the air.

115181004.content: Y-Yeah, I guess... Right, have you seen Marduk? I lost sight of him after the explosion!

115181006.content: Why wasn't there any forecast of the Quake? Was there a slip?

115181009.content: At Anubis' suggestion, Bastet turns her eyes to the current time displayed on the terminal—

115181010.content: 9:10... That's... the deadline Paracaesar gave us to withdraw...

115181011.content: Anubis is silent for a moment, then opens his comms channel with Paracaesar.

115181012.content: So? Have you taken Marduk with you?

115181013.content: No. A Quake just hit Rostach.

115181015.content: Yes... A Quake was recorded ten minutes ago. How unfortunate, it must have slipped through the cracks in Aether Gazer's forecast system.

115181017.content: Heh. Don't let your rage get the better of you, Jackal, I'm only teasing. And where's the kitten? Is she fine?

115181019.content: Excellent. Seeing as you're both valuable assets I cultivated personally, I'd hoped you would withdraw before nine so that no... accident would befall you.

115181020.content: Aether Gazer predicted two weeks ago that a Quake would occur in Rostach. As is customary, we were to inform Rostach on their behalf.

115181022.content: Ma'am, why would you do something like that?!

115181023.content: As I've said, the only reason Rostach still exists is because of Marduk's promise to eliminate latent threats there.

115181024.content: But with all these conflicts sprouting up all over the place, I cannot see how he'd keep his end of the bargain. Naturally, I had to step in.

115181025.content: What about the people living here...!

115181026.content: Hasn't either of you ever run an experiment? If you don't clean up after yourself properly, you'll end up with bacteria left over in the culture dish.

115181027.content: Observing a bacterial colony could be sport, but it's best you scrub it from the dish to keep the experimental environment tidy.

115181028.content: Those people, they're no more than bacteria.

115181030.content: I refuse to accept that, ma'am!

115181031.content: Even you would defy me, kitten?

115181033.content: Once again I'd like to remind you, that by no means do I wish death upon these people. All I've ever wanted is for them to stay out of the way of my plans.

115181034.content: To that end, I will always pick the best route. The Quake was just convenient enough to occur at the optimal time.

115181035.content: Marduk hasn't been rescued yet. I will continue with the mission.

115181036.content: Suit yourself, provided you don't mind the consequences that await you.

115181037.content: Are you going with him, kitten?

115181038.content: I... I'm sorry, ma'am, but I have to help him complete the mission!

115181039.content: Heh, the two of you... No matter, I expected no less.

115181041.content: Anubis, what do we do now...?

115191001.content: After crossing the last obstacle, Anubis finally sees Marduk.

115191002.content: Shielding Kingu behind him, his arm is drenched in blood. The Bane Energy-corrupted AGI Mecha looms before him. Though currently paralyzed from a heavy blow, it's rapidly rebooting.

115191003.content: Lit up by the flames, Marduk's physique looks as stalwart as ever, like an unconquerable mountain.

115191006.content: Glad to see you both okay. Now save your own skin, I'm not going with you!

115191007.content: No! We're here to take down this hunk of metal with you!

115191008.content: That's not what Paracaesar told you to do, was it?

115191009.content: It's what we want to do.

115191010.content: Tch. Stop getting in the way, old fart! I can subdue it!

115191011.content: Seeing that Anubis and Bastet have arrived, Kingu snaps out of it and speaks. His faintly trembling voice, however, gives away his panic.

115191014.content: Marduk gives a couple dry coughs, wipes the blood from the corner of his mouth, then locks his sights on Dark Metal, still mid-reboot. He lifts up Rage Serpent once more. Blood drips down his shoulder, turning the gun in his hands from black to red.

115191015.content: Kingu stares at Marduk's back, his teeth digging into his lower lip. Finally, he relaxes his jaw, at last giving up the idea of joining this fight that's above his power level.

115191016.content: Just what are you hiding, old man? You still won't explain, even now?!

115191018.content: Without looking back, Marduk continues to raise Rage Serpent, like a hunter raising his bow to guard his young from a ferocious beast. Soon after, however, words begin to spill from the man's mouth like a sigh of relief.

115191019.content: You may be a Modifier, but since you haven't fully awakened to your powers yet, these concepts might not ring a bell to you...

115191020.content: The disaster that you just witnessed is called a Quake. These monsters are called Visbanes. That AGI Mecha of yours has been corrupted by the Bane Energy they brought here, that's why you can't fix it.

115191022.content: Over a decade ago, CORG predicted the disaster would spread through the entire world. They worked hard to stop the Quakes, but there were unintended consequences. Rostach's misery was one of them...

115191023.content: You wanted to know why I cooperated with CORG. The truth is—I used to work for CORG before I got here, and everything I did was to help them find a way to stop the disaster.

115191025.content: Didn't you say you could do a better job than me, kid? That I should leave all my "problems" to you?!

115191026.content: Now tell me what you'd do if you were me?! Destroy CORG, slay your enemies, then let disaster run rampant?!

115191028.content: Kingu looks around. The nearby buildings have been reduced to rubble and the surrounding area is now engulfed in flames. The monsters let out ear-piercing shrieks as they spill out from the rifts without end.

115191029.content: The troops he formed have utterly succumbed to the monsters' assault, and Wasteland Fiend—his pride and joy—couldn't withstand a single blow from the AGI Mecha.

115191030.content: In the face of total calamity, he has once again found himself an incapable child.

115191032.content: The Visbane-corrupted AGI Mecha suddenly reawakens with a low rumble—its reboot is now complete.

115191033.content: Hey, CORG boy there! Do me one last favor! Go protect the civilians, I'll handle the AGI Mecha!

115191034.content: It's too dangerous for you to fight it alone, boss!

115191037.content: Haha... I hear you're adopted, but you really are a lot like Jackal. Having someone like you who gets it as a comrade-in-arms sure takes me back!

115191038.content: Eyes on Anubis' back, Marduk's face breaks into a smirk.

115191039.content: You told me that, if you had been there, maybe you could have saved Jackal. Tch, just what you'd expect from a kiddo. Even if you had been there, even if Jackal had known you're a Modifier, he still would have thrown himself between you and harm's way without hesitation.

115191040.content: There isn't a father in this world that puts his own son in danger!

115191041.content: Its reboot complete, the Visbane-corrupted AGI Mecha lets out an earth-shaking roar.

115191042.content: Come on! Show me what you got! This time, I don't have some stupid tower to protect!

115201001.content: With a loud bang from Rage Serpent, the Visbane-corrupted AGI Mecha finally collapses on the ground with a crash.

115201002.content: The steel beast blocked countless shells from the man, but there was something even stronger that even the toughest steel couldn't withstand—determination.

115201003.content: Where's your reboot button now, huh?...Ha... Hahaha... (Cough)...

115201004.content: Marduk is so more exhausted than he thinks. He can no longer stand.

115201005.content: No... not now... There are still more Visbanes...

115201006.content: Anubis rushes over to Marduk's side, steadying him just as he's about to collapse.

115201008.content: Don't worry, I've taken care of the Visbanes in the area...

115201009.content: That Quake was brutal, I have to assemble the Guild immediately... (Coughs violently)

115201012.content: Perhaps having seen the fight between Marduk and Dark Metal from a distance, the Akkadian Guild bounty hunters arrive in droves.

115201013.content: Dammit! Boss, the earthquake hit out of nowhere, then awful monsters started popping out all over!

115201014.content: Hey, Kingu's here too! Grab him!

115201015.content: Those monsters only showed up after he sent out that AGI Mecha! It can't be a coincidence!

115201016.content: Get your hands off me... What do you think you're doing?!

115201017.content: Enough, he had nothing to do with this!

115201018.content: Marduk's reproach stuns everyone present—other than the crazed Visbanes rushing over.

115201019.content: How are the people outside the station?

115201020.content: I don't know. But given the situation, I...

115201021.content: My wife still hasn't answered me since the Quake... Oh no...

115201022.content: Now I want you to take care of each other... while we go save some people outside the station.

115201024.content: A panicked Akkadian Guild member sprints from the ruins of the carriages, but before he finishes screaming, a dense barrage of bullets suddenly hails down from the sky, wiping out the Visbanes that were hot on his tail.

115201025.content: A figure appears atop a nearby carriage. With a casual snap of his fingers, the sound of heavy footfalls rings out from a distance—a group of small, armed AGI Mechas quickly charges in and repels all the Visbanes in the area one by one.

115201026.content: Marduk. Looks like I made it right on time.

115201027.content: Ethan...? What the hell are you doing here?

115201028.content: Kingu is my partner. As leader of the Children of Iron, it's not like I'd just leave him high and dry.

115201029.content: During Ethan's speech, a dozen or so small, armed AGI Mechas go over to Kingu and separate him from the bounty hunters.

115201030.content: So, you're the one who gave Kingu that AGI Mecha.

115201031.content: Oh... Yeah. I went on a looting spree recently in a big factory and snagged quite a few of them!

115201032.content: Ethan! I, investigator from CORG's Egregious Crimes Department, am here to inform you that you're detained under CORG Statute 26 for vandalizing the Photon Rail, theft of military supplies, and illegal possession of weapons of mass destruction. You will come with me and answer my questions!

115201033.content: Graahhh!! What's this guy yammering about, Bossman?

115201034.content: (Anubis, there's so many of them. Do we really have to show our hand right now?)

115201035.content: Oh... So, you were after me this whole time? CORG's li'l hound dog... Heh, interesting. A pity that I've got something more pressing right now. So maybe next time.

115201036.content: Kingu! You made up your mind yet?

115201038.content: Then it's settled! Your baby boy's coming with me, Marduk! He's got somewhere more important to be. Now, if you'd be so kind.

115201039.content: No need to worry about the monsters outside, I've already taken care of them. I think that makes us even.

115201040.content: Is this some kind of joke? You think you're taking a traitor of our guild away like nothing happened?

115201041.content: So, you Children of Iron punks have been pulling the strings!

115201042.content: Huh?! The heck you guys talking about? You wanna fight? Bring it, the more the merrier!

115201044.content: Marduk's command leaves both sides silent for a moment. Between both sides of the stand-off, only Kingu steps forward.

115201045.content: Old fart... You used to be a CORG?

115201047.content: Did you help CORG to find a so-called "way to stop the disaster" on their behalf, or to help Rostach survive under them?

115201050.content: You asked what I would choose to do in your place, right?

115201051.content: I've made up my mind. I'm a Rostacher, born and bred. That world-ending disaster needs to be taken care of, sure. But why do we Rostacher have to be the ones to sacrifice everything for it?!

115201052.content: Why don't we get a say in any of it? Who gives CORG the right to set up our life for us? Screw them, and screw that "necessary sacrifice!"

115201053.content: I'll take back everything they took from us with my own hands!

115201054.content: And future disaster, whatever it is, I'll find a way to deal with it. I'll prove that CORG is full of it!

115201057.content: Suddenly, Marduk raises his hand. Just when Kingu thinks he's going to strike, all he feels is slight pain from a bump against his forehead.

115201058.content: Do what you want to do.

115201060.content: Why would I? Haven't you already thought it through? I've seen too many people just muddle through life. You believe in something, that makes you a better jerk than I was.

115201062.content: You can walk your own path, but once you take your first step, you have a responsibility to yourself. That's the difference between kids and adults.

115201063.content: I don't agree with your choice to fight CORG with him, but you're my son, and that's enough. You have my full support.

115201064.content: And... you can always pay me a visit when you mess up.

115201067.content: Marduk turns away from Kingu and doesn't look back.

115201071.content: The other bounty hunters look helplessly at each other, not saying another word.

115201072.content: Though seriously wounded, Marduk's voice only grows clearer and firmer, as if he doesn't want to give Kingu any reason to hesitate with his words.

115201073.content: Kingu clenches his fists as he looks at Marduk's back. Finally, he resolves to leave.

115201074.content: Mark my words, old fart... One day, you'll come to me and cry for my help! Then, I'll prove to you that you were wrong!

115201075.content: Kingu steps up onto the carapace of the AGI Mecha Ethan's standing on, then disappears into the night with the Children of Iron, followed by their legion of AGI Mechas.

115201076.content: As the first ray of dawn's light gleams from the east, the chaos that raged on through the night is finally over.

115201077.content: The bounty hunters leap into action, clearing the wreckage of buildings and tending to their injured comrades.

115201078.content: Fortunately, it was just one regular Quake and the rifts in the Source Layer closed up on their own pretty quickly.

115201079.content: Still, if that strange man hadn't come with all those AGI Mechas, there would have been even more casualties...

115201080.content: That woman received the warning well in advance, but chose not to let Rostach know, didn't she?

115201083.content: I'm returning to CORG. I need to report this to the higher-ups.

115201084.content: That's right! We need a big shot who can put Paracaesar in her place!

115201085.content: You kids... It won't do you any good.

115201086.content: You don't know what's involved in the research on artificial Modifiers. They might have full authorization from the Council of Observators.

115201087.content: Even so, I've made up my mind.

115201089.content: What will you do next, boss?

115201090.content: Marduk turns his gaze to the bounty hunters sitting beside him.

115201092.content: Boss... I just heard you say that you're... you were with CORG, is it true?

115201095.content: Colonel, then I got sacked. Now I'm not even on the bench.

115201097.content: To be frank with you, boss, you always talked about fishing for big orders and then a pile of supplies would arrive out of thin air. I had my thoughts...

115201098.content: But that doesn't matter. You've been our boss for, what, ten years or more? Even if you did work with CORG, I know you did it for our... what's the word... best interest, yeah!

115201099.content: You done with the crap? Good. Now, if any of you are still coming with me, get your ass up and we'll be on our way.

115201100.content: Since Paracaesar's already given up on Rostach, she can take her ban and stuff it. I'm getting everyone out of this place, we'll find somewhere new to call home.

115201102.content: You all saw the Quake and Visbanes. The Quake Damage Control Department should be on their way to wipe your memories as we speak.

115201103.content: Kid, you're not gonna detain us until they're here, are you?

115201105.content: Actually, if you guys plan on leaving... I know a place that could take you in without being noticed by CORG. Maybe.

115211001.content: The clamor echoing from afar makes this corner of the station seem completely quiet in contrast. A figure pokes their head out from a carriage, then assumes an utterly suspicious and clumsy-looking infiltration pose.

115211002.content: Bossman, I've reached the designated location. CORG soldiers really do have eyes on the place.

115211003.content: Good work. Find a way in, and make it quick.

115211005.content: Do you think it's a good idea?

115211006.content: I do. With Kingu's guys facing off against the Akkadian Guild, CORG's focus falls elsewhere. This is the perfect time to sneak in.

115211007.content: No! I mean, can we really count on Sobek to carry out a mission like this?

115211008.content: Pops, you really don't think those CORG goons will be any match for me, do you?

115211010.content: Zero One is on another mission, so why don't you help me ready the AGI Mecha troops and give our boy a chance?

115211011.content: I suppose we do need more people. I hope Zero One's intel is right, or all our effort will go down the drain.

115211012.content: Have faith in her. CORG is more than capable of hiding its skeletons in places it can legally control, I assure you.

115211013.content: I thought Kingu could get Marduk to talk, but it seems we'll have to look into it ourselves now.

115211014.content: Understood... Sobek, remember to stay in contact with us. No messing around in there!

115211015.content: You know what to do, Sobek.

115211016.content: Yup, just leave it to me! RAAHHH!

115212001.content: The warehouse door is smashed in with a bang, and Sobek charges through alone. Before the stream of light from his blade has dimmed, all the soldiers behind him are already out for the count.

115212003.content: Hasn't anyone taught you about "sneaking in"?! What if you triggered the alarm?

115212004.content: I don't hear a thing. Looks like they didn't have the chance to sound the alarm.

115212005.content: ...Guess the boy just reinvented the word "infiltration".

115212006.content: Wooooo—! Looks like I'm pretty good at this infiltration thing!

115212007.content: Now, watch your steps. We have no idea what's in that warehouse.

115212008.content: Whatever happens in there, you're on your own!

115212009.content: No problem! I'll just take out anyone I see!

115221001.content:
Dark Metal development log entry #1

The assembly of the various modules is complete, and our tests of the fire control system have proven it successful. The machine's firepower far exceeds that of conventional military mechas, and the armor used to simulate the skin of a Visbane was easily destroyed. The robot should thus be able to handle actual Visbanes with ease.

115221002.content:
Dark Metal development log entry #2

We now have a working self-repair system that uses memory alloy and overload-restart technology. It is almost impossible for this mecha to be destroyed in a conventional battle, so what exactly are the commanders planning?

115221003.content:
Dark Metal development log entry #4

Tech improvements are more or less completed. The AI system has been greatly weakened, and the corresponding maneuverability and fire control sensitivity features are also greatly reduced and simplified. The self-repair system has been completely removed, and the mecha is now also smaller in size. Although it is now much more capable of resisting corrosion, it is now also a mere consumable that has to be deployed in numbers to ensure victory.

The design standards described above have been incorporated into the new manufacturing specifications. We have no choice but to do this, since we cannot afford to have an accident like that happen again.

115222003.content: Dark Metal's first battle with the Visbanes... ended in disaster... systems corrupted by Bane Energy... control was lost... military intervention... workshop sealed off...

115222004.content: I don't understand. Are those AGI Mechas really this weak?

115222005.content: Before Sobek finishes reading, an alarm suddenly sounds.

115222006.content: Huh? But I took everyone out!

115222007.content: Bossman, Sobek here. I, uh, mighta screwed up.

115222008.content: Not all alarms are sounded manually, boy. Places where secrets are being kept definitely have automatic alarms around!

115222009.content: GRAAAH...! This might be it for me, but I'll tell you everything I learned first!

115222010.content: That AGI Mecha, the one we built based on the drawings, its AI got corrupted, but then the tech was improved by—

115222011.content: Save your last words for later! Get yourself out of there first!

115222012.content: Just make a run for the exit. We'll handle the rest.

115232001.content: A dense burst of gunfire rattles out, and everyone behind Sobek collapses to the ground.

115232002.content: Ethan and Olheim appear at the exit, looking down at the awkwardly prone Sobek like two helpless parents.

115232004.content: Wanna try not to make a mess of things next time? Have you not learned anything from me in all this time?

115232005.content: I... I could have made it out on my own!

115232006.content: Still fooling yourself even now? Did you get the intel?

115232008.content: Sobek draws a wad of creased papers from a slit in his helmet.

115232009.content: No need to be worked up, boss. He just leaps before he looks. I'll give him a lesson later, don't worry.

115232010.content: Huh? Oh, not at all. I was just trying to figure out when Zero One will get back. The gang's been spending less and less time together lately, and I think we should get a group photo the next time.

115232011.content: Um, sure, boss, but I have to say I didn't quite catch you...

115232012.content: As Olheim speaks, CORG guards close in around them. Then, as if suddenly receiving a new command, they immediately turn and vacate the area.

115232013.content: What, they got their tails between their legs already? Scared? Haha!

115232014.content: A vibration suddenly ripples in from the distance, followed by the shrill cries of Visbanes.

115232016.content: Now? Guess we'd better be on our way too!

115241001.content: The Children of Iron's safehouse lies at the edge of the container zone. Hidden and secure, it's completely safe even during a Quake.

115241002.content: After reading the intel Sobek brought back, Ethan's brows furrow.

115241003.content: From the looks of this intel, before CORG started researching artificial Modifiers, they had their eyes set on AGI Mecha tech. The purpose of all this research was to fight monsters called "Visbanes."

115241005.content: That restricted area we investigated before... Remember what we saw in there?

115241007.content: There's quite a few in Spealght as well. We've been dealing with these things for a while now.

115241008.content: Huh? How come I've never seen them?

115241009.content: CORG and Spealght worked together in the underground lab in Rostach to develop an armed AGI Mecha specifically designed to fight Visbanes—"Project Dark Metal."

115241010.content: They soon discovered a major flaw in their plan—without souls to drive the mechas, the more advanced their AI, the more easily corrupted they are by the Visbanes' Bane Energy. In the end, they were forced to terminate the project.

115241011.content: They hid their experimental data here, then sent the backup manufacturing data back to the Spealght headquarters.

115241012.content: So those blueprints we found in that Spealght factory...

115241013.content: Correct. And we accidentally built a bomb with them.

115241014.content: Then, the AGI Mecha Kingu had... Heh, good thing we lent it to him.

115241015.content: After that, CORG completely abandoned Project Dark Metal. They also tightened AGI Mecha manufacturing standards to prevent future batches from being vulnerable to Bane Energy corruption.

115241016.content: Combined with the intel Zero One got from CORG, we know that they pivoted to artificial Modifier research after Project Dark Metal failed.

115241017.content: Which must have failed as well. And it seemed to have led to even graver results, otherwise, there wouldn't have been so many restricted zones in Rostach.

115241018.content: Now where did they move on to after bricking it twice in a row?

115241019.content: Ethan looks at his mechanical arm, deep in thought.

115241020.content: I say we ask them in person. In any case, we have a name now: Paracaesar.

115241021.content: All right! Now we can finally take the fight to the enemy's lair, right?! I'm gonna cut 'em all up into teeny tiny, itty-bitty pieces! RAAAH—!

115241022.content: Hijacking the Photon Rail was already a tough job. Are you saying we're launching a direct attack on CORG's headquarters next?

115241023.content: Not in one shot. We'll take it one step at a time.

115241024.content: But first, the AGI Mechas are all tuned up now, right? We should go and pick up Kingu.

115241025.content: Huh? That AGI Mecha's a massive land mine waiting to blow, Kingu's probably already in over his head. Are we really gonna get ourselves into that mess?

115241026.content: I'm the one who gave him that land mine. Besides, aren't you always saying we should recruit more people? Kingu and his Resistance are sworn enemies of CORG. We could use their help.

115241028.content: Ethan takes the controller from Olheim and opens the warehouse door. The power indicators of thousands of compact AGI Mechas light up one after another.

115241029.content: Strength in numbers, right? Then we need to make our numbers BIG!

115251001.content: As live reports on the Rostach Quake stream in on CORG's internal communication screen, the research department personnel are as busy as always.

115251002.content: Ma'am, I've just been in touch with the Quake Damage Control Department.

115251004.content: Our people in Rostach did not make it out beforehand when the Quake hit.

115251005.content: Jackal and Kitten were right, that old coot refused to leave... Casualties?

115251006.content: Paracaesar asks casually, downplaying its significance as if simply confirming the results of a mundane experiment.

115251007.content: Less than a hundred, it would seem.

115251008.content: Less than a hundred? That's an unexpected low. Have you double-checked the datum?

115251009.content: Someone brought a group of AGI Mechas in halfway through. According to the report, they were the Children of Iron's. They left after the Quake was over, and Marduk later led survivors out of Rostach...

115251010.content: Oh, now that's a development I didn't anticipate.

115251011.content: Aether Gazer has been demanding to know why Rostach wasn't warned of the Quake... And I'm concerned that the survivors will spread the word about the Visbanes.

115251012.content: That's Quake Damage Control Department's problem, not mine. They were the ones who insisted on hiding the existence of Visbanes from the public anyway. We have more pressing matters to attend to.

115251013.content: Understood. I've already sent someone to find the whereabouts of 0704, it's just...

115251014.content: Speak freely. Following 0704's escape, I don't think anything can surprise me.

115251015.content: 0704 is making more and more of a stir, and by the time we arrived yesterday, it was too late to clean up the mess. It's possible that Aether Gazer took notice.

115251016.content: Where did I put my painkiller...

115251017.content: I had planned to inform you tomorrow...

115251018.content: It's fine. In fact, this might be our chance. The 0704 affair mustn't escalate further. I have to come up with another way to drag them down without exposing ourselves in the process.

115251019.content: Paracaesar's face breaks into a self-assured smile as she regards the various complex messages on the communication screen—just the way it always does whenever she's faced with an intractable research question.

105901002.content: I catch sight of the backpack-clad Apollo preparing to start his usual afternoon restaurant shift by the door. He gives me a wave.

105901004.content: All fellow Aether Gazers can come check out the restaurant if so desired. I know it may look a little expensive, but the food is up there with the best.

105901005.content: Plus, we'll throw in an exciting performance. Well worth the price!

105901006.content: Apollo may be a little one-sided with his self-appraisals, but certainly seems to have the skills where it counts in the music department. The diners should have a good time with his accompaniment.

105901007.content: Got it. I'll be there to give you moral support when I get time.

105901008.content: Great to hear it. Then I look forward to the present of your presence, Administrator!

105901009.content: The console soon lights up with Apollo's current location. It looks like he's made his way to a rather high-end restaurant.

105901010.content: Looks pretty good, I must say. Could be worthwhile living it up for an evening after work...

105901011.content: So I think as I make my way to the designated map coordinates after work.

105901012.content: One of the classiest, well-known restaurants anywhere in Ain Soph, and it certainly looks the part. It's got a kind of vintage cruise ship decor that screams early industrialization as patrons dine away to the pleasant background sounds of steam pistons hauling across the ocean.

105901013.content: The classical ensemble highlighted in the middle of the dining hall fits the theme perfectly - among which is Apollo. He's quite wrapped up in his performance and doesn't seem to notice me.

105901014.content: How was I today? Please, don't hold back. I want to hear your unvarnished praise.

105901019.content: Administrator, glad you could make it! Sorry you had to see one of our "backstage dramas" just then.

105901020.content: The light returns to Apollo's dour, stony complexion upon noticing my arrival.

105901021.content: Awkward. I came here to congratulate Apollo on another performance well done, not overhear his dismissal by his manager.

105901023.content: Oh gosh... Showbiz, you know. And it wasn't my first warning. Apparently I keep doing my own thing and he thinks the ensemble gets distracted. But I honestly don't know what else to do because -

105901024.content: Apollo suddenly steps forward, arms raised, in exaggerated pose.

105901025.content: Great music is like the release of an arrow from a bow. You must target the seat of your audience's emotions—their hearts!

105901027.content: Hah, exactly! I've long since accepted my fate in life is not to be understood, except by similar visionaries of course.

105901029.content: (I'm not sure if it's really good for me just to encourage him like that.)

105901030.content: Ahh. It is a headache, no doubt about it.

105901031.content: And, circumstances press me again, my dear Administrator, into humbly requesting another meal at your table.

105901032.content: But you can be absolutely assured of a first-class ticket when I eventually get my chance to perform in the grand auditorium!

105901034.content: You're about to walk out of the restaurant with Apollo when the sight of an argument delays your exit.

105901035.content: The customer at a certain table is clearly unhappy with their meal, and is having it out with the manager. Voices are getting heated.

105901036.content: You call this Omorfies lamb chops?! The taste of lamb is not tender enough! The meat is poorly cooked, and the spices are all wrong! You have no idea what you're talking about if you call this "Omorfian" cooking!

105901037.content: Madam, please just recognize for a moment this is our third attempt to serve you today.

105901038.content: But, if you remain unsatisfied, then I'm in the unhappy position of having to perhaps suggest you try another restaurant. But before you do, I would also please ask that you honor your bill for the effort we have taken tonight...

105901039.content: The customer is clearly not accepting this.

105901040.content: The customer then goes through the story of how she booked this very well-reputed, very pricy establishment over two months in advance just for a chance to relive some dearly-remembered dishes from her much-beloved and most sorely-missed hometown.

105901041.content: And she is utterly adamant that her excursion to this restaurant and authentic Omorfies lamb chops shall not, under any circumstances, end until satisfactorily fulfilled.

105901042.content: The head chef chooses this moment to burst out of the kitchen to vouch loudly for both the authentic ingredients and flavors involved.

105901043.content: The head chef then loudly stakes his entire culinary reputation on the genuineness of this dish.

105901044.content: The argument has evidently reached some kind of tipping point.

105901045.content: (Time for a decision: leave quietly or try to add some wisdom to the discussion...?)

105901047.content: Huh? Apollo? Where have you got to...

105901049.content: Your casual interjection seems to have stirred up bitter feelings from both parties...

105901050.content: Never a good idea to intervene... Oh well. I'd better make myself scarce before this hornets' nest gets me too.

105901051.content: Let's go, Apollo. Uh... Apollo? Where are you?

105901052.content: So caught up in your interaction were you that you somehow miss Apollo's exit.

105901053.content: Then, in the twinkle of an eye, you see Apollo make his way over to you again but this time carrying his harp in his hands. He sits down beside the discontented customer's table before beginning a voice and harp serenade under the rapt stares of those present.

105901054.content: Shine heaven's eyes in dark velvet deep ♪ Guiding sailors' hearts home, their ageless keep ♪

105901055.content: Cradle the waves and vast sea ♪ May tranquil and calm still they be ♪

105901057.content: How these bottled memories sing a song ♪ "Sweet, oh sweet salt breeze, lead us where we belong ♪

105901058.content: Souls to whom our fates belong." ♪

105901060.content: Apollo's melodious interruption appears to have utterly distracted the customer and head chef from their argument.

105901061.content: The manager who had just moments ago sent Apollo packing for his "free-spirited style" seems now at a loss for words.

105901062.content: Apollo's solo has attracted the attention of all other patrons who, gradually and then all at once, erupt in a round of applause.

105901064.content: The customer's voice trembles with emotion as she points out the song's name, which has clearly triggered a dear remembrance of great significance judging from her teary eyes.

105901065.content: Oh, oh! It is not becoming of me to provoke a lady to tears! By way of apology, would you mind if I cooked up some authentic Omorfies lamb chops for you?

105901066.content: Apollo turns to the head chef still standing there off to the side.

105901067.content: Mr. Head Chef, could I borrow your esteemed kitchen facilities for just a moment?

105901069.content: Ah-hah! Just you wait, Administrator! You didn't think my many talents were confined simply to the world of music, did you?

105901070.content: Apollo gives me a wink as the head chef who, apparently still stuck in some kind of reverie induced by Apollo's performance, barely gives the most half-conscious of nods.

105901072.content:
Apollo returns shortly thereafter from the kitchen carrying a plate of freshly oven-roasted lamb chops as he unties his apron.
It looks virtually identical to the head chef's previous attempt.

105901073.content: The mesmerizing effect of Apollo's performance seems to have mostly lifted by now. The customer casts a suspicious eye over the newly prepared lamb chops, looks back at Apollo's beaming face, and then slowly reaches for her fork—

105901074.content: It's.... oh! Authentic Omorfies lamb chops! Yes!

105901075.content: Well-tuned to your palate, I should trust. And thus hopefully I can be forgiven for my loutish incitement to your tears.

105901076.content: Apollo's extraordinary culinary skills are complete news...

105901077.content: Thank you. I feel so vindicated. Otherwise they would've probably thought I was just kicking up a fuss over nothing....

105901078.content: Not all! We take every customer complaint with the utmost seriousness.

105901079.content: The manager himself appears rather content with the current outcome of the drama.

105901080.content: And one other thing... Mr Apollo, on behalf of management, I'd like to convey my thanks for protecting us from what could have been a dark stain on our reputation for excellence.

105901081.content: Heh! It was no trouble at all, really! Just a little bit of pottering around in the kitchen—given all my expertise.

105902001.content: You finally exit the restaurant with Apollo and a sneaking suspicion something about the day's bizarre events isn't quite right.

105902002.content: I'm honestly taken aback, Apollo, that your skills in the kitchen surpass even the head chef of such a famous restaurant.

105902003.content: I can't claim that, Administrator. I fancy myself a man of many talents, but truly I was simply following the exact recipe in the kitchen manual.

105902005.content: Omorfians have very unique tastes compared to people from most Sephirah Zones. That's why other chefs can't make it the right way, because it goes against their common sense.

105902006.content:
Rosemary—the quintessence of the Omorfies style.
The thing is, I add it at the start when I'm marinating the chops, and not just at the end as a finishing touch.

105902007.content: I was not aware of that. I see you're genuine Omorfian, born and bred.

105902008.content: But I knew even that wouldn't be enough, judging by the way those two were going at it.

105902009.content: It didn't matter how good that dish was. Anything in front of such an aggravated customer would have been a "fail".

105902010.content: So I needed to add a "magical touch" before making my own offering.

105902013.content: No less than a household favorite for pretty much anyone from Omorfies - "Sea of Stars". Nothing like one of the old classics to calm someone down who so desperately misses home.

105902014.content: My nostalgic foray would have also accentuated the "Omorfian" aromas of the dish when I brought it out.

105902015.content: I get it. All the hallmarks of your distinctive brilliance.

105902016.content: So concluding, Apollo does not use the opportunity to heap more flattery upon himself as usual, but offers a sheepish smile as he fixes up his golden hairdo.

105902017.content: You are reminded of an old rumor: that Apollo was forced into Aether Gazer and a new career due to his stubborn refusal to entertain romantic entanglements with a certain lady of considerable note in Omorfies.

105902018.content: You finally managed to stop yourself from asking Apollo about the rumor.

105902019.content:
Wonderful news, Apollo.
You are back in your preferred role and with a suitable salary boost.

105902020.content: The pleasant end to the encounter markedly improves the restaurant manager's attitude to Apollo.

105902021.content: The manager not only thanks and praises Apollo for his well-placed intervention, but also rescinds his earlier dismissal with a new job offer at a substantially higher pay.

105902022.content: Huh! What a wonderful ending. The happy diners of this establishment will have the good fortune of continuing to enjoy the healing melodies of my performance and uplifting, sunny voice.

105902024.content:
I'm quite used to Apollo's self-aggrandizement by now.
But the motivation to poke fun is quickly subsumed by another thought—

105902025.content: That reminds me, you looked a bit worried when I saw you leaving earlier today. Was something bothering you?

105902026.content:
Ah, thanks for the reminder, Administrator.
I very nearly forgot today's "main event" thanks to this impromptu exercise in customer relations.

105902028.content: Apollo lifts his wrist to glance at the empty space of what was presumably meant to be a wristwatch—

105902029.content:
Well, there should still be enough time, but it'll be tight. I'll be heading off then.
See you tomorrow, Administrator. Adios.

105902031.content: Apollo leaves for the city streets atop his motorcycle and I am momentarily at a loss for what to do.

105902033.content: I was wandering that Apollo's promotion into a better paying and more stable restaurant job would spell the end of his financial difficulties. I did not realize it was but a small portent of what Apollo could do.

105902034.content:
Administrator, I was just wondering if you'd like to become the first lucky customer of the "Apollo Psychological Counselling and Guidance Center"?
There's a special discount for you, Admin.

105902035.content: Apollo popped into the lobby and offered this out-of-the-blue proposition. I must say I was rather surprised.

105902037.content: I've not made a systematic study of the topic, but I'm confident that my natural talent, grasp of the literature and many varied experiences with friends should give me ample understanding of the field of psychological counselling.

105902038.content: It's a particular point of pride that every single one of the individuals I've counseled has managed to set aside a lot of their negativity in favor of a much more upbeat and confident attitude, as exemplified by myself.

105902039.content:
...They say vice is found at all extremes...
And also, Apollo, I expected you'd be doing well after your recent promotion. What's motivating this new business venture?

105902040.content: Haha! How can I not let my "sunlight" reach every part of the world? And... there're plenty of good reasons to spend those lovely coins.

105902041.content: How about cutting back on your spending as an alternative? For example, you could have not bought Zenkibo a new personal drone as a gift.

105902042.content: It turns out that the "main event" Apollo referred to that day was a trip to the AGI Mecha Mall for the latest in high tech drones.

105902043.content: Equipped with a voice-control system, capable of aerial photography, and high agility from the rotor system. Such a drone surely is Zenkibo's dream gift. However, when Zenkibo is happy, someone will get a headache...

105902044.content: Hahahaha. I just wanted to give her a present to help her discover some new interests, so that she can spend less time pranking people. I was only thinking of the greater good!

105902045.content: Yet by doing so enabled her mischief-making to reach new, destructive heights...

105902046.content: But don't you think the gift's a bit too much? You really are just spoiling her.

105902047.content: Heh! How can I deny the honest prayers of a lady? After all, "one must always answer the wish of a fair maiden", that's somewhat of a life motto of mine.

105902048.content: Well... I can only hope your credit card agrees with that sentiment next month.

105902049.content: In the end it turns out Apollo's enormous investment in a state-of-the-art photography drone for Zenkibo once again plunged him into dire financial straits.

105902050.content:
Apollo's "Psychological Counseling Office" sadly had to shutter its doors after a considerable length of time and a lack of customers.
An outcome that could be expected given the challenges of such impulsive business ideas.

105902051.content: Zenkibo and I decide to check up on Apollo at the restaurant where he works.

105902052.content:
Ah, Apollo's friends, right? Welcome!
I remember how helpful you were before. It'd be my pleasure to offer you a 20% friends' discount!

105902053.content: Oh... you're looking for Apollo then?

105902054.content:
I approved his leave. He's not coming in today, as I understand it.
Anything's wrong? I hope he's OK!

105902055.content: I leave the restaurant more unsettled about Apollo circumstances after politely declining the manager's offer of help to locate him.

105902056.content: Gosh... that seem off to you? Pineapple abruptly asking for leave without saying anything, and he left so early this morning?

105902057.content: I just hope he's not in any kind of trouble... Come to think of it, I thought I heard him muttering something about "finding another way" or something of that nature when he left this morning.

105902058.content:
(Apollo surely isn't the type of person who would do something unethical for money's sake.
Or, to put another way, it doesn't seem too likely he's embarked anything really out-of-the-ordinary...)

105902059.content: I think it's completely possible he's been tricked into doing something dangerous, knowing his penchant for dumb heroics. Like joining the Musketeers or something.

105902061.content: "Oh no, a princess somewhere has been kidnapped and held in another castle... We have to do something to save this poor girl!"

105902063.content: Zenkibo delivers an uncanny impression of Apollo, probably given their membership in the same team.

105902064.content: Growing more concerned by the hour, we decide to mount a full search everywhere we think Apollo might be.

105902065.content: Another restaurant? Maybe he got a better offer.

105902066.content: A salon? It'd be just like him to throw fiscal prudence to the wind for some fun?

105902067.content: A hairdresser? A chance to practice his favorite hairstyles in a place that would approve of them?

105902068.content: The plaza? We might see a street busker there with a harp and a cap for donations.

105902069.content:
...No luck.
None of the places that could obviously have been of interest to Apollo turn up any trace of the man.

105902070.content: All other avenues exhausted, all that remained was to drag our weary bodies back to Aether Gazer.

105902071.content: (How bad can it be? He's a fully grown adult...)

105902072.content: Yikes. It's just really hard to know what to think with someone like him.

105902073.content: Zenkibo releases her frustrations pent up from a day of searching.

105902074.content: Zenkibo isn't wrong, but frankly it's not her place to judge. Not after all these pranks.

105902075.content: And I wouldn't be surprised if whatever reason she's so interested in finding him today is that she misses the subject of her mischievous experiments...

105902076.content: There's nothing for it but to use Zenki's "ace in the hole"!

105902078.content: Copy that. Battle Eagle A initiating -

105902079.content: Zenkibo seizes the joystick excitedly as the drone slowly ascends up by her feet and out of the window with a loud buzzing sound.

105902080.content: Apollo's present has been deployed in a most unexpected way. So I think as I gaze upon the little drone Zenkibo affectionately named "Battle Eagle A".

105903001.content: You know, the West Coast Core City looks very different from way up here compared to street level. No wonder so many people have fallen in love with this metropolis of technical wonders.

105903002.content: ... Wait! Now's not the time to get caught up in sightseeing, but to find the shadowy figure of Apollo as he makes his way past these busy city streets.

105903003.content: I crane my neck to get a good view of the live feed from the drone as Zenkibo looks for signs of Apollo.

105903004.content: Hold on a second! When did that dessert shop open? I wonder if they have lava pearl cake.

105903005.content: (Actually, I think maybe I'm the only one who's really anxiously searching the screen...)

105903006.content: What are you doing, racing on the streets?! You're not going to outrun Zenki's Battle Eagle A with those poor motorcycles! Come on!

105903007.content: We're looking for Apollo, right, Zenkibo?

105903009.content: Even a lengthy round trip around the skies above Ain Soph is insufficient to reveal Apollo's latest movements. It's eerie, almost as if he's vanished without a trace.

105903010.content: Of course, there's not much we can do if he happens to be indoor. We're not going to search the gazillion buildings that make up Ain Soph.

105903012.content: I was just reconciling myself to seeing Apollo turn up out of nowhere at some later date as if nothing had happened when Zenkibo glimpses something exciting on the feed.

105903014.content: The drone has come across a live stage performance of the popular cartoon "Atlasman" in a public gardens. Today, the typically quiet green space is anything but.

105903015.content: Zenkibo, did you forget that we're looking for Apollo?

105903016.content: Yes, well, it's very possible that he's doing what everyone else is doing and seeing this performance!

105903018.content: You decide it's worth a shot looking for Apollo among the many faces of the crowded public garden, and yet Zenkibo rather unhelpfully brings the camera view down to almost eye level against the performers on the stage.

105903019.content: How's this supposed to help us find him?

105903020.content: Your comment doesn't seem to register with Zenkibo at all.

105903021.content: I must become stronger to protect everyone! Stronger!

105903022.content: Zenkibo excitedly mouths the famous words from the cartoon series alongside the Atlasman figure on the stage.

105903023.content: Cultural icon of the day, is he? Atlasman?

105903024.content: I take a good look at the well-built, masked protagonist on the stage clad in tight-fitting garments. His various acrobatic tricks, somersaults, long jumps and so on take in plenty of applause.

105903025.content: Hahaha! Battle Eagle A was the perfect gift! See? We even get to see an Atlasman performance now. It's just perfect.

105903026.content: Um… Wait...? His pose is slightly off... That's not from the comics.

105903027.content: Zenkibo seems to have noticed something amiss, and casts an inquisitive eye my way seeking confirmation.

105903028.content: I've never read the comics. But if you want my opinion, then... Huh? Hold on a sec...

105903029.content: Something's slightly off even to me. I've never read any of Atlasman comics, but -

105903030.content: (From what I know of cartoon protagonists, they usually are not so bombastic...  His movements are a little... exaggerated? It's almost like he's fishing for adoration...)

105903031.content: These flaunting moves and poses really do remind me of someone...

105903032.content: Zenkibo seems to have struck upon the same idea, and zooms in for a closer look.

105903033.content: A shame we can't make out his face underneath that mask...

105903034.content: Haha! Of course not. That's meant to be Atlasman's Mask of Righteousness. His powers lie in it.

105903035.content: Zenkibo strangely introduces this in a rather self-congratulatory tone.

105903037.content: Surprisingly, "Atlasman" notices the drone and waves at us through the camera in an unmistakably distinctive manner.

105903040.content: That's it. We've found Apollo, who at this moment is playing the protagonist of the popular Atlasman series in front of an adoring crowd.

105903041.content: I think this demands an in-person confirmation...

105903042.content: You want to go? Alright! Let's go.

105903043.content: The stage performance has just finished by the time we arrive to the park.

105903044.content: Zenkibo deftly pulls me along in the opposite direction of the thronging crowd backstage with all the finesse of an experienced camerawoman.

105903045.content: Our suspicions are immediately confirmed as to the identity of Atlasman who at this point has removed his mask but not prop clothing.

105903046.content: Pineapple, you rogue! How can you pull something off like this without inviting Zenki!

105903047.content: Heh... It sort of fell into my lap so fast I didn't have time to tell anyone. It's been a real blur. I'm sorry my Aether Gazer crew missed out.

105903048.content: Zenkibo and I got a few close-ups... but why Atlasman?

105903049.content: I must say, this role was made for me. I think the better question is why hasn't someone offered me the role before now?

105903050.content: It's simply inconceivable, like a sunflower unable to orientate itself to the light.

105903051.content: My next meeting is very soon. Could you be brief?

105903052.content: If you put it like that, Administrator, then I'll do my best to sketch the basics of my mesmerizing performance.

105903053.content: First of all, I must begin my story from four hours ago...

105904002.content: (Everyone is always so busy rushing to and fro, no one really takes time to appreciate the beauty all around them. What a cold and efficient age we live in. Where's the romance?)

105904003.content: It falls again to me to bring light and love into people's lives—my mission.

105904004.content: OK then. Let's go to the park and see whether an open-air performance by Apollo would garner much interest on this sunny weekend.

105904005.content: Apollo arrived at the Ain Soph City Park with his harp box.

105904006.content: Sure are a lot of people here today... But is it because their lives and thoughts have been touched by light and love recently?

105904007.content: However, it didn't take long before even Apollo, in all his infinite capacity for self-praise, had to admit the crowd was not here for his performance.

105904008.content: Wow, isn't that the character from the trending cartoon, Atlasman? A live stage show? Didn't expect that coming. The crime fighting Atlasman does cut a handsome figure, although not a patch on myself.

105904009.content: Looks like my open-air concert will have to wait. Let's enjoy the public performance of the Atlasman stage show with all these lovely people.

105904010.content: This should be fantastic! I don't know how it's going to compare with the cartoon though. Hey, what're they waiting for?

105904011.content: Haha! I'm all about the limited-edition memorabilia, and expect to pick some up today. Hey, aren't they meant to have started by now?

105904013.content: It appears the stage performers are running late for some reason.

105904014.content: There is no sign of the actors although there are certainly signs of banners fluttering in the wind and staff in plush mascot headwear exchanging awkward glances with the expectant audience.

105904015.content: Did you hear the rumor? The actor who's playing Atlasman's got food poisoning. He's been rushed to the hospital!

105904016.content: You're kidding! Food poisoning? I hope he's going to be OK...

105904017.content: Yeah. They might not go ahead. That's a shame. Took two hours to get here.

105904018.content: Rumors of the star performer's likely absence begins to ripple through the crowd like wildfire. The scene is abuzz with loud disappointment.

105904019.content: Huh? How can something like that happen in this day and age. Well, Atlasman, all you can do is rest up, buddy.

105904020.content: No one's going to walk away disappointed with Apollo on site! Hah! Missing the stage performance means another chance to hear Apollo's concert!

105904021.content: Apollo readies his harp in preparation for his own performance when he is especially struck by a little girl's heartfelt sobs.

105904022.content: No. I can't believe it! I wanted to see Atlasman... I want to see Atlasman!

105904023.content: The little girl is dressed in a princess dress, and her hair is braided in butterfly knots. Her parents are trying to comfort her, but nothing can stop her pearly tears from dropping.

105904024.content: Who's gonna save our city without Atlasman?

105904025.content: No! I don't want a chocolate cake! I want to see Atlasman!

105904026.content: What other bystanders may see as the willful tears of a young girl, Apollo sees as the unconscionable sight of a little darling tugging at his heartstrings.

105904027.content: "I want to see Atlasman" - the wish of a fair maiden.

105904028.content: My dear princess, your whole kingdom will be greatly affected by sadness with your continued tears.

105904029.content: Apollo gets down on one knee to look the girl directly into her tear-stained eyes.

105904031.content: The girl appears dumbstruck at the sudden sight. Her cheeks start to redden with the words "my dear princess".

105904032.content: Do not worry, milady, for no harm has come to Atlasman. He has merely... overslept and will be with us very soon.

105904034.content: Indeed. If you will only wait but a moment, my royal princess, it will be as if Atlasman were never absent. Remember he is always there when needed.

105904036.content: A glimmer of hope becomes visible in the girl's tear-stained eyes, like a gemstone glittering from the bottom of a lake.

105904037.content: - If that is the wish of a fair maiden, it shall be brought to pass.

105904038.content: Apollo stands up and offers the girl a gentlemanly bow.

105904039.content: If no one shall grant this young lady's wish, then I'm afraid the world has a very serious problem indeed.

105904040.content: What next? All I needed to be the savior of the hour was to find a way backstage, show off my acting talents as quickly as possible, and do a quick run through with my co-performers.

105904041.content: Huh! Good thing I'm a man of many talents and never forget a script - even at just a glance. I also have a knack for cooperating with my team perfectly, even though we just met 5 minutes ago...

105904042.content: You call that "perfectly"? You messed up some of his signature moves - and lines too!

105904043.content: Heh. Better not to sweat the details. Even the sun gets the occasional spot.

105904044.content: So... you jumped into the performance just for that little girl?

105904045.content: Is it not as I have said? "One must answer the wish of a fair maiden".

105904046.content: Apollo catches a glimpse of that girl again from the stage feed, which is still playing.

105904047.content: Not to mention, that's such an adorable princess.

105904049.content: The young girl holds a balloon as she walks with her parents past various stores selling memorabilia. Her face is positively beaming with joy. Any tears have long since gone.

105904050.content: Oh well. I can't argue with your reasoning... Well done, Apollo.

105904051.content: It may have nothing to do with Aether Gazer work, but there's no harm in throwing an occasional compliment Apollo's way.

105904052.content: Hahaha. Don't tell me you're falling for my charms too, Administrator? The average person is one thing, but I don't need to tell you the nature of our work could complicate things greatly.

105904054.content: Hah! Whatever. The thing I don't get is why you didn't invite your pal Zenki on your crazy escapade, Pineapple! You owe me an apology!

105904055.content: Oh, my dear Zenki, however can I make it up to you?

105904056.content: Don't think you can sweet-talk your way out of this! Actually there is one thing—a limited edition Atlasman action figure might wiggle some forgiveness from my pained heart...

105904057.content: Zenkibo points to a nearby store selling all kinds of memorabilia as something tells you she had this scene rehearsed.

105904058.content: ...It looks like Apollo's real fairy princess has been by his side the whole time.

105904059.content: Haha. Alright then. I just so happen to have my acting fees for today's work. Just remember to let me play with it occasionally, Zenkibo.

105904061.content: (Hey... Don't forget you're in dire financial straits, and it's a limited-edition figurine! Surely actors don't earn that much?)

500011001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500011002.content: You regain consciousness to find yourself situated in front of an expansive lake of crystal-clear water. You note the calming effect of the brilliant emerald water as a longsword with a golden hilt catches your eye as it floats amid the lake. The edge of the blade shimmers in the sun with an almost unnatural brilliance. Your choice at this time is to—

500011004.content: You obtain a sharp longsword. You quickly realize the importance of placing it in a scabbard as it nicks the palm of your hands, leaving a nasty-looking wound.

500011005.content: You immerse yourself in the water of the lake which seems to cleanse you of dirt and iniquity as if sanctified by some higher power. However, this inadvertently angers the lake spirit dwelling within who rages against your disturbance.

500011006.content: You have not left the serene lake behind for long before you meet an old man in a gray cap who greets you with a rather standard looking scabbard.

500021001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500021002.content: You regain consciousness to find yourself walking along a busy street. You get your bearings and notice some strange-acting nearby service AGI Mechas. The red lights are flickering, a sure sign of something wrong. You vaguely recall something of relevance...

500021004.content: You yell at what you think is the top of your voice, but barely attract a ripple of attention from nearby pedestrians as at this moment the AGI Mechas appear to lose all control. You note the logo of the manufacturer on the frame: Spealght...
