500021005.content: A decisive punch renders the camera over the malfunctioning mecha inoperable. This doesn't prevent the other AGI Mechas from experiencing the same malfunction, but at least you've saved a nearby little girl.

500031001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500031002.content: You reawaken to find yourself knee-deep in snow, buffeted by an icy wind that greatly obscures your sight. You make out a great humanoid statue ahead with difficulty and a spear running through it. You decide to—

500031004.content: The cold is almost too much to bear, and yet somehow you manage to pry the spear out of the statue before losing consciousness to the elements. The vicious snowstorm immediately dies.

500031005.content: Your odds of surviving a place like this do not look very good for any length of time, but eventually you find an exit after considerable stumbling.

500031006.content: The idea of asking for help via a quick prayer suddenly pops into your mind, something you hadn't considered until now... You open your eyes afterward and notice a warm-looking pendant in the snow ahead.

500041001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500041002.content: You recover consciousness to the feeling of two strong hands grabbing you by the shoulders. A man dressed in what looks like a mining outfit hauls you to an inconspicuous corner and enquires secretively whether you have any interest in purchasing a "very interesting little piece of ore" he's managed to dig up. He seems nervous. You decide to—

500041004.content: He's very happy at your response and, after exchanging some money for his bag, disappears into the crowd. You reach your hand in to take the item out only to receive a nasty electric shock. It's far from ideal, but you resolve to keep it considering the expense paid.

500041005.content: You sense a hint of desperation on the part of the miner, which is soon confirmed as he accepts an extremely lowball counter-offer for the object. He hands you the bag and then disappears into the crowd. You reach your hand in to get the object and are greeted by a very nasty electric shock. It must have been a con! You throw it away.

500041006.content: This doesn't look like the kind of trade a sensible person would make. You refuse the offer, and then quickly depart.

500051001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500051002.content: You reawaken to find yourself on some kind of vast mountain. A person on a raised sedan is currently heading in the direction of some shrine or other followed by a retinue of what appears to be five priests plus attendants. It appears a ceremony is an order. You decide to—

500051004.content: Something about your movements seems contrary to the strict requirements of the ceremony, and the chief attendee immediately recognizes your lame imitation and boots you out of the procession. You reach into your vest on the lonely trip down the mountain to discover an embroidered "raven" talisman. It seems to be a very old emblem of the Sasanami family...

500051005.content: Something seems wrong, and so you immediately take steps to leave the strange procession. This crude break from the ritual is recognized as an insult to the ceremony and attracts the wrath of the mountain god.

500061001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500061002.content: You reawaken. The first thing you notice is a large mess of nearby containers marked with the word "CORG". The haphazard tracks indicate maybe the convoy came under some sort of ambush from bounty hunters. It's a rather valuable haul, and so you decide to—

500061004.content: You're just about to open the last container when the survivors of the convoy return. This is going to be difficult to explain.

500061005.content: The rightful owners of the goods return before long and thank you profusely for your help. The group also throws in a handsome financial reward and a small gift.

500061006.content: Your actions aren't very honorable. You decide to leave with the contents of one of the larger containers, but it explodes before you have a chance to pry it open. The result is your new hairstyle.

500061007.content: You shouldn't take what isn't yours. That should be clear by now.

500071001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500071002.content: You reawaken to find yourself in the midst of a busy plaza full of all kinds of artistic sculptures and paintings. One item of artwork in a quiet corner attracts your eye with its rather exorbitant sales price, and you decide to—

500071004.content: The work is obviously rather abstract, but something about it sends disquieting chills down your spine. The artist can't help but notice your reaction, and proclaims you the "true and rightful" owner of the work, which he insists on giving you for free. This raises another question: where to put it? Clearly, not somewhere visible.

500071005.content: There are quite a number of artworks on display in the plaza and you select a few that appeal to you for one reason or another. The experience lifts your mood somewhat.

500071006.content: The generosity of your spending reflects the wealth you are lucky enough to possess. Regardless, you must admit that it was something of an impulse purchase.

500081001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500081002.content: You reawaken to find yourself sitting on a boat out in the middle of an extremely calm sea, without the least hint of a storm or faint ripples of a wave on the horizon. However, you can make out a beautiful singing voice somewhere far off, and hence decide to—

500081004.content: You are lucky enough not to suffer the consequences of your somewhat guileless decision as the singing turns out to be courtesy of some bored fishermen, who treat you rather kindly.

500081005.content: Unpleasant legends come to mind that motivate you to move your boat as fast as you can in the opposite direction. Unfortunately, this sets you on a collision course with an unpleasant storm. Your life is in peril.

500081006.content: Some time passes. You're not quite sure what to do. Perhaps it's best just to wait here for rescue and, as it turns out, you're in luck. You pay a small rescue fee and you're free to go.

500091001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500091002.content: You regain awareness to the sight of a man directing a herd of cows your way. He very politely pleads with you not to tell another living soul of the herd you've just witnessed and promises to return with an item of great value if you can keep his secret.

500091003.content: You're reflecting on what happened when this time a young man comes by and asks if you've seen a herd of cows around here somewhere. He looks quite stressed. You decide to—

500091005.content: You're not sure what's going on, but you can tell enough from the young man's anxious disposition that he needs some assistance at least. He's very happy to hear what you saw and gives you a small pouch of gold to express his thanks.

500091006.content: You find the offer from the previous man more enticing and so intentionally mislead the youth into going the wrong way. You wait for some time but the first man does not appear. You realize that you've been tricked.

500091007.content: Something tells you there's more to this than meets the eye, and so you mislead the young man into going the wrong way. You later trace tracks on the ground back to the first man who seems quite shocked to see you again and then provides you with a small violin crafted out of turtle shell. He then asks you again to forget everything you've seen today.

500101001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500101002.content: You recover your awareness to find yourself in the middle of a ruined city full of smoldering fires. There's a large rift in the ground nearby out of which an endless horde of Visbanes spill forth to inflict renewed damage on this once great city. You decide to—

500101004.content: Something instinctual drives you to resist the Visbanes even without a single weapon to your name. Something about this battle seems awfully familiar, but you have little time to reflect on this fact as your rash act of resistance quickly causes you to lose awareness again.

500101005.content: An instinct from deep within tells you the most important thing to do right now is keep a cool head and hide until circumstances improve. Luckily, your chosen spot is rather well-stocked with supplies, water, food, and even some basic weapons.

500111001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500111002.content: You reawaken to find yourself standing in front of a sword buried in a cube of stone. You also notice voices cheering you on nearby, encouraging you to pull the sword out. You decide to—

500111004.content: You recall certain legends and rather excitedly clasp your hands around the hilt of the blade as you give it a solid pull. To your great surprise, it slips out with incredible ease. You ride the wave of excitement for a short time until you realize it was just a toy.

500111005.content: You decide it's better not to waste your time trying to accomplish the impossible, and turn around to leave.

500121001.content: Administrator, Wheel of Fortune has been tasked with taking you temporarily to several particular times in history. You're always free to exit as usual, but note that the changes highlighted here are of particular significance to our Deviation Rate observations, so we suggest persevering with your decision.

500121002.content: You reawaken to find yourself in a noisy cafeteria full of what seem to be aggressive-looking mercenaries although not equipped with particularly good weapons. A rather short fellow comes up to you at this moment and asks if you're interested in sharing a drink.

500121004.content: You're not exactly enthralled by the idea, but think it's best not to decline. The short man sees something in your confident manner and comes over with a metal badge inscribed with the words "Children of Iron". He then tells you that you'll be fine hanging around here as long as you keep this on you.

500121005.content: You've had quite enough of this rowdy, drunken atmosphere. You wave your hands in polite refusal and walk out.

500121006.content: You feel compelled to refuse the invitation, but still hang around long enough to locate the owner and get some basic details about the place. He does that in exchange for a little "fact-finder's fee", meaning you have to buy a bottle of rather strange-looking liquid. You almost break out in a fever at the thought of drinking this disgusting concoction.

103901001.content: Today it's my day off, as well as Poseidon's.

103901002.content: So I decide to come into the office very early today to make sure nothing goes wrong.

103901003.content: Everything seems to be going well. Today might be the day to ask.

103901004.content: I open the drawer under my desk. Two tickets to the aquarium quietly sit there.

103901005.content: Poseidon has always been viewed as a trusted pillar of support for her co-workers as one of the core members of Division Nine.

103901006.content: She's shown me plenty of consideration on numerous occasions, and yet I haven't found the right opportunity to say thank you... until now. I heard she's always wanted to go to the aquarium, and so today is the day I plan to make that expedition into a reality.

103901007.content: I check today's schedule again just to make sure Poseidon is still in the HQ building and not out on some errand.

103901008.content:
Let's go.
Time to invite the guest of honor.

103901009.content: If I recall correctly, Poseidon's office should be just around here...

103901010.content: I see the name plate from a distance with the name "Poseidon" in beautiful floral script and a lovely image of a dolphin.

103901011.content: I was just about to walk over when -

103901012.content: A nimble shadowy figure beats me to the punch.

103901013.content: Ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah!

103901014.content: Is... Is Master going to hate me?!

103901015.content: Leviathan bursts into Poseidon's room with all of the finesse of a tornado.

103901017.content: The door slams shut in front of me with a vicious thud.

103901019.content: That's alright. I'll just wait for her to come out.

103901021.content: Hehe! Thank you, Poseidon! I'll try that—exactly what you said.

103901022.content: Leviathan's tears quickly morph into expressions of joy as she leaves Poseidon's office with a beaming smile, her mood clearly as changeable as a child's.

103901023.content:
Leviathan departs happily with something in her hands.
Now might be the moment...

103901025.content: I spot a figure that would have remained imperceptible were it not for my sharp eyes.

103901026.content: It's Hodur, who rather hesitantly skirts past from the nearby shadows.

103901029.content: I turn around before Hodur has had a chance to skedaddle and thus somehow relinquish my front-row ticket to Poseidon's door.

103901030.content: I'll just wait it out in this corner for a bit.

103901031.content: A short while later and I can make out a faint knocking sound.

103901032.content: Uh... May I... may I come in?

103901033.content: Of course. Please. Come in, Hodur.

103901035.content: I am once again shut out.

103901037.content: I'm quite bored by this stage, and the yawns have started coming. Hodur finally exits the room.

103901038.content: I feel much better now. Poseidon, thank you so much.

103901040.content: I stick my head over for a peek to see her clasping something tightly in her hands with a smile.

103901041.content: Hodur is gone now. Now at last I can—wait a second? Isn't that Shu? She's coming this way.

103901042.content: This is the first I've ever seen Shu walk such heavy, depressed steps. Whatever is bothering her is obviously bad enough that she barely registers Hodur's passing presence.

103901043.content: Poseidon is just about to close her door when she finds Shu standing in front of it.

103901044.content: Here you are. I've already brewed your favorite coffee.

103901045.content: Poseidon escorts Shu into her office with a smile before she has a chance to respond.

103901046.content: I once again find myself outside and staring eye to eye with the big-eyed dolphins on Poseidon's name plate.

103901047.content: I wonder what's bothering Shu so much...

103901048.content: Maybe... I'd better come back later?

103901050.content: I make my way once again to Poseidon's door.

103901051.content: I take a glance at the adorable name plate and consider once again whether I should just simply knock.

103901052.content:
No one is coming down the hallway to my left.
It's completely empty on my right.

103901053.content: There's nothing behind me... except my own shadow.

103901056.content: Poseidon's voice startles me as I swiftly turn around to find her looking right at me with a slight smile on her lips.

103901058.content: The room features the same basic layout as the other offices but in a completely different decor creating a very unique atmosphere.

103901059.content: I step inside as a feeling of peace washes over me much inspired by the room's decorative ocean theme.

103901060.content: Closing the door to Poseidon's office brings in a gust of wind that sets off gentle wind chimes from nearby shells in a melodious, yet piercing tune. Miniatures of various dolphins have been placed artfully and yet sparingly in various places around the blue-tinged room.

103901061.content:
Poseidon herself sits beside her desk, making some tea.
The aroma wafts in your direction and carries a hint of the ocean and its deep secrets.

103901062.content: I sit opposite Poseidon, surrounded by an encirclement of miniature dolphins that briefly conjures up thoughts of swimming with a school of fish.

103901064.content: Poseidon notices the way my eyes are drawn repeatedly to the dolphins, and explains embarrassingly.

103901065.content: I like to busy myself with creating little trinkets sometimes. Somehow I ended up making quite a lot of them.

103901066.content: You really like dolphins, don't you?

103901067.content: I certainly do! Dolphins are very adorable and also very intelligent! And I've encountered a number of dolphins while swimming...

103901068.content: ...Did you know that each dolphin possesses its own distinct whistle? It's kinda like their calling card.

103901069.content: ...And dolphins can pass mirror experiments, which was designed to test for self-awareness, so...

103901071.content:
Poseidon abruptly lowers her voice.
You see the red outline of a blush across her cheeks.

103901072.content:
I'm... I'm sorry. Have I said too much?
I always have a lot to say when it comes to the ocean...

103901073.content: Oh right! What brings you here today, Admin?

103901074.content: I unconsciously touch the aquarium tickets in my pocket.

103901075.content: Today is the holiday. I was thinking maybe... you and I could go for a walk.

103901076.content:
Oh! Of course we can.
So let's...Uh.

103901078.content:
Both of us are suddenly struck by the unseemly lateness of the hour.
Even if we left right away, the aquarium would have already closed its doors by the time we arrived.

103901082.content: Since we are not going anywhere today, how about this as a comforting present: Let me show you a unique relaxation technique!

103901083.content: Poseidon jumps up and moves to my side and, before I can react, I find myself looking up at her with 90 degree change in my field of vision.

103901084.content: The back of my head is now sitting on something warm, soft, and rather distinctive from the tea aroma—elegant and yet also homely.

103901085.content: My head is resting on Poseidon's lap.

103901088.content: I'm about to get up when a hand reaches out to cover my eyes.

103901089.content: Everything goes dark as the sensation of soft pressure against my skin and the aromas of the room grow more distinct.

103901090.content: Imagine that you are looking at a vast, great ocean.

103901091.content: You're lying on a white beach. The sand feels fine and soft. A cool, refreshing breeze passes over your face, and you smell the pleasant, salty sea air.

103901092.content: Poseidon's voice is warm and soft in a kind of rhythmic way as if reflecting the beating of waves upon a beach. It might be your imagination, but it seems as if you can hear the occasional seagull cry in the far distance.

103901093.content: I don't know how, but somehow my body starts to recognize perhaps I am on a warm afternoon beach being bathed in the gentle rays of the sun. I slip into a deep slumber.

103901095.content: It's already dark outside when I open my eyes again.

103901096.content: Poseidon looks down at me, smiling.

103901099.content: I can scarcely believe I actually fell asleep in Poseidon's office. The long hours of the last few days must be getting to me.

103901101.content: Poseidon's face is replaced in my vision with a small dolphin ornament.

103901102.content: Come to think of it, Leviathan and Hodur both left with something in their hands. Is this some kind of memento?

103901105.content: For the tireless work you put in, and allowing yourself to have a good relax.

103901106.content: If you ever feel tired again, please feel free to come back here anytime.

103901107.content: I may not be able to lighten your workload, but at least I can provide you with a place you can relax.

103901108.content:
It's a small, soft and rather heartfelt dolphin ornament you can hold in the palm of your hands.
It seems imbued with the same uplifting nature of Poseidon's smile.

103901109.content: You leave Poseidon's room, happy enough that the pleasurable envelopment of the imagined sun and sea has remained.

103901110.content: You're getting a sense of why everyone loves visiting Poseidon's office so much.

103901111.content: But... it looks like you'll have to put up your plans to visit the aquarium on hold for now.

103902001.content: The occasional visit to Poseidon's office eventually morphs into habit with the passage of time.

103902002.content: The room with its wave-like aura and pleasant aroma of fresh tea seems to exert some kind of enchanting hold over you as if able to immediately improve your mood.

103902003.content: Any whispered words from Poseidon now seem to have the power to cure you of fatigue and worries.

103902004.content: I start to understand why it is everyone likes coming here so much.

103902007.content: I bump into Shu as she's leaving Poseidon's office.

103902008.content: She looks rather tired, but quite relaxed—as does everyone who leaves Poseidon's office.

103902010.content: She nods but with some slight embarrassment. We bid farewell to one another and she disappears down another section of the hallway.

103902011.content: Poseidon is really rather popular, isn't she...?

103902012.content: Poseidon has slowly morphed into the psychological pillar holding up the entire Aether Gazer organization, from whom everyone seeks consolation.

103902013.content: It seems anyone who encounters a problem, even the ever-capable Shu, seems to reveal a different side in Poseidon's domain.

103902014.content: Nor does Poseidon seem to mind the imposition as she sends each healed soul away afterward with a soft word.

103902015.content: Poseidon has become a supporting force back in the office, just as important as she is in battle, but of very different significance.

103902016.content: Poseidon's door opens with a "clink" as I find myself musing on these topics.

103902018.content: She opens the door with a smile.

103902019.content: How long were you going to stand here?

103902020.content: I return to the familiar chair in front of which is a warm cup of freshly-boiled tea.

103902021.content: Yet I find myself unable to enjoy the room and its relaxing aura as my thoughts drift to new, unpleasant topics.

103902022.content: I won't know what it is if you don't say it.

103902024.content: I somehow didn't expect these words out of Poseidon's mouth.

103902025.content: Poseidon may typically play the role of patient listener, but she does have her more active moments.

103902026.content:
How did you know...
Don't tell me you can read minds too?

103902028.content: Wait, I was just kidding... You don't mean... really?

103902030.content: Since I can read the mood of the sea, it shouldn't be so surprising that I can read someone's thoughts from time to time.

103902031.content:
Poseidon waves away the question with a joke and I let out a sigh of relief.
The knot of anxiety sitting in my stomach all day suddenly dissipates.

103902032.content: Impressive. No wonder even Shu seeks your advice on all kinds of tough problems.

103902034.content: Poseidon's expression becomes a little awkward.

103902036.content: Shu does come here from time to time, but she no longer reveals all of her deep-seated anxieties like she used to.

103902038.content: I can feel from Poseidon's tone that something's not so right.

103902039.content: Shu and I were great friends as students. We joined Aether Gazer together. I've always lent an attentive ear whenever she's come to me with problems or complaints.

103902040.content: Almost every time, I'm able to guess what's troubling her.

103902041.content: But... years of being in charge has changed things slightly. There is less communication.

103902042.content: Those businesses Shu's dealing with are such a burden, but she doesn't wish me to worry. So she just talks about some easy topics when she visits me these days.

103902043.content: Of course, I'm very happy to just have some tea with her, chat a little, and laugh at things. But there are things we don't communicate about and I think she doesn't want to talk about them.

103902044.content: I understand. Shu has chosen to place Aether Gazer first and her own needs second.

103902045.content: Poseidon lowers her teacup as she seems to stare directly into its swirling liquid.

103902046.content: I think... there is a vast ocean within every person's heart.

103902047.content: I am able to read its color and mood, but even I cannot pry open its secrets.

103902048.content: Any attempt to try would do neither of us good.

103902049.content: It seems Poseidon's respectful boundary-keeping is very much part and parcel of her gentle nature...

103902050.content: Poseidon raises her head rather abruptly and looks straight at me.

103902051.content: So, Admin, can you look after Shu for me, please?

103902053.content: Actually, I was the one put forward as the second-in-charge of Aether Gazer, but I didn't have the confidence to take care of everyone.

103902054.content: I'd rather support from the back, but that means I can't see what Shu sees.

103902055.content: But you're in a very different position, Admin.

103902056.content: Poseidon is a bit surprised at the quickness of my reply.

103902057.content: It's seldom of you to ask for help, and I believe you won't ask for something too troublesome.

103902059.content: Poseidon looks a little wordless at this moment.

103902060.content: You really should listen to what someone is asking before you agree, Admin. But anyway, it would be a tremendous help.

103902061.content: If it's you, you may have the chance to get to know the side of Shu that I cannot reach.

103902062.content: And if you feel that she's too tired, please take care of her for me.

103902064.content: My reply brings a smile back to Poseidon face.

103902065.content: That's Poseidon: she always feels anxious about others' stresses or gets lighthearted for others' joys. But...

103902068.content: Are you too tired yourself, Poseidon?

103902069.content: That is a question too easily ignored by yet another visitor to the room and recipient of Poseidon's healing powers.

103902070.content: No doubt Poseidon must have her own difficulties while listening patiently to others' complaints and emotional stress. Surely she herself also deserves a brief respite on somebody else's knee?

103902071.content: I'm very thankful for all you've done for us, Poseidon, but I'd hate to only take from your kindness without returning something...

103902073.content: Is that too forward of me?

103902074.content: Well, I'm a little surprised... but I'm very happy that you would think to ask that, Admin.

103902075.content: The thing is, I'm actually doing very well.

103902076.content: I may be occasionally stressed about how to solve others' problems, but mostly I just share in everyone's joy whenever they visit.

103902078.content: But... you must have moments of struggle? If there's anything I can do to help...

103902079.content: Didn't you just agree to look after Shu for me?

103902080.content: What about yourself? Surely there's something I can do for you?

103902081.content: If you put it like that, Admin... Whatever it is?

103902086.content: A mountain of paper suddenly appears on the desk in front of me.

103902087.content: "Protect The Ocean": These three words occupied my sight.

103902089.content: Right! These are for the Ocean Conservation Society's Open Day coming next week! Unfortunately, I made a little mistake and printed way too many copies. I can't distribute them all myself. I'm just worrying about that.

103902090.content: Poseidon's crystalline eyes gaze at me.

103902093.content: The excitement in her eyes dims slightly.

103902094.content: What I meant is: I'd love to! So I only need to hand them out? Or is there anything else I can do as well?

103902096.content: I don't really have anything else for you, but since you're going to help promote ocean conservation, you‘ll need to learn some basics about it!

103902097.content: So, without further ado, here's a crash course for my Administrator!

103902098.content: When I finally exit Poseidon's office, it's already dinnertime.

103902099.content: It feels like I've forgotten something. But Poseidon, who had just had a big talk about ocean knowledge, looked very content. So just keep it for now.

103902100.content: Alright then. I'll be going now. See you next time.

103902102.content: I turn around, expecting what Poseidon has to say. But surprisingly, I saw a very different smile on her face, which I had never seen on her before.

103902103.content: When I declined the offer for the command job all those years ago, it's not only because my character is not suitable. There is another reason.

103902104.content: That is, if I did become second-in-charge, I might not get the chance to visit the sea again.

103902105.content: So don't worry about me. Deep inside, I'm actually quite wilful.

103902106.content: Poseidon gives me a wink and then closes the door.

103902107.content: I stand there for a few moments before I comprehend her meaning.

103902108.content: And I break out in a smile.

103902109.content: Surely, there's no need to worry about her.

103902110.content: I still didn't get a chance to invite Poseidon to the aquarium today after all, but did get to see a very new, unexpected side of her.

103902111.content: Huh? An invite to the aquarium?

103903001.content: Today's the Ocean Conservation Society's Open Day, and I have an agreement with Poseidon to distribute flyers together on the streets today.

103903002.content: Please take a look at this.

103903003.content: Hello, do you have any interest in ocean conservation?

103903004.content: Not many people actually responded. Most people just took the leaflets and left, then threw them in the trash without even looking at them.

103903005.content: Poseidon is still determined. Several hours of this pass without a break.

103903006.content: We've already done a lot today...

103903007.content: Yet the mountains of leaflets behind us do not seem to diminish much.

103903008.content: I had cherished hopes visiting the aquarium with Poseidon after we handed out all the leaflets, which is why I brought the tickets with me. But it's not looking likely at this stage...

103903009.content:
Poseidon, do you think we ought to take a break?
It's lunch-time. Why don't we get lunch and come back?

103903010.content:
Lunch-time already?
You've done heaps, Admin. My treat.

103903012.content: We make our way to a nearby restaurant as each of us vies for the honor of paying for the other's meal.

103903013.content: We are greeted by an unexpected presence.

103903015.content: Only an idiot would stop when told to!

103903018.content: It's a scene of absolute chaos.

103903019.content: At the center of it were what appeared to be two very familiar looking children.

103903020.content: Leviathan? Zenkibo? Stop it right now! Don't cause a scene in the middle of a restaurant!

103903021.content: Poseidon quickly makes her way over to part the pair on seeing the chaos.

103903022.content: The restaurant quickly returns to a semblance of normality after the altercation.

103903023.content: The four of us plus Fenrir sit in a corner of the restaurant as far away from the other diners as possible under the manager's accusing stare.

103903024.content: Don't cry, Leviathan! And you, Zenkibo, stop making faces. Can anyone tell me what just happened?

103903026.content: Hum, I'm not telling you anything.

103903027.content: My blood pressure rises several-fold at the sight of Leviathan with tears and an extremely recalcitrant Zenkibo.

103903028.content: Alright, alright. Let's just have a pleasant meal with friends.

103903029.content: Poseidon comforts the pair and then takes them aside separately to try and figure out what happened.

103903030.content: It turns out the argument broke out around a question of beverages.

103903031.content: Everyone knows a cake goes best with a cup of passion fruit milk tea.

103903032.content: What are you on about? The best fit should be a cup of refreshing fruit juice! Leviathan, you have a kid's diet and taste in drinks.

103903033.content: You're the weird one here, Zenkibo!

103903034.content: The pair glare at each other with such intensity the air bristles with static electricity.

103903036.content: Poseidon draws their attention with a quiet clap of the hands.

103903037.content: You each have your own favourite drink. Why don't we test it out?

103903038.content: My treat. Leviathan, you try some fruit juice. Zenkibo, you try some milk tea. And then we can see how each other does.

103903039.content: Leviathan and Zenkibo give each other another stare.

103903042.content: Poseidon gives me a look as I get up from the table and return with the cake and drinks.

103903044.content: The hostility between Leviathan and Zenkibo seems to evaporate along with the cake they excitedly devour.

103903045.content: Now that the cakes' been eaten, would you like a drink?

103903046.content: The pair reach for the glasses I've just placed in front without further thought.

103903049.content: Fruit juice... can be pretty nice.

103903050.content: Although not quite as good as fruit juice, milk tea is not that bad.

103903051.content: Poseidon and I smile at each other with the awkward atmosphere.

103903052.content: Be careful on your way home.

103903053.content: We send the two kids off and then Poseidon and I return to the task of distributing our leaflets.

103903054.content: We have barely begun the next phase of our leaflet distribution when I'm distracted by the sound of someone running very fast behind me.

103903056.content: Leviathan has returned with many tears in her eyes.

103903058.content: Leviathan received a special crystal brooch as a reward from a teacher in school.

103903059.content: Leviathan typically carries this brooch around and yet somehow it's now gone missing!

103903061.content: Tears start to well up in Leviathan's eyes.

103903062.content: Wait, hold on! Don't, don't start crying!

103903064.content: What should I do about this, Poseidon!

103903065.content: I search for Poseidon's backup only to return a short while later to find her kneeling down next to Leviathan as she wipes away her tears.

103903067.content: Poseidon looks up at Leviathan as she speaks in soft, gentle tones.

103903068.content: What do you think's more important right now? Cry? Or find your brooch?

103903070.content: So why don't we start looking for it now? Do you remember where you've been?

103903071.content: Leviathan has a bit of a think before rather confidently nodding her head.

103903073.content: We follow Leviathan's directions to make a search of the area between the restaurant and the place she ran into Zenkibo.

103903074.content: However, the brooch is nowhere to be found.

103903075.content: (Sobs) What can I do? I haven't even shown it to Master Vidar...

103903076.content: Master said I should study hard... so I... I did try so hard in school!

103903077.content: I was the only one who made so much progress on the test... and...

103903078.content: Leviathan presents a picture of utter distress. It is clear now how much the brooch must have meant to her.

103903079.content: Come, Leviathan. Can you give me some more details about the brooch? What does it look like?

103903080.content: Ah... It's blue! There's a gorgeous gemstone on it! It's very beautiful!

103903081.content: Leviathan gesticulates the shape of the brooch as she speaks well enough to give us a general idea of what to look out for.

103903082.content: Why do I get the feeling I've seen the brooch somewhere before recently?

103903083.content: I look over to Poseidon. She seems to have an idea of some kind or other.

103903084.content: I see... Come on! Let's have another look.

103903085.content: This time let's take a closer look in the corners.

103903087.content: Sometime later and after rummaging through quite a lot of unpleasant dust and cobwebs we find ourselves without even a single crystal to our name.

103903088.content: Leviathan leads the way, but her footsteps have become disheartened. Occasionally she darts to and fro to check less obvious spots we may have missed as she rubs her eyes with her sleeves.

103903091.content: Something over by a flower vase has startled Poseidon. Leviathan quickly closes in for a look.

103903093.content: Poseidon points to a tuft of grass and smiles at Leviathan.

103903094.content: Push it aside. Have a look.

103903095.content: Poseidon looks over at Leviathan with encouraging eyes, who nods excitedly and moves the tuft away with her hand.

103903096.content: She reveals a crystal glittering brilliantly under the sun's rays.

103903098.content: Leviathan bids farewell to us as she clutches at her precious brooch once presumed lost. She hops away with a spring in her step to show Vidar her reward.

103903099.content: Poseidon and I have no choice but to remain as our "consciousness-raising" task for today remains incomplete.

103903100.content: Alright then. A nice break. Now let's finish handing out these remaining flyers.

103903101.content: Not much of a break I think...

103903102.content: A break? More like some extra work. And...

103903104.content: I call Poseidon to a stop as she prepares to head back to her busy task of leaflet distribution.

103903106.content:
There's no hint of hidden subtext in Poseidon's face.
However, I happen to know exactly what happened.

103903108.content: That brooch you found for Leviathan... It's yours, right?

103903113.content: Poseidon's rather standard habit of dress immediately drew my attention to the rather precious-looking crystal brooch she was wearing when I entered her office that day. I was rather surprised.

103903115.content: Poseidon picked up the brooch before neatly pressing it to an ocean conservation poster on the wall.

103903116.content: See? Just like the color of the ocean.

103903117.content: Back at university, I remember... there was a time when it rained all day. Even the color of the ocean went dark. And one day, I stumbled upon this marvelous trinket on a random visit to a jewelry shop.

103903118.content:
I fell in love with it immediately, that color of the ocean on a clear, sunny day.
It was an impulse purchase that cleaned out my savings.

103903119.content: And as soon as I purchased it, the skies cleared! And the ocean returned to its wonderful azure, too!

103903120.content: Since then I've associated it with good luck.

103903121.content: You really like that brooch, don't you? So why give it away?

103903122.content: We can just do some more searching. Perhaps we missed a spot.

103903124.content: She raises her right hand, which until this moment had been firmly closed, revealing an object sitting on her palm.

103903125.content: A beautiful brooch... or the fragments of it at least.

103903126.content: School prizes won't be that expensive. The crystal gem Leviathan mentioned was actually a piece of cheap plastic.

103903127.content: When I found it in a corner of the restaurant, it was already broken.

103903128.content: I think... it was crushed by accident when they were fighting.

103903129.content: That's why you wanted us to split up—so you could plant your own brooch where Leviathan would find it?

103903130.content: Yes, and I would have gotten away with it too, was it not for a crafty Administrator.

103903131.content: She cast an eye over to my reaction.

103903134.content: That might be above my jurisdiction.

103903135.content: If that's Poseidon's solution, How can I be the wet blanket here?

103903136.content: Certainly not after all you've done for me.

103903138.content: Poseidon's eyes open wide. She casts a flustered glance the direction Leviathan departed and then looks back at me. She seems as if about to say something, then stops herself.

103903139.content: Just kidding. I'll keep it between us.

103903140.content: Poseidon's eyes light up again with positivity.

103903142.content: But I really hope you won't go to the length of sacrificing such a precious item next time.

103903143.content: What are you saying? It's no sacrifice at all.

103903144.content: Poseidon wiggles her index finger in negation.

103903145.content: For me, the most precious thing is the smile on everyone's face.

103904001.content: Do you have time to hang out today, Poseidon?

103904003.content: My poor attempts have come unstuck so often Poseidon and I have become used to some daily variation on this sentence.

103904004.content: Something will always goes wrong regardless of who tries to organize the outing. It's hard to say this point whether we'll get a chance to use the aquarium tickets before they expire.

103904005.content: Right. That's too bad. Next time... Wait. What was that?

103904007.content: Have my responses been getting a little predictable? Don't forget, I've wanted to go to the aquarium for a long time!

103904008.content:
Poseidon takes her handbag and stands up.
This is the first I notice she's already ready for a daytrip.

103904010.content: Alright then. Let's go! Here are the tickets... Oh! Wait. Let... Let me just check my schedule...

103904011.content: Her refusals have become so frequent I haven't bothered checking whether my schedule is in fact clear. My memory turns to mush suddenly.

103904014.content: We don't really need a schedule to have fun in the aquarium together, do we?

103904016.content: I'm not sure what to make of Poseidon's comment but I don't care to ask for follow-up.

103904017.content: What's the emphasis here? The aquarium? or... together?

103904018.content: Oh wow, this place is fantastic!

103904019.content: Penguins, seals, whales, and dolphins! Which one should we start with?

103904020.content: Poseidon takes on the manner of an excited little girl at setting foot in her beloved aquarium.

103904021.content: Her eyes widen with excitement wherever she looks.

103904022.content: It looks like the answer to my question would be "the aquarium"

103904026.content: When somebody knocks the glass around the turtle enclosure rather aggressively.

103904027.content: Hey! I paid good money to see you. Wakey wakey! Move it!

103904029.content:
He gives enclosure another whack.
The turtles remain motionless.

103904030.content: Fists insufficient, he angles his legs for a powerful kick.

103904032.content: Sea creatures have excellent hearing. That noise will be very disturbing to them!

103904035.content: I'm not... but you shouldn't do that.

103904037.content: He spits near Poseidon's feet deliberately and then, without another word, put his hands in his pockets and walks out of the area nonchalantly as if nothing Poseidon said matters.

103904042.content: I see the anger in Poseidon's face.

103904043.content: "I" am the only one who's fine.

103904044.content: We end up following the hooligan.

103904045.content: Poseidon's "teaching moment" with the young ruffian seems to have the reverse effect. He now not only starts hitting the glass enclosures as loudly as possible, but also starts dropping plastic wrapping from various snacks into the turtle enclosure!

103904046.content: Poseidon is getting angrier and angrier.

103904047.content: I know you're angry, Poseidon, but we're at an aquarium after all...

103904049.content: Relax. Since it's an aquarium, "aquarium justice" it is.

103904050.content: It's at this moment, when I'm starting to get anxious Poseidon exploding with rage, that she turns to me with a smile and, as I stare back at her, notice the temperature in the aquarium is dropping rapidly.

103904052.content: She then walks into the nearby souvenir shop with the same fixed smile on her face.

103904053.content: It is also at this moment the possibly deeply unhappy hooligan is looking for a new target.

103904054.content: Damnit. "Have fun at the aquarium"? Yeah right. What's with all the glass? At least you can touch the animals at the zoo.

103904055.content: I'm gonna complain and get my money back.

103904057.content: A chill wind blows in from somewhere. The hooligan notices he's next to the penguin zone.

103904058.content: The penguin zone is not totally sealed off by a glass enclosure unlike some of the others. There's a little platform where you can interact with and feed the penguins near the edge of the zone.

103904059.content: A decent jumper could easily leapfrog the railing when the staff aren't looking and get up close and personal with the penguins.

103904061.content: He leaps in past the edge and then, with a smile, reaches out for the nearest penguin -

103904062.content: A large shadow object suddenly lands on his head out of nowhere.

103904063.content:
The penguins notice something's weird and scatter.
Soon there is only the man and... an even bigger penguin?

103904065.content: A large wave seems to come up from the edge of the zone and behind the giant penguin!

103904067.content: The man's hardwired survival instincts kick in. His brain is telling him to get away from the wave, and yet his feet are finding it rather hard on the slippery, snowy terrain.

103904068.content: The man finally, and with the most comical of motions, manages to haul himself over the side of the penguin zone to make his escape.

103904069.content: H...elp! Help! The penguin… the penguin's going to eat me!

103904070.content: He was only greeted by the innocent gaze of a group of seals.

103904072.content: He's fallen into the seal zone.

103904073.content: The shadowy figure soon presses in on him once more.

103904077.content: He leaps into the water and, desperate to put some distance between himself and the shadowy figure, has no choice but to swim forward as fast as his arms and legs can carry him!

103904083.content: The man's bizarre circumstances have come upon him so suddenly he must be having trouble figuring out whether this is real or part of some strange, twisted nightmare.

103904084.content: The world in front of him seems to go black as he approaches the open mouth of a giant shark—

103904086.content: I take off the soft turtle costume and heave a sigh of relief.

103904087.content: I didn't expect that. I think you gave him a pretty severe fright.

103904088.content: That's what happens to people who don't respect the mighty ocean.

103904089.content: It was, as you said, "aquarium justice".

103904090.content: Poseidon and I smile at each other.

103904091.content: Poseidon had bought two large sea plushies from the souvenir shop and hollowed them out to fit a person inside. Then Poseidon and I had taken turns playing the role of a vicious monstrosity to teach that hooligan a lesson.

103904092.content: And so is the truth of all this.

103904093.content: I even added a spot of supernatural power in there somewhere... which, as long as nobody else noticed, will not need to be filed with HQ.

103904094.content: I don't think he'll ever try anything like that again after such a fright.

103904096.content: I must say that shark at the end was very realistic. You could have fooled me.

103904098.content: The shark? I thought that was Admin... ?

103904100.content:
Poseidon and I look at each other for a moment and then, quietly, turn to the nearby zone.
It is indeed the shark zone.

103904104.content: We immediately notify the aquarium staff to get him out of there. He runs out of the aquarium as fast as he can go without another word the instant his feet touch solid ground.

103904105.content: He's not coming into any aquarium ever again, is he?

103904106.content: That was lot of fun, but it's getting late. The stream of visitors has been down to only a few tourists here and there taking the occasional photo.

103904107.content: The aquarium will be closing in less than two hours.

103904108.content: And although we chased that hooligan through all the zones, the fact is we haven't really had a good chance to look at much of the sea life.

103904109.content: Such magnificent aquarium. It seems like one trip just isn't enough. What do you think about a next time?

103904111.content: Poseidon unexpectedly pulls my hand back into the azure corridor surrounded by glass enclosures.

103904113.content: I'm so happy to be able to have fun in the aquarium together with you!

103904114.content: Even the ground reflects the azure blue of the sky at this moment.

103904115.content: The light seems to dance around Poseidon in a somewhat strange, almost unreal sense that leaves me wondering for a moment whether I've stumbled into an alternative reality where she is a sea princess from an oceanic kingdom.

103904116.content: Let's come back when we get the chance.

103904117.content: There's not a lot of responses I could possibly give to that.

103904119.content: The two remaining hours pass quickly as we are forced out and onto the road home all too soon.

103904120.content: I would have missed a lot without your helpful explanations, which were a lot better than the aquarium's.

103904121.content: I learned these things out of interest, that's all. But you got one thing wrong, Admin.

103904125.content: My face goes bright red at the thoughts of my recent and rather ham-fisted performance decked out in turtle apparel. Poseidon keeps laughing to herself as if having told a hilarious joke.

103904126.content: And thus our great aquarium adventure comes to a fitting close.

103904127.content: We're not sure when, but soon hopefully we'll going to get a chance to visit again.

60001002.content: I've been keeping a close eye on your progress during this time and, as your mentor, I'm very pleased with how much you've grown with Aether Gazer.

60001003.content: And that is exactly why I've decided you're ready for another major mission.

60001004.content: So, rookie, you should know we're always about getting rid of Visbanes and stabilizing the world. That means modifying world scenarios with too high a Deviation Rate—

60001005.content: And whenever we stop one of these terrible futures, the causal relationships and possibilities that disappear coalesce into a material—Shifted Stars.

60001006.content: A Shifted Star has lots of precious data. We can upgrade Mimir System by analyzing Shifted Stars with it.

60001007.content: As you can guess, this is easier said than done. Getting it means entering the future modelled by Shifted Stars while syncing well with Mimir.

60001008.content: Remember, these are worlds where the bad guys won. That means danger on every side more often than not. You're the only person we've found able to maintain a stable connection with Mimir for any great length of time.

60001009.content: Also limitations on our computing power mean there'll be some differences between the modelled future and our system's record of what actually happened. Doesn't make the data any less valuable. Trust us, collecting it'll be a huge help in upgrading our computational capacities.

60001011.content: Only Mimir can really go with you during the observation process, but for your safety, we will be co-infiltrating a small Modifier squad in the form of intra-system data. In other words, you'll be able to call for help if you run into trouble.

60001012.content: Well then, rookie, if you're ready, can I suggest we head to our first observation point now?

60001014.content: Idealbild Deviation Rate: 1.425612. Observation coordinates: Neuhansa Sephirah Zone—Spealght Factory. Glug, glug, glug... Commencing synchronization!

60101001.content:
Observation target: World Plane X0128_Neuhansa Sephirah Zone_Spealght Factory
Current location: Spealght AGI Mecha Assembly Floor
Idealbild Deviation Rate: 1.4132
Visbane corruption: Severe

60101002.content:
A sealed-off AGI Mecha factory has gone rogue and begun attacking people indiscriminately.
The Directorate has sent an investigative team, including Modifiers, to look into the issue, but contact has since been lost. The reason behind the mecha's rogue status could not be determined prior to the World Plane's reset by the Gaea System.

60101003.content: The team had Modifiers and they still lost contact? Must be very serious...

60101004.content: They may have left some clues for us. Hey, rookie, curiosity is a good thing, but remember this mission is primarily about data collection, alright?

60102001.content: Ummm, I'm reading a discomforting aura from this rift.

60102002.content: Hey, careful now. Enemies could ambush us from this rift at a moment's notice.

60102003.content: On the other hand, fixing this Turbulence Rift might provide additional data. You may as well try, rookie.

60103001.content: Uh huh, just as I thought: fixing the Turbulence Rift has formed a Topology Box out of the unstable data stream. Open it!

60103002.content: You'll find two more types of these crates scattered around holding different data. Rookie, make sure don't miss any.

60104001.content: To everyone's surprise, here is a holographic console glimmering with fluorescent light in the midst of the strange rift.

60105002.content:
Interesting. I think it's safe to say this world has already been reset then?
...I'm Merfil, a Modifier. It's a surprise to see our memories accessed in this manner.

60106001.content: Hey! What's with this flagrant violation of my right of publicity?

60106002.content: Ummm. So it's just a Modifier data backup point?

60106003.content:
Administrator, if you trigger a trap that messes up your Modifier data, just read one of these backups to restore it.
Heh. Don't be so surprised. There's nothing a Mimir projection can't do!

60107001.content: Pass through the desolate Industrial Park to the target location: the Spealght Factory.

60107002.content: The hellish sight of burned-up AGI Mechas and overturned goods atop pools of oil has replaced the orderly Spealght production zone once teeming with AGI Mechas about their busy tasks.

60107004.content: Let's go check the Spatial Observation Report from Aether Gazer first, it will bring you up to speed.

60108001.content: Ummm Ummm, you've got your hands on enough data to open the next Observation Point. Nicely done, rookie.

60108002.content: Don't forget you can always revisit any place of interest. A copy of this world will be stored in Aether Gazer's computational systems.

60109001.content: Ummm, you've got your hands on a perfect set of data! You won't be able to make it without the Great Lord Mimir!

60201001.content:
Team Grove Captain, Merfil.
Let's begin our investigation.

60204001.content: Hey, I tagged along with Merfil. Gosh, that kid's capable! Should just leave everything to her. She'll get it done.

60204002.content:
I'm just having a look around, as usual, noting a few things down.
Huh? Lazy? Me? Not at all. You gotta really take your time to notice things those busy kids won't pick up.

60204003.content: For example: Have you noticed that interesting mechanism over by your 9 o'clock?

60206001.content:
The picture's getting a bit clearer now, but it's still rather confusing.
Proceed very carefully.

60207001.content: Hey, this is a lot larger than the last Observation Point, but same deal, Administrator. Find all of the Topology Boxes and get the data we need.

60207002.content: As before, I suggest reading up on Aether Gazer's Spatial Observation Report before you start.

60208001.content: Wow. The way's open to the next Observation Point already.

60208002.content: But why hurry? Some data from this area hasn't been collected yet.

60209001.content: Hmm, perfect! You got it all—in no small part thanks to myself! Heh.

60210001.content: Interesting. So it was their memory we saw in that crate last time.

60210003.content: That's right. Their physical bodies may have been destroyed, yet memory data was retained in some form.

60210004.content: These memories can be saved within Topology Boxes, relatively stable receptacles in their local environment. Opening a crate gives us a decent chance of viewing one.

60210005.content: Don't worry. They're not ghosts, Administrator!

60301001.content:
Oh! Is this one of those legendary spatial rifts I keep hearing about?
I may be a well-travelled Modifier, but still it's my first time seeing one in the flesh.

60302001.content: He just turned it off temporarily for a rest... There must be a way of fixing it.

60303001.content: Team Grove always expects the unexpected.

60305001.content: They're gone. Time for a looksee. I am a well-travelled Modifier, after all...

60306001.content: The Team Leader is responsible for the safety of all team members.

60307001.content: Oh no. This is the only memory slice where I'd rather not...

60309001.content: You've completed your objective rather handily. You must be very thankful to me, Administrator.

60401001.content: In any case, what happened here was truly extraordinary.

60402001.content: Burned metal and silicone chips: Smells like a conspiracy in the brewing.

60404001.content: Be nice to help Merfil out... can I?

60501001.content: Why do we keep running into each other? Heh. I'm the eternal traveler.

60501002.content: Since the universe seems determined to put us together, let me tell you something important. See this key? I think it opens the innermost door.

60501003.content: But I don't think it'll be enough all by itself. Good luck, adventurer!

60502001.content: Oh. Looks like we have a way forward.

60503001.content: ...You guys. Unfortunately, I have hurt myself by fallen into a trap and need to recover. Please be careful on the next leg of your journey ahead.

60503002.content: By the way, there seems to be a key at the bottom of that pond. It might help your search.

60503003.content: Eh? Let me have a look...

60504001.content: Tricky opponents! But I think there may be a special reward in it for us...

60505002.content: But... you can have it seeing how "sis" is so enamored with you two.

60506001.content: Ah, there you are again! What luck. Seems we were all drawn here by the Key of Gaea.

60506002.content: Really? Don't you think it looks extraordinary beyond all measure?

60507001.content: Administrator, this should be the innermost area of the factory, and where we'll probably find the most data. And please don't lose your wariness!

60508001.content: Hey! Don't give up here, Administrator. You've got data you haven't collected yet.

60509001.content: Congratulations on making it all the way here, adventurer. Looks like this world won't have to go through the destructive process of a restart thanks to your efforts.

60509002.content: Is it finally time for goodbyes? Even if foretold of afore, parting is such sweet sorrow...

103801001.content: I see a familiar and most unexpected presence in the Aether Gazer lobby on my way to process some documents.

103801002.content: A lady sits by the window in a formal black and red dress holding a gold inlaid cup from which she elegantly sips aromatic black tea by the window. She hasn't changed a bit.

103801003.content: It's Hera from the Society of Muses. Her unexpected return to Aether Gazer must herald some important business.

103801004.content: Hera notices me and waves with all the bearing of a monarch commanding one of her servants.

103801005.content: An unexpected pleasure to see you here at Aether Gazer, Hera.

103801006.content: ...And I would not have frequented your offices were it not important.

103801007.content: Hera's tone is rather stiffly regal as usual. However, you can clearly see she's in a good mood.

103801008.content: As if happy to acquiesce to my sense of curiosity, Hera lifts what looks to be a rather impressive letter adorned in a golden rose seal.

103801009.content: Heh. Nice to see even a rather venal place like Ain Soph can hold a decent fashion event every now and then. I was inspired to see for myself what the hustlers and bustlers of this city can produce.

103801011.content: Hera passes me the letter. It's already been opened, and contains an invitation in the same golden style.

103801013.content: The opening day of the 17th Ain Soph Fashion Week will be held on the 24th in Seaside Park (Core City District 3) under the auspices of the Ain Fashion magazine.

103801014.content: We hereby cordially invite you, Miss Hera, to adjudicate on our judging panel on account of the great talents with which you are recognized in the fields of art and fashion.

103801015.content:
The "Ain Fashion" Magazine
Ain Soph Fashion Week Organizing Committee

103801016.content: Thus the reason for Hera's arrival to Ain Soph is revealed.

103801017.content: Congratulations, Hera. I'd take it as a mark of great respect to be invited to the judging panel.

103801018.content: Heh. Nothing out of the ordinary for me.

103801019.content: Really... I can just scarcely imagine it. As a layperson.

103801020.content: Au contraire, Administrator. You are coming with me this time.

103801022.content: A decent celebrity like me should have an attendant. But Hades hasn't sent Mintha or Leuce to help me this time…

103801023.content: You mean you want me to follow you around like your personal valet?

103801024.content: Don't act so surprised! Not everyone gets such a chance as you do. And you are privileged with this honor solely because you are the Administrator of Aether Gazer...

103801025.content: I'm afraid I may have to decline. I have a lot of work to get through.

103801027.content: Hera, who has always maintained her bearing as a sort of virtue, makes no attempt to conceal her annoyed shock at my answer. she is undoubtedly a stranger to the experience of being turned down.

103801028.content: She quickly regains her composure and quietly places her teacup on the table as she stands up.

103801029.content: (Cough)... Administrator, I fear that you may not be prioritizing matters in the order to which they should be prioritized.

103801030.content: Let me put it like this: What work could you possibly have to do that could be more important than being in the company of the great Miss Hera? And I can't have people see me fumbling around with three suitcases while judging at Fashion Week, can I?

103801032.content: This exhibit may not be the crème de la crème, but it is certainly a place where many of the best new artists can showcase their work.

103801033.content: ...And where I've made it my habit to add the works of those up-and-coming or at least decent provocateurs to my collection.

103801034.content: I see. Sounds like a smart strategy.

103801035.content: (And one that takes a lot of initial capital...)

103801036.content: So why me for your attendant?

103801037.content: I'm sure there are plenty of others, like Ver and Apollo, who'd be just as, if not more, helpful.

103801038.content: You really have no idea? Administrator?

103801041.content: Hera sighs loudly. She picks up her cane and waves it at me as if trying to talk sense into some underachiever—

103801042.content: Now listen here. Can't you see it's for your benefit? It's your chance to get some more knowledge into you and improve your sense of aesthetics.

103801043.content: At the end of the day, the Society of Muses has a close and intimate partnership with Aether Gazer, and as a representative of Aether Gazer yourself, I ask how you can continue to dress in such tired outfits?

103801044.content: I actually feel quite comfortable in ordinary work apparel.

103801045.content: But I suppose it is a once in a blue moon opportunity to attend a fashion show like this with Hera, and might be a good opportunity to learn a thing or two from her.

103801046.content: I understand... But if you have been meaning to invite me, why not ask directly?

103801047.content: Hmph. It wouldn't be seemly for a lady of my stature to just go around inviting people here and there, would it?

103801048.content: Hera's ideas about proper behavior seem rather strangely fixed in her mind.

103801049.content: Good thing I came by, or no one might have noticed her request until after the show, thanks to a lengthy period of communications maintenance due to start today...

103801050.content: I accept Hera's invitation and soon find myself carrying three large suitcases in Hera's footsteps toward the fashion show.

103801051.content: The sea winds seem quite a bit stronger than usual this evening night at the Seaside Park, but certainly far from strong enough to dissuade the festive crowd.

103801052.content: Crowds of people excitedly mill around the main event holding distinctive cups resembling a wave of foam from a distance.

103801053.content: Each new model on the stage kicks off a wave of excitement from the audience.

103801055.content: The theme is "Party Animal of the Future".

103801056.content: The models strut to and fro wearing owl-shaped pink and purple sunglasses in exaggerated tuxedos trailed by something. You're unsure if it's meant to be a lizard tail or some other animal's behind.

103801057.content: Other models walk at a brisk pace holding goblets filled with strange liquid while covered head to toe in rhinestone outfit shining so brightly you feel the need to avert your gaze.

103801058.content: The next set of fashion is from the famous designer from Neuhansa— Olivia!

103801059.content: Her outfits represent the industrializing spirit of Neuhansa while perfectly approaching the theme of this year's Fashion Week.

103801060.content: I can see mecha-themed elbow pads, bracelets, and knee pads crafted out of some kind of alloy. The sheer reflectiveness of the assorted pieces is almost as blink-inducing as those weird rhinestone outfits.

103801062.content: Yet the skirts and "chest plates" is made up of AGI Mechas' outer shell. The LED circuits remain, so these pieces are still giving out the neon glow.

103801063.content: (I feel like I'm on a party on a spaceship...)

103801064.content: The crowd is having a good time. Even I get swept up in the idea that I'm a privileged witness to a true fashion spectacle. Unfortunately, the sentiment is not universal judging from the face of the lady beside me, Hera, one of the event's adjudicators.

103801067.content: So Hera says as the crowd works itself up into a peak of excitement at the fashion spectacle.

103801068.content: Hera's merciless comment spreads across the entire park via the microphone in front of her. A dash of cold water has been heaped upon what had up until now been a rather sizzling competition.

103801070.content: I'm just as surprised at Hera's comment as the crowd. I can only see the side of her face from here, but what I can see looks rather cold and stony at this moment.

103801071.content: Silence quickly descends upon the crowd and soon enough only the rhythmic beating of the fashion show's "easy listening" background music can be heard.

103801072.content: Wow. That is a pretty harsh sentiment. Your gaze surely is piercing! Ladies and gentlemen! Looks like our foremost art critic of Omorfies doesn't like what she sees very much! Artists, now it’s the moment of truth and tension.

103801073.content: The emcee attempts to smooth over everyone's discomfort in a professional manner.

103801074.content: However, Hera is ignoring his effort as she continues broadcasting her own comments through the microphone—

103801075.content: That these cheap bells and whistles can be called "fashion" just shows how far we've fallen.

103801076.content: The other judges look at each other, aghast. Even I start to sweat a little.

103801077.content: Hera, don't you think that's a bit... much?

103801078.content: Nothing I say seems to get through to Hera's ears.

103801079.content: This is not to say that she did not hear me. Rather—

103801080.content: Hey, you can't just say things like that! Who the heck does she think she is?!

103801081.content: If you don't like it, go somewhere else!

103801082.content: So tell us then! If this is "bells and whistles", what's real fashion?

103801083.content: The crowd's surprise quickly turns into frustration and anger. Perhaps now my voice really can't reach her ears with all these loud protests.

103801084.content: All I can do is look in Hera's direction and hope and she doesn't do anything to tip the crowd's anger over into something else.

103801086.content: Hera's gets up to leave the judge's podium. She glumly surveys the disaffected, even accusatory, shouts of the crowd as if observing the petulant complaints of children.

103801087.content: I'll show you the true meaning of "beauty" with a real fashion show!

103801088.content: Hera thus resolutely bids farewell to the judging panel with these final words.

103802001.content: I thought that's that after Hera's "performance" yesterday. No more fashion show involvement for me. However...

103802002.content: So you really meant it when you said about putting on a "real fashion show"?

103802003.content: Of course. I can hardly go around just saying things without actually doing them, can I?

103802005.content: The budget's tight this month. I don't see any way we can hire the decent staff we'd need to make it real. Plus, we don't have any experience.

103802006.content: Hire people? Surely you are jesting, Administrator. If we're going to show these people what true fashion and beauty is, then of course we'll do it ourselves.

103802007.content: Fret not about your lack of experience. Do you not have the world's foremost expert on art and fashion here with you right now?

103802009.content: We must be productive, Administrator. We must begin now if we're going to show these people the true meaning of beauty!

103802010.content: At no point in Hera's grand plan was it mentioned that although she may be the originator of all these ideas, I would be implementing them.

103802011.content: I found myself ordering deserts over the phone (of course, for Hera's handpicked menu)—

103802012.content: Hello, I'd like to place an order for black forest cake, mango pudding, and apple cider for about 5,000 people.

103802013.content: That's right, on one day. In terms of dates...

103802014.content: I went to pre-order fabric and specific cuts from the tailor—

103802015.content: I'm sorry I need about 30 meters of Moreland fabrics...

103802016.content: Also, do you think you could tailor it for me into specific lengths as well?

103802017.content: And of course I had to organize the scenery, layout, stage, and lighting for the grand event -

103802018.content: This is the minimum size, and I'm afraid our budget isn't very big... Also, could you give us any discounts on the equipment?

103802019.content: Somehow I was in charge of everything...

103802020.content: And there was also the very important matter of recruiting models.

103802021.content: Admin, here're the names and resumes of the models who responded to your listing. I've printed them out.

103802022.content: Thank you, Miss Shu. I'm so glad you are helping us on all this.

103802023.content: Shu helped us publish the modeling ad online and do some in-person promotions. She seems to be exhibiting an unusual degree of leniency versus Hera's stubborn ways. Is it to protect our valuable cooperation with the Society of Muses, I wonder?

103802024.content: A number of residents were happy enough to register online given Aether Gazer's and Shu's fine reputation.

103802025.content: Admin, I think we've got more than enough candidates on hand. Would you like to organize interviews?

103802027.content: I watch on as Hera mercilessly - even from what I'd expected of her - shaves down the pile of our candidates to just six models.

103802028.content: That might be a little few for a fashion show, I think...

103802029.content: I sigh. Hera seems genuinely disturbed as she furrows her eyebrows.

103802030.content: Hera, you shouldn't be so harsh on everyone...

103802031.content: No, the show has to be perfect. Any minor flaw, even the possibility of a flaw, must be absolutely excluded.

103802034.content: Hera's eyes light up as she suddenly wags a finger directly at me. I'm shocked. I almost thought she was referring to me as a potential model.

103802035.content: (There's no way I'd qualify from what I've seen of Hera's strict interview standards...)

103802036.content: We'll choose the remaining models from the Aether Gazer Modifiers!

103802037.content: That's a relief. But soon I realize that this raises another problem.

103802038.content: Huh? Hold on. Our Modifiers are all on missions shifts!

103802039.content: I leave it to you to find volunteers from your Modifiers, Administrator. But don't take too long. We haven't got much time as it is.

103802041.content: I publish the news of Hera's upcoming competition and our need for Modifier models anyway to see what happens.

103802042.content: I'm sorry. I have a lot of work to get through. Getting you the budget is the best I can do.

103802043.content: Right... You've done a lot already, Shu. Thank you.

103802044.content: I'm very happy that you thought of me, Administrator. But as it is... I'm about to embark on a remote polar expedition.

103802046.content: My goodness. Me? In drag? Not that I'm saying I couldn't pull it off well...

103802047.content: I'm not saying that you need to dress up as a woman! We need you for men's wear modeling!

103802048.content: We found ourselves with fewer than ten Modifiers potentially interested and without any other urgent tasks on hand. They now have to pass Hera's strict interview process.

103802049.content: The most important factor, more important than any others, is your understanding of the concept of "beauty". Now tell me: What does "beauty" mean to you?

103802051.content: Right! From my point of view, uh... it's that sound of meat cooking on a grill or in an oven and it sizzles and turns a lovely brown! Or, uh, the look of absolute satisfaction on guests' faces eating a perfectly cooked steak!

103802052.content: Heh. A very confused answer yet also... somehow filled with your unique understanding. Satisfactory.

103802053.content: Beauty for me would be the deep blue of the ocean, the translucence of waves, and the softness of a beach—anything to do with the ocean really is beautiful to me.

103802054.content: You have the confidence to stick with your own vision of "beauty", and I commend that.

103802055.content: Me? Ladies first I should think... Has everyone else had a chance?

103802056.content: Alright then. Beauty in my eyes is like the brilliance of the sun. Of course, when it comes to earthly things, it must be the charms of a fair maiden.

103802057.content: Heh. Fair enough. I heartily agree with your latter sentiments. But I hope you're not just telling me what I want to hear...

103802058.content: Only Verthandi, Poseidon, and Apollo pass Hera's strict interviews from among Aether Gazer's internal personnel.

103802059.content: Heh. I'll do my very best for our Administrator.

103802060.content: ...I don't know how well I'll do exactly, but I'll try my best.

103802061.content: I'll light up the night with brilliance when I step out onto that stage!

103802063.content: OK then. You're my favorites. Now are you ready to overturn the world's humdrum, pedestrian sense of beauty with me?

103802064.content: The lights in Aether Gazer's break room - temporarily requisitioned by Hera into a training studio - remain on into the wee hours of the morning.

103802065.content: (They've been practicing until really late for days now... It's been hard work.)

103802066.content: I open the door to the break room as I consider reminding Hera to get some rest.

103802067.content: So concentrated are its occupants on their great mission they fail to even notice my entrance—

103802068.content: That's not right! Not like that! You have to imagine that you're a Persian cat prowling past the windowsills of a castle quietly, without a sound, without a trace...

103802070.content: Don't be nervous, Ver. You can only walk with true elegance when relaxed.

103802073.content: I leave the breakroom to make a couple of cups of coffee for them.

103802074.content: I return to find Ver has almost finished practicing her catwalk technique.

103802075.content: It's tough, Hera... Ah, Admin, good evening!

103802077.content: Hera's taken such trouble to mentor me, I just don't want to let her down!

103802078.content: I'm also looking forward to your performance.

103802079.content: Thank you, Admin! Then I'd better get back for some much-needed rest!

103802081.content: You watch on as she leaves.

103802082.content: True. She doesn’t have more modelling talent than any average girl, but it's in her persistence where she truly shines.

103802083.content: Hera smiles with satisfaction. I'm reminded of when I first saw her.

103802084.content: I've always thought of Hera as particularly consumed with self-promotion, especially of her semi-regal status. However, at this moment, she seems more like a teacher reveling in the progress of her students.

103802085.content: You seem confused, Administrator. Is there something on my face?

103802087.content: Anyway, you should get some rest too, Hera. I'm sure you don't have to stay up so late every night.

103802088.content: Huh? How can I rest when I've so many designs to iron out? And I wonder whether you underestimate the Modifiers' stamina?

103802090.content: Anyway, perhaps you'd better go back and rest. I've made you very busy over the last few days, and I would not want your frail human physique to fail on me.
