103802091.content: Are you concerned for my wellbeing, Hera?

103802093.content: Hera's expression seems to freeze mid-sentence as if caught out by the unexpected nature of what her comment implied.

103802094.content: Uh... what I mean to say is, I won't have an assistant, will I, if you collapse from tiredness?

103802095.content: Hera looks down to take a few mouthfuls of coffee before raising her eyes again to mine.

103802096.content: Coffee... Emmm... Tasty. Anyway, carry on.

103802097.content: Hera walks briskly out of the "training room", leaving the interpretation of what seemed almost like a compliment up to me.

103803001.content: Hera soon advertises the fact that her own fashion show will also be held in Seaside Park of Core City District 3 as if to deliberately challenge Fashion Week's organizers.

103803002.content: The makeshift T-shaped platform seems to rock with a somewhat unsteady rhythm in the face of the brisk sea winds.

103803003.content: I hope nothing goes wrong with the stage—I silently pray to myself as I gaze down from the stage at Hera running through her final pre-event checks.

103803004.content: Check audio again. I don't want any static or to have anything go wrong with my audio in my perfect performance.

103803005.content: Hera strolls back and forth atop the stage like a proud queen who will brook no dissent from her subjects.

103803006.content: The strong moonlight casts a pallid glow across Hera's face like white candle wax. Something about the image strikes my fancy and I find myself staring at her long enough to see her turn around and meet my gaze...

103803007.content: I simply stand there as she looks at me, bewitched.

103803008.content: My reverie is broken by the feeling of intense heat from my blushing cheeks as if by some ungodly spotlight upon me.

103803009.content: Watch, Administrator, and witness! The "Kingdom of Dreams" starts now!

103803010.content: One hand astride her waist, Hera looks down at me from her regal balcony with some satisfaction.

103803011.content: So the "Kingdom of Dreams" themed fashion show begins amid the bustling crowds of Seaside Park.

103803012.content: Even the weather seems supportive today as the stage is helpfully illuminated by the stars and moonlight of a cloudless sky, and which renders much of the additional lighting equipment somewhat unnecessary.

103803013.content: The "Kingdom of Dreams" is a fantastical haven and interstitial realm between the moment of sleep and the moment of dreams.

103803014.content: —Hera's interpretation resounds outward from the stage.

103803015.content: The residents of the "Kingdom of Dreams" are the dream-weaving elves.

103803016.content: These elves feast upon the memories of human beings, which appear to them as sublime delicacies whether happy or sad, or seemingly bereft of any significance.

103803017.content: Every sleeper encounters their own elf when the memories of a whole day can no longer be held within their weary mind. They spill forth and are redeemed for dreamlands of their preference.

103803018.content: Others lose their way amid the opaque clouds of the between-world, never encountering an elf until waking.

103803019.content: So what sweet haven will you exchange with your memories? Or would you rather pass a peaceful dreamless night?

103803020.content: The background music starts to rise as a spotlight shines down onto the stage. The first model eagerly anticipated by the crowd appears.

103803021.content: The first dreamland is a steam locomotive that travels across this great and vast Milky Way.

103803022.content: Poseidon walks across the stage wearing a brilliant, star-studded dress decked out in a Milky Way theme.

103803023.content: The weaver of this dreamland is also an elven ticket inspector for the Galaxy Railways, and from whom access may be purchased on which to travel our local star cluster.

103803024.content: Poseidon waves at the crowd with a warm smile. Clearly, a sleeping passenger on her train could expect to be woken by her friendly face.

103803025.content: Or perhaps, having missed their stop, might be entertained by a bowl of hot Udon noodles and an exciting game of poker.

103803026.content: Such thoughts inexplicably slide into my head for some reason.

103803027.content: Of course, the Kingdom of Dreams is also inhabited by the conniving and the crafty.

103803028.content: Apollo now appears on the stage decked out in a tuxedo with a monocle that just screams "untrustworthy businessman".

103803029.content: Interactions with the human world have taught the naturally crafty elves some of our own dissemblance and trickery.

103803030.content: Apollo gives the audience a bow in a gentlemanly manner, yet something in his smile conveys a disquieting darkness.

103803031.content: He's a really good actor, isn't he...

103803032.content: He will ask for your most valuable memories, for dreams as sweet as pink fairy floss...

103803033.content: You will find yourself aboard a great hot air balloon, with your desired companion, in the dreams that he will weave for you, looking down upon the beautiful cities in the Kingdom of Dreams.

103803034.content: In reality, it will only be of the poorest quality, easily discombobulated by a tree branch. You'll fall down into some deserted mountainous valley from which you will eventually awake.

103803035.content: Apollo waves his hands on the stage and makes an expression as if to say "Hah, you got me". The audience laughs as the show continues to move along at a comfortable, relaxed pace as expected.

103803036.content: Other models selected from among local residents also impress the audience.

103803037.content: One of the "elves" in a cat mask and leopard-skin waist-high skirt weaves a dream for a lovesick wildcat.

103803038.content: Here in this dream you will carry the best fish you can get, along endless alleyways, in search of your one true cat...

103803040.content: I observe the girl I remember from her interview as rather consistently embarrassed give a stately performance to everyone's applause.

103803041.content: What a transformation in such a short time! But I'm not sure whether it's due more to Hera's secret training sauce or the girl's natural talents.

103803042.content: The crowd's mood steadily warms until finally we come to tonight's main event.

103803043.content: Backstage. The designers and the makeup artists are very busy.

103803044.content: Huh? In the hospital? I understand...

103803045.content: Verthandi had just finished changing into her "Grand Finale" outfit for tonight's catwalk when she received a most unexpected phone call.

103803046.content: Verthandi, who just moments ago had been brimming with enthusiasm and excitedly exclaiming "Administrator, I'm going onto the stage!" is clearly rather concerned by the contents of the phone call.

103803048.content: Ver reveals her restaurant coworker and also fellow university schoolmate just had a rather unfortunate slip in the kitchen, leading to a broken arm and possible signs of concussion.

103803049.content: The staff have already taken her to the hospital, but just left her there because the restaurant has hardly enough people as it is. I feel so bad for her. She's not from Ain Soph, and she doesn't have any family to help...

103803050.content: Go and help her, Ver. I take it you're fairly concerned for her, right? Just go.

103803051.content: I give Ver my frank and fearless advice as a matter of principle, fashion show can wait.

103803052.content: But you and Hera took so much effort to get this up and running... and Hera spent literally days helping me to practice my walk...

103803053.content: And look at this outfit! Hera sacrificed so many sleepless nights to design it for me just the way she wanted...

103803054.content: Clearly Ver is second-guessing herself and her responsibilities.

103803055.content: The entire purpose of this fashion show is to tell this world what "beauty" really means.

103803056.content: And just like that Hera's voice pops up behind us.

103803057.content: Hera looks at us, arms folded rather imperiously.

103803058.content: Any beautiful material would become unbeautiful on that stage if worn with a heavy heart, not to mention a guilty conscience by one whose responsibilities lay with her mate. The thought of sending you out in such circumstances? Ridiculous!

103803060.content: Go on then. Run like Melos racing to save his friend before sundown. There is so much beauty in that.

103803062.content: Ver may not completely understand Hera's words, but is moved to tears all the same.

103803063.content: Yet I can't let all my painstaking work designing your dress go to waste. So be it. I'll wear it myself.

103803064.content: Hera sizes up her decision to model Ver's Grand Finale dress with chin in hands. She sighs.

103803065.content: Wait... wait. I can take it off myself... It's so tight around there. Don't damage your dress!

103803066.content: Relax. As its designer, I ought to know a thing or two about it.

103804001.content: To me, the sight of Ver's rushing figure as she departs to see her coworker after taking off the fashion outfit sheds a bit more light on Hera's distinctive concept of "beauty".

103804003.content: I don't have much time to ruminate on Hera's philosophy as the roar of the crowd washes over me. A quick head check and I find Hera has somehow already put on Ver's outfit and begun her catwalk without my noticing.

103804004.content: If there was ever a time to hold my breath in or at the beauty of a fashion show, this is it.

103804005.content: The glossy fabric ripples under the gentle starlight as the expertly tailored dress dances in the cool sea breeze.

103804006.content: (I don't recall buying any special, glossy materials...)

103804007.content: Nor does the beauty of the outfit conceal in any way the beauty of its wearer—

103804008.content: Hera surpasses the good looks of the average person on an ordinary day, let alone this moment where she strides towards the center of the stage in such an extraordinary outfit. Words cannot describe such beauty.

103804010.content: She seems utterly ethereal, an entity transcending the grime and grubby mortal realm. She seems—

103804011.content: Indeed! She seems to belong to that majestic elven realm—"the Kingdom of Dreams."

103804012.content: Hera's pre-recorded narration blares out through the speakers just after these errant thoughts popped into my head.

103804014.content: The final dreamland you will witness tonight comes via a celestial, who joined the happy humans in their celebrations, and got lost in the sweet pleasures of merriment.

103804015.content: The dreamers to encounter this weaver are lucky indeed.

103804016.content: Hera does a decent job of strutting the catwalk in time to the audio although her expression is a tad stiff.

103804017.content: (I suppose even Hera must find it awkward to hear the sound of her own voice played back at her...)

103804018.content: You, mortals, can experience something about the life of the celestial here... What? You consider it mundane for Your Magnificence? Hah. Then your understanding of these creatures and this world falls terribly short.

103804019.content: Hera puffs up her chest and glares down imperiously at the audience below in time to the audio. She plays the part well. Perhaps a little too well as I'm reminded of a kids' cartoon character.

103804020.content: Most of the audience, including myself, simply stare back at Hera with laughter. And Hero does not appear the least bit phased by the attention. Rather, she keeps up her faux arrogant attitude.

103804021.content: But the celestials do envy humanity—even the celestials! Particularly your arts of entertainment. And our envy can be painful for you to behold.

103804022.content: It is a truth hardly admitted, but the celestials do take great enjoyment in the partaking of human celebrations under mortal guise.

103804023.content: Beautiful garments, dazzling sweets, and glittering fireworks in the night sky—

103804024.content: Such creativity and imagination are the few shining points that have been impressing the celestials, since the beginning of mankind. As for other talents, none of the mortals can get the height of the celestials.

103804025.content: Thus, having made her way to the front of the T-shaped stage, Hera then points down at the audience as I realize she is speaking directly, not through the recording—

103804026.content: So admire my beauty! Admire and adore!

103804028.content: Lady Hera, could you please sign this autograph?

103804029.content: Miss Hera, could you take a photo with me?

103804030.content: Alright, alright. Get in line and don't be pushy. I take no delight in those without manners.

103804031.content: I'm still coming to terms with the way the show ended. That was rather surprising.

103804032.content: I had worried for a moment Hera's extemporaneous speech at the end might not have, like last time, gone over well with the crowd.

103804033.content: I was holding my breath in suspense, just to find the rapturous applause bursted out from the crowd.

103804034.content: I’m your simp, Hera! I'll do anything you want!

103804036.content: (I should worry about the crowd being over-enthused, not offended.)

103804037.content: Phew. Well, that was tiring. Even my wrists are sore.

103804038.content: All signing and photo taking activities now concluded, Hera rests in her chair as she eyes me with a "do you remember you are my valet" expression.

103804039.content: Administrator, supposing you were my personal valet, do you know what a personal valet would do at a moment like this?

103804040.content: I don't recall ever seeing the term "personal valet" in my job description for this event?

103804041.content: So saying, I pour Hera a cup of her favorite black tea anyhow.

103804043.content: I appreciate Hera before sharing my own impressions of the night's proceedings—

103804044.content: Although in some respects you might come across to others as a little arrogant, the truth is you actually do care deeply for others.

103804045.content: And I guess this is also what prompted the fashion show—out of a desire to help awaken people's own inner sense of aesthetic beauty. Right?

103804047.content: Hera seems genuinely startled by my words. Perhaps I'm being too forward, but she quickly returns to her customary equanimity after a few soft coughs.

103804048.content: (Cough). Both human beings and Modifiers are pretty much in the same boat when it comes to the pursuit of Beauty and the purity of the soul—it's fundamentally an act of instinct.

103804049.content: Since the time that an earthquake or flood could destroy an entire civilization, things like etiquette, art, and philosophy were already created. These things exceed the daily life of survival. That's the evidence of my words.

103804050.content: These "sparks" are always preserved past the end of each civilization... and re-invented by the next.

103804051.content: Isn't that fascinating? Adorable? Even celestials would wonder, what kind of fruit would humanity offer, with these desperate and foolish strivings...

103804052.content: ...I must say I disagree with the "desperate and foolish" part.

103804053.content: Hera's words reflect a certain coldness, and yet there is a strange hint of compassion there too.

103804054.content: It seems odd to me the greatest of humanity's charms would decline in a time of unprecedented material prosperity.

103804055.content: People today seem so caught up in following others' voices they seem to have lost their own powers of judgement, particularly with regard to beauty. And all that matters is some influential voice pushing in a direction they do not truly understand.

103804056.content: I'm sorry, but I simply cannot tolerate such pedestrian aesthetics in our world.

103804057.content: Hera's voice carries a touch of wistfulness, which vanishes just as soon as it appears as she raises her eyes with a smile.

103804058.content: Yet fortunately it seems there are the teachables among us, are there not?

103804059.content: Such as our own lady Ver willing to drop everything to help her friend.

103804060.content: And our wonderful audience this evening. If only there were more such inspiring folk, I would be more than pleased to provide generous lessons like tonight.

103804061.content: The least humanity could do in return is to devote itself to the never-ending pursuit of beauty and art. All just for I, Hera the Honored.

103804063.content: Hera becomes less easy to listen to the more arrogant her choice of expression...

106601005.content: The ventilation grill is easily removed by the BunBun Mecha following Ookuninushi's instructions.

106601006.content: BunBun made it look as light as a feather... Impressive.

106601007.content: Don't be so surprised, Administrator. BunBun-3's the strongest in my collection.

106601008.content: Ookuninushi can downplay BunBun-3's feats of strength, but her satisfied smile tells another story.

106601009.content: The vent is quite small though. I don't think BunBun Mecha can make it.

106601010.content: Huh? You mean I can't take BunBun-3 with me?

106601011.content: The prospect of losing her companion instantly wipes the smile off Ookuninushi's face.

106601014.content: You can just... you know, being polite... Well, thank you for the encouragement...

106601016.content: Forget it. Looks like I'm all on my own this mission.

106601017.content: And me as well, don't forget...

106601018.content: The AGI Mecha Legion incident sent shockwaves through the community and Spealght. The Industrial Park was immediately closed under CORG's orders. The area is now closely guarded by CORG patrols. Civilian access is strictly prohibited.

106601019.content: Unfortunately, our sneaky visit could not simply be filed with CORG management...

106601020.content: They've rejected my research budget again... I don't get it. Was my plan for a Brain-Machine Automatic Juice-Feeder not detailed enough?

106601021.content: No, I don't think that's the problem...

106601022.content: Well, then why did they also reject my other proposal of a Portable Standing Bed?

106601023.content: I'm thinking about rejecting it the moment I hear the name...

106601024.content: Gosh. If I can't get any research money for these fake proposals, how am I going to get my real plans off the ground?

106601025.content: (I'm flabbergasted that behind Ookuninushi's harebrained schemes must lie even more harebrained schemes.)

106601026.content: It's not going to work. We're simply not going to be able to fill the order, what with the Spealght lockdown and skyrocketing Tranzist Ore and chip prices these last few weeks.

106601027.content: I place the rejected order on Ookuninushi's table while conveying the sad news.

106601028.content: I'm disappointed about it too, but that's HQ's decision, and that's that.

106601029.content: If only there was a place we could get our hands on all those chips for free...

106601030.content: I don't think a place like that would be around for long before...? Oh.

106601031.content: I hesitated but for a moment, but it was a moment Ookuninushi pounced on with glee.

106601032.content: Did you just get an idea, Administrator?

106601034.content: Beep! Lie detected! A lie has been detected!

106601037.content: So, Administrator, you do know a place where we could get all these chips for free?

106601038.content: Such a place may be described as existing, however...

106601040.content: Ookuninushi's piercing eyes laser in on me like two perfect red gems before I have a chance to finish.

106601042.content: I—I see... I don't think getting our hands on the chips should present too many problems.

106601044.content: Given that chips and Tranzist Ore prices only skyrocketed thanks to Spealght's lockdown, I suppose it'd be possible to simply help ourselves to the factory's current storages.

106601045.content: Huh? You mean... Administrator, are you proposing a Spealght factory heist?

106601046.content: I'd prefer not to use the word "heist".

106601047.content: Shu mentioned we never got delivery of a bunch of AGI Mechas we'd prepaid for before they closed it down.

106601048.content: Anyway, I'm not serious. At the end of the day, CORG has locked down the factory, and I doubt Shu would approve of us just helping ourselves to these chips.

106601049.content: I see. Then I won't go.

106601052.content: In the end, Ookuninushi not only decided to go a few hours after our conversation, but also dragged me along no matter what I said.

106601053.content: It's not like I couldn't handle the whole thing on my own.

106601054.content: The thing is, I drew a very unfavorable tarot reading today. It informed me that a solo trip would be beset by terribly bad luck.

106601055.content: ...What does that have to do with dragging me along specifically?

106601056.content: I also took your reading, Administrator.

106601059.content: Not exactly a fantastic omen, but significant all the same.

106601060.content: Pairing the reversed Moon with my terrible reading could reverse it and hopefully get me out of danger.

106601061.content: What about the one who got the reversed Moon?

106601063.content: Why are you giving an apologetic face?

106601064.content: I have another "special" reason for bringing you along, Administrator.

106601065.content: You knew I was going to visit Spealght, and I, uh, couldn't have you turning around and telling Shu.

106601066.content: What gives you the impression I would do that?

106601067.content: You and Shu are in league with each other.

106601069.content: You both think I'm wasting my time on useless research in the Cryptics, and I'm constantly inventing useless and impractical stuff.

106601071.content: I want to deny it, but there's no way a reasonable person would not think so after observing Ookuninushi's past inspirations.

106601072.content: Research grants would be more freely available if we could just get some idea of the practicalities of your research.

106601074.content: Well, uh, something useful with regard to Visbanes? Or the Source Layer? Something we could use in battle?

106601075.content: Practical for Aether Gazer, yes, but why does value have to be determined by Modifiers and human beings?

106601076.content: And what does "value" mean in this context anyway?

106601077.content: The invention of any new and true thing, even if just in my mind, must surely be recognized. As it would be by the "God of Truth".

106601078.content: Such inventions and conceptions are an act of destiny. Who am I to negate their existence?

106601080.content: No doubt you're having a hard time understanding the significance of what I'm telling you, Administrator?

106601081.content: No, I... No. I think I'm getting the picture.

106601082.content: You and I are on the same mission: to ensure the world of Gaea can continue and stop any Deviation Rate increase in the Idealbild Deviation Rate... even if we don't always see eye to eye on what "fate" has in store.

106601083.content: And maybe as you said, Ookuninushi, our ideas about "value" and "correctness" are more in our heads than objective reality. At the end of the day, we are all of us limited in our thinking.

106601084.content: That's why I'm so interested in my truth-finding and explorations of destiny! I'm approaching my "God of Truth", as I call it.

106601085.content: So I guess we can "agree to agree"?

106601088.content: And thus our search for chips neared its end amidst these happy conversational topics.

106601089.content: I was worried before that we might be running into some Banified AGI Mechas. Good thing we didn't.

106601090.content: We're just about run out of room for more chips. Ookuninushi, I think it's about time we...

106601094.content: And, in the blink of an eye, Ookuninushi has disappeared.

106601097.content: I find Ookuninushi kneeling down and lovingly patting the head of an AGI Mecha.

106601098.content: This particular mecha looks very different from Spealght's usual industrial style with a pink-white body and two elongated sets of mechanical bunny ears atop its head... more reminiscent of a pocket edition BonBon Mecha.

106601099.content: You called it "BunBun-0." Did you design this mecha?

106601100.content: I did, but I've got no idea how it ended up here.

106601101.content: A group of unknown robbers stole my BunBun-0 designs en route to the factory. I thought that was the end of it.

106601102.content: Unknown robbers? Probably the Children of Iron, I take it?

106601103.content: Images of Ethan and that group of faux security guards come to mind.

106601106.content: BunBun-0 murmurs gently in response to Ookuninushi's strangely loving touch before leaping lovingly into her arms.

106601107.content: So tickly, haha. BunBun-0, are you saying you missed me?

106601109.content: Isn't this the first time you've met?

106601110.content: All the BunBuns carry unique impression parameters of their creator, or at least that's how I designed them. Whoever built this cutie didn't bother to edit that.

106601111.content: Ookuninushi, face turning red, plays a bit more with her beloved BunBun-0. It's the first time you've seen Ookuninushi behave more like a young girl than her typically stern self.

106601112.content: Shu once told you Ookuninushi is only interested in two things: new theories and her own inventions. She hit the nail on the head.

106601113.content: Alright then. Looks like we had better..

106601114.content: I was just about to remind Ookuninushi we need to get out of here when a powerful beam of hand-held torchlight hits my eyes.

106601116.content: This area is strictly off limits! How the heck did you get in here?

106601121.content: I quickly put Ookuninushi's weapon down from the CORG personnel just as they land handcuffs precisely on our wrists.

106601123.content: All I can think about now, with CORG guns pointing at my head and angry darts of rage coming from the eyes of the silver-haired girl next to me, is how I know I'm going to explain all this to Shu.

106602001.content: Sign here and you can go.

106602003.content: And please confirm that all your possessions we impounded earlier are here.

106602006.content: BunBun-0's sudden appearance ameliorates some of the anger from Ookuninushi's face, but she is still clearly very, very annoyed.

106602007.content: I'm sorry, I had no idea you had your gun set to stun...

106602008.content: I'm not sure how much the silver-haired girl cares for my explanation as she emits a quiet "huh..." and turns around to walk off in another direction.

106602009.content: That reminds me. Were Ookuninushi and I interrogated by the same group of people? Why did I get out a lot earlier than her after HQ was notified?

106602010.content: I also wondered why Ookuninushi was escorted out of the complex by a golden-haired man grinning from ear to ear whereas I had to put up with a stern talking-to by a stately gentleman. Was it just up to our interrogators?

106602011.content: They also asked me about a few... personal matters.

106602014.content: Ookuninushi gives me another cold glance before walking out of the park without a glance back. I seem to have annoyed her quite badly...

106602015.content: Any yet something draws the young lady back into the park before long.

106602016.content: Ookuninushi marches straight up to me but for some reason seems to be avoiding eye contact. She bites her lip in the manner of a bashful girl.

106602018.content: I... don't know the way back.

106602021.content: I go a whole week at Aether Gazer without a single word with Ookuninushi. I'm not sure whether it's because she's still angry at me or too excited at the prospect of debugging and reprogramming BunBun-0.

106602022.content: Yet I probably shouldn't be so quick to assume annoyance on Ookuninushi's part. A homebody like her who rarely ventures outside our offices, could never maintain a grudge against her "rather distant" coworkers for very long. We must surely be on good terms again by now.

106602023.content: I hear a sudden knock on my door while amusing myself with such thoughts.

106602024.content: I see the individual has chosen not to use the bell... and note the rather forceful strength of the knock on the door...

106602025.content: The strong noise hurries me to open the door where I find Ookuninushi standing before me with BunBun-0 in her arms.

106602027.content: BunBun-0 is currently brandishing an oversized boxing glove fitted onto its left arm and, I see, is apparently the marvelous little trinket responsible for that terrifying knock.

106602030.content: Ookuninushi responded to my question without looking at me. She doesn't appear to be in the mood for much talking.

106602031.content: Would you like my help with securing funding?

106602033.content: Then... another visit to the Spealght Industries?

106602034.content: Considering my previous punishment of having to write a four plus page report exonerating myself, I shudder to imagine the consequences of another botched heist.

106602036.content: Ookuninushi's hands seem to clasp more tightly onto BunBun-0.

106602037.content: Administrator, would you like to patrol the city with me today?

106602039.content: Aether Gazer had been organizing weekly patrols in order to guard against Visbane and Quake events.

106602040.content: Such patrols are usually undertaken by Special Task Force members rather than rank-and-file Aether Gazers, let alone someone like Ookuninushi who rarely ventures out of the lab.

106602041.content: Ookuninushi, why the sudden desire to go on a city patrol?

106602042.content: ...Because I'd like to take BunBun-0 for a walk outside the lab.

106602043.content: You'd like to take your mecha for a walk?

106602044.content: I spent this week adjusting BunBun-0's learning module so it can now think and observe independently. It's on its way to developing a unique sense of intelligence.

106602046.content: So it's essential for BunBun-0 to get as many opportunities to see the world and gather as much information as possible.

106602047.content: Wouldn't it be easier just to upload something?

106602048.content: Any data I upload would have all the hallmarks of an external source. It wouldn't be BunBun-0. I don't want to just make BunBun-0 a copy of some other AI.

106602050.content: Do you think that I'm being... a bit weird, Administrator?

106602052.content: But I don't suppose it's too much to ask to just patrol the city with her.

106602053.content: All of Ookuninushi's creations are inestimably special in her sight. I can understand why she'd want to take BunBun-0 out if it means helping it to evolve.

106602054.content: I understand. I'll accompany you on a "patrol" around the city then.

106602055.content: But I haven't taken too many loops either... Wouldn't it make more sense to ask someone more experienced, like Shu?

106602056.content: The thing is... I did a tarot reading for today's patrol.

106602057.content: Ookuninushi pulled two tarot cards from somewhere.

106602058.content: I drew the Tower, the card on the left. The Tower always represents difficulty, whether upright or reversed. Basically, something bad will happen wherever I go...

106602059.content: Surely a random card shouldn't dissuade you from your plans...

106602060.content: ...and this is the card you drew, courtesy of me, Administrator. The Wheel of Fortune in the upright position, which symbolizes the beginning of a run of good luck and all difficulties improving.

106602062.content: You don't believe in my tarot-reading abilities, Administrator?

106602063.content: What about the last time we went to Spealght? We didn't get any chips and Shu had to come in and rescue us from CORG.

106602064.content: I'd hardly count that as a misreading. Yes, the result wasn't so good, but who knows what else could've happened if you didn't come?

106602065.content: What I mean is, there's a whole lot of ways it could have gone worse going into Spealght by myself.

106602066.content: (I suppose Ookuninushi is making sense. There's no telling what awful fight she could have gotten into if discovered by CORG on her own, and I doubt she'd have the humility to ask Shu for a rescue package.)

106602067.content: (Come to think of it... all this is making me rather concerned for Ookuninushi's safety even on a routine city patrol.)

106602068.content: Alright then. Let's go on patrol today.

106602069.content: My "routine" Patrol with Ookuninushi plus BunBun-0 starts off almost immediately on very different footing than what I'd imagined. Whether that means failure is still up in the air...

106602070.content: You see that girl? She looks like a character straight from a comic book!

106602071.content: Hey, you're embarrassing her! Still, I get what you mean...

106602073.content: Ookuninushi has always been something of a hermit. The other pedestrians' comments and stares are only making her introverted tendencies worse.

106602074.content: Why are they staring... I knew humans were simpletons, but I didn't realize they—lack even basic manners...

106602075.content: I think it's because they like you.

106602076.content: Like me? Why? What have I done?

106602077.content: People don't need any particular reason to like someone. Generally speaking, people just go with whatever their emotions dictate.

106602078.content: It's a bit hard to explain... Think of it like the way Ver loves barbecues, and Poseidon dolphins.

106602079.content: I get it. It's like the way I'm driven to constantly come up with new inventions—an unconscious drive. I can understand that.

106602080.content: Eh... I guess so? Not too far off the mark.

106602081.content: Hey, mom! That girl's ears and her pet are so cute!

106602082.content: Oh, I have never seen an AGI Mecha like this before. Let's go to the Mecha mall later and take a look.

106602085.content: I'm not used to my inventions... receiving praise.

106602086.content: Ookuninushi lowers her head as a scarlet blush spreads across her cheeks.

106602087.content: So the way to Ookuninushi's heart seems to be to praise her inventions rather than herself...

106602088.content: The rest of our patrol passes without incident, which is to be expected of our peaceful district. We even managed to get used to people's stares somehow.

106602090.content: The BunBun-0 buried in Ookuninushi's arms emits a happy cooing sound unlikely to be matched even by the latest and greatest AGI Mechas for the versatility of expression.

106602092.content: This patrol... turned out way easier than I expected.

106602093.content: I have no doubt it's the role played by your Wheel of Fortune card. And I do feel a bit safer with you around too.

106602094.content: Is Ookuninushi praising me specifically? Or the card...?

106602095.content: So, will you be joining any more patrols?

106602096.content: No. It's not as burdensome as I expected, but I really don't feel comfortable on the streets.

106602097.content: Of course. Ookuninushi's "homely" tendencies will not change from one day's excursion.

106602098.content: By the way, I think you should also have a turn holding BunBun-0.

106602100.content: BunBun-0 has not left Ookuninushi's arms since the beginning of our trip, but now she stuffs it into my hands.

106602102.content: Great! Looks like BunBun-0 likes you, or at least doesn't mind you, Administrator.

106602104.content: I hesitantly extend a hand to pat BunBun-0's head before BunBun-0 itself moves to affectionately rub the palm of my hand.

106602107.content: Seeing how well the two of you are getting on, I think I'll leave BunBun-0 in your care for the time being.

106602109.content: What do you mean? For the time being? What are you going to do?

106602110.content: Ookuninushi tosses her silver braids behind her head as she disregards my question and, no doubt thinking of some other topic, turns to walk away in the direction of the setting sun.

106603002.content: BunBun-0! Wait! You can't eat pot plants!

106603003.content: What did you do with the clothes in my closet?! Did you put them on the corridor again?

106603004.content: A rubbish bin is not an enemy target!

106603005.content: It's been a week since Ookuninushi handed BunBun-0 into my safekeeping. I quickly realized its sweet demeanor was simply a mask for an inner wellspring of infinite disobedience the following day.

106603006.content: A week of taking care of BunBun-0 has turned my life upside down in more ways than I'd ever thought possible, and likely won't ever experience again.

106603009.content: I immediately spring forth from my office without another thought at the sound of Ver's voice, notwithstanding the BunBun-0 lazily curled in my lap.

106603011.content: Ver hands me a newspaper. A glance at the headline in explosive red typeface shocks me for a while.

106603012.content: "Faye, the daughter of the past child prodigy, returns in partnership with CORG's Temporary Research Institute in Neuhansa!

106603013.content: My eyes keep trending down the page until I notice a group photo of the Institute's researchers. Ookuninushi is there.

106603014.content: What? Ookuninushi joined CORG's research facility?

106603015.content: I keep staring incredulously at the photo until the sight of a golden-haired man in a suit within the photo quickly jogs my memory.

106603016.content: I've seen him before... Oh. He was the one who interviewed Ookuninushi after we got picked up at the Spealght factory!

106603017.content: He seems to be in charge of this whole temporary institute thing they've got going.

106603018.content: So that's why he held Ookuninushi for questioning for so long! He's trying to poach our talent!

106603020.content: She does, but it doesn't seem to bother her very much.

106603021.content: How's that? Ookuninushi can't just leave us to go join CORG...

106603022.content: Unless... Ookuninushi has been so bad for our budget even Shu doesn't mind letting her go?

106603023.content: You recall numerous scenes of Shu looking at Aether Gazer's financials and groaning. The idea gets more convincing...

106603024.content: Ookuninushi's proposals were rejected so much. And I'm sure she wasn't very happy about it.

106603025.content: I guess it eventually led her to leave without saying goodbye...

106603026.content: The fact that Ookuninushi was no longer a part of our organization slowly dawned on me as my feelings morphed shock into a sense of loss.

106603027.content: It pains me to think that even Ookuninushi, who was always holed up in her office and so reluctant to speak to her colleagues anyway, could leave us so abruptly.

106603028.content: I think perhaps our frequent interactions in these last few days had inspired a sense of friendship, at least I think she's an important friend.

106603029.content: If Shu isn't interested in stopping her, I suppose there's no use worrying about it.

106603030.content: We're really going to let her go just like that, Administrator?

106603031.content: Nursing a sense of loss and disappointment, I bid farewell to Ver to return to my office.

106603032.content: "Prodigy joins Sustainable Tranzist Ore project promising to resolve energy needs for 50 years"

106603033.content: Well, that's just great... Now Ookuninushi can deploy her talents on a very worthy project, heavily backed by CORG no less. She'll never have to worry about budgeting again.

106603034.content: She won't need to ever submit monthly expense reports to HQ or force herself to take part in unpleasant missions or city patrols. And she gets to spend all day in the lab alongside like-minded researchers.

106603035.content: I shouldn't feel bad about Ookuninushi leaving. I should be happy she's moved on to somewhere she'll be much happier.

106603036.content: Ookuninushi has taken a brave step forward for the sake of her own future—even if that means no longer being a part of Aether Gazer...

106603038.content: I was just about to convince myself when BunBun-0, curled up by the side of my bed, leaps up to nip at my heels.

106603039.content: The pain immediately rouses me out of my somber state and I go nuts—

106603040.content: Ouch! Cut it out! Damnit! Your behavior is getting worse by the day, BunBun-0! I bet Ookuninushi made this worthless thing just to annoy everyone!

106603041.content: My anger now vented, I began to calm down.

106603042.content: Do you also think this way, Administrator? That only inventions that provide value to human beings deserve to exist?

106603043.content: And what does "value" mean in this context anyway?

106603044.content: Those words Ookuninushi once shared with me floats across my mind.

106603045.content: That's right... Interesting. I'm sure a lot of scientists would consider their lives complete just to take part in a massive project like this. But something makes me doubt it's quite so simple for Ookuninushi.

106603046.content: And another thing... Ookuninushi loves her inventions dearly. How could she just dump BunBun-0 into my lap and move on?

106603047.content: Something's fishy. I can feel it. I'd better confront her and find out!

106603048.content: I open my door again to find Ver standing outside my office with a look of worry on her face.

106603049.content: I was... you cried out like you were in pain, Administrator. I was worried.

106603050.content: I'm fine. But I was wondering if I could get your help with something?

106603052.content: The research team's going to be at the business expo in Central Park in half an hour, and I think Ookuninushi will be there. What I'm thinking is—

106603053.content: I see! Let's go find Ookuninushi!

106603054.content: Ver stole the words right out of my mouth as if she'd been waiting for me to utter that for a while.

106603055.content: We made our way to the grand square in Central Park. The crowds were somehow a lot bigger than what I remembered back in the day.

106603056.content: The square was filled with all manner of people, from reporters eager to catch an interview with the new-generation prodigy to ordinary citizens curious about the latest advancements and of course, investors and corporate reps.

106603057.content: As I understand it, your mother left academia a while back. What did she pursue afterwards?

106603058.content: I don't know... I think she went to work for a real estate company.

106603059.content: Oh. Can I ask why your mother named you after herself?

106603062.content: We make our way with some difficulty through bustling crowds until I can just make out Ookuninushi's microphone-enhanced voice. Indeed, the interview has already ended by the time we make our way to the stage.

106603063.content: Uh... anyway... so I decided to get involved in the project too.

106603064.content: Ookuninushi may be the end of envy of almost every scientist in the world, but clearly isn't loving the limelight one bit. She keeps looking for a way to avoid eye contact until at last departing the stage with this final thought.

106603066.content: But we came all this way to see the "new generation prodigy"!

106603068.content: Our feeble attempt to get Ookuninushi's attention is quickly drowned out by the cacophony of voices in the crowd.

106603069.content: I go to chase Ookuninushi backstage when I feel a sudden hand on my shoulder. I turn back to see a member of event security in a pair of dark sunglasses.

106603070.content: Excuse me, are you a friend of Miss Faye?

106603071.content: Faye...? I catch myself. Of course. That's what the newspaper called Ookuninushi.

106603072.content: This way please. Our director would like to see you.

106603073.content: I bury my misgivings and, seeing as Ookuninushi is no doubt already far away backstage, decide to meet with the mysterious director without checking in with Ver first.

106603074.content: The man in black takes me to a high-end restaurant. I arrive to find only one person seated. They've obviously booked the entire place out.

106603076.content: Truth be told, I already had some idea of who I was going to find waiting for me. Lo and behold, it's the same golden-haired man that questioned Ookuninushi after our misadventured heist on the Spealght factory.

106603077.content: My name is Amos, general director of CORG's Neuhansa Research Institute. I'm delighted to meet with you, Administrator of Aether Gazer.

106603078.content: I was speculating on what it was that drew your personal attendance to our panel. Perhaps Aether Gazer has some interest in our new project?

106603080.content: Hehe. I was just kidding. I know you came to talk to Ookuninushi.

106603081.content: I take it Ookuninushi is genuinely interested in joining your organization?

106603082.content: Absolutely. And, as you know well, no organization, least of all CORG, would ever dare try and force a Modifier to work for us.

106603083.content: Amos is one of the very few, as a member of CORG, privileged enough to know of Ookuninushi's true identity as a Modifier.

106603084.content: I recognized her immediately as Faye, the child prodigy who stunned academic circles in Ain Soph around a decade ago, on the day of your ill-fated escapade.

106603085.content: All Modifiers are exceptional in some way or another, but Faye... mm. A technical genius like Ookuninushi is rarer than one in a million.

106603086.content: I imagine there's much about our new project you do not fully understand. It is an extremely valuable undertaking that has received virtually unanimous support from all political and economic circles—nothing less than a sustainable plan for limitless Tranzist Ore self-generation.

106603088.content: Kind of explains itself, doesn't it? This project holds the promise not just to change the world as we know it, but to lead to new, revolutionary possibilities the significance of which we are only beginning to grasp.

106603089.content: But, I mean, is Ookuninushi... or Faye, is she genuinely interested in your project?

106603090.content: I'm sure that a chance to take part in such a monumental project such as this, to devote one's effort and genius to it, is exactly the kind of opportunity an outstanding scientist like Ookuninushi has always dreamed of.

106603091.content: Although I realize Aether Gazer might not take too kindly to having us “poach" any member of your esteemed staff, I was hoping you and your colleagues might see past this, owing to the substantial and truly important nature of our work.

106603093.content: That said, unfortunately, duty calls and I must bid you farewell to meet with a very important client of ours. I just thought it was important to have this chat. And don't worry about the bill.

106603094.content: Just one more thing... We’d like the people in our team, including Ookuninushi, to have the chance to devote themselves fully to their work. I would hate, at such a critical time as this, for her to experience any unnecessary distractions—

106603095.content: For example, from a bothersome ex-colleague determined to talk to her when she has no interest in the same.

106603096.content: I hope we can all be mature adults about this and that this meeting can mark the beginning of a fresh chapter in Aether Gazer's positive, wholesome relationship with CORG. After all, our respective organizations will not lack for fruitful partnership opportunities going forward, will they?

106603098.content: Amos responds to my response by straightening his immaculate white suit before leaving with a smile.

106603099.content: I understand. Which means I know exactly what to do...

106604001.content: What? Did he really say all that?

106604002.content: My goodness... I should give him a real talking-to. How dare he refer to our Administrator as a bothersome ex-colleague!

106604003.content: Shhh. Don't forget why we're here, Ver.

106604004.content: I take a guarded peak around. Fortunately, there are fewer security guards patrolling the Employee Division of the Research Institute compared to where we first infiltrated.

106604005.content: CORG converted an area of Spealght's massive factory district which has taken minor damage into a makeshift research institute in the months following the disaster. Yet even this area is still massive enough to ensure Ver and I have thoroughly lost our way.

106604006.content: Oh. These rooms are all filled with couches and utensils. What do you think... clerks? I think we'd better look for Ookuninushi elsewhere, Administrator.

106604007.content: No. Let's stay a bit longer...

106604008.content: I hear arguing from one of the offices ahead.

106604009.content: I know that voice. Is that...

106604010.content: Please! I just need a bit more time to secure the necessary investments!

106604011.content: That's exactly what you said last month! We have nothing to show for our money but pliable reporters and paid-off officials! And your project is going nowhere!

106604012.content: You promised us the world. You said the return on investment would be quite frankly "unimaginable", that it's a sure bet!

106604013.content: They seem to be having an argument of some sort. Administrator, this is our chance to get away quietly.

106604015.content: Just as we're about to leave in search of Ookuninushi—

106604016.content: Hold up, Ver. Something's fishy in the air. I just want to eavesdrop a bit.

106604017.content: Sheesh. Do you really not understand? It doesn't matter how our research goes.

106604018.content: W-What are you talking about? It is the research! It's the whole thing!

106604019.content: Are you kidding me? "Infinitely sustainable" Tranzist Ore? Sounds cool... but it doesn't exist! That much should be obvious.

106604020.content: Then why go to all this trouble and expense to hire the most brilliant minds in science? Or get that Faye lady?

106604021.content: Isn't it obvious? To drum up a media storm. To get our name out there and attract investors' eyeballs.

106604022.content: You mean... you actually have no interest in developing a new kind of self-sustaining energy source?

106604023.content: Look, if we can create a miracle, that's great. But I'm perfectly happy with attracting a whole bunch of investment and then getting out when the time is right. That's the most surefire investment in this world you'll ever find.

106604026.content: I motion for Ver to keep calm as we remain in an unobtrusive corner and observe Amos see the wealthy businessman off.

106604027.content: He then readjusts his suit before heading for another corridor.

106604028.content: Goodness me. All these maggots care about is their return on investment. Well, I guess I can use your filthy money for a while if I have to...

106604031.content: CORG's Temporary Research Institute, former Spealght Industries.

106604032.content: Where's Miss Faye! Somebody go and find her! She was just here, wasn't she?!

106604033.content: What a disaster! She's meant to do our proof-of-concept presentation in half an hour!

106604036.content: Don't panic. Keep your cool, everybody! What's our current status?

106604037.content: The demonstration is starting in a moment, but Miss Faye has just disappeared on us without telling anybody where she's gone.

106604038.content: What about the product? Do we still have it?

106604040.content: Well, that's fine then. I can do it. I wasn't comfortable giving it to her anyway. For this to work, we need to be show absolute confidence in our product's potential.

106604041.content: Hey? Who are you? Why haven't I seen you around here before?

106604042.content: They're acting real suspicious. Industrial espionage!

106604044.content: I'll slow them down. Administrator, you go find Ookuninushi!

106604046.content: You gotta tell Ookuninushi what's really going on. Don't let these scoundrels use her!

106604047.content: Alright... Good luck. I guess I gotta leave you here.

106604048.content: Ver nods in my direction. I use her precious distraction to evade the other laboratory personnel in pursuit.

106604049.content: Emergency! Intruder alert! Security guards, report to your stations! Locate the intruders! I repeat: security guards to your stations. Find the intruders!

106604050.content: I hear the sound of footsteps running all around me and mentally note the facility's emergency broadcast has really roused security into action. Unfortunately, that's going to make finding Ookuninushi very difficult.

106604053.content: I'm scurrying around when I dash past a corner right into a security guard's face.

106604056.content: I was just about to run away from the guard when I couldn't help but notice my counterpart's short stature, ill-fitting outfit, and overly long sleeves. I suppose that's why she had the worse of our collision.

106604059.content: The "security guard" in her comically oversized outfit removes her helmet to reveal a silver-haired lady and confirm my suspicions.

106604063.content: I don't have time to reflect on her strange response. More footsteps are coming around the corner.

106604066.content: You're not going to get very far in that ridiculous outfit!

106604067.content: Given our circumstances, I somehow found the strength to pick Ookuninushi up and carry her as I ran.

106604068.content: I carried the rather short Ookuninushi like a scared kitten in my arms as her hands held onto my chest for dear life.

106604069.content: I did another tarot reading for today's escape attempt.

106604071.content: What I got said today's attempt would be extremely dangerous, full of setbacks on every side.

106604073.content: But no matter how difficult, if a certain someone could get here in time, then everything would work out.

106604074.content: What card did you draw for me then?

106604077.content: Well.... then I pray this forecast could be true!

106604078.content: I carry Ookuninushi past several encirclement attempts. Honestly, I was shocked at what my body was capable of in these desperate moments. Perhaps the cards really did help in some way?

106604079.content: The guards' footsteps grow more distant. Did we really just throw them off?

106604080.content: Administrator... did you happen to be a marathon runner by any chance?

106604082.content: The exit lay just ahead. Then, when I finally thought we'd cleared all our obstacles—

106604084.content: I told you it was a smart idea to wait by the exit! Get 'em! We'll be promoted for sure!

106604085.content: Uh oh. Do you have any weapons, Ookuninushi?

106604089.content: The CORG personnel close in on us when a shimmering beam of light shines out from somewhere behind them—

106604090.content: What's that? Who's back there with the torch?

106604092.content: Something's happening. Ookuninushi quickly covers my eyes with her hands to protect me from the blinding light that soon envelops the hallway.

106604095.content: The blinding light fades and I open my eyes. The two members of CORG who had attempted earlier to block us from leaving are now lying by the exit, weapons discarded limply. It doesn't look like another trap.

106604098.content: As if to answer my question, BunBun-0 climbs over the two unconscious bodies on the ground in our direction.

106604099.content: Oh, there you are BunBun-0! Come here!

106604101.content: I designed BunBun-0 with a super powerful light capable of knocking people out. I see whoever built it decided to keep it intact.

106604103.content: Ookuninushi embraces BunBun-0, who nods as if in perfect understanding.

106604104.content: Ah... BunBun-0 secretly followed you. Very impressive!

106604106.content: What's wrong with it? Something doesn't feel right.

106604107.content: BunBun-0 has been dealing with a constant semi-Visbanial corruption, which have impacted some functions.

106604108.content: Keep fighting it, BunBun-0! I've got the original smart chip passcodes, so I can easily remove the Visbane-corrupted modules back at the Cryptics.

106604109.content: Original smart chip passcodes? Is that why you really joined the Institute, Ookuninushi?

106604110.content: BunBun-0's manufacturer coded its internal chip architecture. I need it to remove the Visbane corruption while retaining its memories.

106604111.content: I take it the blueprints ended up in Amos' hands after CORG took over Spealght? And he used the promise of those passcodes to hook you in?

106604112.content: The truth is, I have no interest in any grand visions of a radically transformed human society. Everything has a price. Only humans would be foolish enough to dream about a perpetual motion machine or reservoir of limitless energy.

106604113.content: Good to see the Ookuninushi we all know and love reassert herself.

106604114.content: By the way, the folks after us could come here any second. I suggest we get out now.

106604115.content: Actually, something tells me they'll be preoccupied with other things.

106604116.content: Administrator, do you still have your console with you?

106604117.content: My... Yes. But I put it in offline mode.

106604118.content: I open up the internal CORG Institute network interface following Ookuninushi's instructions.

106604119.content: An endless barrage of comments from the Institute's live feed flows across my display like a tsunami.

106604120.content: Are you having a laugh? You organized a press conference to advertise this crap?

106604121.content: Hah! I told you! The whole idea of infinitely sustainable Tranzist Ore was just a con from the beginning! Can you believe people got taken in?

106604122.content: Give us back our hard-earned money!

106604123.content: I want to withdraw my investment now! This is a scam!

106604124.content: What is going on? It can't be... It was working perfectly well during the test phase!

106604125.content: Director... members of the Investigation Bureau are here to see you. They're outside.

106604126.content: Amos is frozen for a moment, paralyzed in the face of the rather solidly-burned AGI Mecha in front of him and its dull piece of lifeless Tranzist Ore.

106604127.content: He got me to invent a "proof-of-concept" model that trick the investors, you know, a new kind of super energy-efficient Mecha that secretly drew power from elsewhere. There never was any "sustainable Tranzist Ore" technology.

106604128.content: So... you did some sabotage on his demonstration model?

106604129.content: ...Not that I had any interest in exposing him. But... he called you a bothersome ex-colleague. My Administrator!

106604130.content: You were there too? At our meeting?

106604131.content: You may be quite annoying from time to time, but you do have your uses. And I thought it was really quite rude for him to refer to you in that way, especially when he has no idea what you do.

106604133.content: After leaving Spealght a short distance.

106604134.content: Ver. OK. Right. We got Ookuninushi out. I can fill you in on the details later.

106604135.content: The Spealght complex has been surrounded by a mob of angry reporters and demonstrators... Can't be helped, I suppose, when you consider the sheer number of people Amos conned out of their money.

106604136.content: Great you managed to take advantage of the chaos to get out. I'll see you back at HQ then. Take care of yourself.

106604138.content: Don't worry, she's quite alright. In fact, she wants to stay back to see what happens at the complex.

106604139.content: Come to think of it, Shu must have known what was going on it all along, right? No wonder she seemed so relaxed about the whole thing.

106604140.content: But Ver and I got mixed up in it before we knew what was going on. Heh! We got lucky. Too many cooks in the kitchen...

106604143.content: Ookuninushi, who rarely pays much attention to what anyone else has to say, takes a rare opportunity to negate my comment.

106604144.content: You and Ver’s coming wasn't a case of "too many cooks in the kitchen" at all.

106604146.content: I take a deep breath and decide to finally get some feelings off my chest.

106604147.content: The truth is I thought that maybe you leaving Aether Gazer could be a good thing.

106604149.content: I don't think there's anyone else in our organization, except maybe Heimdall, who quite shares your passion and enthusiasm for technology.

106604150.content: Your funding proposals keep getting rejected, your off-the-cuff inventions denied, and so I thought maybe it'd be a good thing for you to go to somewhere you can do what you want?

106604152.content: Actually, most people—particularly you, Administrator, are so far from genuinely caring about science and discovery. You wouldn't recognize it even if it hit you on the head.

106604153.content: Most people are slaves of pragmatism, unable to offer any constructive suggestions on my research except to endlessly parrot a never-ending series of questions...

106604154.content: But the thing is... that's exactly why I can't go...

106604155.content: It's the little things. Like tagging all my equipment with bunny ears, subjecting colleagues to my unstable inventions, or even those times I accidentally brought down our power supply...

106604156.content: I don't know when but, somehow, I got really used to these daily escapades...

106604157.content: And, if I leave, where else am I going to find a bunch of nincompoops dumb enough to put up with that?

106604159.content: So never say, "Maybe you leaving Aether Gazer could be a good thing" or anything like that ever again... silly Admin.

106604160.content: Ookuninushi then strolls off with her bunny-shaped mecha in the direction of the overpass.

106604161.content: She takes a few paces before turning back.

114801001.content: The Division Nine break room is a fine place for a few moments of relaxation outside of our busy work schedules, which also makes it an ideal place for Zenkibo's mischievous escapades.

114801002.content: Zenkibo has been warned many times. We have all learned to guard ourselves anyway, and somehow Zenkibo finds new ways to amuse herself.

114801004.content: Leviathan lets out a scream before rushing to the washroom. She's so shocked she even drops her favorite ice-cream sundae.

114801006.content: ...Whoever made her sundae must have got the wasabi and the matcha mixed up?

114801007.content: So saying, Zenkibo offers yet another mischievous grin, no doubt at the thought of another well-executed prank.

114801008.content: That is not how you make friends, Zenkibo.

114801009.content: No way! I am so serious in friend-making!

114801010.content: One of your... potential friends just ran to the restroom thanks to your delightful wasabi. Doing so will...

114801011.content: If she really is my friend, she would have lined her glass with two-way sticky tape before pretending to run off. And when I checked my handiwork, it would have stick to my hand!

114801013.content: My friend, Goki, would! Goki knows quite a lot of tricks!

114801014.content: There goes Zenkibo mentioning her "ghost" again, and by which I read a hint of disappointment in her smiling expression.

114801015.content: You can't just keep doing this and, as an Administrator, I have a responsibility to...

114801016.content: I become aware of Zenkibo's eyes boring into my soul and realize, from her mischievous expression, she may have found a new target for her pranks. Oh dear. Now I'll really have to be on guard.

114801017.content: ...I'm so sorry, Administrator. Here's the deal: if you could just do me a favour, then I promise you I won't play another prank on anybody for the next two weeks.

114801018.content: Two weeks? Oh. I remember. We're about to go on a special two-week "Division Nine holiday" organized by Shu. It could be worthwhile ensuring no one has to put up with Zenkibo's mischief during this otherwise peaceful period...

114801019.content: Yet something about Zenkibo's expression tells me this is not going to go the way I want.

114801021.content: Just one thing: I want you to help me organize one great prank together!

114801023.content: The image of Shu's disapproving, stern face floats into my awareness. I shiver.

114801024.content: Then... I will just keep going on my own.

114801025.content: Wait... You're saying you're going to keep pranking others even if I don't help you, correct?

114801026.content: Of course. So you should really consider my offer, Administrator. It's a very good deal.

114801028.content: Why do you have to feel so bad about it? Pranks can be fun for everybody!

114801029.content: That remains to be seen... but I guess I could help you do one prank—but only to ensure a happy, prank-free holiday for everybody. And, only for today.

114801030.content: Stingy, eh... but that's alright. Once you see the joys of pranking , you'll join me yourself.

114801033.content: If only your role was even more senior than Shu's...

114801034.content: That's hardly relevant! Knowing Shu, she wouldn't let me off the hook for helping you even if I outranked her.

114801035.content: Yeah alright. Anyway, time to have some fun! Trust me, I'm an expert. Your secret is well and truly safe from Shu.

114801036.content: OK. And just so that everyone can enjoy a nice, peaceful vacation... and only for today!

114801038.content: Zenkibo excitedly announces her acceptance as she takes me by the hand out of the break room and toward the dorms.

114801039.content: I enter Zenkibo's restroom for the first time with an uncomfortable sense of walking on eggshells, afraid that some nasty trap will be triggered to scare the living daylights out of me at a moment's notice.

114801040.content: Don't worry, Administrator. You're my assistant for today, which means temporary prank exemption privileges.

114801041.content: So saying, Zenkibo conjures up a small blackboard from a corner of the room as if by magic and then gives it a few pointed knocks with a marker.

114801042.content: Your introductory class to the art of pranking begins now—

114801044.content: What do you think? You don't turn into a master like me overnight. You need to take it seriously! You need to study!

114801045.content: ...To tell you the truth, I'm not really sure...

114801046.content: Raise your hand before you speak in class!!

114801048.content: (Cough) As a rookie, what you must understand, Administrator, above all else are two questions in particular.

114801049.content: The first: what is the goal of our pranking today?

114801051.content: Wrong! The true goal of pranking is to bring joy into everyone' life!

114801052.content: I'm not so sure about that...

114801053.content: Zenkibo responds to my skepticism by turning to an empty corner of the room.

114801055.content: I'm tempted to call her out on her strange behavior, but don't quite know what to say.

114801058.content: The second question: who is the target of our pranks?

114801060.content: Wrong! It's our dearest, most familiar friends!

114801062.content: It takes a lot of time and energy to plan a prank. Are you seriously going to waste all that time and energy on someone you don't even like?

114801064.content: For our next step, it's time to select the target of our Administrator's first prank.

114801065.content: Huh? Choosing the target... for me?

114801066.content: Of course! You can't be a decent prankster without some field experience. And what I want is a partner. I don't want to just tell you what to do.

114801067.content: Zenkibo smiles in an encouraging and yet hopeful manner although I think also with a hint of manipulation.

114801069.content: Seeing as you haven't been in Division Nine for very long, you probably don't know a whole lot of people. How about running through a list of people you do know? We can go name by name.

114801070.content: Zenkibo's excitement gives me a sudden idea.

114801071.content: Zenkibo, aren't you one of my most familiar friends?

114801073.content: But that's going to be rather hard. Only one person's ever pulled off a successful prank against me and that was Goki. Could be a bit too much for you.

114801074.content: Zenkibo taps the blackboard with her marker again as if to summon another name from me.

114801075.content: I'm pretty familiar with Osiris, Verthandi... Poseidon has also supported me quite a lot in recent times.

114801076.content: So many things have happened in such a short time alongside the rookie Admin and the Rookie Squad.

114801078.content: Zenkibo ignores my wistfulness and writes down the three names on the backboard.

114801079.content: Osiris looks like a prime target, but in my experience, any attempts at mischief to her would be responded to harshly. I think it is rather dangerous for a newcomer.

114801080.content: I thought you would say she's too timid to be pranked.

114801081.content: Timid is good for business. The last thing you want is pranking someone having too many nerves, such as Ver.

114801082.content: Let's say if I rig some kind of scary jack-in-the-box for Ver. Not only would she not be frightened, she'd probably think it was some sort of gift and come and thank me afterward.

114801083.content: ...And there's nothing more boring than a prank like that.

114801084.content: Zenkibo crosses off two names while speaking.

114801085.content: So, Administrator, the final choice must be— Poseidon!

114801087.content: No second-guessing yourself, Administrator. Poseidon loves her heart-to-hearts. We've got ample opportunities.

114801088.content: More importantly, Poseidon is very caring. She's unlikely to react harshly to our prank, or tell Shu what we did. Safe mark!

114801089.content: ...And that is exactly why I don't want to do anything to Poseidon!

114801090.content: Then... Administrator, I'm afraid the only remaining "familiar" candidate is Shu herself!

114801092.content: Alright then. And that concludes our class for today.

114801094.content: You figured out the "two questions". Class over; now's the time for homework.

114801096.content: Of course, we have a practical session coming up—where I hope you, my Administrator, will play an active role. I would like you to design a prank against Poseidon. You need to submit it after lunch.

114801097.content: Zenkibo looks positively delighted with all of the mischievous potential this adventure implies while I'm already beginning to regret my decision.

114802001.content: My post-lunch break is usually my favorite time of the day, but not today obviously as I find myself anxiously standing behind Zenkibo almost as if genuinely worried about what mark my "teacher" will assign my proposal.

114802002.content: And what is my "teacher" doing? Rather expressionlessly highlighting certain features of my proposal with her mouse to try and illustrate a few areas my "prank" could do better.

114802003.content: Replace her phone's background image with a picture of broken glass? Really? Would anyone fall for that today? I hardly think it's going to provide much fun for either party.

114802004.content: And what, pray tell, would be more amusing for the person being pranked?

114802005.content: You should think about it some more, Administrator.

114802010.content: Can I choose to fail your course, Miss Zenkibo?

114802011.content: What, just like that? Looks like my student needs a lot more one-on-one time than I'd expected.

114802012.content: Zenkibo once again takes out her blackboard in an exasperated manner.

114802013.content: The best place to start when figuring out a prank is someone's hobbies or habits. So what are Poseidon's hobbies and habits?

114802015.content: Dolphins eh? Not exactly ideal... but maybe something related to marine life would work. Let me have a think... Got it!

114802016.content: Zenkibo suddenly produces a cardboard box from which she empties an assortment of mischievous trinkets before finally selecting two candidates.

114802018.content: How does that relate to marine life exactly?

114802019.content: Have you heard of a fish called the "stonefish"? Apparently it's the most poisonous fish in the world. A single prick sends you into unconscious paralysis in just a few moments!

114802020.content: Thing is, it happens to be rather delicious, and so it's sold in fish markets all over the world. Administrator, could you buy one and then take it with you to Poseidon? You could pretend like you want to get some information about this fish from her.

114802021.content: That's the moment these little trinkets will have their chance to shine!

114802023.content: Zenkibo starts writing a rather crude and yet graphic diagram of the sequence of events on her blackboard.

114802024.content: So, Administrator, the first step is to bandage yourself. You should pretend that you accidentally pricked yourself on the fish's poisonous stinger.

114802025.content: You then pretend to faint from the poison just as Poseidon starts saying about how poisonous stonefish are. That's when I arrive on the scene and produce my "adrenaline shot" that I happen to carry with me sometimes.

114802026.content: Our poor, kind, gentle Poseidon will want to save your life. So she's going to have to conquer her fears, grab the needle, aim it straight at your heart, and then push down with all her might—

114802027.content: Zenkibo illustrates the action by pushing the needle against the palm of her hand. I wince at the sight, but then she simply withdraws the needle, which retracts back into itself.

114802028.content: And then, what you need to do, Administrator, is sit up as both of us yell "Got you!"

114802030.content: Heehee! Pranking is a serious business, and you need to learn a lot of things to produce a good prank.

114802031.content: And as the more experienced of us pranksters, it's my job to make sure you take it seriously Administrator. No fooling around.

114802032.content: I only wish you could take courses related to our work at Aether Gazer as seriously...

114802034.content: Knowing Poseidon, after finding out the truth, she will probably let out a sigh and then say something like "Oh, just a prank. Wonderful".

114802036.content: Anyway, the sight of Poseidon's face as she desperately tries to conquer her fears and bravely revive her Administrator with the adrenaline, that will be more than worth all the effort!

114802037.content: Now, Administrator, let us begin our first "live" pranking session!

114802038.content: It may my first real prank, but Zenkibo is clearly the one who's having more fun.

114802039.content: I detect a hint of hopeful expectation from Zenkibo's mischievous smile. Maybe she really expects something more out of today's events, like a fellow prankster she can finally work alongside.

114802040.content: Alright then. Time to go and buy some fish...

114802041.content: The park is unusually peaceful after the lunchtime rush. There I stand, holding a fish tank, as I wait for Poseidon to return from the aquarium and consider how on earth I can possibly make this interaction less awkward than I'm afraid of.

114802042.content: Zenkibo, on the other hand, appears perfectly calm, even genuinely interested in the stonefish by my hand.

114802043.content: It looks a bit different than the pictures. Those rocky shapes on its skin really do look like stones though.

114802044.content: Hey, Administrator, how did you get all this water on you?

114802045.content: I have no choice but to handle the stonefish with these exceptionally bulky gloves to avoid this from becoming more than a prank. It slipped through my fingers and the water got on me.

114802046.content: Great! The more effort you put in, the more you get out. And that'll make our victory all the sweeter!

114802048.content: So saying, Poseidon appears at the end of a distant street. She's on her way back after buying some more dolphin-related trinkets and seems rather pleased with herself.

114802049.content: Admin, Zenkibo, what brings you here!

114802050.content: Heh. What a coincidence, seeing you here, Poseidon! Ah...

114802051.content: My improvisation is bad enough to make just about anyone cringe. Zenkibo cradles her head. But Poseidon doesn't seem to notice anything out of the ordinary. Her eyes are immediately drawn to the stonefish in my little tank.

114802052.content: Admin, what are you doing with this fish?

114802053.content: Shu's orders. Me and the Administrator are on kitchen duties, so we ordered some stuff at the fish market. I think this one's called a "stonefish". Apparently it tastes very nice!

114802054.content: Zenkibo saves the scene with her clever excuse and motions for me to place the tank by the roadside seat for a moment so Poseidon can get a clear look at it.

114802055.content: You're right about the delicious part, but...

114802056.content: It's real slippery. This thing nipped me on the finger when I was trying to pick it up.

114802057.content: I finally get into the spirit with Zenkibo's help. Poseidon gazes in wide-eyed horror at the bandage on my hand as I take my acting skills up a notch.

114802058.content: Administrator! You mean... you were stung by that fish? A stonefish?! They're very poisonous!

114802060.content: I then pretend to faint on the ground as we rehearsed many times.

114802062.content: The stonefish has a fast-acting neurotoxin! Quick, we've got to get the Administrator to the hospital! Any delay and we could be looking at a heart attack or paralysis of the lungs!

114802063.content: A neurotoxin... Oh! That reminds me, I was given an adrenaline shot by the Medical Department on my last mission. I think I might still have it with me. Here it is!

114802064.content: Zenkibo takes out her prank syringe with deft familiarity and hands it to Poseidon.

114802065.content: If I recall correctly, you have to aim it right at the heart and press down as hard as you can. Do you think... you can do that?

114802066.content: Zenkibo has really gotten into the role. I can even hear the sense of panic in her voice. This is the moment of truth. I hold my breath to make my symptoms that much more realistic.

114802067.content: Poseidon just stares at the syringe Zenkibo offers with great puzzlement.

114802069.content: Uh... It's an adrenaline shot. We can give it to the Administrator.

114802070.content: Adrenaline won't do anything. Stonefish poison is very fast-acting, but the Administrator was fine until now. This isn't from getting stung at the fish market.

114802071.content: The poison secreted in the stonefish's glands is water-soluble. I think Admin must have got the poison from the water, not the stonefish itself, which slowed it down a lot. So delivering adrenaline straight to the heart would do nothing...

114802072.content: We should get Admin to the hospital right away, and have a professional give the antidote!

114802073.content: Neither Zenkibo nor myself had planned for Poseidon's ingenious interpretation. I decided there was nothing for it but to jump up in terror while Zenkibo vacillated between responses.

114802074.content: There was poison in the water, I'm sure of it! Quick, call an ambulance!

114802075.content: Poseidon stares straight through my attempt to panic. She is smiling.

114802076.content: The poison was in the water...

114802077.content: Don't worry. Stonefish poison doesn't really spread through water. The only thing you have to worry about is a direct sting piercing the skin barrier.

114802078.content: But... it got me right on the finger. I'm going to faint...
