114802079.content: Poseidon observes my performance with a gentle smile. The game is up.

114802080.content: But there is one thing you need to know. That fish in your tank ... is actually a grouper, which is not poisonous, and not a stonefish.

114802082.content: Are you and Zenkibo in cahoots now, Administrator?

114802084.content: I can't believe you didn't clarify what you were buying, Administrator!

114802085.content: Maybe the clerk misheard me? Anyway, you were the one telling me all about your general knowledge, so you should have noticed we had the wrong fish!

114802086.content: I... Come on. I just did a quick internet search. I can't spend hours pouring over images of stonefish...

114802087.content: It's alright, it's alright! Real stonefish are very delicious, but also dangerous. You'll need a professional to cook them. I'm glad they only gave you a non-lethal grouper for your prank.

114802088.content: Come to think of it, I think grouper is actually a bit poisonous too.

114802089.content: Grouper toxins are a complex byproduct of pollution in the oceans and food chain, leading to a buildup of toxins in the fish's digestive tract which can generate ciguatoxins.

114802090.content: And speaking of complex byproducts and oceanic pollution...

114802091.content: Our prank quickly turns into a general ocean conservation information session courtesy of Poseidon, which goes on for some time.

114802092.content: ...And that is why we need to take ocean conservation very seriously!

114802094.content: Zenkibo hurriedly bids farewell to Poseidon. She looks anxious.

114802095.content: What a mistake to try and prank Poseidon in her area of expertise.

114802097.content: Zenkibo responds to my hopeful attempt to end our pranking with renewed excitement.

114802098.content: ... But at last, someone besides Goki saw through one of my best. Finally! A challenge!

114802099.content: Looks like I should take this a bit more seriously. Let's deliver a perfect prank, Admin!

114803001.content: The next prank I observe is Zenkibo's lovingly prepared signature "matcha" sundae with wasabi cream.

114803002.content: The large pack of wasabi Zenkibo throws away afterward gives me some idea of the deadly consequences of trying her new concoction.

114803003.content: There it is: operation "wasabi matcha sundae" round 2 begins!

114803004.content: Who's the target this time? Leviathan?

114803005.content: Obviously! Hard to find anyone else in Division Nine who loves ice cream so much.

114803006.content: But you just used this trick on her this morning. Do you really think she's going to fall for it again?

114803007.content: That's good, Administrator... taking a target's past experiences into account. Good progress.

114803008.content: But rest assured, a master prankster such as I has already foreseen this possibility. And I prepared a countermeasure.

114803009.content: Don't you realize that the sweetest prank is the same prank executed twice in a row on the same target!

114803011.content: If someone was offering me ice-cream twice in a row, I'd be so happy.

114803013.content: I need you to go and find Vidar next.

114803014.content: And what do I want from Vidar?

114803016.content: Zenkibo has a wicked smile on her face as if everything is proceeding as she has foreseen.

114803017.content: After lunch. For most people that means a bit of rest and relaxation. The corridor to and from the office gym is pretty much abandoned. It is here Zenkibo and I await our target: one of the few Modifiers who'd go to the gym during this precious rest period, Vidar.

114803018.content: Vidar comes with a gust of cold air, as well as Fenrir, who gives a couple of quick yelps and then crouches on the ground, tongue out, in a friendly manner.

114803019.content: Administrator. And... Leviathan's sworn enemy. Anything?

114803021.content: I guess Leviathan said something. That's probably why she's not returning my messages. She must be angry.

114803022.content: Zenkibo has somehow morphed into a repentant lady very much ashamed of her actions. Even I'm impressed at the performance, knowing what she's planning.

114803023.content: All I wanted was to play a nice little prank on my friend. Now she's really mad at me! I've decided to make it up to her with a cup of her favorite sundae.

114803024.content: I don't think she's in the mood to see me at the moment, so I was hoping that you, Vidar, could pass it along.

114803025.content: Prank, getting angry, apology... Sounds reasonable.

114803026.content: And one other thing, I don't think she's in the mood to accept any kind of gift from me right now, so I think it's better that you gave it to her in my stead, Vidar.

114803027.content: It'd make me feel a lot better to see Leviathan get her favorite sundae she's wanted all this time.

114803029.content: It's a simple matter to convince Vidar of Zenkibo's logic, and she accepts the tray from Zenkibo's hands. Fenrir and Vidar then head in the direction of the break room.

114803032.content: You got someone angry, you apologize. That's logical.

114803033.content: What's not logical is that you are the one doing this.

114803034.content: Hah! That's what I mean about Vidar being my "countermeasure". She doesn't get some of the complexity of human relationships.

114803035.content: But, more importantly, Leviathan is not going to refuse a gift from Vidar.

114803036.content: Even if the cream smells a bit like wasabi...

114803037.content: I know what you're thinking, Administrator. I have another good reason for selecting Vidar—her low-temperature aura. It'll help to mask the smell.

114803038.content: I also put some seasoning on it too. Even Fenrir wouldn't notice anything strange. There's no way Leviathan'll be able to figure it out before she takes a nice, big mouthful!

114803040.content: Leviathan will have to come by this way as she rushes out of the break room for the washroom.

114803041.content: Zenkibo has her camera at the ready to take a few high-definition mementos of her success.

114803042.content: Seconds and then minutes tick by without anything happening...

114803043.content: How long has it been now?

114803044.content: If I know Leviathan, she must have been in the break room... so Vidar would've found her right away.

114803045.content: Oh... there is another possibility. Let's check it out!

114803046.content: Isn't it too obvious if we go there now?

114803048.content: Zenkibo creeps surreptitiously towards the break room. Her sharp eyes latch onto Leviathan's favorite seat. Neither Leviathan nor Vidar are present.

114803049.content: The seat is not empty, however. It contains a single, empty cup. Perhaps it's a message?

114803052.content: Surely I didn't put... matcha in it? That was real wasabi! What happened?

114803053.content: Zenkibo's curiosity overpowers her. She goes to pick up the empty cup for a closer examination.

114803054.content: Zenkibo notices the word "YOU FOOL" on the bottom of the cup and that it seems, for some reason, to be sticking to her hand. She tries to put the cup down, and cannot.

114803056.content: Leviathan appears out of nowhere. She must have been hiding in the corner for some time.

114803057.content: Today marks the day Leviathan finally pulled off a counter-prank against Zenkibo!

114803058.content: Our other colleagues in break room who were watching the strange drama unfold break out in a slow clap. Even I feel compelled to join in.

114803059.content: Double-sided sticky tape? I can't believe I fell for something so... so... boring.

114803060.content: Well done for not crying after tasting my special wasabi matcha, Leviathan.

114803061.content: Hmph! And I would have been taken in too if Master hadn't had a bite first.

114803062.content: Zenkibo finally notices Vidar behind Leviathan. There's a trace of green cream on the corner of her mouth.

114803063.content: You had... quite a bit then?

114803064.content: Food is a precious resource. Leviathan said she was going to throw it away. My attitude is "waste not, want not".

114803066.content: It was a bit strange, but it would be pretty good with some fish meat caught from the Pole.

114803067.content: I see... I made a few oversights.

114803068.content: The disappointment on Zenkibo's face is palpable, but this is quickly subsumed by renewed confidence.

114803069.content: Zenkibo returns to her room to rummage once again through her "little box of horrors". She is down but clearly not out for the count.

114803070.content: I didn't think Leviathan had it in her. Time to reveal my ultimate weapon!

114803071.content: Zenkibo finally locates the desired item from her "box of horrors" and brandishes it aloft for me to see.

114803074.content: Yep. The program inside allows me to control someone's computer remotely.

114803075.content: This is the only reason I forced myself through Ookuninushi's horribly boring book on programming.

114803076.content: You taught yourself how to program this?

114803077.content: Obviously! All the sweat and tears, just for the greatest prank!

114803079.content: Heh! Someone has learned the joys of pranking. Now it's time for me, the master prankster in Aether Gazer, to display a true pranking masterpiece!

114803081.content: Zenkibo's smile takes on more evil contours as I remain motionless. There'll be no way for Zenkibo or especially myself to escape Shu's anger in the event of a botched "ULTIMATE" prank.

114803082.content: Zenkibo meanwhile misinterprets my trepidation for curiosity before commencing another little blackboard lesson.

114803083.content: Our target is, no doubt, Shu's computer. She is Division Nine's director, so her computer has access to the entire network.

114803084.content: Controlling it gives access to any screen or lighting system anywhere in Division Nine. Oh! By the way, I also prepared a most delightful thriller!

114803088.content: Whatever. Now I just have to figure out our next step...

114803089.content: I was already imagining scenes of utter chaos and confusion that would accompany Zenkibo's madcap plan as she quietly thought to herself—

114803090.content: The mood will be fairly relaxed the night before everyone's break. It is at this moment Zenkibo will dim the lights and play some sort of terrifying supernatural thriller on everyone's screens...

114803091.content: Should this mad scheme prove successful, it'll be a terrifying but memorable night for all our Division Nine colleagues.

114803092.content: Zenkibo, perhaps now is a good time to give up and get some rest?

114803093.content: Huh? What gives you that idea?

114803094.content: Zenkibo is still holding the marker she uses to draw her insane schemes. I can see the twinkle of anticipation in her eyes.

114803095.content: This is the first I've ever seen Zenkibo so excited. I realize now her pranks are so much more than a way for this mischievous kid to pass the time, but a whole-hearted endeavor.

114803096.content: It seems churlish to shut down Zenkibo's plans with a few words of wisdom in the face of her sheer enthusiasm and drive.

114803098.content: Uh... Because pranks are fun for everyone!

114803100.content: Really... But when Goki and I were pranking each other, we both had lots of fun.

114803101.content: Anyway, I've been trying to have fun with others since Goki stopped pranking with me...

114803103.content: After all the efforts I made... Finally, they start to see the fun in pranking! Didn't you see?

114803104.content: I hesitate, but cannot bring myself to extinguish the light of enthusiasm in Zenkibo's eyes.

114803107.content: Well... When Goki and I were pranking each other, we both had lots of fun.

114803109.content: I know you all can't see Goki as I do.

114803110.content: So you won't understand the joy we shared, just like all the others.

114803111.content: The sight of Zenkibo's pure enthusiasm forces me to extinguish some sense of duty toward restraining her.

114803112.content: Hey! You are pranked today! Remember? Doesn't that mean people are finally starting to warm up to what you have to offer!?

114803114.content: Zenkibo's eyes are sparkling once again.

114803115.content: So then, Admin, are you on board with my "ULTIMATE prank"?

114803116.content: As long as you keep your words.

114803117.content: Wonderful! Now the first step... is to hack into Shu's work computer!

114803118.content: However, Ookuninushi has installed an impressive firewall. That's why I'm going to need your help.

114803120.content: You don't need to be. All you need to do is distract Shu long enough for me to slip past, insert the USB, and install the remote control program on her computer.

114804001.content: After waiting for half an hour, I run into Shu by coincidence on her way back to her office from dinner.

114804002.content: Admin? You have some unfinished work, too?

114804003.content: Oh no, not at all. I just wanted to talk about something...

114804004.content: What's it about? Is it urgent?

114804005.content: Uh oh, I'm stuck. I promised Zenkibo a ten minute distraction, but I don't know if I have the conversational chops to distract Shu the workaholic with random topics.

114804006.content: I feel Shu's eyes bore into my soul. It is at this moment I somehow stumble on a topic I should probably avoid.

114804008.content: Zenkibo? Don't tell me she's been pranking you too?

114804009.content: You could say that, to an extent.

114804010.content: Hm... well, Division Nine protocols dictate a penalty for interfering in the Administrator's work of...

114804011.content: I'm not here to file a complaint!

114804012.content: Oh? Then what exactly were you after?

114804013.content: I just wanted to ask you whether you think Zenkibo's pranks are really just... a unique way to make friends?

114804014.content: Of course! I know that. Everyone in Division Nine knows that.

114804016.content: That's why no one files formal complaints for her pranks, unless it's too... Oh, Admin! Has she played an outrageous prank on you?

114804018.content: Shu smiles in an especially knowing way as if she's a parent who's figured out her kid's secret.

114804019.content: Well, I trust that you and Zenkibo will get along quite well.

114804020.content: Shu turns back to her office as I hurriedly think of ways to delay her further. By that moment, my phone buzzes with a notification from my pocket: Zenkibo's signal she's successfully completed her "infiltration".

114804021.content: Zenkibo peaks her head out from the corridor after Shu leaves and waves at me with a smile.

114804022.content: Easy peasy! I can't believe you managed to delay Shu that long. Whatever you did, that was great.

114804023.content: Now the fun part: Let's enjoy the fruits of my ULTIMATE prank!

114804024.content: I nod helplessly as I reflect on the way in which everyone cares so much about Zenkibo they're willing to put up with her inanity, and that Zenkibo has no idea.

114804025.content: Everyone in the office is exceptionally relaxed on the night before our lengthy break. A great number of Division Nine colleagues have decided to congregate in the break room as I observe the start of Zenkibo's master scheme.

114804026.content: Zenkibo leads me to a corner of the break room as we await the "grand surprise".

114804027.content: It should be starting now. Is it time? Make sure you get everyone's reactions, Admin!

114804028.content: When I turn to Zenkibo she's put her hands over her eyes.

114804029.content: Don't you want to see it?

114804032.content: Why would I pick something to scare other people that doesn't even scare me?

114804033.content: Yes but... what about that "Goki" you keep talking about? I thought she follows you all around?

114804034.content: She's not a ghost! You just can't see her!

114804035.content: Anyway, I distinctly remember a certain pranking expert tell me a professional prankster has to verify the fruits of their work.

114804036.content: Clearly the label "unprofessional" must be worse than viewing whatever horrors Zenkibo has in store for everyone as she lowers her hands from her eyes.

114804037.content: That is indeed an insightful suggestion, young apprentice.

114804038.content: The time had come. Like clockwork, the break room lights dim as an eerie mix of black and purple appears over the public screen.

114804039.content: In the center of the screen we observe a young-looking lady ghost with bedraggled hair muttering in a low voice and crawling toward the camera in a familiar replay of so many horror tropes.

114804040.content: I already hear a few scattered yelps. Zenkibo has her camera out and ready to film reactions despite her own squeamishness. It is at this moment the ghost on the screen finally speaks—

114804043.content: Why can't you... let me rest...

114804045.content: Zenkibo has no idea how to respond to this most unexpected turn of events. She squeals in horror, which draws everybody's attention.

114804046.content: The ghost takes on an even more menacing look as Zenkibo wracks her brains, trying to figure out the mechanism by which her horror film selection could inspire a reckoning from an angry digital ghost.

114804047.content: Zen... ki... bo... I... want... to... wish you... a happy Arrival Day!

114804048.content: The break room lights turn back on as the ghostly apparition on the screen turns into a smiling, loveable Shu, the Division Nine director. Then everybody in the break room bursts out into an impromptu "Happy Birthday" song.

114804049.content: Everybody's here, including Shu, who brings over a magnificent birthday cake.

114804050.content: Zenkibo and I are apparently the only ones not in on it.

114804051.content: Messing with my computer should lead to a two-day detention. But I'll let you go this time. Consider it an Arrival Day gift.

114804052.content: And you wrote a pretty good program, I might add, even if it's not a patch on my version.

114804053.content: Enough everyone. We should be focusing on celebrating Zenkibo's Arrival Day, right?

114804055.content: Even if it's Zenkibo's Arrival Day, I still get a slice of that cake, right?

114804056.content: I finally figured out what is going on amidst the bustling chatter. I think Zenkibo also finally realizes the full extent of her master prank's failure.

114804057.content: I almost forgot. Today is my Arrival Day...

114804059.content: Zenkibo's announcement seems to freeze everyone on the spot. Perhaps some think Zenki incapable of admitting defeat or genuinely thanking everyone after having done so.

114804060.content: My years of discipline are finally having an effect?

114804061.content: Zenkibo won't refuse everyone's love just because one single defeat?

114804062.content: I've also figured something out about Zenkibo. Oh dear. She really looks embarrassed now.

114804063.content: What's that supposed to mean? Why you are looking at me like that?

114804064.content: ... And I don't admit defeat! I'm going to... Anyway, let's just finish this cake first!

114804066.content: Now's the time for everyone to crowd around Zenkibo and offer our smiles and congratulations as the warmth of our friendship dissolves the discomfort on Zenki's face.

114804067.content: The night of horrors I had feared turned into a rather pleasant "Awakening" celebration. Almost everyone stayed up until fairly late celebrating Zenkibo's day against a warm backdrop of candlelight...

114804068.content: Thus did Division Nine's special, unprecedented two-week break begin.

114804069.content: And Zenkibo also put her pranking ways on hold as promised for that two-week period. Whenever she visited the break room in the meantime I found her whittling away her time like an ordinary lady.

114804070.content: I could finally relax in her presence.

114804071.content: I thought you would be here, Administrator.

114804073.content: I understand your surprise. I rarely drop by the break room, let alone during our "break".

114804074.content: But I'm not here for the break. Actually, I'm doing my job.

114804076.content: I've sent you a penalty notice for helping Zenkibo with her pranks. Please check it in the system.

114804078.content: You have the right to appeal, according to Division Nine protocol.

114804079.content: Appeal? Probably well-deserved. I'm just curious, how can you figure out our prank yesterday?

114804080.content: Zenkibo is indeed an expert prankster. Otherwise, she won't succeed so many times. But yesterday, we got some help.

114804082.content: Shu takes out her portable laptop and shows me a list of emails.

114804083.content: I quickly notice she received quite a number of emails from the same person yesterday explaining Zenkibo's prank in detail and suggesting countermeasures.

114804084.content: The name of the sender is... "Goki".

114804086.content: I asked Ookuninushi to investigate. The sender's IP does not actually appear anywhere in the network. It's almost like the "ghost" Zenki's claimed. Nowhere to be found.

114804088.content: Strictly speaking, I wouldn't use the word "exists" with reference to this entity.

114804089.content: The Cryptics proposed a theory, that the super-awareness of each Modifier would bring a still-living fragment of memory from the Gen-zone, even after the Modifier is given a corporeal form.

114804090.content: Zenki and Goki could have been two super-awarenesses generated within the same Gen-zone. And they, for whatever reason, happen to be good friends who love pranking each other.

114804091.content: However, not every super-awareness can be given a corporeal form within Gaea. Perhaps this "Goki"... Apparently, she still accompanies Zenkibo in some form we are unaware of.

114804092.content: Such examples cannot be fully explained without a deeper knowledge about the system of Gaea.

114804093.content: I remain silent for some time and take another glance at the list of emails on the screen. I also note that the "ghost", Goki, started each email in the same way.

114804094.content: "These pranks are my Arrival Day gifts for Zenkibo."

114804095.content: I'm suddenly overwhelmed by a sense of the rightness of my decision to assist Zenkibo yesterday. It may be our failure has finally provided proof of the mysterious counterpart she's longed for all these years.

114804096.content: In hindsight, it really was great I could help Zenkibo out with her pranking yesterday.

114804097.content: Administrator, that's not how you reflect on your mistakes.

114804098.content: I feel the need to fend off Shu's sudden sternness with a bunch of excuses, including the deal I'd made with Zenkibo for everyone's benefit.

114804099.content: Zenkibo and I agreed she'd refrain from pranking everyone for these two weeks if I just helped her for one day. So, you could say, I did it for everyone's benefit...

114804100.content: But, my dear Administrator, what compelled you to think that?

114804101.content: Zenkibo always takes a two-week break every six months. That's one of the reasons I set up our "special holiday" when I did.

114804103.content: Shu looks at my surprised expression with a knowing, almost parental smile.

114804104.content: Nice to see Zenkibo pulled off at least one of her many pranks in the course of your partnership.

114804105.content: Zenkibo smiles triumphantly in response to my yelp of horror.

114804106.content: Another temporary ceasefire... but I'll get you next time!

114804107.content: Zenkibo mutters away to herself at nothing in particular.

1104805001.content: "Let's play!" screams the girl, raising my arms while standing on her tiptoes.

1104805002.content: I'm not sure why, but ever since her birthday party, Zenki has taken to using me as her battle prep partner.

1104805003.content: Even though I don't remember agreeing to this at all...

1104805004.content: When she enters her "burnout," Zenkibo reflects on her mistakes...

1104805006.content: It's a beautiful vacation morning. It's warm, and there's no rain.

1104805007.content: (A day when Zenki isn't playing tricks is always a good day...)

1104805009.content: A loud noise interrupts my thoughts.

1104805010.content: A blast of air knocks the cup of soy milk out of my hand, flinging it onto my head at a weird angle...

1104805011.content: I'm doused in the sweet liquid.

1104805012.content: When I look up, the culprit is standing before me, giggling.

1104805013.content: Zenkibo—you have the right to remain silent.

1104805015.content: Then this is quite the coincidence. Did Goki put you up to it?

1104805017.content: I'm telling on you to Shu. You're going to have to write a three-thousand-word apology.

1104805018.content: No! On a day off? That's cruel! ...Are you mad, #{nickname}#?

1104805020.content: I thought you were in "prank burnout." What are you doing in this room?

1104805021.content: Heehee. I hope that doesn't mean you're burned out from me!

1104805022.content: I might be taking a break from playing pranks on other people, but I've still got lots of plans for you, #{nickname}#!

1104805024.content: I was thinking. I've run into you again while getting breakfast. Why do you always target me?

1104805025.content: Heehee. Because you'll always forgive me.

1104805026.content: Although, I did want to ask you something...

1104805028.content: Hehe... You'll have to come to my room.

1104805029.content: #{nickname}#! Welcome to part two of Zenkibo's Prank Class!

1104805030.content: Zenkibo whips out her pointer and writing tablet.

1104805032.content: Oh yes! Review is really important!

1104805033.content: Ms. Shu won the last prank war because we were careless.

1104805034.content: Just switch the "Ms. Shu" and "we" in that sentence and it will be correct.

1104805035.content: So after doing six hours of reflection in my room, I decided that as the senior prankster, I ought to help the rookies.

1104805036.content: So I was thinking that during these two weeks, we could...

1104805037.content: Zenkibo raises her eyebrows at me.

1104805039.content: Hey, are you turning on me, #{nickname}#?

1104805040.content: Never mind that right now. Was the conclusion you reached during your "reflection," to give me a soy milk shampooing?

1104805041.content: Soy milk tastes much better than regular milk!

1104805042.content: And besides, soy milk is perfect for pulling pranks! It's sticky and great for doing a series of pranks!

1104805043.content: So you decided to soak me in it?!

1104805044.content: Well, that's how all the soy-milk-scented shampoo commercials go...

1104805045.content: At least regular milk is actually used in some shampoos...

1104805046.content: Oh! I see! Tomorrow I'll replace your shampoo with the milk I never drink!

1104805047.content: Hey, I'm the victim in all this! Show me some sensitivity!

1104805048.content: Zenkibo raises a finger and wags it in front of my eyes.

1104805049.content: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth!

1104805050.content: If you're trying to hypnotize me, I suggest you stick to pranks.

1104805051.content: Oh, please... Anyway, we'll be pranking together, just like last time.

1104805052.content: Zenkibo's eyes fill with tears, and she looks at me piteously. I sigh in exasperation and cross my arms.

1104805053.content: Didn't you promise that if I helped you with your pranks for a day, you'd lay off them during these two weeks?

1104805054.content: Uh... But I still wanna play with everybody...

1104805055.content: Zenkibo's head falls in disappointment. It's hard to say no to her when she's like this.

1104805056.content: But Zenki is still Zenki. Right as I'm beginning to waver, her expression changes to one of glee.

1104805057.content: Well, it's up to you. Come here, I've got something to show you!

1104805058.content: Instinctively, I immediately take three steps back.

1104805060.content: Zenkibo takes a device from the corner of the room. She pushes it in front of me and removes the lid.

1104805062.content: Hello, friend. I'd like to play a game.

1104805063.content: It talks?! And with your voice?!

1104805064.content: Where on earth did you get that?

1104805065.content: It's boring just sitting around by myself! So I bought this with my own funds. Now I can cheer up Ookuninushi, who's always complaining about not having any money, and everybody can meet Goki!

1104805066.content: Oh, and I got a surprise for Ookuninushi too!

1104805067.content: Um... could I ask what sort of surprise it is?

1104805068.content: I tied all of her bunnies' ears into bows! They look adorable!

1104805069.content: Zenkibo pulls out a rope, grabs it at both ends, and ties it into a very tight—and very ugly—knot.

1104805070.content: When I was leaving the lab, I heard a terrible cracking sound...

1104805071.content: I think you broke something! What made you think a rabbit would look cute like that?!

1104805072.content: Well, isn't that what their ears are for? Decoration?

1104805074.content: Then Ookuninushi said Goki has a lot of optimization problems, and we need to carefully verify the project's integrity, and a bunch of other stuff I didn't understand, but anyway, the budget is way too small...

1104805075.content: So I just ended up with this half-finished thing that has my voice.

1104805077.content: Zenkibo looks dejected. She's clearly invested a lot in this plan.

1104805078.content: It looks like all of those BunBun products weren't just acquired with her pocket money...

1104805079.content: Heh. Sometimes you're just like a little kid...

1104805080.content: What're you looking at me like that for? Are you pitying me?

1104805081.content: I'm just saying your taste is...

1104805084.content: No, no, I believe in you—really!

1104805085.content: You've been smiling this whole time. You still are!

1104805086.content: Whatever. It's time to try it out!

1104805087.content: Wait, what? Uh... this thing isn't going to suddenly explode on me, is it?

1104805088.content: Sucking on a chocolate bar, Zenkibo grabs my hand and places her other hand on the mecha.

1104805089.content: #{nickname}#, do you take Zenkibo to be your prank partner?

1104805091.content: That's strange. Why does Goki have Zenkibo's voice?

1104805094.content: For richer or poorer, in sickness and in health, till death do us part? As prank partners, I mean.

1104805096.content: Zenkibo, do you take #{nickname}# to be your prank partner?

1104805099.content: You're way too excited for this. At least hesitate a little!

1104805100.content: For richer or poorer, in sickness and in health, till death do you part?

1104805102.content: Why aren't you listening to me? I said NO! (Option)

1104805103.content: You can't be saying this sort of thing in this situation!

1104805104.content: Does Zenkibo even know what she's saying?

1104805105.content: Zenkibo lifts her head, blinks, and signals me to put the other half of the chocolate bar in my mouth.

1104805107.content: Stop looking at me like that!

1104805108.content: It's like she's trying to lure me in...

1104805109.content: Hahaha! I can't believe I got you with such an obvious prank!

1104805110.content: You know the meaning of the vows Goki was reading!

1104805111.content: I've wanted to try that on you for so long! Your reaction was so funny! Hahaha!

1104805113.content: But I can see how touched you are!

1104805114.content: I tilt my head, flustered, but Zenki just runs back up to me.

1104805115.content: Haha! You couldn't even see through such a simple prank!

1104805116.content: I was just playing along... Don't get carried away now.

1104805117.content: So what sort of vows do you think we should make, Admin?

1104805119.content: Shouldn't the first words of any vow be "forever and ever"?

1104805120.content: Forever and ever? Wouldn't we get bored?

1104805121.content: If you really want to be with me forever, you'll have to add more to the vow.

1104805122.content: Yes, yes, yes. This is another prank, right?

1104805123.content: If I don't play along, I suppose you'll never leave me alone, so let's get this over with.

1104805125.content: If you're unhappy, Goki and I can fix it!

1104805126.content: But right now, you seem to be enjoying yourself.

1104805127.content: Now, could I ask you a small favor?

1104805128.content: The impish smile returns to Zenkibo's face.

1104805129.content: Her grin is wide, revealing her canines. I can tell that this is going to be an interesting day...

1104806001.content: 14 days after making the prank vows with Zenkibo.

1104806002.content: Under the bed, behind the curtains, in the drawers...

1104806003.content: Well, don't say that I won't fight back!!!

1104806004.content: Like a ninja, Zenkibo is able to sneak up close to me and deliver the final blow.

1104806005.content: Even the Aether Gazer staff has gotten used to my little lackey's constant attacks. They often throw me sympathetic looks as they pass by.

1104806006.content: I'm so hungry... Where's my meal card...?

1104806007.content: Did my wallet walk off or something? How did it end up in the fridge?

1104806008.content: Now that I think about it, a lot of my things have been going missing lately...

1104806009.content: Wanna get some food together, Admin?

1104806010.content: The culprit's remorseless face appears, grinning widely at me as she waves the card she hid.

1104806011.content: Now? You don't look hungry at all...

1104806012.content: What do you mean? I haven't eaten all morning. I'm starving!

1104806013.content: Liar! Tell me what you did first!

1104806014.content: Uh, hehe... Why don't we go grab some grub, #{nickname}#?

1104806015.content: Come on, Admin. Try this bubble gum I just got!

1104806016.content: I study Zenkibo, suspicious by the fact she's suddenly acting nice to me.

1104806017.content: Bubble gum isn't a meal... People get cavities from that.

1104806018.content: Well, if I do, I'll just pull the tooth!

1104806019.content: Just give it a try. It's only bubble gum!

1104806020.content: Zenkibo and I sit down together. Zenki unwraps the gum, moves closer to me, and hands it to me.

1104806021.content: I feel a bit self-conscious trying it is front of people, but at the sight of Zenkibo's expectant look, I follow her lead and start chewing.

1104806022.content: Pbthhhh! Ah! It's spicy! Are you sure this is bubble gum?!

1104806023.content: My reaction draws a small crowd around us. I shake my head around, trying to spit out the gum, but it's like it's stuck to my tongue.

1104806026.content: The bubble gum has reacted with the drink. I feel like a dragon about to breathe fire. Now a bubble is forming on my lips...

1104806028.content: Hey, come look! The Admin is flying!

1104806029.content: Everyone stares as I shut my eyes tight, open my mouth wide, and breathe out a huge, wet bubble. Struggling, I grip Zenkibo's hand and float upwards.

1104806030.content: The cartoons Zenki brought over are playing on the TV. It's the only time she ever settles down.

1104806032.content: Zenkibo sets the scoreboard to 14 and nods, a satisfied expression on her face.

1104806034.content: The prank master pulls out a cup and shares her spoils from the cafeteria with me, before taking a drink herself.

1104806035.content: I never agreed to a contest. It's bizarre that you're keeping score...

1104806036.content: What's wrong, Admin? Your mouth's still sore? Let me take a look...

1104806037.content: No, I'm fine. But don't you think this is a waste?

1104806038.content: You've only got so much of that commemorative fruit soda.

1104806039.content: Not at all! I'd give you all my soda just to see you fly again.

1104806040.content: Save it... My tongue is still numb.

1104806041.content: That's because you haven't eaten really puffy snacks. Here, I'll tell you the secret to fixing it.

1104806042.content: Zenkibo sits on my knee and, like a magician who's just finished a show, smugly explains how the trick works.

1104806043.content: And just like that, you can fly without pain!

1104806044.content: This might be the reason I love watching to her performances.

1104806045.content: Thanks for having me, Admin. Oh, I wanted to buy something for everyone this afternoon. See you at the haunted house tonight!

1104806046.content: The "haunted house" is Zenkibo's room. Because of this name, she was quite disappointed when it turned out there was no spirit living in there... Thankfully, she agreed to live there, anyway.

1104806048.content: Just like the cat and mouse in Zenki's cartoons, we've casually arranged the time of our next confrontation.

1104806050.content: I nod, turn off the TV, and drape a blanket over the sleepy Zenkibo.

1104806051.content: The terminal in my pocket vibrates and I look at the screen. It's from Ookuninushi: "Zenkibo's helper, come see the Cryptics this afternoon."

1104806052.content: I head to the Cryptics. There, I see Ookuninushi and Heimdall facing a container and talking.

1104806053.content: Oh, good afternoon, Zenkibo's little helper.

1104806055.content: You've been spending a lot of time with her lately.

1104806056.content: Not many members of Aether Gazer use guns, so call the Admin Zenkibo's helper is accurate, isn't it?

1104806057.content: ...I suppose so. When I first joined Aether Gazer, it was Zenkibo who taught me how to shoot.

1104806058.content: Modifiers don't have to train with humans, but Zenkibo always wants you to do target practice. I don't know whether you're lucky or unlucky.

1104806059.content: Thanks to her, I think I'm able to look after myself during missions.

1104806060.content: Anyway, what did you want to see me about?

1104806061.content: I point to rifles lying in the container and throw Ookuninushi a questioning look. She gives me a nod.

1104806062.content: The Comet R4Y Ct-08 Alto-reloading Beam Rifle. It should help Zenkibo get accustomed to mecha battles.

1104806063.content: Whoever tied the BunBuns' ears into knots is so annoying. Now I can't use my hard-earned data.

1104806064.content: But nothing says I can't sort out my work and my mood in one go.

1104806065.content: Can I ask... which part is your mood?

1104806066.content: As payback, I captured Zenki and stuck her in that anti-gravity chamber for six hours of testing.

1104806067.content: I look at the anti-gravity chamber and feel a bit of sympathy for Zenkibo.

1104806068.content: She's actually taking it pretty well. It's no surprise, seeing as she was trained by Odin.

1104806069.content: (Coughs) Since Zenkibo and the Admin have similar training and fighting styles, theoretically, your experimental data could be used to adjust the access key data.

1104806071.content: Suddenly, I read the second line of the warnings: "The participant may become dizzy or vomit due to weightlessness." My sympathy turns into panic.

1104806072.content: I just need to complete some environmental simulation battle data.

1104806074.content: The test won't take long. You can do it.

1104806075.content: I am then practically pulverized in the anti-gravity chamber and not let out until dinner.

1104806076.content: Walking through the corridors, my stomach churning, I run into Zenkibo, who has just gotten back from shopping.

1104806077.content: This kind of prank is no fun at all! If I were there, I'd never have let her get away with it!

1104806078.content: And to think, I even bought her BunBun toffee and was going to apologize...

1104806079.content: Zenkibo puts her hands on her hips and pouts. Then she crouches down and rubs my back as I vomit uncontrollably.

1104806080.content: I go to sleep for one moment and this is what she does to you?! How could she?

1104806081.content: It wasn't a prank... Don't you want your key to be able to fire quickly and shoot lasers, just like a sniper rifle in a video game?

1104806082.content: As long as I can see you reach your full potential, then today's experiment will have been worth it... Ohhh...

1104806083.content: How could that be as important as playing with you?

1104806084.content: And besides... I'm the only one allowed to prank you!

1104806085.content: Sit in my room for a bit, #{nickname}#. I'll get you something to drink.

1104806086.content: Zenkibo puts on roller skates and dashes out of the room.

1104806087.content: Watching the little figure dart around, I suddenly find myself overcome by a sense of unreality.

1104806088.content: Zenkibo's a good girl, don't you think?

1104806089.content: In the corner of the "haunted house," the imaginary friend speaks to me from under its dust cover.

1104806090.content: I don't know if I'd call her "good"... but being a prankster doesn't mean she's a bad girl.

1104806091.content: Come to think of it, she isn't able to get anything, and she's always getting reprimanded by Shu.

1104806092.content: She does these things to "bring everyone closer together." Sometimes, I actually admire her.

1104806093.content: She knows what she's doing, by pulling all these pranks.

1104806094.content: Oh... So that's what you think of me, #{nickname}#?

1104806095.content: I don't know how Zenkibo came back so fast, but now she's standing outside her room, gawking at me.

1104806096.content: She walks forward, extends her hand, and hands me the drink. For once, there's no prank.

1104806097.content: Heehee. As my student, you've got a long way to go.

1104806098.content: For now, though, I'd say your shooting and pranking skills are passable.

1104806099.content: But only passable! You still need to keep at it.

1104806100.content: For example, you don't quite understand the motives behind some of my pranks!

1104806101.content: So! Shall I give you another lesson?

1104806104.content: Wait! Hands up and drop your weapon! Stay away...

1104806105.content: Hey, you're not supposed to do that, Admin...

1104806106.content: I hid your wallet because I wanted to go out and have fun with you.

1104806107.content: I stole your meal card because I wanted to have lunch with you.

1104806108.content: And I'll do the same tomorrow!

1104806109.content: So please don't stop forgiving me for my pranks!

108401005.content: A person in a beret prods my forehead and notes something in a hospital-like clipboard document.

108401006.content: What about her? Do you remember her?

108401007.content: A young-looking girl with braided pigtails darts over to me at this juncture as if waiting for her moment.

108401008.content: Surely you remember me, don't you? I'm Verthandi.

108401010.content: A few indistinct images float across my mind. Oh dear. I'm in terrible pain, aren't I? The agony forces me to cut my attempted recollection short.

108401011.content: That's alright. Don't force it! Just let it come naturally.

108401014.content: My well-wishers converse quietly with each other, just quietly enough to hide what they're saying.

108401015.content: The lady identifying herself as "Ver" is the only one who makes no attempt to conceal her feelings. She looks shocked and then increasingly positive about something. She's an open book.

108401016.content: I checked all the nearby universities. No record found.

108401018.content: Fantastic! And I thought the Division would...

108401019.content: Their conversation concluded, the lady in the beret puts her booklet-type thing down and smiles at me for what I think must be the first time.

108401020.content: Greetings! My name is Shu. I'm the current director of Division Nine at Aether Gazer.

108401022.content: Aether Gazer? Isn't that the largest comprehensive investment company in Ain Soph?

108401023.content: I recall a memory from somewhere of glancing through their corporate information booklet in a waiting room—

108401024.content: You were on the cover—one of the directors...

108401025.content: Good. That saves us some introductions.

108401026.content: The truth is we have another, very particular identity in addition to our "Aether Gazer" roles...

108401027.content: ...All the members of Division Nine are Modifiers.

108401028.content: Somehow I knew she was about to say "Modifier". The word struck a bell somewhere in my subconscious.

108401029.content: I remember. The lady "Verthandi" said something about Modifiers.

108401030.content: "You can relax now! We're Modifiers.. You're completely safe with us!"

108401031.content: Did she say something like that? I could have sworn it... What was I doing before I lost my memory?

108401032.content: Let me cut to the chase. Are you interested in joining us?

108401034.content: Those monsters that assaulted you are called "Visbanes". Human beings injured by Visbanes suffer irreparable, permanent harm.

108401035.content: As far as we can tell, you're the only one who has survived such serious corrosion... Yet here you are. Your body just healed itself..

108401036.content: I tried to feel my limbs for signs of injury. Hmm... I couldn't pinpoint a single thing wrong with me, let alone any sign of the monstrous attack "Shu" described.

108401037.content: But that doesn't mean you're in the clear. For whatever reason, the Visbane failed to damage your physical form. Yet we do believe they left something inside you.

108401038.content: They left some sort of mark in you. As long as it stays, wherever you go, the Visbanes will always be on the hunt for you. In other words, you've become the tastiest morsel they could ever hope to consume.

108401039.content: You mean I'm like the highlighted target to these monsters?

108401040.content: We tried to remove the mark, but failed. We don't exactly have any experience with it since, as I mentioned, no one's ever survived this before.

108401041.content: But there's not all bad news.  Keeping Modifiers around you will significantly dim the effect of this mark. Which means, you are safe if you stay around Aether Gazer's offices.

108401042.content: Is that why you're inviting me to join?

108401043.content: Not entirely... But if you don't mind, I'd like to fill you in on the details tomorrow—at our training facility.

108401044.content: My new companions are obviously concerned about complications from my "incident". I just wish I could see some evidence of it so all this could feel less weird.

108401045.content: The mysterious accident and subsequent operation has left a giant blank space in my mind where my memory ought to be. It's like I've just woken from a terribly long coma.

108401046.content: I take a few steps on my feet and this alone provokes more hurried footsteps from behind. I turned to see a lady in long pigtails rush over as if a nurse looking after an elderly patient.

108401047.content: So... you really don't remember me at all, do you?

108401049.content: It's alright. N-No... I should be the one thanking you!

108401050.content: The lady steps back a few paces to bow solemnly my direction, hands clasped in prayer-like formation.

108401051.content: Thank you for saving me yesterday! Thank you—even if you can't remember what happened!

108401053.content: By the way, you haven't eaten anything all day long, right? Let's grab a barbecue. On me!

108401055.content: The restaurant is in the same street as Aether Gazer's commercial offices.

108401056.content: The lady who introduced herself to me as "Verthandi" gazes upon the generous helping of meat with succulent longing as if the mere thought of eating it has wiped away all worries from her mind.

108401057.content: I, on the other hand, simply stare at the huge platter in front of me, knife and fork in hand, wandering where I should start.

108401058.content: The restaurant is not particularly noteworthy except for the hustle and bustle of patrons coming and going, the impressive commercial district outside, and its size and relative opulence.

108401059.content: It seems humanity's "frontline warriors" against the "Visbanes" dwell entirely within Division Nine's top floor office. The other two hundred odd floors and street are hardly implicated in this grand affair, and the offices themselves are rather pedestrian.

108401060.content: I can guess of no other reason than the Modifiers don't want draw attention...

108401061.content: So... do you not like the barbecue?

108401062.content: I pull my meandering thoughts back to the present. Verthandi has not slowed down one bit. She consumes her meat platter with gusto, blue eyes glancing with excited puzzlement in my direction.

108401063.content: I thought a meat platter is just the thing to improve anybody's mood...

108401066.content: I prefer meat with BBQ sauce. Can you get some for me?

108401068.content: Verthandi leaps from her seat and rushes over to the counter rather than wait for the staff to respond.

108401069.content: I set about plastering BBQ sauce onto my dish as she looks with uncertainty at my efforts to use my knife.

108401070.content: How do you find it now?

108401072.content: Really? Wonderful! I hope you're feeling better. You do feel better, don't you?

108401074.content: That's alright. All good things will come in time. Right now let's just focus on filling ourselves up with great food!

108401077.content: Ver... could you give me a brief rundown on exactly what happened yesterday?

108401078.content: I mean, that Visbane attack? And how you all saved me? And what was that you said before about me saving you?

108401080.content: I'm quite alright. Just curious, that's all.

108401082.content: Ver goes over the preceding day's events once more.

108401083.content: I was having a meal... with a lady?

108401084.content: Yeah. We saw it on the CCTV footage. You were chatting about a book in a restaurant. You looked really engaged. The name of the book was "The Black Goat".

108401085.content: And were you able to get in touch with her? Maybe she knows who I am.

108401086.content: We couldn't. We went through the restaurant's receipts and found out her name is "Kay", and you were pen pals meeting for the first time.

108401088.content: Yes. After the meal, she paid and then left. And you left afterward.

108401089.content: And then, you noticed I was being followed by a Visbane into an alleyway.

108401090.content: That Visbane was still in disguise as a normal human being, so you must have considered it some creepy stalker.

108401091.content: You... pushed me away when it launched the attack, and got dragged down to the Source Layer in my stead.

108401092.content: I'm so sorry for getting you involved in all this!

108401094.content: Oh, sorry. I just can't believe I would do something heroic like that.

108401095.content: You know, there's nothing quite like losing all your memories to make you wonder who you really are.

108401096.content: I was worried I might not be a nice person. But, from your story, it turns out I'm a bit of a hero—who rushes in to save strangers and likes reading.

108401098.content: Anyway, thanks for telling me this, and that wonderful meat platter... I'll definitely think about joining your organization.

108402001.content: An extraordinary sense of fatigue washes through my body, zapping my strength. It's a struggle even to open my eyelids, which appear weighed down—

108402002.content: In the next moment: pain. A sharp jolt from the back of my hands wakes me up.

108402003.content: The sharp electric current coils around my nervous system like a boa constrictor. I scream.

108402006.content: CAT??? How dare you!!! You shall call me "Lord Mimir".

108402007.content: The body of the strange creature is mostly concealed inside a white mechanical box which floats through the air as if suspended on invisible wires. Only the catlike head is visible plus a long blue tail wagging in my direction.

108402008.content: A faint glimmer of electricity sparkles from the hindmost part of the creature's tail, and seems most probably the cause of my unpleasant awakening.

108402009.content: Don't tell me you're sleeping in on your first day? Our recruits get sloppier every year, I tell you!

108402010.content: If you think Aether Gazer is your ticket to an easy life, you'd better think again!

108402012.content: Wait, Lord Mimir! #{nickname}# hasn't agreed to join us yet!

108402013.content: Verthandi is the next character to burst into the room. This time in her pajamas.

108402014.content: That's the current situation, so to speak.

108402015.content: (*Sound of clearing throat). Hasn't joined? I see. My mistake.

108402016.content: Ver, what is this cat... sorry, Lord Mimir. Who's Lord Mimir?

108402017.content: Lord Mimir is the super intelligent AI in charge of all Division Nine systems! All tasks, including missions, are directed at Lord Mimir's capable hands.

108402018.content: Okay... But why are you calling a cat as Lord Mimir?

108402019.content: Uh, that's how he wants to be addressed. Apparently, Heimdall made a mistake on his AI growth map somewhere. Anyway, not everyone calls him this. Like... Miss Shu.

108402020.content: Does he always come down this hard on new recruits? I'm a bit shocked.

108402021.content: Shh... Don't let Lord Mimir hear that. He's got a long memory.

108402022.content: Since you are both here, #{nickname}#, and Ver, I need you to do a test together.

108402024.content: Shu brings us to a rather large training room containing a screen full of all kinds of data.

108402025.content: Ver precedes to the center of the room while I and Mimir stand on another side separated by a transparent partition.

108402026.content: I see a chair outfitted with all kinds of strange devices, electric cables, ports, and whatnot. Regardless, it seems all I need to do to proceed is put on the red and blue arm bracelets.

108402027.content: A virtual projection of Mimir pops up as soon as I sit down along with reams of data from the central training facility screen—

108402028.content: Seems to be Ver's physical metrics, Divine Power data, scenario information, and Access Key compatibility metrics...

108402029.content: Shu, are you sure about connecting this guy to the Mimir System? Even Odin didn't last long.

108402030.content: It should be OK. Data suggests we have a good chance this time.

108402031.content: Am I the only one who finds nothing remarkable in this rookie?

108402032.content: What, uh, what am I meant to do exactly?

108402033.content: Ver is going to conduct a simulated training session. Notice the open comms channel with her? All you need to do is give your analysis on the battle to her.

108402034.content: I nod. Sounds easy enough. I just haven't the foggiest idea why they're asking someone like me to perform a battle analysis.

108402036.content: No sooner had the words left Shu's mouth when a host of fast-moving, expanding red dots fill the center of the training room.

108402037.content: The dots coagulate into the shape of a fearsome monster. The creature is obviously just a projected image, but still life-like enough for Ver to grip her weapon with nervous intensity.

108402039.content: Ver raises her blade and brings it down hard against the creature's equally sharp spear as the harsh sound of metal against metal resounds across the room.

108402040.content: Ver decides to change tactics and backs away after this initial strike leaves something to be desired. She launches another fearsome attack.

108402041.content: Ver changes her approach this time at the last second before landing a blow somehow to the creature's behind.

108402043.content: The blade leaves a brilliant red trail through the air as it slices clean into the beast's body.

108402044.content: Ver's success is short-lived. The blade bounces off what must presumably be the creature's very hard outer carapace, allowing it to seize the upper hand.

108402046.content: Ver just manages to fend off the incoming attack, but appears much the worse for wear. Her body is showing faint signs of exhaustion.

108402047.content: Strangely enough, more and more analytical data fills the virtual screen as the battle continues.

108402048.content: You make out patterns in the creature's actions, weak points in its attack and physical defenses. Either time or the dance between the two fighters has slowed down because you're beginning to get a sense from the data of what its next move will be.

108402050.content: Your tip allows Ver to easily sidestep the creature's next strike and provides her with a successful counter-blow.

108402051.content: Ah... color me surprised. You figured out "Zero Time" already.

108402052.content: The tables have turned in Ver's favor. She keeps dodging the creature's attacks and, with each dodge, drives her blade deeper and deeper into its back until at lasts it is pinned to the ground.

108402054.content: The sound of Shu's clapping draws Ver and I back from our simulated battle.

108402055.content: Amazing... So that's what it feels like? Fighting with the boost of the Mimir system.

108402056.content: So Ver mutters to herself half-consciously as she gazes on the creature penned to the ground, which now melts away into data.

108402057.content: And how do you feel? Physically?

108402058.content: I get up from my chair. Shu immediately comes over to inspect me like a doctor inspecting a patient. This ends with Shu waving her hand in front of my eyes a few times.

108402059.content: And you feel clear-minded? Like you're all there?

108402060.content: Don't worry, Shu. I was monitoring vitals. Nothing's wrong.

108402061.content: Where did you come from? An 80% plus synchronization rate, and you adapted effortlessly...

108402063.content: During the surgery, we tried synchronizing the rookie's body to the Mimir System. That was rather radical, but it worked, with no after-effects.

108402064.content: That's why you thought the rookie might be capable of the high synchronization during combat?

108402066.content: And look, Ver's final blow, there're signs of Modified Mode activation. Even she didn't realize it.

108402067.content: Ver never succeeded with that before... Does that mean the capability of the Mimir system is more than we realized, or is that the power of #{nickname}#?

108402068.content: An excited Ver waves in my direction from across the training room.

108402069.content: Shu smiles at us and stops talking. Enough explanations, perhaps.

108403001.content: Ver and I get lunch together. She keeps revisiting our "training session" during the conversation.

108403002.content: Ver... are you quite sure that's the case?

108403003.content: Not at all! The fighting is completely different under #{nickname}#'s support! I feel like I can even beat a much stronger enemy!

108403004.content: Ah. And Lord Mimir also helped a lot.

108403005.content: Glug, glug, glug... how humble of you to think of me.

108403008.content: I also keep ruminating about the day's events on return to my designated office.

108403009.content: I feel like I've been living in a dream since I lost my memories. Finding out about Modifiers, Visbanes, and that unreal training session has only intensified my expectation I'm about to wake up at any moment...

108403010.content: I'm not getting any sleep with these thoughts swirling around my head. I decide to drop into Shu's office for a visit.

108403011.content: Shu is waiting for me with two freshly-brewed cups of coffee as if expecting me.

108403012.content: Is foresight also a kind of Modifier power?

108403013.content: ...I was ready to drink the second cup myself.

108403014.content: Shu passes the other cup of coffee in my direction with a smile that simply exudes warmth. But she seems to be waiting for me to start the conversation.

108403015.content: I was thinking about this morning... I didn't realize I could actually do some help.

108403016.content: Do you feel burdened by the sense of responsibility?

108403017.content: I wanted to deny it outright, but thoughts of the vicious Visbane, its terrifying image, and glass partition sends a cold chill down my spine that I can't ignore.

108403018.content: You can join or not. It's totally up to you. Anyway, we'll still try to get rid of that Visbane mark in you. Until then you're free to stay here, and I highly recommend that you do.

108403019.content: Shu, can you tell me a bit more about the Visbanes and the Modifiers?

108403020.content: Such information should remain secret. Until you formally join, that is.

108403022.content: But since you are going to stay here for quite a while, I think it should be fine to reveal something to you. Okay, where shall we start...

108403023.content: You may find what I'm about to tell you rather shocking. It may completely subvert your understanding of the world. You'd better be prepared.

108403025.content: So... were you aware that what you call your "world" is actually a virtual world?

108403027.content: Even Shu's well-meaning attempt to cushion the blow didn't quite prepare me for that turn in the conversation -

108403029.content: We call this world "Gaea". But the truth is that this world is merely a digital copy, a recreation, of the world in which human beings originally lived.

108403031.content: The original physical world where humans lived is called "Planet Earth". Unfortunately, a weapon used during a war rendered it uninhabitable.

108403032.content: The surviving governments of humanity banded together in those last days. With the world's greatest scientists, they tried to figure out a way to keep the light of humanity and civilization going.

108403033.content: There was only one solution in the end, flawed though it was. In short, humanity had to relinquish its sovereignty over Earth and their physical bodies, and upload their consciousness into a supercomputer generating a virtual reality: "Gaea".

108403034.content: So what you're saying is everything in this world, everything I see or do—the entire world, including my own thoughts—is not even real? It's actually some kind of computer program?

108403035.content: Correct. The original Gaea world copied the 22nd century Earth, the one before that war. It took more than 2 centuries of development to reach what it is today.

108403036.content: Hold on a sec. So what you're saying is this is a virtual reality? So how can it still develop? Why not just give everyone what they want? Make everything perfect?

108403037.content: I'm afraid the Gaea system is not quite so simple... You need a lot of stability to create a world, even a virtual world, with orderly and well-regulated systems. Bias always means a risk of some sort of catastrophic failure.

108403038.content: This is also one of the reasons why the system's architects modeled Gaea after the human civilization of the 22nd century.

108403039.content: What do you mean by "catastrophic failure"?

108403040.content: Natural disasters, unintended phenomena, even... dangerous monsters.

108403042.content: Actually, we're still not quite sure about the exact reason why Visbanes appear. But it's no doubt that they are a result of some kind of critical system failure.

108403043.content: So now, #{nickname}#, I think you can understand why we Modifiers exist.

108403044.content: The original design of Gaea must have some ways to maintain the stability of the whole system, and since you;re the only power that stands againse the Visbanes..

108403045.content: So you are like some sort of self-check program run by the Gaea system?

108403047.content: Ver seems genuinely befuddled by my choice of language before refocusing her mind on a deadly swing that destroys an incoming Visbane.

108403048.content: Um... Maybe Shu said that once, I dunno.

108403049.content: I'm not really sure about that kind of thing.

108403051.content: I didn't even know that I was a Modifier a year ago.

108403052.content: Shu said not all Modifiers know who they are or what they're meant to do from the very beginning. Most are exactly like me. We had very ordinary lives before Aether Gazer.

108403053.content: When a Modifier awakens, everything changes. That's when they get the power to fight Visbanes, and the moment they realize their born purpose and identity. But it differs for everyone.

108403054.content: I've heard lots of stories about Modifiers getting their powers without understanding who they are.

108403055.content: You mean, these Modifiers don't even know they're Modifiers?

108403056.content: What about you, Ver? How'd you end up with Aether Gazer?

108403057.content: Me? I awakened when I was seventeen, like I was remembering something from a past life. I don't know how to describe it... I just suddenly realized that I am very different.

108403059.content: Yes, and Aether Gazer runs regular scans for unusual fluctuations in Divine Power with the Mimir System. They picked me up right away and sent an invitation to join.

108403060.content: Oh. But I told my parents I was going to college in the big city.

108403062.content: Adoptive parents, that is. Most Modifiers have regular childhoods on the "Surface Layer" of Gaea. I'd say I was really lucky to get the adoptive parents I got.

108403063.content: Your deep and meaningful conversation with Ver proves too much of a distraction from her combat training. She stops and flops onto the ground.

108403064.content: Phew... Maybe I'm a little over confident. There's no way I can handle so many Visbanes without the Mimir System's help.

108403065.content: Do you want to try again with Mimir System backing you up?

108403067.content: I start up the machine myself from memory just like in my first session. Mimir's projection floats in front of me as I strap on the bracelets.

108403069.content: Excuse me? You are the one synchronizing to the system without permission! I should be the one asking that!

108403070.content: So each time I synchronize to the system, you will also be connected...

108403071.content: What was the name of the system you're using? Read after me: the "MIMIR" System!

108403072.content: Please, Lord Mimir. Let's just help Ver do her training session.

108403073.content: Alright. But ask first next time! No one forces overtime on Mimir! No one! Glug, glug, glug...

108404003.content: Yes. I would like to formally join Aether Gazer.

108404004.content: You don't want to think about it some more? I don't want to rush you into this.

108404006.content: After another combat session in the training room.

108404009.content: So Modifiers... have to battle against these terrifying monsters?

108404010.content: I know you're winning, but what if you run into like an even more powerful Visbane? What happens if you lose? It'd be very bad, right?

108404011.content: Of course. We heal almost immediately from regular injuries, but Visbanes are also evolving. Some Modifiers have been pretty badly hurt from Visbane attacks.

108404012.content: One of Aether Gazer's objectives is to help all Modifiers work together. In this way, we can fight better against the Visbanes, and reduce these sorts of incidents.

108404013.content: So what is the reason you Modifiers fight such tough battles? Your destiny?

108404015.content: Ver scratches her head as if deep in thought.

108404016.content: Modifiers quickly develop a hypersensitive awareness of Visbanes in all their forms, and are hostile toward them. But I think it's a bit more complicated than that.

108404017.content: Just like not all Modifiers know they're Modifiers—even if they have super powers. Not all of them want to fight Visbanes all day.

108404018.content: Look at Division Nine, for example. Plenty of colleagues don't fight Visbanes at all.

108404019.content: So, what's your motive for fighting the Visbanes?

108404020.content: Mine? Well... Actually, when the invitation came, I... hesitated.

108404021.content: Because I honestly couldn't see how I was different from any average girl. I have parents who love me, friends I've grown up with... I just couldn't see myself getting involved in this stuff, you know, fighting Visbanes.

108404022.content: It's not like I knew I'd be good at it. We have colleagues who have lots of training and experience against the Visbanes. How can a newbie like me be of any help?

108404023.content: Then I realized all my doubts and misgivings were just me cheating myself... to close my eyes.

108404024.content: Knowing that someone, somewhere is being hurt by Visbanes, can I just pretend this is not happening? Just because it’s not happening by my side?

108404025.content: I can't just say, "someone else will handle it," you know? If everyone thought that, I have no doubt the Visbanes would win in the end.

108404026.content: I don't want to see people I care about getting hurt. I don't want to see my hometown, let's say, getting ruined by the Visbanes. But such things are happening to someone, somewhere—

108404027.content: ...And then Ver said she can't just sit back and watch these disasters play out without lifting a hand.

108404028.content: So you found what Ver said quite... impactful?

108404029.content: I don't have any memories left, pretty much. I guess in that sense I don't really have anyone to protect. But that's just skin-deep, you know. I agree with Ver... and so I'd like to support her.

108404031.content: The good news is you can operate the Mimir System without any side effects. But it's going to take a while to learn how to use it fully.

108404032.content: And it's not enough just to know your way around the Combat Assisting System. Cooperation on the battlefield also demands a really solid understanding of your team members.

108404033.content: Come to think of it, Division Nine has never recruited an ordinary human before. We'll certainly try our best, but you may find your duties a bit eclectic at times. Is that alright?

108404035.content: Your position will be part of the General Office. It's a position we've considered for a long time, but I think you're the first person truly right for the role. From now on you are officially Aether Gazer Division Nine's... Administrator!

108404037.content: You won't need to go into battle personally against Visbanes, but it's not going to be a walk in the park by any means. Are you sure?

108404039.content: Good answer. Then can you please sign here?

108404041.content: We are a real company after all. So we need to do things by the book. Also, don't forget that having an official job title makes a lot of things easier in society.

108404042.content: So engrossed am I in the text of the employment contract I manage to bump my head into something while leaving Shu's office.

108404044.content: Pfff! Last I heard you still hadn't joined us. Changed your mind, rookie?

108404046.content: Welcome aboard. Now, as your senior, I have the duty to fill you in on a few basic details about your role.

108404047.content: I trust that Shu has given you your ID card?

108404048.content: First of all, I need you to grab me some Coolant from Inventory. And remember: I need it done first thing every morning when you wake up.

108404049.content: Lord Mimir, are you saying you don't have access to get it yourself?

108404050.content: Fffff. I'm the only one in Aether Gazer without access to Coolant...

108404053.content: Mimir goes immediately from confidence to slinking behind me in fear at the sight of the approaching golden-haired lady.

108404054.content: What are you doing? Deceiving another newcomer? I thought you would've remembered our last chat.

108404055.content: I'm just guiding them. (Cough) But since you're here, Baldr, I'll leave the next onboarding steps to you.

108404058.content: Relieved actually. I'm happy to see how friendly and casual it is around here. I thought it would be more... strict.

108404059.content: That's sweet. Anyway, we aren't actually conducting business here.

108404060.content: Let me introduce myself, Administrator. I'm Baldr. Glad to meet you.

108404061.content: Shu's briefed me about you already. Now let me give you a run-through of the Division Nine and your daily job.

108404062.content: What does an Administrator do, exactly?

108404063.content: Quite a lot. Apart from assisting Modifiers in their combat missions, you'll also be in charge of members' rosters, dorm arrangements, training management, and some psychological consultings... Because at the end of the day, you need to get familiar with everyone to ensure the efficiency of your cooperation.

108404064.content: The detail of Division Nine should remain secret to ordinary humans. That's why only Shu and the Mimir MEOWs were doing these kind of stuff themselves. But Shu has her hands full with directing, so it's reasonable to distribute the work at this point.

108404065.content: And your duties do not, I repeat, do not, include helping Mimir get Coolant. He's a crafty one, I'll give him that, and he'll binge like nobody's business. Keep that in mind.

108404067.content: Here we are. Your new office... although, I would say it's probably more like your study room at this point.

108404068.content: You arrive to find a rather expansive office full of a ridiculous array of books and other literature in all shapes and sizes.

108404069.content: All colleagues have to pass the examinations first before joining actual combat. Yours will be in a month. By the way, are you any good at studying?

108404071.content: Oh right. Sorry. You lost your memories.

108404072.content: No problem. Shu and I will take turns mentoring you now and again.

108404073.content: #{nickname}#, I heard you agreed to join! What changed your mind?

108404074.content: Ver, remember to knock—even if you're excited.

108404077.content: Because I want to save the world.

108404079.content: Just kidding. It just feels so weird... the thought of just hanging around here and protected by you. I really do want to help however I can.

108404082.content: I can see Ver wants to protect the world... And I want to help you.

108404083.content: I see, #{nickname}#—oh wait, I need to call you Administrator now! Welcome on board, Administrator! Let's save the world!

108404084.content: Don't you have quite a lot on your plate today, Ver? I suggest getting back to your training. Our new Administrator has quite a lot of books to get through.

108404085.content: Hold on a moment... I'll see you tonight, Administrator.

108404089.content: Baldr closes the door and I am left alone in my large office to study this mountainous pile of reading material.

108404090.content: "AGI Mecha Operations Manual", "A Guide to the Mimir System", history, finance, corporate management, Division Nine protocols... isn't this a bit too much?

108404091.content: I open a rather scholarly-looking textbook at random and am surprised to find the content is actually not quite as dry as I'd feared.

108404092.content: It looks like I didn't lose any of my intelligence or reading abilities when I lost my memory. What does that mean? Was I a very smart person who read a lot?

108404093.content: Knowledge concealed somewhere within came pouring out as I buried myself in the not too unfamiliar texts, as if clearing away dust from my subconscious. It was night before I realized it, and then I soon found myself asleep in the same manner.

108404096.content: Wakey-wakey! Please don't tell me you've decided to sleep in on your first day on the job.

108404097.content: Get yourself to Cafeteria No.2. Everyone's waiting.

108404098.content: Waiting for me? Did I miss any notes?

108404099.content: I arrive at the cafeteria nursing a sense of confusion—

108404103.content: Streamers float down beside me with a bang as I stare, dumbfounded, at my assembled colleagues clapping loudly. I also notice a banner "Aether Gazer Welcome Party for Our New Administrator" prominently displayed near the ceiling.

108404105.content: The new recruit seems a bit out of it. Think they're going to be much fun?

108404106.content: I got Micoco to do the catering as usual. I hope it's alright for you...

108404107.content: Don't just stand there! Come over!

108404108.content: A good catch for Aether Gazer! But not many people here know you. Would you like to introduce yourself?

108404109.content: Oh... hello everyone. I'm #{nickname}#. I, uh, just joined. Today is my first day on the job. I'm really happy to be working alongside all of you and I'll do my very best...

108404110.content: Like you're reading from a speech! Boring!

108404111.content: Just say whatever comes into your head. Relax.

108404115.content: I don't actually know who I am, what I've been through in life up until the accident. I'm also not really sure what the future has in store.

108404116.content: I have to say life has been a bit nerve-wracking until a few days ago. I've been worried about whether people will accept me, and even what it would mean for me if I suddenly did recover my memories...

108404118.content: But I can happily say I don't feel that way anymore.

108404119.content: I still can't remember anything, but I feel like this organization and my new colleagues have good hearts. I find that very reassuring, and it's motivating me to do my best.

108404120.content: I'm really very happy... to be able to join Aether Gazer and work alongside you all.

108404123.content: And w-we're also very happy to work with you...

108404125.content: Administrator, there'll be moments when you'll find your work difficult, perhaps more difficult than even you or I had imagined. But whatever happens...

108404126.content: Whatever happens, we and Aether Gazer will always count you as our invaluable colleague, partner, and support!

108404128.content: It's alright. That's what I was going to say.

108404129.content: Hehheh... Then what are we waiting for—let's party!

62101001.content: Is this it? This world seems no different from the real one.

62101002.content: Ahh... It's been so long since I've been free of my shackles. I don't care if this is a dream. This feels so good!

62101003.content: (The dreamscape seems more real than I expected. Maybe because we are both here and it can build on Ausar's memories as well as my own?)

62101004.content: Hey, great job with the recreation of that crappy old factory. I suppose that means those annoying AGI Mechas and guards will be turning up soon?

62101005.content: Spealght's security arrangements don't seem to have changed from the last time. Come with me, Ausar, we have to infiltrate the lower levels.

62101006.content: Infiltrate? Hehe... That's not what I intend to do at all.

62101008.content: Like I've said, I will prove I can raze this place without even breaking a sweat. Why would I have to sneak around like you weaklings?

62101009.content: Well, the stage is set. And all that remains is for me to give my audience the show they want to see. You? Just back off, open your eyes, and watch and learn!

62102001.content: Hey! Stop there! Who the heck are you, and how did you get in here?

62102002.content: Ausar, those guards are armed with submachine guns and alloy blades. We can...

62102003.content: Just get out of my way, minions. You aren't worth my time.

62103001.content:
Eliminate intruders—!
Glory to Spealght Industries!

62103003.content: Ah... I remember now. You weaklings couldn't defeat all the AGI Mechas back then, could you? And they chased you down like you were a pack of stray dogs...

62103004.content: The alarms are going to bring more AGI Mechas here soon. But if we can get to where the signal can't reach—

62103005.content: Alright, I know what I'm going to do. I am going to turn each and every one of these AGI Mechas into scrap metal!

62103006.content: (Somehow, I knew she was going to say that.)
