62104001.content: E-Error... Error… Operations failed… Operations failed…

62104002.content: Hahahahaha! You see that? They can't stop me, no matter how many of those gewgaws they send!

62104004.content: Huh? You're even more useless than I thought. I mean, you can't even keep up...

62104005.content: How am I supposed to keep up with someone who's literally flying...

62104006.content: Fine. I'll wait for you. For now.

62104007.content: Oh, I thought you would just leave me behind.

62104008.content: Ha! That's actually an excellent idea, now that I think about it.

62105001.content: Ausar, you... you truly are powerful.

62105002.content: Pfff. What do you hope to gain with such lavish and sudden praise?

62105003.content: Nothing. I was just being honest.

62105004.content: Flatter me as you will. Weaklings like you will never be fit to be my companion.

62105005.content: That said... it is understandable you will wish to follow me, now that you have witnessed my strength. Haha... So, for now, I will allow you to feast your eyes upon my glory.

62106001.content: Ausar, I do have a question though. Are you able to access Osiris' memories, even when you are not in control of the body?

62106002.content: Well, yes and no... I can watch her memories like I'm watching a movie. But sometimes the reel gets stuck. Or I get bored and my attention wanders...

62106003.content: And then I look up again when your antics get too much.

62106004.content: Umm... Osiris doesn't seem to have any of your memories though...

62106005.content: I've never prevented her from watching mine. You should go talk to her. Maybe she's the one who is preventing herself from watching?

62107003.content: Well, I enjoyed letting off some steam. But I'm getting a little tired of this...

62107004.content: Ugh... I thought you were excited to be free at last?

62107005.content: That's the thing about excitement. It comes quick and it goes quick. And fighting those opponents was child's play... Ugh, forget about it. And keep up, please?

62108001.content: Ausar, do you know what Osiris used to be like? Has her personality always been like this?

62108002.content: You say that you're her companion, and yet you're asking me this?

62108003.content: Um... Well, I joined Aether Gazer late. You've known her longer than me.

62108004.content: Hmm, that's true. Yeah, she has always been like that, putting the needs of others before her own, constantly worrying that someone else may be ever so slightly unhappy. She never knows how to say no.

62108005.content: She's not changed ever since she was taken in by that inconsequential organization of yours. She seems to think she's cared for, looked after, but all she's really doing is taking orders from a bunch of weaklings.

62109002.content: I'm shoved violently forward, and I fall face down to the ground. By the time I come back to my senses, there is a shattered AGI Mecha lying where I had stood a moment earlier.

62109004.content: Here's a question for you: What happens if you die here?

62109005.content: Any injuries suffered here don't affect our real body. But the deeper we are in a dreamscape, the stronger the link between our consciousness and the memories formed here. Sever that link too suddenly, and we may fall into a coma.

62109006.content: So, if you die here, there will be no one to witness me flatten this entire place?

62109007.content: Ah, forget it. This is pretty much a farce, anyway. Keeping you alive will add to the challenge.

62109008.content: Carrying a weakling like you, completing my mission, and keeping you from harm... Heh, this makes things more interesting.

62201002.content: What did you people do to make Osiris like you all so much? How did you fool her into being so obedient to you?

62201003.content: We didn't fool her... We were training buddies. We looked out for each other and became partners along the way.

62201004.content: (Pfft. I've spent more time with her than any of you have...)

62201006.content: Nothing. We're below that crappy factory now. Watch how I demolish this place!

62202001.content: U-Ugh... What's going on? My head suddenly hurts like crazy!

62202002.content: It's probably a side effect of spending so much time in a dreamscape. Nobody's used the device for this long before...

62202003.content: But you seem perfectly alright to me!

62202005.content: Don't let me find out that you've tricked me...

62202006.content: We should probably leave if this is too much for you?

62202007.content: Pfft! A little pain... is nothing to me...

62203001.content: Hahaha! That's more like it. Alright, time for me to tear all of you to pieces!

62203002.content: Wave after wave of military AGI Mechas are awakened and ordered to attack us. They march on us in lines, like the infantrymen of old, and many are cut down by Ausar's sword wings before they can even raise their weapons.

62203003.content: An exhilarated Ausar brandishes her arms, her sword wings dealing death. The army that once left us completely devoid of hope is completely helpless in the face of her utter savagery.

62203004.content: All units advance on the targets. Capture the intruders!

62203005.content: Come then! Let me see how much clunking junk you have for me to smash!

62203006.content: And don't worry, it'll be your turn soon. We weren't properly introduced the last time we met, in the Source Layer.

62203008.content: (Ausar is becoming unstable. I need to find Osiris quickly.)

62203009.content: I pull the knife that is on my waist and use it to slash my palm. Although I am in a dreamscape, the pain makes me wince nevertheless.

62204002.content: Novich said that intruders wouldn't get here this quickly. Are you a Modifier!?

62204003.content: Zip it. All you need to know is that I'm here to end this!

62204004.content: Ausar, I'll give you a hand with Mimir System!

62204005.content: Get lost! Just sit back and enjoy the show!

62204006.content: So, it's all over. You see that, Osiris? Can you and your weakling friends match my power?

61101001.content: Welcome. As you can see, this is now a hot spring hotel.

61101002.content: A fine mansion once belonged to a great family. And then it all burned down.

61101003.content:
Me? I'm a nobody, an unknown painter.
If you're interested, I invite you to look at the paintings on the wall. These are some of my better works.

61102001.content:
While you are welcome to look, whatever you do, do not touch... Ah. Too late, I see.
Well, brace yourself then, hehe...

61103001.content: I'm just a strange bird that sings nursery rhymes...

61104001.content: Travelers, my mission is to continue singing this tune.

61203001.content: I was the one who killed her... killed them.

61301001.content: They remind me of the person I used to be. I can't let such a tragedy happen again.

61302001.content: All I wanted to do was help mankind... Though in the end, I couldn't even save the humans I wanted to protect most.

61303001.content: But still, I won't give up.

61402001.content: The people know me as the "Strange Bird."

61403001.content: This sword nearly hurt a good person once. Now it exists only to protect her.

61404001.content: Please, put the fire out. I'm begging you...

61501001.content: I never thought that old arrangement would come back to haunt me...

61502001.content:
Hehe... Has your curiosity been sated?
Or do you regret touching the paintings?

61503001.content: I've fulfilled my end of the deal. Why haven't you?

61504001.content:
Why would I buy this place to build a hotel?
Hehe... To collect lost children and send them home. That's all.

603101001.content: Miss Hel, this wooden sign is pretty much wrecked. I doubt it will tell us anything.

603102002.content: I follow Hel's gaze. Once again, the black butterfly has appeared.

603102003.content: Is it waiting for us? Hey! Wait!

603102004.content: The black butterfly disappears into the night, leaving only a faint glimmer to guide us onwards.

603103001.content: Dammit, I don't think we can go any further.

603103002.content: Well, if you need an obstacle removed, I'm here...

603103003.content: I'll try to moderate the power output, Miss Hel. But please do watch out for the line of fire.

603104002.content: Understood, Miss Hel. It's an honor to fight alongside you.

603104003.content: Hel, who is suddenly in combat mode, pulls me down and looks around warily.

603104004.content: Before long, my bewilderment is dispelled by the sight of Visbanes emerging from the fog.

603105002.content: Yes, Miss Hel, the device seems capable of directing energy beams around corners and the like.

603105003.content: If we use it wisely, maybe we can hit targets we can't fire at directly.

606101002.content: "Go to sleep... If you go to sleep, the pain will disappear..."

606101003.content: "There are no weightless stones in dreams, only soft pillows..."

606102002.content: "Yikes! Alright, we're okay now. Thank goodness I was quick enough... Darn, why are there stones flying this way again?!"

606103001.content: "Piping hot steamed buns! Buns fresh from the steamer!"

606103002.content: "Get in line. There's enough for everyone!"

606201001.content: "Hey, are you out of ideas? See that Taiji pattern on the ground? Just push the Cloudsong Ore over there! Come, let's do this together... One, two..."

606201002.content: "Hmm? I guess you're having a good time? Never mind, that's not a bad thing... Just remember to be careful!"

606202001.content: "Just where did she go? I can't find her no matter where I look."

606202002.content: "But she won't give up on Xu Heng no matter what... right?"

606203001.content: "I'm guessing you're hungry now? The Cloudsong Ore in this area has pretty much been stabilized. Thank you for your hard work. Come sit down and have some steamed buns!"

606203002.content: "Hehe, my lunch box keeps the heat in, so you can have hot steamed buns from me anytime."

606301001.content: "I didn't realize that silly cat statue was so powerful!"

606301002.content: "Make good use of it! It may even turn things around... You never know."

606302001.content: "Slow down, there's more here. Don't choke on the buns. Here, have some sweet porridge, I made it myself."

606302002.content: "Hmm? How is it that I have an unending supply of buns and porridge? Hehe, quite the curious one, aren't you?"

606303001.content: "You want to know why I don't sleep...? It's because even if I do fall asleep, I can't have dreams of my own anyway."

606303002.content: "Aren't these feathers beautiful...? But not one of them belongs to me."

606401001.content: "Ha! Mmm, yummy... Hehe, watching everyone eat with such gusto has made me hungry too."

606401002.content: "As expected, more steamed buns... (Burps) Now, where were we? My secret? Let me tell you!"

606402001.content: "Hmm, not bad. You can actually keep up with me."

606402002.content: "Hey, hey, hey! What is this monkey business now?"

606402003.content: "Well, at least we also saved several people along the way. For now, just keep doing good. Let the future take care of itself."

606403002.content: "Shh, the kid just fell asleep. She's worked hard enough. Let's let her rest."

606501001.content: "Even if we were to use my feathers, there'd still be more and more children having nightmares..."

606501002.content: "This is not a good sign... Are you ready for the final outcome?"

606502001.content: "Huh. Interesting. Your skills are on par with mine."

606502002.content: "Ugh, no I can't... I have to take a nap now. I'll have to count on you to keep going now..."

606503001.content: "Hmm... Actually, my lunch box is linked to another dimension, where there is an endless stream of steamed buns... Do you believe me?"

606503002.content: "I can't believe you nodded... But it is important to trust others!"

606503003.content: "So, as long as we have steamed buns, it won't be the end of the world... At least that's my motto! Why don't you try believing in it too?"

606104001.content: Is that Cloudsong Ore? The one you can only find in Xu Heng? I don't know why, but I really want to push it and see what happens, heh.

606105001.content: See that gorgeous divine statue? If the road ahead is blocked, just go and say a prayer at that statue. Remember to give it your complete devotion!

606106001.content: Tsk, are we fighting again? What a pain. It'd be really great if we could find a way to eliminate all those Visbanes without fighting...

606106002.content: Do you think we ever will?

606106003.content: Hmph, just you wait and see! Don't you underestimate your Lord Mimir!

606107001.content: Looks like as long as the stones are pushed onto the floor tiles with the mysterious icon, the door will open... (Clears throat) Of course, I figured that out a long time ago!

606108001.content: Wow, look at the pit! It's filled with Cloudsong Ore!

606108002.content: Mmhmm. Now we can use this road again.

606109001.content: Two stones, but only one tile with the mysterious pattern... Mmm. This is quite the puzzle.

606110001.content: Hehe, I did well, didn't I?

606110002.content: You say that when we solve puzzles too? Ver, can't you think of a few more victory lines?

606111001.content: Well, it would be nice if I could fly over there... But if I can push the Cloudsong Ore here...

606204001.content: Looks like some of the Cloudsong Ore pieces won't stop once you push them out...

606204002.content: That's because they are weightless. To change the gravity coefficient of those pieces, try pushing them onto the grids with the Taiji icon on them.

606205001.content: Ver, there's something I forgot to tell you...

606205003.content: I got so caught up watching you that it slipped my mind... All you need to do is use the weightless pieces of Cloudsong Ore to smash the Turbulence Rift...

606206002.content: Ehehe, I know this one. This is the Taiji icon. Ver, try pushing a piece of Cloudsong Ore onto the icon.

606207001.content: Wow, the Cloudsong Ore just floated over...

606207002.content: Mmhmm. Looks like you must first change the gravity state of the ore if you want to fill the pit with it.

606208003.content: Hang on, what kind of a move is that...?

606208004.content: Ehehehe... I learned that from little Jinwu...

606304001.content: Hmm, what am I going to do with all this Cloudsong Ore...

606304002.content: No time for that now! Let's get rid of the Visbanes first!

606504001.content: Hmm... How can I get the Cloudsong Ore to that glimmering tile...?

606504002.content: See that cool, handsome statue over there? Try walking a few times around it. With complete devotion, of course!

606505001.content: We're more or less done with the data recovery, and have plenty of Shifted Stars in the bag, too. (Burps) What? We don't have enough?!

606505002.content: Don't ask me, that's what #{nickname}# said...

606505003.content: The next area will be even more challenging, and there won't be any Shifted Stars there. It's up to you whether you want to take it on.

651101001.content: You're finally here! How does it feel to be back home?

651101002.content: Lord Mimir! I didn't think you'd be assisting us.

651101003.content: But of course. This is your first cleanup. While you were at the headquarters, I analyzed CORG's Large Visbane Incident Cleanup guidelines. There are a few points from it that I want to emphasize.

651101004.content: Your task is to collect items and evidence that are connected to the Visbanes. As the executive team, you should focus on searching the safe zones and <color=#FF9500>establishing Comms Stations</color>, as many as are needed for their signals to cover the entire area.

651101005.content: After you set up the stations, HQ will escort a support unit to the area, who will assist you in exploring. The support unit will analyze unknown areas from the Comms Stations, which will directly help your exploration progress.

651101006.content: Since the last Visbane incident, the factory has been locked down. We don't know how much of it has been destroyed, since the loss of power has limited our visibility. There are also some AGI Mechas that haven't been recovered yet, so watch your <color=#FF9500>Stamina</color> while you're in there.

651101008.content: Nope. Thanks for the detailed explanation—I expected nothing less!

651101009.content: Of course. During your task, I'll upload maps for the areas you've already explored. Keep an eye on them and note where you are so that you don't get lost.

651102001.content: CORG has sent you the coordinates of the safe zones. It's time to go set up the <color=#FF9500>Comms Stations</color>.

651103001.content: Oh, and take those things over there with you.

651103002.content: They're devices made by Spealght, but they don't quite match the blueprints from CORG...

651103003.content: Maybe it's like the Admin said—they're devices used by Spealght internally?

651103004.content: Possibly. You should <color=#FF9500>collect</color> all of the ones you find. I don't know what they're used for, but I'm sure you'll figure it out when the time is right. They'll help you whether you turn them in or use them yourself.

651103005.content: The <color=#FF9500>event</color> happened just up ahead. Go on, take the devices.

651104002.content: There's a hole over here. Was it created by the Visbanes?

651104003.content: Be careful—this cleanup will be harder than you think. You just traveled through the factory's waste <color=#FF9500>Recycling Pipeline</color>. It's supposed to be closed, but it might have opened up due to the power issues. The other entryways might be the same way.

651104004.content: That's the tunnel's control panel over there. You can close the tunnel and move on, but you'll need an access card.

651104005.content: Um... I don't think we have one.

651104006.content: I've reported that to HQ. The support unit will have a solution when it arrives. For now, just keep going.

651105001.content: You're doing pretty well for a newbie. You've reached the target coordinates, so you can <color=#FF9500>set up the Comms Station</color>.

651106001.content: Lil' Osi! Did you run into any trouble on your way here?

651106002.content: The area here is safe, thanks to your efforts. Let me know if you need anything!

651106003.content: That's right, Ver—the support unit has reached the station. Why don't you rest and <color=#FF9500>replenish your supplies</color> before continuing on?

651106004.content: Don't forget that, once you've set up the comms stations, they'll send coordinates to everyone's terminals. Once the rest of the executive team arrives, we can <color=#FF9500>ask them</color> for other <color=#FF9500>safe zone coordinates</color>. That's another <color=#FF9500>important function</color> of comms stations.

651106005.content: Once you're done resting, you should get ready to move on.

651107001.content: The factory's <color=#FF9500>Elevator</color> is up ahead—it'll take us to the upper level. But just like that tunnel, it looks like we'll need a card and energy.

651107002.content: Admin, before I left headquarters, the researchers gave me an access card for the <color=#FF9500>Elevator</color>.

651107003.content: Excellent! Now we just have to connect the <color=#FF9500>Elevator</color> to the power sources we found on our way here.

651107004.content: HQ seems to be aware that the situation is worsening here, and they're making us some tools. When more combat personnel arrive, you'll have <color=#FF9500>more options for solving the problems</color>.

651107005.content: Admin! The <color=#FF9500>Elevator</color> is ready. Let's go search upstairs!

651108001.content: How do you like the area up here? The <color=#FF9500>view is much better</color>, isn't it?

651108002.content: In the future, you can look at lower areas from places like this, then use the Elevator to take care of any issues you find. That way, you'll be able to gather evidence more efficiently.

651109001.content: Helping these people is so dull. Nothing's been happening.

651109002.content: The CORG contact is here, and the analyzer signals have covered the entire area. You can move on to the <color=#FF9500>next zone</color>.

651109003.content: Already? We just left CORG. There must be more to find in this zone. <color=#FF9500>Keep looking around!</color> I'll make sure you find something!

651110001.content: Zenkibo, CORG said they gave you a modding tool. It's supposed to be able to <color=#FF9500>reset the data</color> of the devices we find, then let you change their function. Is that right?

651110002.content: Yep! Get your raw materials ready, and I'll make something out of them!

651110004.content: This isn't a tool for making mischief. As soon as I modify it, you'll be able to use it.

651110005.content: But I think CORG said it was just a prototype. There's a <color=#FF9500>limit to how many times it can be used</color> before we have to return to a Comms Station and have a tech <color=#FF9500>see to it</color>.

651110006.content: But don't worry—I understand this thing through and through, and I'll have plenty of opportunity to use it!

651111001.content: CORG headquarters just sent a message. There's an abnormal signal nearby that needs to be investigated. The coordinates have been sent to your terminals.

651111002.content: Before you <color=#FF9500>set up a Comms Station</color>, HQ will evaluate the safety of the surrounding area. But the signal in the region is spotty, so we'll need you to <color=#FF9500>inspect space yourself</color>.

651111003.content: It'll be dangerous, Admin, but we need to secure the area for the support team!

651112001.content: Careful! I detect strong Bane Energy approaching from up ahead. Shall we engage, Admin?

651112002.content: If we defeat them, we'll be able to proceed through this passage. But from the fluctuations I'm seeing, these aren't small Visbanes. We'd be better off avoiding them and collecting intel first.

651112003.content: But I'm always ready for a fight. I think we should let the Administrator decide.

651201001.content: So what's the problem over here? It's not enemies? Darn it, I was hoping for a little warm-up!

651201002.content: If anything gets in your way, just leave it to me!

651202002.content: I know I didn't help in the last battle, but I can handle all of them from here on out.

651203001.content: HQ received the information from you. Thanks for all your hard work.

651203002.content: What's next, Admin? I'm yours to command.

651301001.content: it's been a perfect mission so far. That's why you're in charge, Admin.

651301002.content: Based on what we know, this is the most dangerous area. Thank you for investigating the signal.

651301003.content: Let's keep following the plan—carefully, now.

651302001.content: Our data indicates that this area is dangerous. We might face a lot more battles like the one we just had. The passages will start branching more, too...

651302002.content: I-I'll fight as best as I can! I'll analyze our intel, too!

651302003.content: I just want to be of use to you...

651303001.content: Thank you for bringing back this important information.

651303002.content: Future explorations may be more dangerous. There are still many berserk AGI Mechas that haven't been recovered from the underground labs yet.

651303003.content: But don't worry about it too much. Just let the sun light your path.

651304001.content: How are the assistive tools? I'm going to follow along and recover data.

651304002.content: By the way... I heard that you've collected some interesting devices. I'd like to see them. They might be able to help me in my research...

651401001.content: Thank you for your hard work. From the analysis of the data obtained from the last outing, we now know where the key offices of the Spealght Factory are.

651401002.content: Heh, we have you to thank too, Lord Mimir, for your analysis of the data. Is this mission similar to the previous one?

651401003.content: That's right. Like the last time, you are to look for safe zones in which to <color=#FF9500>establish Comms Stations</color>. Your objective is to set up as many stations as needed to create complete signal coverage of the area.

651401004.content: However, I must remind you to <color=#FF9500>keep a close eye on your stamina</color> during the mission. This is because you have to explore the area yourself due to poor visibility in this area. You can thank the power outage for that.

651401005.content: Also, keep an eye out for any devices you may come across along the way, and respond to various occurrences in a timely manner, so that you can also collect resources while carrying out the mission.

651401006.content: If you don't have any questions, it's time to start moving!

651402001.content: WHOA! That was close. It's so slippery in here. Thank goodness there's this wall here to stop me.

651402002.content: Hmm. Let me take a look... This seems to be a low-friction material that Spealght developed to improve transportation efficiency. However, in the end they halted the program due to poor market response. Looks like they've stockpiled all the material here.

651402003.content: Hey, rookie, just <color=#FF9500>watch out</color> while you explore this area. Who knows, you might come across other discontinued materials or devices. Observe your surroundings closely, and make use of these resources to find a more convenient route.

651403001.content: Hold on, rookie. You seem to have walked into a dead end.

651403002.content: I don't see any exits around us. Let's <color=#FF9500>go back the way we came</color> then.

651404001.content: We've stopped... finally. But are we?

651404002.content: It's another dead end... Wait a minute, I just received a message.

651405001.content: Another team nearby has managed to establish a Comms Stations. We can <color=#FF9500>teleport</color> to a location close to it.

651405002.content: Then let's get out of here now.

651406001.content: Turns out that there's a hidden shortcut here that can <color=#FF9500>teleport</color> us to the vicinity of the comms station. Remind me to thank the team that found it later.

651406002.content: The next time we're lost, we can <color=#FF9500>teleport</color> to get to the target communications station.

651406003.content: At the station, you can talk to other folks and <color=#FF9500>ask around</color> for the location of the next station.

651407001.content: I've already marked the coordinates of the location you just learned about on your terminal. Head there to <color=#FF9500>set up the next station</color>.

651408001.content: The team on-site just now has given us access to a Master Console nearby. We can use the <color=#FF9500>Master Console</color> to operate various facilities around us. Give it a try.

651409001.content: Wow, cool! We've flipped around the operating status of all the facilities in the vicinity!

651409002.content: You'll <color=#FF9500>be able to use</color> all devices once access has been <color=#FF9500>granted</color>. The team that was previously on-site has obtained the access card, and the Command Room should have finished studying it by now. We should be getting a copy once we set up the next station.

651409003.content: Keep heading towards the location of the next Comms Station.

651410001.content: The Command Room just sent a message saying that there's an important database near our current location. Let's first unlock the secretary AGI Mecha over there, then get to the <color=#FF9500>marked location</color>.

651411001.content: Escort mission successfully completed. But of course, this kind of mission is a cakewalk for my Mjölnir and I.

651411002.content: Oh, by the way, CORG told me to give you this <color=#FF9500>Master Console</color> access card. This allows you to use <color=#FF9500>Master Consoles</color> form now on.

651411003.content: Leave the fighting to me from now on, Admin. You're in charge of planning the route.

651412001.content: Escort mission completed... Oof! I finally got a chance to work with you, Admin!

651412002.content: I can take care of the device modes... I'll do that by using the device modification tool from the Command Room!

651413001.content: Rookie, you can save yourself a lot of work by <color=#FF9500>asking around</color> where you should set up your next station before you move on. Of course, you can also choose to explore every square inch instead, but just don't forget your main task, which is the comms station.

651414001.content: Rookie, once you're done collecting the items in this area, don't forget to use the <color=#FF9500>Master Console</color> to travel to the next location. Finish your main mission as soon as possible.

651501001.content: We've arrived at a more central zone, rookie. The Command Room knows very little about this area, so be sure to proceed carefully.

651502001.content: I can't believe my mission is to escort you weaklings. You people had better stay on your toes.

651502002.content: Forget it. Besides, I did promise her to help you people complete the mission... I'll take care of <color=#FF9500>the platform</color> and the fighting. Now let's get moving!

651503001.content: Thank you for your hard work. Based on the data collected, there are several AGI Mechas on high alert in this area, so don't let down your guard.

651503002.content: Just like the last time, I'll grant you access to <color=#FF9500>the thrusters</color>. You can keep going now.

651504001.content: I can't believe that I've been asked again to explore a dangerous area. I suppose this means that everyone thinks highly of me?

651504002.content: This is the second time I'm on a mission like this. I... will do better than I did the last time.

651601001.content: According to the message from the Command Room, this should be the last area we have to clear. It seems to be a pretty big area, so pace yourself and take your rest first before you continue.

651602001.content: Admin, the escort mission is complete. I'm now back with my squad.

651602002.content: I'll take care of the <color=#FF9500>recycling pipeline</color> ahead of us like the last time. You just keep moving.

651603001.content: I'm finally done escorting these sheep. Let's go find some place fun, Admin!

651603002.content: Of course, give me any equipment that needs repairing. I promise to make them even more fun!

651604001.content: Of course main characters like me always appear at the most critical junctures.

651604002.content: Don't worry, your dazzling sun will continue to light the way forward for you, as always.

651605001.content: The Command Room confirms receipt of your report. Thank you for moving along so quickly in your mission.

651605002.content: I've checked the power charging equipment you just received, and it's in normal condition. Bring it back to me to charge when it's low on power. Now keep going with your mission.

651606001.content: CORG just sent a message saying that there is now complete signal coverage of the area from the Comms Stations. Although this mission has been more challenging than the last, you've managed to complete it nevertheless. Thank you for your hard work!

103701002.content: The hallway outside the Intelligence Office looks just like any other in Division Nine. Without the sign outside, I'm not sure I would have even found it.

103701003.content: This is my first visit to the Intelligence Office since joining Aether Gazer, since typically Baldr and Hodur would deliver combat intel to the Command Room and the General Office instead.

103701004.content: While my visit isn't official business, it does concern the two sisters...

103701006.content: So... While I was away, Hodur must have spent quite a bit of time on training, apart from looking after me and taking care of the works of the Intelligence Office.

103701007.content: I know she's capable of handling the paperwork. But I do feel guilty for dumping so much on her shoulders.

103701009.content: I'm not blaming you, Admin. Even if you had offered to help, Hodur would have said no.

103701010.content: I know she doesn't look it, but she can be a real stubborn badger sometimes.

103701011.content: By the way, Admin, would you do me a favor? You see, at the moment—Ouch! It still hurts.

103701012.content: Baldr tries to sit up in bed, but her injuries stop her.

103701013.content: Despite that, she keeps smiling. She makes it look like all she's done is stubbed her toe and doesn't know whether to laugh at her clumsiness or cry at the pain.

103701014.content: I guess that's Baldr's usual sunny disposition shining through?

103701016.content: I'm still worried about Hodur, though. The girl can handle a lot, but sometimes she pushes herself too hard.

103701017.content: And there's no need for her to, really, since there are certain things only Hodur can do. I've told her about this over and over, but she still doesn't get it.

103701018.content: So, I was hoping you could spend some time at the Intelligence Office, Admin. You know, to give her a hand.

103701019.content: Didn't you just say that Hodur would refuse my help anyway?

103701020.content: Of course. So, you'll have to make her an offer she can't refuse.

103701021.content: And how would I do that...?

103701022.content: Say you'd buy her dinner if she says yes...? Something like that?

103701023.content: That sounds like an offer Ver can't refuse, not Hodur.

103701024.content: Admin, aren't you supposed to be an expert in the art of persuasion?

103701025.content: Solving problems, relieving worries, putting smiles on everyone's faces, both in and out of work. Isn't that what you're best at, Admin?

103701026.content: That's true, but you just brought up some bad memories of mine...

103701027.content: Well, I'm counting on you, Admin. Oh, and take these with you.

103701028.content: Aren't these the earphones Hodur just gave you?

103701029.content: That's right. I'll get them back eventually, but I suspect Hodur needs them more than I do right now.

103701030.content: That's the big sister's instinct. Yes, that's it.

103701031.content: So here I stand, at the door to the Intelligence Office.

103701032.content: I knock gently. No response. Fortunately, I have the access that I applied for from Shu earlier, so I am able to open the door myself.

103701033.content: Only then do I realize what Baldr meant when she said that there are certain things only Hodur can do.

103701034.content: There are piles of folders and hard drives all over, and the walls are covered from top to bottom with notes. What kind of fortitude does it take to stay on top of all this?

103701035.content: Two tables are pushed together, the only clear surfaces in the room. Slumped on top of one of them is Hodur, fast asleep. At least that seems to be the case.

103701037.content: Hodur does not stir even one bit. Yup, she's sleeping. She must be really exhausted. Maybe I should come back later.

103701039.content: Come on in! Um... Admin, what are you doing here?

103701042.content: Have you come with the latest combat report? I could have saved myself a trip had I known you were coming this way.

103701043.content: No, I'm here about something else...

103701045.content: Oh? Well, don't forget to finish the report, Admin.

103701047.content: Wait. Admin, what can I do for you? And you, Miss Shu?

103701048.content: Yes. After going over these documents, please write up a report and send it to the Special Task Force with the files. Thanks.

103701049.content: Shu puts down the huge pile of documents she has been carrying. Just looking at it makes me want to clench my jaws.

103701050.content: No problem. Although... could I send over the report tomorrow?

103701051.content: There's no real rush. Whenever suits you, Hodur.

103701052.content: Oh, no, no, no, I'll be as quick as I can. I know how important the report is.

103701053.content: Let me give you a hand.

103701055.content: It'll help me understand our enemies. I can't beat them if I don't understand them, can I?

103701056.content: Also, going through all the intel will help me command on the battlefield.

103701058.content: Admin is right. A good understanding of all the intel will improve the efficiency of using the Mimir system.

103701059.content: If the intel is what you need, Admin, you can read the file once I'm done with it.

103701060.content: I mean, what about your own work? You can't possibly be spending all your time here.

103701061.content: I have Miss Shu and Lord Mimir. Surely you won't mind teaching me some tricks of the trade...?

103701062.content: An ominous expression flashes across Shu's face.

103701063.content: Of course, if Admin can learn more about our intelligence work, it will make future tasks much easier.

103701064.content: I'm sure Mimir will be happy to take on Admin's work in the meantime.

103701065.content: Honestly, all I do is just basic paperwork. I'm not sure if I actually have anything to teach you.

103701066.content: But if it helps you and everyone else, I'll do my best.

103701067.content: Okay then. I'll have Mijir bring your tools, Admin. See you later.

103701068.content: Um... Miss Shu, could I have a minute of your time?

103701069.content: What is it? If you're worried about Admin, just talk to #{nickname}#.

103701071.content: Baldr's just woken up from a coma. So... So, I'd like to take on her work in the field.

103701072.content: I promise I won't fall behind on the Intelligence Office work. I'll bring Admin up to speed on what we do here as well.

103701073.content: Hodur, you know I've already rejected your written request.

103701074.content: I know other teams are doing Baldr's work right now. But we can't keep on creating trouble for others...

103701075.content: My combat rating has improved, too. I could handle a reconnaissance mission, I'm sure!

103701076.content: Hodur, combat missions aren't just about the fighting.

103701077.content: It's about being adaptable, and using camouflage and tactics to avoid unnecessary confrontation. That takes patience, caution, and attention to detail. Much like your intel work.

103701079.content: Anyway, I'm assigning other teams to the field.

103701080.content: Baldr still needs to recuperate. Both Aether Gazer and the Intelligence Office can't afford to lose you as well, Hodur.

103701083.content: I watch as a disappointed Hodur returns to her desk.

103701085.content: It's okay, Admin. I get it, don't worry about it.

103701086.content: Miss Shu was right. What I should do now is to concentrate on my own work and stop causing more trouble for her.

103701087.content: Hodur starts muttering to herself again, as if nothing had happened.

103701088.content: Miss Shu had said no only because Hodur was critical to the Intelligence Office.

103701089.content: If only Baldr were here... Oh, never mind. Admin, let me get you the things you'll need to work here.

103701090.content: You don't have to, Hodur. Shu is going to have Mijir bring everything.

103701091.content: I'll have to find you some desk space, at least. Mijir will tell me off if the office is this messy.

103701092.content: And you've come to help me, after all. At the very least, you should have somewhere to work.

103701093.content: Hodur carefully skirts the table next to her, moves to a desk opposite her spot, and starts to clear out the files on it.

103701094.content: That other table, I'm sure, was Baldr's.

103701095.content: It looks like Hodur had been keeping Baldr's workspace tidy the whole time, most likely to damper her feelings of longing.

103701096.content: Come on, let me be of some use here.

103701097.content: Huh? Oh, you don't have to.

103701098.content: Listen, Hodur. I know I cause problems sometimes. But I also solve them.

103701099.content: It was my idea to come and work here. So I should be doing this.

103701100.content: Hodur and I start to attack the mountain of papers and files in the office.

103701101.content: But there was another great, big hill that had to be climbed at the Intelligence Office.

103702001.content: The intel on the Visbanes has to be sorted by type and by Sephirah Zone. That's the most basic, and the easiest task.

103702002.content: If a Visbane is spotted in multiple areas, it is categorized under the Sephirah Zone where it was first sighted. This may change later on if the Visbane moves on to another area of activity.

103702003.content: Some Visbane types mutate and their classifications thus also change. That means confirming the reports we get from the combat squads, archiving the original dossiers, and then reporting back to the Special Task Force to see if more investigation on the Visbane in question is necessary.

103702004.content: Patterns can be discerned from almost every combat encounter with a Visbane and in every Visbane type, and we have to make sure to include them in our risk assessments.

103702005.content: Alongside all that, we have to ensure our files are secure.

103702006.content: While Hodur is usually the quiet sort, once she gets talking about management of our files, there is no shutting her up.

103702007.content: Intel drives everything Division Nine does, large and small. We have to make sure that it lands in the hands of those who need it.

103702008.content: I am starting to understand why Shu is so worried about Division Nine and the Intelligence Office losing Hodur.

103702009.content: So... have you always processed all this info yourself?

103702010.content: No, Baldr often helps out. Then Miss Shu helps me with any files or documents I don't know what to do with.

103702011.content: But most of the time it's just you, Hodur, right?

103702012.content: Well, most of the time, yes. I guess this is repetitive and boring work to everyone else...

103702013.content: I mean, it's basically doing paperwork day after day. It's nowhere near as exciting as field combat.

103702015.content: I guess I'm good at it, but I'm still not doing much to help. I mean, had I known what would happen at Spealght...

103702016.content: Maybe Baldr wouldn't be in the infirmary.

103702017.content: That wasn't your fault, Hodur. Nobody could have predicted that. We simply didn't know what was happening.

103702018.content: The squad's comms were taken out and we lost touch with them——

103702019.content: "Hey, Rookie! Snuck away from work, I see!"

103702020.content: Huh? What are you doing here, Lord Mimir?

103702021.content: Mimir pops up on the screen, interrupting our conversation.

103702022.content: Hodur, sorry to bother you. I'm looking for a certain idler.

103702023.content: Oh, no problem, Lord Mimir. I was just explaining the Intelligence Office's work to Admin.

103702024.content: Yes, and that's whom I'm looking for. Hey, rookie, when did you start playing hooky at work?

103702026.content: I have no idea why Shu agreed to this. Why am I covering all your work at the General Office? Explain yourself!

103702027.content: Is that why you've dumped all your work on me? This is going to take more than a few bags of coolant to fix, you know!

103702028.content: No! Lord Mimir, that's not what happened!

103702029.content: Hodur, let me tell Lord Mimir what's going on.

103702030.content: In the corner, I explain the situation to Lord Mimir.

103702031.content: Ah, I see. Well, in that case... No, no, dumping your work on me is still unacceptable!

103702032.content: I promise I'll make it up to you, Lord Mimir.

103702033.content: This is a matter of principle. It doesn't matter if you make it up to me or not...

103702034.content: Five bags of coolant. Blue Cola flavor.

103702035.content: Hmm. Tastes a little odd, though it does have a pretty color... Okay, it's a deal.

103702036.content: Right, misunderstanding resolved! Work hard, rookie, and no more playing hooky!

103702037.content: With a contented smile, Mimir leaves.

103702038.content: Apparently, Mimir's appearance is not the only thing catlike about him.

103702039.content: Was Mimir here about your work in the General Office?

103702040.content: I'd hate it if helping out here meant that your other work gets delayed...

103702041.content: Relax, it's all been taken care of. Lord Mimir's going to help out too.

103702042.content: Now, where were we? I don't think you'd finished explaining these things.

103702043.content: With my encouragement, Hodur picks up where we had left off.

103702044.content: Some time later, we are only a third of the way through her carefully prepared presentation. However, she seems to have become distracted.

103702045.content: Data on newly identified Visbane does not go into the main database... It has to be first assessed... a new entry has to be made in...

103702046.content: A new entry has to be made in…

103702048.content: Data on newly identified Visbanes has to be first assessed by the Special Task Force, so a new entry has to be made in their database first. If no new reports on that Visbane type are received in the next 48 hours, the data is then sent back to the Intelligence Office.

103702049.content: This is a list of contents for the Intelligence Office and Special Task Force databases, along with the respective encryption key and code tables. You'll need to memorize these, Hodur.

103702050.content: Yes, Miss Shu. I'll do that.

103702051.content: It's tiresome work. Thanks for taking it on.

103702052.content: I should be thanking you for training me, Miss Shu.

103702053.content: It's an important job, Hodur, and you may be the only person we can count on for this.

103702054.content: Huh? But it's just organizing and analyzing documents. I'm sure lots of people could do a better job than me.

103702055.content: I've tried having the combat teams work intelligence shifts. That didn't work out very well, trust me.

103702056.content: We'd turn up for a fight and realize we had the wrong intel, or entered incorrect info into Mimir. It was fiasco after fiasco.

103702057.content: But... But why me, Miss Shu?

103702058.content: Because I've scoured Division Nine and I can't find anyone who is more conscientious and detail-oriented than you, Hodur.

103702059.content: You see, Intel failures paralyze the other departments that rely on that intel. That's not a risk we can tolerate.

103702060.content: So, if you run into any problems, Hodur, feel free to raise them with me. There's going to be a lot to get used to while you're starting out.

103702062.content: Sometimes I worry that I'm putting too much pressure on you...

103702064.content: (Cough)... What are you up to, Hodur?

103702065.content: Baldr! What are you doing here?

103702066.content: Why do you look so surprised? I thought you'd be waiting for me to walk through that door... How disappointing.

103702067.content: No, that's not what I meant! I thought you were out on a combat mission. I'm just surprised that you found the time to come see me...

103702068.content: If you need any documents, I can bring them to you.

103702069.content: Well, as you see, I'm not out on a combat mission! There's no shortage of fighters, I don't need to be out there every day.

103702070.content: But I'm sure I remember seeing your name on the combat roster for today—

103702071.content: Ah, never mind that. I'm actually thinking about asking Shu if she can assign me to the Intelligence Office.

103702072.content: You get such good light here, and we'll be able to spend more time together, Hodur. Plus, that means I'll be done with all that running around.

103702074.content: You can't move to Intelligence just to be with me. You're an awesome fighter...

103702075.content: Oh, don't you want me here, Hodur? Nice. I'm not sure "disappointed" covers it this time...

103702076.content: No, that's not what I meant! I mean, you can't give up combat missions just because of me. I'd be holding you back.

103702077.content: Ah, but I've already sent my request in to Shu.

103702078.content: You see, I've decided this is where I want to be! It'll be great! Although I think we'll need another desk, next to yours.

103702079.content: Hang on! Where is this coming from...?

103702080.content: This one looks good. Watch out, coming through. There, that'll work.

103703001.content: That day, Hodur kept on talking and talking until she suddenly fell asleep. She let on that she often sleeps poorly, probably because of how overworked she is.

103703002.content: I try to persuade her to spend less time on her work and training, and to make time for rest. My words probably didn't stick, though.

103703003.content: However, at my insistence, Hodur agrees to skip training today. Instead, she stays in the Intelligence Office to work on some of the easier tasks.

103703004.content: But I too find myself getting absorbed in the endless work in front of us. To continue like this, however, will mean that I won't be able to fulfill my promise to Baldr...

103703006.content: Hodur, I wonder if you've noticed this as well...

103703008.content: Ever since I moved to the Intelligence Office, the doorbell keeps ringing...

103703009.content: Hmm. I think you may be right.

103703011.content: Ugh! Who is it? Come in!

103703012.content: I am already irritated by the pile of combat reports from last month that I have to deal with. The incessant ringing only makes me even more annoyed.

103703013.content: Our visitor is dressed in CORG uniform and looks about as happy as I feel.

103703015.content: The wrap-up reports for Neuhansa, including the ones on the mechas, are overdue. Why haven't you sent them over?

103703016.content: You mean Neuhansa Dossier No. 17? Well, mister...? How should I address you?

103703017.content: Miles. The name's on the request form.

103703018.content: Well, Mr. Miles, may I have your encryption key?

103703019.content: This? Hurry up, they're waiting at headquarters.

103703020.content: Miles hands Hodur a small data strip. I catch a glimpse of the Aether Gazer logo.

103703021.content: That checks out, Mr. Miles. Did you say that the Directorate hasn't received the dossier?

103703022.content: Obviously, or I wouldn't have come all the way over here, would I?

103703023.content: We have already sent the dossier over last weekend. The transmission is recorded in our logs here, and we have a receipt from the CORG server.

103703024.content: Which, under the terms of our arrangement, means the Directorate has it. So in principle, this isn't our problem.

103703025.content: But we didn't receive the dossier.

103703026.content: Or it means they were overlooked by CORG. We have raised this issue before. There is room for improvement when it comes to CORG's systems for processing incoming intelligence.

103703027.content: CORG's process for handling intel from receipt to archiving is quite convoluted, meaning it makes it easier for things to slip through the cracks.

103703028.content: Is all this complaining necessary? We didn't get it, so why not send another copy? Then we're done.

103703030.content: I have never seen Hodur refuse a request so bluntly.

103703031.content: Mr. Miles, we may have some differences in our protocols. But Hodur is right.

103703032.content: How can you be so sure you didn't make a mistake? There's no sign of the dossier at our end!

103703033.content: If that lack of intel means we make bad decisions, you'll be held responsible!

103703034.content: Yes, just like we would be responsible for the consequences of sending another copy.

103703035.content: We cannot risk intel ending up in the wrong hands.

103703036.content: Are you suggesting we might leak the intel?

103703037.content: Huh? No, not at all. I simply mean—

103703038.content: Very well. Be prepared to see my name on strongly worded letters to your bosses and mine soon!

103703040.content: I know that any problems for the Intelligence Office or Hodur will make it even harder for me to do what Baldr has asked.

103703041.content: I rush over to stop Miles from leaving. Then, I turn to Hodur.

103703042.content: Hodur, why don't we just give them another copy?

103703043.content: No, Admin, we can't do that. That's in breach of our protocols.

103703044.content: There is a unique code on each dossier to prevent misuse.

103703045.content: If there's any chance the original dossier still exists, they need to find it, not come to us for another copy.

103703046.content: This intelligence has come at a very real cost to whoever obtained it. We must treat these sacrifices with respect.

103703047.content: I have the feeling that he's going to raise a ruckus with Shu and CORG.

103703049.content: Hodur is being unusually assertive. But this means that we risk things getting worse...

103703050.content: How about this, Hodur? Let's buy some time by telling him that we'll look for the dossier.

103703051.content: Once we're sure the problem isn't on our end, we'll reject the request, and we'll then deal with any complaints together.

103703052.content: But we already know that the problem isn't on our end, Admin. Don't you... believe me?

103703053.content: Of course I believe you. But it won't be easy, getting this Miles guy off our backs.

103703054.content: Let's try to buy us some time. That's one of the things I've learned in situations like this.

103703056.content: Have the two of you made a decison yet? Hurry up, I've got better things to do than spend all day here arguing with you.

103703057.content: Alright. Mr. Miles, we're going to try and track the dossier first here in Division Nine. Would you come back tomorrow?

103703058.content: Yes, we'll have something for you tomorrow. We need a little time, even if we just recompile the dossier. I hope you can understand.

103703059.content: Once we have persuaded Miles to leave us in peace, Hodur and I get to thinking about how to handle the situation.

103703060.content: So... What do we do next?

103703061.content: There's no point looking elsewhere in Division Nine. Dispatch from the Intelligence Office is the last link in the chain...

103703062.content: Sitting here worrying won't help. We need to do something.

103703064.content: Knowing Lord Mimir, I think he'll reject the request from CORG.

103703065.content: We've already caused Miss Shu too much trouble. We can't possibly bother her with this.

103703066.content: In that case, let's talk to the Special Task Force.

103703067.content: Maybe they can give us some new ideas.

103703068.content: And so, I drag Hodur with me to the Special Task Force. Only the Winter Squad is on duty.

103703070.content: Fenrir bounds up to Hodur, sniffs her, then returns to the sofa where Vidar is all curled up.

103703071.content: Hodur! It's you! It's been a while!

103703072.content: Fenrir misses you, too! What have you been busy with? Is it because of Baldr?

103703074.content: Master and I went to see Baldr. Mimtastic says she'll be all better soon!

103703075.content: Thanks, Leviathan. But we're not here about Baldr.

103703076.content: Hodur and I tell Vidar and Leviathan what happened at the Intelligence Office...

103703078.content: Hmm... I'm not sure, something seems off.

103703079.content: If they've breached the rules, we should just refuse, shouldn't we?

103703080.content: Yes, but he said he'd lodge a complaint with Miss Shu. That's gonna create a whole lot of trouble.

103703081.content: Why not just kick him out of your office?

103703083.content: I mean, the problem here seems to be him...

103703084.content: That's right, Master! None of this is Hodur's fault.

103703085.content: No, no, no, we can't just do that!

103703086.content: Uh... Did I say something wrong?

103703087.content: No, no, of course not. You are right, of course, but we can't possibly do that...

103703089.content: Hodur explains the sensitivity of the matter to Vidar...

103703090.content: Vidar has identified the true cause of our problem. However, to be undiplomatic with CORG staff would be to invite an avalanche of "strongly worded letters."

103703093.content: Waa... Well, if Master doesn't have any ideas, I'm sure I don't either.

103703094.content: W-Why not talk to Baldr? I'll bet she'll know what to do!

103703096.content: What? No, we can't disturb her. She needs to rest.

103703097.content: I'll go and recompile the dossier. If Mr. Miles insists on submitting a complaint, I'll have to let Shu give me a talking-to.

103703099.content: No, you can't, even if you are the Admin.

103703101.content: Is Hodur... mad? Did I say something wrong?

103703102.content: What's wrong with asking friends and family for help when you're in trouble?

103703103.content: Hodur isn't mad at you, Leviathan. It's just that this is a complicated situation.

103703104.content: But... I think you may have given me an idea. Thanks!

103703105.content: Master! See, Leviathan had a useful idea!

103703106.content: Um... yeah... you did... kind of...

103703107.content: I should go, then. Thanks, Leviathan. You too, Vidar.

103703109.content: I leave the Winter Squad and try to catch up with Hodur. Thankfully, she hasn't gone far.

103703111.content: No, Admin. I'll just recompile that dossier. There's no need for Baldr to get involved in this.

103703112.content: That's not what I meant. I need you to help me deliver something.

103703113.content: Huh? Why do you have Baldr's earphones with you?

103703114.content: Well... Baldr asked me to take them to Me-Yow for some fine-tuning. But I forgot to return them.

103703115.content: I was just reminded of this when Leviathan mentioned her name. I'm wondering if you could take them to her.

103703116.content: But what about the dossier for Mr. Miles?

103703117.content: Forget that. It's already late and we've already had a long day. Let's get some rest.

103703119.content: You take the earphones to Baldr. Let me worry about the dossier.

103703120.content: I feel a weight lift from my shoulders as I watch Hodur disappear down the hallway.

103703121.content: Baldr must have guessed I wouldn't be able to convince Hodur on my own. But it took Leviathan's comment to make me see that.

103703122.content: Guess I'll have to take them out to dinner next time...

103704001.content: Aether Gazer Medical Department, infirmary ward.

103704003.content: Hmm? Oh, it's you, Hodur! I thought you'd forgotten me!

103704004.content: As if! I'd have come sooner, but it's been a busy day.

103704005.content: I-I've got your earphones. Admin asked me to bring them.

103704006.content: Me-Yow has fine-tuned them. Admin just forgot to return them.

103704009.content: I hear Admin is helping out at the Intelligence Office. How's that going? I bet Admin's better than me at the paperwork.

103704010.content: Admin's just learning about what we do there, so it's all good so far...

103704011.content: Heh. I was worried Admin might cause you as many problems as I did.

103704012.content: Of course not! I mean... You've never caused me any problems! A-Anyway, I should let you rest—

103704013.content: What are you hiding from me, Hodur?

103704014.content: N-Nothing. It's just that I have to get back to work. We still have some things to attend to.

103704016.content: Pull up that chair and sit yourself down. Oh, should I get up and move it for you? Well, okay then—

103704017.content: Stop! I'll get it. Just stay where you are.

103704018.content: Hodur moves the chair to the side of Baldr's bed and sits down, looking like a guilty child.

103704019.content: For a while, the two sit quietly in the light of the setting sun. The only sounds that can be heard are the hums and beeps of the bedside monitors.

103704022.content: Baldr takes Hodur's hand. There was a time when the two hands were almost identical. Now, one of them is covered in bruises from countless injections.

103704023.content: Tell me, whatever it is. I can help.

103704024.content: Still holding Baldr's hand, Hodur tells her in a low voice what happened that afternoon: the unreasonable demands of Mr. Miles, and the visit to the Special Task Force to ask the Winter Squad for help.

103704026.content: Yes. So I need to go back and—

103704028.content: Me? What about me? I'm fine...

103704029.content: You haven't been losing sleep? Or sneaking in extra overtime?

103704030.content: I-I'm fine. Just a bit tired.

103704031.content: Hodur, have you ever wondered what would happen to Division Nine if you were to collapse from exhaustion?

103704033.content: The Special Task Force wouldn't get the latest intel. That means they'd be at a disadvantage on the battlefield.

103704034.content: We wouldn't be able to provide assistance to CORG. They wouldn't be able to evacuate people living in dangerous areas.

103704035.content: Without you, Hodur, we won't be able to protect anyone.

103704036.content: But... I worked so hard and this still happened to you.

103704037.content: If I'd realized sooner that there might be Cognizant Visbanes at the Spealght factory, you wouldn't have gotten injured...

103704038.content: Hodur... If beating the bad guys was that easy we'd have wiped out the Visbanes ages ago.

103704039.content: Sometimes I tell myself that if I'd died back then, you would have been the last person I ever saw.

103704040.content: A cheap cliché... but I don't dislike it.

103704042.content: Because I know you're a grown-up now. You could cope without me.

103704044.content: If someone leaves a battlefield alive, it's not just because we've fought to protect them.

103704045.content: It's also thanks to the intel you provide, Hodur. These intel and data protect people.

103704046.content: Once upon a time, you relied on me all the time, Hodur. Now, people rely on you.

103704047.content: But I always cause you so much trouble. Like right now.

103704048.content: Hey! You can keep on relying on me, Hodur. I'll be mad if you don't.

103704052.content: You will never be a burden to me, Hodur. You are my sister, and I will always be proud of you.

103704053.content: I'm sorry... I... I didn't mean to make you worry.

103704054.content: Ha! If you're going to apologize, let's make it something meaningful.

103704056.content: Your punishment is to spend the night here, getting a good night's sleep. And ramen! When I get out of here, you're taking me to that place we went last time.

103704057.content: Hodur doesn't say a word, choosing instead to respond with a smile.

103704058.content: On the two sisters' clasped hands, fallen tears glisten in the setting sun.

103704060.content: The following day. Aether Gazer Intelligence Office.

103704061.content: So, have you got the dossier for me or not!?

103704062.content: Mr. Miles, let me confirm: You want the Neuhansa Intel Dossier No. 17, is that right?

103704064.content: We've recompiled the dossier for you. It's all here.

103704065.content: But would you explain this message, please?

103704066.content: Hodur passes the tablet in her hands to Mr. Miles, and a look of panic flashes across his face.

103704067.content: Earlier today, we consulted with the Quake Damage Control Department about how they dealt with intel leaks in the past, and also looked up the tracking info for Dossier No. 17.

103704068.content: According to the information received from CORG, Mr. Miles, you intercepted an intel encryption key we sent to the Directorate last week.

103704069.content: Those keys are single-use only, and we're not sure why you did what you did. But in consideration of what happened, we will not be handing over the Dossier No. 17 to you.

103704070.content: The Directorate may speak to you as part of its investigation, though of course that is not of Aether Gazer's concern.

103704072.content: Well, I'm afraid it's too late to turn back now! I'm going to need that dossier.

103704073.content: Hey! I can see you're no fighter. Hand over the dossier and you won't get hurt.

103704074.content: You know I can't do that.

103704075.content: Don't say I didn't warn you!

103704076.content: This Miles guy clearly has underestimated what the Modifiers can do.

103704077.content: One second he is charging at Hodur, and the next, he is slamming into the floor.

103704078.content: Okay, enough! No more fighting. Stop!

103704079.content: Ha. You... behave yourself and... and maybe the Directorate will go easy on you.

103704080.content: Okay, okay. You've got me. Whatever you're going to do, get on with it!

103704082.content: As Hodur picks up the telephone to have the Special Task Force duty squad come by to take Miles away, he slips out of Hodur's grasp.

103704085.content: Miles throws the door open—and falls to the ground writhing in agony before falling silent.

103704088.content: Baldr is propping herself against the door frame. Next to her is Mimtastic, holding Baldr's IV pole.

103704089.content: What are you doing here? Wait, shouldn't you be in bed resting!?

103704090.content: Mimtastic, what's going on? What is Baldr doing here!?

103704091.content: Everything you told me yesterday made me suspicious of this Miles guy.

103704092.content: But I couldn't go to the Special Task Force with nothing more than suspicions. So I came in person.

103704093.content: As this mister here crashed into me on his way out, I... gave him a little shock.

103704095.content: But you! You should be in bed!

103704096.content: Yes, that's why Mimtastic is here. To help with my IV.

103704097.content: Baldr forces a wan smile, but Hodur has already turned away, frantically bustling about.

103704098.content: Hey... Ugh... Mimtastic, I need another favor from you...

103704099.content: Easy there, Baldr. Your vitals are fluctuating. Hold still.

103704102.content: The team from the Special Task Force sent to detain Miles carries Baldr back to the infirmary.

103704103.content: Mimtastic explains to a sobbing Hodur that Baldr would be okay, that she had simply fainted due to a combination of low blood sugar and sudden exertion.

103704104.content: Miles, trussed up like a chicken by the Special Task Force team and woozy from being electrocuted, soon confesses—he had planned to use his position to obtain the AGI Mechas left at Spealght and sell them to the Children of Iron.

103704105.content: Had Shu not intervened, Leviathan would have sent Miles back to CORG in a much more dreadful state... or should I say icy?

103704106.content: After the affair, thanks to Mimir's vigorous complaining, I am assigned back to the General Office and my usual work.

103704107.content: Well, rookie, this is the work that's piled up in the time you were away. I did my best to help, but... well, there's a lot of it.

103704108.content: ...It looks like it hasn't been touched at all.

103704109.content: Like I said, no one in Aether Gazer has the authority to make me work overtime!

103704110.content: Mimir lays happily across a bag of blue coolant. Everyone wins, except for me. The world seems to enjoy feeding me a big ol' pile of...

103704111.content: Hodur comes in as I am pushing a pile of documents to one side.

103704112.content: Hey, Admin, do you have a moment?

103704114.content: I... I want to ask you to come and train with me... There's a place in the commercial district I want to go, but I'm not sure exactly where.

103704115.content: You see, I've heard Apollo say a real bow feels different to a virtual one. So I'd like to try one out.

103704117.content: Hey, rookie! Are you playing hooky again? When I'm right here?

103704118.content: Training with the rest of Aether Gazer is part of my job, remember?

103704119.content: I'll report you to Shu! Hey!

103704120.content: With the door shut on Lord Mimir, Hodur and I head for an archery range in Ain Soph's commercial district.

103704121.content: Wow... This is very different from the training room.

103704122.content: Well, this is an archery club after all. People come here to relax and enjoy themselves.

103704123.content: It is a good idea though, to practice and let off some steam at the same time.

103704124.content: So, that's how the string feels. It really is different from the auxiliary gloves they've got back at Aether Gazer.

103704125.content: Using a real bow is going to be much more tiring than the virtual practicing at the training room. Do you think you'll be okay, Hodur?

103704126.content: I've been training for a long time. I'm sure I can manage a real bow.

103704127.content: And... It doesn't matter how good a bow is, does it? If you pull the string too tight it'll break.

103704129.content: I've thought it through. If I can't protect people with bows and arrows, I'll have to do it with the skills I do have.

103704130.content: Baldr and everyone else fight to protect me. If I can't join them, I'll just have to support them any way I can.

103704131.content: For so long, I've felt like I was a burden to my sister. A shadow in her sunshine. I wanted to keep up with her, but also worried I was holding her back.

103704132.content: But now, I realize that... that the sun shines on both of us, not just her.

103704133.content: With that, Hodur lets her arrow fly.

102601001.content: You'll be meeting with Nuadha. He's a craftsman we've worked with extensively.

102601002.content: You may find him a little... odd, but rest assured you will never find a better machinist.

102601003.content: Weapon designs we've commissioned from him often come back more powerful than we were expecting.

102601004.content: I'd heard Nuadha's name come up a few times at Aether Gazer, but have had virtually no interaction with the man himself. My impressions have largely come from others' opinions.

102601005.content: However, when you hear the words "specialist in the design of advanced weapons," and "eccentric genius"...

102601006.content: ... it is hard not to think of someone mad, or dangerous.

102601007.content: Shu stops abruptly and points somewhere ahead.

102601009.content: It seems like this is the end of the road for her. She gives me a pointed look.

102601010.content: Oh? You're not coming, Miss Shu?

102601011.content: Correct. I think you'll be fine on your own. It might be better, actually.

102601012.content: My efforts with Nuadha have come unstuck a few times. He might be more at ease without me.

102601013.content: Then what makes you think I'll be able to succeed, Miss Shu?

102601014.content: Shu remains silent, instead handing me a wad of materials in relation to our custom weapon design. She then motions to me to "Engage."

102601016.content: The cover purpose of this trip is to procure Nuadha's services in the design of a new weapon.

102601017.content:
The reality is something quite different, as Shu had earlier informed me.
What we really want to do is add this expert craftsman to our ranks.

102601018.content: Shu's description of Nuadha does nothing to improve my confidence.

102601019.content: Don't worry. He's not going to bite you!

102601020.content: My nerves must be showing on my face, for Shu attempts to defuse the tension with a lighthearted comment.

102601021.content: Does that mean "Anything can happen except for being eaten..."

102601022.content: Surprised, Shu's smile tells me she finds my commentary more delightful than hers.

102601024.content: This is where we part ways, Administrator. Get in touch with me afterward, and I'll come pick you up.

102601026.content: Alright. I guess I've got to do my best.

102601027.content: I walk into the workshop as Shu's gaze follows me at a distance.

102601028.content: I should be more specific. I'm actually not able to enter at all.

102601029.content: An enormous number of metal shelves of various shapes and sizes are scattered in front of the entrance, filled to the brim with cardboard boxes.

102601030.content: Crevices in some of the less well-maintained boxes reveal a plethora of unknown components.

102601031.content: Old home appliances and what look to be rather dangerous weapons, with sinister glints on their metallic surfaces, seem to be largely gathered on the topmost shelves, side by side.

102601032.content: The whole mess constitutes something of a barrier unintentionally, or perhaps intentionally, blocking the entrance to the workshop.

102601033.content: There is no point even trying to knock, given the circumstances.

102601036.content: I pause for a response. There is none.

102601037.content: Oh well. It seems I have no other choice but to make my entrance directly. I survey the nearest shelves until I locate a couple of crates with a relatively wide opening I might be able to squeeze through.

102601038.content: I angle my body in an attempt to make it past the metallic pile.

102601039.content: I've done rather well with my front foot, but just as I am about to angle my back foot into the enclosed space, I accidentally trip on an inconspicuous electric cable on the ground.

102601040.content: The cable brings down some boxes. The boxes brings down one shelf. One shelf brings down more shelves...

102601042.content: I am almost knocked out by the enormous pile of crates. It definitely was not my greatest of maneuvers...

102601044.content: I hear a voice from somewhere above my head, muffled by surrounding crates.

102601045.content: I hear box after box being lifted away from the pile that entraps me.

102601046.content: The sunlight beams directly down to my eyes. I can't help but squint. All I can see is a vague figure standing in front of me.

102601048.content: Any orders for humanoid android repair recently?

102601049.content: Sorry, but I am a human being.

102601050.content: A real human being, you say? The level of artifice required... is extraordinary.

102601051.content: ...What I mean is... I'm not some artificial product...

102601052.content: I push the surrounding components aside and try to sit up. That's when I get my first good look at the youthful figure before me.

102601053.content: The young man has a set of crystal eyes, but a surprisingly disarming smile. I am reminded of a country boy visiting the big city from his family farm.

102601054.content: Haha. Sorry about that. You're the Administrator, right? Aether Gazer told me you were coming.

102601055.content: He extends his hands to help me up.

102601056.content: Let me have a look at the blueprints. What do you want customized this time?

102601058.content: I pass over the blueprints, thinking of what else to add. But I don't need to say anything because Nuadha has already turned back to his workshop, and is muttering away blithely to himself.

102601059.content: So they want a combination of two distinct systems to reduce cooldowns? Bold, challenging, but certainly worth an attempt.

102601061.content: These would be the materials I'd require...

102601062.content: Oh dear. He's obviously not listening to a word I'm saying.

102601063.content: Nuadha certainly gives me the impression of a brilliant craftsman, and I have no doubt that we'll receive the custom design we so desire. But that does nothing for my other, more important mission...

102601064.content: Nuadha, hold on a moment. Could I just talk to you about something?

102601065.content: I follow him closely, and just as we are about to enter the depths of his hallowed workshop...

102601067.content: A metallic click comes from somewhere at my feet. I think I've stepped on something.

102601068.content: None of the shelving or cardboard boxes on the floor, thanks to my accident, have been put away. Whatever I've stepped on, I thought, must have fallen off. And in fact, that was an exquisitely-designed drone.

102601069.content: I looked up in embarrassment, straight into Nuadha's shocked eyes.

102601071.content: Nuadha rushes over and crouches down to examine the drone.

102601073.content: Instead of furiously driving me out of his workshop in anger, Nuadha lifts his gaze to mine and breaks out in another disarming smile.

102601074.content: It's alright. I'll just fix it.

102601075.content: Only the wing took some serious damage. It'll be very easy.

102601076.content: Well then I'd like to help!

102601077.content: While Nuadha insists he can fix it himself, I insist even more vigorously that I can help.

102601078.content: Firstly, out of a sense of duty and, secondly, because it just might give me the opportunity I need to persuade him to consider Aether Gazer.

102601079.content: That's what I was planning anyhow. However...

102601080.content: Can you pass me the second box over on that shelf?

102601082.content: Good. And can you have a look for a red wrench somewhere at the bottom of that box?

102601084.content: Then could you get me the metal pipe from next door? From the fourth box on the left in the corner.

102601086.content:
The result? Nuadha sure knows how to keep someone on their feet.
I want to broach the topic, but his speed and efficiency keep dashing my hopes.

102601087.content: And I find other things to concern me...

102601089.content: The drone I stepped on was definitely not outfitted with this very familiar piece of hardware. So I cannot ignore what is taking shape in Nuadha's hands.

102601090.content: I could have sworn I had stepped on some toy drone. Why does it look like some sort of new military tech in Nuadha's hands?

102601091.content: Isn't it a bit too much to be installing such weaponry on a drone?

102601093.content: Alright then. I've made several attempts. I'll have to interrupt nowhim forcibly or he'll disappear into his work so thoroughly he won't even notice my presence.

102601094.content: I still need to install an automatic target seeker...

102601095.content: I am observing another side to Nuadha—totally absorbed in his work, eyes burning with zeal as his hands work quickly and tirelessly to organize mechanical components together.

102601096.content: The disorganized workshop is an inherently dreary and maybe even cold place of metals and machines. Yet so vigorously does Nuadha work that he seems to provide his own source of warmth in the drafty hall.

102601097.content: Is it all just about fixing a drone?

102601098.content: Shu was right. He's a real oddball.

102601099.content: At some point I must have drifted off to sleep. A sudden noise from Nuadha wakes me.

102601102.content: Heh. Want to take it on a test flight?

102601103.content: He takes the drone in his hands as he asks me, beaming with excitement.

102601105.content: He, holding the firepower enhanced drone now equipped with auto-targeting capabilities, asks me excitedly.

102601106.content: Hold on. Where are you going to do your test flight?

102601108.content: In a nearby street, of course.

102601110.content: Nothing I say is going to slow him down. He nimbly threads his way out of his own workshop clutching the drone like a child with a new present.

102601111.content: The street immediately outside the workshop is rather large, and although not crowded, features quite a few kids and elderly passersby!

102601112.content: You're going to fly such a killing machine here?

102601113.content: I rush over, agitated. I think of confiscating the drone from Nuadha's hands, but I'm too late.

102601115.content: I reach out, but the drone flies away like a bird.

102601116.content: The drone circles in the air a couple of times with its enhanced heavy horsepower rotor wings before the machine gun suspended from the base of the craft suddenly points in my direction.

102601118.content:
Nuadha pushes a button on the remote control without a second thought.
I don't get a chance to interrupt him.
