102601120.content: ♫ Twinkle, twinkle, little star, how I wonder what you are. ♫

102601122.content: The drone's speakers start playing a familiar tune as I see the barrel pointing at me to shoot...

102601124.content: ♫ Up above the sky so high... ♫

102601125.content: What do you think of my "Firepower Enhanced Bubble Drone with Automatic Lock-on"?

102601126.content: The features of the drone do not comport at all with its external appearance. Yet he's boasting it, proudly.

102601128.content: You spent all those hours and installed all those components just to make a drone that... shoots bubbles?

102601129.content: Are drones not allowed to shoot bubbles?

102601130.content: Nuadha fiddles with the joystick. The drone glides gently down to the ground like a bird returning to its nest.

102601131.content: Isn't this better than actually equipping it with a dangerous weapon?

102601132.content: I'm not quite sure how to respond to Nuadha's disarming smile.

102601133.content: The soap bubbles glint with kaleidoscopic colors, much like the joy that can be seen in Nuadha's eyes.

102601134.content: I have to go back soon—whether I want to or not.

102601135.content: Nuadha heads back into a pile of new machines. I'm not sure if he heard my goodbye, but I don't get a chance to follow it up as Shu is already waiting for me by the entrance.

102601136.content: So. How did you find Nuadha?

102601137.content: Actually brilliant, quite eccentric. Happy enough to spend time with. A bit difficult to understand since he has kind of a strange logic to the way he pursues things.

102601139.content: I think for a moment about what to say next...

102601140.content: I think he's a nice guy.

102601141.content: And how about our plan to convince him to join Aether Gazer?

102601144.content: I had forgotten partway through the evening as I ran to and fro at Nuadha's beck and call.

102601145.content: Embarrassing, no doubt, but Shu takes it in stride as if she expected me to fail.

102601147.content: We'll get plenty of other chances—until the weapon is complete.

102602002.content: I say the formality words as I take my familiar route into the Hearth of Danu.

102602003.content: I am becoming a regular fixture at Nuadha's workshop under the cover of checking on our new device. In reality, I am still trying to find the right opportunity to convince Nuadha to join us.

102602004.content: I mentally catalogue the familiar rows upon rows of objects in front of me: cardboard box, circuit board, non-descript metal, cardboard box, component, cardboard box, Nuadha, cardboard box...

102602006.content: I drop and squint at what just might be Nuadha's figure within the sea of components.

102602007.content: An exquisite human figure stands out like a sore thumb amid the metal.

102602008.content: The right arm is clearly a metal prosthetic, but connected to it is undoubtedly flesh and blood.

102602009.content: Nuadha is half-submerged in a pile of stuff, sleeping soundly with a wrench in his hand.

102602010.content: You should sleep on a bed...

102602012.content: I try rocking him, for which I receive a few more snores. Oh well. I guess I'd better look for a blanket to cover him up. I'll just walk around until he wakes up.

102602013.content: The Hearth of Danu is as messy as ever, but there is something to be said for the way Nuadha can always find whatever he needed at a moment's notice. Chaos is in the eye of the beholder, I suppose.

102602014.content: I stand in front of one of the shelves which is filled with "completed products"—a bubble-shooting drone at the top, and then an automatic shoe-fitting machine, and then half-painted mechanical cat ears.

102602016.content: I'm sorry, Nuadha. I just don't see any rhyme or reason in this chaos.

102602017.content: In fact, I don't even see why any of these things should exist. I don't understand why anyone would create any of this.

102602019.content: I find a relatively empty space to sit down as I mentally file the workshop away under "indecipherable"—along with its mysterious founder.

102602021.content: Nuadha mutters a few sentences. Is he objecting to me in his sleep?

102602022.content: Unfortunately, the court cannot understand even the contents of this objection, which hence must be overruled. The court's decision shall stand.

102602023.content: He must be tired beyond all measure. I wait several more hours before Nuadha finally wakes up.

102602024.content: His body gives all the signs of being awake, but his mind is clearly elsewhere. He looks around, dazed and confused, at the tools around him. He moves slowly, sluggishly, like a starving koala.

102602028.content: The wrench drops to the floor and falls into the pile of components with a loud clang.

102602029.content: A-Administrator! What are you doing here?

102602030.content: You didn't respond to my recent text. I was worried something had happened, so I decided to check on you.

102602031.content: Really? I'm sorry... I must have been so busy I didn't notice.

102602032.content: He sits down on a machine behind him, still tired, and smiles apologetically.

102602033.content: But something about his smile reminds me of an image without enough color saturation—seemingly lifelike, but joyless.

102602034.content: I take a look at the black rings around his eyes. And I realize that I sent my first message quite a while ago... Which means...

102602035.content: How many days has it been since you last slept?

102602036.content: Let me think... two... no, maybe three...?

102602037.content: The exact answer is so difficult Nuadha tries counting on his fingers.

102602040.content: The vacant look in Nuadha's eyes tells me that this isn't his first practice of some literally "sleepless" work. Luckily, I have plenty of experience with the same problem at Aether Gazer.

102602041.content: The secret? Don't give them the space to justify themselves.

102602042.content: I forcibly lead Nuadha away from his machines.

102602043.content: No work, only rest, starting now.

102602045.content: You're working on a project commissioned by Aether Gazer. Then, as a representative of your client, it's very important to me that you maintain ideal working conditions.

102602047.content: Good mental and physical health is essential to our work. That means good rest is needed. If you refuse, then we're going to have to add a separate clause to our contract.

102602048.content: ...So do I just go back to sleep?

102602049.content: A common problem. Workaholics often fall asleep without meaning to, especially after mental overexertion. But proper rest means much more than just not working—it means getting rid of all that tension.

102602050.content: In other words, the answer is not just more sleep. I've got something much better.

102602051.content: I take him outside by the hand.

102602052.content: As alluded to, I am now walking around the street with Nuadha.

102602054.content: Notify me prior to the next such unplanned activity.

102602055.content: You should have known what it means for you to walk on the street without any Modifier protecting you.

102602056.content: I'm sorry! It won't happen again.

102602058.content: Take a walk and then go back. And do not leave Nuadha's side for a moment, do you understand?

102602060.content: The resulting beep informs me of the unilateral ending of the call, and piques Nuadha's interest, who until now seemed rather deflated.

102602061.content: What happened? Something wrong, Administrator? Should we go back?

102602062.content: Everything is just fine. I've received approval. We can keep going.

102602063.content: My reply seems to deflate Nuadha like a popped balloon.

102602064.content: I may have successfully dragged this "machinist homebody" out of his room for the day, but not all is well. He suddenly becomes very anxious after half an hour of walking.

102602067.content: He decides not to make a break for it at the last second.

102602068.content: Nuadha tries several times to slip off in a different direction during our journey.

102602069.content: Since he still has works unfinished, it looks like his nerve is taut as a bowstring. The string won't loose unless the jobs done, or he himself is broken.

102602070.content: But the fact is anybody so highly strung is also liable to snap at any moment.

102602071.content: Or so I think as I grab Nuadha by the arm to dissuade him from yet another attempt to lose me.

102602072.content: I'm not letting us go back until I feel that you're sufficiently relaxed.

102602075.content: How am I supposed to relax in a place like this?

102602076.content: We are wandering in the city's busiest commercial street, surrounded by stylishly dressed men and women having fun out on the town.

102602077.content: The very air around us dances to the beat of the popular tunes laid down from speakers, and we are surrounded by flashing ads on huge screens, and discounts of various types—everything to make Nuadha feel like a fish out of water.

102602078.content: I hadn't exactly picked the most suitable destination, I admit.

102602079.content: Did you know, Nuadha? Businesses here are all about enhancing the client experience and gaining new customers with machines.

102602080.content: Case in point, we have low-flying aircrafts distributing leaflets on the footpath, and plenty of facial recognition systems at the entrances to various places of business. Technology is part of what makes the commercial district so special.

102602081.content: I pick up a discount drinks voucher from a low-flying craft overhead and pass it to Nuadha.

102602082.content: The craft immediately takes off again, expertly sidestepping all the pedestrians who don't want to touch it with a ten-foot pole, and then pause precisely near another interested passerby.

102602083.content: It may not be the most advanced technology, but you have to admit they've done a fantastic job on the details when it comes to maximizing customer outreach.

102602084.content: Every little optimization is another chance to make more money.

102602085.content: Perhaps some of these machines could... Nuadha?

102602086.content:
Nuadha looks like a hunter that has just locked eyes with its prey.
The next moment he launches himself at his quarry...

102602088.content: I try to dissuade Nuadha on the merits of disassembling the flyer drone in front of everybody on the street, but to no avail. On the plus side, here at last he's found something interesting.

102602089.content: Our positions are quite reversed. Now I am being pulled by him, following those machines whizzing everywhere.

102602090.content: I see. It's not about finding a signal, but receiving it... Much more efficient!

102602091.content: This sort of lighting is much gentler on the eyes.

102602093.content: He turns back toward me with a huge grin. The sparkle in his eyes has returned.

102602094.content: You're right! It's not the best of the best technology, but they've done their utmost to improve the user experience!

102602095.content: This is an incredible design angle to pursue! You're an absolute genius!

102602096.content: I'm afraid I'm not the genius here...

102602097.content: The real genius of the two of us ignores my response, busy as he is pursuing his next target.

102602098.content:
At some point in the proceeding minutes, he grabbed a notebook in his hands to... well, take notes.
His right hand, although mechanical, is exceptionally well equipped for scribbles and sketches. I see a familiar object take shape.

102602099.content: Hold on. Isn't that... the weapon we commissioned?

102602100.content: OK. Look. From this angle there are a lot of aspects that could be refined.

102602101.content: His eyes glint again with that strange enthusiasm. It is infectious, and certainly more engaging than the nearby billboards.

102602102.content: So it turns out that my one and only opportunity to go on a stroll with Nuadha had somehow turned into yet another work day.

102602104.content: Administrator! Can we have a look at that thing over there?

102602107.content: Not what I initially planned... But who can say no to an invigorating dose of new inspiration?

102602108.content: Or so I think, resigning myself to my circumstances.

102603001.content: I don't have any real work on for today, a rare treat. I find myself strolling leisurely back to my office after lunch.

102603002.content: The Aether Gazer offices are always rather quiet in the post-lunch lull. Both the building and the moods of its occupants are at rest.

102603003.content: So I quickly notice the sound of some very purposeful and very rhythmic footsteps.

102603004.content: These are followed by an energetic greeting.

102603006.content: The figure pats me on the shoulder before I have a chance to respond, and then steal a glance behind.

102603007.content: Can I borrow your Administrator for something?

102603009.content: Shu has rounded the corner at this very moment, and from the shadow of a smile on the corner of her mouth, one can tell she feels a bit funny.

102603012.content: Permission granted, Nuadha half drives, half pushes me out of the office while somehow maintaining a jocular hand on my shoulder.

102603013.content: Hold on. What on earth is this about?

102603014.content: We're going to do some good deeds!

102603015.content: In front of an old building.

102603016.content: Here is your old phonograph. And please remember to come and see me if there's anything else you need fixing!

102603017.content: Thank you so much, kind young man.

102603018.content: No problem at all! If you must thank me, then leave a few lovely sausages for me next time!

102603019.content: Heh. Got it. I'll make sure to leave plenty.

102603020.content: The deed Nuadha speaks of is in fact the act of pulling a trolley full of old electrical appliances around in this local neighborhood full of elderlies. And we are visiting them one by one, door to door.

102603021.content: We have reached the end of the rundown, out-of-the-way street when Nuadha hands out an old-fashioned, mounted clock from his trolley.

102603022.content: My goodness! It's been broken for decades. Don't tell me you actually fixed it?!

102603024.content: This clock was one of the family heirlooms I brought over when we first got married. You know, back in the old days…

102603025.content: The odd pair launch into a rather meandering conversation and, as usual, there is no good place for me to add my two cents.

102603026.content:
All aged people love telling others those stories in their lives, and I must say that Nuadha has a talent for listening.
I thought he was only interested in machines...

102603028.content: It takes me a few moments to work out the elderly lady is calling to me. I look up, confused, to see a kind, wizened face staring back at me.

102603030.content: I don't feel like I can really say no—even though the trolley is still filled with plenty of odds and ends. I nod.

102603031.content: I begin to regret my rash acceptance several minutes into our friendly chat.

102603032.content: I can hardly not invite you in after you visited my neighbor!

102603033.content: Thank you so much! You always help us with those things. Please, come. Have some fresh fruit.

102603034.content: So we pass our afternoon with all manner of cakes and deli meats, discoursing on such wide-ranging topics as clocks with built-in radios to the upkeep of modern farming mechanics.

102603035.content: Enough time passes that I end up taking an interest in the subject matter anyhow.

102603036.content: And before I know it, I am also revealing intimate details of my personal life—as intimate as my memories allow, anyway.

102603037.content: Charm goes a long way. I truly think that Aether Gazer should look at hiring some of these elderly folks for their intelligence-gathering services...

102603038.content: I would have said no if I had known we were going to be doing stuff like this...

102603039.content: Haha... Don't say that! Trust me, it gets much more interesting once you get used to it.

102603040.content: My mounting fatigue does not share Nuadha's optimistic appraisal of the situation after three houses.

102603041.content: We are actually pretty close to the Hearth of Danu. I had no idea there's so many elderly residents living nearby.

102603042.content: The locals seem surprisingly friendly and talkative whenever Nuadha comes into view. And he loves talking to them, too.

102603043.content: Conversing with Nuadha often involves intuitive leaps of logic his mind would take. What does that say about the kinds of people who can keep up with his conversation?

102603044.content: Virtually everything I've seen today runs counter to my early impressions.

102603045.content: I am so tired I just want to sit down, and yet Nuadha keeps plucking away, visiting one house after another for a friendly chat.

102603046.content: When I was younger... my partner and I…

102603047.content: So the drainage tube for a machine with this kind of structure...

102603048.content: I'm sorry. I was wrong. I'm not sure whether I'd call it "conversation."

102603049.content: It might be more accurate to say Nuadha and his conversational partners are running two different but overlapping conversations, where one or two lines of dialogue might result in something resembling normal speech.

102603050.content: There may not be much of a meeting of minds taking place, but whatever is taking place is clearly satisfying for both parties.

102603051.content: Out of boredom I begin cataloguing all of the relics that should have been discarded long ago on Nuadha's trolley but which he is determined to repair.

102603052.content: Items generally came in three categories: too old, too heavy, or too out of touch with modern styles.

102603053.content: Yet each one returned is a work of masterful repairs. And not all of Nuadha's brilliance is on display either—he even remained the dents on an old radio damaged after a fight.

102603054.content: The old man who receives the radio caresses the site of the former dent with his old withered hands and a smile.

102603055.content: That sure was a big argument...

102603056.content: The reflection of the two men takes on tones of a dark oil painting, with only their smiles giving off a warm light.

102603057.content: Only when I am just starting to relax do I realize we had stayed far too long!

102603058.content: Nuadha! We have a lot more to return!

102603059.content: But dusk has almost fallen by the time we finally reach the end of the street.

102603060.content: There is only one item left—an electrical cat of sorts.

102603061.content: I remember seeing the frame of the mechanical kitty in the workshop somewhere. Nuadha had designed it meticulously. It is hard to tell from the real thing once he added the fluffy exterior.

102603062.content: I thought you didn't like replicas with fur and all that stuff?

102603063.content: That should be obvious! Who wants to work with a material that blocks heat diffusion on the machine? And...

102603064.content: He is about to embark on a long speech about the dangers of "fur as an exterior" before he stops himself and simply shrug.

102603066.content: We stop in front of a rather empty courtyard, which I would have simply walked past had not Nuadha reminded me otherwise.

102603067.content: The structure looks somehow older than the other old buildings and the gate has been left open. The front area looks empty and cold.

102603070.content:
In that case I get ready to find the elderly occupant.
Surprisingly, Nuadha holds me back.

102603073.content: Nuadha does not explain himself. He smiles awkwardly, bends down to pick up the cat, and presses a button on its eyes.

102603074.content: The cat's green tinted irises open wide. It leaps to the ground with such alacrity I almost forget it is a machine.

102603075.content: Whatever command Nuadha had installed, it was amazing: I feel the cat's faded yellow tail brushes across the back of my leg as it scampers across the cold courtyard to the main building under the last rays of the setting sun.

102603077.content: It meows in front of the mottled door a couple of times.

102603078.content: There is a creaking sound from the old wooden door after a few seconds before an elderly lady with a hunchback steps out of a darkened passageway.

102603080.content: Her voice is filled with a piercing eagerness. She manages to kneel down with some difficulty and feels the ground with her hands.

102603081.content: This is when I notice the white film over her eyes, which struggles to focus on any one point.

102603082.content: Nuadha tugs at his hair nervously.

102603083.content: It's been many years since she lost her sight, but she's pushed everyone away so far who's come to help.

102603084.content: She has no children or family, just her kitten. And the cat got old and...

102603085.content: It occurs to me that Nuadha must be so much more familiar with the world of machines than messy, organic biology.

102603086.content: He doesn't have to finish this sentence for me to recognize what had ultimately become of that cat.

102603087.content: The old lady is still kneeling down next to it. She hasn't moved a muscle.

102603089.content: She raises her hand, hesitantly, but does not try to pat the cat in front of her again.

102603090.content: Maybe I should buy a real one?

102603091.content: Nuadha takes a step forward. He looks hesitant, as if regretting his decision to fashion a replica and desiring to take it away.

102603092.content: But this is where the machine's extraordinary sensors kicked in.

102603094.content: The cat inches forward, raises its head, and leaps into the elderly lady's arms, warm fur and all.

102603097.content: She lifts her arms to welcome the cat into her embrace.

102603098.content: Nuadha, standing next to me, heaves a sigh of relief.

102603099.content: He turns to me and flashed his customary, pleasant smile.

102603101.content: Nuadha races back to his cart to check on today's haul. I have a mind to follow him, but stay for a moment to catch another peak at the elderly lady in the courtyard.

102603102.content: Being blind, I don't expect her to actually be able to see us.

102603103.content: But she is looking straight at Nuadha's departing figure as she bows slightly in his direction, clutching her precious, reborn feline family.

102603104.content: Administrator? Let's go. We've got to return you as well.

102603106.content: I turn to look one last time at the courtyard. The lady and cat are gone.

102603107.content: The large courtyard does not look quite so desolate under the orange rays of the setting sun now.

102604001.content: I wake up some time later and can still feel the sting in the back of my head.

102604003.content: I am tied to a support pillar in one corner of what looks like an abandoned factory. Nuadha, several meters away, seems to have shared my fate.

102604004.content: He is hunched over, motionless, messy hair fallen forward over his eyes.

102604006.content: It started out as just another day.

102604007.content: I had come, as was my custom these days, to the Hearth of Danu for the cover of checking in on our flagship project and helping Nuadha in whatever way he deemed helpful.

102604008.content: Can you bring me one of those?

102604010.content: That's right, Administrator! You know, you should really stay here and help out full-time.

102604011.content: Having you around will make me twice... no, three times more efficient! Plus you can craft whatever comes into your head here!

102604012.content: I really appreciate the offer, but I'm going to have to decline.

102604014.content: I have not yet forgotten the real purpose of my frequent visits to the Hearth of Danu. I can't imagine what my colleagues over at Aether Gazer will think if it turns out I have been poached instead by Nuadha.

102604015.content: I haven't yet found the perfect opportunity to broach his potential employment with Aether Gazer... and our weapon design is only two days from completion.

102604017.content: I don't get a chance to finish. I am interrupted by a feeling of soft fur against my feet.

102604018.content: I look down to find Nuadha's masterpiece of a kitten running around my legs, licking its claws happily.

102604021.content: I pick up the delightful little cat in surprise, but get more than I bargain for as it struggles against me.

102604023.content:
It may have been installed with one of the most advanced "cat simulator" computer chips known to man, but it is obviously not advanced enough to reply.
Nuadha responds instead.

102604027.content: You know what. Just follow me. Showing beats telling.

102604028.content: We line the courtyard with balls of yarn, cardboard boxes, cushions, even a box of tissues.

102604029.content: Do you like to play with balls of yarn, Kitty?

102604030.content: The cat leaps over and rolls the ball of yarn around with its claws.

102604031.content: Nuadha, off to the side, nods with satisfaction as he scribbles something on his notepad.

102604032.content: How about this: Do you like playing around inside cardboard boxes?

102604035.content: No, no, no... This is just a routine check... Ah!

102604036.content: A momentary lapse of concentration allows the cat to leap forward and pluck the dried fish—both bait and reward—from Nuadha's hand with its mouth.

102604037.content: Wait... Oh well. I guess that last jump just about finished the test anyway.

102604038.content: This is really meant to be testing something?

102604039.content: Well, yeah. It was created to do exactly these sort of things.

102604040.content: I can't disagree with you there.

102604041.content: But why go to all this trouble?

102604042.content: What do you mean? It's about the user experience, right? Remember that little jog you took me on?

102604044.content: It's my first chance to really broach the topic a week after we went on our neighborhood visit run.

102604045.content: What I'm talking about is: Why go to all that trouble to help out the old folks who live around here?

102604046.content: You don't get enough time to sleep, let alone step outside, as it is. Why spend those precious few hours left on that street? I just think...

102604047.content:
It's a waste of your talent.
I don't need to say it for Nuadha to understand what I am getting at.

102604048.content: He stands up a bit straighter and tugs at his hair again, as if trying to think of how best to put it.

102604049.content: I think you might have misunderstood me, Administrator. What I'm actually doing is...

102604050.content:
Ding!
We are interrupted by a ping from Nuadha's mailbox.

102604051.content: I sigh and motion to let him have a look.

102604052.content: Thanks. Huh? It's a job... But it's anonymous.

102604053.content: Their factory is in trouble, and they really need my help. They attached a map. It doesn't look that far.

102604054.content:
What do you think, Administrator?
Do you want to come with me? Or head back to Aether Gazer for the day?

102604055.content: I think that I'll... Hold on a second. That's it? And the message is anonymous?

102604057.content: Doesn't that seem really suspicious to you?

102604059.content: Nuadha gives me another one of those innocent smiles as he brings up the picture received on his console.

102604060.content: The picture is of a rundown-looking factory filled to the brim with rusted, abandoned machinery. The only clean-looking machine, and it looks very clean, is smack dab in the middle of the factory floor. The exposed wiring on the outside makes it look like it's still very much a work in progress.

102604061.content: Don't you find that machine fascinating?

102604063.content: Nuadha's eyes are positively shining with enthusiasm. I think I have my answer.

102604064.content:
Alright then.
I'll come with you.

102604065.content: And that's how we ended up here.

102604066.content: The email was extremely suspicious, so I was on my guard. Problem was I had underestimated our opponents.

102604067.content: We followed the map to the abandoned factory and were immediately knocked out from behind once inside... with this result.

102604070.content: Administrator? What's going on? Some sort of kidnapping test?

102604071.content: Never heard of any test like this. And I've got to say it is really...

102604073.content: A heavy metal door opens and closes, giving enough light to make out the "I am bad news" faces of several men entering.

102604074.content: A surprisingly applicable description as I notice the colorful, fluorescent words ablaze on their shirts in various languages: "Get Lost," "Fight," and "Bad News."

102604075.content: It might be worth mentioning the word "Idiot" emblazoned on the shirt of the man who speaks first. The ancient language in which it is written makes me doubt that he understands the meaning.

102604076.content: It does give me inspiration for what to name each one.

102604077.content: The one with the words "Get Lost" on his shirt, that is, the stocky one, gets out in front.

102604079.content: Idiot. The guy with the mechanical arm!

102604080.content: "Idiot" gives "Get Lost" a smack across the forehead.

102604081.content: Uh... Durh! Of course... Of course I knew that, b-b-boss. Just checking—just in case!

102604082.content: There was something so ridiculous about the sight of a man wearing an "Idiot" shirt calling his pal an idiot that I just have to smirk.

102604085.content: An awkward silence descends upon the room.

102604086.content: I notice the fearful expressions of the people behind the "Idiot".

102604088.content: He cracks his knuckles with a devilish smile.

102604089.content: There's always someone who thinks he's smarter than me. Who thinks I'm an idiot, right?

102604090.content: I only notice how tall he is, and that my nose only reaches his chest, when he's standing a few centimeters from my face.

102604091.content: He then lifts up his muscular arm...

102604094.content: I hear a loud blast behind me. I can't imagine what that must be.

102604095.content: The pillar to which I'm tied, that reaches all the way to the ceiling, has been broken off just centimeters from my head.

102604096.content: Anyone else think they're better than me?

102604100.content: "Idiot" barks at "Get Lost" to keep watch over me while he slices through the rope holding Nuadha in place and carries him over to the semi-completed machine in the center of the room like one might carry a small chicken.

102604101.content: I hope you take us seriously, machinist. Your friend is in our hands.

102604102.content: This, is why we need you.

102604103.content: He gives the machine a solid whack. It quivers slightly and is, it seems, in relatively good condition.

102604104.content: Wasn't easy to get. The people we got it from didn't understand its true value. I do.

102604105.content: It's going to make an extraordinary weapon! Just look at the size of the barrel! I don't know where it was made, but it doesn't matter. It's ours. And if you can complete it...

102604106.content: "Idiot" starts talking at length about the wonders of this machine. Nuadha, who I thought would have been interested, seems a little bored. He keeps looking my way.

102604107.content: I'll help you complete it if you release my friend first.

102604108.content: You should forget about terms and conditions with me, boy.

102604109.content: I can smash your head, the two of them, with a single blow. How about this for a deal: Repair this machine and both of you can live.

102604112.content: The factory floor is in fact outfitted fairly well still, and Nuadha gets into the habit of issuing so many orders the mob of hoodlums actually get rather confused.

102604113.content: Even "Get Lost", who was meant to be guarding me, has to run off to complete various odd jobs, giving me the sense Nuadha is buying me time.

102604114.content: But Nuadha is just a machinist at the end of the day, not a miracle worker. My best course of action is still to SOS to Aether Gazer for help.

102604115.content: Good thing "Idiot" had damaged my pillar, because I am now able to disentangle my arms from the ropes behind me with a bit of effort. Freedom is in reach...

102604117.content: A familiar, hulking figure clouds my view. He raises his hand menacingly, clearly aiming for something other than the pillar.

102604118.content: There is no time to run. All I can do is stand there and await my fate...

102604120.content: A familiar yellow shadow darts out from a corner.

102604122.content: I have no idea when Kitty came to our rescue, but I can see the cute catty nails its claws inside the "Idiot"'s muscule, and bites at the man's fingers with teeth tough enough to dispatch any mouse.

102604123.content: "Idiot" cries out in pain and does his best to throw the cat to the ground.

102604124.content: The sound of the cat short-circuiting rings out before sparks fly out everywhere with a bang. The light in its green eyes dim. It stops moving.

102604126.content: Nuadha turns his attention from unscrewing something on one corner of the machine to look over.

102604127.content: "Idiot" continues stomping on the inactivated cat on the ground.

102604130.content: All eyes turn to Nuadha. His hand is still stretched mid-air, showing he just threw something.

102604131.content: And throw something does. The wrench lands with absolute precision on the back of the "Idiot"'s head, and falls down next to Kitty.

102604132.content: My stomach knots. I can understand his decision on a gut level, but we are badly outnumbered and there is no way we can do anything without backup...

102604133.content: Just a pathetic little machinist, and you think...

102604135.content: I don't get the chance to finish.

102604136.content: I have seen so many different sides to Nuadha so far.

102604137.content: The sight of his dedication to his work, the excitement in his eyes when discussing machines, as well as the occasional befuddled smile when confused or inconvenienced by an elderly friend.

102604138.content: But I had never seen him like this—with a fire in his eyes that seems ready to melt our surroundings into ash.

102604140.content: He lowers his voice, which booms around the room. All is quiet except for his angry stare.

102604141.content: I feel the room is about to explode with tension—even the inanimate tools seem to quiver in the awkward silence.

102604142.content:
Hold on...
They really are quivering!

102604143.content: The moment I realize something very unusual is happening is the moment countless machines, gears, pipes, circuits, boards, screws, and computer chips come unstuck and lift into the air.

102604144.content: These components become like a legion of knights commissioned to defend their noble machine kingdom, regrouping the troops for an attack.

102604145.content: Nuadha is standing in the center of the factory floor, relatively unconcerned, holding a control panel as he commands the machine parts he's already enlisted to his cause.

102604146.content: When did he figure out how to do that?

102604147.content: Was there much sense in asking? Nuadha has already shown himself more than capable when it comes to achieving anything in the world of machinery.

102604148.content: My ropes are cut by a multifunctional knife that flies over from one corner, frightening "Get Lost" in the process.

102604150.content: He squeals in terror and turns to run, accidentally tripping over a cooling pipe. His head lands on the floor with a loud thud. Lights out.

102604151.content: "Fight," for his part is trapped between two machine arms patched together from different parts. A screwdriver from somewhere finally knocks him out.

102604152.content: "Bad News" has been bullied into a corner by a trolley with only two wheels remaining, and the collapse of a metal conveyor buries him in some metallic boards.

102604153.content: Only one of the ne'er-do-wells is left standing after a few minutes—"Idiot".

102604155.content: He angrily crushes underfoot a conveyor belt that attempts to block his path, swats away another machine that tries to spray oil into his eyes, smashes an ambush from a wrapping machine in one corner, and reaches Nuadha.

102604156.content: Can't beat me with that crap! Now be a man and hit me with your fists!

102604158.content: Nuadha drops the control panel with a smile.

102604159.content: "Idiot"'s attacks come heavy and yet quick, but Nuadha is surprisingly agile. He opens his right mechanical arm into a large cannon while sidestepping an incoming punch.

102604160.content: What happens next occurs too quickly for my mind to register. There is a blast of fire, a blur of red and black, and Nuadha launchs his attack.

102604161.content: A bright explosion launches the big guy's hulking figure firmly into the wall across the factory.

102604163.content: I never really associated Nuadha with such combat capability until now. But the display makes me appreciate just how badly Shu must want to add him to our ranks.

102604164.content: I can still see the fiery rage in his eyes. I am almost hesitant to approach.

102604165.content: Nuadha remains silent too. All he does is walk over next to Kitty and sit down.

102604166.content: After an appreciable silence he raises his head and waves at me.

102604169.content: Nuadha smiles. The fire in his eyes disperses.

102604170.content: You're the best assistant I could have hoped for, Administrator. We'll have Kitty fixed up in no time—especially with all these great materials.

102604171.content: He points to the semi-complete weapon in the middle of the workshop.

102604172.content: I thought that one is very valuable? Isn't it something you're interested in?

102604173.content: I'm more interested in fixing Kitty.

102604174.content: I haven't even found the number three wrench before he's pretty much finished salvaging the so-called era-defining weapon for spare parts for Kitty.

102604175.content: People love to categorize things by value, usefulness, significance, and so on. But...

102604176.content: Do you really think, Administrator, there's no point to a bubble-shooting drone?

102604178.content: Now is the time to be circumspect, but my face gives me away.

102604180.content: I get it. That would be the common view. Now for question number two.

102604181.content: Do you think there's no point to me helping the elderly fix their things?

102604183.content:
I think back on all the smiling faces we observed, all the wrinkled hands tenderly clasping mementos full of nostalgia and sorrow.
It does not seem fair to call it pointless.

102604184.content: And do you think it was pointless for me to make Kitty?

102604186.content: Kitty saved my life. And I saw how much it meant to that lady.

102604187.content: From my point of view, it's one and the same.

102604189.content: He stops what he is doing to look at me directly.

102604190.content: Do you think there's no point in me, Nuadha, of the Hearth of Danu?

102604193.content: I feel the penny drop after this last question. I realize where he is going with this.

102604194.content: You knew all along why I came.

102604195.content: Well, Shu has came so many times before.

102604198.content: The cat on the ground gives a weak murmur.

102604199.content: Nuadha's eyes light up with satisfaction as he grabs his tools again.

102604200.content: I've become familiar with that state of mind. It signifies he will not be hearing anything I say before he finishes his job, and yet also means...

102604202.content: I used to think Nuadha was more complicated than the average person, but he may be simpler... and much more pure.

102604203.content: After all, he is where he has chosen to be. And he is not at all stressed by the prospect of others not understanding his values, engrossed as he always is in his current task.

102604204.content: Nuadha of the Hearth of Danu.

102604205.content: I quite like the title. Well, maybe Shu won't.

102604206.content: Nuadha doesn't answer me amidst his busy work, but I feel I can see the faint hint of a smile tugging at his mouth.

102604207.content: And thus it seems my long mission of trying to recruit Nuadha to our organization has come to a sad, failed end.

102604208.content: But at least I can say I've made at least one, though rather eccentric, friend.

101901001.content: It's been a while since the devastating quakes in Duskfall. Most of the clean-up and rescue work has finished. Formal oversight of the recovery has been transferred to CORG.

101901002.content: The Emergency Relief Center has already provided tremendous assistance to those affected—both in the terms of manpower and supplies. Great effort was put toward the resettlement of those who had lost their homes.

101901003.content: Aether Gazer took an important role in the relief effort, just like other megacorps in Ain Soph. Its more "normal" divisions contributed enormous manpower and financial resources to the rebuild.

101901004.content: As I'm nearly crushed by all the work assigned to me within the General Office, I sense a visitor by my door—one radiating the heavenly aura.

101901005.content: You look a bit out of sorts, Administrator. If you want, I could book you with Medical Department for a psych checkup.

101901006.content: Um... I... Sorry to give you that impression. However, one more day of this and they might need to check my physical health as well.

101901007.content: I can see now the radiant aura around Shu is just a figment of my desperate desire for a break. It's just Shu—stern, reliable Shu, serious-minded behind her bespectacled gaze.

101901008.content: "Go see Shu if you're having trouble." Though it is nothing more than a few words scribbled on some paper, it somehow provides me with relief beyond belief.

101901009.content: Since we are short of combat-capable Modifiers in the field, I've assigned the board-related tasks to someone else. During this period of time, you'll have to handle all the work in the General Office. I trust you're not too overworked?

101901010.content: Oh... Um... Worry not, Miss Shu. I've been here long enough. I can handle myself. Yeah...

101901011.content: Is that so? I can see that you're very tired. Even the way you talk has changed.

101901013.content: You don't normally add so many... "um" and "ah".

101901014.content: I fidget nervously. Perhaps Shu's right. I do need a visit to the Medical Department.

101901015.content: ...(Cough) Must be because I've been going through so many documents... You know, a lot of talking to myself and such...

101901016.content: Remember to take a break when you need to. Feel free to get up and move around, walk outside, or get a cup of tea, things like that.

101901017.content: How about I come and help you tonight after I get back from patroling out around Duskfall? They've updated the roster recently, and I'm on this afternoon's shift.

101901018.content: That's great. And safe travels out there!

101901019.content: I smile at Shu as I silently planning to speed up my work for the afternoon.

101901020.content: Another thing... Mimir has just hooked up this office with field communications. That means if anything happens—anything unusual—you can just get in touch with me right away.

101901021.content: As if Ver's calling in to illustrate the matter, we both hear her voice loud and clear through the speaker attached to the wall.

101901022.content: No abnormalities detected north of Duskfall. The Overture Squad is RTB. Can you send in the next squad for handover? Over.

101901024.content: I give Ver a quick reply and then tap proudly on the slender, swan neck-shaped microphone stand.

101901026.content: And that is exactly where Shu is going—to the northside of Duskfall, to relieve the Overture Squad from their patrol duties. Refugee shelters had been set up on the north outskirts, which is closer to Core City. And that's where the restoration efforts were first and most vigorously focused.

101901027.content: Unlike other squads, who enjoyed radioing in occasionally with little updates, Shu remains almost entirely silent on the line. Two hours pass without any updates her way.

101901028.content: Does she think I'm too busy? Or maybe it's been so long she's forgotten she's meant to periodically report back...

101901029.content: I don't want to bother her unnecessarily, either. But after two hours, the silence is finally getting to me. I'm... a little worried.

101901030.content: I should check in on her.

101901031.content: Miss Shu? Come in! What's your status?

101901032.content: Oh, sorry. I forgot I'm supposed to keep updating you... Everything is looking good.

101901033.content: It's not like you to forget protocol, Miss Shu. Have you run into any distractions out there?

101901034.content: I stopped by to survey the reconstruction. I'm very happy to see a lot of companies invested in by Aether Gazer are taking part. I've been evaluating their work.

101901035.content: As the investor in these companies, we also have a duty to oversee the quality of their work. And put a stop to anything that is not any interest of the people.

101901036.content: It suddenly strikes me that Shu has lot of other things to focus on—that is, things not having to do with Division Nine.

101901037.content: I'd be very surprised to hear of companies doing anything improper considering they're really in the public spotlight out there... So how is the reconstruction?

101901038.content: Pretty quick, I would say. Give it another week and many of the refugees will be able to return to their homes.

101901040.content: That was a lot faster than I had expected. The mental image of the ruined and ravaged district just after the Quakes is still fresh in my mind. It seems hard to believe that the city could be restored to a state viable for human habitation in just ten days.

101901041.content: I think all of the reconstruction teams really believe in what they're doing. They're very passionate, so I don't think the speed of the reconstruction is all that surprising... Let me show you what it looks like out here.

101901042.content: The live feed from Shu appears on my console, exactly the scene she herself is seeing.

101901043.content: I see a makeshift base close to Shu's location, functioning as the main reconstruction office for the Duskfall Area.

101901044.content: There are plenty of work sheds nearby, each bearing different corporate logos. Obviously, many of the best and brightest of Ain Soph's corporate world have come together to help Duskfall rebuild. There is a large central clearing at a crossroads, to which an enormous quantity of supplies is being ferried into the hands of the logistics teams and forward engineering teams.

101901045.content: Further away, I spot a line. On the north side of the line are open spaces cleared of rubble and ready to be rebuilt by some of the best engineers in Ain Soph, and on the other side are, well, ruins that are being cleared. I'm glad to see the line never stops pushing south.

101901046.content: A really awe-inspiring sight. I feel like the entire Ain Soph is out here helping.

101901047.content: All of Aether Gazer's Divisions have contributed a lot—with manpower and goods. Yet that seems a drop in the bucket here.

101901048.content: There must be well over a hundred major corporate entities represented here. Which of them are with Aether Gazer?

101901049.content: Quite a few... Actually that's one of my main duties: to evaluate and improve our corporate investments. So I'm quite familiar with all of our partner organizations.

101901050.content: Corporate partnerships with this sort of rebuilding effort involve a rigorous due diligence process. Basically, the same process by which we choose corporate affiliates—they need to be a good match with our organization.

101901051.content: I've heard that Aether Gazer picks its corporate partners pretty carefully.

101901052.content: I know Aether Gazer is pretty big, and growing all the time, but I'm not very familiar with the social affairs business of the company. Nor am I particularly familiar with all of the many other responsibilities Shu has to perform as a member of the board.

101901053.content: From the looks of it, Aether Gazer has its fingers in many pies. More pies than the average corporate titan.

101901054.content: It is true that we have very strict requirements for who we partner with over at Aether Gazer. Businesses need to have up-and-coming potential, plus a management philosophy and values that match our own.

101901055.content: Management philosophy? Values? I'm not exactly sure what that means.

101901056.content: Are you worried that one of our partners could give Aether Gazer a bad name?

101901058.content: Shu falls silent for a few moments.

101901059.content: It's more of a personal thing. A bit selfish, I suppose.

101901060.content: Ideally, I would like all of the divisions of Aether Gazer to reflect the same dedication and humanitarian philosophy we share at Division Nine.

101901061.content: I would like Aether Gazer to give back to society, to help maintain socio-economic order. I don't want it to be just another corporation that will do anything to turn a profit.

101901062.content: Business success should never come at the expense of the ordinary people. That's one of the hard-and-fast rules I use to evaluate companies at Aether Gazer...

101901063.content: The original purpose of Aether Gazer was to defend against the Visbanes. The more orderly and flourishing the society is, the less we will have to worry about the resources we need to deal with them.

101901064.content: The work of the board is required for our fight against the Visbanes; at least that's what I had thought was driving Shu to put so much effort into the social affair.

101901065.content: Why would you call that selfish? We all have a stake in society, don't we?

101901067.content: That's what people call "idealism." Isn't working hard so that other people can be a bit happier—no matter what anyone thinks—the right thing to do? That's not selfish, is it?

101901068.content: The truth is that a lot of people who were part of our company in the early days fought hard against that kind of philosophy. They claimed that such a philosophy would limit the development of the company. Actually, a lot of people left over the decision to broaden our responsibilities...

101901069.content: Shu pauses once more, and the live feed abruptly switches angles.

101901070.content: The reconstruction teams have done a great job of clearing away rubble from the area, which now looks rather empty. That makes it all the easier to see the little girl's head poking out from behind a low wall.

101901071.content: The girl immediately pops her head back. She must have seen Shu notice her as well. Before long, she pops her head out for another look. Then she turns around and runs away.

101901072.content: What is that little girl doing out here all on her own?

101901074.content: In two minutes, Shu chases down the girl to what looks like a standalone, barely intact residence. The girl looks inside the front door as if she's searching for something.

101901076.content: Hold on. Just one more minute... Don't run around, Millis!

101901077.content: A female voice can be heard coming from the house. I can also make out the sound of stuffs being moved around.

101901078.content: We haven't declared that it is safe enough for residents to get back here, have we?

101901079.content: That's right. I thought that the girl was just off playing around here by herself. I'll tell them to leave.

101901080.content: Shu decides to reveal herself to the mother and daughter. The girl immediately turns around, as if sensing a threat, but relaxes when she realizes Shu doesn't mean any harm.

101901083.content: The girl looks a little shocked, but nods hesitantly.

101901084.content: Are you here with your mom to find something that you left back here?

101901085.content: Mom came back for our photo album... She said that Dad was gone. So we have to find the album to see Dad again.

101901086.content: The girl lowers her eyes to the ground and shivers as she speaks, like she's throwing off some bad memory.

101901087.content: Shu tenderly pats the girl on the head. Words are better left unsaid at times like this.

101901088.content: An outsider can never really understand what it feels like to experience such a loss. What they need is renewed hope, something to look forward to—not an attempt to minimize or downplay their lived experience.

101901089.content: Who are you? Do you work for Aether Gazer?

101901090.content: The mother's guarded question breaks the silence. She is still there by the doorway, clutching a fat backpack nervously.

101901091.content: I'm a member of Aether Gazer's special safety patrol team. We're responsible for keeping the stricken areas safe from... incidents, and that people don't return to these areas before it's safe to do so.

101901092.content: I'm sorry, but we left so much at home. I had to come back...

101901093.content: Something very important to you? Did you find it?

101901094.content: Shu doesn't press the point, but smiles at the mother and daughter in a friendly manner as she inquires about the result of their expedition.

101901095.content: The mother seems to have thought about something, as I can clearly see a shiver on her hand, the one grasping that fat bag. Soon, she relaxed, and nods.

101901096.content: We also had some medicines at home. I wanted to bring them back with me just in case...

101901097.content: So the bag is stuffed with medicines? The mother is trying to explain herself, yet what she said attracts Shu's concern —and mine.

101901098.content: As far as I know, the shelters are providing any medicines people need free-of-charge. Why come back for them?

101901099.content: The mother glances at the girl named Millis as she plays near the door. She looks worried about something.

101901100.content: We moved to the shelter two days ago, but there was some kind of leak in the gas system. Millis inhaled too much gas and went into a coma. Luckily we sent her to the hospital in time...

101901101.content: I heard it can cause long-term issues. So it would be handy to have some medicines with us, just in case she develops other... problems.

101901102.content: There was a leak in the gas pipes? And she suffered a coma from gas poisoning?

101901103.content: Only the qualified and certified companies are allowed to join the rescue and rebuild effort. I don't know how something like that could happen...

101901104.content: I haven't heard of it from any of the other residents there. I guess we just got unlucky.

101901105.content: But the company in charge of the gas systems is called Masson-Nalen. I don't think it's a very big company... Never heard of it.

101901107.content: The name must be familiar to Shu. She falls silent for a moment.

101901108.content: If you have time, can I suggest we bring Millis to our own Aether Gazer Medical Center for a checkup? To rule out any long-term side effects of the gas poisoning. I will report to my superiors and make sure that you don't have to pay anything for it.

101901109.content: Besides, I believe that you are well within your right to ask Masson-Nalen for compensation. And if you want to do it with legal representation, Aether Gazer will provide that too.

101901110.content: Thanks, but... Masson-Nalen already told us they found the leak was our fault because we didn't use their equipment properly. And we moved into another room once Millis got better. So there's no evidence to prove it was their fault.

101901111.content: It sounds like the mother, Mira, doesn't want to bother Shu with the issue or pursue it further. She anxiously ends the topic, calls her daughter back, and then the two bid farewell to Shu, say thank you, and leave.

101901112.content: Through the screen, I watch the mother and daughter disappear down another street. Shu knows I have some questions lined up already. She starts explaining as she returns to her patrol.

101901113.content: When Masson-Nalen Energy Limited was newly established, Aether Gazer invested in this company. I still remember them.

101901114.content: And that means... we can help.

101901115.content: If this is what I think it is, it would be one of the most egregious cases of profiteering and avoidance of responsibility I've ever seen. And it will not be tolerated in any form.

101901116.content: I'll be launching a full investigation with our External Investment Division. And if they corroborate what this lady said, then we will punish Masson-Nalen by withdrawing our investment partnership.

101901117.content: The whole thing has obviously left quite a sour taste in Shu's mouth. After all, she was just telling me about how important it is for companies to be publicly minded and not chase profits at the expense of others.

101901118.content: But as eagerly as I'd like to help Shu on this, there's not much I can do to help this time. I barely know a thing about business and management, not to say the social affair thing.

101901119.content: I'll help you where I can. And I'm very sure that Aether Gazer and you will not have any problems whatsoever with resolving the issue.

101901120.content: I can almost hear Shu smile in her answer.

101902001.content: The disaster relief effort has largely drawn to a close. The work of fixing the Source Layer fissures and dealing with the Visbanes is also complete. Division Nine is finally liberated from the mounds of disaster-related work.

101902002.content: If you ask who is the most relieved one here, it must be Shu. Her authority as a director remains in the custody of the Board of Directors, while I have taken over most work in the General Office. The always-busying Shu suddenly has quite some time to rest.

101902004.content: In earlier days it would have been unthinkable for me to run into Shu at our canteen during breakfast. She just wouldn't have had the time.

101902005.content: Morning, Administrator. And you too, Poseidon.

101902006.content: We met while getting our breakfasts.

101902007.content: The fish tank in Admin's office is in dire need of some cleaning. I was thinking of dropping by. Would you like to come, Shu?

101902009.content: The end of the Quakes also means an end to the period of heightened alert. Now we all feel we can breathe a sigh of relief.

101902010.content: Ha... I know you've been working really hard recently.

101902011.content: We are about to sit down when Poseidon exclaims at the TV.

101902012.content: Look... Masson-Nalen! That's the company you just mentioned, right?

101902013.content: We look over at the TV screen Poseidon is pointing to, currently running a bulletin on the state of the clean-up.

101902014.content: ... For Masson-Nalen, involvement in the reconstruction effort has been not only an example of the high trust with which the company is regarded by the public, but also a chance for us to flex our enormous expertise and resources.

101902015.content: But as a relative newcomer to the energy sector, it is only natural that we should be experiencing a prolonged period of continual optimization, whether in terms of product quality control or adjustments to production.

101902016.content: All of Masson-Nalen's factories have been working at capacity for quite some time in order to fulfil the enormous emergent demands of the reconstruction effort, and occasional issues—particularly in terms of staffing—have indeed led to several deficiencies in terms of production management.

101902017.content: As the new representative of our proud corporation, I will be dedicating my time with Masson-Nalen to the further improvement of our corporate oversight, and to vigorously pursuing a positive ethos capable of inspiring our entire company. Thank you everyone for your support and understanding...

101902020.content: Yes. This person named Black took over as the chief manager of Masson-Nalen three months ago. He's been associated with the occasional corporate scandal in the past, but seems to be doing a pretty good job at Masson-Nalen so far. And the media certainly doesn't mind him.

101902021.content: Something's a bit fishy about all of this...

101902022.content: Would a company that really cared about its "corporate responsibilities" refuse to compensate lil' Millis?

101902023.content: We all turn with one accord toward Shu, who wears a serious expression.

101902024.content: As Admin said, I find it very strange that Masson-Nalen would refuse to give compensation to them. Yes, it is possible that Mira made a mistake using the gas heater or something, but if so, I can't see why she would lie to us.

101902025.content: I remember you said that you wanted the External Investment Department to look at it. Did they find anything?

101902026.content: Shu shakes her head with a tired "no."

101902027.content: They just gave me a report which had nothing to do with it—just a summary of Masson-Nalen's operations. Effectively just telling me to trust them because they're doing so well.

101902028.content: The report mentioned there's been tremendous demand for energy and heating products in the reconstruction zone. It makes sense that Masson-Nalen was authorized to help with the reconstruction.

101902029.content: We don't own a significant stake in Masson-Nalen. I'm afraid there's not much more that we can do if External Investment can't find anything else.

101902030.content: I'm sure they think they can just cover it up...

101902031.content: What if the media gets wind of Millis' poisoning? Maybe Masson-Nalen would be forced to issue a statement?

101902032.content: But there's no concrete evidence of any wrongdoing.

101902033.content: A relatively new company like Masson-Nalen is still trying to improve market share. What they want to be looking at right now is basically improving brand awareness.

101902034.content: A huge reconstruction project is one of the best ways of doing that. It's great for two reasons: They don't have to worry about competition, and they also gain credibility in the eyes of the public.

101902035.content: If the story gets out that their products have widespread quality control issues, but there's no concrete evidence, then it can actually work to their advantage. Running the story will promote brand awareness in the public eye without a big reputational hit.

101902036.content: All the public will remember is that Masson-Nalen was one of the companies chosen for the reconstruction effort, and they did heaps of stuff there, and that actually helps them to establish their brand even more.

101902037.content: We listen amazed at Shu's lucid breakdown of the situation. We had no idea of the political and economic calculus involved in a company deciding to take part in a big project like this...

101902038.content: So, that's it? Millis got hurt, and her mother, Mira, was heartbroken. And no one will be responsible for that? I can't just accept that.

101902039.content: It's a cutthroat competitive business world, and sometimes the boundary between public benefits and company profits can get a little blurry. But those with a conscience will do their best to make sure that what happens in business stays in business and doesn't hurt innocent bystanders.

101902040.content: Now I'm getting an idea of what Shu was driving at... Aether Gazer could easily fall into the same trap.

101902041.content: But Poseidon and I know very well that Shu would never let short-term greed influence decision-making as long as she was at the helm of Aether Gazer.

101902042.content: You could even say that Aether Gazer is trying as best it can to buck the trend and fight against the rising tide of corporate greed and malfeasance.

101902043.content: We feel a bit better after breakfast. We take to discussing the day's schedule as we leave the canteen.

101902044.content: You don't have any work today, do you, Shu? Anything that you want to do?

101902045.content: Not at the moment... I was planning to return to the Board of Directors to deal with some work that's been piling up for a few days.

101902046.content: How can I be at ease handing the position over to somebody else?

101902047.content: Are you really that keen to rush back into your busy schedule after finally getting a break?

101902048.content: Yeah! At least take the opportunity to rest for a few days before getting your old job back.

101902049.content: What about four days? You asked for four days of leave anyway. In fact, you haven't even taken one day off, you've just worked all day. I think it's quite unreasonable.

101902050.content: Four days is probably a bit long...

101902051.content: Poseidon and I exchange glances. We smile. We've entered the bargaining stage. That means that Shu is at least going to take some time off.

101902052.content: How about three days? Over a long weekend.

101902053.content: All our other divisions are very busy at the moment. The board has not been contacted, but things are sure to build up...

101902054.content: Two days is fine, I guess... I know you, Shu. Staying away from work for too long makes you anxious, doesn't it?

101902055.content: Somehow four days of leave became two days. With a fifty percent drop, the haggling doesn't seem to be going well. And Shu still seems on the fence about it. It's time to strike.

101902057.content: It's a very standard period of leave and I think it is quite appropriate. You may be used to being busy all the time, but that does not make it normal. Shu, you really do need to try relaxing from time to time.

101902059.content: One day of leave should be considered a necessity—no matter how concerned you are about your job. Just like Poseidon said: To ask for leave without actually resting on your day off is actually disrespecting the purpose of the leave system.

101902060.content: I can't just decide this on a whim...

101902061.content: Poseidon looks to be on the cusp of saying something, but Shu interrupts her with a smile and a wave.

101902062.content: But you're right. I've asked for leave. So I think it is appropriate that I should rest.

101902063.content: As for whether I take one or two days off, I need to ask the Board of Directors...

101902064.content: Our conversation is interrupted by message on Shu's terminal. She has a look, and seems to relax a bit.

101902066.content: The medical center just notified me that they've completed their check-up on Millis.

101902068.content: Still some effects on her nervous system. But I've arranged for Miles to stay in the center for a few more days for follow-up observation and treatment. She should make a full recovery.

101902069.content: Poseidon and I are both very happy to learn that even though Miles probably did suffer some damage, it will almost certainly get resolved.

101902070.content: But it's going to be quite an expensive treatment. I'll have to work my magic on medical to ensure that Millis' mother doesn't have to pay for it.

101902071.content: Admin, how about we all visit Millis now?

101902073.content: Our shared concern for Millis quickly results in a snap visit to the medical center.

101902074.content: We find the little girl lying down on hospital bed in the high-grade facility, looking through storybooks. Her mom is sitting next to her, busily cutting up fruit. They seem somewhat more relaxed this time around.

101902075.content: The mother is a little startled by news of visitors, and particularly Shu's appearance. She hastily adopts the most polite expressions and mannerisms that she can muster.

101902076.content: Mom, it's that lady we met before.

101902078.content: Millis nods her head vigorously. It's reassuring to see her smile and that, by all appearances, she looks perfectly healthy.

101902079.content: Thank you so much, Miss... Director Shu. And your friends are...?

101902080.content: We don't need to worry about titles here. These are two of my colleagues.

101902082.content: We've done some investigations into Masson-Nalen. But we weren't able to find concrete evidence of widespread quality control issues, so unfortunately we're not going to be of much help.

101902083.content: No, that's quite alright. You've already helped us so much! And it's also my fault. I should have stayed behind with her that day...

101902084.content: At some point, Poseidon had moved over to Millis and is busy reading a storybook with her. She seems to have a talent for interacting with children, and before long the girl is treating her like a distant aunt.

101902085.content: I resolved not to let Millis leave my side again after that.

101902086.content: Have you or Millis run into any other issues in the last few days? Honestly, the treatment would have gone a lot better if you had come earlier.

101902087.content: Actually, I wasn't quite sure whether to believe you when you said Aether Gazer would front the cost of Millis' medical appointment. But I felt I had no choice, since Millis suddenly feel very nauseous yesterday, and I thought we just had to come in.

101902088.content: I can understand the mother's skepticism. After all, there's no such thing as a free lunch. As much as we at Aether Gazer might want to project a wholesome image to the rest of society, we can't just gain everyone's trust that easily.

101902089.content: Mira shares their experiences at the shelter. It sounds like they are taking good care of all the basics. It is certainly true that the reconstruction is going pretty well, and with greater efficiency than people had thought likely.

101902090.content: We are just about to bid farewell to the mother and daughter when we notice an unexpected visitor outside the ward.

101902091.content: Long time no see, Administrator from Division Nine.

101902092.content: I am very surprised to see Tyr here of all places. He doesn't want to come in for whatever reason, and so beckons to Shu and I to join him outside for a private chat.

101902093.content: Tyr? Anything you need the Administrator for?

101902094.content: ... Actually, I was looking for you. It seems Division Nine's involvement in the clean-up is coming to an end. Or it already has ended—unless there's anything else you need to look at?

101902095.content: Not at the moment. But, at the urging of some colleagues, I was just preparing to take one or two days off before returning to the board.

101902097.content: The young director raises his eyebrows in surprise. But he nods regardless—he isn't about to interfere with Shu's plans.

101902099.content: Everything runs smoothly. Nothing to complain about. I wouldn't bother you with those, though—since you are still on vacation.

101902100.content: Actually, I think you being away for a little while may actually be good for the company.

101902102.content: We are just too large. And you've been controlling all details of our operations—major and minor—for quite some time. Micromanaging does work. It has certainly helped to cover up some of our organizational deficiencies.

101902103.content: But it's not a long-term solution. The economic winds are changing. So is the market. And I'm afraid the organizational structure may need a few updates to get with the times.

101902104.content: Aether Gazer has or will hit a few roadblocks in your absence. But this will also provide us with the chance to discover and to deal with these roadblocks—a far better outcome than letting them eat away at the very foundation of our corporation.

101902105.content: As everyone is aware, Tyr is a master when it comes to business, and seems to have a sixth sense for dangers lurking in the corporate world long before others catch on—possibly because of his own traumatic experiences while he rose to power.

101902106.content: ... And what do you think would ultimately become of Aether Gazer if we... or I, just let these problems fester, as you say?

101902107.content: Tyr furrows his brows for a moment as he looks me over.

101902108.content: You should understand that a lot of the managers within our company, particularly in marketing, do not agree with some of your views.

101902109.content: And without you in the middle as a peacemaker, I'm sure the company would eventually split into two factions—those that support you and those that oppose you. In other words, those determined to focus on Aether Gazer's social responsibilities and those more interested in the company's own gains.

101902110.content: But where do you stand, Tyr?

101902111.content: I, as a loyal member of Aether Gazer, together with the Valleyrand Family, and Division Three, would stand with you, of course. But I don't know what the outcome would be if things came to that.

101902112.content: In short, I would not put too much faith in the ability of companies to work according to their conscience and proactive engagement.

101902113.content: Tyr doesn't want to stick around after our brief "business chat." He checks in on Millis briefly and then leaves.

101902114.content: It was a brief visit. But it seems to leave a powerful, lingering impression.

101902115.content: Companies that produce things or offer services will be bounded to the reputation of their products and services. However, such a bound is really weak for an investment corporation like Aether Gazer.

101902116.content: I had no idea things were so complicated even within the Aether Gazer company...

101902117.content: Tyr is merely pointing out potential issues. I don't think the situation is quite as bad as he makes it out to be.

101902118.content: And... I have you, don't I? You're helping out with the General Office. So, thank you, Admin.

101902120.content: So if you're getting a bit too busy, then feel free to send some work my way. As long as you can tolerate having someone learning on the job, Director Shu.

101902121.content: Ha... I'll be sure to do that if need be.

101902122.content: We hear someone opening the door behind us.

101902126.content: Well, Tyr is a director at Aether Gazer. I'm sure he has a lot on his plate.

101902127.content: We should go back and say goodbye to Mira. I hope that Millis gets better soon.

101902128.content: Even though we can't quite investigate Masson-Nalen's role in the incident, we can still do our best to help Millis recover.

101902129.content: It's time to relax and enjoy a well-deserved break—at least that's what we are thinking at the moment.

101903001.content: The issue with Masson-Nalen had come to a close. Shu is about to get back to her very busy schedule tomorrow. Looks like everything is getting back to normal.

101903002.content: But this very evening, I see Shu in the canteen after I clocked out, and am struck by how anxious she looks. She's sitting in front of her laptop with an untouched coffee by her side, fingers dancing over the keyboard.

101903004.content: I was going to look for you, Admin... Come! Take a look at this.

101903005.content: Shu waves me over to the seat next to her and rotates the laptop screen toward me.

101903006.content: It's a news report prominently displayed on a popular website. The report is a simple document in a simple format, listing a whole bunch of company names and their basic details.

101903007.content: Shu's mouse highlights a certain name: Masson-Nalen Energy Limited.

101903009.content: Disclosure announcement from the Aether Gazer External Investment Department for the next quarter. It just came out.

101903010.content: I've always been the one in charge of approving which companies get onto our investable list. Of course, I had to leave that duty to someone else because of the clean-up. And now they've approved some projects in my absence.

101903011.content: We are going to increase our stake in Masson-Nalen?

101903012.content: Yes. Looks like they didn't consider the risk of the company's recent change of administrative personnel, and they didn't conduct a thorough investigation into Masson-Nalen's operations, either. Increasing our stake looks like a fairly obvious low-level mistake to me.

101903013.content: And it's not just Masson-Nalen... The list is filled with other companies that I rejected in the past. I don't think anyone on the Board of Directors would dare contradict my earlier decisions.

101903014.content: The investment plan comes from the External Investment Department, right? So maybe someone decided on it themselves...

101903015.content: The director of External Investment is Arrogan. He should be the one ultimately responsible for drafting this. I sent him an email about it. He hasn't replied yet.

101903016.content: Additionally, there was a report issued by a publisher controlled by another investment group in Core City called "Golden Sky Investments." They are saying that there were widespread quality control issues with the gas systems provided by Masson-Nalen in the shelters, and are using that as an angle to attack us—Masson-Nalen's investor and backer.

101903017.content: So why release the investment plan at this moment in particular? ...Does it have something to do with this report criticizing us? They know I'm not just going to sit here and accept it, so they want to use the opportunity of my absence to...

101903018.content: Shu's hypothesis of corporate malfeasance is starting to get to me. I already have a headache. The story, which was picked up on multiple news outlets, is proving to be very popular as the number of comments critical of Aether Gazer's involvement grows.

101903019.content: If we don't do something to resolve this now, our reputation as an enabler of evil corporate misdeeds will be forever cemented in the eyes of the public.

101903020.content: Shu resolutely closes her laptop and lifts the now cold cup of mostly not drunk coffee to her lips, and drinks it all in one big gulp.

101903021.content: I'm ending my vacation right here and right now. Unfortunately.

101903022.content: We'll have plenty more opportunities for vacations in the future.

101903023.content: Taking over the work so abruptly will be tricky, Administrator. Would you mind giving me a hand?

101903025.content: We make our way down on the elevator. Shu has already given me a new work schedule—or perhaps I should say a new "plan of action." Basically, we have to split up to make this fast.

101903026.content: Shu heads in one direction to convene the Board of Directors to formally take her old position back as soon as possible. I am tasked with finding Tyr, who was informed earlier, to get his help following up on Shu's concerns with our External Investment Department.

101903027.content: If we really have a problem with this Arrogan fellow, then I'm going to need to...

101903028.content: Apprehend him on the spot? Well, if he is guilty of a major breach of company protocol, we do have the right to forcibly keep him in his office for a brief period of time.

101903029.content: Shu's access card opens my way through layer upon layer of otherwise restricted doors in the Division Three until I finally meet Tyr.

101903030.content: He nods at my explanation of Shu's plan and various worries about the investment plan, and then gets up to leave with me.

101903031.content: Let's go. With me onsite, it should be easier for us to get to the bottom of this.
