101903032.content: With Tyr by my side, we have no problems getting through the corridors, and we head straight for External Investment.

101903033.content: Feels like I won't be doing much but letting them know Tyr's coming...

101903035.content: Nothing. Just wondering how Shu's doing.

101903036.content: I was just following up on the Board of Directors when you came. I don't know if it's a glass half full or half empty thing.

101903037.content: Just tell me the glass is half full.

101903038.content: Ha! I like people with a bit of optimism.

101903039.content: Shu has been a towering presence in the company and over the Board of Directors for such a long time. A lot of the "old hands" are afraid of upsetting her by doing literally anything. So, it turns out, no one wanted to take over her job. The position stayed vacant... I suppose that's why so little has come out of the board these past few days.

101903040.content: Even I am shocked by the situation.

101903041.content: The attitude of the other directors seems to be "better to do nothing at all than do something wrong." They're too used to saving their own skin.

101903042.content: If that's the case, I don't see how the investment plan could have gotten the board's approval. So it's true? Someone have just made that decision all by themself?

101903043.content: ...Just a snake who managed to pull the wool over the eyes of the sheep, with promises of rewards. Nothing serious.

101903044.content: I don't think that Shu will run into too many obstacles. It's just... there would be a stockpile of work waiting for her... and now she also has to deal with this mess.

101903045.content: We'd be much better off focusing on what to do next rather than on who is responsible for the investment plan. The worst is yet to come. The plan is already out there in the open. Whether we withdraw that plan or not, Aether Gazer takes a reputational hit either way.

101903046.content: The only question is whether we try to label the plan a "mistake in corporate direction" or withdraw it as an "error of management"... If it was up to you, what would you prefer, Administrator?

101903048.content: Yes. I think most people would interpret withdrawing a plan that had already been approved as an act of incompetence. They would claim that such action would harm the company's investment credit. But I think that Shu would rather take that hit than push something out of line with her philosophy.

101903049.content: Maybe withdrawing the plan is the better option...

101903050.content: Indeed. Shu has always been very focused on Aether Gazer's responsibility to society. It seems that she has had an impact on you, too.

101903051.content: And it's not just her that will be very busy when that moment comes, but the entire corporation.

101903052.content: We turn a corner. The large door of the General Director of the External Investment Department is at the other end of the corridor. The door is slightly ajar, and we can hear, even at this distance, the sound of a middle-aged man trying desperately to hide the panic in his shouts.

101903054.content: Because of that report? Golden Sky Investments! It's definitely them!

101903055.content: Ah! Dammit! Why did they keep getting in my way?!

101903056.content: It almost sounds like a confession to me. Tyr and I each take a side of the corridor as we move down to the office.

101903057.content: We are only around five meters away from the door when a man in an expensive suit rushes out of the office, slams the door behind him, and then collides into us.

101903058.content: D-D-Director Tyr. What brings you here?

101903059.content: Clocking out already, Arrogan? You look... hurried. Is there any... urgent affair you need to attend to?

101903060.content: Yes... Y-Yeah... And excuse me... who is this?

101903061.content: Director Shu's temporary assistant. I'm here to convey her will.

101903062.content: Arrogan's breath stalls at the sound of Shu's name. Sweat appears on his brow. His smile becomes increasingly forced.

101903063.content: Don't worry about it. Masson-Nalen had... contacted me before. If something happens, I'll help you cover it up.

101903064.content: The man's expression of panic recedes a bit, as if he had just been thrown a lifeline.

101903066.content: Arrogan's face turns white as he speaks that word out. He is in such a panicked state that he doesn't seem to be able to properly interpret a carrot dangled in front of him.

101903067.content: And like all animals who are threatened, Arrogan reacts with his instincts—he starts running.

101903068.content: Arrogan is surprisingly spry for a middle-aged man. His desire to survive prompts him to sprints at top speed. He even manages to glide past the narrow gap between me and Tyr toward the other end of the hallway.

101903069.content: Security! We have two intruders! Stop them! Security!

101903070.content: Arrogan shouts for help at the top of his voice. I stop Tyr, who is thinking of doing something a little more forceful. But it really wouldn't look good for one of Aether Gazer's directors to beat up a subordinate in front of everyone—no matter how annoying.

101903071.content: You sure you can handle this?

101903072.content: I may not be a Modifier, but I've had a little bit of combat training.

101903073.content: I flex my muscles and then rush off after Arrogan. I'm a lot faster.

101903074.content: A member of security reacts immediately to Arrogan's shouts for help. They chase after me, but basically all of them stop when Tyr appears. Several of the younger guards, who clearly don't know who Tyr is, circle around. I easily break past them.

101903075.content: There are more people in the main atrium, and hardly any of them would dare block the path of a senior executive like Arrogan. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for a relative stranger like myself...

101903078.content: There are just too many people between me and Arrogan. I have to slow down. Just as I think I'm about to lose him, he suddenly stopped.

101903079.content: Arrogan is in flagrant violation of company protocol and suspected of egregious misuse of corporate authority for his own benefit! And anyone who tries to support him can expect the same penalty!

101903080.content: A booming female voice echoes throughout the atrium. I use the opportunity to get behind Arrogan and, with a well practiced wrestling move, quickly have him on the ground with me.

101903081.content: I lift my head to see none other than a half-smiling Shu in front of the elevator.

101903084.content: It looks like Tyr wasn't kidding when he calls Shu a towering presence in the company. It doesn't matter what Arrogan screams or yells, no one is willing to lift a finger against Shu in his favor.

101903085.content: Tyr quickly confirms Shu's orderly resumption of her Director of the Board powers before heading back to Division Three. Shu and I together haul Arrogan back to his office for an impromptu interrogation.

101903086.content: I have several things to discuss with you. Remain silent and I will take that as a yes. Speak if you wish to disagree.

101903087.content: And by the way, we've already opened up an investigation into your recent conduct. I've learned quite a few things already from those in the know. So don't waste my time with any lies.

101903088.content: Shu ignores the murderous look from Arrogan's hate-filled eyes as she sits behind the desk and starts casually throwing out questions at him.

101903089.content: The next quarter's investment plan never passed a formal resolution of the board. Yet you took the opportunity in my absence to publish it anyway, and took bribes from several of the companies I'd previously blacklisted.

101903091.content: Shortly after the disaster in Duskfall, the chief manager of Masson-Nalen Energy, Mr. Black, came to you for an emergency injection of funds. You used the extra money left over from your current investment budget for a private, unauthorized loan to Masson-Nalen.

101903093.content: Black was able to use this injection of funds to rapidly expand Masson-Nalen's production to take advantage of the tremendous energy needs in the disaster zone. But you knew about Masson-Nalen's quality control issues from the very beginning. And you knew they were suppressing customer complaints.

101903094.content: And what does that have to do with me? It's Masson-Nalen's fault! It's their products!

101903095.content: It has a lot to do with you, given that you gave them an unauthorized loan. And they could only do it because of your loan.

101903096.content: What else do you have to say?

101903097.content: Arrogan lifts his head again and glares with absolutely hatred at Shu. He smiles, but it is not a smile of confidence. More like the smile of one who knows he has been defeated.

101903098.content: I don't get you. Masson-Nalen is an excellent company with lots of long-term potential. Don't you understand the returns we could get from investing with them? What kind of manager would I be if I didn't take the money that was free for the taking?

101903099.content: The ink would already be dry on the deal were it not for Golden Sky's meddling! I have no idea where they got that information, but if they didn't post that damn report, and you did not intervene, we would be swimming in money from the deal soon enough. Everyone understands this except you!

101903100.content: The faulty gas pipes Masson-Nalen provided are responsible for the gas poisoning of at least one eight-year-old girl. The company rejected any compensation out of hand, blaming the mother for improperly handling the heater...

101903101.content: Does that sound like an excellent company to you?

101903102.content: Hah! So some girl got hurt. What does that prove? You're making mountains out of molehills! Anyway, she got cured, didn't she? Everyone has product quality issues—especially at the start! They've already fixed the issue! Why do you have to derail the plan because of one minor case?

101903103.content: I'm not concerned with the absolute number of product quality issues, but the attitude they represent. What I see is a company that doesn't want to own up to its own mistakes, but takes it out on vulnerable consumers instead. They don't deserve to partner with our corporation.

101903104.content: Yes, yes, of course—so says the high and mighty Director Shu, who will lead us all into the glorious sunset of corporate social responsibility with her mighty investments.

101903105.content: By this point, Arrogan seems to have lost whatever respect or fear he once held for Shu. Hysterical, he yells at the top of his voice.

101903106.content: Look outside, my wonderful and pure-hearted director! Look at our competitors! They're getting bigger and bigger! They're gobbling up the resources that could have been ours! Keep this up and Aether Gazer is no longer going to be one of the head companies in Ain Soph!

101903107.content: And so what did the Board of Directors do when it's time to publish the investment plan? They said nothing! Not a single word of feedback. They just collect a paycheck and go home. Am I the only one who actually wants to do something? What am I supposed to say to the market? How am I supposed to explain it to my colleagues in External Investment?

101903108.content: If you dare fire me, I tell you: I'll be snatched up by another company before the day is out and for a higher salary! And I'm going to help your competitor become the biggest, baddest investment group among all of Ain Soph. And you... You can watch as your ethical investing dreams die!

101903109.content: Arrogan's unseemly yelling has brought an eerie sense of silence to the office. I think I hear a sigh from Shu, standing behind me.

101903110.content: I don't care where you go, Arrogan... And if that's your wish, then fine. You're fired.

101903111.content: It sounds like this wasn't the first time Shu had fired someone like Arrogan. Makes sense after so many years on the board.

101903113.content: Arrogan is covered in sweat, which quite visible on his shirt. He doesn't wait for Shu's reply. He simply walks out with a cold and angry look. Shu just lets him go, shaking her head when I make a move to stop him.

101903114.content: It looks like I'm the only one in the room genuinely surprised at this turn of events. It was so hard to chase the man down. Are we really just going to let him walk away?

101903115.content: Arrogan disappears down a corridor. I can't suppress my question any longer.

101903116.content: Are we just going to let him walk away?

101903118.content: Don't you think that we should... um... restrain him? Or at least do something?

101903119.content: Shu is initially a bit puzzled by my question. However, I quickly realize the flaw in my logic myself.

101903120.content: Administrator, we're a company. We're not an arm of law enforcement...

101903121.content: After fighting so many battles at Division Nine—against Visbanes—I'd almost forgotten this wasn't the normal course of action here.

101903122.content: Here, it isn't up to us to maintain public order. Even if we wish to fix society's ills, that doesn't mean we have the authority to do so.

101903123.content: But he's going to be punished, right?

101903124.content: It's hard to say whether a competitor will genuinely take on the risk of charges of corporate conspiracy by accepting Arrogan into their ranks.

101903125.content: More importantly, the people of Duskfall affected by the faulty gas pipes won't forgive him, nor will Ain Soph's legal system if they can find evidence of negligence. At end of the day, he has violated the trust of the people, and that is unforgivable.

101903126.content: And I'm going to withdraw our investment partnerships from those companies that I had rightly put on my blacklist. And this will mean quite a lot of extra work...

101903127.content: As Shu's new assistant, I pick up on her meaning and gently pat my chest, smiling.

101903128.content: Didn't you say, Shu, you'd let me know if you needed my help?

101904001.content: With Shu's help, Aether Gazer quickly withdraws the investment plans and issues a statement explaining that it had experienced an incident with management, which delved into Arrogan's sordid actions in great detail.

101904002.content: Many people don't buy the story, since it smacks so much of a company using a sacrificial lamb to clear itself of wrongdoing. In fact, it seems only to unite the chorus of criticism against Aether Gazer further.

101904003.content: Public opinion only starts to move in our favor once CORG arrests Arrogan and Black, and also issues Masson-Nalen with an enormous fine, as well as a cease and desist from further operations.

101904004.content: Aether Gazer also has to hand over some money for breaking those contracts signed by Arrogan, but at least we protected our public image as an corporation that still cares about the greater social good. What's more, the Board of Directors and our major shareholders strongly approve of the way that Shu handled it.

101904005.content: And what price did we pay? What was the cost? Me!

101904006.content: I sit in one corner of the canteen, eyes closed, as I slowly bring each spoonful to my mouth, enjoying the beautiful sensation of a meal and my "resurrection" from a horrible workload.

101904007.content: I had once again experienced the pain—during these tough three days as the "Director's Assistant"—that I had suffered days after the disaster when she had handed her responsibilities over to me.

101904008.content: Now I finally have a chance to enjoy a simple lunch in peace. Shu sits across from me. I'm not interested in maintaining my dining manners. I'm just really hungry.

101904010.content: Today, just for today... Can I just not care about eating healthy?

101904011.content: I'm sorry. I underestimated your workload. It's not easy to find a qualified director's assistant. Most need quite a lot of experience.

101904012.content: For you to have done as well as you did without any prior experience is actually quite surprising.

101904013.content: I learned on the job. Not to compare myself with anyone, but I think I'm a fast learner.

101904014.content: It reminds me a lot of when I first came to the General Office. I had no idea what was going on. It's only thanks to your and Mimir's patient guidance that I was able to pick up the pace.

101904015.content: And as for this time, it's thanks to you, Shu, that I've learned so much. And I'm sure if I want to become a director's assistant now, I'll be a lot closer to qualifying!

101904016.content: I shuddered inwardly at my words. I'm not sure three bowls of junk food will be quite enough for me to repair my wounded psyche after enduring nearly three days and nights without sleep.

101904017.content: Rest assured, Administrator, that your role in Division Nine is perfectly safe—until the next major emergency.

101904018.content: And, of course, I'll do everything I can to ensure that doesn't happen...

101904019.content: Tyr was right about one thing: There are problems in the company structure brewing further issues down the line. And I'm not sure it's enough for me just to put out fires as soon as they occur... I really should implement some changes.

101904020.content: Well, if that's what you think, I'm sure you can do it.

101904022.content: Unconditional? Of course not! Seeing the larger-than-life role you play at Aether Gazer, I don't think anyone would have any doubt of your capacity to implement your own vision in the company.

101904023.content: Sounds a lot like a dictator...

101904025.content: The basis of your authority comes simply from the fact that—whether that's a low-level employee or someone in upper management—everyone here in the company really trusts you and has lot of faith in you. And that could not be more different from a dictator... (Burp)

101904026.content: The rumbling in my stomach is telling me that I am getting dangerously full.

101904027.content: Ugh... I'd like to go for a walk outside.

101904028.content: I've finished almost everything assigned to me except for a few last dregs. But I'm determined to follow it through. I don't want Shu reassigning that to anyone else.

101904029.content: I roughly calculate my remaining workload. I should still have enough time to finish everything today even if I only come back after dinner.

101904032.content: I notice as I walk past the first section of Duskfall earmarked for reconstruction. It looked quite different compared to only a few days ago on Shu's video live stream.

101904033.content: Most of the buildings—even those badly damaged by the Quakes—have been largely restored. Residents are already starting to return to the relatively more intact structures. After all that tragedy, Duskfall is finally coming alive again.

101904034.content: Shu suggests we walk past the area that she had patrolled earlier. There we walk, side-by-side, on nice flat roads that have recently been paved.

101904035.content: The clouds soften some of the harsh sunlight from the glare of the midday sun. The wide open roads feel a bit like we're wandering across the plains, and a gentle breeze whirls about.

101904036.content: Quite a few people recognize the Aether Gazer logos on our outfits. There is a certain amount of distrust, it seems, in their expressions.

101904037.content: Looks like it'll be a long, hard road when it comes to rebuilding our damaged reputation...

101904038.content: Everyone's busy. No one has time to do their own research. All they know is Aether Gazer was mentioned in connection to a scandal. Fair enough, I suppose. Better to spur us on to do better next time.

101904039.content: One of our first steps to righting past wrongs is that we've launched a new charitable investment fund to help businesses move into the New Duskfall at lowest cost.

101904040.content: What about our competitors? Surely they'll see this as an opportunity as well.

101904041.content: Three days of being my assistant, Admin, and you're better at this business stuff already.

101904042.content: You're right. Golden Sky has publicly announced they want to partner with us. Obviously they want to hitch a ride on our coat tails. And we can't say no because of how it would look.

101904043.content: Looks like a little bit of a game of wits is shaping up... But I hope nothing like what happened with Masson-Nalen happens again.

101904044.content: The men responsible are now in prison. Everyone is aware of the corporate malfeasance that took place. If there's anything good to be said about the Masson-Nalen incident, it's that it's a constant reminder for us all to be vigilant about corporate practices.

101904045.content: I had wanted to take the whole Modifier patrol route, but I'm starting to feel it may be a bit too long.

101904046.content: I need to be sure I still have enough juice left over to finish my work once we get back to Aether Gazer. So, we took a shortcut.

101904048.content: ...I wouldn't have remembered, but for the scenery.

101904049.content: The standalone house that we're looking at is surrounded by lush greenery. A number of fine ornaments hangs around the eaves and walls of the house. There are a number of small, paper pinwheels attached to the pillars of the awnings.

101904050.content: Millis just got out of the hospital yesterday, right? So they have already moved back here from the shelter today?

101904053.content: I follow Shu's line-of-sight over to a far corner of the wall. A little girl is peeking out from behind, sizing me and Shu up with her dark eyes.

101904054.content: What are you doing crouching behind that wall, Millis?

101904055.content: Her mother's voice comes from behind the wall.

101904057.content: The mother comes out carrying a vase of flowers. She's very surprised to see us.

101904058.content: Hello! Are you here in Duskfall on business?

101904059.content: Just having a look at the reconstruction. I take it moving back in went smoothly?

101904060.content: Can't complain. The house is mostly undamaged. And we're very comfortable back here. We're just so thankful for all of the treatment that you provided Millis... very thankful.

101904061.content: This happened because of a mistake by one of our senior managers. We should be the ones apologizing.

101904062.content: Don't say that! Aether Gazer has done so much for the reconstruction. And I'm sure there must be a lot of other people that you've helped, just like you helped me.

101904063.content: Most folks at the shelter were really impressed how Aether Gazer owned up to the mistake with Masson-Nalen. We know there's a lot of negative press out there... But I think most people really believe in you!

101904064.content: Millis' mother is quite sincere in her choice of words, and she thanks us again—this time with some yellow lilies that she planted herself.

101904065.content: I look at Shu, who seems positively delighted with the gift.

101904066.content: It looks like Shu's views and dedication to society is being recognized, and laying the seeds of hope that we will continue to do likewise going forward. I'm sure that's her biggest motivation for working so tirelessly for the board.

101904067.content: Phew. That's the last of it.

101904068.content: I finally finish all of my work just before midnight. Then I walk through Aether Gazer's enormous, but completely empty, hallways with my satchel of documents to the elevator up to Shu's office.

101904069.content: I'm hoping she's returned home to sleep... but also accept that it's highly unlikely.

101904070.content: Shu's office light is off, but the door is slightly ajar. I open it a crack just in case she's sleeping on her chair. I don't want to disturb her.

101904072.content: The soft light from Shu's computer screen casts a pale glow over one corner of the office. She is still sitting there, typing away on the keyboard with her right hand as she cradles a mug of coffee with her left.

101904073.content: The warm aroma from the coffee fills the office, and makes Shu look somehow quite relaxed even though she's still crunching away deep into the night.

101904074.content: You haven't gone home yet, Admin? It's so late.

101904075.content: And look lazy in front of my overworking boss? I don't dare.

101904076.content: You'll get fired if you keep talking to your boss like this.

101904077.content: I don't know how I haven't been let go yet...

101904078.content: Our fun little conversation gives me a burst of energy. I pull up a chair next to Shu and hand her the documents.

101904079.content: Alright then. I'll take a look tomorrow.

101904080.content: Not worried I made a mistake?

101904081.content: You haven't handed over anything with a mistake in it for the last three days. You're a very reliable assistant, Administrator.

101904082.content: Shu looks at me sideways from her office desk with a clean smile illuminated by the moonlight glow-lit computer. Her compliment makes me a bit... uncomfortable?

101904083.content: Haha... I'm not good at taking compliments.

101904084.content: Um... What are you busy with?

101904085.content: We've reopened the portal for companies to request partnerships with us—since cleaning up the mess with Arrogan's investment plan.

101904086.content: The External Investment Department has come up with quite a lot of new partnership proposals in the last few days, and we really need to get them looked at. There's going to be trouble later if we can't move the investment pipeline along like old times.

101904087.content: Investment plan... I remember you saying that Masson-Nalen was invested by Aether Gazer when it was newly established.

101904088.content: But the company changed with a change of its manager, and we couldn't fix their mistakes... Makes me feel like all your hard work went to waste.

101904089.content: Sigh... You get used to it.

101904090.content: Shu is scanning through submission after submission on her computer monitor from companies eager to partner with Aether Gazer. Some of them are established brands looking for a massive cash injection to broaden their business, and others are lean and hungry up-and-comers.

101904091.content: Not many businesses can retain a consistent vision... The operational difficulties and the temptation of profits just become too much.

101904092.content: Here at Aether Gazer, what we want to provide these companies with is not success, but hope. We can't control what happens to them in the future. But we can recognize them right now for doing the right thing.

101904093.content: And if they really believe that their philosophical ship can sail in the same direction as us, and if they're willing to put in the hard yards to make it work, then at least Aether Gazer can be another reason to stay the course.

101904094.content: Giving hope to those who deserve it?

101904095.content: Yes... And, of course, I often feel that—even to me—it's an endless journey. Just like the job of the Modifiers.

101904096.content: Well then, whether it's for Aether Gazer's lofty aims, or the work of the Modifiers, I'll do my best to help you in any way I can.

101904097.content: Shu smiles at me. Her gaze lingers, as if she's looking for something in my eyes.

101904098.content: Is it evidence that we share the same views? Evidence of my determination? Or perhaps hope... Maybe something of a nature for which no proof can be asked.

101904099.content: The world should be at peace, and tragedies must be stopped when they can. Aether Gazer will always remain committed to its mission of modifying the imperfections of the world.

101904100.content: Haha... Good to see you're so enthusiastic about our work.

101904101.content: Shu passes the cup in her hand over to me.

101904102.content: In that case, do you mind fetching me another cup of coffee? It is your job, after all. My dear assistant.

103301003.content: The red warning light in the Cryptics' lab is making the dead silent atmosphere even more alarming.

103301004.content: For the past 15 minutes, the members of the Cryptics have been quietly watching Heimdall and Ookuninushi argue. As a brief silence falls over the room, everyone wonders how the two of them are going to end this fight.

103301005.content: Tell me, how many times have you caused the lab server to crash now?

103301007.content: ...And would you care to explain to me where the "half a time" comes from?

103301008.content: It's from the experiment we did together - the one you wanted to examine the resonance effect of Bane Energy in free state.

103301009.content: But that was because you were trying to artificially create Divine Grace by generating a Tarot Circle using electromagnetic energy. You tripped up, set off two experiments at once, and overloaded the server!

103301010.content: And this time around, if only you had tested the server load before you decided to go to town with that cumbersome wave energy weapon...

103301011.content: How can you call it cumbersome??? Every invention has its application!

103301012.content: Ookuninushi is clearly not convinced that she's in the wrong and angrily turns her head away even before she is done explaining.

103301013.content: You don't care what I think anyway! Do you have any idea how many tries it takes to turn a new technology into a usable application?

103301015.content: A mere theoretician like you, Heimdall, will never understand just how difficult application is!!!

103301016.content: The server has finished rebooting, bringing back the cold light of the light strip to the lab and making it feel as bright as day. But now that the two of them can see each other more clearly, an awkward tension settles in.

103301017.content: Realizing that she has probably gone a bit too far in the argument, Ookuninushi bites her lip and hastily leaves.

103301018.content: ... Alright, let's get back to work, everyone.

103301019.content: The onlookers are gone. Heimdall feels a fatigue that's distinct from the mental exhaustion of solving scientific problems. She returns to her desk, sits down, and presses a cat button.

103301020.content: A blue-haloed M.E.O.W. slowly emerges from the corner and comes over to Heimdall to await her instruction.

103301021.content: Researcher Heimdall. Mitir is currently operating normally. Please enter your command.

103301022.content: Heimdall's expression softens as she pets Mitir's head.

103301023.content: Tell me about the damage we've taken in this crash.

103301024.content: The team's database was backed up as scheduled three minutes before the server shut down. The crash has affected data from 24 routine documents, five Level I experiments, one Level II experiment, and one Level III experiment.

103301025.content: With the exception of the Level III experiment headed by Researcher Ookuninushi, all other lost data can be restored with manual intervention.

103301026.content: So, she's actually the one most affected by the crash...

103301027.content: Am I being too harsh on her...?

103301028.content: Heimdall didn't really think Ookuninushi had gone too far with her parting shot as she had no evidence to refute her claims anyway.

103301029.content: Give me a comparison of my and Ookuninushi's papers and inventions over the last year.

103301030.content: Researcher Heimdall: 12 papers and 6 inventions over the past 12 months.

103301031.content: Researcher Ookuninushi: 4 papers and 18 inventions in the same period.

103301032.content: Despite working in the same lab and dedicating all their time to their researches, the two of them have produced dramatically different outputs.

103301033.content: "Experience without theory is blind, and theory without experience is mere intellectual play."... I understand that idea very well.

103301034.content: But to say that I don't understand practice and application is... hmph... really hard for me to accept.

103301035.content: Researcher Heimdall, the system is able to perform continuous logging on all five of your current experiments. Do you wish to check the completeness of the experiment logs?

103301036.content: Heimdall doesn't say a word, although she does look at Mitir for a while. She is clearly thinking something over.

103301038.content: Command not recognized. Researcher Heimdall, please describe what you need in more detail.

103301039.content: The following day, in my office.

103301040.content: My visitor hands me a proposal. As I open it and skim through, I cannot help but feel increasingly flustered.

103301041.content: Um... May I ask... what the purpose of this is, Heimdall?

103301042.content: Given the knowledge gap between myself and the Cryptics, I usually try to be more careful with applications and proposals coming from that direction...

103301043.content: Ever since she found out about my concerns, Heimdall has taken the effort to bring her proposals to me in person so that she can try to help me better understand the science behind them. Just like what she's doing now.

103301044.content: "A New AI Application Module for Mitir."

103301045.content: Basically, I made an AI module that will allow Mitir to use the theories in our database to invent, design, or solve problems on his own.

103301046.content: ... Could you be a little more specific...?

103301047.content: I'm afraid that's as specific as I can get, Administrator.

103301048.content: At this point, I've only written the core logic for the module. As Mitir learns over time, it will grow into a comprehensive logic network, but I'm not sure what that would turn out.

103301049.content: During the learning process, Mitir will try to identify potential theory applications, and expand his knowledge by assessing their effectiveness.

103301050.content: A "comprehensive logic network"... so, you're saying an artificial intelligence like, say, Mimir?

103301051.content: Yes, but Mimir's intelligence level is not what I'm aiming for with Mitir. I'd rather Mitir doesn't become as um, um... How would I put it...?

103301053.content: Heimdall pauses for a moment and starts chuckling at my rather apt description.

103301054.content: Hmm, if I recall correctly, Heimdall, weren't you the one who developed all the M.E.O.W.s around here? Should we also install this, um, module in the other M.E.O.W.s as well...?

103301055.content: Even if I wanted to do so, the intelligence upgrade isn't suitable for all M.E.O.W.s.

103301056.content: As you know, Administrator, Mitir has always helped the Cryptics in their research work. He is also the only M.E.O.W. that I maintain myself.

103301057.content: Mitir may look a little clumsy on the outside, but he has already accumulated vast amounts of theoretical and experimental data, which gives him a solid foundation for a more advanced understanding of the world.

103301058.content: With Mitir, I am confident that I can bring his intelligence level beyond that of a mere assistant's...

103301059.content: I get you... So you want to make Mitir a great scientist, just like you!

103301060.content: Heimdall stares at me with a rather odd look on her face.

103301061.content: That wasn't what I was thinking, actually...

103301062.content: Heimdall tells me about the argument she had with Ookuninushi the day before.

103301063.content: ... Scientists and their need to prove themselves!

103301064.content: But since this is a technical problem, I place my full trust in this scholar who has already brought countless new technologies to Aether Gazer.

103301065.content: I understand. Since you're confident, Heimdall, go ahead and take that shot.

103301066.content: Alright. I'll reset Mitir to his current state if any problem crops up.

103301067.content: However, I have to ask you for a favor, Administrator.

103301069.content: I hear Heimdall out. It's not really a "favor" per se but part of my job description to begin with.

103301070.content: All trial and pilot proposals generated by Mitir in the course of his learning will come under the Cryptics, and I am the one who has to review them...

103301072.content: This has to be the first time ever that Mitir has flown to me on his own accord and greeted me. Typically, whenever I come to the Cryptics' office, Mitir would be quietly sitting in the corner until he's summoned.

103301073.content: While he still looks the same from the outside, I can tell that something in Mitir has changed, and quite significantly at that.

103301074.content: Tell me about your proposal, Mitir. I'll evaluate it for feasibility while the Administrator will assess it for practicality.

103301076.content: Mitir pulls up a holographic screen in front of us that contains a rather detailed design proposal.

103301077.content: Regarding the poor communications quality issue that can crop up in the Source Layer, Mitir can try to establish a communication node network on the Source Layer using Type IV miniature optical signal towers. Additionally, Anti-Bane Energy coatings and signal relay hubs may prove useful.

103301078.content: These nodes will be powered by the free data in the Source Layer in line with Energy Conversion Equation No. 21. As long as there are enough nodes, Modifiers will be able to enjoy smooth communications when they are out on missions in the Source Layer...

103301079.content: Although I don't quite understand what Mitir is saying, I can tell from the look on Heimdall's face that this probably isn't a great idea.

103301080.content: The huge amount of manpower we'll need to install all these nodes in the Source Layer aside... The anti-Bane Energy coating will interfere with the optic signals, and the physical changes that take place in the Source Layer will also cause damage to these nodes.

103301082.content: Mitir does not try to defend his proposal. Instead, he immediately proceeds to the next one.

103301084.content: Regarding the issue of a mismatch in supply and demand of goods in the vending machines in the Aether Gazer building, Mitir has examined historical sales data to develop a set of weekly purchase orders.

103301085.content: Using these purchase orders will allow everyone to buy all the goods that they want, and vending machine capacity will only need to be expanded by 30%.

103301086.content: Heimdall looks at me, and I shake my head without any hesitation.

103301087.content: Our suppliers are not going to be willing to handle purchase orders on a weekly basis. I'm also not sure if it's worth to get bigger vending machines all round...

103301088.content: Besides, don't we all end up buying whatever we see in the machine anyway? There's also the option of takeout... I don't think this is that relevant.

103301090.content: This isn't going as well as I thought it would.

103301091.content: Mitir continues to present a stream of proposals, each outlandish in its own way, that are either not technically feasible or do not have much real practical significance. We go through a dozen or so of these proposals and reject each and every single one of them.

103301092.content: As expected, we're seeing unsatisfactory results in the initial stage... that can only be used as the basis for further trial-and-error. Looks like there are still some problems in terms of the direction the logic network is taking...

103301093.content: Heimdall scoops up Mitir in her arms. These results don't seem to be surprising to her. But she still looks a little apologetic nevertheless...

103301095.content: Do you think we should give Mitir some... directional prompts, Heimdall? Do you think that'd help?

103301096.content: Hmm. Providing prompts may introduce certain biases into the logic network... but that may be okay in the early stages.

103301097.content: Do you have any ideas, Administrator?

103301098.content: When I see Heimdall petting Mitir as if he is a pet animal, an idea very naturally comes to my mind.

103301099.content: Why don't we try solving your most recent problem first, Heimdall?

103301100.content: Impossible, Administrator. Mitir is currently not equipped to handle the issues that I'm encountering in my research...

103301102.content: Mitir and Heimdall have come up with diametrically opposed reactions.

103301103.content: In fact, Mitir actually has one more proposal for your perusal. It is a proposal that perfectly fits the Administrator's suggestion.

103301105.content: Horse racing predictions. Mitir understands that you've been troubled by this issue for the last two months, Researcher Heimdall.

103301106.content: Horse racing? What does that have to do with Heimdall?

103301107.content: Heimdall's finger is hovering over Mitir's sleep button in a flash. However, she eventually decides against pressing it in the end.

103301108.content: Researcher Heimdall is a long-time fan of the races. However, none of her predictions over the last two months have turned out right. In Mitir's opinion, this is a problem that is very much worth solving.

103301109.content: Is Mitir speaking the truth? I look over at Heimdall for the answer to my question. Heimdall, the bespectacled "picture of reason" in our labs, blushes slightly, and then nods at me with some difficulty.

103301110.content: I may be the only person in Aether Gazer who knows about this...

103301111.content: Building a good predictive model requires scientific rigor, and this project will at least help us evaluate whether Mitir is capable of independent research. I... have no objections.

103301112.content: I may not know a thing about horse racing, but... this sounds like it's going to be interesting.

103301113.content: Shall we go to the races together if I can find the time? Let's bring Mitir along, too.

103301114.content: Heimdall doesn't quite know what to do with the rather sudden invite to the races, but she keeps her composure and does not let any embarrassment or shyness show.

103301115.content: She pushes up her glasses and walks towards me, and then hands Mitir over.

103301116.content: You can talk to Mitir first if you wish to learn more about horse racing.

103301117.content: ... You've got to brush up on your race knowledge before Saturday. Otherwise, it'll be a very boring day out for you.

103302002.content: Hmm. It doesn't look like the commentators think very highly of Number Four.

103302003.content: I am standing at the entrance to the Core City Racetrack and peering at race info on my phone. I look up at the snaking queue in front of and behind me, and once again marvel at the popularity of the races.

103302004.content: I've been looking forward to my Saturday date at the races with Heimdall. However, with all that bustle around me it feels less like an outing by two friends and more like a carnival.

103302005.content: Number Four, Golden Current, has been out of action due to injury. This is his first outing on the tracks in a year.

103302006.content: He was a champion that had earned himself the nickname "Mach-Speed Current." However, given his injury I think it's safe to say that his fitness has suffered...

103302007.content: Number Seven, Snowlord, is the favorite to win... And that is a sensible judgment. After all, she's a three-time champion that is currently on a hot streak.

103302008.content: Oh, is that so? I just placed my vote for Golden Current. I was looking forward to getting that winner's plush toy...

103302009.content: A three-time champion versus a veteran long hobbled by injury. Mitir, are you sure your algorithms don't need adjusting?

103302010.content: Mitir will watch the telecast of today's races remotely along with us to see if his predictions are accurate.

103302011.content: The theoretical accuracy of Mitir's predictions is 95%.

103302012.content: "Theoretical accuracy," huh... But I suppose if you don't make the right guess your actual accuracy would be... zero?

103302013.content: In addition, Golden Current has been a favorite of Researcher Heimdall for quite some time. Please have more faith in him.

103302014.content: Oops. I look over at Heimdall with a little sheepishness.

103302016.content: Heimdall pushes up her glasses again. But she doesn't seem to mind that I've become less sure of her favored equine.

103302017.content: Don't worry too much, Administrator... I've taken a look at Mitir's predictive model, and it does look quite sound to me.

103302018.content: While a number of the parameters used in this model are a little unusual, even puzzling, his predictive accuracy has been shown to stand at 95% with historical data.

103302019.content: Typically in research, the basis for introducing a specific parameter is that of a cause-effect relationship. However, Mitir's approach is more like "proof by exhaustion"... Instead of using deductive reasoning, Mitir is looking for patterns in data...

103302020.content: Sounds like if anyone can pull this off, it's Mitir.

103302021.content: Yes. Methods that cannot be practically employed by humans are a piece of cake for Mitir.

103302022.content: With the sinking feeling that I cannot be any further from the winner's plushie, I enter the racetrack with Heimdall, and we walk amongst the crowd to our seats.

103302023.content: Cheers rise up all around us in the stands as the race horses make their appearance and trot into the starting gates. Heimdall and I, who are seated in the front row, are soon buoyed by the excitement around us.

103302024.content: Here they come! Number Seven and Number Four!

103302025.content: Snowlord, a horse that is pure white from head to tail, captures everyone's attention as soon as she walks out onto the course. With her elegant coat and aesthetically pleasing lines, it looks like she was born to rule the races.

103302026.content: Following closely behind Snowlord is Golden Current. However, instead of following the other horses into the starting gates, he heads towards the stands with the rider on his back, neighing with his head held high.

103302028.content: He must be excited to be on the racetrack and see the race-goers after so long.

103302029.content: Golden Current's show of exuberance seems to have jogged the memories of the regulars in the stands, and they begin applauding and cheering on Golden Current with great delight. The roar that ensues seems to be even greater than the one that occurred for Snowlord just moments before.

103302030.content: Whoa! You sure know your star horses, young lady.

103302031.content: There is a slightly older man to our side who is wearing a headband with the words "Golden Current" on it, and he becomes increasingly excited as he listens to Heimdall speak. Finally, a fellow fan of Golden Current!

103302032.content: These days, those with short memories know only of Snowlord the three-time champion. I remember in Golden Current's heyday——

103302033.content: Stories from yesteryear, gramps? I'm telling you! This is the age of the Snow King, mind you!

103302034.content: What? You have no idea what you're talking about! Golden Current was a legend!

103302035.content: The operative word being "was"! Golden Current is a has-been! An also-ran!

103302036.content: What?! You're itching for a fight, I see!

103302037.content: Another race-goer who appears to have thrown in his lot with Snowlord interrupts the man in his rhapsody, and the two begin a heated battle of words.

103302038.content: Heh, I must say that race-goers are a passionate lot... Do you think they'll actually fight?

103302039.content: Nah. That's just how things are at a racetrack. Once you've come a few more times, you'll see, Administrator.

103302040.content: ... I mean... IF you come back.

103302041.content: Heimdall looks away, as if she's realized that she's been a little presumptuous with her words, and quickly corrects herself.

103302042.content: Horse racing is probably a subject that is rarely brought up in the Cryptics' labs. Perhaps Heimdall has been longing for a friend to share her interest with.

103302043.content: I've been wanting to ask, Heimdall: how did you come to be a fan of horse racing?

103302044.content: A video montage of the various horses, complete with commentary, is playing on the giant screen at the racetrack. As the atmosphere heats up, I dare ask a question I've been dying to ask.

103302045.content: Heimdall lets out a little laugh, as if she's just remembered something from a very long time ago.

103302046.content: ... When I was a kid, I lived in the suburbs where my parents kept horses. They loved horse racing so much, one year they even gave me a pony as a birthday present.

103302047.content: Since most of my other classmates lived in the city and my parents were always busy, I spent most of my free time either reading or playing with my pony, which I named Goldtop.

103302048.content: As she grew older, Goldtop started competing at some local races and did quite well, and so my parents decided to send her to more competitive races. I didn't try to keep Goldtop with me.

103302049.content: At first, I felt a little lonely. However, as I watched Goldtop race and saw just how free and alive she was, how she would just run without a care in the world, I became interested in horse racing...

103302050.content: By the time Goldtop retired from racing, I could understand why everyone else around me loved the sport. There's the raw power, the hard work, and sometimes, there are miracles...

103302051.content: Number Four, Golden Current, comes on the giant screen. A montage of his past races jogs the audience's memories of a time where his golden mane would fly in the wind, far ahead of the rest of the competition.

103302052.content: I first became fond of Golden Current because his mane is the same color as Goldtop's. It was only later after seeing him perform better and better in the races that I started liking him for more than just the association with Goldtop.

103302053.content: Heimdall looks relaxed as she reminisces. These are clearly happy memories that she holds dear.

103302054.content: Heimdall... I'm surprised by your slyness.

103302056.content: You have left me with no choice. How could I possibly support any horse other than Golden Current after hearing the story?

103302057.content: ... Weren't you the first to cast a vote for Golden Current, Administrator?

103302061.content: At the loud crack from the starting pistol, 17 sleek horses dash out of their starting gates. There is a deafening roar from the race-goers around us, a roar so loud it fills the entire racetrack.

103302062.content: They're off! Some horses have got off a little quicker than others, so we've now got four groups heading down the first straight.

103302063.content: Aaaand at the very front is... Snowlord, just as expected! At the other end, Golden Current, racing for the first time since he was sidelined by injury, is third from last!

103302064.content: Although I've been told about the different racing strategies and I know that Golden Current is a so-called late runner, I can't help but be anxious as I witness the great gap between him and the frontrunner.

103302065.content: This doesn't look good... Golden Current's right at the back.

103302066.content: Let's cheer for Golden Current together, Administrator!

103302067.content: Heimdall suddenly tugs at my sleeve, and I turn back. She's taken off her glasses and appears very excited, just like the crowd around us.

103302068.content: Huh? Can you... actually see without your glasses on, Heimdall?

103302069.content: Oh, these are smart glasses. I'm not shortsighted.

103302070.content: Wow, here's something else I bet no one else knows about Heimdall...

103302073.content: The fellow Golden Current fan calls out to Heimdall, and flashes a thumbs-up sign at her.

103302075.content: Hey, hey! What kind of mousy cheer is that? Just follow me!

103302076.content: Golden Current, go, go, go! Golden Current, go, go, go!

103302077.content: My efforts at cheering on Golden Current are definitely a little feeble compared to the vigor and passion shown by the de-spectacled Heimdall and her even more spirited comrade.

103302078.content: Dang it. I yell perfectly fine when I'm trying to cheer on Ver and the other girls in battle...

103302079.content: What's with that look on your face, Administrator?

103302080.content: Heimdall tugs at my sleeve again. I turn to look at her, and I see a bright smile on her face, one that I've never seen before.

103302081.content: You know, it's always a pleasure to cheer on a competitor or horse that you're a fan of, no matter if they win or lose, because you can feel that they're giving the race their best shot.

103302082.content: She stretches out her arm and gently rubs her thumb left-to-right between my eyebrows, as if to smoothen out the furrows there.

103302083.content: So, never, ever frown when you watch a race.

103302085.content: Heimdall hurriedly pulls her hand back, as if she's just realized that she's been overly friendly. She tries to hide the blush on her face by resuming her cheering.

103302087.content: Golden Current, go, go, go! Golden Current, go, go, go!

103302088.content: Yeah, that's right, that'll do it!

103302089.content: However, no matter how hard we cheer, Golden Current doesn't seem to be able to free itself from tail position.

103302090.content: The frontrunner group is coming round the bend and into the final straight, and Snowlord is still in the lead! Looks like Snowlord, the blinding meteor of this race, has this race all wrapped up!

103302092.content: The race isn't over yet, my friend.

103302093.content: Ha! That Golden Current is still third from last! If he catches up with the rest of the field, I'll eat...

103302094.content: What...? Wait a minute! What are we looking at here???

103302095.content: Golden Current, also known as the "Mach-Speed Current," is on the move!

103302096.content: Everyone's eyes are now on Golden Current.

103302097.content: This is the perfect spot to start the final sprint!

103302098.content: I'm not quite sure I understand what I'm seeing here... do we have a chance to win?

103302099.content: He's speeding up.... Tenth place... Fifth place... We're looking at an incredible burst, ladies and gentlemen! Such astonishing speed! Can Snowlord sense Golden Current coming for her...?

103302100.content: Golden Current is overtaking his competitors one after another in a seemingly effortless sprint, as if he is finally done with his long warm-up and is ready to get to business.

103302101.content: We are now on the final straight and Golden Current is in second place, ladies and gentlemen!!! But there's still some gas left in Snowlord and she's speeding up, too! Both our champions are speeding up!!!

103302102.content: They're still neck-to-neck at the 50-meter mark! We're closer and closer to the finish line, and our winner today is...!!!

103302105.content: Time seems to have slowed to a crawl at the racetrack. Just two meters or so from the finish line, Golden Current edges ahead of its rival and takes the crown.

103302107.content: Golden Current has, at Mach speed, overtaken 14 of his competitors! It's a miracle!!!

103302108.content: ... Did you also see that coming, Mitir?

103302109.content: Theoretically, Golden Current could have won the race even more easily. According to our model, starting in 15th place is a fairly low-probability event for Golden Current.

103302110.content: I haven't forgotten why I came to the race in the first place, and so as soon I leave the racetrack I get in touch with Mitir.

103302111.content: Well, that's not what I was expecting, but... your guess was right, Mitir.

103302112.content: Mitir did not make a right "guess," Administrator. The correct way to look at this is as a high-probability event that occurred as predicted.

103302113.content: It's not just the champion prediction. Mitir also got the placings of 11 of the horses correct.

103302115.content: Away from the racetrack, Heimdall's glasses have returned to their usual place, and she is also back to her usual serious and composed self.

103302116.content: However, now that I've seen her relaxed and even joyful, I can no longer think of her as this aloof scientist from the Cryptics.

103302117.content: The physiques of the horses, ground conditions, race styles, cross-comparisons between races, as well as day-to-day medical care, weather, etc., etc... With sufficient data, in theory the outcome of the race can be predicted accurately.

103302118.content: Ha ha... I don't think anyone takes so many factors into consideration when they watch a race? For me, it's just exciting to watch the race in person.

103302121.content: ... It is important that we take time off from our research to unwind. Doing so also helps us to work more efficiently.

103302122.content: I also got to learn why you're such a fan of horse racing.

103302123.content: ... I think we can stop talking about this.

103302124.content: Also, about the predictive model... It's highly accurate indeed. So, Mitir...

103302125.content: I want you to put the model in storage. It must neither be used nor made open to the public. It is for our experimental use in your logic development project only.

103302127.content: Mitir had clearly paused for two seconds before agreeing to Heimdall's instruction.

103302128.content: I'm not sure I understand... Are you doing this because the model is not quite perfect yet?

103302130.content: Heimdall looks back on the crowd streaming out from the racetrack, on the folks deep in discussion about what they have just seen on the racetrack. There is a gamut of emotions out on display.

103302131.content: Surprise, disappointment, excitement, regret... One race, but a myriad emotions and memories.

103302132.content: The model is so perfect, it could potentially torpedo the kind of enjoyment one gets from this sport that is full of possibilities... This is a completely different world from one where a race-goer makes a prediction based on instinct and passion.

103302133.content: "Correct" is not the same as "meaningful," Administrator. I hope this is something Mitir will come to understand, too.

103303002.content: I walk into the Cryptics' office to see a generously sized sleeve flapping vigorously as Ookuninushi waves at me. The flapping stops, however, as a passing Heimdall holds her hand mid-wave from behind.

103303003.content: Are you wearing the wrong coat...? Why did you ask the Administrator here?

103303004.content: Administrator, this is the new BunBun Pistol. I'd like you to test it.

103303005.content: Ah... The one that doesn't require Divine Power to work...

103303006.content: Your last upgrade plan was to turn a pistol into a sniper rifle, Ookuninushi. Is there really a need for this? After all, as long as it's good enough for self-defense...

103303007.content: I know that. But I've made the new BunBun Pistol lighter and easier to hold. Even you would be able to use it, Administrator.

103303008.content: I frown a little. Guess Ookuninushi doesn't think very highly of me...

103303010.content: Oh! Good afternoon, Mitir. Any new inventions for me today?

103303011.content: It's been a fortnight since our experiment at the racetrack ended. Mitir's AI module is also now in its pilot phase.

103303012.content: Over the last two weeks, apart from supporting the research work over at the Cryptics' labs, Mitir has also helped to improve a number of facilities at the other departments and common areas. Looks like the module is now on track.

103303013.content: Mitir has been helping me out with designing an experiment on Bane Energy conversion, so you won't be seeing any "new products" for a while.

103303015.content: "The Reverse Analysis of Bane Energy." This is a topic that Heimdall has long been interested in. With a good understanding of how Bane Energy works, we'll be able to find a way to completely get rid of Visbanes.

103303016.content: Well, come to think of it, Heimdall's long-term research focus should be named "The Total Eradication of Visbanes," since it's nothing to do with...

103303017.content: Just say that you don't really care about the Visbane threat, Ookuninushi.

103303018.content: Heimdall lets out a sigh and interjects, as the true target of Ookuninushi's grumbling slowly becomes clear.

103303019.content: Research on Bane Energy is very slow-going, Administrator, and I've not made much progress since you got here. It's only in recent days that I've had some new ideas...

103303020.content: Let's put this aside for the moment and let's start testing while we have the time. Remember, safety first.

103303021.content: ... Hold on a second, Administrator. Mitir has come across a problem for which an answer cannot be found.

103303022.content: Based on what I see in Aether Gazer's data, humans are far less efficient at dealing with Visbanes than Modifiers. So is it really necessary to equip the Administrator with a piece of equipment that is designed to fight Visbanes?

103303023.content: Heimdall and Ookuninushi turn to look at me. The problem here is not a technical one. In fact, one could even say that it's a... subjective one.

103303024.content: Heh... You gotta do what you gotta do with the first human to join Division Nine, I guess!

103303025.content: Although I do not have the power of the Modifiers, as a member of Aether Gazer I'll do all that I can to fight the Visbane menace. If there's something I can do, I'll gladly do it.

103303026.content: And thanks to Ookuninushi's BunBun Pistol, at least now I won't be totally helpless.

103303029.content: As his logic network becomes more advanced, Mitir has started to ask a host of questions that cannot be answered using simply hard data and logic.

103303030.content: While he does say "thank you" when we provide him with an answer, we can only take it as a show of courtesy. Just how much Mitir really did understand was not something we thought about.

103303031.content: The consequences of this oversight became apparent around a week later.

103303032.content: As usual, I'm sitting in my office and looking through proposals that were submitted by the various departments.

103303033.content: As Mitir is a part of the Cryptics, his project proposals also come to the General Office for review.

103303034.content: Oh? What does Mitir have up his sleeve today... Let's take a look...

103303036.content: I nearly spit out my coffee as I carefully read the title of a proposed project.

103303037.content: "A Plan to Strengthen the Surface Layer's Defenses Against Bane Quakes and for the Total Eradication of Visbanes...?"

103303038.content: I open up the proposal with quite a bit of trepidation mixed with curiosity and start reading, and then I reject the proposal as soon as I'm done with it. I think over the matter with my brows knitted tightly together for a brief moment, and decide to send Heimdall a message.

103303039.content: Heimdall strides into my office just as I press the Send button.

103303040.content: Administrator, I learned that Mitir has submitted a proposal to you without my approval.

103303041.content: Yes, I wanted to speak with you about that.

103303042.content: I get Heimdall to sit next to me and then show her Mitir's proposal.

103303043.content: "… bring to the general public's awareness the existence of Visbanes and Modifiers, and use the power of mankind in the fight against Visbanes on a large scale..."

103303044.content: "... the current state of the 10 Sephirah Zones... coordination of resources... all members of the population against the root of Quakes..."

103303045.content: "... develop anti-Visbane weapons that can used by human beings... deep into the Source Layer to completely eradicate the Visbanes..."

103303046.content: Just like me, Heimdall's astonishment at reading just what Mitir has proposed soon turns into pensiveness, and finally grave concern.

103303047.content: The proposal has pretty much framed, and treats, the lives of human beings as mere tools in the war against the Visbanes in a "the end justifies the means" sort of way...

103303048.content: This plan will turn the Surface Layer upside down... And to think it's framed in such a matter-of-fact manner! When did Mitir become like this?

103303049.content: Looks like you didn't expect this either.

103303050.content: The high concentration of information, the excessive divergence of logic, and the inability of the machine to comprehend human beings...

103303051.content: She tries to put a brave smile on her face.

103303052.content: I've failed once again... Is it really impossible to program human values and thinking capabilities in AI...?

103303053.content: What other ways do we have...?

103303054.content: Mitir is Heimdall's brainchild and the result of her work after all, from the early days of design and development through various upgrades, and right down to the very last bolt installed in Mitir's body. Heimdall is the last person to want to see Mitir spin out of control.

103303055.content: Is there any way we can save this?

103303056.content: ... I'll place a few more constraints on Mitir's core logic to see if we can change his learning trajectory.

103303057.content: If you get any similar proposals from Mitir today or tomorrow, Administrator, please reject them as well.

103303059.content: I keep a special eye out for news from the Cryptics over the next day.

103303060.content: However, I don't see anything from Mitir, not even a report.

103303061.content: Does Mitir really understand everything now?
